name: Private Master Bed & Bathroom in New + Modern Home
description: Private en-suite Master bedroom & bathroom in 3 bed / 3 bathroom home with complete amenities and access to deck, backyard grill and fire pit! Our duplex was recently renovated head-to-toe with hardwood flooring and stainless steel appliances.  Tucked in a peaceful, laid-back neighborhood, our home is conveniently located right between downtown and the Austin Airport. A large park, coffee shop and Independence Brewery are within a 10-min walk as well! On the inside you'll enjoy brand new furnishings in every room, full kitchen, in-house laundry and Roku connections on every TV. Your bedroom has a queen-sized bed, desk, closet and drawers with ample space leftover for air-mattresses.  Outside has a private spacious deck and plenty of backyard space, including a bbq grill, fire pit and hammock. The front door has a digital keypad lock (with regularly-changing codes), so you will be able to check-in at your convenience to take a well-deserved nap or drop off your bags and hit the town. My
neighborhood_overview: Safe, laid-back and sprawling neighborhood tucked away from all the construction cranes. No issues with neighbors or noise complaints to date.
transit: Rideshares are a fast, easy and safe way to get around town.

name: The Crow cottage near UT & downtown-most walkable
description: Please read all listing details before making your reservation. This cute cottage is in the central Austin "Heritage neighborhood" just behind the historical "Brogan House".  We are just a few blocks from UT and less than ten minutes by car to downtown, Lady Bird Johnson Lake, and (about 10-15 minutes to) Barton Springs, and Zilker Park (ACL FEST). Please read all listing information before making your reservation.  This cute cottage is in the central Austin "Heritage neighborhood" just behind the historical "Brogan House".  We are just a few blocks from UT and less than ten minutes by car to downtown, Lady Bird Johnson Lake, and (about 10-15 minutes to) Barton Springs, and Zilker Park (ACL FEST).     This is a fully furnished tiny house (340 square ft) cottage.     We are within walking distance to UT, and biking distance to the Capitol and downtown Austin. We are just two blocks from the bus stop, zip cars, and a wide variety of wonderful local restaurants,  shops (such as Antone's R
neighborhood_overview: I love that my neighborhood is within walking distance to so many great restaurants and entertainment, including: Steel City Popsicles- boutique treats Texas French Bread-great walnut scones & lots of other yummy things. Spider House-great place to grab some coffee and hang out.  Hopfields- bistro food and tasty brews.  Pad Thai-incredible fresh food in a clean and attractive setting. Wheatsville-an awesome coop and their handmade sandwiches & hot food bar are great also.  Amy's Ice cream-must have their add-ins! And there are many more.. Ten things you should see/do during your visit: 1. Barton Springs-swimming and sunbathing 2. Zilker Park-hike and bike trail, botanical gardens, kite/ACL/ other festivals 3. South Congress Blvd- great shops, food trucks, and restaurants  4. The Broken Spoke- Tx music and dancing 5. Tx Capital building 6. Paramount Theater 7. Vintage shopping along Burnet Rd.  8. Hamilton's Pool- must make reservations well in advance  9. Mt Bonnell 10. Canoeing/kayaki
transit: There is a bus stop two blocks east of the cottage  right on Guadalupe St. There are zip cars and bikes for rent within two blocks, as well.

name: East Austin Guesthouse with Deck & Yard
description: The East Austin Guesthouse is close to Figure 8 Coffee Purveyors, Fleet Coffee, Micklethwait Craft Meats, Franklin Barbecue, great taco trucks, & all the East Side music venues. You'll love the Austin vibe, great backyard, & walking to food trucks, restaurants, and bars. The guesthouse is good for couples, friends, solo adventurers. The house is just over a mile from downtown. I like to stock the pantry with some beer, Topo Chicos, coffee, tea, milk, cream, sugar, & some Austin-made snacks. The Guesthouse is 184 square feet of renovated 1970's charm! It has a deck and large shared backyard with a table and chairs and a grill if you'd like to grill! There's a new refrigerator (not shown in pix) that is "studio" sized - about 2' x 4'. The oven doesn't work but the stove top does. There's also a kettle, coffeemaker, and I'll provide coffee, tea, milk, cream, sugar - whatever you like to get you going in the morning! Don't be surprised if I message you asking for what you prefer! And there
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is in the midst of gentrification with many original bungalows as well as new modern homes. It's multi-cultural with a mix of white, Mexican, and African-American folks.
transit: The East Austin Guesthouse is walking to dozens of restaurants, coffee shops, restaurants, and bars. It's also a great location to bike from. There's a B-Cycle stop down the street on East 11th, and you can also rent bikes from East Side Pedal Pushers on East 5th.  The house is also near a bus line. And while Uber and Lyft don't currently operate in Austin, there are a few similar apps that work well, namely Fasten, Fare, and RideAustin.

name: ★Private Bedroom ★Cute South Congress Bungalow!★
description: Just 1 mile South of the main drag on South Congress, & 10 minutes to the airport, this private bedroom in our 2-bedroom bungalow is a perfect spot to post up for fun, or for work! Your bedroom has a comfortable queen sized bed, and you can use the full sized kitchen, Amazon Fire TV w/ Amazon Prime, High-Speed Wifi, a full bathroom, and  you're able to access the house with a keypad. The grounds are shared by other cottages, and you'll house share with our on-site manager: now that's service :) Our property is called the SoCo Cottage Collection, and features a few different fun spots to call home during your time in Austin. This private bedroom is one of two bedrooms in our "SoCo Cottage Collection 1," the main house on the property. We pride ourselves in providing you a clean and comfortable place for you to relax and stay during your time in Austin.  The queen-sized bed has been called "VERY comfortable" and is dressed in high quality and comfortable linens. You will have shared use
neighborhood_overview: This is a residential neighborhood; please be courteous and congregate indoors after 9pm (who are we kidding, you will be out on the town anyway)!
transit: UBER and Lyft are quick and easy. We also love Turo for car rentals if you want to have your own set of wheels. Be trendy and take a scooter around - they are fun, but also please be safe!! Download one of the scooter apps before you go searching for one - we like Bird and Lime. Otherwise, walking is an option too!

name: New Condo Steps from Zilker Park!
description: This is a great new condo that couldn't be closer to Zilker Park! Dozens of restaurants and food trucks well within walking distance. This listing is specifically for ACL and you'd be hard pressed to find a better lodging for the festival! This is a beautiful new condo with wood floors and granite kitchen and bath counters. This is a 1250 sq ft 2/2 apartment with a large balcony and it's pretty much all yours with the exception of 1 bedroom and bathroom. I will be to meet you upon your arrival and will be sporadically available throughout your stay. I have a roommate who will be staying in the other room of the apartment--don't worry he doesn't even bite, actually he's quite friendly. If there is anything you need I ask that you try to let me know upon your arrival so that I can take care of it for you as quickly as possible. This is one of the best neighborhoods to stay in all of Austin! Barton springs pool and Zilker park are both merely steps away and after you wear yourself out dow
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the best neighborhoods to stay in all of Austin! Barton springs pool and Zilker park are both merely steps away and after you wear yourself out down, there are a plethora of restaurants and high quality food trucks all within a stone's throw!
transit: You can be just about anywhere downtown, south congress, campus or the east side with a $5-10 uber ride

name: Joy and Ease in a Zen-Inspired Home in South-Central Austin
description: Be centered within the zen-like aura of this warm home adorned with vivid abstract artworks, no-frills wood furnishings, and a trove of books. Have a seat on a white leather sofa flanked by scarlet end tables and fronted by a sleek solid-wood table.
neighborhood_overview: The house is set in a laid-back neighborhood and a short walk away from the restaurants, shops, and pubs that line South Lamar Boulevard. Enjoy a scenic walk along one of West Bouldin Creek’s Greenbelt trails, then grab a bite at Odd Duck.
transit: Austinites mostly travel around using car-share services like Lyft and Uber, preferring to leave their cars behind if heading out for a night on the town. If you use the code "Bunk" you'll get some amount of free ride-share credits. Renting bikes is also highly encourage--I ride my bike to Barton Springs Pool in about ten minutes : )

name: Howdy Hour Inn (Oasis in the City)
description: Come enjoy an escape in North Central Austin!  Amazing Neighborhood with wonderful nature and 15 minutes to Downtown.  We believe you shouldn’t have to worry about anything while on vacation, so we provide everything that are essential to us when we travel: Robes & towels  Hair dryer Mini Fridge Microwave Keurig + coffee  Popcorn Wifi/Netflix/Basic Cable The apartment is attached to our main home , so we’re nearby if there’s any questions you have about the area. (Private Entry) Front Door can get sticky with the humidity - push and pull with some force and all should be good! Shared Door Remains locked from each side for the entire guest stay. You are welcome to enjoy the front yard patios and the entire upstairs Studio Unit. Available by text/phone for recommendations or hospitality needs. Quaint Neighborhood Setting, 15 minutes to UT , Downtown, 6th Street, Rainey & South Congress.  Easy Walk to Barretts Coffee, Great Mexican At El Nuevo Quick Access to 183 & 35 Hwy . Uber Friendly,
neighborhood_overview: Quaint Neighborhood Setting, 15 minutes to UT , Downtown, 6th Street, Rainey & South Congress.  Easy Walk to Barretts Coffee, Great Mexican At El Nuevo

name: New* Business ready 1BR/1BA King Apt (B) in E.ATX
description: Check out our extremely spacious, stylishly furnished one bedroom, one bathroom apartment in the Platform Community, a brand new residential building in East Austin. It's located right off the Metro Rail, just one stop away from downtown and the Convention Center. The unit comfortably sleeps 4. There's fantastic, resort-style pools, easy parking, a fully-equipped fitness center, complementary high speed Wi-Fi, and more! Stylish, yet comfortable with lots of amenities: * Sleeps 4* High speed Wi-Fi * Smart Roku HDTV * In-unit washer and dryer * Fully-equipped, brand new kitchen (coffee/tea) * Quartz countertops and wood flooring * Nest thermostat * Huge bathrooms w/ hairdryer and toiletries * Iron and ironing board * High quality linens and bath towels * Ceiling fans in every bedroom * Walk in closet * Free onsite parking Guests can enjoy the entire apartment and all community areas, including: * Multiple resort-style pools * Poolside BBQ area and covered cabanas * Clubhouse with pool ta
neighborhood_overview: Features · residential · hipster · urban gardens · parks · laid back · east side pride Locale’s home is located in Austin, Texas, United States. We're located in the heart of East Austin, close to restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and nightlife. We're near the University of Texas and just one stop away on the Metro Rail from downtown!
transit: The MLK stop on the Metro Rail is onsite! Under 10 minutes to downtown.

name: Central East - Close to EVERYTHING!
description: This space is ideal for all travelers who need a place to relax, work & play. Perfect for SXSW, Eastside nightlife, less than a mile from Downtown Austin, the State Capital, Bob Bullock Museum & IMAX Theatre, The Blanton Gallery, Austin MOMA & The Paramount Theatre & this is just scratching the surface. Not bad for ACL & Circuit of the Americas races and concerts too. Phew, made me tired thinking of all the exploring folks can do from staying here. Soooo much fun to be had in our wonderful city! The entire house has wood floors as well as an open floor plan in the living room and the kitchen - the place has been completely remodeled and is super clean and comfortable.  There is a fantastic bathroom with a large stone shower plus a luxurious bathtub which is lovely for anyone needing to relax after a long day of running around our fun city. There is one bedroom with a king-sized bed that feels like your own private island.  Also, there are 2 queen size air mattresses if you and your peo
neighborhood_overview: The east side is a rapidly changing area with new restaurants and shops opening up monthly.  There are several fantastic restaurants such as Blue Dahlia, Hillside Farmacy, The Hightower, Lichas, Takoba, East Side Pies, Food Trailers and much more within walking distance as well as tons of stuff to drive to. (Added, 2017 and on) There are a few retail shops too - Las Cruxes and Altatudes just a few steps away if you have some extra $$$$ burning a hole in your wallet. Plenty of coffee options with Rio Rita (quick walk) Figure 8 (short walk), and Quickie Pickie, a cool convenient store with great food too (short walk)Thunderbird and Cuvée coffee shops, later one of my favorite spots to work from (a nice decent walk or super short drive). Can't go wrong with this location!
transit: There is a bus stop literally 50 feet from the house which will take you north, south, east or west.  Also downtown is about 1 mile away so you could feasibly walk anywhere you wanted to. Lyft or Uber are both available too.  Car2Go is a convenient option to having a vehicle on demand, full transparency, don’t know much beyond that it is available, one would have to look at their site for further info. On E11th there is a Public Bike hub that allows daily rate bikes that have tons of places to park em when you’re done with em.

name: Downtown Garage Studio
description: Turn-key solution for somebody who wants a clean cozy furnished place for SXSW, ACL, Formula One or any other of the million reasons to visit Austin. The cozy 500 sqft garage studio (16'x30') is furnished with a comfortable queen size IKEA bed & mattress with clean soft cotton sheets, a new quilt, and pillows.   A small dinette provides for area to eat, work, or read.  Wireless internet is available along with a 42" Plasma HDTV.  Appliances include a fridge, oven range, and microwave. A washer and dryer is located in the utility closet just outside the unit. The bikes and paddle boards in the utility room within the garage belong to the tenants in the front house so please refrain from use. The location couldn't be better: - 1 block from South Shore District- mixed retail/living space - 2 blocks from Town Lake and the hike & bike trail  - 4 blocks from Emo's music venue - 6 blocks from brand new HEB Plus & new Planet Fitness  - 8-10 blocks from huge Guerrero Park & Austin's "Secret Bea
neighborhood_overview: The location couldn't be better: - 1 block from South Shore District- mixed retail/living space - 2 blocks from Town Lake and the hike & bike trail  - 4 blocks from Emo's music venue - 6 blocks from brand new HEB Plus & new Planet Fitness  - 8-10 blocks from huge Guerrero Park & Austin's "Secret Beach" - 1.5 mile to downtown, 6th street, SXSW & convention center - 2 mile along bike trail to Auditorium Shores & Zilker Park (ACL Festival)
transit: Between Uber, the bus stop on the corner, Riverside and Parker, and electric scooters having a car is not necessary.  Be sure to download the Lime and/or Bird scooter app.  Parking is available on site but be sure to let me know what kind of vehicle you have so we leave a spot for you as close as possible to the garage. AIRPORT TRANSPORTATION:  Uber is $30 with tip during low traffic.  You can also take the Airport Flyer for $1.50.  They have a designated pickup area outside of luggage claim.  Leaves every 15min.  The bus goes down Riverside but it doesn't stop unless you request it to stop.  You need to get off at Riverside and Parker.  Cross the street and then walk 500ft up Parker Ln ( slightly graded).

name: Palma Plaza Pool House: 30 night minimum stay
description: This one bedroom apartment sits amid the canopies of mature pecan & oak trees, overlooking a pool, in the charming, historic Clarksville neighborhood, just west of downtown. Queen-size bed, full kitchen, pool access, & walking distance to restaurants & coffee shops. This listing is now only available for one month minimum stay. This is a 2nd story garage apartment in Clarksville, just a few blocks from Austin favorites like Josephine House, Caffe Medici & Jeffrey's. The apartment is in the back of the property, above the garage, accessible via one flight of stairs. You'll have access to one covered parking space in the back. There is also plenty of free street parking out front. CHECK IN at 3 PM (access code for entry will be emailed to you on your arrival day) CHECK OUT time is 11 AM.  I will try to be flexible on check in/out time, depending on whether there are other guests arriving/departing. Please let me know at least 24 hours in advance if you would like to request more time. I
neighborhood_overview: West Lynn St. is just a couple of blocks away, where you'll find several restaurants, grocery store and other shopping options.
transit: Located 1 mile west of downtown, or about 1 mile north of Zilker Park, you're a short drive from just about everything in central Austin.  FYI, public transportation is not very good here, but there are several local businesses where you can rent a bike for easy, fun transportation during your stay (at least during fall/winter/spring... summer can get brutally hot).

name: The Ansel Adam's Room in Natural Setting on Creek
description: Welcome to Sweet Dreams Guest House.  If you love drinking top  notch coffee in the morning while looking out at a quiet creek in the middle of the hustle and bustle of what is East Austin with people from all over the world, you have found your place………. The property hosts a large home with an oversized communal kitchen and living room and a natural setting with 1/2 an acre and a creek. The Ansel Adams Room is beautiful with a queen sized bed, desk, walk in closet, and sitting area. The room is so nice you might find yourself not wanting to leave the room.  The people are so beautiful though that you will have a hard time going to your bedroom.   I live on the property with my boyfriend in a separate apartment with my cat and two small dogs that you might see in the backyard.  We are friendly, quiet and very laid back.  You will see me cleaning and work in the yard.  My friend said to me as I was tooth brushing the baseboards, “Cassie, nobody is going to care what the inside looks lik
neighborhood_overview: Around here: Mueller airport is the place to be.  There is a huge HEB, Pad Thai restaurant (one of my favorites in Austin) Torchy’s Tacos (Obama loves), a park and a lake, Frisbee golf, and if you have a child you have to go to the Thinkary.
transit: Transportation: There are busses outside the house and always uber and lyft: Here is the entire map of Austin public transit.  We have buses and a a rail line: (URL HIDDEN) Bus route number 20 takes you into downtown (including 6th street), then to Lady Bird Lake, and then goes all the way into south Austin. From the house, turn right and walk about 5 houses to the corner with the car wash.  The entire map can be seen at: (URL HIDDEN) Bus number 37 stops right in front of my house.  Just take a few steps to the left from the driveway.  It also goes downtown. (URL HIDDEN) There are also ride shares in Austin.  Here is a run down of them: (URL HIDDEN)

name: Private, Super Cool, and very Close In
description: Our home is conveniently located in 78704, the heart of Austin. It is a 5-10 minute drive to downtown or a 15-20 minute bike ride. It is also 2 minute ride to Barton Springs. This is the middle room of a a 3 story house. On the main floor of the house. Each bedroom is on it's on floor with it's own private bathroom. 1 or 2 other rooms could be available. If the timing is right you could have the whole house. Comfortable furnishings, high ceilings, natural light and wood floors welcomes you to beautiful Austin. Our home is a sanctuary to us and we  would love to share that with you.  Our home is conveniently located in 78704, the heart of Austin. It is a 5-10 minute drive to downtown or a 15-20 minute bike ride along the hike and bike greenbelt to downtown. It is also 2 minute ride to Barton Springs, The Place to swim in Austin. This bedroom is the top floor of a three story house. It has its own bathroom and private balcony overlooking the back yard. It has a King size  bed. It is an a
neighborhood_overview: We live in Barton Hills  which is Central and South....with quick access to Downtown and Zilker Park. Great place for ACL and SXSW.
transit: There is not a super close Bus stop....well maybe a 15 minute walk. For city dwellers like NY and SF it's not really that far.

name: Luxurious Modern 5BR Mansion With A View
description: Relax in a modern home with high ceilings nested in the perfect location in the Hill Country. Our back patio is perfect for sipping wine with views of the rolling hills. We have a large back yard with a playground, our kitchen is stocked, and our five bedrooms have a modern and comfortable style with a kid-friendly layout. Our place is good for business travelers, families with kids, and groups. Our house is a luxurious, modern house in one of the best Hill Country neighborhoods only 15 minutes from downtown Austin. We live in this space but are renting it out on weekends when we are traveling. We will leave a lock box for easy access and have a handbook for the necessities. We'll be available by phone throughout the stay. This is a hilly and very quiet part of west Austin with spectacular views. It is less than 15 minutes to both downtown Austin and the lakes. Car transportation is required (no public transit is nearby). Rides to the city are 15-20 minutes. No pets allowed.
neighborhood_overview: This is a hilly and very quiet part of west Austin with spectacular views. It is less than 15 minutes to both downtown Austin and the lakes.
transit: Car transportation is required (no public transit is nearby). Rides to the city are 15-20 minutes.

name: Private bedroom and bathroom in East Austin home
description: Nice quiet location in a cute neighborhood in East Austin.  Close to Manor Ave and MLK (where you can drink coffee at Bennu, eat at Salty Sow, or make it to downtown in less than 5 minutes).  Walking distance to the MLK train station. You'd have a private bedroom and bathroom located on the ground floor, next to the living room and kitchen.   I do have a dog, but he can stay upstairs when I'm not home, and he would not go into your space. Any room on the ground floor is accessible (your bedroom, bathroom, in addition to the shared spaces: living room, kitchen, and laundry room). I'm generally available via text or email.  I'll be at work during the day. This is a quiet neighborhood just a few minutes away from downtown.  Houndstooth (a coffee shop) is a 5 minute walk away.  Manor road and 12 street are a 15 minute walk, and have fun bars and restaurants. Street parking is available.  The MLK train station is within walking distance, and provides easy transportation.  UT Austin is less
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet neighborhood just a few minutes away from downtown.  Houndstooth (a coffee shop) is a 5 minute walk away.  Manor road and 12 street are a 15 minute walk, and have fun bars and restaurants.
transit: Street parking is available.  The MLK train station is within walking distance, and provides easy transportation.  UT Austin is less than a 10 minute drive away.

name: Brand New Modern South Austin Studio
description: This is a brand new renovated garage turned into a modern and beautiful studio. This space is completely private from the main house, with a private entrance and cozy patio. It can sleep 4 people, although the space would be a little tight for 4 adults. There is a queen bed, and a sleeper sofa which can be used together as a queen, or option to separate into 2 twins.  Free Wifi, free parking, very close to downtown Austin but in a quiet and safe neighborhood! Please see map! There is a full sized refrigerator stocked with complimentary bottled water, light breakfast items, Coffee maker with Dunkin Donuts coffee, and microwave. Basic toiletries and hair dryer available. Holden and myself (Michelle) have both been in Austin for 20 years! We have traveled all over the world, but cannot imagine living anywhere else but South Austin. We are available as much or as little as you would like, in order to help you have the Austin experience that you are looking for. Whether you want to visit th
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to South Austin! We are located 5 miles to Downtown Austin and Zilker Park (location of Austin City Limits Festival). This up and coming neighborhood is only 1 mile from the Yard, which is the home of many local Austin vendors: St Elmo Brewery, Still Austin Whiskey, The Spokesman Coffee, Austin Winery...the list goes on!
transit: To get to downtown, we are a 10- 15 minute drive away if you have a car, or you can take a Lyft/Uber.  Also we are a 5-8 minute walk to a bus stop which is on South First street, and will take you directly to downtown, UT campus, Zilker Park- all of which is only about 5-8 miles from our place depending on where in downtown that you want to go. We can also arrange private rides to and from events ahead of time for a fee.

name: Close to Downtown and UT 2bed/2bath treasure!
description: Both sophisticated and fun, this 2 bedroom 2 bath is spacious and well lit with floor to ceiling windows in the living room. It is blocks from UT,  just north of the Drag and less than 2 miles to downtown.  An organic grocery store and drug store are directly across the street.  This spot is classy, fun and close to it all. Unlimited parking! The kitchen is big, the living room is comfortable and the beds are memory foam for a great night's sleep. Towels are thick and pillows are full for your comfort. One bedroom is decorated in pop art and the other is a bit, well, sexier, with a canopy bed and silver bedding. Entire home is yours to use I’m available by text or phone. Otherwise you’ll probably never see me. This apartment is located on Guadalupe just north of the "Drag". This is a location of unique boutique shopping and lots of eateries. There is an organic grocery store across the street and one of the best pizzerias in Austin right downstairs. Juiceland, Torchy's tacos, Halal Guy
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located on Guadalupe just north of the "Drag". This is a location of unique boutique shopping and lots of eateries. There is an organic grocery store across the street and one of the best pizzerias in Austin right downstairs. Juiceland, Torchy's tacos, Halal Guys and Bros are all within 2 blocks and much more.  With downtown so close anything you have heard of in Austin is accessible. I have a long list of fun places to experience, so if you need recommendations, just ask!
transit: A bus stop is located across the street, but I recommend taking an electric scooter or motorized bicycle for more fun! Uber and Lyft are also cheap and easy.

name: Walk to ACL from Beautiful New Modern Farmhouse
description: Charley's Farmhouse is sparkling new, beautifully serene, and a five-block walk to ACL!  We  are less than 10 minutes' walk from Barton Springs Pool, the Green Belt, the hike and bike trail, Alamo Drafthouse,  the Saxon Pub and countless cool South Austin eateries.  After your fabulous day in Austin, you can come home to the peace and comfort of our beautifully designed, light-filled sanctuary. Everyone who enters our home comments on  how peaceful and full of light it feels. This house was years in the making, and every detail lovingly attended to.   We know that you will love it and treat it with the same care that we do. You have access to the entire house, unless someone is staying in the garage/utility room.  If that is the case, we will do your laundry for you . You also have access to the backyard and our badminton set. There is a 105-year-old fully restored quarter-grand piano in the house and we can chat about that.   You also have access to our Sonos system. Please feel free
neighborhood_overview: Zilker is close to downtown and every hot spot happening but borders on some of Austin's most beloved green spaces, and as a neighborhood is quiet and peaceful.  You can see stars from our backyard and hear the neighborhood owl. Everyone who stays with us just loves our neighborhood.
transit: We are five blocks from the Cap Metro Rapid Transit bus stop on South Lamar in front of Maudie's (great Tex-Mex).  These buses go every 8-10 minutes during peak times  to downtown, UT, and the Domain. The digital message board posts when the next bus is due and you can also download the Cap Metro app. If you like to walk, however, you can use our beautiful pedestrian bridge to cross the lake to go to Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Violet Crown movie theater, and all places downtown.  It's a beautiful walk and much to see and do along the way.

name: Cozy East Side Newly Renovated Gem!
description: Newly renovated 1/2 duplex available!  Close to downtown, fully furnished, ease of access to the airport, downtown, and north or south Austin due to the central location and nearby highways. Upgraded appliances, including full size washer and dryer make your home away from home a place you want to stay.  Outdoor, fenced-in yard with large deck allows for entertaining.  There are 2 bedrooms, one bath, and a hideaway loft/clubhouse for your inner child, or your actual child, and gives the place two living areas.  The shower is probably my favorite.  Large rain shower head powered by a tankless water heater, natural light, and a glass door gives the small bath a spa like quality. Full access I'll let you know where the key is.  Let yourself in and out and call/text if you need me. Welcome to the East side!  East Austin is an up-and-coming neighborhood in the city.  It's convenient location and diversity attracts everyone to the area.  There are crumbling houses next to half a million doll
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to the East side!  East Austin is an up-and-coming neighborhood in the city.  It's convenient location and diversity attracts everyone to the area.  There are crumbling houses next to half a million dollar modern properties.  I love the the unique bars and restaurants, the ease of getting to the airport in 10 minutes, and just as quickly getting to downtown.  Austin's traffic gets worse by the minute so being close and central makes every day easier.  I want to inform you though that it's not everyone's cup of tea. It's the type of place that the artists live, the rich and poor co habitat, and the investors who can see the value of being in it all live.  It's an eclectic, original group - but isn't that why you came to Austin?!  Down the street on Springdale are the new climbing gym, a juice bar, and local tea and coffee houses.  Original amazing restaurants such as Justine's, Eden East, Casa Columbia, Takoba, and many many more are all within a few miles.
transit: I suggest renting a car, grabbing a bike, or using Uber or Lyft.  There's also Car2go, but you'll need a membership.  The metrorail, and buses are available as well.

name: Enchanting Mountain Modern Home near Downtown
description: Wind away the hours around the rooftop fire pit of this unique retreat. This modern urban space embodies Austin at its finest, while incorporating elements from other cultures from around the world, transporting you to another time and another place. When I built The Mountain Modern, I wanted to embody Austin in it's finest as well as a look into some of my favorite Cultures from around the world. I believe that we share a unique bond with the outdoors, so I brought the outdoors feel to a modern urban space. Walk into the kitchen for a feel of life in a Bungalow in Bora Bora Or Walk into a 1800's Moroccan Hunting camp in the master. Upstairs has a Luxurious Rockstar feel, as it has came together from my travels and tours. Challenge your friends to a game of foosball, put on a vinyl or watch the game, upstairs is a perfect hideaway.  Relax by the fire, in a comfortable, Lush rooftop setting. Inside you will find the utmost comfort in a clean, modern atmosphere. I thoroughly hope that yo

transit: Bikes are most effective during the day. RideShare services are the way to go in the evening or to and from the airport.

description: I love Austin and wanted to be around the city life. I love my location, because it is by the lake, city life (bars, resturants), in a beautful neighborhood and quiet. Also many walking options to resturants, shopping, groceries or bars The cat Calivin is an indoor cat. He does not go outside.

name: Modern Barton Hills Oasis 4BR & pool
description: A South Austin oasis located in the highly coveted Barton Hills neighborhood. This Mid Century Modern/Bohemian style home is the perfect get away for your Austin vacation. Stay home and enjoy the pool during hot Texas summers or head out! Walk to hip destinations on South Lamar, Zilker Park, Barton Springs or the Greenbelts. Close to downtown, *ACL and *SXSW. *Note: special events may require a longer stay and/or special rates Special request or stay? Please inquire: we're happy to discuss! For more pictures of amenities, neighborhood and features please visit us on Instagram (@airbnbatx) and/ or search #airbnbatx One story home with off-street driveway parking for 2 cars.   All of our beds are all new, high-quality Simmons BeautyRest or IKEA mattresses with quality threaded linens and hypoallergenic accessories: 1 California king bed in the master bedroom. 2 rooms with queen beds Full on-suite master bathroom, remodeled 2018 4th bedroom has a small foldable couch suitable for 1 person
neighborhood_overview: South Lamar area located in 78704.  Known for bars, restaurants, Barton Creek greenbelts, Barton Springs and Zilker Park.  Also easy access to highways and a 10 minute drive to downtown and South Congress shops.
transit: You can easily walk to restaurants, bars and shopping on South Lamar.  Uber, Lyft, Ride Austin and Fasten are all ride sharing apps that you can also use to get around.   There is an Enterprise Rent-a-Car location south of the house on South Lamar 2 blocks (NOTE: Enterprise is closed Sundays). Several rental car share options are available on South Lamar including Zipcar and Car2Go.

name: Brand New Cozy & Bright East Austin Casita
description: This charming casita is a quiet, bright, and serene space located in the heart of East Austin.  Re-energize in this calming studio or venture out to explore the close-by coffee shops, bars, and parks. Soak up the high ceilings and mid-century modern minimal vibe in this adorable private mini-house. Coded entry or your safety. (Code will be sent to you upon reservation confirmation, before your check-in).  Outdoor table and chair to soak up sunsets and sunrises. Chargers, cable, internet, and bluetooth music box are included for your convenience and enjoyment. PARENTS: Pack n Play & stroller available upon request. Available via text for any questions, checking-in or out issues,  or recommendations. Also totally fine with zero communication during your stay (whichever you prefer). All local coffee, restaurant, and bar recommendations are included in our guidebook (see below). You'll see great places such as Justine's Brasserie (1 mile),  Brewer's Table (1 mile), and our personal favorit
neighborhood_overview: All local coffee, restaurant, and bar recommendations are included in our guidebook (see below). You'll see great places such as Justine's Brasserie (1 mile),  Brewer's Table (1 mile), and our personal favorite: Launderette (1.8 miles). Just 3 blocks away are 2 of Austin's best Breweries: East Side Ciders and Friends & Allies, as well as the best climbing gym, Austin Bouldering Project. Medici Coffee and The Front Page  are just .3 miles away and are great spots for coffee, drinks, salads, or sandwiches. Since you're visiting Austin, you'll need to know where to find breakfast tacos... Here's our favorite:  Vera Cruz taco truck (1.8 miles).  More coffee shops close by include Say-Tan and Flitch (all within .7 miles). Do you need a specific recommendation after booking (ex: Vegan, BBQ,  pizza)?  We can help,  just let us know!
transit: Nearby you'll find the public bus stop or plenty of Uber or Lyft drivers. We'd suggest hopping on a rentable scooter or bike to get around since there are bike paths on all major streets close by. Cars can be parked on the street for free if you're bringing a rental. Don't forget your running shoes! Access to the Lady Bird Hike and Bike path is just 2 miles away. Into cycling? Bring your bike, helmet, and shoes because the 19.5 mile out-and-back paved Walnut Creek Trail is just 1 mile away.

name: Re-Imagined Historical Home, Most Walkable Area
description: Discover a tranquil retreat in this renovated property built in the 1940s. The residence features a blend of original finishes and chic contemporary decor, contrasting textures and patterns, bright and dark surfaces, and an outdoor dining area. The house is in an historic district of Austin, and the house has the old school charm of the 1940s, including built in phone nook, hardwood floors, original crown moulding.   The house is roomy, sunny, cozy and very well situated. The backyard is big and private, with a big picnic table for picnics, and a fun red tire swing. House rental includes use of washer and dryer, hair dryer, toiletries, fresh coffee and breakfast snacks. Guests can walk to fantastic local restaurants in all price ranges, cute stores, and a historic pharmacy with an old fashioned soda fountain. There is a Whole Foods, REI,  and Anthropologie very close by, as well as the largest independent book store (Book People) and independent record store (Waterloo Records) in Austi
neighborhood_overview: This is a real walking neighborhood, with many parks nearby. There are exciting restaurants of all price ranges within two blocks. The area is a quiet historic district right on the edge of an exciting urban downtown.
transit: The area is extremely walkable, with a Whole Foods, Anthroplologie, REI within walking distance, and very near to historic 6th Street, full of charming shops, restaurants, bars. There is  very accessible bus and bike routes. The house is exactly centrally located, ride shares/taxis make everything minutes away.

name: Little pink house for you!
description: With a recent facelift, this charming 1940s cottage in historic Old Enfield is your relaxing place to rest and get a taste of the Austin that *used to be* after you experience the Austin that *is*. Airy and comfortable, two miles to campus and three to downtown. Gorgeous historic neighborhood and quick access to major streets. Traditional meets eclectic style and tons of natural light. I've put some fun things around for you to discover, too. Entire house and front patio are available. I'll be staying in the studio on the property but will give you as much privacy as you prefer. Old Enfield has been the home to notable Austinites and is part of the Old West Austin National Register District. Walk to neighborhood restaurants or catch a rideshare anywhere. From this house, ridesharing options are usually your best bet. Consider RideAustin, which is a local nonprofit company competing with Uber and Lyft. But Uber and Lyft work too. About a mile away on West Lynn street you'll find Cafe Me

name: Private Bath! 2mi SoCo, 4mi Zilker, 4 mi downtown!
description: Queen-size memory foam mattress and private bath en suite in my conviently located 2bdrm/2bath south central apartment.  2.5 miles to South Congress district, 4 miles to Downtown, 4.5 miles to Zilker Park (Barton Springs/ACLFest), 7 miles to the airport, 10 miles to Circuit of the Americas, 2 miles to the Boardwalk. Third floor apartment, the balcony with amazing views overlooks the wildflower trail with easy access from the unit. Please note, vegetarian/pescatarian kitchen, so no meat cooking. :) If you're looking for an affordable home base close to everything that makes Austin the hip destination spot it is, or for work downtown/central, then my place is perfect.  However, even though the apt is a 2bdrm/2bath, and the guest suite is spacious, the shared spaces in the apartment are small, so if you plan on not leaving the apartment much, my place won't be a good fit. Shared kitchen, dining room, living room, balcony Sometimes I'm a homebody and sometimes I'm not around much at all. I
neighborhood_overview: So close to all things cool!  And the park that the apartment backs to is a designated wildflower area that hosts a surprisingly array of wildlife in the center of the city. It's perfect for running or walking. And also nice to just look out at from the balcony over morning coffee or evening relaxation :)
transit: Only a few miles from main attractions for cheap Rideshare fares and also on the busline!  4.5 miles to Barton Springs and Zilker Park (ACLFest),  2.5 miles to South Congress district,  4 miles to Downtown,   7 miles to the airport,  2 miles to the Boardwalk

name: ♫ Penthouse Condo with a View
description: Wonderfully open penthouse apartment with plenty of space to party! Book with confidence! What makes this a 5-star location: ✦ 24/7 grocery 1 block away (free coffee!) ✦ Multiple top-rated local bars / restaurants / food trucks 3-5 blocks away ✦ 10 min Uber / 15 min scooter ride to the heart of Sixth Street ✦ 12 min walk to UT stadium! All essentials (and more) provided 100% free -- travel light! Early check-in almost always available Mid-stay cleaning option (fee applies) Two bedrooms sleep 8 guests comfortably, and a queen-sized sofa couch sleeps 2 more. A spiral staircase allows access to a loft with a queen bed for 2 more guests, perfect for a couple or others wanting more privacy while still enjoying the company of the rest of the group. The real attraction, though, is the extra wide balcony with stunning views. Check out the photos! The entire home is yours, plus two free garage parking spaces! Guests are welcome to use the pools at two sister properties a couple blocks away. I l
neighborhood_overview: Ideally located on the northern edge of downtown, West Campus is one of Austin's most desirable neighborhoods, with easy access to the city's best amenities. There's excellent bus service and pedestrian- and bicycle-friendly infrastructure designed to meet the needs of this young and active neighborhood.
transit: It's one block to a 24/7 grocery store and 3-5 blocks to multiple top-rated bars / food trucks / restaurants. It's less than 10 minutes by Uber to get anywhere in Central Austin, or 15 minutes to all the major spots south of the river. And if you're feeling adventurous, try an electric scooter!

name: Quiet, safe condo, perfect location - with cat!
description: Quiet, clean 1-bedroom condo in downtown Austin - 3 blocks from Whole Foods and steps away from the best downtown has to offer. You'll have the whole place to yourself, in a very small condo building with respectful and quiet neighbors. This listing does come with a catch - and why it's so cheap - my Calico cat, Penelope, will be there. It's the basic cat care stuff (food, water, litter box) plus giving her pills 2x day (she gets them in treats and eats them right up, no struggle necessary). Downtown Austin but SUPER quiet - the best of both worlds! The condo looks out on to green spaces and is in a very unusual corner of downtown, so there's minimal foot traffic and minimal noise... but walk 7 minutes east and you're at 6th and Congress. I'll be traveling but always available via text, email, or phone. My friend lives in the same complex and can be on-call to help with any issues. This is an incredibly unique part of downtown - it's mostly law offices and small businesses, so it's ver
neighborhood_overview: This is an incredibly unique part of downtown - it's mostly law offices and small businesses, so it's very quiet during the day and has no nightlife or loud activity/foot traffic at night. But you're steps away from the middle of downtown's best offerings. It's the best of both worlds!
transit: I walk everywhere or use the busses (the CapMetro app is great). Entertainment/Restaurant districts like Rainey Street or the East Side are just a 10 minute scooter ride away.

name: Aloha Austin Studio Private Pool, Spa & Waterfall
description: I built a beach! You’ll love:  * Your own private pool & spa * morning coffee or evening drinks in the hot tub *Falling asleep under the 60,000 star Home Planetarium *kissing under the waterfall *exploring the garden *bird watching *sunrise/ sunset walks on Town Lake *lying on the hammock & listening to the birds *crazy comfortable beds *citrus infused shower-head *Getting around w/ Bird or Lime electric scooters & bikes Great for couples, solo adventurers & business travelers #AlohaAustinStudio The most important amenities for me are coffee and a refrigerator. There will be both here. Breakfast is 3 flavors of steel cut oats (Maple & Brown Sugar, Apples & Cinnamon, Plain) IMPORTANT: There is a spectacular citrus infused shower head.  Please DO NOT book if you are allergic to citrus. Amenities: * Fiber High Speed Internet  * QUEEN 12" Memory Foam Mattress on modern frame * 1 pull out FULL Lucid 6" Dual Layered Memory Foam Mattress * Remote control Luminara candles in each corner (my fa
neighborhood_overview: Some of my favorite Austin things to do: Graffiti Park Cathedral of Junk Neo Soul Poetry on Thursday nights at Mr. Catfish Grown Folks Step N'Roll Saturday  Austin Poetry Slam on Tuesday night at the Spider House Ballroom Shop on North Loop  (It's all old Austin vintage shops) 2 step at the Broken Spoke (it's really easy to learn if you don't know how) Alamo Drafthouse Movie Theatre & Food Pinballz Arcade (BYOB the games all have cup holders) NATURE: Morning walk/ bike ride on Town Lake/Lady Bird Lake (WALKING DISTANCE) Hamilton Pool Mayfield Park is full of peacocks, just walking around. My best friend got married there DAY OUT: Go to Umlauf Sculpture Garden then cross the street to Barton Springs, rent a canoe on Town Lake and finally walk to Chuy's for great  Tex-Mex... sleep DAY TRIPS:  (outside of Austin) Enchanted Rock Longhorn Caverns  Tubing in Greune, TX then stay the night Honky Tonkin' at Gruene Hall (built in 1878!) Such an awesome town  Unicycle Football San Marcos (get re
transit: * One parking spot available  * Lots of street parking except during SXSW * ELECTRIC SCOOTERS AND BIKES The easiest, least expensive and most fun way to get around town with Bird or Lime electric scooters/bikes. Just download both apps. It's like Uber. The app will show you where the bikes/scooters are and how much battery charge is remaining. Drop them off wherever you like and hit done on the app. * WALKING distance to A LOT of Austin, but scooters are the most fun.  * Near multiple BUS lines (with bike racks) * BICYCLE RENTAL is available on 503 E. Cesar Chavez for $30/day including, lock & lights (our city buses have bike racks)  *RIDESHARE (RideAustin, Uber or Lyft)  There are often free ride credits.  I always say get all apps and use all the discounts you can :-)  Wait to download these until just before your arrival because the promotions are only good for 30 days.  PROMO CODES RIDEAUSTIN code: 4cetxhhl if that promo code doesn't work try: rideatx

name: Spacious, bright, modern 3 bedroom home in Mueller
description: Gorgeous single family, one story home in the new Mueller neighborhood.  The home is located within walking distance of grocery shopping, restaurants, Alamo Drafthouse cinema, walking trails, parks, and the community swimming pool is right across the street!  Close to UT (2.5 miles), downtown (4 miles) and the airport (7 miles). The kitchen is stocked with all of the conveniences of home and plenty of options for making coffee or tea.  The space is ideal for families (pack and play available) and business travelers alike. I will be available by text or phone during your stay, and I'm happy to answer any questions you may have. Mueller is a walkable, central community that you never have to leave--unless you want to!  The neighborhood is full of options for families, couples, groups of friends, and longer-term visitors.  There really is something for everyone.  Walk to the Dell Children's Museum and the weekly farmers market.  There are coffee shops, restaurants, and retail therapy -- a
neighborhood_overview: Mueller is a walkable, central community that you never have to leave--unless you want to!  The neighborhood is full of options for families, couples, groups of friends, and longer-term visitors.  There really is something for everyone.  Walk to the Dell Children's Museum and the weekly farmers market.  There are coffee shops, restaurants, and retail therapy -- all within walking distance.  We now have a Kerbey Lane Cafe and an Alamo Draft House cinema in the neighborhood, too.
transit: If you do decide to leave the neighborhood, you can take public transportation (the bus stop is about 1/2 mile away) or you can catch a ride share and get around town for a reasonable price.

Our neighborhood is conveniently located minutes from downtown! Guests will have access to the entire home, except the garage. Interaction depends upon the comfort level of the guest. A walking neighborhood, it's a few minutes from delicious coff

name: Austin Hilltop Home - Walk To Everything!
description: Gorgeous hilltop duplex - walkable to everything Austin has to offer, including Town Lake, South Congress, Riverside, Rainey St., East Cesar Chavez and more. Fully remodeled 2+1.5 mid-century duplex with a relaxed boho desert vibe.  Our front facing duplex sits at the end of a cul-de-sac and is set far back from the road for maximum privacy. The space is bright and sunny, furnished with a gentle nod to mid-century Palm Springs.  Rest well!  We have queen beds outfitted with memory foam mattresses and soft, crisp linens in both bedrooms, comfy leather couches in the living room, and thoughtful, decorative touches throughout. You'll have everything you need when you stay with us!  Plush towels, hair dryers, cozy beds, a huge kitchen, a dining table that seats six, a 60in TV with Hulu, Netflix, HBO, and more, GFiber internet, plenty of room to spread out, a full sized washer/dryer, and a location that's crazy close to all your favorite Austin landmarks! Note:  Our home is a duplex with on
neighborhood_overview: Travis Heights is one of the best spots in Austin!  Set high up on a hill, Las Palmas (our house) sits at the end of a cul-de-sac for maximum privacy and is just steps from Town Lake, the hike and bike trail, South Shore district and more.  You can walk to Rainey Street, South Congress, East Cesar Chavez and more, Grab the bus at the bottom of the hill, or Lyft/Uber anywhere you want to go!  There are great restaurants close by (Pho Please!, El Taquito, Hai Ky, Chi' Lantro, and more!), as well as a nearby grocery store.
transit: Our home is walkable to many of Austin's most loved hot spots, so there is really no need for a car.  You can also Uber anywhere for just a few dollars, or grab the bus right at the bottom of the hill!

name: Enjoy Beautifully Renovated, Cozy Retreat near Zilker Park
description: While away balmy evenings on the porch among tall live oak trees at this colorful home in South Austin, incorporating both hill country style and coastal tranquility. Head to nearby Lamar Boulevard for memorable dinners, or gather friends for a picnic at Barton Springs. This home has 5 beds (including a queen-size sofa sleeper), 3 bedrooms, and 2 baths. This is a first story duplex. (The owners/hosts live in the second story duplex.)
neighborhood_overview: This residential area of South Austin is in zip code 78704. Barton Hills is family-friendly and has lots of hills for good walking and biking activities. The house is about three miles from Zilker Park, Barton Springs Pool, and kayaking.
transit: Within short (less than 1 mile) walking distance, you can go to restaurants, clubs (like the Broken Spoke), shopping, a book store, and an art museum on South Lamar. An Enterprise Rental Car location is about 2 blocks away (closed on Sundays). RideAustin, Uber, Lyft, and other ride sharing companies are available. We are partial to RideAustin because they are a non-profit organization and do fingerprint background checks on drivers (which verifies the person is who they say they are), plus doing regular background checks. Uber and Lyft do not do fingerprint security checks on their drivers.

name: My Friend's Backyard Barn
description: Send us a request that details why you'd like to visit our Backyard Barn. ABB only gives us 24 hours to decide if you're a good candidate for a visit, so you're more likely to be accepted if you have a COMPLETE profile and demonstrate that you've fully read the listing on a full-size device (scanning on a phone loses some significant details!!) Barn is 1300 sqft of country chic decor, with one bedroom, one bath, light and bright with a glass garage door in the living room. Cool AC, well-equipped kitchenette, plenty of space to work or relax. City conveniences while relaxing in country openness is a great way to visit Austin or the Hill Country. Queen bed in bedroom, two twin daybeds/trundles as well as air mattresses available in the bedroom or living room. Pricing is based on total guest count. With your request please send the full names of every overnight guest and any day guests that you'll be hosting as well. The Barn is in our Backyard so we expect all guests to have the attitude
neighborhood_overview: We are just on the SW edge of the city on the way to Dripping Springs. If you're not sure where we are in relation to wherever else you're visiting or Austin's typical traffic patterns, please ask! When you stay in the barn, you will be near to Downtown Austin (11 miles), The University of Texas (13mi), St. Edwards University (10mi), the Texas State Capital (12mi), Zilker Park & Barton Springs pool (9mi), Barton Creek Greenbelt (7mi), the Circle C neighborhood(6mi), Hill Country Galleria (6mi), Lady Bird Lake (9mi), Lake Travis (18mi), Veloway (5mi), LBJ Wildflower Center (6mi), Austin Zoo (3 mi), SOCO (10mi), Grey Rock Golf Course (5.5mi), Hamilton Pool Preserve (19mi), Dripping Springs (12mi), Wineries (11mi), Deep Eddy Vodka (10mi), Camp Lucy (17mi), LifeAustin Wedding Chapel (2.4mi), Circuit of the Americas (20mi), Driftwood (14mi), and much much more.
transit: The barn is 11 miles from downtown in a simple country neighborhood, near one of Austin's most notorious traffic choke-points, The Y in Oak Hill. Convenient to Austin, Lakeway, Hill Country. A car or rideshare are best transportation options. Private parking available at the barn. Parking area, exterior monitored by security cameras.

name: 1-1 Condo  / Highly Desirable Central Location
description: Classic Austin condo on popular Manor Road.  Recently renovated.   Avoid Austin traffic;   hop on  high-frequency route 20 bus to / from airport, Riverside, downtown, and UT campus directly in front of complex.  Great selection of restaurants and bars in easy walking distance. Older apartment complex recently renovated and converted to condos.  Great pool.  Art filled space with an eclectic mixture that leans toward mid-century modern. This is a fully permitted, legal short-term rental unit. The daily rate includes 9% Austin City tax; State tax is calculated and added to your total by AirBnb. Not on property,  but an easy call / text away to help make  guest's stay as comfortable as possible. Manor Road exemplifies all that makes Austin - Austin.    Award winning restaurants,  best of Austin breakfast tacos,  keep Austin weird quirky bars and theater and most everything in between.    All within easy walking distance. Directly on high frequency bus route 20 that goes to UT Campus, down
neighborhood_overview: Manor Road exemplifies all that makes Austin - Austin.    Award winning restaurants,  best of Austin breakfast tacos,  keep Austin weird quirky bars and theater and most everything in between.    All within easy walking distance.
transit: Directly on high frequency bus route 20 that goes to UT Campus, downtown, Riverside, and Austin Airport.  On bike lane,   great for walking.  Unit does have a reserved parking spot for guest use.

name: Enchanted Retreat Blocks From The Lake!!!
description: WEEKEND STAYS WELCOME WITH WEEKDAY CHECK-IN.  An older house  with high ceilings, lots of color and interesting  decor make this space unique.  Tucked away in a quiet downtown, east side residential neighborhood; teeming with all the NEWEST business just blocks away!  Built in 1910 & moved to the Fiesta Gardens Neighborhood (now known as Holly) in 1925.   Original art, antiques,  flea market finds and bold colors and art pieces.  This house  spins tales and themes of wondrous whimsy and delight! An older house full of character & originality.   High ceilings, lots of color and odd decor make this space playfully interesting!!  The kitchen area is stocked with all the basics for your stay here.  Bottled water, coffee and tea provided.   I would love to welcome you to Austin and be part of your great experience here!!   Being on the East Side of Austin and about a mile from downtown; it is within walking and bicycling distance (about 1 mile) to  6th Street,  Historic Rainy Street, major
neighborhood_overview: The East Side is full of new art!!! Lots of must see colorful graffiti art and murals on the sides of many buildings on the East Side.
transit: Walking & bicycling distance from downtown (approximately a mile from downtown and right in the heart of east austin).    Uber and Lyft available in Austin. Bus #17 travels downtown every 10-15 minutes.  There is also a light rail line which travels north / south.  Look up Capital City Metro for schedules and route information.    Lots of new Dockless bikes and scooters in Austin now!

name: Grandma Chic Cottage in Sun-Dappled Yard
description: Cozy up in a quiet, private cottage that’s perfect for two. We've recently furnished our surprisingly spacious cottage with comfy and quirky treasures to make for a dreamy stay in North Austin. A short drive from the shops, restaurants, and bars at The Domain outdoor galleria, as well as Chinatown and breweries galore, you'll find plenty of fun to be had in the area when you're ready for adventure and a relaxing retreat waiting for you when it's time to unwind. PRIVATE GUEST HOUSE: Tucked into the corner of our quiet backyard, you’ll find a cozy cottage with a spacious private bedroom with queen bed, bathroom, comfy living area, a kitchenette with complimentary coffee, tea, and marmalade made from our homegrown bitter oranges, and a chlorinated & filtered stock tank pool that's perfect for two. Free wifi, a TV with Roku, and parking in our driveway are available.  BEDROOM: With blackout curtains to darken the otherwise sun-streaked room, you and a partner will sleep like the dead on a
neighborhood_overview: We love our diverse North Austin neighborhood and hope you do too! We’re located in the Quail Creek area of North Central Austin, an eclectic and international part of town with everything from tacos to dim sum and of course some barbeque for good measure.  The easiest way to explore the area and the rest of Austin is by car, as we are located about 8 miles north of the city center (see drive times below). Please also note that our house is located on a main through-street that connects to I-35, but we’ve found that traffic noise is light and non-intrusive inside.
transit: EASY ACCESS to I-35, Hwy 183, and Mopac Expressway QUICK WALK to the rapid bus line that will take you directly to UT, downtown, or South Congress GO DOWNTOWN: Approx. $15-20 Uber/Lyft/Ride Austin  DRIVE TIMES:  Austin Bergstrom International Airport - 20-30 minutes in light traffic (13.6 miles) Downtown / Austin Convention Center - 15-20 minutes in light traffic (8.5 miles) The Domain shopping district - 10-15 minutes in light traffic (4 miles)

name: Cozy Modern Condo in the Heart of East Austin
description: A conveniently located eco/green certified one bedroom 685 sq/ft condo in the heart of East Austin. Walking distance to Satillo train station, Satillo plaza, breweries, bars, coffee, East 6th Street and shops. Access to pool and patio. Conference room and coworking lounge on site. 12 minutes drive from the Austin airport.  The condo has a queen bed + sofa bed + air mattress, which could sleep up to 5 people. However, this is a tiny space, and is ideally set up to comfortably host 3 people. In the condo, you will find a refrigerator, stove, microwave, iron, and  washer/dryer (bring own detergent). TV and WIFI is available for guests.  Bike trail to downtown right outside the condo. Bike-share station is located on the northwest corner of Chicon and 4th St. Luxury pool (same floor as condo), conference room, coworking space, outdoor lounge with grill. Feel free to text it call us! Amy: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Hoang: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Eclectic east austin Easy access
neighborhood_overview: Eclectic east austin
transit: Easy access to bike trail. Bike rental station is located right outside of the complex. 3 minute walk to Satillo train station, this will take you right into downtown and the convention center.  Uber/ Lyft/ taxi.

name: A Funky, Clean & Convenient Oasis!
description: Minutes away from downtown. Steps away from outdoor patios, food trucks, BBQ, & margaritas. A short walk to Zilker Park, & Barton Springs. Easy bike/car rentals & bus routes. Expect a fun and funky oasis, nestled in the heart of the city! Clean, comfortable, and convenient. You will have everything you need for your stay. Newly renovated with granite counter tops, faux hardwood floors and Wifi. It has a firm and comfortable Queen sized bed and a cozy couch. There is a large outdoor patio off the living room. Enjoy a cigarette with your morning coffee while you people watch. Or the outdoor lighting makes it a cozy place to hang out at night with a glass of wine. And there are extra folding chairs for friends if you need them. The kitchen is complete with everything you need to cook with (stove top, oven, refrigerator, toaster oven, microwave, dishwasher, pots and pans). The refrigerator will be clean and ready for use. I always stock extra tea and coffee for guests. So help yourself to
neighborhood_overview: I cant say enough about Zilker. It is an oasis in an urban landscape. So while you can enjoy its robust natural beauty, it is also appreciated for the accessible creature  comforts and proximity to late-night hotspots. Barton Springs Rd. is always bustling with people walking their dogs, and riding bikes. The street is lined with outdoor patios filled with interesting characters eating Tex Mex, BBQ, drinking coffee, and enjoying frozen margaritas.  But if you just drive two minutes, you are on 6th street and headed into downtown.  Outdoor enthusiasts find endless enjoyment in nearby Barton Springs and Zilker Park, where runners, bikers, swimmers, Frisbee golfers, and kayakers share in their love for all things active.  For lovers of the Arts, the Umlauf Sculpture Gardens and Zach Theater,  are a short walk, and the Botanical gardens, and The Ling Center are just up the road.
transit: Please let me know what kind of experience you are looking for and I can recommend the best option for you. But here is a brief overview... You are just moments away from major bus stops (I can help you with which bus you need and routes), several bike rental shops. Public street bike rentals. Enterprise Rent-A-Car. If you plan ahead, you can sign up for Car2Go and there are always cars near the apartment.  And an Uber or Lift ride costs no more than $10 to reach the north, east, or far south of Austin. You're only 1.7 miles from the Convention Center, 1 mile from Whole Foods and 0.6 miles from Lady Bird Lake. Bergstrom International Airport: 25 minutes by car Downtown: 5 minutes by car and 15 minutes by bus South Congress: 5 minutes by car

name: Perfect Downtown 2 Bedroom for SXSW- E. 6th Street
description: Best location for SXSW!! Our 2bdrm/2bath apartment home is conveniently located on East Sixth Street (downtown). We are close to everything and at the center of it all! Just a short walk to a variety of restaurants, bars, coffee shops and so much more! You will have access to a fully equipped kitchen with all appliances (gas stove), utensils, etc. Feel free to relax on the patio (smoking outside only). We have board games and cards if you want to stay in one night. Although cable is not available, you will have the option to stream from Hulu, Netflix, HBOGo, etc. We have wifi access (password will be provided). Guest will have access to the pool, fitness center and business center. We will provide one reserved parking pass with covered parking and one visitor parking pass. Gate code will be provided for access into property. We will be available and in the area. If there is anything you need help with or you have any questions, please let us know and we will be more than happy to help.
neighborhood_overview: We are conveniently located in downtown Austin on East Sixth street. As soon as you walk out of our apartment you hang a left and are literally 0.2 miles from the first bar, Lazarus Brewing Co. (this is one of austin's new and upcoming breweries). Keep heading west for one mile and you are experiencing what Dirty Sixth has to offer! Along the way stop by The Liberty, Zilker Brewing Company & Taproom, The White Horse, Shangri-La and many many more Austin staples!  Austin has amazing food to offer as well, right across the street is Counter Cafe (best crab cakes ever) and Cuvée Coffee Bar. If you want something a little more Tex-Mex, we are only a block from Joe's Bakery (Austin staple) and only half a mile from Juan in a Million (featured on Man vs. Food), located on the ever growing Cesar Chavez street.  Along Cesar Chavez you will find numerous bars, restaurants, food trucks and local businesses. From tattoo shops, cafes and convenience stores, this neighborhood is constantly growing
transit: Austin has plenty of ride sharing companies from Lyft to Uber. The bus stop is just around the corner from our home and there are bike rentals available as well.  There is so much just walking distance from our location that traveling on foot is just as easy. Otherwise, pedi cabs are constantly going up and down our street and picking up riders for an easy lift to their destination.  We are open to discussing a pick up from the airport if you are flying in for SXSW as well! Inquire for details.

name: Sweet Home South Austin
description: Great South Austin location! Close to DownTown, South Congress,  Austin 360, Circuit of the Americas, and the Airport.  Our home is perfect for families and large groups with two living areas, two dining areas,  and large back yard.   Make yourself at home in this great house for your stay in Austin. 5 Bedrooms, 3 Full Bathrooms, Laundry Room with washer and dryer Answers to your questions are just a call or an email away. Nice established South Austin neighborhood, with Starbucks and several restaurants a 5-minute walk away. Easy public transportation or 15 minute Uber ride to downtown.

description: Neat room on a house. 15 minutes away from Downtown Austin. Friendly environment and accomodating host! You have full access to everything except for my bedroom. Feel free to use the kitchen as if it was your own. Your privacy is very important to me, but I want you to be comfortable.  Don't hesitate to tell me if you have questions or need help. This is a very peaceful neighborhood with easy access to I-35 and 5 minutes away from Walnut Creek Park. There is always parking available in case you're driving. description: Indulge in BBQ on the spacious patio, or enjoy the full chef’s kitchen featuring a waterfall island that opens to the living room. Fully equipped and centrally located, this chic Austin home is an ideal base from which to both explore and unwind.
neighborhood_overview: It's only a 10-minute walk to vibrant South Congress Avenue (aka SoCo) and its fantastic restaurants, cafes, boutiques, and music venues. Nearby Big Stacy Park has three acres of walking trails and a heated, spring-fed swimming pool for water babies.

name: Spacious Home Base; Walk Downtown
description: This charming refuge, tucked in the historic Bouldin neighborhood, is quiet but close to all the action. Equipped with highspeed fiber-optic internet.  To get downtown, it's a 7 minute bus ride or a 25 minute walk. Only 8 blocks from Auditorium Shores. Available long-term or month to month. THE ROOM:  Airy bedrooms with private access. One bedroom has a comfortable twin bed with memory foam and a trundle tucked underneath which makes it an excellent place for two. The other bedroom has a  queen size Tempurpedic mattress. High speed fiber optic wi-fi internet access. BATHROOM: Bedrooms both connect directly to renovated, shared full bath. You will have access to the kitchen (which has a microwave, dishwasher and gas range), washer/dryer, living and dining rooms and patio out back, as well as a screened-in room with hammock. We will share a bathroom which is directly connected to both bedrooms. The bedroom has its own private entrance. We're happy to answer questions and give recommendat
neighborhood_overview: Apart from being in a great location and close to all the action, the neighborhood is quiet and charming with historic homes and tree-lined streets.  It is in easy walking distance to South Congress, 1st Street and Lamar. It's also close to Auditorium Shores, which is known for its live music festivals, as well as Town Lake, where you can go jogging on the running trail or just enjoy people-watching.  Delicious restaurants like Bouldin Creek Cafe, Elizabeth St. Cafe and Sway or food trailers like Torchy's Tacos are easily walkable, while fine dining places like Lenoir or Uchi are quickly accessible from my place as well.  When you're done feasting, you can always head over to places like the famous Continental Club for late night fun too.
transit: The #5 bus which leaves right out front will take you directly downtown in 7 minutes. If you want to bike around, there is also a bike rental station at the end of my street. Otherwise, the beautiful walk downtown has scenic views of the lake and city.

name: Cozy West Campus Apartment
description: Welcome to my cozy home! This 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment comes fully-furnished and stocked with all the amenities you'll need for your stay. The unit has 2 parking spots, WiFi, an in-unit washer and dryer, a kitchen, and a cozy living room with a large TV and Amazon Firestick. There is also a large patio/balcony out front with two chairs to sit out and relax after a long day. If you're looking for a unique place to stay in Austin, beyond a typical hotel, my little apartment is for you! Guests have access to a fully stocked kitchen, cozy living area, bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The apartment has two beds, a couch and an air mattress in the living room. The entire apartment, patio and balcony area, and 2 on-site parking spots. I'm happy to share my home with you while I'm away for the summer. While I won't physically be in the city, I am always a text/phone call away. :) West Campus is a very unique area in Austin, nestled between the UT campus and downtown Austin. It's great if you'r
neighborhood_overview: West Campus is a very unique area in Austin, nestled between the UT campus and downtown Austin. It's great if you're looking to visit the UT campus or explore the city in general, as it's a quick Uber ride away from most sights in Austin.
transit: There are several bus stops within walking distance of the apartment: the UT shuttle is a 2-minute walk and the Captial Metro bus to downtown is a 5-minute walk. Uber is also great and there are tons of Lime electric scooters scattered around West Campus if you just need to get somewhere close by fast.

name: Clean Condo near Downtown & UT with huge pool
description: Enjoy the sun by the pool when you stay in this newly renovated 2 bedroom apartment conveniently located near University of Texas. Plenty of great restaurants, cafes, bars and food trucks nearby! Experience downtown Austin, SoCo, Rainey Street and the Convention Center all within 10 mins from the apartment. Perfect place to stay for SXSW, ACL, UT Football games, Formula One, Rodeo and much more! Clean 2 bedroom/1 bathroom apartment near UT. Fully equipped kitchen with a Keurig.  Queen size beds in each bedroom.  Living room includes a queen size sleeper sofa, which can comfortably sleep additional 2 guests (a comfortable queen size air mattress is available as well).  HDTV with Roku, Netflix, Hulu and Prime video. In-unit washer & dryer for your convenience. Perfect place to stay for SXSW, ACL, UT Football games, Formula One, Rodeo and much more! Guests will have access to the entire apartment as well as the community BBQ area, gym and pool. The pool is a community pool and because it’
neighborhood_overview: Upper Boggy Creek This casual East Austin neighborhood advocates laid-back living in a homey atmosphere. It offers a tame alternative to University of Texas, its neighbor across the interstate. Instead of throwing all-night parties, this East Austin neighborhood is more likely to host backyard barbeques or picnics at its local park. Upper Boggy Creek may be a casual residential respite, but it boasts plenty of delicious eateries and unpretentious music venues of its own while remaining close to Downtown—6th Street is just a short drive away. NEARBY ATTRACTIONS: Convention Center - 7 min drive 6th Street - 7 min drive (SXSW) Rainey Street - 7 min drive Austin City Limits  - 12 min drive Texas Memorial Stadium - 20 min walk or 5 min drive ZACH Theatre - 10 min drive Moody Theatre - 9 min drive Lady Bird Lake - 12 min drive Zilker Metropolitan Park - 12 min drive (ACL) Texas State Capitol - 6 min drive LBJ Presidential Library - 4 min drive or 20 min walk Austin-Bergstrom International Ai
transit: If you don't have a car, there is a huge community of Uber and Lyft drivers available.  Download the Uber or Lyft app and a ride can pick you up in minutes. For a FREE Uber ride (up to $5), sign up using this link: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  To and From Austin-Bergstrom International Airport 12 minute drive Public Transportation 1. Goto lower level of airport and look for the "20 metro bus”. For the bus stop - Look for number 4 with the giant guitar. It’s a 45 minute ride to the apartment.  ($1.25USD)

name: Eastside Upstairs Duplex with Retro Modern Style
description: Relax on the private deck or curl up on the crimson sofa at this cool duplex in a unique pocket of Cherrywood, central Austin. After a day of sightseeing, enjoy highlights like the gourmet kitchen and the spacious, lush walk-in shower.STR (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
neighborhood_overview: Locals refer to this pocket of Cherrywood as Duplex Nation. It's a good mix of renters and live-in owners, with a quirky style. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places as the "Delwood Duplex Historic District" in 2011.
transit: We are very close to the UT campus and to downtown Austin, all a short drive from the apartment. We are also close to a number of cafes and restaurants down on Manor Road (pronounced MAYner by the locals), walking distance (about a mile). If you don't feel like driving, there are a number of regular public buses that run over to campus, downtown, and through the bohemian streets of East Austin. When we are able, we would be happy to pick up our guests from Austin Bergstrom International Airport.

name: Modern and Convenient South Austin Apartment
description: Welcome to South Austin, one of this growing Texas city's hottest spots. This apartment features a swimming pool, club house, fitness center, on-site laundry, playground, and community garden. You'll enjoy spending time outdoors by the pool, or in the shade by the club house. Please contact the building manager for access information. Help throughout your stay will be available in the Pillow Guest Guide. South Austin is an alive and happening Texas neighborhood! The apartment is close to downtown, so you can enjoy the various dining attractions and nightlife spots. Nearby attractions include Brodie Oaks Shopping Center, The Institution Theater, and South Austin Pop Culture Center. Public transportation is available and easy accessible to the complex. If you have a car, a covered carport is available for your use. The building is Airbnb friendly! No need to sneak around as someone’s “friends” or worry about getting kicked out.

Take a soak in the mosaic tile tub after a grueling local hike before grilling something tasty on the BBQ. This beautiful home is just steps from the Hike and Bike Trail and is less than a 10 minutes walk to Rainey St/Cesar Chavez St and eateries like Juan in a Million, Launderette, La Barbecue. Located just 12 minutes from Austin airport, this is the perfect location for your next vacation in Austin. LIVING AREA Bright colors and contemporary decor create an inviting living space. Enjoy an evening of Netflix on the 55” Smart TV. There’s room for five on a vibrant blue sofa and cushy love seat -- both open to reveal full-size sleepers for additional slumber space. KITCHEN & DINING Stained glass light fixtures, orange cabinetry, and dark stone countertops make for a dynamic sense of contrast in this fully equipped kitchen. Whip up dinne
