name: Clean 1st floor studio downtown
description: I'm renting out my studio in Austin on the weekends! I moved into this apartment not long ago and I absolutely love it!! Its 400sq/ft on the 1st floor with brand new vinyl. I'm 2.8miles from auditorium shores (SXSW downtown area) and 15min  from Cota!  I have a full kitchen and a washer/dryer INSIDE the unit. CLUTTER FREE SPACE! Oh wait....There's more? 420 friendly. I just put down some faux turf on the patio so going out barefoot isn't a problem (the patio is actually a pretty good size and the turf made it more comfortable).  Besides the bed, I also have an air mattress (full size) available. The complex is older and the apartment is a little dated but I brought it back to life and have given it a  fun personal touch. If you want a clean, private, CLUTTER FREE, and comfortable place to stay in a GREAT location... look no more! You will have the studio to yourself and are more than welcome to use the kitchen to prepare meals. Feel free to chef it up.  I'll leave plenty of room in the
neighborhood_overview: I am in the coolest little spot in a GREAT location. There are tons of bars/breweries/restaurants in this area! My two favorites that are right across the highway are The Park (sports bar but classier), and Pinthouse Pizza (PHP) which has a wide craft beer selection (they also brew their own) and the BEST pizza. There is a Summer Moon only 7min away!!! LA fitness, planet fitness 8min away. Also a target right across my street if you need anything.
transit: There are bus stops right by the complex and you'll usually find those lime scooters around here too! Theres a "nest" located in front of the target so chargers usually always leave them there ready to be used. During events a lot of people lyft/uber/etc.

name: Xeriscape Bungalow in Hip E. Austin
description: Escape to Austin and stay in a newly remodeled bungalow in the heart of all the hip East ATX action.  One mile from downtown, even closer to the legendary East-side food trucks and eateries like Franklin BBQ, Launderette, Via 313, & East Side King. This newly remodeled 50's bungalow is the perfect escape to the quintessential Austin experience but with all the modern amenities. The bungalow will accommodate up to four people. If you want to add more people to the party, there is a fold-down futon couch,  regular couch and a vintage Shasta Airflyte camper outback.  ABOUT THE CAMPER: The vintage  Shasta Airflyte camper out back has a queen bed can be used if there are 5 people in your party. This will add the refreshing outdoor shower and bathroom as well. So if your group is 5 people or more you will have two bathrooms. The price automatically calculates when you put in the number of people in your party. If you have fewer than 5 people in your party and would like to rent the vintage c
neighborhood_overview: I have lived in East Austin for 12 years and love the thriving artist, urban gardening, DIY community. The neighborhood is within close proximity to downtown, South Austin, UT and all the other hip central places to visit. East Austin is where you will find amazing food, all kinds of art, music, DIY house shows, loose chickens and wylie and friendly neighbors to talk to. Airbnb has a great East Austin neighborhood guide. Check it out: https://www.airbnb.com/locations/austin/east-downtown  (NOTE: East Austin is a transitional / once a segregated neighborhood and if you are uncomfortable with confronting America's long history of racist housing policies, this neighborhood might not be for you.)  There are a few neighborhood cats that love to hang on the patio and I keep food for them in the shed if you would like to feed them. They do not go into the house. I also have a few other properties in East and South Austin. Check them out on my profile page.
transit: The house is located close to the airport, downtown, the University of Texas, and ACC East. The bus stop that takes you downtown, is 200 ft from the house. AIRPORT (7.7 miles) Bus: 100 Airport Flyer Bus, $2  One transfer from downtown to the #6 bus which drops you a few feet across the street. (30 min) Ride Share / Cab: $20 (15 min) DOWNTOWN (6th & Congress) Cab: 1.8 Miles  $8 cab ride Metro Rail: $2.75 or Day Pass for $5.50 0.7 mi walk Bus:  $2 Take #6 bus, stop is 200 feet from house.   Car2Go: Carshare service, see their website for pick-up locations Bike Share: The closest B-cycle stop is 1106 E. 11th St. (1.1 mi from house)

name: Large Party Bargain - Near Town & Airport
description: PERFECT FOR BACHELORETTE PARTIES and all other group celebrations!  Open layout is spacious and bright.  Only a 15 min Uber ride to downtown or the airport, this unique half-acre property of ancient oaks is a tremendous value for large parties.  Beds for 14 plus 3 big sofas and 4.5 baths (rare amount of bathrooms) includes a separate guesthouse, huge shaded yard, ping-pong table, hot tub, swimming pool, large gas grill, wifi & 3 cable TVs.  Also super-close to multiple grocery stores and Target. The bedrooms are set up as follows: 1. Master - king tempurpedic, full private bath 2. Bedroom - queen, shared full bath with tub 3. Bedroom - queen, shared full bath with tub 4. Sunroom - queen tempurpedic sofa bed, full private bath 5. Game Room - bunk beds (twin over full), private half-bath 6. Backyard Studio - bunk beds (twin over queen), full private bath You'll have the entire property to yourselves. I offer all guests complete privacy from arrival to departure.  Access codes are provide
neighborhood_overview: The location is extremely convenient - located in the Western Trails neighborhood in South Austin.  The gem of the neighborhood is the Central Market Cafe and Grocery Store only two blocks away (wonderfully fresh seafood, meats and produce).  In addition, there is a Starbucks, Target, multiple taco joints and other restaurants and stores within 1 mile of the house.  Popular attractions like Zilker Park, South Congress Ave., South Lamar Ave, Downtown Austin, Circuit of the Americas (Formula One racetrack) and the Austin airport are all within 15-minutes drive.
transit: RideAustin, Uber or Lyft are definitely the way to go from here!  Short rides and no need to drive or park.  Perfect for this spot.

name: Roomy house with one of Austin's best porches!
description: Come enjoy one of the greatest porches in Austin, a classic East Austin experience! Savor being in this beautiful green, tree-lined neighborhood in a spacious, simple house that's got everything you need. We love living here and so will you! This is our home, not a fancy hotel, so expect a place that's simple, charming, welcoming, and lived in. That said, closets and cupboards are all empty and ready for you.  This house is spacious yet unpretentious, perfect for multiple (or single) people who need space on a budget. Enjoy a main communal area featuring a classy dining table with comfy bright red sofa, a bedroom with a wood floor and hand-crafted wood frame and swanky en-suite bathroom, a well-lit and fully-stocked kitchen, a guest room with loft bed and futon bed and desk, and a second naturally-lit bathroom. The house has air conditioning and fans in every room, and remains comfortable throughout the hot summer. And of course, the crown jewel is the front porch! The house is on a co
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the East Cesar Chavez neighborhood, a charming place known for its art and Latino heritage, and located 5-10 minutes walk from downtown and close to cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, art galleries, breweries, bike shops, cocktail bars, and some of Austin's finest: the hike-and-bike river trail, the bat bridge, the Vera Cruz taco truck (best migas tacos in town!), and the White Horse honky-tonk bar with live music and dancing 7 nights a week. On morning walks from the house, you can enjoy quiet streets under a spacious tree canopy, historic homes, and rustic back alleys.
transit: The house is close to a bus line. On-street parking is easy. Downtown is within a 10 minute walk or 5 minutes on the abundantly available dockless bikes/scooters.

The entertainment room has a big screen TV and an Xbox, so you can watch movies or game.  There is a huge deck in the backyard to socialize or just listen to the cicadas sing their songs. Feel free to ask me any questions. My daughter and I will happily greet you. If we can't make it for some reason, I will leave the keys. I answer texts promptly. name: Peaceful, Natural, Family Home
description: We know you'll feel the love in our peaceful, natural home, with a mix of earthy, playful, modern decor. The neighborhood is safe and a quick drive to everything that makes Austin weird and lovely.  A 2,200 sq ft home away from home to relax in! Welcome to our clutter-free, serene, natural home! We are an all organic family, so you can rest assured you'll be sleeping well and breathing freely in our non-toxic home that exudes a cheerful, warm, peaceful feeling! Come relax at our place after rocking the festivals, conferences and events of the 'weirdest' city in Texas! Our new 2,200 sq ft family home is spacious with 4 bedrooms and 2 baths upstairs and a large living room, dining room (seating for 10), 1/2 bath and open kitchen downstairs, perfect for entertaining and relaxing comfortably together.  A huge master bedroom upstairs has an uber comfortable, new memory king sized bed, chair and a private bathroom with deep garden tub (with shower) for soaking in. Fully stocked with organic
neighborhood_overview: Our new home is conveniently located near Austin's airport, beautiful McKinney Falls State Park, Circuit of the Americas, Austin's hipster Eastside, and 15 minutes from Downtown Austin.
transit: We are less than 10 mins from the airport. Uber is thriving in our town and we highly recommend it. There is a bus stop right outside our neighborhood, maybe a 10 minute walk from our home.

name: Large 3 BR/2 bath house w/yard - IDEAL for SXSW!
description: A huge, comfortable & affordable base for your SXSW experience! This fantastic home is a duplex with 3 BR's, 2 full baths, open Kitchen/DR/LR area, & a private (fenced) backyard. This large home is 10 min to airport, & 12 min to downtown. Two BR's have king-size beds,  & the 3rd BR has a full-size bed. The LR has a couch that folds out to a full-size bed, & there are 2 more air mattresses for your use, as well as another couch. There's also a fantastic yard, screened in porch, fire pit, & more! This is our home when we're not traveling so it's fully set-up and decorated to exude coziness and comfort. Just what you need as a base for your SXSW trip: a spacious, well-stocked and comfortable place to crash and recoup between outings. In addition to 3 large bedrooms and 2 full baths, the main area is extremely spacious, with high vaulted ceilings and large windows for lots of natural light. There is no smoking allowed inside.  Outside, there is a fantastic grassy backyard, with a full priv
neighborhood_overview: 10 min to airport, 12 min to downtown, 10 min to South 1st or South Congress districts. Walking distance to a fantastic Austin grocery store -- Central Market.
transit: Using rideshare apps to get around is a breeze. Or if you have a vehicle, we offer off-street parking in our driveway. There is also a local bus stop across the street for the 311 bus, and it's a 5 minute walk to the 803 bus which will take you directly downtown!

name: Large Room Downtown Great Location
description: Large beautiful two story apartment in the heart of Austin.  Fully furnished with everything you will need for a great stay and just 3 miles south of downtown in the wonderful S. Lamar 78704 area. This is a two bedroom / one bathroom apartment and it is just myself staying in the other bedroom. This is a very quite neighborhood however you go a quarter mile in either direction and you are in the heart of the city with plenty of great restaurants, bars, shops and anything else you may want to do and see. There is a bus stop right outside of the complex. This apartment is located just three miles south of downtown, a couple miles from the popular South Congress area and a short walk to the growing South Lamar area with plenty of shops, restaurants and local bars as well.

name: Modern Zen Oasis - East side home
description: 2,000 sqft of living space, 4 bed 3 bath: three queen beds one full, + air mattresses.  Outdoor kitchen and patio, large wrap around balcony, 8 person hot tub, covered 13x13 pergola with sectional sofa, 3 mister zones, large bamboo raised planters, fire pit, hammock, free parking, Gigabit fiber internet, 2 miles to Downtown, dog friendly (medium sized dog door) Beautiful new modern home built in October 2012 for entertaining.  Granite counter tops everywhere, stained concrete floors on the 1st floor, and shag carpeting in the loft.  Two master bedrooms: one located in a lofted 2nd floor with a wrap around balcony.  Each master has a large walk in closet and dual vanity bathroom with pocket door toilet stalls.  Each also has a private door to exit to the back yard / hot tub.  The 3rd full bathroom is shared on the 1st floor between the other two bedrooms.   While I don't have cable, I do have a 65" 4K TV with surround sound, and an expanded media center with many movie and TV options +
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood, very close to all the east side happenings, and just two miles to downtown.  The east side is an area of transformation, lots of new modern homes popping up, but the neighborhood still has a lot of charm and rustic roots. There are a ton of amazing food options close by.
transit: The house is a $10 cab ride from anywhere downtown, $20 from the airport. I'm one block from a bus stop, and two blocks from the metro rail which both go downtown for a dollar. There is also a good rental system called car-to-go in Austin, and they are often found parked within a block of the house.  Austin is very bike friendly and there is a great flat bike trail through rosewood park to get to east 7th. Austin also has Uber and Lyft ride sharing programs available, as well as pedi-cabs.

name: Little blue vintage house in East Austin
description: **ONE SWEET LITTLE CAT ON THE PREMISES** Note! You'll be taking care of my low-maintenance, exceptionally friendly cat Willie while you're here. Price has been adjusted for this.  -- Cute, small, 1940s-era house with vintage style and huge backyard in rustic East Austin. Close ride to downtown, clubs, food trucks, museums, honky tonks, etc. Well located and lovely. 5-min walk to Skylark Lounge, art galleries, and 20-min walk to restaurants, bars, cafes. Perfect landing pad for explorers! I'm a freelance photo editor/art researcher so my house is full of framed artwork and tons of photobooks. I love vintage finds, have lived around the country, and love travel. The house has lots of windows so gets nice light and some direct sunlight. One bedroom has a queen bed, the other has a queen sleeper sofa.  Please note: it's an older house and doesn't have a dishwasher or garbage disposal, in case you're planning on doing a ton of cooking/dishwashing! :) Because it's unacceptable to eat bad Mex
neighborhood_overview: Rustic, smaller 1940s houses, for the most part. It's a pretty neighborhood that's off the beaten path but not too far from attractions—a great balance for those who like to go out but want a relaxed, chill environment where you're staying.
transit: I'm a 7-15 minute car ride to downtown and a 20-30 min walk to a few bars, cafes, restaurants, park, a club or two. The #18 and #20 buses are about a 5-min walk away and go downtown. There's also a metro rail stop nearby. It's a nice location for out-of-towners who want a true taste of old Austin living!

description: Enjoy a double bed, private bathroom, walk-in closet in one of Austin's best neighborhoods. Quiet, clean and serene, within walking distance of UT athletic facilities, Manor restaurants and cafes, and all those hip east-side spots. Ride your bike to SXSW events. You'll have access your your room, restroom, living area and kitchen. This includes kitchen amenities, washer and dryer. I work all day but am available by text. Chestnut is one of the most diverse neighborhoods in Austin with easy access to fabulous food, drinks, and entertainment. Chestnut is adjacent to downtown and UT where your eating, drinking, and people watching options are virtually endless. I'm more than happy to offer recommendations! We are a quick walk away from Light Rail stations providing easy access to downtown a various points north and south. Less than one mile to the MLK MetroRail stop, 15 minute bike ride to Austin City Hall (smack-dab in the center of downtown), and less than 3 miles to Lady Bird Lake, you

description: Our comfortable, modern studio is close to South First Street, South Congress Street, South Lamar. You’ll love this place because of the neighborhood, the comfy full bed, the ambiance, the light, the balcony, the outdoors space and proximity to the bus stop. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. No pets and no smoking. Our neighborhood is called Galindo. It's an up and coming area, nestled between South First and South Lamar.  It's super close to downtown and a quick scoot to lots of fun restaurants and bars! We recommend car or Uber /Fasten (or any other taxi service). The bed is a full.

name: SoCo Bungalow
description: My cozy 1 bedroom apartment is nestled between eclectic South 1st Street and the iconic South Congress. Centrally located, 10 minutes from Rainey St, Zilker Metropolitan Park, and downtown Austin. You'll have all you need for a long weekend stay. Start your morning by taking a walk to Cosmic Coffee for fresh pastries and coffee (or mimosas!) This is my primary residence but I will give you your privacy and be a text away should you need anything! You will have access to the entire apartment I will meet you to give you the key and a special gift unique to Austin! Right across from St. Edwards University. Summermoon and Cosmic coffee are two great coffee shops located nearby. a short uber ride (less than 10 min) to South Congress! Close to Lake Austin for paddle boarding, Congress Bat Bridge, 15 min from University of Texas campus. The apartment is near numerous bus stops. Parking is open once inside the gate.

name: AirBNB  Remodeled Awesome Town Home
description: This is a recently remodeled town house with updated appliances and tile floors. It has two bedrooms and two and one half bathrooms. The living room is on the first floor and there is a sofa bed that can sleep two people. The bedrooms are on the second floor. Essential for booking to be 30+days. It is in a quiet neighborhood with easy access to all that Austin has to offer. It is a walking distance from the Balcones golf club. It is located a short 18 minutes drive (depending on traffic) to downtown and the University of Texas (U.T) campus. Additionally, you will enjoy being close to the Domain and Arboretuem shopping areas. The lake is a short 25 minutes drive as well. The town house is very close to major highways (183, 45 toll road, I-35) train, busses, and park and ride. All approximately 10 minutes drive from the town house. It is close to Round Rock, Cedar Park, Leander, Avery Ranch, Lake Travis, Steiner Ranch, and Lakeway. For your convenience, there are numerous grocery stores

name: Austin Oasis Close to UT and Downtown
description: NEW to AirBnB, this Craftsman style home is one of a kind. Built in 1914 with modern day amenities, this home features a backyard oasis with an in-ground pool.  Features include spacious bedrooms, 2 living rooms and an abundance of natural light throughout the home. The backyard is an oasis with a  pool, pond, table tennis table, and multiple decks to entertain. Carport for 2 cars with access to Tesla Level 2 charger and free street parking is available. Charming, remodeled Craftsman style home, built in 1914, rare find. This is a new Airbnb listing so all sheets, pillows, towels, blankets are new.  This home is two stories and the downstairs is your private area. The upstairs has tenants, who access their space from a separate entrance on the side of the home. The tenants respect our guests and are quiet but there is some sound transfer with squeaky floors in a 1914 home. Access is to the entire yard, the first floor of the home and the carport that has a Tesla Level 2 charger (charge
neighborhood_overview: Close to the University of Texas, very walkable neighborhood. Few blocks away from Shoal Creek Hike & Bike Trail.
transit: Nestled North of UT, walking distance from supermarkets, restaurants. Easy access to downtown Austin, less than 2 miles away. Bus stops around the corner (3 blocks away), accessible scooter and bike rentals.

name: Cute & Convenient East Austin Home
description: A cozy and clean centrally located bungalow in one of the best neighborhoods in Austin.  10 minute walk to Manor Road nightlife, 2 minute walk to coffeeshop, 5 minute walk to the bus lines that take you downtown.  A great place to enjoy Austin! The house is clean and comfortable with all needed amenities including Wifi, central air conditioning, a full kitchen and spacious bathroom.  2 bedrooms, one with a double bed and one with a queen bed.  Large sitting room with dining table and 10 foot long sofa! Guests have full and private access to the entire house. We will meet you to exchange keys and help get you settled in. The neighborhood is in the perfect location.  A 2 minute walk to Cherrywood Coffeeshop for your morning coffee and breakfast taco.  A 10 minute walk to Manor Road with over 15 bars, restaurants, and coffeeshops.  It is 2.5 miles from downtown. A 5 minute walk to the buses where a 15 minute bus ride drops you right in the middle of downtown.  The house is convenient to I
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is in the perfect location.  A 2 minute walk to Cherrywood Coffeeshop for your morning coffee and breakfast taco.  A 10 minute walk to Manor Road with over 15 bars, restaurants, and coffeeshops.  It is 2.5 miles from downtown. A 5 minute walk to the buses where a 15 minute bus ride drops you right in the middle of downtown.  The house is convenient to I-35.  It is a quiet tree-lined refuge from the mayhem of the city center but still close enough to go wherever you need to go in Austin quickly.
transit: 2 major bus routes are a 5 minute walk away.  The house is a 2 minute walk from a 24-hour grocery store.

name: Slice of paradise
description: Private home with huge backyard. Comes fully furnished and great for all types of groups. Fully furnished with TV, couch, fridge with ice maker, oven, microwave, coffee machine, toaster, dishwasher, plates, bowls, glasses, silverware and cooking tools. Also, house includes washer, dryer, iron, sheets, and towels. Will be traveling back and forth so probably won't be in town while you stay here but will be available to contact for any questions, concerns, or comments. 5 minutes from the Mueller complex that includes a HEB grocery store, many restaurants and stores, a movie theater, and multiple parks. 15 minutes from UT campus and 20 minutes from downtown Austin. Private transportation or take the bus from the bus stop a block away. A female boxer will be at the house during your stay. Her name is Maggie, she is 5 years old, and she is a sweetheart, who loves humans.

name: Beautiful Home in Perfect Location
description: Be near the action! Whether it's the airport, downtown life, famous Austin restaurants, Dell Children's hospital, or the University of Texas...our home is close to it all!  You’ll love the comfy beds, kitchen, grill, & TV. Plus check out the running trails and parks in our neighborhood. You can WALK to amazing nearby parks, to the nearby grocery store, our local Torchy's Taco restaurant, or to the newest Alamo Drafthouse Movie Theater! Our beautiful home could not be in a better location! Our place is perfect for families visiting, couples escaping, singles adventuring, business people traveling, or groups of friends looking to hang. We've loved opening up our home over the years and take a lot of pride in providing an excellent stay for people who choose our home. The whole home will be yours to use while you are here. Take the pool key and head to our neighborhood pool, just a block away! Because our home comes equipped with a smart lock, I will send you a digital key to open the fro
neighborhood_overview: The Mueller neighborhood is a beautifully planned community. From beautiful lake parks, to pools, to running trails, to food trucks, this is a community where people enjoy being outside. The streets are securely and safely well-lit, easily accessible for parking, and make walking and running a breeze. We are only a few blocks away from great restaurants, grocery stores, and movie theaters. We are so close to Dell Children's hospital (and the Thinkery, an awesome children's museum), in addition to being nearby downtown Austin and the University of Texas.
transit: The main road our neighborhood is off of is Airport Blvd...meaning it's a straight shot to the airport, about 15 minutes away! While Austin isn't an NYC in terms of public transportation, we do have a couple of bus routes nearby that should be able to get you to your destination. However, there are plenty of Uber/Lyfts in the area along with scooters usually right outside our door for rent!

name: The Loft: Close to ACL, SXSW and Downtown!
description: Bright and open 1 Bedroom 1 Bathroom loft walking distance to Zilker Park/Barton Springs (Austin City Limits) and Downtown (South By Southwest). There is a market across the street with all the necessities, as well as a number of fantastic restaurants/bars/breweries walking distance from the house. The greenbelt offers a convenient and scenic route to Downtown through the best of Austin, on bike or foot you will be taken through Zilker, along Barton Springs and across town lake (~1hr on foot)! There is a queen bed in the loft (upstairs), as well as a comfy new sofa bed in the main living area (downstairs). The layout is open with the kitchen and gym downstairs, whereas the bathroom is upstairs. You will have access to the entire apartment, both beds, the bathroom, kitchen and gym (please use gym at your own risk). There is a laundry facility onsite that accepts credit and debit cards only. The pool is available seasonally. Friendly and outgoing (yet respectful of privacy). We will foll
neighborhood_overview: We have great neighbors and beautiful neighborhood with lots of trees, a dedicated bike lane, and Zilker Park and the Barton Springs Pool right next door! There are tons of fun indoor and outdoor things to do all around us!
transit: Bicycle (we're working on getting community bikes for guests), walk, drive, Fasten (Austin's version of uber) or pedicab if you're feeling fancy!

name: Quiet Studio In Walkable Area of Zilker (78704)
description: Our studio is in the heart of the Zilker neighborhood minutes from Downtown and easily walkable to the bars, restaurants, theaters and live music on South Lamar (SoLa).  We are eco-conscious and run our household on Austin Energy’s 100% renewable energy plan. Our chickens are friendly, and so is the neighborhood. We offer a quiet space on a lovely street, ready for your next getaway. No cleaning fee/ Pet fee if more than 30lbs = $40/ 2 or more pets = $40/ We’ll send a money request via AirBnB. Our studio is 400 sq. ft with stained concrete floors and spray foam insulation on the ceiling and between the walls. Austin musicians use the same foam to soundproof their studios!  A new soy-based queen mattress (made in Texas) sits on a platform base. There's also a full-size futon for extra seating and sleeping. You'll have access to a (Hidden by Airbnb) Fiber-connected PC, (free Wi-Fi) a large bathroom, refrigerator and a washer and dryer. You can walk to Barton Springs and Lady Bird Lake as
neighborhood_overview: The Zilker neighborhood is an eclectic mix of old and new and provides a safe and secure environment to enjoy some of the best things about Austin. We are walking distance from Zilker Park and Barton Springs, as well as the restaurants and bars of South Lamar. Both natural beauty and city living are easily accessible in this famous neighborhood in 78704.
transit: Easily accessible bus stops nearby Uber or Lyft in minutes to Downtown Bike paths nearby Walking trails nearby

I can split up the dates into two bookings. $350/night from: March 9, 2018 to March 19. On site parking $30/day. Workout room, pool, guest lounge, business office, and guest rooms all available to use. Guests can access the workout room, pool, business office, room, and various other resort amenities. name: Private Apt! Affordable. Close to Airport & DT
description: Private Garage apartment!! We live in a quiet South Austin neighborhood with easy access to major roads (2 miles to I-35 or 290/71) and less than a block to #311 bus or 0.5 mile to #7 bus. We are 6 miles from downtown.  Garage apartment is SMALL but completely PRIVATE and includes: Full Bathroom: Sink, Toilet, and Shower with Tub Living Room: Futon and Kitchenette (Sink, Mini Fridge, Microwave, Keurig, and Dishes X NO STOVE X) Blue Bedroom: Queen Bed Green Bedroom: Full Bed, Twin Bed Small, private garage apartment in family home in quiet neighborhood, close to bus routes. 6 miles to downtown and 7 miles to airport. Walking distance to really nice neighborhood park, public golf course, and library, very close to McKinney Falls State Park. We have several exterior cameras for added security during your stay. If you need access to the footage please let us know. There are, of course, absolutely no interior cameras! You'll have access to your private garage apartment with two bedrooms (no
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is mostly quiet families. We are walking distance to a food truck (Mexican food), gas station, Sonic, Church's, and Family Dollar.
transit: Free PARKING on quiet neighborhood street. Walking distance to two bus lines that will take you downtown (Cap Metro).  Austin area has a lot of great things to do, so if you have the budget we generally recommend a car/rental car. Otherwise Austin has Uber, Lyft, and local ride share options.

name: Modern East Austin Home 3bed/2.5 bath
description: Modern/Contemporary and spacious 3 Bedroom , 2.5 Bath. This home is centrally located, 3 miles (10 minutes) from downtown in the heart of eclectic and burgeoning East Austin surrounded by so many Great restaurants and 12 minutes from the Austin Airport. This is the perfect house for you whether you are in town to celebrate a special occasion, enjoy Austin’s urban/outdoor vibe, or travelling for business. We look forward to hosting you while providing the best of what Austin has to offer. This house has all of the amenities for a luxury stay in Austin, with furnishings that are nothing less than the best. Great spot for small groups to hang out or get quiet time in a bedroom. The house is removed enough from the nightlife to give you peace and quiet, but a quick  trip downtown or to UT, or town lake. I am always  Available, Day and Night. In the event that you need some Help on where to eat, what to do, or just need some connections on where to rent a boat or Kayak. Reach out out to me
neighborhood_overview: Shops, music, food, everything right down the street! And my personal favorite part that not everyone has the luxury of enjoying: when I'm done with the excitement of the day I can just close the doors and turn off the excitement on demand. My home is quiet & cozy when I want it to be. After a hard day at SXSW or ACL or just cruising downtown, you can finally return home to peace and tranquility.
transit: This  home is 8-10 minutes Uber/Lyft ride from all the Austin entertainment districts (6th Street and Rainy Street). Both streets are lined with bars, renowned restaurants, and food trucks. Quick access to town lake trail and Barton Springs.

Enjoy all the amenities of home with a well stocked kitchen, comfortable linens and a great North Central location 2miles from the Domain.  Third floor, no elevator.  Please inquire for long term discounts and stays for less than 3 days. It is very comfortable and cozy.  It is more affordable than a hotel with much more space and a kitchen and washer/dryer in the unit. .  It is on the 3rd story with no elevator. Pool and walking and biking trail. I give my guests a keyless entry code to check in and out on their own.  I am available to help, but give my guests as much privacy as desired. Walnut Creek Trail, The Domain, Rock Rose, Whole Foods, Hopdoddy, Taco Deli, Mangia Pizza, convenient to Mopac. It is very near the MetroRail. name: Cozy/Upscale/Quiet Home minutes to downtown Austin
description: The house is a quick 5-10 minutes by car or 20-30 minute walk from downtown Austin. H-E-B grocery store is 2 blocks away. Torchy's Tacos, Pacos Tacos, Alamo Drafthouse, BD Rileys, Kerby Lane Cafe, Lick Ice Creams, Bao'd Up, Franklin's BBQ, Cherrywood Coffee House are all close. My home has high ceilings, large spaces, is super clean, has fast internet and the quiet is wonderful. It is great for couples, solo trips, business trips, and families. No smoking and no loud music after 10PM. The entire downstairs includes kitchen area, half bathroom, patio, dining and living space. The upstairs bedroom offers a queen size bed, a queen size air mattress and a full bathroom. Closets upstairs and downstairs provide hangers and hanging places for clothing as well as additional linens and pillows. The upstairs area also has a washer and dryer that are available if needed, please provide your own cleaning products. If you’re planning on staying with 6-8 people please know that the air mattress loca
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is wonderful to live and work in. Very close waking distance to anything you'd need and a quick car or bike ride to anything else just a bit out of reach. There is a wonderful farmers market every Sunday from 10am-2pm. It's located at the Mueller lake park just a short walk away and it has won Austins best the past few years in a row. The wonderful mosaic market is close and open early and late with great coffee and super convenient for grocery runs. And again, absolutely no smoking and no loud music after 10PM. Thank you.
transit: Uber and Lyft are back! As well as other locals apps. Bikes are best but ride sharing is less sweaty. Austin has a great bike rental program called B-Cycle, download the app and go from there. There is free parking scattered around the side streets and away from front of houses. In front of the homes there are rules for parking so just mind those and you won't have any issues.

name: Beautiful Farmhouse Cottage in Central Austin
description: Our lovely 2 bedroom cottage is a perfect place to rest and relax after a full day at SXSW, ACL, F1 or exploring Austin.  Just a few blocks from the Crestview train station or a 15 minute drive to downtown - it has easy access to all the fun events happening around town!  Come home to our cozy cottage on a quiet street in one of the most adored neighborhoods in Austin. Our kitchen is the heart of our home!  The vaulted ceiling creates an open and airy space for guest to gather around.  Our beautiful kitchen island is perfect for a quiet morning coffee or a lively evening gathering.  Our living room is a more intimate room with a comfy couch and arm chairs.  The bedrooms are on opposite sides of the house to give a bit of privacy for our guests.  You can enjoy the backyard where you can relax in our hammock or build a fire in our fire pit. You'll be able to enjoy all the common spaces: kitchen/dining & living room, the master bedroom & master bath, and the guest bedroom & bath.  The thi
neighborhood_overview: Great restaurants all around including Little Deli (2 blocks away) Hop Doddy's, Taco Deli, Little Woodrow's, Lucy's Fried Chicken, The Triangle (Mandola's Italian, Flying Saucer Pub, Maudie's Mexican, Galaxy Cafe) , Central Market, Pint House Pizza, Draught Haus Pub, Upper Crust Bakery, Stinson's Coffee, Thunderbird Coffee House, Epicerie Cafe, Shoal Creek Trail, Michi Ramen, Stile Switch BBQ, Tatsuya Ramen, Little Woodrow's Nieghborhood Bar, Lucy's Fried Chicken, The Pour House Pub, Barley Swine, Bufalina Due Pizza, El Chilito, Taco Flats, Peached Tortilla... so many more!
transit: The Crestview train station is a 5 minute drive or 30 minute walk.  Downtown is a 15 minute drive south, UT is 10 minutes south as well.  East Austin is 10 minutes east.  The Arboretum and the Domain are both 15 minutes North. You pretty much can get anywhere in 15 minutes!

name: Relax in a Charming Travis Heights Bungalow
description: Originally constructed in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , this brick bungalow carries a sense of history within a modern, updated aesthetic and layout. Each room offers something different, making it the perfect place to come together for a meal, listen to music, or unwind in one of the many quiet spots around the house. You'll feel right at home, and yet be surprised at all the unique features you'll discover during your stay. Upscale amenities for group of up to 8 people. The original living quarters were renovated just a few years ago with the primary goal of maintaining the home's original accuracy. A more recent addition in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) created space for more modern rooms and amenities, while maintaining complementary architectural features, such as original brick, exposed shiplap, crown molding, high ceilings, and more.  This home delicately marries old with new, featuring unique pieces such as a handmade dining table and record player alongside original stru
neighborhood_overview: As one of the first neighborhoods to be developed in South Austin, Travis Heights is beloved by residents and visitors alike. With easy access to some of the most coveted hotspots in Austin, it’s easy to see why. Popular attractions such as Lady Bird Lake, the hike and bike trails, SoCo, and Downtown are all right at your doorstep. Its central location also provides easy access to the airport, East Austin, and more. Originally established in the late 19th century, Travis Heights features a range of unique homes, from small bungalows to large modernized estates. It’s also a haven for urbanites and nature-lovers alike; Little Stacy Park, Big Stacy Pool, and Blunn Creek Nature Preserve are all close by and add to the picturesque natural environment, while also serving as a communal space for residents to enjoy. Travis Heights is also fiercely proud of its heritage and place in Austin’s music history. Many residents are committed to preserving its historical integrity and the eclectic vibe
transit: Centrally-located, you can easily access most Austin hotspots in a matter of minutes by car. There's also plenty to see within walking distance, or you could rent a bike or scooter to get a different perspective.  Walk to SoCO - 15 min Walk to Lady Bird Lake - 20 min Drive to Downtown and Convention Center - 10 min

name: Garage Efficiency near S Congress.  Private space.
description: A crash pad converted 1 car garage @ 240 sq ft.  It has its’ own entrance, is separate from the house as a furnished efficiency w/ a full size bed, small bathroom, desk, kitchenette w/ coffee maker, dorm fridge, & microwave. No TV. No smoking. Wifi avail.      It's an extra bedroom & not advertised as fancy. It's functional, convenient, & affordable. Great location 2 blocks from S Congress & Oltorf.  Walking distance to all of S Congress and HEB grocery. Usually about a $8-11 Uber to downtown. The place is self contained & private with its’ own in & out.  Folks seem to really like it.  It’s simple, but super easy & functional. As needed, but respect your privacy. S Congress hotspots such as C Boys, Vespaio, Enoteca, June’s, Lucy’s Fried Chicken, Guero’s, San Jose, Continental Club, HEB grocery...coffee shops. Walk, Uber/Lyft, or bikes.  Anything is easier than parking.

name: Close to downtown, but nice & quiet
description: Upstairs large bedroom, full bath, full size bed. Front door entrance leads right up stairs for a fairly private entrance. Just off E. Riverside Dr., 5 minute walk to bus stop, 2 mile/5 minute drive to downtown Austin. Quiet neighborhood, private yard. In addition to the upstairs bedroom, guests have access to the side yard and patio table through entry from the front yard gate. We are available at different times throughout the day to give recommendations and tips! Great neighborhood, plenty of street parking Bus stops a 5 minute walk down the street on Riverside to anywhere in the city; 10-15 minutes from both downtown and the airport. We have 1 dog, an English/Australian Shepard named Max. He is 2 years old, and still very much a puppy at heart, but an incredibly sweet and cuddly dog.

name: Mid-Century Charmer in West Congress Neighborhood
description: Find yourself at home in this updated 2 bedroom 2 bathroom home with a huge screened in porch in the West Congress neighborhood.  2.5 miles to the popular South Congress street with endless shopping and dining options.  4 miles to Rainey and 6th street  5 miles to Zilker Park and Barton Springs Pool This sweet little home features a refurbished kitchen with butcher block counter tops and a farmhouse sink, updated appliances, updated bathrooms, and a screened in porch addition. The large backyard features a full privacy fence and a beautiful oak tree that provides shade for the entire yard. There are two queen beds and a large sectional sofa that can sleep two adults comfortably. You will have the entire home to yourself. I will be available by phone or email during your stay. This charming home is located in the West Congress neighborhood of South Austin, one of the fastest growing areas in the city. You are only an 8-minute drive from the river and downtown proper, with tons of notewo
neighborhood_overview: This charming home is located in the West Congress neighborhood of South Austin, one of the fastest growing areas in the city. You are only an 8-minute drive from the river and downtown proper, with tons of noteworthy restaurants, bars, gelato, food trucks, and coffee shops along S 1st street and S Congress. The popular Saint Elmo Brewing Company and Soursop pan-asian food truck are less than 1 mile away.

It’s walking or biking distance, depending on you and the weather, from Taco Deli, Walmart and the rest of Bernet mini center. There is plenty of free parking here. Twenty-five minutes from the airport. If you want to bike around we have a bicycle you can ride. Lots of guests Uber since it's not far to come and go and they don't have to worry about parking downtown etc. You may park on the street in front of the house or in the driveway around back and come in through the back gate. name: Private condo off iconic South Congress! (1BR/1BA)
description: Our condo is nestled in the heart of Austin right off South Congress (SoCo) where the city's iconic restaurants and shops are laid out in a row leading up to the famous bat bridge with the capitol as the backdrop!  Enjoy a true Austin experience in this updated & spacious condo (all to yourself!) featuring its own private porch, bedroom w/ queen bed, plus an additional queen Serta air mattress.  Take a walk down the street to the highest density of Austin's diverse restaurants & local shops. 1 bedroom with queen bed & large walk-in closet Open living & dining area Spare Serta air mattress  Private porch Fiber cable & wifi Complex also features: Pool Gym Laundry facilities Keypad entry with the entire unit to yourself! You also get to use 1 assigned parking space right in front of the unit and additional parking on the street. We fell in love with this neighborhood because it's the epicenter of Austin. There's a plethora of good eats (of all sorts) in just a walking distance away like:
neighborhood_overview: We fell in love with this neighborhood because it's the epicenter of Austin. There's a plethora of good eats (of all sorts) in just a walking distance away like: Magnolia Cafe (closest and 24 hours!), Lucy's Fried Chicken, Torchy's Tacos, Enoteca, Vespaio, Barrel & Brown, Guero's Taco Bar, Hopdoddy, Perla's, Home Slice, Hey Cupcake, Doc's, Snack Bar, Jo's Coffee with the famous "I love you" wall, & more!  Or walk to South 1st for Alcomar, Polvo's, Bouldin Creek Cafe, & some more amazing taco & food trucks! We wound up falling for the shopping too! Such a variety of cool stores for apparel, crafts, knick knacks, jewelry, and even a market that sets up on the weekends! Local convenience with River City Market (best cold brew coffee!), Farm to Market, a couple gas stations, and even Texas native HEB. Bars and other nightlife are also in walking distance or catch a ride to downtown spots.
transit: An easy walk to all the action. Catch a ride downtown or wherever else with Lyft, Uber, or even local rideshares Fasten & Ride Austin! Our condo is also next to the capital metro bus stop.

name: Cute Studio Apartment
description: Modern cute studio apartment tucked away in the hilly Travis Heights neighborhood. 2 miles South of downtown Austin. Urban studio apartment super close to downtown. Its cute and comfortable and in a great area. You will have access to either of the pools, gym, and washing/drying machines ($1.50). I will be just a phone call away if you need anything during your stay. Feel free to text or call me at anytime. The Algarita Apartments are tucked away in the hilly neighborhood of Travis Heights. Two miles south of Downtown. With nearby grocery stores, bars, and restaurants. The apartment is about a $5-7 uber ride downtown. and about a 15-20 min bike ride to town lake. There is also a close fantastic bar/restaurant called Whip In which is a 5 min walk.

description: This private 2 bedroom duplex is located in a quiet, cozy, South Austin neighborhood close to parks and multiple shopping centers. This newly renovated and contemporary designed space includes one of a kind photography and artwork. Each room includes a comfortable queen size bed that accommodates 2 guests. For extra guests, we have a comfortable 22” high queen size air mattress. Private parking space is available behind the property and the Bus stop is just feet away from the front door.. BOOK WITH CONFIDENCE: Book with confidence knowing you’re dealing with a professional host. With over 600 five-star reviews and over 1,000 trips hosted, we’ve got the guest experience down to a science.   We’re Airbnb Superhosts so rest assured you will have a high quality experience. We also provide a Guidebook of our top rated things to do/see/eat in town. neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quaint with lots of shady trees and walking distance to a Nature Preserve with hiking trails. The property is a 20 minute drive to downtown and about 50 mins on a bus. The airport is about 20 minutes away by car and and about 90 minutes on a bus. There is a Bowling Alley and a Starbucks 2 minutes away by car. Highway 35 is a 10 min drive and Highway 1 (MOPAC) is about 6 mins away. Lots of eating options within a 10 minute drive radius.

name: Private room/bath in cute, modern home (NE Austin)
description: Hi there! Welcome to my new home; I'm offering the master bedroom with private bathroom for rent. We're excited to host some visitors! I work from home in the living room, and there are currently two other permanent housemates (and an adorable little cat). Rooms are on separate sides of the house, so we try to give you as much privacy and quiet as possible, but are always ready to greet you or answer questions if you have! The house is newly renovated in a clean, modern, and open style. The shared kitchen area has a fridge, appliances, microwave, air fryer, and basic spices you can use. The living and dining areas are also shared spaces with lots of indoor plants, turntables to play music and vinyls, or play one of the games we own. There is a TV with Chromecast available in the master bedroom for you to use. Two other individuals permanently live in the space, they occupy two of the bedrooms on the opposite end of the house for maximum privacy to you. There is also a small, short-hair
neighborhood_overview: 12-15 min from the airport 10-12 min from Mueller (food/theater/farmers market on weekends) 12-15 min from Domain (outdoor shopping center and food/drinks) 18-25 min from Downtown 5 min from HEB (grocery store) We aren't the closest to the downtown area if you're planning to make multiple trips to that part of town without a car, but by no means are we far either (only 7-8 miles). Time downtown by car is on average 18 min, but can be up to 30 in heavy rush hour traffic. Just like to make note of this so you can check the distance to your destinations prior to your stay! Please feel free to message me with any questions.
transit: There is ample parking on the street in front of the house. Bus stops five min walking distance. Rideshares - lyft, Uber, rideaustin

name: My Treehouse Home in South Austin
description: Airy, relaxing, and only a few minutes from all the stuff you plan on doing while in ATX. My home is located in the coveted 78704 area of South Austin, along the South Congress (SoCo) shopping and entertainment strip. You can easily walk to the 24 hour grocery store, four different banks/atms, a pharmacy, restaurants, shops, bars, coffee shops, bus stops, a nature preserve, a public pool, parks and more. Borrow a couple of my bikes and you'll be downtown in five minutes or most anywhere you want to be in Austin in less than twenty.  The heart of SoCo is 1 mile away, Auditorium Shores is 2 miles away, Zilker Park/Barton Springs is 3 miles away and the airport is only a 15 minute drive. This is the side of the duplex I lived in and it includes wifi, central air, full kitchen, queen bed, queen couch bed, off-street parking, screen patio, front balcony, vaulted ceilings, solar panels, rainwater collection, big backyard, and a quiet neighborhood where you won't have to fight for a parking s
neighborhood_overview: Sherwood Oaks is very convenient and mostly quiet given how close it is to South Congress and Downtown.  Take a minute to walk through St Edwards university, it has a great view of the city.
transit: Every form of transportation is available from this house.  Bus lines, taxis, rideshare, car2go, bikes, walking, driving, skateboarding... just walk to the end of the block and roll down the hill to the river.

Only 1.5 miles from the Domain,  8 miles to downtown and 3 min walk to Austin's iconic restaurant Chuys. Breweries are just a mile away!  Great place for anyone looking for an affordable place to stay while exploring the City. Private studio apartment in  North Austin close to many attractions! Guess have access to the left side of the driveway and small patio. I live on the property and guests can text or call me if they need anything. The area is on the East side of the Domain. There is commercial businesses around the corner of the house which is only a block away from a very busy street, N Lamar. It is a great center point because downtown Austin is about 10 min away and the Domain is less than 5 min away. There are local breweries on Metric which is less than a mile away. The home has security system so it is very safe. The windows are also secure and alarm

name: East Side Bungalow-Walk to Downtown
description: Charming East Side Home Feel at home & relax in a large room. Walk to the convention center, 6th Street, & everything Austin has to offer! Kitchen, washer, dryer & living room to share with 2 other roommates. You cannot be any closer! A large Room (approx 15'x15') with plenty of space for you to spread out. A closet and I will provide hangers and drawers for you to store your items. There is a small climbing wall, weights, and a yoga mat in the room in case you want to get a workout in. Help yourself to any of the workout equipment in my room except for the bike. Feel free to cook and use the kitchen. You are welcome to use the fridge and the common living room. Our home is just tucked away from the hectic noise of South By Southwest, but close enough that you can quickly walk to all events in under 15 minutes. Everything you will need will be within walking distance. Should you need to travel outside of the SXSW areas, I recommend using Lyft (similar to UBER) for an inexpensive ride.

name: Cozy house, walking distance to downtown ATX!
description: This listing is for our very cute 2BR/1BA house in East Austin. Our house is on a bus line, but also walkable (20-30 mins), and bikeable (5-10 mins), driveable (<5 mins) to downtown and East 6th Street. Cool hosts, cool house, cool city! This quaint little house is a perfect place to stay for SXSW, ACL, FunFunFun, and all other Austin festivals! Outside of the festivals, this house has year-round tenants that keep the place clean and tidy, that means this space has anything and everything you will need to make your Austin visit fun, easy, and memorable! The couch can also fit somebody and we can provide air mattresses if needed. If you have severe pet allergies then please keep in mind that while we will scrub your room clean before you arrive, there is usually a dog and a cat around. We have never had a complaint about any pet hair, but just keep that in mind while booking. Any other questions, please don't hesitate to message me! Before you even enter the house, guests will have outs
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in the historic area of East Austin. There are several museums, libraries, historical buildings, parks, and cemeteries within walking distance. This house is located in the heart of the Eastside and is full of culture and true Austinites! Walking distance to downtown, restaurants, bars, and venues, making this an easy location for visitors!
transit: Transportation to and from the airport is easiest by cab, Fasten, or Fare. Once you get to the house, transportation around town is super accessible! The house is located directly on a bus line, with a bus stop across the street. It is also within walking distance (20-30 mins) to downtown Austin and the East 6th Street District. If you are choosing to rent bikes, you can make it downtown in 5-10 minutes. If you are renting a car, there is unlimited free street parking right in front of the house, and there is also space for one car to park off the street in the private driveway. It takes less than 5 minutes by car to get downtown.

name: WESTLAKE MODERN - close to downtown
description: Beautiful modern home in Westlake offers private bedroom with view of greenbelt. Our Frank Lloyd Wright style house is located close to a bus route, in walking distance to stores, and 3-4 miles from downtown. It comfortably fits two people on queen-size bed. You will be sleeping in a large bedroom with view of our green belt. This bedroom has a desk and computer for you to use and a large bathroom with a nice walk-in shower. You will have a variety of pillows (down, allergy, tempurpedic) to choose from. Our house is very modern and has lots of art to view. There is a mini fridge in the room stocked with water and soft drinks for you and to store anything you like to keep refrigerated. We have an Espresso machine for your perusal in addition to a traditional coffee maker with freshly ground beans and a selection of teas in the kitchen for you to enjoy. Private bedroom, balcony, yard, kitchen, living/dining area We are looking forward to your questions and will suggest beautiful places t
neighborhood_overview: We are in a quiet neighborhood of the hilly part of Austin surrounded by many trees and greenery. Streets are safe to walk or go jogging. There is a beautiful greenbelt (Barton Creek greenbelt) 1.5 miles away to hike or swim (when there is water) and the Ladybird lake trail downtown for walking, running or biking. You can also rent kayaks or SUPs at the lake.
transit: We are about 10 minute walk from a bus route (#30). Grocery stores and pharmacy, coffee and sandwich shops are accessible in about 10 - 15 minutes walk. An upscale mall (Barton Creek Mall) is about 1 mile away. And then there are always ride-sharing companies! Being Texas, a car-centered culture, it is best to rent a car or bike to get around easily. You may also borrow one of our bikes. Downtown Austin is about 3-4 miles accessible by bike, bus, or car. If you come by car please park on street along the curb one car length away from mailbox. Feel free to use our driveway for loading and unloading of your luggage.

Walk to UT stadium and all the shops, restaurants, and entertainment that Manor Road has to offer. Up one flight of stairs, you'll find yourself in a light-filled studio designed with your comfort in mind. There is a queen sized bed and side tables with easy-access charging ports for your devices. The living area has a full size  sofa-bed and a 40 inch, adjustable, wall-mounted, flatscreen television. Feeling hungry? A full kitchen awaits with stainless steel appliances, natural gas stove, microwave and other small appliances, including a Nespresso-cappuccino/espresso machine with supplies for your morning or afternoon coffee time. name: Artsy Central Eastside 4 Groups Walk 2 bars&coffee
description: Get weird, stay weird, and most importantly Keep Austin Weird during your stay in this Hip East Side Vacation Rental. Great for groups (especially "friends get away"  weekends) with Plush hotel style bedding, 4 outdoor entertaining areas, Full kitchen amenities (coffee and margarita maker), 3 off street parking spots, and unlimited hot showers from the tankless water heater.   We've lived here for years and are happy to help with details or trips for your trip. The Eastside Peoples Palace is located directly in the center of all that makes this up and coming neighborhood the newest must visit spot in Austin.  The Palace boast excellent entertaining accommodations and plenty of sleeping spaces making it the perfect spot for groups. The location is walking distance to great morning coffee and hip late night drink spots, as well as a short Rideshare from downtown. It's ALL yours, baby!  Enjoy the Peoples Palace all to yourself.  You have key pad access at the porch gate.  Once you enter t
neighborhood_overview: Eastside it's exactly where you want to be. Check out our helpful neighborhood tips in the map section.
transit: Bus? Austin Bus system is awesome.  There are bus stops everywhere-- yes, even right close to The Palace.  Check out the mobile app to find times and routes for getting around.  It's cheap, quick, and easy.  --Leave the driving to the pro and remember -- "every bus is a party bus if you want it bad enough" Rent Bikes:  Sure you can.  There's a spot just down the hill with bikes available to rent by the hour. (check the map) Rideshare: Ride Austin ---  We highly recommend using this rideshare service to get around the city.  This is a locally based non-profit that benefits our community, and you would be cooler if you used it-- just sayin' Pedi Cabs: That part about keeping Austin Weird -- we meant it.  You can take you and your crew around in style by pedi cab.  They even offer group rates and brewery/ pub crawls. Ask us in advance (we know a guy)

name: Centrally Located Apartment with Kitchen & Laundry
description: The apartment is located in the Crestview neighborhood just 6 miles north of downtown Austin. Quiet, family friendly neighborhood with a dog park, playground and pocket park with outdoor dining and BBQ area. Nearby restaurants and services:  -Fuzzy's Taco Shop -Kula Revolving Sushi Restaurant -Black Star Brew Pub -Fat Cat Coffee -Modo Yoga  -Corner market   -99 Ranch Market grocery  -Chago's Restaurant -The Metro Rail line and bus stop  -Enterprise rental car office  -Car 2 Go pickup station The apartment has a private entrance and off street parking adjacent to the apartment. It is a spacious studio apartment with a queen size bed, full kitchen (fridge, microwave, stove/oven, toaster, coffee maker and all the necessary cooking supplies) and there is a full bath, closet with extra shelves, iron and ironing board and a washer & dryer.  The apartment sits above the detached garage and the fenced-in yard is shared with the house. It is very private but my husband or I am usually in the ho
neighborhood_overview: We are walking distance to the Black Star Co-op Brew Pub which has great food and beer, Fuzzy's Tacos, Fat Cat Coffee & Desserts and there is a small corner market with prepared food, beer, wine and groceries. The metro rail is 3 blocks away so you can ride downtown to the convention center and not have to worry about driving and parking.
transit: The Crestview station bus stop and metro rail is 3 blocks away, very convenient to get around especially to downtown.

name: Spacious Home in Historic Hyde Park
description: Ecclectic, spacious home in historic Hyde Park neighborhood.  3 blocks from great amenities: 4 restaurants, raw food/juice bar, bakery, park/golf course, cheese shop, gelato/wine bar.  Quiet & in the heart of Austin. Easy access by bus/bike to fests. Located on large corner lot with fully fenced, xeriscaped back yard.  House dates from 1920's (that's old for Texas).  Lots of windows and light.  Semi-open floor plan feels spacious but also many comfy corners for hanging out or working.  Two living areas, big kitchen with table and seating area.  Two bedrooms and a bath upstairs - master bedroom with queen bed and second bedroom with full bed.  A bedroom with queen bed and two full baths downstairs.  The fourth full bedroom is a lovely cottage with a queen bed called "The Hermitage" in the back yard.   The Hermitage has extra amenities (TV with Netflix, small sitting area, lots of storage) since we use it for family, friends and B&B guests.  One living area has queen sized sofa bed with
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood still has the feel of older Austin, funky and quiet but with all the amenities of newer Austin, great restaurants and bars within walking distance and easy access to downtown and most music venues.  If you don't have a car or don't like driving, you can bike bus or walk most anywhere.  And if you are driving, you will escape the gridlock that surrounds much of the city.
transit: Our home is easily accessed by bus, has car rental options within blocks and we have loaner bikes on hand.  The #7 bus stops two blocks away and the #5 and #10 also go downtown and are within seven blocks.  We routinely take the bus too and from the airport.  The #100 Airport Flyer crosses the #7 bus line at several stops meaning you only have to carry/wheel your bags two blocks.  Travel time from the airport by bus is usually 45min to 1 hour.  If you want to rent a car for a day or two, four blocks away we have an Avis/Budget rental location (in the Sears Auto repair building at the Hancock shopping center).  And if you like to bike, we have loaner bikes on hand with safety gear and locks.

name: Stunning private room, en-suite bath + game room!
description: Welcome to our truly luxurious private bedroom, in our new home, includes en-suite private bathroom and your own wetbar and living room upstairs to enjoy along with shared spaces downstairs.  Need more rooms?  You can also book our 2 room or  3 room option to block off the entire floor! See our other listings. (Note, if you book this private room, no other Airbnb reservations will be booked for that floor, do not worry.)   If you're flying in, we're only 7 mins away from the airport. We are Superhosts who don't cut any corners - we are proud to provide you with a super comfortable brand new king-sized bed; a Samsung TV with Cable TV & Netflix; a double-sized closet with an ironing board, iron, shoe rack, and hangers; a quality hairdryer & a full-length mirror. Your private en-suite bathroom has plenty of towels, good quality soap, shampoo, conditioner & shower gel. Then there's your own *private* game room!  Brand new 58" Samsung TV with Cable TV, Netflix, Amazon Prime Video & Spotify
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a gated community in a gentrifying area, with a rich Mexican culture, and lots of very authentic, yummy taco trucks near by. It is growing and bustling. Grocery, nail salons, restaurants, are just down the road, but most of all, our back exit gets you quickly on to Hwy 71 to the south side, downtown, and all the major highways, and our front entrance takes you to Riverside which is super easy to east side Austin hot spots and downtown.
transit: We generally recommend ride sharing or renting a car.  If you need to use a vistor spot, we have limited ones in our community.  It will always be cheaper for you to take a Lyft, which are easy to get at our home since we're so close to the airport.  We are only about a 10-12 minute drive to the South Congress area, and another few mins to downtown.

Home also has Security/Surveillance and Nest Thermostat, Gorgeous backyard for R&R, and if you fancy trail hikin

description: Beautifully landscaped property with pool and walk across street to Starbucks, lots of restaurants, Natural Grocer, Alamo Drafthouse movie & eatery, sports bar and shopping. Easy access right off  Mopac/Loop 1.  Large master suite with two walk-in closets. Fully stocked gallery kitchen & open bar pass through.  Great property for a single or couple needing everything included and ready to move in.  Six month minimum or longer - All bills paid, including cable.  Safe, Secure, Central Located Although laundry is not in the unit, it's just downstairs and easy to access.  Walk through the nooks of the property and find beautiful sitting areas and statues an fantastic deep pool and bbq areas.  It has a New Orleans Courtyard Feel. The entire condo unit is available to guests. We're about 20 minutes away and available if needed. Starbucks, organic grocery store, lots of restaurants, bars and movie house are all within walking distance. Property is close to the bus line and is easy to access.

name: Feel at Home in our Bright Sparkly House on SoLa
description: Bright and spacious home conveniently located minutes from downtown Austin. The house is blocks away from several coffee shops, restaurants and bars. Our home is fully equipped for cooking, enjoying either of our two outdoor seating areas, or simply having a perfect place to crash after a night of live music or exploring downtown. The house is very spacious with gorgeous natural light. Guests will enjoy access to one bedroom, a full bath, a half bath, living room, dining area, fully-equipped kitchen and two sizable outdoor areas. The bedroom has a queen sized bed. We will provide clean pillows, sheets, and blankets. There will be at least one parking space available to you in the driveway in front of the house as well as plentiful free street parking. The house is located ~15 minute drive from the airport and has easy access to anywhere that you'd want to visit in the Austin area! Guests can access a front atrium seating area, backyard, kitchen, dining area, laundry room (with brand ne
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is safe and walkable at any time. Our house is only one block away from our favorite coffee shop, which makes for a lovely morning walk. If you like yoga, there's a wonderful studio right across the street. There are several restaurants and bars within walking distance. Famous Zilker Park is just a 25 minute walk away!
transit: Downtown is about a 10 minute car ride and Austin has Uber and Lyft as well as other ride share apps. There's also a bus line on the corner that goes downtown as an economical option. If you're feeling ambitious, you can walk into town as well, which is only a few miles away. There are also scooters like Bird and Lime in Austin now. It's also an easy walk to Barton Springs Pool, Zilker Park and Town Lake.

name: Historical Loft with Capitol View!
description: Located one block south of the Capitol in a historical building on the corner of Congress Avenue this apartment is walkable to: - All of downtown - The University of Texas - Paramount Theatre - 6th Street - Lady Bird Lake Perfect for SXSW, Longhorn football games, ACL, Formula 1, Triathlons, Marathons and experiencing Austin for the first or tenth time. The apartment has refinished 100 year old longleaf pine flooring, fabulous furniture, fresh paint colors, a vintage sound system and incredible art from local artists. The kitchen is great for cooking for a small group and the bedroom has a comfortable queen bed with hotel quality sheets. The keyless door code lock makes check-in/check-out super easy! You can walk to amazing restaurants: Franklin Barbecue, Arro, Parkside, Backspace, Ranch 616, Roaring Fork, Congress, Perry's, Truluck's, Second Bar + Kitchen, Swifts Attic, Lamberts, La Condesa, Manuel's, Annie's, etc. Or nine blocks of bars on East Sixth: Blind Pig, Maggie Mae's, Jackalo
neighborhood_overview: You can walk to amazing restaurants: Franklin Barbecue, Arro, Parkside, Backspace, Ranch 616, Roaring Fork, Congress, Perry's, Truluck's, Second Bar + Kitchen, Swifts Attic, Lamberts, La Condesa, Manuel's, Annie's, etc. Or nine blocks of bars on East Sixth: Blind Pig, Maggie Mae's, Jackalope, Midnight Cowboy, etc. Or all the bars on West Sixth: Kung Fu Saloon, The Ranch, Brew Exchange, Rattle Inn, etc. Or live music: Mohawk, Stubb's, The Parish, Elephant Room, Ray's Backstage, etc. The location can't be beat, far enough from 6th St so you can sleep but close enough that you don't have to worry about driving home.
transit: The airport shuttle is $1.50 and drops off/picks up a few blocks from the apartment. Almost everything to do is within walking distance and with the new bike share station across the street you can easily get anywhere you want to go in minutes.

Each of the others has a Queen bed, and the largest bedroom has two Queen beds and two single beds; one of the single beds is a rollaway or trundle bed from under the first single bed.  Two bathrooms, one is in the hallway and one is in the masterbedroom. The Living Area and Kitchen area have an open space and is very comfortable. There is a flat screen TV on the fireplace mantle. No fires in the fireplace allowed.  You will have the driveway for parking.    Please be sure to accurately reserve for the precise number of guests because the price is per person, per night and price changes accordingly.

name: SOLA Townhouse
description: Beautiful, quiet home in '04, 1.5 miles from Zilker Park (ACL Festival) and downtown (SXSW). Very walkable neighborhood. This is my home and I will be here, so no friends of guests allowed over.  ***ACL festies - steps from the bus stop to Zilker or you can bike, scooter, or walk to Zilker Park. ***SXSWers - steps from the bus stop to Downtown or you can bike or scooter. Living room, outdoor patio, kitchen are part of the guest space. Guests are not allowed upstairs (third floor). Located in the hot SOLA (South Lamar) retail/restaurant district close to Zilker Park & Downtown. Steps from bus stop, plenty of scooters lying around near the property. Guests are not allowed on the third floor.

name: ~Austin's  Original Urban Farm~Downtown~Historic
description: Just 3 miles east of Downtown, 5 miles west of the airport, in the heart of East Austin, lies Historic Boggy Creek Farm on 5 acres. Sit in a rocking chair at daybreak and again at moon rise. The farm is in front of you.  Check out the crops and the old farm house (1841). Shop in the farm stand. Visit the chickens.  At night, sleep tight; the 2012 Dog-Trot is well insulated for noise. If it rains, relish the sound on the porch's tin roof. Relax, you are in an old place. Located adjacent to Boggy Creek Farm, the Dog-Trot House has 2 units separated by a wide "dog-trot" breezeway. Completed in 2012, the Trot was inspired by the 1845 dog-trot farm house of the last President of the Republic of Texas (Anson Jones). Floors are North Carolina Pine; framing for the porches is Oak from trees that died in the 2011 drought/heat wave that hit Texas. The ceiling of the porch and the shelves in the apartments are Pine from a firestorm that killed thousands of tall trees just east of Austin, also in
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood around the Trot is typically pretty quiet. Occasionally a little Spanish music drifts through the air, and on some festive occasions fireworks may be observed from the Trot porch. Boggy Creek Farm is one of the oldest urban farms in the USA; the farm itself dates back to 1839. On market days, top area chefs and members of the community can be seen shopping in the farm stand.  Folks from near and far may be seen exploring the farm w/ their friends or family. It is a welcoming place; a place of peace and tranquility, a place that nourishes the soul.
transit: Minutes to everything... Downtown, South Congress, Zilker, Barton Springs, UT, Museums, Circuit of Americas and Airport. There are more cool and hip restaurants than you can imagine just a short ride away. Uber, Lyft, etc. are an easy way to get around and not very expensive because it's a quick ride to so many great destinations. City bus stops are about 2 blocks from the Trot. Austin is a big biking and scooter town; rentals can usually be found a short walk from the Trot.

name: Travis Heights Hideaway SoCo studio
description: One of the most desirable historic neighborhoods, quiet and tree-filled, but close to everything guests want to visit. Walkable location near Sooth Congress, Downtown, Convention Center. Two Free Bikes. Super comfortable private space with lots of amenities. (Hidden by Airbnb) Fiber WiFi and TV with HBO. Complimentary coffee, tea, snacks, and natural spa products. Memory foam queen bed with super soft bedding and variety of pillows. Green cleaning, pest control and yard products. Off-street parking space. This efficiency apartment is in a triplex in Travis Heights, one of South Austin’s coolest neighborhoods.  A green oasis in the heart of Austin's most popular activities.  FREE BIKES - Two bikes are just for you, good condition Specialized Crossroads, upright seating hybrids with 7 gears. Helmets, locks, lights, water bottles, front basket all provided. WELL EQUIPPED - This cozy space has everything you need for a weekend or longer.  (Hidden by Airbnb) Fiber WiFi, fast and reliable. 3
neighborhood_overview: WALKABLE - This quiet historic neighborhood filled with old oak trees is a 15 minute walk (3/4 mi.) to the nationally recognized eclectic collection of South Congress shops and restaurants. The unusual mix of homes is from the early 1900s to innovative modern homes that were built last week.
transit: LOCATION - Visit Zilker Park (2 mi.) with Austin's jewel - Barton Springs Pool. View the bats from Congress Avenue bridge at twilight before you head downtown for nightlife (less than 2 mi.). This is an ideal location for going to the Convention Center, anything downtown, South by Southwest, Austin City Limits. Bus stops are 3 and 5 blocks away (Download Capital Metro app). Download apps for ride share companies: Lyft, Uber, Ride Austin. Several hourly car rental services available, such as Car2Go if you are a member. Enterprise car rental is close by.

name: Top floor Patio View; King bed; 2 blks to Zilker!
description: The Heart House is a lovely one bedroom condo just a few blocks from Zilker Park, Barton Springs Pool, & Lady Bird Lake! With a new king bed and floor to ceiling windows in the bedroom, it's a romantic treat for any couple.  There's a queen sleeper sofa in the living room, WiFi/cable TV, reserved parking, free laundry on site. This property is pet friendly, but we do charge a $50 pet fee. If you choose to instant book, we will send an additional request. During SXSW, there is no weekly discount. The fun loving Heart House will certainly make you smile!  You will sleep soundly in the king pillow-top mattress and enjoy the 3rd story view from the floor to ceiling windows in the bedroom. The living room features a vaulted ceiling with clerestory windows which provide wonderful natural lighting.  The balcony is always a popular hangout spot for your morning coffee, dinner, or a late night cocktail. The Heart House has a fully furnished kitchen to cook in if you so choose.  The entry is onl
neighborhood_overview: The Zilker Neighborhood is one of Austin's favorites and once you arrive you'll see why. Huge trees, quiet streets, charming architecture, and proximity to so much of what makes Austin tick.
transit: You are two miles from downtown Austin and it's a great spot to explore with a bike! If you're wanting to take the bus around town, there is a bus stop around 2/3 mile away on Barton Springs Rd.  Bike rentals or tours from Barton Springs Bike Rentals and Tours with our 10% discount or bike and scooter sharing are a great way to see Austin. There's reserved parking if you are bringing a car. We have several ride-share companies in Austin now: RideAustin, Lyft and Uber.

name: Your home, deep in the heart of Austin!
description: We’ve got a 2 bedroom and 1.25 bath making getting ready easy for a few people at the same time. Two super comfy queen beds, a list of recommendations close by,  and everything you could need. We have a really cute and comfy living room to listen to music in and hang out. We have Hulu, Netflix, and really everything you might need while you’re in town.  We’re a new listing and hoping to make your stay perfect and memorable, so please feel free to reach out with any questions.  Lastly, for disclosure, there’s a train that runs through Austin and sometimes you can hear it more than others. It’s always been soothing to us, but want you to know. :) We’ll likely be staying next door but out of the way. We’re happy to answer questions or give advice on where to go and what to do, but we also want to respect your privacy. Quirky 78704 is what make Austin so unique and “weird”. It’s where the iconic South Congress shopping district is and many of the amazing food spots in town. There’s a bus s
neighborhood_overview: Quirky 78704 is what make Austin so unique and “weird”. It’s where the iconic South Congress shopping district is and many of the amazing food spots in town.
transit: There’s a bus stop a short walk at the corner of Thornton and Oltorf if you need, but we have a carport for you should be driving. We recommend Uber and Lyft as it’s normally about a 7$ ride to anywhere you want to go. We also have electric scooters that end up in the neighborhood if that’s your thing :).
