name: Stylish Highlands house
description: The perfect location in the Highlands of Denver. This house is walking distance to some of the best sights, shopping and eating in all of Denver. Mile High Stadium, the Pepsi Center, and Coors Field are all short hops from this home. As are many of the city's fine cultural institutions -- Denver Museum of Art, the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Clyfford Still Museum and the new home of the Kirkland. The Highlands is filled shops, restaurants and bars many of which are within walking distance. This house is super spacious and filled with clear Colorado sunshine. There are two distinct living areas in the house with a comfortable living room on one end and a cheerful sunroom in the other. The dining room can double as a work space. There is plenty of room to spread out in the bedrooms as both have dressers and closets full of hangers and shelves. The kitchen is stocked with all the essentials and there is a BBQ in the backyard for the warmer seasons. There is also a basement, but there
neighborhood_overview: Walking around the Highlands is treat. The historic neighborhood is filled with stunning Victorians and beautiful bungalows and (most) people keep their homes and gardens looking great. The retail districts are just as special and have some of the best shops, restaurants and bars in Denver. Guests can even walk to less exciting (but just as important) destinations like drug stores, supermarkets, banks and liquor stores.
transit: There is a lot you can walk to in the Highlands and you can walk to downtown if you are up for walking a little more than a mile. Using public transportation is also an option. There are several bus lines within a few blocks of the house. The downtown transportation hub (light rail, Amtrak, Greyhound, Bustang and airport train) is just over a mile away.  Other transportation options include bike sharing (Denver BCycle and Jump Bikes) and electric scooters, which are cheap and fun, but maybe not so great in winter.  If you have a car, parking is easy in the neighborhood. One day a month, the city sends street sweepers around so be aware of signs as the days are different on different sides of the street.

name: Gorgeous large private suite in Prime location
description: Best location in South Park Hill on a quiet block just 3 blocks to City Park and minutes to downtown!  Newly remodeled entire private suite with keyed entry.  Walk to City Park, Museum of Nature & Science, Denver Zoo, Colfax Avenue restaurants, bars, music venues, shops, and more.  Bus line direct to downtown just 1 block away! Beautiful stocked kitchen & spa-like bathroom with walk-in shower and huge soaking tub. Rare off street parking on private driveway for easy checkin/checkout! This listing is for a private keyed entry, garden level, guest suite/apartment in our remodeled early 1900's craftsman bungalow on a beautiful quiet block lined with lots of old  trees in South Park Hill.   LOTS of natural light because the windows are all above the ground. High speed WiFi AND direct ethernet connection.  Xfinity premium Cable with 220+ channels & netflix, Roku, flat screen TV's.  "Sleep number" bed with remote in the bedroom, "Tempurpedic" futon in large living room.  The futon is an unus
neighborhood_overview: "South Park Hill" is rich in culture and history and is consistently ranked among Denver's Top neighborhoods, including #1 by (Website hidden by Airbnb) who also ranked South Park Hill a Top 30 neighborhood nationwide!   You can internet search for: "best neighborhood in Denver South Park Hill" to read more about why niche ranked South Park Hill the best neighborhood in Colorado.  We love our neighborhood and we are confident you will too. Very walk-friendly neighborhood and we love our particular area of South Park Hill because we are only 3 blocks to City Park and <2 blocks to Colfax attractions.  More about City Park (3 blocks away): This expansive, multifaceted park is Denver's version of New York City's Central Park. In City Park's 330 lovely, landscaped acres, you'll find a public golf course (closed in 2019 for renovations), colorful flower gardens, ornate fountains, placid lakes and rolling green lawns perfect for picnics. City Park is home to some of Denver's most popular attr
transit: Off street front driveway parking!  The driveway is yours :)  Uber pickups in minutes.  The "15 line" bus stop that runs all day is only 1.25 block away and takes you straight downtown, with no transfers!  Or take a short uber/lyft to downtown.  Our house has an 83 walk score and 93 bike score.  Also, there is an Enterprise car rental conveniently located less than 2 blocks away if you felt like renting a car for a day:)  Several attractions are in walking distance like the Museum of Nature & Science, City Park, Zoo, The Bluebird, Sprouts Farmers Market, Marcyck's, and more. Convenient car, bicycle and motorized scooter rentals nearby.  In fact, if you'd like to rent a car for a day, there is even an Enterprise car rental less than 2 blocks away!   Coors Field, LoDo, and RiNo Art District and breweries are just a short drive or uber away.  You are also minutes from Cherry Creek shopping & dining!  Lastly, getting to and from the airport is pretty easy via bus/uber & train. Let me know

name: Sophisticated Contemporary House near Lower Highland
description: Cook elaborate dinners in a gourmet kitchen with upscale appliances and loads of prep space. Have sunset drinks on a rooftop terrace with sweeping views of the city. Cozy up by a modern fireplace and find some private time to soak in a designer tub. Open, clean and brand new! Traveling couples and families will find this home very comfortable.  Furnishings make this space gorgeous but not always toddler friendly. Glass, mirrors and furniture with corners will make families with young wobbling toddlers uncomfortable. Owner occupied, we live right next door and are easily accessible to guests. The house is on a quiet block that's walking distance to great restaurants and bars. The LoHi (Lower Highland) neighborhood is less than a mile away. Mile High Stadium, Coors Field, Pepsi Center, and Denver Aquarium are close by. Less than two miles from Union Station. Free and easy street parking in front of the house (no time limit). Cheap Uber/Lyft fares.

name: Blackbird House - Near DU
description: We have a newly built, bright and beautiful, five bedroom home nestled in the very walkable Platt Park neighborhood. Everything Denver has to offer is at the doorstep of this gorgeous home, including mountain views. * For DU graduation week, we have a studio apartment over our garage that can be rented for an additional fee. The apartment has a full kitchen and bathroom and sleeps 4 people (1 queen bed, 1 fold-down queen couch). Please inquire if you are interested. The main floor has a cozy living room, an open kitchen/dining space with a small sunny sitting area, an office with a queen mattress and a half bath. The basement has an entertainment area, a bedroom and a full bathroom with double vanity. The second floor has a master suite, two bedrooms (one with a twin bed and the other with twin bunk beds), an additional full bathroom, and a laundry room with iron and ironing board. We have an additional space, a studio apartment with a queen bed and a pull out double couch for an addit
neighborhood_overview: The Platt Park neighborhood borders Wash Park and DU. Our home is two blocks from Platt Park's celebrated South Pearl St., five blocks from light rail to downtown, and roughly thirteen blocks from the University of Denver. South Pearl Street is known for its famed Sushi Den, and there are many other restaurants, bars, shops, galleries, massage, yoga, a bakery, a florist and a Farmer's Market from late May to mid November on Sundays. Decker Library and Platt Park (the actual park) are a few blocks away. South Broadway is a few blocks farther and is lined with more restaurants, shops, and entertainment. Wash Park is less than a mile away with tennis courts, two playgrounds and a recreation center.
transit: Street parking is available. Light rail is five blocks away and a great way to get around the city and into some of the suburbs. City bikes are available at the light rail station during Spring and Summer months. A convenient bus, the O, runs up and down Broadway. We are eight short blocks from Broadway. Other options are Car2Go, Lyft, and Uber.

description: You get your own bedroom and bathroom on the garden level of the house located right in the heart of the Capitol Hill neighborhood in Denver. We are always happy to suggest places to go and what to do, but are also happy to be totally hands off and let you explore your own way in Denver. Right in the heart of Cap Hill, close enough to Downtown but away from the noise. This is one of the best neighborhoods in Denver! 10 minute walk from downtown (16th street mall), restaurants, convention center, civic center park, etc. $5 Uber/Lyft. name: Entire Guest Suite in the Highlands
description: A separate entrance welcomes you to the private 400 sq ft. basement apartment with 1 bedroom, 1 bath and cozy living area with a Smart TV and a small dining table and chairs. Our 90 year old Craftsman house is located in the historic Highlands neighborhood vibrant with restaurants, bars, shops, and trendy boutiques. We are located within walking distance to downtown (10 minutes), with nearby freeway access for zipping up to the mountains or Red Rocks. Enjoy the comfort of a queen-size sleep number bed. The living room area is a comfortable place to relax with a Smart TV and wireless wifi network.  There is a small dining table and chairs. Enjoy the comfort of a small refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, microwave and toaster. The bathroom is stocked with everything you might need. Relax on the backyard patio with a glass of wine or cook out on the gas grill . We will generally be available for our guests during their stay. If we are out of town, there are two other sources of help should
neighborhood_overview: Our wonderful Highlands neighborhood has it all:  the ambiance, the location, the people. Airbnb has a recommended list of 30 Best Restaurants in Denver. The #1 listing is Linger's which is only 1 mile away. In fact 1/3 of the listings are less than a mile away and all of the rest are within 5 miles from us. There are over 50 places to eat and drink within one mile.
transit: Free parking on the street in front of our house.We are within walking distance to downtown. You can catch a bus 2 blocks away. Uber is $5.00 to Union Station.  Free parking on the street in front of our house.

name: DENVER SUITE: A BREATHTAKING VIEW, GREAT LOCATION!
description: SPACIOUS 1 BEDROOM /1 BATHROOM SUITE by Denver Performing Art Center, Convention Center, Pepsi Center, museums, restaurants, coffee shops. You’ll love the condo's location and the neighborhood. The suite is perfect for a couple, solo adventurer or a business traveler. Quiet unit in busy Denver downtown business and theater district a block from 16th St Mall. All amenities including a swimming pool May-Sep, gym, club room, conference room. The most walkable location in Denver! OUR 1 BD/1BA CONDO IS PERFECTLY LOCATED IN THE VERY HEART OF DENVER DOWNTOWN  BUSINESS AND THEATER DISTRICT. THE VIEW OF DENVER SKYLINE  IS TRULY BREATHTAKING.... THE HIGH-RISER OFFERS GREAT AMENITIES INCLUDING ROOFTOP POOL DURING SUMMER MONTHS, A GYM, BILLIARD ROOM, CONFERENCE ROOM AND MORE. THE CONDO IS PERFECT FOR AN EXTENDED STAY. WE ACCOMMODATED A LOT OF BROADWAY SHOW ACTORS, ARTISTS AND BUSINESS PROFESSIONALS  HERE. WE WILL PROVIDE ACCESS INSTRUCTIONS WHEN RESERVATION IS CONFIRMED Send us email or call/text.
neighborhood_overview: THE LOCATION IS THE BEST: IT IS SECURED BUILDING WITH 24 HOURS FRONT DESK. SECURE KEY ACCESS TO THE BUILDING
transit: While you can walk to almost everything in town, you can also use RDT ride (free on 16th St Mall) and for a fee if you need a longer ride. There are also B-Cycle Bike Rental throughout the city, horse drawn carriages, RTD’s Bike-n-Ride, taxis or pedicabs. They are all fun and get you where you need to go.

name: Private - Art Inspired Urban Guest suite + Bikes
description: Our home is a Modern/Industrial Asian Inspired row house located just a short walk from Downtown Denver’s Uptown and Capital Hill neighborhoods. (Walk Score 95 - Bike Score 98).  Let this well-appointed and modern living suite be your basecamp to explore the city; minutes away from the City Center, Lodo, Restaurant Row, and many museums and arts venues and easy access to most mountain adventures - convenient for both business travelers and vacationers alike.  Come enjoy all Denver has to offer! You will have the entire bottom floor to yourselves. It's a very private set-up with a large modern open concept living area that includes an inviting queen bed, writing desk and leather sectional, a mini-fridge and microwave, a private bathroom, laundry and walk-in closet with hangers for your use.  There is also an amazing two-person shower!  We also provide 2 bikes and bike locks for you so that you can get around on your own schedule.  We just ask that you please be mindful and put everythin
neighborhood_overview: We are just minutes away from downtown Denver, the Convention Center, and many museums and arts venues - convenient for both business travelers and vacationers alike.  Plan a ski trip to any number of Colorado’s top ski areas, catch a concert at the legendary Red Rocks Amphitheater, explore the city’s recreational dispensaries on a cannabis tour, or sample craft beers at one of the micro-breweries in the area.  For outdoor enthusiasts, stroll through City Park, Cheesman Park or the Botanic Gardens, bike along the Cherry Creek or Platte River bike paths, or hike in our breath-taking Rocky Mountains.  If your ideal vacation focuses less on sightseeing and more on R&R, we welcome you to lounge in the shade of our beautiful outdoor garden or cozy up with a book in the hot tub during the winter months.  We have an extensive list of local activities, shops and restaurants in and around the city - do not hesitate to ask for recommendations on how to spend your time in Denver!
transit: Denver is an amazing city to visit.  The neighborhood is close to downtown and is quite safe.  Many of the best local restaurants, bars, boutique shopping, coffee shops and points-of-interest are within walking distance including some of the top running and biking trails in the city.  There is plenty of street parking available right out front of the house. Depending on the situation we may be able to share our garage – please ask.   Most bike paths are easily accessible to Cherry Creek Trail, City Park and into downtown Denver.  We provide 2 bikes and bike locks for you so that you can get around on your own schedule.  We just ask that you please be mindful and put the bikes and locks back as you found them.  There are also city bike or scooter rentals just a block away.   Uber rides from the airport are usually between $30-$40 or better yet take the new light rail to Union Station and the cost is around $9.  There is also easy access to many local bus routes, and we are very close to

name: Contemporary Berkeley 3 BED/3 BATH & Outdoor Patio
description: This property is centrally located in Denver’s charming Berkeley neighborhood where you’ll find easy access to restaurants/bars, breweries, coffee, shopping and outdoor recreation. The unit features 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, living/dining area and outdoor patio. Easy access to DIA, downtown, Tennyson St., Highlands and all that Denver has to offer! This garden level property is 1 of 3 separate units located within an iconic 1938 Denver Tudor. The kitchen is fully equipped with all the tools you’ll need including a refrigerator, range, dishwasher, microwave and coffee maker. The kitchen flows into the living/dining space with a large dining table and comfortable lounging area with 54” Smart TV. On the other side of the living/dining space is a small desk and lamp perfect for a remote office. The fully stocked laundry includes washer/dryer and the bedroom closest to the laundry area has an iron/ironing board. There are 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms each with its own
neighborhood_overview: Berkeley has a quiet small town feel but is close to some of Denver’s most popular restaurants, shops breweries and so much more. There are several coffee and restaurant options within walking distance. Tennyson Street is about a mile away and is lined with an eclectic mix of art galleries, shopping, breweries and unique amenities. Rocky Mountain Lake park is a few blocks away and Berkley Lake Park is less than a mile away both are perfect for picnics or an evening stroll. This funky neighborhood is full of local flavor and offers a unique Denver experience!
transit: Everything is close! The RTD bus stop is 1 block away on Federal and 46th and has direct routes to downtown. Many amenities are walkable or a very short Uber/Lyft ride away. Access to the mountains or other parts of the city is easy with I-70 less than a mile from the property.

name: Historic heart of Baker home w/ bikes & patio
description: Much like its neighbors in this serene, historically-preserved neighborhood, my house has been painstakingly restored to its (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) condition. Rated a "Biker's paradise," 2 bikes connect you to downtown along a dedicated river trail, but I'd recommend instead you stick around Denver's most interesting and walkable neighborhood. Four blocks from both Broadway (cafes, bars, restaurants, antiques, distilleries) and Santa Fe St. (art scene center w/ 30+ galleries), & just a 20 min walk of 8 breweries - Restored (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) 's ornate brick, original brass & club-foot tub - Air conditioning! - Two-monitor docking station in a high-ceiling, light-rich room - 420 friendly - Flagstone back patio w/ outdoor lights and grill  - Two bikes provided - Complimentary selection of coffee and tea - Shampoo/conditioner/soap, hair dryer, iron w/ board - Just off the highway, 20 minutes from the mountains and Red Rocks with easy, free parking - CorePower Yoga an
neighborhood_overview: Baker is Denver's oldest, historically preserved neighborhood, and my house sits within 4 blocks of two of the city's most foot-trafficked neighborhoods. All houses radiating for blocks in every direction were built in the 1800's and they retain their charm, tree-lined sidewalks, and quiet atmosphere. The neighborhood also has the second largest concentration of breweries in the city, with 9 breweries in close walking distance.
transit: Getting to the airport via Union Train Station, is as easy as taking the #0 northbound on Lincoln Street, and getting to the house by taking it southbound along parallel-running Broadway. It takes longer than a car, but the trip is easy, predictable, and will cost you only $9.  I'm also within a block or two of stops for the 1, 33, 52 line which take you all over downtown and other parts of town you'll want to visit.

name: Denver Apt near 16th st mall pool balcony jacuzzi
description: If you're visiting Denver there is no where better to hang your hat than the highly desirable uptown neighborhood. Walk to the 16th st mall, several music venues, bars restaurants and clubs.  Uptown is where it's at. Trust me you will love it.  I also rent cars so if you need an amazing and affordable car and don’t want to be bothered with the shady rental companies let me know and I’ll send you a link. The apt features an extremely comfortable king size bed with high end pillow top mattress.  It's like sleeping on a cloud.  The living room has a queen sleeper sofa with adjacent reclining sofa.  There is a 40" lcd hd tv with roku and free Netflix living room to entertain yourself with, if you're into that sort of thing.  Free wifi Internet is also provided.  The kitchen is stocked with all pots and pans for a nice meal.  All linens are provided for the bedroom and bathroom.  There is a glass top bar height table in the living room. There are beautiful views of the city right from the b
neighborhood_overview: We are in the center of Denver and a few minutes from everything including the convention center, the performing arts center, the capital, the Colorado Rockies, the Denver Broncos, several music venues, excellent restaurants and much more.
transit: We have free street parking available but a car is not a necessity as we are a short bike or Uber ride from just about everything.

name: Newly Renovated Basement Home
description: Newly renovated basement apartment with a ceiling height of 6ft 8 inches throughout.  The location lends to easy access to all Denver and Colorado has to offer with walking to Highlands - West and Highlands Square as well as Tennyson district, full of boutique shops, restaurants, coffee and trendy bars! within 10 minutes to Downtown and 5 minutes to 1-70, the gateway to our Colorado Rocky Mountains.  Uber, Lyft, and cabs are also convenient and low cost ways to get around town. Brand new throughout with brand new beds.  The basement is all yours with a separate entrance.  We allow dogs only.  The PET FEE is $50 per pet and must be paid before your arrival. IF YOU DO NOT DISCLOSE (via message, prior to your arrival) that you have a pet the fee will be $250 per pet. There is an additional cleaning fee of $75 for extended stay (7 nights or more).  We provide all linens, dishes, cups, utensils, etc.  If you don't see something ask us, we probably have what you need upstairs.  We are an eas
neighborhood_overview: We are walking distance (3 blocks) to restaurants and unique shops in an area called Highlands Square to the south of us.  We are about 5 blocks to another row of great shops and places to eat on Tennyson Street just to the North of us.  Sloan's Lake is south of us a few blocks and you can easily walk, ride a bike, or take a cheap lyft or uber.   If you are headed to downtown you may want to stop by LOHI first and walk around and experience a variety of shops and restaurants/bars.  Lastly, you are only 9 miles from Union Station in downtown Denver.  You could stay here for a 2 weeks and never go out to the same place twice and never have to travel farther than a few blocks or miles and enjoy some of the best places that Denver has to offer.  We are 2.4 miles from the Bronco's stadium, 2.7 miles from the Nugget's/Avalanche's stadium, and 3.1 miles from the Rockies stadium.  The new up and coming area called Rino is only 4.1 miles away as well.  On the weekends you can use the free cart
transit: I would say lyft and uber are your best bet to get around at your convenience.  There is a bus stop (the 38, real original) north of us about 3 blocks on 38th street that takes you downtown and another bus stop about 3 blocks away just south of us on 32nd (yep you guessed it the 32) that also takes you downtown.  I think it is $2.25 each way per person.  Denver has a service called CarToGo and it lets you rent Mercedes by the minute and park at any legal public parking spot for free.  That means that you can park at any parking meter for free but you can not park in a private parking lot (they  are all private downtown so don't park in them if you use CarToGo).  If you decide to sign up for Car2Go, do it before your arrival.  It takes a couple of days.  Also use my code: (EMAIL HIDDEN) and you will be able to sign up for free and get $10 drive time credit. Review the website for rules and if you think you are interested in this look into it before your trip because it takes a few days

name: 420 Friendly 79
description: My place is within walking distance to many dispensaries, Sloans Lake, restaurants, Joy Ride Brewery, bars and dining. You’ll love my place because it is 420 friendly. No smoking cigarettes inside just pot. My place is 23 minutes or 14 miles from Red Rocks amphitheater, 20 minutes or 13 miles from Dicks sporting goods Park, 11 min or 7 miles from Coors Field, 9 min or three miles to Sports Authority Field at Mile High, good for couples, solo adventures, business travelers and mainly pot tourism. This is an 11 unit apartment complex, 4 units are only for Airbnb and the rest are long term tenants. There is a coin operated laundry facility on site. I am usually not around and may be out of the country. Angelica is in charge of housekeeping and she can be found in unit (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) or at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  Make yourself at home and relax, you are among friends and neighbors!      When you exit the complex through the front gates, take a right to get to Sloa
neighborhood_overview: Make yourself at home and relax, you are among friends and neighbors!      When you exit the complex through the front gates, take a right to get to Sloans Lake, 25th St. Joyride Brewery, many dispensaries and restaurants.      You will notice the Mexican bakery, hair stylist and nail salon across the street (Sheridan) on your left before the 7-11 store. Other eateries are down along the lake on your right. Rupert's is my favorite, and is only open for breakfast and lunch.     Barbershop and one day spa are also down Sheridan just past Starbucks, as is Northern Lights dispensary. The other way on 29th is my favorite day spa A new spirit 4840 w. 29th.      Catch the #28 Eastbound bus in the covered bus shed by the lake across the street from 7-11.  Fare is $2.60 and includes a transfer. This takes you downtown where you can catch the free 16th St. Mall Shuttle.  Catch the #28 bus Westbound to return home on 15th St. The drivers are all very helpful as are other riders.      If you are i
transit: There is a bus stop half a block away and light rail is one mile down the road. Uber is $9 to downtown.

name: Explore the Hip Historic District at a Walker's Paradise
description: Catch an indie film at the Mayan Theater, then rest up in the southwest-inspired bedroom before another day of adventures. This hidden gem was once part of Denver's one and only converted photo studio, combining geometric tiles and metallic lighting.
neighborhood_overview: The property sits near the Broadway's shopping district in one of Denver’s most popular areas, with a Walk Score of 85 and a Bike Score of 91. Downtown Denver is 5 minutes away, while a short walk to the west will reach the Santa Fe Arts District.
transit: I highly recommend using ride-sharing services: For $20 in Uber credit, use my code - iyql4 For $20 in Lyft credit, use my code - grindfath (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Turo is the Airbnb of car rentals. For $25 off, use code DANNYR380 ￫ If you have multiple vehicles, there is street parking, but you need to pay attention to parking restrictions. Please let me know your car situation that way I can advise where to park within my off-street parking spaces before your arrival.  ￫ Car2Go is a local car share company that is always accessible in the neighborhood. ￫ There is a B-cycle station about a half mile away on South Broadway if you would like to rent a bike for the day.

name: Historic Park Hill  Home.
description: 2 floors, 4 lovely bedrooms, 3 full baths, fabulous kitchen, comfortable living and dining rooms. Deck, porch, cable, wifi, free parking. Upbeat, trendy neighborhood w/ bookstore, deli/market/bakery, kids' park, Zoo, City Park, Museum  Nature and Science, restaurants. Bus 15 min. to downtown, Cherry Creek, or 2 medical campuses. Elegant, warm,  comfortable, historic home. Great for all kinds of travelers- family, friends, or business. 2 floors, 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, living and dining room, gourmet kitchen, deck, porch.  Separate, otherwise occupied apartment in basement with its own entrance. Available by phone, text, email. The house is in a beautiful, tree lined residential neighborhood with free parking but still within walking distance of an Italian deli, bookstore, bakery, parks, restaurants, the Zoo, the Science and Nature Museum, golf, and 15 minutes from downtown, or the University of Colorado medical campus. Bus stop is at end of block. On street parking at house. Bus acces
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a beautiful, tree lined residential neighborhood with free parking but still within walking distance of an Italian deli, bookstore, bakery, parks, restaurants, the Zoo, the Science and Nature Museum, golf, and 15 minutes from downtown, or the University of Colorado medical campus. Bus stop is at end of block.

name: Beautiful City Views in the Center of Everything!
description: - Prime location Downtown Denver - Open, spacious apartment with cozy ski-lodge inspired décor - Penthouse feel, overlooking Downtown - One block off of Larimer Square - Gorgeous complex with pool, hot tub, sauna, steam room, & gym - Parking spot provided, leave your car and walk everywhere! The space is located in a beautiful complex in the heart of Downtown Denver. Situated on the 17th floor in a 2000 square foot apartment overlooking the city, you will love the western, southern, and eastern views of the mountains and city life. The colorfully lit, iconic May D&F Tower brightens the night. The comfortably and luxuriously furnished apartment is decorated with ski-lodge inspired decor perfect for a Denver getaway. The master bedroom has a luxurious king bed and two full sized beds fit with relaxing My Pillows. The second bedroom is complete with a queen sized Murphy bed for extra sleeping space as well as a desk perfect for studying to catching up on work. Cook delicious meals in the
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is centrally located in the hustle and bustle of Downtown. Larimer Square is just a block down where you can shop, dine, or grab drinks under the sparkling lights. There is nothing short of endless activities and events going on in the neighborhood. The Rockies Stadium is only five minutes away, Union Station is 8 minutes away, The Pepsi Center is 9 minutes away, and 16th Street Mall is only a few blocks over! You and your guests will have everything Downtown Denver has to offer at your fingertips.
transit: No car? No problem. LYFT is an easy and affordable way to explore Denver. Use the promo code “EFFORTLESS” to get $50 in FREE rides! Denver also has great options for visitors like Car2Go and B-cycle, which offer by-the-minute rentals that can be picked up and dropped off almost anywhere.

name: Solar Powered House in Denver Arts District
description: Hello. We are a worldly couple who enjoy living in Denver and Colorado lifestyle. We are offering our 4 bedroom house near downtown Denver for you to stay but we will keep one room locked with our personal belongings so you will have access to 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a brand new kitchen, and two tv rooms, and lots of space and good vibrations. Our house has 3 bedrooms. There is a covered front porch a fenced in back yard. we offer a 4KW solar roof, we encourage recycling and composting. We also just blew a ton of insulation in our attic so we use a minimal amount of natural gas to heat our home. We use bulk cleaning supplies from our local zero waste store. You are welcome to all parts of the house but for one room we will keep closed. There is cable TV, Netflix and Prime Video. There is a cute little den with office and another great office with a standing desk in one of the bedrooms downstairs. The basement has a two sleeper sofas with a nice big TV, ideal for kids. There is also
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is within a mile and a half of RiNo (River North) which is full of awesome dog friendly breweries. There are two brand new neighborhood bars within 200 ft.
transit: The house is a straight shot and about a mile from I-70. Within 3 miles is the Denver Botanical Garden, City Park (Free Jazz concerts in Summer), RiNo, Denver Coliseum, Western Stock Show Grounds.

name: Stapleton Urban Oasis
description: This beautiful home in the heart of Stapleton features an open floor plan, 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, hardwood floors, flowing natural light, two outdoor spaces, and plenty of room for your home away from home! Sleeps 7. Two cruiser bikes are provided in the 2 car attached garage. A quick 15-minute drive to the center of downtown Denver and a 2-minute drive to the light rail. Walk or bike to the Stanley Market Place and several other area restaurants. We just added two more bedrooms and another bathroom to this house. It is cozy enough for a couple but now spacious enough to sleep 7 comfortably but there is room for a couple more people as overflow. The Stapleton neighborhood is surrounded by great restaurants, shops, and fun things to do. The Stanley Marketplace is just one of the unique and interesting features of the neighborhood. It is just a quick 15 minute drive to the center of downtown Denver and it  less than a five minute drive to the light rail. It is also conveniently located
neighborhood_overview: The Stapleton neighborhood is surrounded by great restaurants, shops, and fun things to do. The Stanley Marketplace is just one of the unique and interesting features of the neighborhood. It is just a quick 15 minute drive to the center of downtown Denver and it  less than a five minute drive to the light rail. It is also conveniently located just 15 minutes from the airport.

name: Cozy Room near Downtown Denver
description: My place is in Congress park, very safe neighborhood in Denver; walking distance to National Jewish, Sticky Buds, Groundswell Cannabis, Trader Joes, Chipotle, Chic Fil A, coffee shops, restaurants, breweries, BlueBird, Zoo, museum, parks. Bus 10, 15, 40 are 1/2 block away. 15 min bus ride/8 min Uber from Convention/Civic/Pepsi Center, 30 min from Airport. Smoking at front porch only. I feel my place is fit for easy going younger crowd.  But anyone can book as long as you are easy going. You’ll love my place because of the comfy bed, the coziness, arts.  I rent out 6 spaces within same house but you will have your own private room with lock on bedroom door.. Only time you may see people if you hang out at the porch. So you may meet new people.  But no party inside the house. Noise from porch does not go inside the house/rooms. You can smoke at front porch only, not inside and make sure front door is closed all the way when you smoke. There maybe someone in couch. You have access to fron
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the best, hottest neighborhoods in Denver. Very safe. You can walk around at 3 in the morning and it should be fine.  1. Within walking distances are MEZCAL (mexican restaurant), GOOSETOWN TAVERN, CEREBRAL BREWERY, THE COFFEE as you walk towards downtown (going West) on Colfax. Colfax is one block from my house going North. Sprouts is 1 block north of my house on Colfax. 2. There are TRADER JOES, INDIAN, THAI, KOREAN restaurants going south on Colorado Blvd. Go east from my house and turn right on Colorado blvd. Go four blocks south and all restaurants should be there. 3. Going east on Colfax are some good Ehiopean resturant, Subway. 4. Museum/City Park/Denver Zoo  is 10 block walk away. Capital hill/Civic Center/16th street mall is 5 min drive.
transit: My place is 1 block from bus stop. Bus 15 or 15L go towards Downtown Denver every 10 or 15 minutes. After 10 PM, I believe they run every 30 minutes. However they run till 3 AM in the morning. Day pass is 5.20 for local and 9 dollars for regional. With regional, you can catch light rails anywhere rails go to. It is located in the area that is called North Denver. Views east from Jefferson Park take in Elitch Gardens Theme Park, The Children's Museum, Denver's Downtown Aquarium, Pepsi Center, the REIflagship store and other attractions in Downtown's Central Platte Valley. Downtown Denver and the Central Platte Valley are quickly accessed from Jefferson Park, using the 23rd Avenue overpass on I-25 and Water Street. In addition, the Light Rail C-Line is located by INVESCO Field at Mile High in the southern part of the neighborhood.

description: Sanctuary in the City is only 9 minutes from Downtown Denver, the Santa Fe Arts District, & the Convention Center.  Located in the heart of a culturally rich neighborhood, not yet gentrified, featuring family-owned shops & restaurants. This whimsical, cozy room is the perfect place for your visit to the Mile High City, but if you are looking for a place to party, this is not your destination. This is a sanctuary in the city, a place of peace & solace. Please read the house rules before booking. You'll have access to your private entrance & room. neighborhood_overview: This quiet neighborhood is surrounded by some of Denver's best authentic Mexican and Vietnamese restaurants and shops. A short jaunt of 9 minutes will put you in the heart of the Santa Fe Arts District and downtown Denver where you can access the light rail and free shuttle on the 16th street mall.  We are only 20 minutes from the beautiful foothills and the quaint mountain town of Golden. Idaho Springs natural hot springs is only 35 minutes up the hill.
transit: We have street parking. Please park in front of our property only or across the street.  Pay special attention to the street sweeping schedule posted on the light post (2nd Thursdays and Fridays April - Nov).

name: LoDo Downtown Condo w Huge Balcony!
description: This urban living condo is just 2 blocks from the newly renovated Union Station where the train from the airport drops off! Walkable to everything downtown including bars, restaurants, museums and shops. There's a very large outdoor terrace space! A covered parking space is included with the rental. There is a queen size bed in the bedroom and then a pull-out couch. The bedroom is separated by 3.5 walls, but there isn't an actual bedroom door. It's an urban-style layout! The space is the ideal urban living! You can't get a better location in Denver. This condo is only two blocks from the Union Station, which now features a 37-minute train ($9 each way) from DIA Airport! The space is modern, yet comfortable. It is very spacious, especially for a condo downtown. The unit features a very large outdoor terrace which overlooks part of downtown and The Cherry Creek. You can also see the back of Union Station from the balcony! There's a table and chairs with an umbrella so you can enjoy the s
neighborhood_overview: Lower Downtown (aka LoDo) is a historic area of downtown, Denver. It is currently booming and one of the best areas to live (or visit!). The neighborhood is safe, but as in any city, it's best to be aware of your surroundings. It is walkable to the Convention Center and all of downtown.
transit: Public transportation is two blocks away. From there you can jump on the light rail or train to DIA (Denver International Airport). The free bus on the 16th Street mall also drops at Union Station. This takes you (for free!) throughout downtown. Lastly, Ubers, Lyft and cabs are great options for getting around if it's a little farther than you want to walk.

The house also has easy access to I-70 and I-25. 1st level - Sleek and fully equipped kitchen with chefs appliances. Dining table and bar stools. Half bathroom. Living room with large sectional couch and 50inch TV. There is no traditional cable, however we do have Apple TV with Netflix and local channels.  2nd level - 2 Bedrooms: The first bedroom has a Queen bed with pillow top mattress and a TV. The second has a firm Queen bed and a pillowtop Twin bed, with a large walk in closet. There is a pack n play available upon request. This level has a full bathroom
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood was recently featured in Time magazine's: The 10 Coolest Neighborhoods in America Right Now (October 2017) RiNo has some of the best new restaurants in Denver, and new ones are opening all of the time.  Love beer? Go on a self guided brewery tour! There are 15 breweries within a mile, and 5 of them within a three block radius.  Love Coffee? Try Crema, an awesome local spot just a block up. Want a cool market with coffee, beer, ice cream, and yummy food? Head to the new Central Market for a mixture of all the above. Want to hang out in some grass? Curtis Park is a few blocks away.
transit: -There is free street parking (make sure to check the signs to avoid street sweeping days and other restrictions) -Uber and Lyft are cheap and easy ways to get around downtown.  -There is a shared bike rental program called B Cycle if you would prefer to get some exercise.  -Lime and Bird scooters are a fun way to see the neighborhood.  -The light rail from the airport is less than a mile away, and there is a bus stop on our block. -There is a free TukTuk shuttle in RiNo that operates on Friday and Saturdays, called the RiNo drink circulator.

name: Beautiful 2bd/2ba Stapleton Condo - Location!
description: Are you looking for a cozy, clean, warm and welcoming home away from home?  That is what I strive to provide - whether your plans bring you to Denver for a quick trip or a longer stay -- I want my condo to feel like home! The condo is centrally located with many restaurants, a grocery store and entertainment within walking distance.   Easy access to I-70, Northfield Shopping Center, Anschutz Medical Center and the National Western Complex. The train station is 1.5 miles and takes you to the airport or downtown Denver, which is only 15 minutes away!  The kitchen is fully stocked with pots, pans, casserole dishes, cookie sheets, a crock pot and all the plates and glassware you should need. There is a coffee pot and a “Ninja” for making smoothies.   The bar area has seating for 3 and there is a separate dining room that has room for 4 (and a high chair, if needed as well)!   Two bedrooms and two full baths provide privacy and space which makes this condo a great option for a group of 4.
neighborhood_overview: In 1995 when the opening of Denver International Airport meant the closing of Stapleton International Airport,  Denver had the unique opportunity to transform 7.5 square miles of runways, concourses and terminals into a beautiful new community.  The idea was to take the best things about Denver’s classic neighborhoods – parks, welcoming front porches, architectural diversity and tree-lined streets – and continue those urban patterns into Stapleton. And perhaps the most sustainable idea of them all: a pedestrian-friendly, mixed-use environment with everything you need a short walk or bike ride away.  Two decades later, Stapleton stands as a model for urban redevelopment worldwide.  Buzzing with bike races, farmers markets and concerts in the park, Stapleton now thrives at a grassroots level thanks to residents and business owners each adding their own touch. It has become a place that’s far better than anyone could have planned.
transit: If you aren't renting a car, Lyft and Uber are great ways to explore the city. The closest light rail station - Central Park Station - is about 1.5 miles from my house.  The Central Park Station is about the halfway point to downtown (west) and DIA (east).

name: Convention Center/Downtown/Golden Triangle Condo
description: Gorgeous high-rise living in downtown Denver. Contemporary decor with a comfortable at-home feel is the perfect place to have a Colorado vacation or productive business trip. Easy access to Denver Convention Center, Pepsi Center, Mile High Stadium, Santa Fe Art District, and Denvers best restaurants and nightlife. You will have beautiful views of the city from multiple balconies. Access to every amenity you can imagine is right at your fingertips in this resort style complex. 6th floor condo with amazing views of Downtown Denver and the mountains. King size bed with memory foam for restful sleep. Full bed in spare bedroom. If you're visiting Denver there is no where better to hang your coat than highly desirable uptown neighborhood. It's the center of everything yet not surrounded by massive obnoxious high rise buildings. Blocks to 16th st mall, several music venues, bars restaurants and clubs. Access to 2 fitness facilities, business center, lobby coffee, tanning,hot tub, pool, and ot
neighborhood_overview: Minutes from Convention Center Mile High Stadium, Coors Field, DCPA, Auraria Campus and Denver night life and restaurants.  Denver Health Medical Center nearby. Denver is near the mountains, not in them. The Mile High City is located on high rolling plains, 12 miles east of the "foothills," a series of gentle mountains that climb to 11,000 feet. Just beyond is the "Front Range of the Rocky Mountains," a series of formidable snowcapped peaks that rise to 14,000 feet. Denver might not be in the mountains, but the mountains still dominate the city. The picturesque mountain panorama from Denver is 140 miles long. There are 200 visible named peaks including 32 that soar to 13,000 feet and above. From the stately Victorian houses of Five Points to the hip restaurants and nightclubs of historic LoDo, Denver's laid-back attitude is exemplified in its neighborhoods. Explore the city on a B-cycle, Denver's pioneering bike sharing system.
transit: Whether on foot, by car or by light rail, Denver is an easy city to get around. Close to public transportation/light rail, Uber and Lyft are highly active in the area, and taxis readily available. Shuttle service is available at the complex.

neighborhood_overview: Platt Park has a walkability score of 87, nestled in the heart of Historic South Pearl Street. Explore fantastic restaurants, boutique shopping, craft breweries, coffee shops, Antique Row, art galleries, and the light rail right on the doorstep.
transit: One of the best things about the Historic South Pearl neighborhood is its central location, giving you easy-peasy access to all of Denver and the surrounding areas.  Headed to Denver see your home team play the Broncos or catch a show downtown? The Light Rail station is just a few minutes walk up the street. Touring a university with your soon-to-be college student? DU is right up the road.  Attending a wedding in the foothills? Freeway access is right around the corner. Our neighborhood has an 87 walk-ability score and there are bike and scooter rentals everywhere.  Uber and Lyft are available 24/7 as well. And of course, you have your own off-street parking space if you will have a vehicle ;)

name: Private Guesthouse \| Walkable to Food, Shops, Lake
description: This private guesthouse is the perfect home base for exploring Denver. The guesthouse has a private entrance, one bedroom, a kitchen, living room, a small bathroom, off street parking and a private patio area.  Location is perfect -- we are within a short walk to many restaurants, breweries, and shops! We love our little neighborhood, but we also love that it is so easy and quick to get Downtown (~2 miles, 10 min by car) and other parts of Denver. Sloan's Lake nearby is a plus! There is only one bathroom in the house -- everything is updated, but it is a very small space (only big enough for one person to stand in it at a time). It’s not a luxury bathroom, but it’s totally functional.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a fridge, stove, oven, microwave, coffee pot, and pots/pans. We have done our best to stock the place with the necessities, but please let us know if there is anything you need! The outdoor patio comes equipped with a grill for cooking.  The living room has a TV with a
neighborhood_overview: We love our little slice of the city in the West Highlands. It is a perfect mix of cute shops, trendy restaurants, laid back places, and the outdoors (looking at you Sloan's Lake). It is a very safe area and you can walk to so many cool places! There are about 7 breweries within a 1.5 radius of us, so if you like beer you are in the right neighborhood (actually, you might just be in the right city). It is nearby to some other cool areas too (Tennyson Art District and LoHi are our favorites in the area).
transit: The public transportation in Denver as a whole is not awesome, but an Uber or Lyft to anywhere in the city is usually very reasonable. There are also bicycles (B-Cycles) for rent just a few blocks away and you can take those around town and drop them off all over the city.

name: Great access to everything downtown.
description: My place is close to anything downtown, easy access to I-25, all 3 pro sports team's stadiums (Sunrise over Coors Field), Union Station ($9 to/from Airport), 16th Street Mall (free shuttle up and down downtown), Art District, its all close by. Most people just want a convenient place to come and go, and secure place to leave their belongings... That is pretty much my place. My place is super convenient to get around all of Denver, for really cheap. Also, one of the cool things is that my place is on the corner of the building and has great views of the sunrises that come up over Coors Field (really nice sunrises). Dog park below is neat to watch the dogs play. Nice view of the downtown skyline. You can access anything, but the master bedroom. I will be around, as I try to work from home as much as possible, and you won't be a bother to me; so ask me anything to make your stay the best it can be. Parks, nightlife, brunch, stadiums, museums, bike trails... Really a lot to do close. Reach
neighborhood_overview: Parks, nightlife, brunch, stadiums, museums, bike trails... Really a lot to do close. Reach out and I'll point you in the right direction for what you what to do to get the most out of your stay.
transit: I have EXCELLENT access (5 min walk) to public transportation that runs throughout the city. And if you need parking, got that too.

name: 100%Green Denver Home Near Downtown
description: Centrally located, this Denver Tudor is quiet and comfortable. Just one block away from Cranmer Park and 5 minutes from Cherry Creek. The room comes with private bath. Even though it looks historic, It is 100% green, heated and cooled by geothermal. Denver Business License BFN (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) You have your own private bedroom with twin beds as well as your own oversized private bathroom with a steam shower.  I designed and built this home in 2009. So everything is completely new since July 2009.  I built our home to look historic and match the neighborhood, but except for the hardwood floor finish. It is chemical free. Even the paint is green.  The heating and cooling system comes from our geothermal system that goes 180 feet deep to bring up the earths constant 72 degrees. However, it is backed up with a conventional heating and cooling system for hotter and colder Denver days...which are not many in Denver.  Electricity come from the suns radiant heat through the 37 solar panel
neighborhood_overview: We are centrally located and surrounded by several huge parks. Cherry Creek is less than a 5 minute drive. Also, City Set in Glendale, a adjacent neighborhood has tons of great restaurants, and just a 5 minute drive as well. Downtown and Lodo and the new train station, Union Station, is a 10 minute drive. Of course, The Colorado Rocky Mountains, Mount Evans a 40 minute drive for wonderful day hikes, Keystone ski resort is a 90 minute drive, Vail is a 2 hour drive, Beaver Creek is 2 hours and 20 minutes. Aspen is a 4 hour drive. You can use my Uber code to get a discount but please contact me since that code changes often.
transit: Hi, We are pretty much in the center of Denver. Many shop, markets and store nearby as well as a bus stop 1/2 block away. If Im heading somewhere and you ride is on the way, I'm happy to give you a ride. Just let me know.

Great place to stay after a Football game.  Close to public transportation.   Walking distance to several bars and restaurants.  Two blocks from the best sunsets in Denver at Sloan’s Lake Park. Separate entrance on left side of the house. Access to washer and dryer, kitchen but no stove.   Microwave and coffee maker on the premises.   Bathroom is old but clean. I am available if needed but won’t be in your space unless you want me there In the heart of the Sloan’s Lake:Highlands neighborhood only two miles from Union Station.  A mile from many bars and restaurants and from the Tennyson Street art district. It’s also less than a mile from Mile High stadium. Easy access to public transportation 3 blocks from bus 28B. Street parking is available should you be want to drive.  Uber and Lyft are inexpensive fr

name: Soak up the Rich History at an Eclectic Former Temple
description: Find yourself surrounded by history in this original Synagogue from 1937. Once part of an emerging eastern European neighborhood, now surrounded by modern comforts and neighborly rigor. Spacious, bohemian, and eclectic. A blend of modern and eclectic, you can be sure you've never stayed in a space quite like this one before. The place is divided into two separate units, if you will, like a duplex. The clubhouse on the bottom level would be your private unit, which is 3k sq ft. The upstairs unit occasionally hosts curated, private events throughout the week, many of which you are welcome to participate in! Guests have access to the entire downstairs 3000 sq ft unit which has both a shared entrance and a private entrance. The shared entrance foyer has a bathroom available for guests as well.  I live on on the balcony above the main temple unit, and our two resident Artists and caretakers stay upstairs on site as well. Events in the main temple unit are common (yoga classes, movie screeni
neighborhood_overview: The building is situated in the 40 West Arts district, a few blocks from Empower Field, close to coffee shops, dining, and entertainment. Sloans lake is a short walk to the north. 25 minutes to the mountains, 7 minutes to downtown.
transit: There is plenty of street parking. If you prefer public transportation and Uber/Lyft, Downtown Denver, and Union Station in particular (train station to DIA), is only a six minute drive away. There is also a bus stop half a block from our front entrance.

name: Tennyson St. Luxury Walk Everywhere Sleeps 8!
description: This spacious and modern home is just 1 block over from Tennyson Street, Denver’s hottest dining district. Easily walk to restaurants, nightlife, and beautiful Berkeley Park! Your group will have plenty of space in this large, modern, tastefully furnished/decorated home with 4 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms. The updated kitchen has stainless steel appliances and is stocked with everything you’ll need to cook during your stay. After a day out exploring Tennyson Street or downtown, relax in the large living area with a flat-screen TV. Sophistication meets comfort at this home in the ideal Denver location! Guests will have access to the entire home. If any issues should arise during your stay, a representative from our management company will be available 24/7 to assist you. “Since its humble beginnings in 1863, Berkeley's Tennyson Street has continued to grow and to evolve - somehow mastering the perfect balance of casual cool through its shopping, services, attractions, and amenities for De
neighborhood_overview: “Since its humble beginnings in 1863, Berkeley's Tennyson Street has continued to grow and to evolve - somehow mastering the perfect balance of casual cool through its shopping, services, attractions, and amenities for Denver visitors and residents alike. Originally annexed as the Town of North Denver, the Berkeley neighborhood has set the stage for some of Denver's most well-known names. Historic giants like Elitch's (Zoological) Gardens, whose original theatre is still located at 38th and Tennyson, helped to create the vibrant cultural landscape unique to the neighborhood and its history. Mary Elitch, the owner of Elitch's Gardens and namesake theatre, had a particular interest in developing the arts and cultural scene in the northwest Denver neighborhood. The popularity of her theatre (the first to screen movies in Denver), zoological and botanical gardens resulted in the rise of the Tennyson streetcar named the "Berkeley Motor", a bustling track of transportation that serviced and
transit: Space for 1 car in the garage is provided. Additional unrestricted on-street parking is 50 yards away.

name: Quaint Space - Near Downtown & Broncos Stadium
description: Whether you're in town for work, or for play, everything is just minutes away! Walk to the Broncos Stadium, Union Station, and some of Denvers best breweries, restaurants and more! This victorian home is the perfect jumping off point to explore Denver. Plus, it has been newly renovated so it's a cozy space to come home to and relax after a long day. This space is a lower unit, so there will be people living above you that you can hear walking around. The space is completely separate, with a separate entrance, however you do share the garden with the upper unit. Guest have access to the front and back yard, along with the back patio. These are also shared spaces with the people in the upstairs unit. I live upstairs and am available at anytime during your stay for questions. Our house is a block away from Briar Commons and Jefferson Park. We are also only a short walk to the Broncos Mile High Stadium. There are a few wonderful bike paths that intersect just down the street for easy acces
neighborhood_overview: Our house is a block away from Briar Commons and Jefferson Park. We are also only a short walk to the Broncos Mile High Stadium.

name: Basement Suite - Well-Lit, Bright, and Charming
description: Come enjoy this lower-level suite situated near all things Denver! Guests will enjoy a private suite with two bedrooms, a bathroom, and a kitchenette. Located close to easy highway access, Regis University, shopping, dining, parks, and other attractions. Guests can enter the suite through a private entrance on the side of the house. Stairs will lead you down to a cozy, quiet suite with carpet, huge closet space, and comfortable furnishings. There are two bedrooms, a kitchenette/living space, and a private bathroom. Guests have access to the lower level of the house, the yard, and back patio. Smoking is NOT permitted in the house, but it is okay outside. Emma & Thomas live on the main level of the house, and Airbnb guests stay in the lower level. We are easily accessible if you need anything to make your stay more comfortable! We have a dog that you may see in the yard, but pets will never be in your space. The house is situated in a residential area in NW Denver with a few fast food re
neighborhood_overview: The house is situated in a residential area in NW Denver with a few fast food restaurants within walking distance. However, we are only a few miles from the edge of Downtown Denver!
transit: Having a car is the easiest way to get around. There is a light rail station 1.5 miles from the house, though!

name: In the Heart of Everything + 2 Bikes + 1 Car Spot
description: Beautiful, historic 1 bedroom in the heart of Capitol Hill. Safe with a perfect location to access Denver's best attractions. Walking distance to the Capitol Building, downtown, Art Museum, multiple parks, and countless bars and restaurants.  We provide 2 bikes for you so that you can get around on your own schedule and we offer a rare and coveted parking space.  Plenty of dishes and cooking supplies, plus oatmeal, coffee, and tea for your convenience. The condo is one bedroom, with a memory foam mattress. However, there are 2 couches in the living room. One with a pull out foam mattress and the other, that can be crashed on, but we ask that you use sheets to preserve the leather.  We'll leave a picnic backpack for you, a frisbee, some games, bike lights, and helmets. We just ask that you please be mindful and put everything back as you found it.  We love Denver. Feel free to message us with any q's regarding where to go or what to do and if you want to take a casual brewery tour, reac
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood has everything you could need. Our favorite restaurant is 2 blocks away- City O' City. They're open from early am (with delish coffee) until 2am (with delish drinks and late night snacks).  There are plant shops, coffee shops, bars, and nature all within a few minute walks. One of my favorite bike rides is a 10-minute ride down to Confluence Park where you can dip your feet into the water while watching the rapids and mini-waterfalls. If you go the other direction, you'll be at Cheesman Park, with views of the mountains and a green space to play frisbee.
transit: We provide bikes for 2! There's also lots of public transit around and ride shares. If you happen to have a car, we will provide a parking space for you as well.

name: Adorable Victorian Home in the Highlands.
description: Relax in the comfort of a quiet, charming Victorian home located in Denver's hottest neighborhood. Within walking distance of countless shops and restaurants, and perfect for the business person wanting close proximity to downtown (~3 miles). Guests will have access to the upstairs bedroom and full bathroom.  There is a half bathroom downstairs also available for use.  The rest of the house - living room, sunroom, kitchen, dining room, and back yard - are all open to guests.  :) This is my home, but I will not be in the space while you are using it.  However, I will be close, so simply let me know if you have issues/questions.  :) This home is perfect for someone who would rather walk than drive. It's equidistant from the Tennyson Street shops and Highland Park (32nd and Lowell), both full of boutiques, restaurants, and coffee shops.  Also Pferdestellar Park is a half block away. Parking is on street - but plenty of it!

name: Mountain Lion House - 4 Bedroom by the Conventions
description: This designer four bedroom home with killer rooftop views is located conveniently between Denver’s Museum District, the Colorado Convention Center, and the Santa Fe Arts District, right in Denver’s Golden Triangle Neighborhood. Almost everything you could need (groceries, bars, art, restaurants, the convention center, museums) is within a 10 minute walk of the house. The house also includes a two car garage, and all access is automated with coded locks. This house was designed from the ground up to showcase the best Denver has to offer, and offer vacationers and conventioneers alike everything they'd need for a wonderful time in my fair city. A stocked gourmet kitchen, walls full of local art, premium green mattresses, bamboo sheets and towels, and a smoker and picnic table on the roof. You'll have access to everything in the house, including the kitchen, bathrooms, TV, rooftop, garage, and laundry room. I give you the entry code, full instructions on how the house works, and have 24/7
neighborhood_overview: Golden Triangle is right in the middle of everything, yet quiet enough to get a good night's rest before a big day at the convention center or after a night on the town. We have plenty of good restaurants within a few minutes walk, and the 16th Street Mall is a 12 minute walk away, as are quirky art galleries on Santa Fe and the State Capitol building by Civic Center Park.
transit: Uber, Lyft, and Denver B-Cycle Bike share are all very accessible from the house (B-Cycle is 300ft away), and the neighborhood itself is very walkable. The house includes a two car garage if you're driving to Denver.

name: Modern StandAlone 2 Story Loft/RiNo
description: Downtown, light-filled, 2 story loft w/ exposed brick; beautifully furnished; in Denver's hippest area, RiNo (River North); next to a B-cycle station, walk to Coors Field, coffee, yoga, live music venues, best new restaurants. Best spot in Denver. Private entrance to your own sunny private courtyard. Converted industrial 2 story loft: 1st floor has beautiful, open, modern kitchen with counter seating, additional dining area, large sunny living room, private den with queen sofa/trundle, full bath with washer/dryer. 2nd floor has 2 bedrooms (both with queen beds) and a gorgeous bathroom with separate tub and shower. One car attached private garage included (a rarity downtown!) Private entrance to your own sunny private courtyard. Converted industrial 2 story loft: 1st floor has beautiful, open, modern kitchen with counter seating, additional dining area, large sunny living room, private den with sofa/trundle, full bath with washer/dryer. 2nd floor has 2 bedrooms (both with queen beds) an
neighborhood_overview: River North (RiNo) is the hippest area in Denver, and is home to some of the coolest restaurants, coffee shops, yoga, and live-music venues in the city. 4 blocks south of Denver Central Market ... fantastic! 2 minute drive to The Source, Denver's trendsetting sophisticated restaurant and market.  Less than 10 minute bike ride or super quick Uber to Coors Field, Union Station, Pepsi Center.  10 minute Uber to Broncos Stadium (Sports Authority Field at Mile High).  Quick access to I-70 for the mountains or I-25 to Boulder. Great place to stay if you're working downtown
transit: Working downtown? 15 minute walk to downtown, 16th Street Mall, Larimer Square. One car attached garage included. Walking distance to Coors Field, B-Cycle station, and RTD stop. Great restaurants, coffee, galleries, bars all within walking distance. Uber/Lyft easily accessible.

name: Private Bedroom in Downtown Denver
description: Rent the guest room in our lovely downtown Denver home! Recently redecorated with great light, it has a brand-new queen mattress and plenty of room. There is a beautiful private courtyard with a fire pit and grill.  In the heart of Rino, you're a block from the light rail and a short walk to Denver Central Market, Coors Stadium, The Source, and Shake Shack.  RiNo is one of the fastest growing neighborhoods in the country--stay right in the heart of it! The house is has a ton of charm, built by my great-grandfather in 1889.  There are a lot of original details.  There is a huge back yard with a fire pit, as well as plenty of space inside.  The room is close to the full bathroom.  There is a fully stocked, remodeled kitchen in case you like to cook!  Help yourself to the HBO on the AppleTV or to a glass of wine on the front porch!  The neighborhood has been ranked by Thrillist, Eater, and the NYTimes as one of the most dynamic food and bar scenes in the country! You'll have full access t
neighborhood_overview: Rino/Five Points is a hot neighborhood-!  There are more bars per capita than almost any other zip code.  There is a flower shop around the corner and two high-end markets, The Source and Denver Central Market, under a mile away.  Some of Denver's best restaurants: Hop Alley, The Populist, Bar Helix, and Fausto are all within a walk as well.  The architecture is amazing with some houses, including this one, built well over 100 years ago.  The neighbors are extremely friendly and you're about as close to everything as you can get!
transit: The airport LightRail line is a 5 minute walk from the front door.  The Downing Street station is even closer!  An uber to the heart downtown is rarely more than $7.  Coors Field is a 10 minute walk.

name: 3 King Beds! WiFi! Pet friendly!Close to Downtown!
description: Have your own space! Close to everything! City Park, Zoo/Museum, Downtown Denver!  Light, modern, and nicely appointed! 3 Bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Private bedrooms with King size beds in each of the 3 bedrooms plus a couch in the living room that can be pushed together to form another king size bed if you need it. There is also a queen size air mattress for you if you need it. Wifi included. The home and backyard are perfect for pets! This is a great place to stay if you are traveling with pets and want to be close to Downtown Denver. The house is located on the corner of Haddon Rd and Colorado Blvd (which is a busy street) You can hear some traffic noise inside when it is quiet but it's never bothered us and it's hard to hear any traffic when you are watching TV or have some music going. name: Magical-Gorgeous Room In Spacious Custom Home!!
description: You'll be booking a private room with a commercial-grade(2)electronic-lock. The house is large, spacious & comfortable. It is located minutes from Downtown Denver! You can make your stay private, quiet & relaxing in the comfort of your themed Green Forest room, or enjoy the social atmosphere in the common areas.  We have hosted over a 1000 guests, our processes & policies are fine tuned. Check-in is automated & communication is quick. Read more below & messages on the app for questions. Thanks! All of the rooms are marijuana friendly!! We are in Denver, so we use 100% Wind-Power in our homes & Environmentally Friendly Laundry Detergent! Your mother would be proud!! All of our rooms are individually themed, so each stay has a unique feel! The whole house is free to use, unless it is locked! This includes, commons rooms, yards, bathrooms & parking spaces are shared for you! You have designated space in the fridge and cupboards with your room name on it. Only use your space or your person
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful, family neighborhood surrounds this lovely house. You will love how it is barely far enough away from downtown to enjoy some quiet, while still being close enough to get involved if you wish! There are numerous parks a short walking distance away, enjoy them! Also, nearby are great restaurants (check the guidebook), shops, and entertainment! Feel free to ask about our local guide if you need help! We are well involved in the community and have many discounts at local places. They are all easily available in the locals section of your house.
transit: Denver is a rather large city, and is not very dense. Most people have cars, and drive everywhere. The best transportation is Lyft or Uber. You can use these codes for discounts! Lyft = AUSTIN565292 and Uber = t7p0r. The bus system in Denver is also rated one of the best! There is a bus stop just about a block away! Use an app to find routes, times, and distances. Parking on the street is free (watch for street cleaning they will ticket or tow!) and the driveway is for guests as well!

description: Cute and cozy house near Downtown Denver with easy access to multiple highways. There are two private bedrooms with queen sized beds, ceiling fans, and walk in closets. The living room has games, books, and movies for you to enjoy during your stay.  Sundry items like shampoo, conditioner, liquid bath soap, toothpaste, and toothbrushes are available in the bathroom. The dining room seats eight very comfortably. The kitchen offers  items to help you make delicious meals. A microwave, coffee maker, coffee grinder, blender, toaster, dishwasher, refrigerator, stove, and dishes are available for you. There is a relaxing pond in the back yard. You have private access through the main door by using a key lock box. Please keep the keys in the lock box.  The reason why we ask you to keep the keys of the house in the lock box is for your own convenience. neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet with a park directly across the street from the house. The park offers a basketball court, baseball field, work out area, playground, picnic areas, and plenty of space to walk and enjoy nature. At the top of the hill, there is a great view of the downtown Denver skyline.
transit: AIRPORT RAIL TO DOWNTOWN At a cost of only $ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) each way, travelers can now take the airport rail from DEN to Denver Union Station and vice versa. The 23-mile ride takes approximately 37 minutes. The rail line serves eight total stations, including the new Westin Denver International Airport Hotel, connected to the airport itself. TOURIST INFORMATION DESK AT DENVER UNION STATION Mon.–Sat., 9 a.m.–5:30 p.m. Sun., 10 a.m.–2 p.m. Pick up maps, Official Visitors Guides, rail service info and arrival guides (with hotel information); also receive personal assistance. TOURS The Crawford Hotel offers tours of Union Station on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays at 1 p.m. and most other days at 4 p.m. Tours are $20 per person and a portion of the proceeds benefit The Crawford’s Dollars For Dreams non-profit partners. Tours last one hour and showcase Union Station’s history, art, transportation, restaurants, retail space, and The Crawford Hotel’s luxury guest rooms. Each

name: City Park Snoopy
description: City Park area delightful large queen suite offers queen bed and shared hall bath in newly remodeled space. Mini fridge and microwave complement great area restaurants on 17th Avenue.  Close to tourist attractions, but live like a local here.  We are located within 5 min drive to the Cherry Creek Shopping area or the wine and dine Downtown/16 Street Mall/LoHi/RINO areas. We are ready to host to your delightful Mile "High" experiences. 420 friendly - smoke outside! We offer a simple but elegant space for our guests, with super comfy queen bed and central air conditioning. We've recently renovated the upstairs space, with beautiful high gloss flooring, making the most of sunny days. You'll like the spacious suite, with extra upholstered seating, as well as a desk, with high speed wifi. A large flat screen television offers DirectTV with the sports package. You'll also find a good sized mini refrigerator and microwave (there is no access to a traditional kitchen - but you don't need it, t
neighborhood_overview: Great location near City Park, one block from Colfax. Just around the corner from the newly opened Carla J. Madison Recreation Center ($5 day pass, see photos), near the Tattered Cover, a great spot for heading to the many music venues on Colfax - the Ogden, Fillmore, Bluebird and more. Uber or Lyft into the Downtown area for a night on the town. 17th Avenue has an incredible Restaurant Row with a wide array of cafes, bistros, coffee shops and restaurants to walk and feel like a local, from dawn til closing time!  Start your day with St. Mark's - a coffee shop that will make you feel like a local, with indoor and outdoor areas (tip- they're open late, along with their bar counterpart, ThinMan). The Vine Street Pub has great burgers, good beer and hosts more than a few good comedy shows through the week. Atelier is exceptional and approachable French dining with a sense of humor, stop in to see what's on the menu this week.  We are walking distance to the following:  0.4 mile to City Pa
transit: Free Street Parking - though it can be a bit tight later in the day - we do recommend using Uber or Lyft, or using car shares, CartoGo is a great option If you are coming from the airport, the easiest way to come is the A-line train for $9, get off at the 40th St station and take a short Lyft or Uber for another $7.  For only ~$30, take a Lyft/Uber directly from DIA. If you're driving from DIA, take I-70 west, get off at York/Josephine, go south, and take a left at 16th Avenue. We are close to public transportation (RTD system (Website hidden by Airbnb) and Uber or Lyft is inexpensive in the area and easy to pick up. You can always rent a bike, Denver is home to one of the country's largest shared bike programs, through B-cycle. A daily pass for $9 allows you access to a bike, with plenty of docking stations throughout the central tourist and downtown areas. You'll have 30 minutes to get from one station to another with no additional charge, $1 for the next 30 minutes after that. Carsh

name: 1890’s Arts District Cottage in Historic Baker
description: Built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and located in the heart of Denver's historic Arts District on Santa Fe, this beautifully restored home is located right in the middle of shops, galleries, restaurants and more.   The private yard is professionally landscaped with a fire pit which is perfect for entertaining!  For travelers seeking other options, check out our 2 bed/ 1 bath unit at https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/23034653?s=51 A contemporary remodeled space located in one of Denver's most vibrant and historic neighborhoods.  The home was recently remodeled with a chef’s kitchen, stainless steel bbq grill, and large perfect for relaxing after a day out on the town.   The neighborhood is filled with lots of restaurants, breweries and galleries and is located in the heart of Denver’s Santa Fe Arts District.  A very short uber or e-scooter ride from downtown restaurants, bike paths, parks and of course, shopping. Entire home, outdoor areas and the garage are available to our guests. $2
neighborhood_overview: The Baker Historic District is one of Denver's oldest and diverse neighborhoods, located just a few minutes from Denver's Central Business District.  The Baker neighborhood  is nestled between Denver's Santa Fe Arts District and South Broadway.   Our home is walkable to many of Denver's finest galleries, antique shops, and neighborhood-friendly restaurants and breweries.   E-bikes and scooters are easily accessible, which help make your commute to RTD rail stations and downtown effortless.
transit: Parking is plentiful throughout the neighborhood   Nearby RTD Train Stations -  10th & Osage From Denver International Airport, take the A-Line to Denver's Union Station and transfer on the C or E line to 10th & Osage stop.  From this station, it is about a five minute Uber or e-scooter/bike ride.   Denver Convention Center/16th Street Mall - 5 Minute Uber or a 20 minute walk.  To reach the convention center by train, start at either Alameda Station or the 10th & Osage Station.  Take the D, C, or F lines to the Theater District /Denver Convention Center Station.

You'll be within walking or biking distance to all the happening restaurants, bars and shops on 17th Avenue. From Starbucks and Einstein's bagels to St Mark's Coffee House and the award-winning Beast + Bottle - you've got it here! We're close to supermarkets, coffee shops, and a tasty vegan bakery! Easy access to public transportation to downtown attractions and shopping are just minutes away. Whether you’re meeting friends for dinner at Strings, discovering local art while sipping on a cappuccino at St. Mark’s Coffee House or listening to great music at Jazz in the Park, the Carriage House offers one of the best Denver locations for your stay! name: Charming Victorian in Curtis Park
description: Located in the heart of the historic Curtis Park Neighborhood of Denver, this apartment is ideal for a couple, but can comfortably accommodate up to 4 people (air mattress and additional bedding provided).  Parking, fireplace, spiral staircase, cozy lofted bedroom, & balcony with big city views. This historic building was built in 1895 and originally was used as a tailor shop.  The apartment boasts large original Victorian molded windows, high ceilings, and a unique lofted bedroom reached by a spiral staircase.  The balcony upstairs offers incredible views of the city skyline with the Rockies in the background.  In the evening the main floor also offers great views of the city, and provides amazing natural light during the day. Guests will have access to a fully operational kitchen: stove, oven, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, dishwasher, pots, pans, utensils, etc.  There is a washer and dryer in the unit with detergent and other needed supplies.  On the main floor there is a Bluetoo
