name: Beautiful Highlands Oasis
description: Welcome to our swank highlands home - close to everything and great for groups exploring Denver. Plenty of room and excellent amenities in the fun Denver Highlands. Our four-bedroom apartment is a great space to explore nearby shops and restaurants, or share a meal at home in our well-stocked kitchen and gathering areas. Our home is a large four bedroom condo with plenty of space for large groups. The upstairs features a master bedroom with ensuite bathroom, including a shower and tub, a private balcony, and second bedroom with another ensuite bathroom and shower.  The main level has a full kitchen, dining area, and living room with gas fireplace.  The downstairs includes a rec room with television and and foosball table, as well as two additional bedrooms with queen beds and a shared bathroom with shower. We also have a two car garage for use during your stay so parking won't be a proble. You'll have full, private access to the whole house. We also have keyless entry so late arrival o
neighborhood_overview: Victorian-era homes and buildings; lush gardens and parks; hip independently owned shops; art galleries; and restaurants, all make the Denver Highlands neighborhood a great destination for visitors. There are three diverse districts to discover here: Highlands Square (right outside our front door), Tennyson Street and Lower Highland (LoHi). Boutiques, wine shops and bookstores, as well as popular restaurants and bars radiate out from Highland Square on West 32nd Avenue and Lowell Boulevard. And, in the Tennyson Street Cultural District, you can spend an afternoon browsing antique prints, photographs and paintings from Colorado artists, plus find live music venues and great ethnic foods. LoHi is characterized by a mix of old and ultra-modern architecture, some of the city's most innovative restaurants and bars, and incredible views of the Highland Bridge and downtown Denver.
transit: Our place is about a $6 Uber or Lyft ride from downtown, but there's also plenty to do within walking distance of the house.  The Route 32 city bus runs along 32nd Ave. and will take you to through other parts of the Highlands neighborhood and into downtown. The eastbound stop, MyStop #10903, is located diagonally across the street. The westbound stop, MyStop #10904, is located one block up, on the corner of 32nd and Perry. If you’d like to rent a bicycle, the closest B-cycle station is on 32nd and Julian.

name: Charming Basement Apartment Near Lively Broadway
description: Welcome to the lower-level suite of our beautiful home. We are located just 5 minutes from downtown in one of the best neighborhoods in Denver. Your new home is on a beautiful tree-lined street just a couple blocks from S. Broadway where you will find a TON of delicious restaurants, great bars, and lots of shopping. Hop on the light rail to explore other neighborhoods or jump onto I-25 or I-70 to hit the slopes or go for a hike.  We know you will fall in love with Denver while staying with us. Our beautiful 1925 home will provide you with a quiet place to rest or a home base for adventures. Our home offers a private entrance and completely private suite. We do live upstairs and therefore are incredibly close if you ever need anything at all. We love hosting people and introducing them to our beautiful city. We will do whatever it takes to make sure you have the best experience possible. Our downstairs apartment features a fully equipped kitchen and dining room, 2 bedrooms, bathroom, an
neighborhood_overview: South Broadway ("SoBo" for short) is lined with an eclectic mixture of neighborhood taverns, avant-garde clothing stores, art galleries, used bookstores, sporting goods emporiums, ethnic restaurants, music clubs, pizza parlors, live music venues, and everything else you'd expect to find within the urban heartbeat of The Mile High City. Whether you're looking for something to do or something to eat, there's a good chance you'll find it on Broadway. The area has a vibrant late-night scene, with clubs featuring salsa, swing, techno and indie rock sprinkled throughout.  We are also walking distance to the beautiful Washington Park known as Wash Park by locals. Washington Park itself has two lakes, two formal flower gardens, tree-lined paths and seemingly endless expanses of green grass. It's a fitness mecca for Denverites, and on any given day you're likely to spot people walking their dogs, running, biking, paddle boating or doing yoga. You will also find more shopping, art-galleries, res
transit: We are located right near many bus lines and are a 15 minute walk to the Alameda light rail station. Lyft and Uber are also inexpensive to use to get anywhere if you would rather not use public transportation. We are very centrally located making it easy to access anywhere in the Denver Metro Area. We would be happy to help you with navigating the city.

description: This is a 3rd floor bedroom in a townhouse of 3 bedrooms with it's own adjacent bathroom (outside of the hallway) on the top floor. The space is shared with two others. In the heart of the Santa Fe art district, this house is right by all of the galleries, a block away from 2 breweries, restaurants, and one mile from downtown ski rises. 5 minute drive from the Convention Center. The bedroom has a queen size bed, TV with Netflix and firestick (no cable). Guests have access to all common areas, the sauna in the garage, fully equipped kitchen, pool table, living room, and roof top deck with a hot tub! When you book this room you are sharing the space with other guests. There is a lot going on in the Santa Fe Art District. Art galleries, restaurants, bars, etc. On the first Friday of every month the entire street lights up with people visiting all of the galleries that open up their doors for guests to check out. Food trucks are parked around and you can explore all of the wonderful bites

name: Charming Victorian in Baker - Master Suite
description: This is one of the best (I think it's absolutely the best) neighborhoods in Denver. The house is two blocks from the most happening section of Broadway, full of restaurants, bars, shops, and all kinds of entertainment. It's also just two blocks from busses and bike/scooter rentals. You will have the master bedroom, which has a large ensuite bath and great closet.  You are welcome to share to common spaces: kitchen, dining and lounge area. Most original features of the home are still intact, like stained class and beautiful moldings.  If you want to stay in there's a great selection of board games to play, books you can borrow, and I subscribe to Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, and several premium channels that you can stream in the living room or upstairs on your own device. You'll have access to the main floor common areas as well, kitchen, dining, living room, and back yard with grill. I spend about as much time in the house as out, and I love to cook, board game, ski, and swim; you're welcom
neighborhood_overview: I hope you love the neighborhood as much as I do!  The home is in a residential area and is pretty quiet considering that it's only two blocks from broadway with dozens of restaurants, shops, bars, distilleries, breweries, coffee shops, the historic Mayan theater, and more!  I'm happy to give you information on all the neighborhood has to offer with some of my favorite spots and activities, like First Friday at the Santa Fe Arts district, just 10 blocks north of the house.
transit: The transportation links are fantastic with four bus lines within two blocks of the house. You can also grab a Lyft share to down town for as little as $4.50. The house is also just minutes from highways 25 and 6th, and from Santa Fe Drive. There is space for one car in the off-street space behind the house. 1st Avenue parking is restricted to residents only but any additional vehicles can park on the cross streets (Bannock and Acoma) without issue.

name: Spacious & Stylish Basement Suite in City Park
description: Clean and comfy recently-renovated basement apartment with high-end furnishings that spare no expense.  Located a short ride from downtown Denver and a quick train ride from the airport, you'll be just a short walk to City Park, the Denver Zoo, and the Denver Museum of Nature & Science.  We are a young and active dog-loving couple who live right upstairs should you need anything, happy to help and make sure you have the best stay possible while in Denver! This spacious basement apartment will make you feel right at home. Keyless entry provides you a pain-free check-in and check-out process at any hour, and there is always ample parking out front in case you have a rental car. We live right upstairs and have 2 loving and senior dogs (12 and 14-years-old) that will likely greet you as you enter through the back door, but don't worry they are kept back by a dog gate to protect your personal space. You may hear the occassional pup walking around or muffled talking, but we're cognizant of n
neighborhood_overview: North City Park is a quiet and spacious neighborhood that you don't find very often in Denver, and being walking distance to the zoo, museum, and City Park are a serious perk. The Plimoth restaurant, Spinelli's Market, and River & Roads Coffee are some of our favorite local spots, and if you happen to be here on a Sunday evening in the summer, Jazz in the Park is not to be missed. The trendy RiNo neighborhood is just off to the west with breweries, restaurants, and incredible street art that we recommend everyone walk around and see.
transit: Just 10 blocks south of the 40th & Colorado train station which is just 1 stop away from Union Station or a 30min ride out to Denver International Airport (DIA). Lyft and Uber are readily available for anywhere you need to go, and for joyriding around town there are plenty of electric scooters and bicycles in the area that can be rented (Lime, Bird, Jump bikes, etc). We're also just 3 blocks north of City Park which has over 4 miles of walking or running trails.

A great little duplex house in the Whittier neighborhood, two blocks away from City Park. You will have access to the whole house except my home office, which will be off-limits and locked. I utilize self-checkin via a lockbox. I will send the code a few days before your arrival. Whittier is a wonderful neighborhood with tree-lined streets and friendly neighbors. Though very pleasant, we are still in the city, so please remember to lock doors at night and when you are not home. Accessible to Car2Go, Uber, Lyft, and a few bus lines. name: Large & Cozy! Perfect for 2, great for 4 friends.
description: You will feel welcome, cozy, and safe in our extra large garden unit in a great neighborhood in lower Cap Hill. With many restaurants, shops, cafes, and bars nearby, you'll love the easy access to the best Denver has to offer. The in-law has its own bathroom, living room,  and micro kitchen with a mini-fridge, microwave, oven, electric kettle, coffee maker with free coffee. If you are two people that need two separate beds, there is a $20 charge to make up the second bedroom. Pups are $15/day. There is one bedroom with a queen size Keetsa mattress and a large private living room with a fireplace and a sleeper sofa that can be used as a second bedroom.  Super fast wi-fi if you need a space to work, and a TV with Roku, antenna, and DVD player for entertainment. Dogs are welcome for an additional fee of $15 a night. We have a big fenced in yard that you and your dogs are welcome to use.  No cats are allowed. The entrance is located at the back of the house through the yard. You will have
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood (Capitol Hill/Alamo Placita) is centrally located in Denver. Close to downtown and very walkable, with great restaurants, bars, a cafe, laundromat, and shops within a few blocks of the house. There's a Trader Joe's and Safeway within walking distance. There are parks nearby for lounging, jogging and walking Fido. Lightshade, one of the best dispensaries in town is a block and a half away, and there's a nice little wine/liquor store on the corner.
transit: We have a parking spot for you if you have a midsize car, and lots of street parking is available. If you have a larger car, please let us know and we will try to accommodate it. Public transportation is great from our house, Lyft is easy an inexpensive and Denver's bike share program B-cycle is awesome and has a station 100 yards away!

name: Half house near RiNo - 3 Beds
description: Clean, comfortable and convenient house north of downtown and east of the River North (RiNo) district. You have two private bedrooms and a private bathroom in a house with, potentially, other awesome Airbnb guests upstairs. Ideal for those who want a good night's sleep in-between their activities. Transitioning neighborhood has a cool vibe with diverse residents. Transportation options: walk 10-15 minutes to two rail/train stations, A-Line and L-Line, rent a car (free parking), or take a Lyft. Your private bedrooms are on the north side of the house with large windows you can open or close. The beds provide sturdy support of a comfortable mattress for a rejuvenating night's rest. Enjoy the texture of natural fibers on the bedding and towels. Recent (Dec 2018) replacement of carpet with luxurious cushioned pile in bedrooms. There are empty dressers and a closet for your clothing and luggage.   Classic white and black tile in the bathroom with toilet, sink, and tub/shower for a ‘just rig
neighborhood_overview: Convenient walkable location. A few blocks walk to rail/train stops at 38th & Blake for the A-Line route and 30th & Downing for the L-Line route. Short walk or Lyft ride (~1 mile) to a ton of great restaurants and craft breweries on Larimer/Walnut/Blake Street. This neighborhood has a rich jazz history and with the quirks of a transitioning neighborhood has a lot to offer the adventurous. Home of the Jazz Festival the third Saturday of May. It is close to downtown but far enough away where traffic isn’t background noise, and there is plenty of free on street parking.
transit: Public transportation:  Convenient access (10-15 minute walk) to two light rail lines, A-Line (that goes to and from the airport--very convenient--and to Union Station) and the L-Line (that goes from 30th and Downing into downtown).  Those with cars:  Free and ample street-side parking right outside the front of our house.  In the off-chance that our immediate street is filled, you wouldn't have to park too far away, around the corner at most.  For anyone: Lyft has a strong presence in Denver!

description: Relax in a light and airy updated home with skylights throughout and a huge private backyard. Walk to  DU, Porter Hospital, local restaurants and bars, parks and bike paths. Centrally located, it's a 20 minute drive downtown & just blocks to public transport. On-street parking. Upgrades include granite and stainless steel, hardwood floors, gas stove and luxurious bathrooms. Covered patio and private yard with a calming water feature & gas grill. No smoking inside, cannabis OK outside. Relax in a beautifully remodeled ranch style home with skylights throughout and a  private backyard. Within walking distance to DU, Porter Adventist Hospital, local restaurants and bars, a par 3 golf course, lush parks and bike paths. A 20 minute drive to downtown Denver, this conveniently located house is very close to I-25, a 20 minute walk to the DU light rail station and 10 minutes from a bus stop. Recent upgrades in the house include granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, hardwood floors th
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is known as the DU-Porter neighborhood. Blocks away is the University of Denver, Colorado's oldest private university. The neighborhood is quiet but is not far from a number of restaurants, bars, grocery stores, parks and there is easy access to public transportation. You'll be near the original Chipotle, Illegal Pete's, Wash Park, the Sushi Den, Lucille's Cajun Restaurant, and Harvard Gulch 9-hole par 3 golf course, just to name a few places.
transit: Parking is a cinch right in front of the house. Easy access to I-25 to get out of town. Public transport is easy to use:  the bus stop at University & Vassar is a 10 min walk. To take the light rail, the University of Denver station is a quick 20 minute walk. Or you can take the bus to get there.  Go to (Website hidden by Airbnb) for more info. Walking & cycling  are good options, too.

name: Cozy basement suite in historic 'hood!
description: Enjoy a Denver escape in this private basement apartment with separate entrance. Located in desirable Sunnyside area in North Denver, it's a quick car/bike/scooter ride to Downtown Denver, Mile High, Coors Field, Pepsi Center - pretty much any major Denver attraction. Walking distance to the Highlands and Tennyson Districts, with amazing restaurants and bars. Features 2 bedrooms, full bath, kitchenette and ample dining/living/work space for couples, business travelers and families with kids. The apartment is located in an historic 1926 Tudor home with cozy charm and character. Guests enter at the back of house via a beautifully-landscaped yard with water feature and seating area.  The 4-room suite is laid out as follows: • Front room includes loveseat, dining/work table and kitchenette with full-size fridge • Spacious, full bath includes bathtub with shower sprayer. • Master bedroom features comfy queen bed, gas fireplace heater, seating area with large couch, TV and dressers. • Second
neighborhood_overview: Adjacent to the popular Highlands neighborhoods of Denver, Sunnyside has its own, somewhat rustic charm, that sets it apart. The Sunnyside neighborhood is an historic area in Northwest Denver. It's a quick commute to DIA, Boulder and downtown Denver. Our rental is located in the Southwest corner of Sunnyside, just across the street from the well-known Highlands neighborhood. Just within a 1-mile radius are beautiful parks, craft breweries, unique ice cream shops, amazing restaurants and boutique shopping. Most major event centers are less than 10 minutes away.
transit: Bike, car share, walk, car (on street parking), scooter, bus. All are easy and very inexpensive options to get to Downtown and Mile High Stadium.

name: Peaceful Retreat in Congress Park
description: Make yourself comfortable in this beautifully appointed colonial style home in the heart of Congress Park.  Steps away from Denver's stunning Botanic Gardens, City Park, Congress Park, Cherry Creek North and National Jewish Hospital.  Step in from the tree lined street and feel immediately at home!  A true sanctuary in the city, from the muted and soft tones on the walls to the luxurious bedding and perfectly appointed rooms.  The backyard offers a lovely sun soaked patio and lush landscaping - a great place to relax at the end of the day.  You will find the guest room at the top of the stairs with a window looking out into the treetops.  Only a couple steps down the hallway you will find your share bathroom with tub, shower and new vanity. The beautiful guest room overlooking the quiet tree lined Cook street is tastefully decorated with beautiful antiques and a very comfortable bed.  You will find space in the set of drawers and closet for all your things.  You will have access to you
neighborhood_overview: Congress Park is a quaint little neighborhood in the center of Denver.  It's tree lined streets, neighborhood restaurants and cafes and it's proximity to several of Denver's beautiful parks and gorgeous parkways make it the ultimate walkable neighborhood.  Also close by is National Jewish Hospital which make this home great for people who are visiting this state of the art hospital.
transit: This is perhaps the MOST walkable neighborhood in all of Denver!  The house is centrally located to everything from parks and recreation to shopping.  There is a bus line with a stop only 2 blocks away and it runs to downtown.  There is plenty of parking on the street so if you come with your own car you won't need to worry!  Taxi and Uber (town car service) are also easy ways of getting around Denver.  If you don't have an Uber account - get one!  You will be glad you did.

There are wood floors throughout and the large bathroom was just remodeled. My house is a hate free zone and all are welcome. The house is within walking distance of City Park, the Museum of Science and Nature, the IMAX Theatre, and the Denver Zoo, and just a few miles from downtown Denver. It's also convenient to the renowned National Jewish Health Center, as well as St. Joseph's, Presbyterian-St. Luke's, and Rose Hospitals. There is easy access to the mountains for day hikes or skiing. You will be able to come in and out through the back door, which leads straight to the guest apartment. My house is within walking distance of City Park, including the Museum of Space and Science, the Denver Zoo, and City Park Golf Course. It's just a short 10 minute dr
neighborhood_overview: My house is within walking distance of City Park, including the Museum of Space and Science, the Denver Zoo, and City Park Golf Course. It's just a short 10 minute drive from downtown, which you can also get to using convenient public transportation. There are good restaurants nearby, and it's easy to take day trips to the mountains from here, too.

Equipped with a private side entrance and well lit walkway. Your home away from home. Multiple guests? Enjoy the comfort of a futon couch and the living room easily converts into a private 2nd bedroom for multiple guests.  Newly remodeled bathroom equipped with all the necessities of home. Start your day off with complimentary Coffee & Tea. Secluded covered patio with an outdoor dining area and sofa couch to kick your feet up at the end of a long day. Forgot something? name: Modern Apt in Heart of RiNo Art District
description: Right in the heart of RiNo, 100 steps from the hottest block on Larimer. Take a stroll to immersive mural art, savor delicious tapas, or grab craft beer at one of five breweries within a two-block radius.  At a half mile, you’re in LoDo enjoying the nightlife. A mile out, you’re at Coors Field. At a mile and a half, enjoy stunningly remodeled Union Station or attend a convention.  Walk, pick up a city bike or an electric scooter, or snag Lyft or Uber to anywhere. Welcome to Denver! ~~~~Indoor space~~~~ This is a brand new apartment in the heart of the RiNo Art District!  It has modern, luxurious finishes, a brand new king-size bed with adjustable base, and a stunning kitchen! You’ll love our place because of the easy access to breweries, wine bars, great restaurants, cafes, and many convenient transportation options. ~~~~Outdoor space~~~~ Enjoy our xeriscaped outdoor patio with built-in gas grill and ample seating. With comfy chairs for lounging and a picnic table for meals, you have o
neighborhood_overview: This location is very walkable, with great things to explore and do at any time of day.  ~~~~Food and Drink~~~~ RiNo is the biggest brewery district in Colorado, with 15+ breweries, distilleries, and winemakers within walking distance. Some of the best, Ratio Beerworks and Epic Brewing, are within a block. Great Divide Brewing, The Block Distillery, and Infinite Monkey Theorem Urban Winery are nearby. If full service bars or craft cocktails are more your style, Finn’s Manor, Bar Fausto, or RiNo Yacht Club are great options. If you are interested in local, unique drinking experiences, you’re in the right place! In the morning, some of Denver’s best coffee shops are right nearby. Crema is one of the neighborhood’s most established options, offering craft coffee, cold brew, and a kitchen. The Rolling Pin Bakeshop offers handmade pastries. Denver Central Market has coffee, as well as a full indoor market with restaurants, produce, ice cream, and a bakery.  For casual dining, Park Burger, B
transit: ~~~~Getting Here~~~~ Arriving at our place is easy. The most affordable and quickest way during rush hour is to hop on the A Line light rail train from the airport and take it to the 38th and Blake stop, which is one mile from the house. From there, a moderate walk or very short Uber will get you the rest of the way.  From the airport, Uber, Lyft, or car rentals are all easily available as well.  ~~~~Around Denver~~~~ For guests wanting to get around Denver, there are a variety of app-based rental bike services. Some are conventional, while others are electric. There is also a city bike rental network called B-Cycle, with a station across the street from the house. A fun way to get around that has popped up recently is electric scooter rentals.  Public transit is also available. There are three bus lines within a block, and two different light rail lines between .5 to 1 mile from the house.  ~~~~Mountains and Red Rocks~~~~ If you are going to the mountains, there are organized tours an

name: Classic Capital Hill 3 Bed 2.5 Bath Patio & Garage
description: This beautiful, private, & secure sanctuary is a great spot to call home while you are in Denver. Located in the vibrant Capitol Hill neighborhood, you will be staying in the best spot in the city. Rated with a walk-score of 90, you are staying near the heart of the city while still having an easygoing neighborhood feel. Relax in the cozy living room, Cook in the fabulous kitchen or Chill out on the relaxing patio. Close to downtown:  5 blocks to the Capitol 10 blocks to the 16th Street Mall Located in the historical Capitol Hill neighborhood in Denver, Co, this 3 bedroom and 2 1/2 bathroom house has the charm of a turn of the century home with the conveniences of a 21st century home. There are 3 bedrooms with queen sized beds and 2 (en suite master) full bath upstairs, and a half bath downstairs. There is a covered front porch and a secluded back patio/garden area with seating and a fully functional gas grill. The comfortable living room has a gas fireplace and a 42" HD TV. Dish progr
neighborhood_overview: The historical Capitol Hill neighborhood is rich with culture and diversity. It is one of the most sought after areas to live in Denver. Just blocks away from the Governor's Mansion, The Kirkland Museum, The Denver Art Museum, The Molly Brown House, and The Capitol Building, you will not run out of things to do without needing to travel far. It is also within walking distance to Cheeseman Park and the Denver Botanic Gardens, a must see while in town. It is also within minutes by car of many Denver attractions such as the Denver Zoo and the Denver Aquarium. DOWNTOWN VENUES  Denver Convention Center 1.2 miles  16th Street Mall Downtown 7 blocks  Capitol Building 6 blocks  Whole Foods Market 3 blocks SPORTS STADIUMS / VENUES  Coors Field 1.7 miles  Pepsi Center 2.0 miles  Invesco Field 2.6 miles HOSPITALS  Denver General Hospital 0.3 miles  Children's Hospital 1.0 miles  Presbyterian St. Luke's 1.4 miles  National Jewish Health of Denver 2.3 miles OTHER  Denver Public Library (central) 6
transit: I highly recommend lift sharing services Uber/Lyft especially if you don't have any out of town trips planned. Either will get you to/from DIA for under $40. The house is located within walking distance to many museums, libraries, beautiful parks, botanic gardens and diverse theaters and venues. Bus / RTD 2 Blocks to the 10 route bus stop. (Downtown). 2 Block to the 15/15L route bus stop. (North/south). 8 Blocks to the 0 route (east/west). There is a B-Cycle (Bicycle rental) station 2 blocks away. Lime, Lyft, Bird, spin and razor scooter rentals are available in the neighborhood to use round the city. The house comes with a garage but if needed there is street parking.

Location is close to both I-25 and I-225 and 2 miles from Yale light rail station. We do have a very well trained and friendly yellow lab on the property. We will ensure that he is put away when we have guests. Bedroom on the main floor with private bath (shower/tub).  We have a nice fenced backyard with seating. No 420 smoking in the house. Chewables are ok.  We do have an outside patio but we ask that the group be respectful of usage smoking outside since we do not use 420. Shared space. description: New,  modern, light, townhouse with private bedroom and bathroom.  The room for rent has a closet for your use. The communal space has an open floor plan, high ceilings, full kitchen with seating at island, kitchen table, and living room.  Rooftop deck with mountain & city views. Modern townhouse - entrance at ground level, living room/kitchen on 2nd floor, bedroom on 3rd floor, rooftop deck above bedrooms. Guests may use living room, kitchen, laundry, rooftop deck, & balcony. This is as close to downtown & Lodo as you can get but still have a neighborhood feel. Walk to Mile High Stadium, the Aquarium, restaurants, coffee shops, and a grocery store. Scooter or Uber is all you need! Many transportation options - electric scooters, electric bikes, Uber, walk to downtown!

name: Mountain Views, Entertainment Galore!
description: An enjoyable home for your next visit to Denver. Enjoy mountain views, watch a movie on the home theater, or kick back in a secluded hot tub surrounded by pine trees. Located near Regis University, Tennyson Shopping District, Olde Towne Arvada, and Inspiration Point Park. Easy access to I-70 means just 25 minutes to the airport and 10 minutes to downtown Denver. We have an energetic 1.5 year old, you may hear some noises during the day, but night-time disturbances are few. The BNB is on the lower level of our home. It's private, with its own entry through a key-coded door. The space features a large, open kitchen - dining - living room, a bathroom, and a large bedroom with a king size bed. The living room has a large couch and a queen size luxury air bed. The BnB is about (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) square feet in all. Guests have access to the yard, patios, hot tub, and shade garden. Smoking is not allowed inside, but is always allowed outside. Access is through the door on the no
neighborhood_overview: Situated around Inspiration Point, the highest point in the city of Denver, the neighborhood offers something for everyone. Walking around the park is a great way to take in the views of the Rocky Mountians. Clear Creek bike path is just to the North, and connects to many major bike routes. Lakeside Amusement Park is open in the Summer providing exciting and inexpensive fun for kids and adults. Dining on Tennyson is wonderful, with great cuisine for any budget.
transit: We are close to I-70 so access to the airport or the mountains is fast and easy. Boulder is 25 minutes away. Downtown Denver is about 10 minutes. Bicycle paths are easily accessible and riding to Olde Towne Arvada is a fun evening activity for dinner and a movie.

Bus (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) are 1 to 2 blocks from my house. 10 min bus ride/5 min Uber from Convention/Civic Center, 15 min bus ride/10 min Uber from Pepsi Center, 30 minutes from Denver Airport. Smoking allowed at front porch only. You’ll love my place because of the comfy bed, the coziness, arts.  I rent out 6 spaces within same house but you will have your own private room with lock on bedroom door.. Most of the time you may see people if you hang out at the porch. So you may meet new people.  But no party inside the house. Noise from porch does not go inside the house/rooms. For this listing, you can hear people from upstairs since this is basement. There maybe someone in couch. You have access to upsta
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the best, hottest neighborhoods in Denver. Very safe. You can work around at 3 in the morning and it should be fine.  1. Within walking distances are MEZCAL (mexican restaurant), GOOSETOWN TAVERN, CEREBRAL BREWERY, THE COFFEE as you walk towards downtown (going West) on Colfax. Colfax is one block from my house going North. Sprouts is 1 block north of my house on Colfax. 2. There are TRADER JOES, INDIAN, THAI, KOREAN restaurants going south on Colorado Blvd. Go east from my house and turn right on Colorado blvd. Go four blocks south and all restaurants should be there. 3. Going east on Colfax are some good Ehiopean resturant, Subway. 4. Museum/City Park/Denver Zoo  is 10 block walk away. Capital hill/Civic Center/16th street mall is 5 min drive.
transit: My place is 1 block from bus stop. Bus 15 or 15L go towards Downtown Denver every 10 or 15 minutes. After 10 PM, I believe they run every 30 minutes. However they run till 3 AM in the morning. Day pass is 5.20 for local and 9 dollars for regional. With regional, you can catch light rails anywhere rails go to.  RTD denver runs the bus system in Denver. 6 minutes uber ride to most things to central of downtown. My place is 25 to 30 min drive from Airport. 5 to 8 minutes from civic center/convention center

name: "Hygge" Bungalow Retreat ♥ Cozy, Clean, Access
description: * Downtown 8 minutes, Red Rocks 20, Broncos 5. * Private entrance. * Keypad: anytime arrival! I enjoy opening my 1930s home to fellow travelers to explore all that Denver and CO offer from a vibrant city to the great outdoors.  Updated garden level suite invites you to make a tasty dinner in full kitchen, relax with the 50" TV or games, soak in a stone floor shower, and drift off in the snug bed. 3 blocks to eateries/brewpubs, Starbucks, movies, bus/LightRail, and Sloan Lake for a 3 mile path. I travel and know the importance of a clean and comfortable space and have worked to provide that for you in the garden level suite. Guests highly appreciate the comfort and access - two important benefits to your home away from home. Hygge - a Danish and Norwegian word for a mood of coziness and comfortable conviviality with feelings of wellness and contentment.  Guest review highlights:  + "Doug was a FANTASTIC host. The apartment was neat and tidy. He provided nice suggestions for what to do i
neighborhood_overview: The West Colfax neighborhood is changing just like a lot of areas of Denver. The biggest changes from the last few years are the redevelopment of the former St. Anthony Hospital just three blocks away and the opening of the West line of the Light Rail system. These have brought new housing, new restaurants, new services, and new people to West Colfax. Exciting times and the character of the neighborhood continues to grow with that.
transit: Bus service is available on Colfax. The nearest bus stop is two blocks away. Light rail train service is available at Perry Street Station on the West line - six blocks away. The West line runs between Golden and Union Station in downtown Denver. You can transfer lines to access the entire light rail network.

description: Recently updated studio apartment in a city neighborhood close to restaurants/bars/breweries.  Enjoy a few of the over 300 days of sunshine in our state by relaxing on your own private patio equipped with a picnic table and grill. Studio apartment with a full kitchen and sleeper sofa.  The cozy, yet open 525 square feet is perfect landing spot for a quick getaway. We live upstairs to help quickly resolve any issues that arise but the space is private (locked off from the rest of the house) and you won't see us unless you need us. The Whittier neighborhood is very walk-able and close to both City Park and downtown.  Living in this neighborhood is a mix of young professionals and families. Uber/Lyft generally have less than a five minute wait before pickup in this neighborhood.  In addition, the 25th and Welton light rail station is .7 miles away. Just as an FYI, we do have an infant as part of our family.

name: Denver Adventurer's Urban Basecamp at Lincoln Park
description: The very best of downtown Denver is just outside my doorstep! Walk, bike, or Lyft your way to all the city activities in mere minutes. After your urban or wilderness adventures, be welcomed back to a delightful exposed brick home with old school charm and timeless modern class. Won't you be my guest? Every inch of this little open concept home is full of fun design details and kept superbly clean for your relaxation and enjoyment — extra tall ceilings, exposed brick walls, diagonal bamboo hardwood floors, retro-modern furnishings, and pop culture easter eggs scattered around the house create a super cool urban loft vibe with the comfort of home you cannot get from a hotel. Plus, leave a bit of yourself behind by pinning where you're from on the guest room map and take an insta-selfie with my old school instant camera! The space is constantly evolving for the better, based on guest feedback, with new design touches and conveniences for you to enjoy. This is a private room Airbnb in my p
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Lincoln Park — a secretly cool downtown neighborhood nobody seems to know about (yet)! Lincoln Park gives you access to the beating heart of Denver, just Northwest of the Santa Fe Arts District and a couple blocks South of the Convention Center, Performing Arts Center, and Pepsi Center. The nearby La Alma Recreation Center at Lincoln Park offers very affordable access to an indoor gym and outdoor pool. Pretty much anything you need to do in downtown is within walking distance and everything else can be reached easily by bike, car, ride-sharing, or public transportation.
transit: Hail a Lyft driver quickly and affordably as they all congregate downtown by my home. Download the Lyft app and use my referral code "ANDY59612" for a potential discount. Walk to the best of downtown within minutes, including the Convention Center, Performing Arts Center, Pepsi Center, 16th Street Mall, Union Station, Denver Art Museum, and Santa Fe Arts District. Catch the light rail via two stations — Colfax Auraria or 10th & Osage — merely three blocks away from my home. Visit RTD Denver's website for fares, routes, and schedules. Pedal forth using B-cycle's bike rental stations scattered around the city  and access the nearby Cherry Creek and Platte River bike trails. Drive to the mountains via Kalamath and 6th Avenue or hop on I-25 to head toward DIA, Boulder, Fort Collins, Loveland, Castle Rock, or Colorado Springs.

A few miles West is Cherry Creek shopping district and mall, with bigger name retailers such as Saks and Neiman Marcus, and many, many, more upscale shopping, specialty stores, restaurants and bars.  To the South about 5-6 miles is the Denver Tech Center, which has all the above and more.  You will find Denver has a ton of parks and recreation areas around.  Finally, downtown Denver is only 6.5 miles away, with all of the major museums, sporting events and venues, as well as multiple live music halls.  Also good spots for eclectic music are along Broadway Blvd, running north and south, and Colfax Avenues, running east and west. Cherry Creek bike path is popular for

description: Artsy, comfortable, boho-chic high-rise apartment in the fantastic Capitol Hill neighborhood of downtown Denver. Wake up to an elevated perspective, with spectacular downtown views from every room, and artful accents throughout the unit. Full access to penthouse level gym and balcony. Live like a local in one of the city's most desirable neighborhoods, within walking distance of everything. Just blocks away from Trader Joe's, restaurants, bars, night clubs and dispensaries.  420 friendly. Artistically appointed, comfortable, one bedroom, one bathroom apartment on the top residential floor of classic high-rise in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of downtown Denver. King size bed, pull-out couch in the living room, large screen high definition smart televisions in both rooms, high speed internet access, and large work area with a desktop PC available for your use. The kitchen is fully stocked with dinnerware and cookware. Guests looking to take advantage of cannabis legality will find a com
neighborhood_overview: There are many great neighborhoods comprising downtown Denver, but if you want a true local experience, in a safe location, Cap Hill is where you want to be. Walk to everything, including restaurants, dispensaries, nightlife, and Trader Joe's. Near the Museum District and Civic Center.
transit: The beautiful Cherry Creek bike trail connect you to LoDo and the Highlands, with electric bikes and scooters available right outside of the building. Anywhere else you'd want to be is a short Uber or Lyft ride away, and the city bus stops right out front as well!

There is no common space that is shared between the two units. Has washer dryer, full eat-in kitchen,  internet, and smart TV.  Pack'N'Play available. Near the Baker Arts District and Antique Row. (by car) Suitable for small families with 1 full bed and an optional air mattress in an adjacent room for an additional charge. *Please note: my home is not child-proofed. Levitt Pavilion is 1.3 miles, walking distance. This is a shabby chic luxurious room. Included in the room is coffee station, an assortment of teas and sweetners, mini-fridge with small freezer, and small microwave.  There is also a small desk/table that seats two.  New ceiling fan installed in room and evaporative cooler just outside room (so nice and cool on hot nights). Complimentary toiletries and a large closet with room for suitcases and hangers. Bathroom has a full shower and a deep jetted tub. Guests will have a mostly private bathroom, a

The greater Ruby Hill neighborhood features a beautiful park with the new, popular Levitt Pavilion concert venue. Ruby Hill park is the to go place for sledding and features a rail yard for snowboarding and a snow making machine.  Rose Cottage is across the street from Sanderson Gulch a walking and biking green belt that allows easy bicycle commuting throughout Denver.
transit: There is street parking (No blocking the driveway please).  There is a bus stop 2- 2.5 blocks away which will take you to the light rail station or easy access to downtown or anywhere throughout the Denver metro area. Airport to location information is available if you search on the internet: "public transportation from airport to downtown denver" and select 'Denver Airport Information & Transportation \| VISIT DENVER'.   (Use Federal Blvd. & Florida Ave. intersection as reference near location of BnB.)  AirBnB understandably does not allow me to post or send URLs. Neighborhood offers a number of restaurants, breweries, bars, coffee shops, boutiques & 2 music venues. 1.5 miles to University of Denver & nearby light rail access that can take you downtown, to Mile High Stadium, Pepsi Center/Six Flags, Union Station, Convention Center, Mission Ballroom, airport, and other areas. Guests have access to a private back yard, washer and dryer and the fully stocked kitchen (pans, cooking utensils, keurig, etc... or whatever you may need to whip up a good meal or a cup of coffee). Typically I touch base a few nights prior to arrival and again the day prior to checkout. For the most part I like to leave my guests alone but I'm available for any questions before or during their stay. Platt Park is a very walkable neighborhood. Within a mile you have restaurants, bars, shops, galler
neighborhood_overview: Platt Park is a very walkable neighborhood. Within a mile you have restaurants, bars, shops, galleries, breweries, dispensaries, convenience/grocery stores and access to light rail. The duplex is steps away from Old South Pearl which is the jewel of the neighborhood where you will find several blocks of diverse restaurant choices, local shops, galleries and coffee shops. Tons of character and lots of food choices! There are also several establishments on Broadway (2 blocks away) to enjoy as well.
transit: I live walking distance (.5 mi) to light rail which provides easy access to downtown, Coors Field, Mile High Stadium, Union Station, Denver Center of Performing Arts, Pepsi Center, Convention Center, Fiddlers Green, Mission Ballroom, Six Flags, Mile High Stadium and DIA (Denver International airport).

name: Victorian Condo in Hip Neighborhood
description: This is the DREAM Victorian condo in the PERFECT location! Awesome one bedroom with balcony of city skyline and mountain views with private back entrance. It has one closet and dresser. Kitchen has granite surfaces and stainless appliances. Hip central neighborhood. Walk out your front door to everything the neighborhood has to offer with parks, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, stores and public transportation. 5-10 minutes from all Downtown Denver's attractions! This unit is on the third floor in a Victorian home.  The home was built in 1891 and has all the modern updates.  Please note there is no elevator, you must be able to climb stairs.  Street parking is available.  In walking distance of pubs, variety of restaurants, delicious homemade ice cream and many coffee shops. Guests have access to kitchen, living room, dining room, shared bathroom, laundry and private patio. I will be sharing the property, but work full time and travel frequently.  I am available to assist if you have q
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is called Capitol Hill. 5-10 minutes away from everything in the city! A great neighborhood to explore! Capitol and Art Museum is a 5 minute drive. Cheeseman and City Park are within 5-10 minutes of walking. 17th Street (2 blocks away) is filled with great restaurants, coffee shops and places to grab a drink. Colfax (1 block away) has restaurants, concert halls and much more! A 5-10 minute car ride, you are in downtown Denver with so much more to explore. Come check it out! You will not be disappointed!
transit: Car, Taxi, Uber, Walk, Bike, Bus --- Everything is very close by!

name: Charming Denver Highlands Bed&Bath
description: The Highlands is one of the most popular neighborhoods in Denver, which offers walking distance to cute shops, restaurants & bars within the Highlands, Lohi & Downtown. Enjoy a charming room and private bathroom in this 3 bd 2.5ba historical home. This quaint Denver Highlands home was built in the early (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s and provides a lot of charm. It is located on a tree-lined street of the Highlands / Jefferson Park, which is walking distance to great shops, restaurants and bars and downtown is 3 minutes away.  You'll be sharing the 3bd / 2.5 ba house with me: a friendly 30 year old young professional and my golden retriever puppy Rossi! The room is a charming bedroom with a private bathroom and walk-in closet. The room comes with a queen sized bed, a 40" flat screen smart tv (Netflix and HBO Go included), a dresser, walk-in closet and your own private bathroom that was just remodeled. The room offers lots of natural light and you will definitely be comfortable durin
neighborhood_overview: Location, Location, Location! My home is located on a cute tree-lined street one block off of Speer and Federal, which allows you to access downtown Denver in under 3 minutes. You also have cute and quaint shops, restaurants and bars of the Highlands, Lohi and Jefferson Park within walking distance.  I love exploring the great food scene in Denver and can offer lots of recommendations.
transit: Free street parking is available. Parking permits are not required, but They DO enforce street sweeping, so keep an eye on that (once a month). It is a city, so depending on the time of day you may need to check the next block over (but that's not often). The bus route is less than a block away and Union station is less than a mile away where you can access the light rail around Denver and to and from Denver International Airport. My house less than a mile from downtown (the Convention Center) and I always recommend Uber or Lyft to get around. It's so easy! Feel free to rent a Bcycle bike during your stay as Denver is very bike-friendly. The Cherry Creek bike path is an excellent way to spend the afternoon exploring.

There's little to no traffic and ample street parking is always available (for more info about the surrounding areas, read the "About the Neighborhood” and “Getting Around” sections below). neighborhood_overview: ArTeZen Sanctuary is a short (8-10 min) walk to Inspiration Point Park, which is the highest elevation in Denver City and offers spectacular sunset views of the front range mountains. Also nearby are Willis Case Golf Course and Clear Creek Trail, as well as several popular and boutique restaurant and shopping districts. If big box shopping is your thing, that's available too!
transit: The Inspiration Point neighborhood offers direct and easy access to Downtown Denver, Red Rocks Ampitheater, Boulder and the Rocky Mountains. Lyft and Uber Ridesharing is always available and represents and excellent transportation option. Public transportation is also available (7 & 12 min walks). If you’d prefer to soak up our famous Denver weather on a bike, there are rentals available nearby at The Bicycle Broker (7 min drive & 35 min walk).

name: 3 BDR/3BA Bungalow with Backyard Oasis Near Town
description: This beautiful Park Hill bungalow is in the perfect location to relax fireside after a long day exploring downtown. Our home offers 3 bedrooms - each with their own private, full-size bathroom - a spacious, well-appointed kitchen, extra-large dining area, two living rooms, and a wonderfully modern backyard with outdoor dining, urban garden, and a cozy spot to lounge around the concrete gas firepit. This is our primary residence, however, we'll be staying in our condo downtown during your stay.  If you need anything, we're just a phone call away! Park Hill was voted Top Neighborhood in Denver in 2017.  There are excellent dining options, dessert shops, a brewhouse, and a local market within a few short, walkable blocks of our home!  Next door to the Denver Zoo, Denver Museum of Nature and Science, and City Park - and only 3 miles from the heart of Denver - you'll never run out of things to do. Denver is a very active city and our neighborhood is no exception!  We highly recommend travel

name: Comfortable, spacious master suite & private bath
description: Welcome to our comfortable and spacious master suite with private bathroom in our Platt Park home. Relax, unpack and take advantage of a nearby coffee shop (Steam Espresso), a local brewery (Platt Park Brewing), Old South Pearl Street, and the University of Denver. Solo visitors, couples, business travelers and families of nearby DU students are welcome. Our spacious private bedroom is on the second floor (stairs), and has a very comfortable queen-size bed, a walk-in closet, and private attached full bathroom. Our home is a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s/f home in Platt Park, a delightful, walkable neighborhood. We offer high-speed internet, on-street parking, on a quiet street/neighborhood. We have a cat, who has not been allowed in the suite, to respect your space and your visit with us. We are conveniently located to light-rail and public transportation that takes you to most all of Denver.  If you are NEW to Airbnb and have no reviews, please include useful and relevant informat
neighborhood_overview: Platt Park is a really nice little area located just to the northwest of Denver University. The area is an established, upscale, and eclectic neighborhood new modern homes alongside older homes that are very well taken care of. Many of the homes here have been around since the beginning of the last century and the quality craftsmanship shows. The streets are lined with old, majestic trees that are beautiful in the summer and fall.  South Pearl Street, at the heart of the neighborhood, is one of Denver’s hubs of fine dining, boutiques, and enjoyable nightlife. You can get a drink at most of the restaurants, from sake at Sushi Den to margaritas at Uno Mas.
transit: Our Location: We are 4.5 miles/12 minutes from Downtown/Performing Arts Center (DCPA)/Convention Center - via light-rail it's about 25 minutes. Cherry Creek is 3.5 miles/10 minutes by car. This is a very walkable neighborhood. You are a short walking distance to  some  of Denver's best restaurants, local shops, and 1.3 miles away from Denver University. 7 blocks to Denver RTD light-rail 3 blocks to denver RTD bus routes. 3 blocks to outstanding restaurants Getting from/to Denver International Airport (DIA): A cab fare is about $65 from/to DIA. Super Shuttle from DIA is $26 each way and takes roughly an hour. Or take the A-train from DIA to Union station, then either Uber to our home or, from Union Station, connect to the E, F, or H lines and get off at the Louisiana Pearl rail stop.

Rem
neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of the prestigious Culver City. Only steps away to the lively down town where you will find sidewalk cafes, fine dining, movie theaters, plays, art galleries, wine bars, live music, sports bars or be part of a TV show audience or just movie star gaze. Everything is within walking distance, Tuesday Farmer's and Trader Joe's markets, Pharmacy, Hospital, Fire and Police. A safe neighborhood at any hour.
transit: From the airport you take three buses, you need a $1.25 exact change cash which includes the bus transfer per person, it is about 45 minutes ride or the shared van shuttles, at 425 per passenger, the ride time depends on number of stops before you, in a rented car is about 10 to 15 minutes. Street parking is by permit only, make sure to ask me and I will provide you with unlimited time parking permits, except street cleaning posted.

Parking space in front of the garage, front living room, bedroom, kitchen, dining room, bathrooms and all outdoor space (shared with back house casita). No other guests in the house, there will be guests in the back casita which they access along the outside edge of the home. Cypress Park / Mt. This means plenty of great taco stands, street vendors and some restaurants a great local cafe and shops / Latin supermarket within walking distance. Walk, drive, bus

neighborhood_overview: West Los Angeles is a more affluent part of Los Angeles with beautiful streets.  Our home is perfectly located: 10 miles from LAX 3 miles from UCLA 3 miles from the Santa Monica Pier 2 blocks from Starbucks 1 block from a grocery store 1 block from 7-11 Several fast food and restaurants within walking distance. Our neighborhood is filled with working professionals and families.  The neighborhood is very safe and we feel very comfortable walking around during anytime of the day or night.
transit: Transportation around our place is wonderful without a car. You have several options. Public Transport: The Big Blue Bus and Metro bus lines both pick up and drop off close to our house.  These will take you anywhere you want to go in Los Angeles for $1.50. Our area also boasts several app based transportation services. They are all very affordable, very efficient, very fun, and very convenient. Download these apps on your smart phone for more details. Many people use these transportation options every day. Bikes and scooters are for more short term travel for a few miles and will cost $5-10. name: Silver Lake Garden Oasis
description: Magical, bright, quiet, green and secluded sanctuary in the Silverlake neighborhood of LA where people of all backgrounds are welcome. Studio space has high ceilings, hardwood floors, full kitchen, dining room table for 6, outdoor deck and lower outdoor patio, laundry, queen sized bed and sofa bed that will comfortably sleep up to four guests. One block from great coffee, food and gift shops and two blocks from children's playground, soccer field, dog park, basketball court and reservoir. This space is unique because of all of the green and quiet around it yet being in the hippest part of one of the largest most vibrant cities in the world. The high ceilings also make for a pleasant and comfortable living space, with the bedroom tucked behind a wall and up some stairs even though technically this is considered a "studio". Apartment can be accessed through the side door and down a flight of stairs. To access the side door, enter the gate to the right of the house if you're looking strai
neighborhood_overview: Silverlake is consistently voted one of the most livable neighborhood in LA because of it's proximity to downtown LA and most parts of Los Angeles, its reservoir, which has a grassy park, children's playground, dog park, basketball court and community center. Top rated restaurants and coffee shops are a block away (see menus on refrigerator) and a Whole Foods grocery store and CVS drug store, Bank of America and public library are a 5 minute car ride from the house. The home is bright and has plenty of outdoor space to relax and enjoy the Southern California weather.
transit: There is plenty of street parking and a pass for one car. Public buses run on Silverlake Blvd. and Sunset Blvd. is 5 minutes away. Burbank airport is the closest, however, If you're coming from LAX take the Flyaway bus ($9.75) to Union Station in downtown and then a ride share or taxi is an easy and affordable way to get to the apartment. Close to the 5 and 101 Freeways.

name: Central, Private, Peaceful & Green Hillside Oasis
description: Overlooking Los Angeles with expansive city and mountain views. This garden surrounded sanctuary is just 10 minutes from downtown. With 2 bedroom, plus home office, this two-story "Hollywood Bungalow" is nestled 55 stairs below a curving residential street. Once you arrive, it's just you and the views. This is a unique, quiet, private, secure, sun filled and sophisticated home. On the entry level a great living room with comfortable seating, views stretching from downtown LA to LAX, even a piano if you care to play. From the living room you can step through double doors onto the outside balcony to see the stars above or all of LA below or dine alfresco. Next to the well equipped cook's kitchen on this level is the dining room with a beautiful large table that can seat up to 12 diners. The second bedroom  with a double bed, closet, video system and dresser for storage is connected to a full bath. The office with its technology and large work table completes this level. On the lower floo
neighborhood_overview: Echo Park was the first suburb of LA. In 1910 Los Angeles city limits were at the end of our block. Our hillside neighborhood is out of the  traffic and noise of the city but if you want to enjoy the rich urban life it's just a few minutes drive or an easy and pleasant walk downhill to where restaurants, clubs, shops, and even the Echo Park Lake are found.
transit: Although this is a hilly neighborhood a 2 block walk downhill will provide access to public transportation. Sure, it's LA and you probably drive so the easy access to three freeways (2, 5 and 101) works.

description: Mid Century modern guest house situated below the main house with its own private entrance.   This large studio is equipped with everything but the kitchen sink. It has a fridge, coffee maker, electric tea kettle, full bathroom and plenty of clean towels. Private balcony with outdoor seating overlooking the Hollywood Hills, perfecting for watching the best sunsets.  Situated close enough to city life (keeping your daily commute sane) yet at the top of the Hollywood Hills. My place is close to the Hollywood Bowl, Pantages, Train station, restaurants, and great hiking trails.  The neighborhood is great and super friendly. My place is good for couples, small families, solo adventurers, and business travelers. There is a full size fridge, a nice spacious desk, a sofa, tv, full cable with the premium channels and wifi. *** For stays longer than two weeks, there will be a weekly cleaning fee of $100 per week. This is separate from the main house so you will not have access to a kitchen or la

transit: The house is up in the hills, but a quick drive into Hollywood. The roads to get to the home are winding and often narrow, but ride sharing services have no trouble if you prefer not to drive.  A rough estimate of taking an Uber from LAX to this location, is roughly $30.00 depending on time of day, and options. Car sharing service into Hollywood is roughly $5.00 USD.

name: Private 2 story Bungalow
description: Eagle Rock in Los Angeles is one of the newer hotspots to live.  Close to all freeway veins to get you anywhere you want to go.  Downtown LA- 10 min. Old Town Pasadena- 3 min. Santa Monica- 35 min. Hollywood- 20 min. West Hollywood- 40 min.    Local Bars, restaurants, metro, Vons & Trader Joe's are minutes away.  I have 3 small dogs in my part of the yard. Plenty of Street parking. The Bungalow is totally independent from the rest of the property so you can count on your privacy.  There is a small private patio with a Barbecue and outdoor chimenea that you are welcomed to use. You may do laundry up on main property. Just text me and let me know when you’d like to come up. Please provide your own detergent. Hi! I tend to leave guests alone and give you total privacy. I am on the property most of the time and can be reached anytime via text. I will happily recommend places to you or give you any information regarding Los Angeles.  I’d be happy to give you suggestions on scenic drives, hi
neighborhood_overview: Eagle Rock and our neighbor, Highland Park, have been the 2 newest neighborhoods in Los Angeles to be hit with gentrification, especially, Highland Park. Property values have shot through the roof and the neighborhood now enjoys its fair share of hipster bars and healthy eateries.  I live in a residential area that is a very short drive or Uber to those spots. (2-5 minutes away). Old town Pasadena is also a five minute Uber ride with lots of shops, theaters, restaurants,  and the train station that can take you downtown and to other places around Los Angeles.
transit: Plenty of street parking, or if you are up to manually opening and closing the driveway gate, you are welcomed to park in the driveway .  You will definitely need a car from my place unless you want to uber everywhere.

As Los Angeles is large spread out city, it's great to have a car or uese taxis/uber as public transit is not the most convenient. name: 3 Bedroom Mediterranean Style House
description: A beautiful home located in the quiet, self-contained community of Sunny Cove. Three bedrooms, huge master suite with balcony, backyard, two parking spaces. Easy access to downtown Los Angeles and just a few miles from Southern California beaches. The house was completely remodeled in May of this year. It sleeps six people very comfortably and has a yard with gas grills. Most often, I will personally hand over the keys and show you around the house.  Then I'll leave you on your own, but will be readily available to answer any questions or address any concerns. The neighborhood is diverse and friendly. Although it is not a gated community, there is only one entrance and it's used primarily by the residents.  It's a well-kept-up residential cul-de-sac neighborhood. Quick access to several greater Los Angeles freeways. On the other side of the backyard wall is creek and a trail for horses.

neighborhood_overview: As one of the oldest neighborhoods in Los Angeles Echo Park, was once where city folk went to hunt. In the early 1900s we were known as Redhill and we still are the center of the artist/free thinkers area of Los Angeles.  Echo Park is walkable, unique, eclectic, friendly and safe. Feel free to walk down the hill to the 3 nearby coffee shops or a local market or 2 small bakeries.  Just past Sunset is the famous Echo Park Lake and park with trails and paddle boats! Friday at Echo Park Ave & Sunset Blvd is our farmers market - it's only 10 blocks away from the apt. Just East and uphill is our huge Elysian Park area with stunning views of downtown at Angels Perch.
transit: Most visitors rent a car as LA is still a huge area to cover and a "car town." There is safe street parking for your car/rental in front of the house.   3 blocks down the hill on the left is the LA Dash Metro Connect bus stop. Dash connects at Echo Park Avenue and Sunset Boulevard to the entire metro LA public transit system of subways, light rail and express busses. You can even take light rail to the USC museums, Pasadena, Santa Monica Beach and the beach in Long Beach. The closest Metro Train stop is a 5-minute walk, and will take you directly to Santa Monica, downtown, and other popular tourist destinations. name: Luxurious Craftsman Style A-Frame Studio
description: Modern, upscale, completely remodeled, spacious studio house. Amazing central location & entertaining upper deck w/heat.   Private entrance:   When entering Magnolia Suites, you will encounter a security gate with a key code pad.  The entrance to the suite is private and keyless entry.  Complete with a futon sectional, king-size bed, cafe' table seating, kitchen and large bathroom. Enjoy the patio area just outside your door or enjoy the sun and comfortable seating in the upper level deck! This beautifully remodeled studio features high skylight ceilings and modern, upscale furnishings.  King-sized bed, with additional sleeping for 1-2 on large futon sectional.  A large closet offers plenty of storage space.  Large private bathroom with double vanity and walk-in shower, with towels & essentials provided.  The kitchen is complete with a stove/oven, toaster oven, coffee pot, full-size refrigerator, microwave, dishes/flatware, cutting board/knives, and a cozy in-room dining area.  This sp
neighborhood_overview: Studio is located in the Historical District of urban Downtown Long Beach.  The neighborhood offers plenty of entertainment options within walking distance, with The Aquarium of the Pacific, The Pike, Long Beach Terrace Theater, The Long Beach Convention Center and Shoreline Village only a five minute drive away.  The area is packed with local and live entertainment, movie theaters, restaurants, pubs, cafe's and coffee shops.  A short drive away guests can visit, popular 2nd Street/Belmont Shore, the beach, Disneyland, California Adventure & Downtown Disney, Knotts' Berry Farm, Universal Studios, Hollywood and Los Angeles.  Freeway close and only 10-30 minutes to dozens of must-see sites. Please remember that this is an urban downtown city area.  There will be some street noise.  All-in-all Magnolia Suites is a beautiful and peaceful place to stay and you'll enjoy the excitement of the city and being close to so many places!
transit: PLEASE PLAN YOUR PARKING AHEAD OF TIME Check out the links and locations of parking sent with your check-in information on the morning of your arrival.  You may want to purchase a day pass or find out about securing a permit in advance.  There is an open pay-to-park lot two doors south of the property and if you tell them you are staying for only a specific amount of time, they will oftentimes work with you to discount your rates or offer a special deal.  PLEASE NOTE:  Free street parking is available, but please be mindful of signs restricting parking on certain days & times for street sweeping services.  If you are parked in a no-parking area you will be ticketed. We recommend walking to many of the local restaurants/cafe's/coffee houses/movies/nightclubs & pubs whenever possible.  Long Beach has a rich and interesting nightlife and for the adventurous at heart it can be  a lot of fun and great exercise to get around town on two feet.

name: Beautiful 2BR+Loft near Beach! Promenade!
description: Beautiful 2 bedroom plus loft home in the heart of Santa Monica. Just blocks away from Santa Monica beach, Main Street, Third Street Promenade, and the new Expo Light Rail, you will be able to experience the city like a local! Enjoy Santa Monica in our beautiful 2 bedroom plus loft home! The bedrooms are bright and comfortable and the master has an updated ensuite bathroom with dual sinks. Designed with style, the living room features vaulted ceilings and hardwood floors can be found throughout the home. Equipped with a full kitchen, dining room and plenty of room to gather, it’s the perfect destination for bringing your group together and enjoying the laid back Southern California life! Bedding:  Bedroom 1- Master bedroom: King Bed Bedroom 2- Guest bedroom: Queen Bed Additional bedding available- Loft: Full Bed Sleeps: 6 Our apartment is fully furnished and very comfortable. The kitchen is stocked with everything you'll need: appliances, cookware, dishes, etc. Our home is professional
neighborhood_overview: Located in the chic beach city of Santa Monica, you will be in the center of it all. Walk down to the beach and visit the famous Santa Monica Pier or the Farmer’s Market. For shopping and dining, you are within blocks of Third Street Promenade, Santa Monica Place, and Main Street. Rent a bike and ride down to Venice to the boardwalk or visit Abbot Kinney.
transit: There is some non-permit parking in the area and taxis, Uber and Lyft operate in Los Angeles.

name: Mar Vista Suite of Private Entry,Patio & Spa Bath
description: Luxurious private bedroom suite with kitchenette (part of house with private entrance)  in Mar Vista walking distance to numerous coffee shops, restaurants, markets, and public transportation. A 10 minute car ride to world-famous Venice Beach, Abbot Kinney, the Venice Canals and Marina del Rey. Perfect for those who enjoy being surrounded by nature, and appreciate privacy and quietude. Good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Large, quiet suite with high speed wifi, smart TV, original artwork, and mini kitchenette of small refrigerator (& freezer), microwave, deluxe K-cup coffee system, dishes and flatware.  Romantic seating for two.  Travertine Spa bath with double sinks, large shower with wide overhead and handheld spray, and a  whirlpool for two.   The bathroom here  was designed by me and renovated with  ideas from my travels in Europe and Asia where the bath is revered.  Not only as a  place to cleanse the body, but also to rejuvenate and recharge the spirit and
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, family Mar Vista neighborhood within 5-10 minute walking distance of 2 supermarkets, great restaurants and coffee shops on Venice and Washinton Blvds, the fabulous Mar Vista Farmer's Market, yoga, pilates, dance studios, and convenience stores.  Almost all your needs can be met within a 10 minute walk!
transit: By car, 20 minutes from LAX.  Quick access to the coast and highways to downtown and Hollywood.  Two and a 1/2 miles to Marina del Rey and Venice Beach.   Public transportation is a 5 minute walk.  Catch a Bird scooter if you are adventurous.

name: Cozy and Spacious Room with Private Bath
description: In the heart of the San Gabriel Valley, only a 15-20 minute drive to Pasadena & DTLA. A great place to stay because of the quiet neighborhood, the outdoor space, the ambiance, and the breeze. Good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Private bedroom with clean, private bathroom. Very quiet area for great nights rest. Closet space, mini-fridge, coffee maker, and Smart TV (Netflix) in room. The bedroom & bathroom should have everything you need. We don’t allow guests to use the kitchen to cook full meals or store food ( however there is a mini fridge inside the bedroom). Preparation of light meals or snacks is acceptable. We are in and out. Home most evenings. A lovely place to stay in the San Gabriel Valley for a quiet nights sleep. Close to Pasadena, Rosemead, and only 15 miles from DTLA. The best Chinese and Vietnamese food in Los Angeles very close by. CVS right up the street. If you don’t have a car we highly recommend using Lyft/Uber ride sharing services. Public

name: Sunny Stylish & Central Echo Park Gem
description: Bright and stylish Spanish duplex in the heart of hip and happening Echo Park. And Silverlake adjacent.  My place is walking distance to all the best cafes, shops, restaurants and parks: Elysian Park, Echo Park Park, Doger Stadium,Echoplex, Masa, Ostrich Farm, Stories Bookstore, Lassen's, Vons, Elf Restaurant and more.    Driving: 5 minutes from Chinatown and Down Town LA, 10 min from Hollywood.You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the light, and the outdoors space. This 700 square foot apartment is one half of a freestanding 1920s Spanish style duplex, which was upgraded an modernized (with features like tankless hot water) without losing the original character.    It is furnished with designer lighting and mid century modern furnishing.  The living room and bedroom looks out over a private, enclosed yard  with palms, succulents and a pomegranate tree.   There are hardwood floors and tile throughout the apartment, warm and uniform lighting, free wifi, and air conditioning.
neighborhood_overview: Sunset Boulevard and music venues The Echo and Echoplex are only a block away.  Walk two more blocks and you are at wonderfully renovated Echo Park Lake.   Rent a paddle boat, jog around the, stroll, picnic, or grab a bite in the Square One Cafe.  A short walk in the other direction takes you to the urban oasis Elysian Park.  It is an incredible walking neighborhood with loads to explore!
transit: Dodger Stadium can also be reached on foot and the adjacent neighborhoods of Silver Lake, Los Feliz, and downtown Los Angeles are easily reached by car or public transportation.   (there is a bus stop two blocks away on Sunset Blvd)  It's a short and direct commute to the Hollywood, Studio City, and Burbank studios, and the 5, 2, 101, and 110 freeways are all within a mile or so.  Street parking is free and on both sides of the street.   It is very economical to take the FLYAWAY bus from LAX Airport to Union Station/downtown ($8 one way) and then take a short cab (or UBER or LIFT) ride to the duplex.

Close to Scores of Restaurants and All Popular SoCal Attractions. Our vacation-ready condo is located in a first-class neighborhood, just above Alamitos Bay.  It's between the ocean and Cal State Long Beach, a few minutes from the attractions of Belmont Shores and beyond. Amenities of all kinds abound.  You are easy walking/cycling distance from scores of restaurants, supermarkets and malls, the university and V.A., major parks and marinas, and all the nightlife of 2nd Street. The L.A. region's best beaches are next door.  Seal Beach is less than three miles..."secret" Sunset Beach is five miles...and legendary "Surf City" Huntington Beach is 11 miles down Pacific Coast Highway.  Our condo is relatively large -- a full 1,100 square feet (about 110 square meters) -- and it features: Two big bedrooms, each with a la

transit: Long Beach is one of the top cities in America for bicycling.  It also has a great bus system, and a train line which connects to all other SoCal public transit, from Santa Barbara to San Diego.

name: Mid City Retreat: The Avocado Suite
description: Nestled in the shade of our avocado tree, rests a suite for your stay in LA.  A skylit bedroom, comfortably furnished living room, along with a spacious yard make for a great space to relax and recoup in the epicenter of Town.  There is a kitchenette perfect for food or drink prep - with a fridge, sink, and some kitchen basics for your convenience. You'll love living like a local, walking distance from coffee shops and restaurants, central to all the sights from downtown to the ocean. A quintessential So-Cal backyard, along with a luxuriously couched living room, and a beautiful bed under sky lights makes for the perfect way to experience LA at its native pace.  This private unit features a bedroom, bathroom, living room and spacious backyard. Your own Living Room + Bath + Bedroom w/ private entrance from shared backyard. Kitchenette with fridge and kitchen sink for any kitchen needs! Guests enter the unit through a private entrance in the backyard. We’re on-site if anything is needed,

Paper and Plastic coffee shop is on the corner, let's start there.

description: View of hollywood sign hills from living room and master bedroom. Our beds are tempurpedic mattress for ultimate luxury comfort. Our comforters are plush, goosedown duvets. Our cloud couch is deepset memory foam/down for ultimate top of the line comfort. Both bedrooms & living room is equipped with smart tvs. Our kitchen is fully equipped/stacked for full range of cooking. Our building is secured, gated, and elevator for convenience. Garages, hallways of building entrance have security. The building's architecture balances a modern aesthetic of glass and horizontal bands of metal with a rich facade of natural cedar wood. The living areas as combined with the openness of a loft residence with soaring ceilings, voluminous windows and generous patios. The custom interior finishes are an extension of the building's Metal, Wood & Glass facade with a concentration of oak flooring, cabinetry and finish carpentry accented by polished chrome, glass and stainless steel. name: Beverly Hills View Estate - 3 BED 3.5 BA Pool Home
description: On top of the world in Beverly Hills, enjoy fantastic views with this spacious 3000 square foot 3BR/3.5BA pool home.  Minutes to all that LA has to offer, above the Beverly Hills Hotel, yet feel like you're secluded in the country.  Not uncommon to wake up and find deer grazing in the yard while you drink your coffee.  Furnished with an eclectic mix of designer and antique furniture and all amenities to make your stay enjoyable. This luxurious home has fantastic unobstructed views of the mountains and canyons.  With three spacious bedrooms (each with their own en suite bathroom), a den with a sofa bed and a large sectional couch in the living room, the home can accommodate large groups easily.  The backyard is designed for fun and relaxation, with a fantastic pool and spa, large grassy area and a gas Weber grill (although we don't supply propane).  Windows abound to take advantage of the light and views.  Each bedroom has it's own private bath.  All linens and towels are provided.  The
neighborhood_overview: The home is in the hills above the Beverly Hills Hotel, and minutes to the Flats of Beverly Hills and all that the Westside and Valley has to offer.  A fantastic central location off famous Oak Pass, surrounded by multi-million dollar homes.  Near Beverly Park, Mulholland Estates, the Beverly Hills Hotel and Bel Air.  Being in the hills, wildlife abounds and you can often forget that you're in the heart of the City.   All with a fantastic view and a great pool and backyard to enjoy.
transit: Plenty of free street parking is available in this quiet private residential neighborhood.  Uber is an easy way to get around.  Public transportation options other than Uber require a bit of a trek to get to.  Most people have a car.  If you need a car, we can provide options via Turo or directly, just ask.

name: Hollywood. Larchmont.  BDRM. #2. Free Parking

Washer/dryer.  Free Wi-Fi. Your own private bedroom in big (12 ft x 12 ft) 3 bedroom Hollywood area/Larchmont Village/Hancock Park home.  There is a full shared bathroom.  The street that this  house is on has a view of the Hollywood Sign!  Pets are welcome, however there is an additional $15 cleaning fee that will be added after you book. When you book, if you are bringing a pet, you will receive a $15 money request through the site. This must be paid before you check in. :)  Very close to Hollywood. Very close to Downtown Los Angeles. And is a 3 minute walk to the Larchmont Village shopping area and the newly opened ice cream shop SALT AND STRAW!  There is incredibly sweet English bulldog that lives on the property and you should be comfortable with dogs.The other 2 bedrooms are airbnb rooms and may or may not
