description: Modern, fully equipped, and newly renovated attic apartment in the center of Northeast Minneapolis. Cute vintage charm has been classicly highlighted with modern amenities throughout. Relax in the bohemian swing chair with a local craft brew in hand or head out on your bikes (2 provided) and tour along the Mississippi River, just a few blocks away, or along Northeast's "Eat Street" for some of the best dining in Minneapolis. FOR PHOTOGRAPHY AND FILM, PLEASE CONTACT HOST BEFORE BOOKING. Attention to every detail, you'll feel welcome from the moment you check in.  Included in the unit: -Lounge-like living room complete with swing chair, Roku streaming device, and electric fireplace. Feel free to log into your favorite streaming services (Netflix, HBO, hulu, etc.) and catch up on your latest binge-worthy episodes.  Sofa is also large enough for one small child if needed.  -Fully equipped kitchen with large sink, dishwasher, full-size range, microwave, and refrigerator.  -Large bathroom ar

The neighborhood is also located close to the Mississippi River, multiple parks, various grocery stores and well known for its down-to-earth neighborhood vibe. I've lived in just about every area of the city and Northeast is a favorite by far.
transit: The house is 1 block away from major bus routes, easily accessible by Uber/Lyft and by bike!

name: **Beautiful, Spacious-1 block to lightrail+Parking
description: Charming duplex apartment in South Minneapolis just steps to 50th St lightrail station and Minnehaha Falls.  Location provides easy access to MSP Airport, bike paths, downtown Minneapolis and St.Paul, US Bank Stadium and Target Field, Mall of America and VA hospital.  Lovely neighborhood with several restaurants and grocery stores just blocks away. *If you love this place but need something bigger, please reach out ... there is one other bedroom that could be added to the reservation. 1200 square feet allows you space to relax - spacious living room, two private bedrooms, bath and kitchen. Bedrooms are spacious, naturally well-lit yet private, have comfortable queen size beds and comfy bedding.  Middle bedroom has a Select Comfort [dual sided] bed so you can control the firmness for your most comfortable level! Bathroom has original claw foot tub from 1900. Your stay allows you the comforts and privacy of home.  Guests have their own private, rear enclosed porch, washer/dryer and ironi

Steps away from the 50th St Lightrail (Blue and Green lines), walking distance to grocery store, beautiful scenery (Minnehaha Falls, Mississippi River, Lake Nokomis, etc.), play areas for children, bike paths and multiple restaurants.  Brew pubs, bakeries, ice cream, coffee shops .... all near!
transit: So many ways to travel to and from! This location is 6 minutes away from the airport via lightrail.  Super convenient for so many visitors to the Twin Cities! Approx. 100 steps away is the 50th street light rail station.  MSP airport, Mall of America, downtown Mpls, US Bank Stadium, Twins Field, Univ. of MN and St. Paul are just a short ride away!  Light rail also interconnects with the Bus lines. If you've arrived via car, you are 1-15 minutes away from all major thoroughfares connecting the Twin Cities.

Includes 1 bedroom with queen sized bed, 1 bedroom with full sized bed, living room (with 32" Roku Smart LED TV), dining room, kitchen (stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, toaster, microwave, dishes, silverware, pots & pans), bathroom, 3-season porch/sunroom, washer & dryer (in basement). name: Cozy Northeast Bungalow
description: Welcome to our cozy home in northeast Minneapolis! You'll stay in a quiet but convenient neighborhood, ~3 miles from the U of MN campus or 4.5 miles from downtown Minneapolis. We're 1 block from a bus stop which goes downtown (~15 minute bus ride) and Uber or Lyft are also available. Closer to home is The Quarry with many shops (Target, Cub Grocery, etc.) a half mile away & one mile from our home is Central Ave with a lot of restaurants and breweries. We would love to have you visit! We live in a bungalow built in the 1920's & enjoy the charm of the home. Many areas have been renovated including the bathroom & kitchen but we appreciate how these renovations kept the character of the house. Feel free to use the dining & living rooms as well as the kitchen. Thanks! I will respond promptly to any messages or texts ahead of time. This is our home so we will likely be around from time to time if you need anything, our room is upstairs. That said, we will certainly give you space & want you
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet, residential neighborhood but it is still very close to downtown & campus. Most housing this close to campus & downtown has larger apartment buildings, more traffic, etc. Most buildings around our home are single family housing so traffic & parking are not an issue.
transit: It's an easy drive from our home to anywhere around town & we have plenty of parking. Also, there is a bus line one block from our home, and additional bus lines are available by transfer or within walking distance. The light rail is downtown & this can get someone to the airport, Mall of America, downtown St Paul, or anywhere in between easily. Lyft & Uber are also available.

name: Quaint and Cozy Minneapolis Home
description: Quaint and cozy home in Minneapolis just 3 miles from downtown.  Recently updated and charming.  Close to Theodore Wirth Parkway and accessible to many trendy places in the Twin Cities. Open floor plan with fireplace and flatscreen TV on the main floor. Three bedrooms up with newly remolded bathroom.  Very private and cozy place to retreat after all of the festivities of the Super Bowl. The whole house is available for use except the garage and basement. Two blocks from historic Theodore Wirth parkway which has sledding hills, winter trails and cross country skiing.  Just 3 miles from downtown Minneapolis and a few minute drive to trendy areas for eating out like Uptown and NE Arts district. There is a bus line just three and a half blocks away.  Uber/Lyft is always a good option since we are located close to most of the fun sites in the city.

name: Your Own Urban Sanctuary Apartment in South Uptown
description: Enjoy the lakes, restaurants and nightlife activity in Uptown and LynLake, then come home to relax in your third story apartment in our quiet South Uptown neighborhood.   This sunny apartment has a bedroom with a double bed, a living room with a queen sofa bed, an office/den, a fully equipped eat-in kitchen and a bathroom.  This comfortable, newly renovated apartment is decorated with artwork and fabrics from our travels around the world. This apartment is a third story walkup.    The bedroom has a double bed with a comfortable mattress and blackout shades.   The living room sofa bed has a very comfortable queen memory foam mattress.   The apartment is suitable for two couples or friends who know each other or a family with older children.  The kitchen is a full kitchen equipped with cooking and baking equipment, and also has a toaster oven, microwave and a coffee maker.   The office/den has a printer and basic office supplies and the bathroom has soap and shampoo products.  All linens
neighborhood_overview: This residential neighborhood is quiet, with tree lined streets and old buildings, but close to the action.  A couple of breakfast eateries and coffee shops are just around the corner, and Lake Harriet and Lake Bde Maka Ska are within easy walking distance.    Both lakes are lovely for walks, even in winter.   Bryant Square Park, three blocks away, offers ice skating and a hockey rink.  The Uptown shopping district, with art-house movie theaters, restaurants, bars, fitness centers, boutiques, ice cream shops and a grocery store is also within walking distance.    Lynlake, a 15 minute walk, offers more restaurants, a comedy club, two breweries, a retro bowling alley, two live theater companies and specialty shops.
transit: We are on bus lines going directly downtown, and with easy connections to light-rail lines going to the airport, St Paul, the University of Minnesota, US Bank Stadium and the Mall of America.     If you drive a car, you can easily find on-street parking within the block. Access to both highways 94 and 35W is very close.

Walking/biking distance to breweries, bars, restaurants, live music, and local grocery/liquor stores.  Work and child-friendly. Two private bedrooms with very comfortable queen beds. We are very child-friendly with two pack-n-play cribs, two portable high chairs, toys, and books for all ages. name: Private Garden Level Room with Queen Bed [4f]
description: Our home is located in the bustling Powderhorn Park neighborhood. This garden level apartment has been recently renovated.  We are just a block from the bus line. We are also a block from the Midtown Global Market, an internationally themed market with many kinds of food and shopping. It's cozy and inviting, and yet you are just steps from all the action our wonderful city has to offer. Our place is set up with our guests in mind. When you stay with us, we want you to make yourself at home. Feel free to make a meal in the kitchen stocked with all the essentials such as pots and pans. Brew a pot of coffee with the coffee we keep on hand just for guests. Or feel free to relax in our cozy living room and watch TV. We live about 10 blocks away.  We are most available by phone or messaging through Airbnb.  We are available until 10pm.  If you think you might need assistance for your check in, please make your travel plans accordingly. Our home is centrally located to the entire metro!  We a
neighborhood_overview: Our home is centrally located to the entire metro!  We are just a few blocks from Abbott Northwestern Hospital and Children's Hospital.  Midtown Global Market is just a block away with food and fare from all around the world.  We are just over a mile from  downtown, US Bank Stadium, HCMC, and the Convention Center. We are just a couple miles from the center of the University of Minnesota, Uptown, Lake Calhoun, Lake Harriet, Lake of the Isles, and Lake Nokomis. We love good food, so we can also point you in the direction of local eating hot spots.  Because we are in the heart of the city, we get to experience people from broad cultural and economic backgrounds in a densely populated area. Our neighborhood, Powderhorn Park, is a vivacious and diverse. There are restaurants, healthcare buildings, old Victorian homes, apartment buildings, and non-profit organizations. We consider it a privilege to live here, but it being in the heart of the city is not for everyone. During your stay, you m
transit: We are just a couple of blocks from several different bus routes.  We are also 2 blocks from the Greenway, which is a bike and walking path that spans a good portion of the metro.

name: Remodeled Minnehaha Falls Getaway With Fenced Yard
description: Recently remodeled one-bed, one-bath unit in side-by-side duplex. Open kitchen with a Norway Pine breakfast bar, flowing into a cozy living room. The rental includes a King bed, a King blow-up mattress  (which can be placed in the living room ) and a sofa to sleep on.  Located two blocks from the light rail Metro Transit taking you quickly to the airport or downtown. Twelve minute drive to the Mall of America. One block from Minnehaha Regional Park and scenic Minnehaha Falls. Full kitchen with gas range, dishwasher and garbage disposal. Central air and forced-air AC, free Wi-Fi, backyard with off-street parking spot and unfinished basement with washer and dryer. All blinds are blackout, blocking the majority of light so you can sleep comfortably. Dog friendly, $25 for one dog and $35 for two dogs will be added to reservation once booked. I am a sales representative who also fixes up promising properties. I grew up in the Twin Cities and am ready to help with dinner/activity recommendat
neighborhood_overview: Fun activities include hiking/running trails at Minnehaha Park, a well-known seafood eatery and bar called Sea Salt, Long Fellow Gardens and an active dog park. The rental is two blocks from Metro Transit with quick access to MSP Airport, downtown, US Bank Stadium, Target Field and more. Ten minute Uber/Lyft from airport. Walking distance from a liquor store, gas station, Walgreens, brewery and three-minute drive to Highland Village Center with many quaint bars and restaurants. Lakes Nokomis and Hiawatha are nearby where you can enjoy the beach, paths around the lakes and rent canoes/kayaks/stand up paddle boards at Wheel Fun Rentals.
transit: At the end of the street is the bus stop and two blocks away is the Metro Transit light rail, so you could get along without a car. If you have a car, there's a private parking spot in the back.

name: Luxury Suite with Kitchen at Erik's Retreat
description: Erik’s Retreat is a nonprofit organization that offers upscale guest accommodations run by young adults with autism. They are concierges. Chefs. Tour guides. All for whom meaningful careers are scarce. You're part of the solution. When you stay with us, you’ll be centrally located with wonderful amenities, all while providing living quarters, social opportunities, and significant work for our members. Welcome to Erik's Retreat. Where vision knows no bounds. (Check out our website!) This is a bright and luxurious two-bedroom suite with a fully-stocked kitchen, a quaint dining table that seats four, one queen bed, two single beds (which can be moved together to create one king bed), and a sleeper sofa. There is also a sitting area, a Keurig, and an elegant European-style 3/4 bath. It can comfortably accommodate up to six guests. Sit in the quaint gazebo and read a book, spend an afternoon in the elegant sitting room with your laptop, or break a sweat in our brand-new fitness room. Check-
neighborhood_overview: Erik’s Retreat is located in the center of everything the twin cities has to offer. We are a ten-minute car ride from the Mall of America or downtown Minneapolis. We are also within walking or biking distance to Lake Harriet and a number of parks and lakes. The Southdale shopping center is in our backyard and high-end shopping is available just minutes away at the Galleria. Additionally, we are very close to the Bloomington, Edina, and Eden Prairie business corridor off 494.
transit: Minneapolis has many taxi companies to offer. The area is also serviced by Uber and Lyft. Additionally, we are one block away from a city bus stop.

name: Cute 2 bedroom home near MOA, airport & downtown
description: Located in South Minneapolis on Nicollet Ave. S. and E 56th St. is this cozy two bedroom home on one level. It has a private entrance and free off street parking. The bedrooms have queen beds with ultra soft sheets and comforters. The living room has a sofa and recliner for relaxing in and a 55" smart TV you can cast your device to. Located close to everything you will need when visiting Minneapolis. A few minutes from MSP international, The Mall of America and Downtown Minneapolis. This one level home is located in South Minneapolis near the corner of E 56th St and Nicollet Ave. S. There is plenty of parking in the street right in front of the house and there is off-street parking on a first come first serve basis. The house itself is a duplex built in the 1940’s and is quite cozy and on the small side. This is not a brand-new home (the floors will squeak) but that’s part of the charm. Old does not mean dirty, this home is cleaned by professional cleaners after each and every guest. P
neighborhood_overview: Nearby are great restaurants and diners. Many parks are very close by including the Minihaha Creek Parkway and the falls. You are a short Uber/Lyft ride to the heart of Uptown or Downtown. If you are in the area to visit the Mall of America, it only 8 minutes to the south.
transit: There are several bus lines on Nicollet Ave. S. within a few minutes walk from the house.  The following are helpful drive times to points of interest: Uptown: 13 minutes Downtown: 15 minutes Mall of America: 8 minutes US Bank Stadium: 12 minutes MSP International Airport: 13 minutes Xcel Energy Center: 18 minutes Target Field: 15 minutes U of M campus: 14 minutes

name: Uptown Minneapolis Private Suite. Parking Included
description: Located in the heart of uptown. With great Downtown views. Just a fifteen minute drive from MSP airport. A short walk from tons of amazing local bars and restaurants. A five minute drive or cheap Uber ride and you're in Downtown Minneapolis. Where there is always something going on no matter how cold it gets. There is private off street parking and washer/dryer access in the building. Great for families, groups of friends, couples getaways, business trips. Its a newly remodeled unit with a modern style. Unit has one queen bed and two full sized futon couches. The building itself is older. In the unit you have access to a bedroom, living room, stocked kitchen, and bathroom. In the building there is access to a free washer/dryer. Located in Uptown just off Lyndale and Ridgewood ave. A block over from Franklin. It is a five minute walk from tons of great local bars, restaurants, co-ops that are located all along Lyndale. The Walker Art Center and the Sculpture Garden are also just a short
neighborhood_overview: Located in Uptown just off Lyndale and Ridgewood ave. A block over from Franklin. It is a five minute walk from tons of great local bars, restaurants, co-ops that are located all along Lyndale. The Walker Art Center and the Sculpture Garden are also just a short walk. About a fifteen minute walk and you're in Uptown Square where Lyndale and Lake street meet. Here there are more bars and restaurants as wells as shops and the beautiful Lake Bde Maka Ska. It is just a five minute drive to Downtown Minneapolis on the Lyndale or Franklin Ave to First Ave. Its also walk-able and will take about twenty five minutes. Great view of the Downtown Skyline!
transit: Very quick driving access to I-94 and 394. There is a bus stop half a block up on the corner of Franklin and Lyndale where you can hope on the 4 or the 6 and get to downtown in minutes. Buses to Target Field and Target Center can also be boarded here. There are also several express buses to the U of M. The 113 takes about 7 minutes to get there.

name: FreeParking⭐️Light Rail⭐️Easy to downtown/MSP/MoA
description: ⭐️Up North★ In The City⭐️ Beautiful restored American Foursquare, modern & vintage decor Between MSP & downtown Mpls. Minnesota charm, you betcha!  ★ FREE parking  ★ 4 bedrooms. Sleeps up to 11 ★ Fully equipped kitchen with new appliances ★ Private yard, gardens, grill & bonfire ★ Dozens of local restaurants nearby ★1 block from Light Rail, 3 stops to USBankStadium & downtown, easy for convention center/Target Field/UofM/MSP airport/MallofAmerica ★WiFi  ★TV with HBO, Netflix, Hulu, Prime & more Corcoran Heights is a 1907 Beaux-Arts beauty, lovingly restored by your host, Gary. Hardwood floors, wood trim and spacious rooms. 3 stops from USBank Stadium and downtown Minneapolis. One block walk to the Midtown light rail station, with free street parking. Large private fenced yard, quiet neighborhood and beautiful gardens. Private single family home, guests have access to the entire house. Private yard with grill, veggie garden, bonfire pit, and free street parking. For bonfire use, please
neighborhood_overview: Midway from MSP airport and downtown, you can't be more centrally located. The Corcoran neighborhood features the best of friendly Minnesota, you betcha. Free street parking. Choose from over 100 locally-owned restaurants, breweries and bars within a mile!
transit: Three stops from US Bank Stadium and downtown Minneapolis. Walk one easy block to the Midtown/Lake Street blue line light rail station. Just $4 for an all day pass, connecting you to the Target Field home of the Twins, MSP airport,  Mall of America and more!

name: Visiting Scholars: Beautiful Home by UMN/Hospital
description: *Longer term student/post-doc stays of 1-6 months welcome.* Share my home in Seward neighborhood of S Mpls. Ideal location 1 mile to University of Minnesota or Fairview Riverside Hospital.  Mississippi River is out the front door. Downtown is a 10-min drive. Enjoy great local cafes, shops, and public transit. Hike/bike the river/parks. Lounge in my gardens, snuggle with kitties and my husky, walk to the grocery coop (2 blocks) or the yoga studio (5 blocks). With convenient access to the University of Minnesota campus (about a 1-2 mile walk depending on which building you frequent), I am especially interested in providing short term housing for visiting scholars. Student discounts possible - send me a message and explain your situation.  **Interview required prior to booking.** My house was built in 1908 and professionally redesigned in recent years, combining all the character of an old home with an exquisite contemporary remodel, from top to bottom. The basement space where you will s
neighborhood_overview: Seward is full of earth-lovers, yogis, gardeners, and kind souls. It is a safe, green, and beautiful place packed full of restaurants, local shops, families, parks, and river paths. I chose this neighborhood to be my home because it is my favorite neighborhood in Minneapolis. It is not quite so hip or happening as Northeast or Uptown, but it is a peaceful and nourishing place to live.
transit: My home is convenient to a number of public transit options. There is also super convenient access to highways I-94, 55, and 35W by car. By car, downtown Minneapolis is about 10 min. away, and the U of M campus is about 5 min. away. If the weather is nice, you can walk to campus in about 20 minutes. There is a 2 bus route 4 blocks from my house, which will take you to the light rail or straight to Uptown. The light rail lines travel between downtown Minneapolis and St. Paul, as well as straight to the airport. There is also a 67 bus route directly on the corner by my house. This bus will take you straight to downtown St. Paul. Prefer to bike? There is a Nice Ride MN bicycle rental station 2 blocks from my house, right in front of the Seward Coop. You can rent city bicycles and ride them all around town to stations situated strategically throughout the Twin Cities metro.

name: Renovated 1BR Apt near the Mississippi River
description: Our 1-bedroom suite is the perfect stay while visiting Minneapolis. This suite boasts a newly renovated kitchen, luxury furniture, and 3 balconies, each with wonderful views of the city! Whether you’re in town for work or play, the provided conveniences make you feel right at home, no matter the duration of your stay. Located near the Mississippi River, you’re not far from parks or other outdoor activities. Restaurants and bars are also within close proximity, offering a wide range of options. Our modern 1-bedroom apartment is furnished with a queen bed, a couch, and an air mattress. It has everything you need for a comfortable stay! The kitchen is stocked with cookware to cook simple meals, stainless steel appliances, and a Keurig to enjoy a fresh cup of coffee in the morning. There's a mart TV with Roku and Netflix (there is no cable) & free WiFi! Our modern 1-bedroom apartment is furnished with a queen bed, a couch, and an air mattress. It has everything you need for a comfortable s
neighborhood_overview: Your suite is located only blocks away from the Mississippi River. Nearby parks include the North Loop Playground and Mill Ruins Park. While the river offers outdoor attractions, the city provides endless options for dining and entertainment. Within walking distance, you’ll find tasteful restaurants, hip bars, and conveniences such as shopping and additional parking if needed.
transit: You’ll never be far from where you need to be. The compact city’s transit system with light rail and buses run regularly and can take you through the city. If being outdoors is more your style, the nonprofit Nice Ride, offers rentals as well. Due to the popular destination, Uber and Lyft are easily accessible.

name: Spectacular 2BR/2BA Apartment in Minneapolis
description: Welcome to Minneapolis! Stay in this conveniently located 2BR/2BA apartment near Target Field, Minneapolis Convention Center, Target Center, US Bank Stadium and several theaters including the Guthrie and Orpheum. Settle in and enjoy the award winning North Loop neighborhood featuring several hip and trendy restaurants and shops. Catch a ride on the light rail, or stroll the beautiful Mississippi River. This unit is perfect for the business traveler, sports fan, theater buff, foodie or shopper. Cozy up to the fireplace in the living room, or pull up a stool to the kitchen for a drink. Guests have access to the pool and gym at the Marriott next door for people looking for something more active. Guests have access to several amenities shared with the Marriott hotel next door such as an outdoor swimming pool (seasonal), billiards room, executive business center, fitness center, snack bar, and conference room. The Marriott also provides luggage holding services if needed before or after che
neighborhood_overview: Great part of downtown Minneapolis close to restaurants, bars, sporting venues and much more. Just a couple blocks from Acme Comedy Club and Target Field, and one mile from US Bank Stadium. Many things to do within walking distance or a short Uber ride.
transit: Walk Score = 88 out of 100 Transit Score = 87 out of 100 Bike Score = 97 out of 100 This apartment is an eight minute walk from the Blue METRO Blue Line and the Green METRO Green Line at the Target Field Station & Platform 2 stop.

name: Bright 1BR Apt in North Loop
description: Welcome to Minneapolis! Our 1-bedroom stay in the North Loop neighborhood includes everything you need during your time in town. The open and modern suite includes a large kitchen with an attached bar and granite countertops, large walk-in closets, and simple decor that make you feel relaxed and at home. Because you’re located in North Loop, you’re surrounded by restaurant and bar options. You’re also within walking distance of downtown Minneapolis, offering plenty of entertainment options. Our modern 1-bedroom apartment is furnished with a queen bed, a couch, and an air mattress. It has everything you need for a comfortable stay! The kitchen is stocked with cookware to cook simple meals, stainless steel appliances, and a Keurig to enjoy a fresh cup of coffee in the morning. There's a smart TV with Roku and Netflix (there is no cable) & free WiFi! You can access the building anytime after 3pm by using the lockbox to obtain the keys. We ask that you respect our home and the quiet hours
neighborhood_overview: You’re perfectly located between popular restaurants, shopping, and an attractive nightlife. North Loop offers endless options for dining or grabbing a drink. You’re also located only blocks away from the Mississippi River, providing parks and bike paths. Being located near downtown Minneapolis, you’re within close proximity to theaters, live-music bars, and much more. Popular nearby attractions include the Nicollet Mall, Foshay Museum and Observation Deck, and the Minneapolis Sculpture Garden.
transit: You’ll never be far from where you need to be. The compact city’s transit system with light rail and buses run regularly and can take you through the city. If being outdoors is more your style, the nonprofit Nice Ride, offers rentals as well. Due to the popular destination, Uber and Lyft are easily accessible.

name: Posh pad close to downtown
description: This is a charming historic unit with french doors and a non-working fireplace with lots of natural light. The unit is nicely furnished and ideal for up to four guests.  The unit is on the second floor of a Victorian home built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  LOCATION: The apartment is just 1.3 mi from U.S. Bank Stadium, walking distance to downtown and minutes away from the Minneapolis Institute of Art. Convenient bus lines run to Uptown, LynLake and, U of M campus. Coffee shops and Eat Street are close-by, as well. This space has a lot of historic charm with east and south facing windows which bring in lots of natural light.  This is a small apartment so although it will fit up to four people, occasionally I get feedback that the apartment is most ideal for two.  However, I have had many groups of three and four who were delighted with the space.  It depends on where one is from right?  New Yorker's and people coming from urban areas find the space to have plenty of room, while p
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a diverse, busy and urban area with some charm and a lot of grit.  There are a number of cafes and stores within walking distance.  The Boiler Room cafe is a charming garden level coffee shop situated in the a boiler room of a commercial building and is 2 blocks away.  CVS and Starbucks are about 2 blocks away as well.  MIA or Minneapolis Institute of Arts and The Minneapolis Convention Center are about 5 blocks away.   A restaurant called The Copper Hen is about a 7 block walk and has French fusion food and a charming high end country aesthetic (think Marie Antoinette playing peasant in her pretend village).  Wedge Table is about 6 blocks walk and features organic healthy wholesome food with a spacious and clean cafeteria style layout.  Slice of New York is 5 blocks away, open late,  and has the kind of delicious and greasy pizza slices one would grab before hopping on the subway for a night out in New York.  The Bad Waitress (a diner), a Pizzeria called Black Shee
transit: Street parking is usually available during the day but often difficult to find a spot at night. Usually there are spots within a three block radius.  If you want to park closer feel free to text me and I can almost certainly make an off street parking spot available for $10 per day.

name: Entire 1BR Apartment 3 blocks from US Bank Stadium
description: Going to the Superbowl? I'm offering my 1 BR apartment, only 3 blocks from US Bank Stadium! 1st floor, 1BR, one king size bed, large kitchen, full bath, washer/dryer in unit, 40" TV. 25 ft ethernet cord. Also a HDMI/DVI cord to connect your laptop to my TV if desired (laptop output permitting). Even a little "crash kit" of food: fruit, oatmeal, frozen pizza, and french press coffee to make yourself feel at home. Please contact me if you have any questions about my unit/building/neighborhood! The unit is a nice space in a modern building. Nothing over-the-top fancy, but it is very clean. I've been living here for years and I really enjoy it. It's a cozy living room, comfortably accommodating 4 people socially, although I have hosted many more in a standing reception. I love to cook and in addition to the location, the kitchen was what I loved most. A lot of counter space on three sides, with one side offering a view into the living room above the counter space. One Bedroom with a king s
neighborhood_overview: Extremely close to US Bank stadium, downtown Minneapolis, and a light rail stop. Walking to any of these locations is usually even faster than driving, and the light rail open up even more traveling opportunities.
transit: A parking space will be included in a heated, attached underground garage, if so desired. Street parking is available with a restriction of 2 hours from approximately 10a-6p, and is otherwise unlimited. MN in the winter gets cold! Even so, I have no issue's traveling on foot to local restaurants, US Bank Stadium, and lightrail stations as long as I dress for the weather. UBER and LYFT are easily accessable, and I am an avid user.

name: The Lucky Homestead ~ 1-2 Guests Women Only
description: The Lucky Homestead...charming garden cottage in South Minneapolis, built in 1907, blocks from the Mississippi River.  Peaceful, quiet, neighborhood with friendly neighbors. Close to U of M, St. Thomas, St. Kate's. One private bedroom upstairs with double bed.  There is an additional single bed room available for booking separately (if available) at a discount when you book the double room. Since this house is vintage and quirky, there is a narrow, steeper staircase with narrow treads to the rooms - if you have mobility issues - please keep this in mind.  Since it is a half-story, ceiling height is a consideration - if you are taller than 5'10'' you will have to duck to enter the bedroom.  Comfortable beds with down comforters, wifi and streaming.  We have a dog named Biscuit (small Yorkie mix - non-shedding) and a cat named Banjo - they would love to spend time with you and in fact, will likely scratch at your door in the morning after I leave for work to get to know you.   As noted b
neighborhood_overview: Great, safe, quiet neighborhood within walking distance to restaurants and shopping. Check out the Hi-Lo Restaurant, Longfellow Grill, Blue Door Pub (2 block walk), Turtle Bread Cafe (2 block walk)  5 block walk to the Mississippi River with walking and biking paths.  Riverview Theatre (great vintage budget theatre with amazing popcorn) and Riverview Wine Bar 7 blocks away.
transit: 2 blocks off of major bus lines to take you to downtown or the Mall of America...convenient access to Light Rail.

name: Greenway Room
description: It’s a family home, we live here daily. A very happy 5 year old will want to  give you hugs & make you feel like the most interesting person. If you don’t like children this room may not be for you. An older home with steep stairs and may not be a good fit for those with knee or mobility issues. Repairs in the basement where the bathroom is located are done in a manner not to disturb or limit access. It’s not fancy but affordable, welcoming, and comfortable accommodations are provided. You have your own room and are welcome to chill solo or join us in whatever we have going on that evening. There is a small desk with chair, dresser, and small shelf in the room as well. The kitchen and both main floor bedrooms are located just off the living room and the full bath is located in the basement. The double bed is always there the twin air bed is set as needed (please specify preference when making your reservation).  *for same day single night reservations if twin bed is already set up it w
neighborhood_overview: There are various corner stores with two blocks. Aldi, Dollar General, and the closest wine/spirits is seven blocks from the house, Target and Cub foods less than a mile away - all a quick drive or right on the bus line. The closest bus stop is at the end of the block - and commonly used bus routes are two blocks or less away. The blue line train that runs between the Mall of America and Downtown (where you can connect to other lines) is just over a half mile walk or a quick bus ride. Common Point of Interest  Airport 9 mi  Mall of America 7 mi Twin Cities Premium Outlets 10 mi  Minnesota Zoo 13 mi State Fair Grounds 7 mi University of MN / TCF stadium 3 / 4mi Target Center and Field < 3 mi  US Bank Stadium < 2 mi  You are also just 9 miles from Downtown St. Paul that hosts attractions such as the Xcel Energy Center, Science Museum, CHS Field, Saint Paul Cathedral, State Capital, Como Zoo and many more
transit: You are in the middle of transportation bliss. We live right off the walking and biking trail (city bike rentals available 1 block away for unlimited use $6 per day ) and in the center of accessible transportation... I’m not to versed at it but my teenager seems to get around with ease... prob a learning curve. Download the Metro Transit ap for trip planning and schedules. Public transit not your thing? Uber and Lyft are generally affordable option since you are kind of in the center of most desirable locations.

name: Callaghans'  Bungalow
description: We and our home are known for hospitality. We live in a warm and welcoming 1923 Arts & Crafts Bungalow that was fully restored to the period in recent years. We welcome you to join us for a visit. We are 10 minutes from the Airport, Downtown Minneapolis, The Mall of America, and sports stadiums. Continental breakfast. We offer a quiet and peaceful place within the city. We welcome the business traveler as well as those here for fun and relaxation. Nuts and Bolts:  We have an electronic key system and a home security system. Access to the home requires navigating four steps at the front or back door. The guest room is on our main level, with its own bathroom. The guest room has a super-comfy double bed that gets rave reviews from our guests!  We have a dedicated closet and chest of drawers for guest use. We are smoke-free, drug-free and pet-free home.  Our neighborhood is in the midst of the City of Lakes, which boasts beautiful trails for walking/running/biking within walking distance
neighborhood_overview: We live on a street that is one-block long, yet right off a main artery in the city. We enjoy great relationships with our neighbors, who are families, couples, and singles of all ages and stages of life. Our picnic table in our front yard is "the" gathering place for hospitality and friendship on our block. We welcome our guests to join us there.
transit: If guests are driving, we are located very near the freeway exit from Interstate 35W and 46th Street. We have one parking spot for our guests on our property. We have a bus stop a block away. We have Uber and taxi service throughout the city. Guests are only a short walk from the Minnehaha Parkway and about a mile from Lake Harriet, which have lovely walking/biking trails. ** For guests visiting for the Super Bowl, we may be able to provide complementary transportation to/from events. **

name: 6 blks  to Conv Ctr - sunny, clean studio APT
description: Centrally located in the Washburn-Fair Oaks mansion district, less than 2 miles from the hearts of downtown and uptown Minneapolis, the studio apartment in an old Victorian mansion is a perfect urban getaway for a couple enjoying a weekend, or a business traveler.  Less than a block from the Minneapolis Institute of Art, the apartment has high ceilings, floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking Fair Oaks Park, hardwood floors and off-street parking. A 15 minute, 6 blocks, walk to convention center. The apartment is in a secure residential building on the second floor. You will need to walk up 1-1/2  flights of stairs. Off-street parking is available in the parking lot on the right side of the building. There is a queen-size bed, a large closet and a small kitchen stocked with a Keurig-style coffeemaker, dishes, cutlery and glassware. The unit has Wifi and a TV with Netflix. Parking lot on the right side of building. Coin-operated washer and dryer are available in the building. Detergent is
neighborhood_overview: The Whittier neighborhood is very central. It is a 15-minute, 6 block, walk to the Convention Center, and a short Uber ride to Eat Street (Nicollet Ave.), Uptown restaurants and nightspots and downtown Minneapolis. Bus line 11 on the corner goes downtown. It is a perfect home base for exploring the Twin Cities.
transit: Uber and Lyft are a great way to get around Minneapolis, we also have the #11 bus route that stops on the corner of our block, 22nd and 3rd Avenue. We also have off street parking if you are driving a car or bike.

name: Simple 1BR Apt near Downtown
description: Our 1-bedroom stay near downtown includes everything needed to enjoy your Minneapolis visit! The open space provides an island in the kitchen offering a great spot to whip up a delicious meal while the large windows give a share of the city. Located within the Phillips area, you’re surrounded by diversity. It brings residential and commercial together, making you feel right at home. You’re close enough to downtown to reach the city with ease while also being able to enjoy a quiet night in. Our 1-bedroom apartment is furnished with a queen bed, a couch, and an air mattress. It has everything you need for a comfortable stay! The kitchen is stocked with cookware to cook simple meals, stainless steel appliances, and a Keurig to enjoy a fresh cup of coffee in the morning. There's a smart TV with Roku and Netflix (there is no cable) & free WiFi! You can access the building anytime after 3pm by using the lockbox to obtain the keys. We ask that you respect our home and the quiet hours of the c
neighborhood_overview: Your location allows you to enjoy the best of both worlds. Downtown is only minutes away, where you’ll find everything that comes along with an exciting city. There are theater and entertainment venues, high-end restaurants, live-music bars, shopping, and more. While you have easy access to adventure, you’re also staying in a quiet and relaxed area, allowing you to enjoy a peaceful night after a long and exciting day of exploring. Conveniences such as grocery stores, ATMs, and additional parking if needed are also nearby.
transit: Getting around your destination couldn’t be easier! Minneapolis offers public transit through light rail and busing. Nice Ride, the non-profit bike-share program, is a great way to explore the city and its many parks. Given the popular location, Uber and Lyft are also easily accessible.

description: After a visit to Waco TX Sue was "Magnolia inspired " to create a new bedroom space at our Airbnb shared home The Magnolia bedroom is at the back of the house, separate guests entry. The 10x10 room is light, airy, clean overlooking the backyard. Eco memory foam cool gel bed for a great night's rest. Single non smoking travelers only, no pets. Newly remodeled bathroom separate shower room with locking doors. Shower shared with/ other guests.  If booking locally let us know your circumstances. The Magnolia bedroom is a sweet cosy spacd overlooking the back yard. The room is 10x10, a traditional size for older homes. A key is in the room for locking your bedroom. (lost key fee $10). You'll enjoy a full size super comfy bed, lots of pillows, 2 night tables, small closet, bedside lamps, ceiling fan, rug, nightlight, bed tray & magazines. Towels, wash cloths, toiletries included.  The Magnolia bedroom has a wee closet with adult coloring & yoga books. There's no TV but fast wifi. Small fridg
neighborhood_overview: Like a small town in the city - Mpls is a city of well established old home neighborhoods with a mix of new condos. We are located in South Minneapolis, midtown right between the airport & downtown. Easy train ride to Mall of America, the airport and downtown - 3 miles to uptown and St. Paul.  We live in a diverse urban community, friendly to all. The house we share with you was Sue's grandfather's built in 1918 and comes with the charm of an old house with newly remodeled spaces. Guest spaces feel private, new & fresh.
transit: Just 3 miles from the airport & downtown or uptown. Uber/Lyft easily available, free street parking, light rail a couple blocks away, nice ride bike rentals by the train station. Easy ride on the train so no need to take a cab. You can walk around powderhorn lake & visit mayday cafe, a small eclectic coffee shop The cafe is 1/2 mile west. Within 1/2 mile Target, Cub foods, Aldi. Delivery we use bite squad or Amazon. Airport/downtown 10-15 minutes by car, 20 by train.

name: Charming Cabin Suite in South Minneapolis
description: Enjoy a cozy getaway in our charming "cabin" suite. The space may fit up to four guests and has amenities that include plenty of room to lounge,  television, wi-fi, a kitchenette (complete with a refrigerator, sink and microwave),  complimentary coffee, tea and breakfast (granola and yogurt). We are a ten minute drive to the MSP Airport, Mall of America, and US Bank Stadium. We are a short walk away to a cafe, nature walks, and bike paths along the creek and lake (breathtaking in every season!) Located in the heart of South Minneapolis, our listing gives you a chance to explore all MN has to offer (delicious local food, ample walking, biking and hiking paths, beautiful views of the lakes) while also allowing a cozy place for you to rest your head at night. We have a passion for hospitality and hope to have thought of all the details to make your stay relaxing, allowing you to leave refreshed. You will have full access to the suite and side balcony where the separate entrance is located

transit: We are located a short walk away to a bus stop where you can pick up the metro line (which travels around the city and near suburbs). name: Tree Top Linden Hills - 2 blocks to lakes
description: Top floor unit, 2 blocks from Lakes Harriet & Calhoun. Huge French doors open to deck with comfy outdoor furniture & outdoor string lights overlooking tree tops.  55" cable HDTV. 3 bedrooms, 1 king, 1 queen, 1 full.  Addtl TV in lg bedroom. Older charm w/updated amenities. Everything you need in a kitchen. Great location!! Walking distances to Linden Hills & the Lakes, shops & restaurants. After biking/walking around the lakes, sit back & enjoy a beverage on the deck perched among the tree tops. There are three bedrooms, one large bedroom, one average sized and one small bedroom.  The kitchen is a galley-style kitchen. It is the top 3rd floor unit of a 4 unit building.  It is big enough but has a cozy feel.  The living room is average sized and we have put both the couch and dining table in the same room with the TV, so there is no separate dining room.  The bathroom has a tub and a shower.  Since it is the top floor the bathroom has angled ceiling but has still ample room for a 6 foot
neighborhood_overview: Linden Hills is one of the most popular neighborhoods in Minneapolis.  The unit is located 2 blocks from both Lake Harriet and Lake Calhoun.  In the Summer there is live music  and movies at the Lake Harriet Bandshell.  The area is laidback but has an artsy feel as well as upscale restaurants and shops that are 4-5 blocks away.
transit: You can easily walk to the Lakes and it's about 4-5 blocks to downtown Linden Hills.  You may want a car to explore the rest of the city and the nearest grocery store is less than a mile away.

name: Urban Forest Hideaway, Downtown Minneapolis Apt.
description: If Robin Hood lived in Minneapolis, this would be his hideaway. Located in a historic brownstone estate in the Elliot Park neighborhood of Minneapolis, less than a mile away from the heart of downtown, my space has been designed & decorated with an 'urban forest' aesthetic that promotes a bright, lush, life-enhancing energy. 10 min walk from U.S. Bank Stadium.  10 min walk from Minneapolis Convention Center.  10 min Uber to Target Field & Target Center. Full of plants, books, original artwork, a large-scale mural in the living room, and a 3 season porch that overlooks the city.  I have been intentional with the investment and design aesthetic of the apartment. I've hosted many gatherings here, and friends and family love the space. The hideaway includes two rooms: one equipped with plenty of outlets, a closet w/ shelves, reading lamp, adjustable overhead light and a bed with a full size bed + memory foam mattress top; the second is equipped with a queen sized bed, reading lamp, closet
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a few blocks from downtown. If you're driving, we're 1 minute from major highways. We have at least 4 parks all in walking distance; a convenience store right across the street; an amazing and affordable East African restaurant across the street; a local cafe about 3 blocks away; and "greasy spoon" diner a block away (great for early mornings after lonnnnng nights).
transit: 10 min walk to Convention Center. 15 min walk to center of downtown (5 Min Uber ride). Bus stop located one block away. Taxis are easily accessible. Enterprise car rental is about 4 blocks from our apt.

name: Bright studio on cusp of downtown!
description: You can't get any closer to the US Bank VikingStadium and Convention Center.  Bus stop right on the block. Within 2 blocks of CVS for convenience. Many coffee shops nearby. A whole strip of international cuisine on Nicollet Ave "Eat Street" -within walking distance. The studio is on the second floor of a small building, right on the edge of downtown Minneapolis. It's close enough for quick, comfortable access to so many things, but also far enough for peace and quite when you need it. We are in town if you need us and we know the city very well. The roads around the Vikings stadium are closed for the Super Bowl but we are as close as you can get! also very close to Nicollet Mall for the outdoor concerts. food options and bar options nearby are endless. Our place is quiet enough to chill and take a break from the crowds. Access to many major bus routes and the light rail lines. Free street parking is available, if you're driving.

Our place is quiet enough to chill and take a break from the crowds.

name: Lovely Family Home in Nokomis Area of Minneapolis
description: 3 br, 2 bath single family home in the residential area of south Minneapolis, near the Minnehaha Creek in the Nokomis area. This space is ideal for a family with young children. Master suite on the upper level, 2 bedrooms on the main level (one with bunk beds). Cool indoor jungle gym (monkey bars and kids climbing wall) in the basement. This is a safe, desirable neighborhood. Easy walking distance to parks, public transportation, major highways, bike trails, and the Lakes. 5 night minimum stay. Our house is located in the Nokomis area of Minneapolis, a safe, residential area close to parks, coffee shops, restaurants, grocery stores, trails, the lakes, etc. Easy access to major highways and public transit. One designated parking space in the back driveway plus plenty of on-street parking.

name: The Best Place Location for Your Twin Cities Vacation
description: Twin Cities, here we come! If you’re looking for the best location with stellar accommodations, you’ve come to the right place. This spot is packed with all sorts of top-notch amenities, including a roof deck, a pool, a high-end fitness center, and outdoor grilling areas! From here, you can walk to catch the Twins, T-Wolves, and Vikings in action; and the city’s best performing arts venues are all within striking distance, too. Whether you’re staying for a while or are just passing through, this place has your name all over it. Welcome home! This one-bedroom apartment can accommodate up to four travelers with a queen-size bed and a pull-out sofa that comfortably sleeps two. Get ready to be impressed by your modern kitchen that’s decked out with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, a Keurig machine (plus coffee/tea pods), and all the cookware and kitchenware items you need to unlock your inner chef. From tons of natural light and closet space to a washer-and-dryer and even y
neighborhood_overview: Downtown West (aka The Central Business District) makes up the skyscraper dominated skyline of Minneapolis.  But don’t let the association with work fool you – this is the *center of fun and nightlife* in the Mini-Apple – with 3 stadiums, a district for professional theaters, nightly live-music venues, sophisticated steakhouses, new American restaurants, and enough retail to shop-til-you-drop, all within walking distance – you can’t beat this location!    Minneapolis is known for its Skyway: 9 miles of elevated, climate controlled, enclosed walkways (the largest in the world!). With entrances all over downtown, including right here, once you arrive you don’t have to deal with subzero temps or hot humidity.  Just around the block you’ll find… - AT&T Tower (1/2 block) - Minnesota Orchestra (1/2 block) - Dakota’s Jazz Club (1 block) - Starbucks / Caribou Coffee (1 block) - Minneapolis Convention Center (3 blocks) - IDS Center (2 blocks) - Pantages Theater (2 blocks) - Univ. of St Thomas /
transit: No car required! This location has a WalkScore of 97/100! And when the weather is too cold or too hot, enjoy the convenience of the Skyway – a unique mode of travel in Minneapolis that covers 80 city blocks and connects you to all your downtown destinations.  When the weather’s dreamy, get around smoothly on a ‘cycle with Nice Ride Bikeshare System (download the app) and 92 miles of city bike ways. Metro Transit (check out their website) has bus and light rail connections that will get you around the city, between here and Saint Paul (Twin City!), and the suburbs. If you like the convenience of a car, Zipcar operates in Minneapolis; and Lyft/Uber and Taxi’s are just minutes away.

name: Beautiful + Historic Home near UMN & Downtown
description: This beautiful Victorian home located in an ideal Minneapolis spot is the perfect space for a small group (no more than 6 people) visiting the city or a romantic couples getaway.  The interior is uniquely decorated with full amenities including a gourmet kitchen, formal dining room, plenty of sleeping options and bright work space. The home is walking distance to Minneapolis' historic Stone Arch bridge,  University of MN Dinkytown area, and a short trip to downtown Minneapolis. Beautiful and unique, historic space. 2 bedrooms with queen beds. An open office space can be used as a bedroom by setting up one of the air mattresses. We have two queen air mattresses available for use. This space can accommodate 8 guests. 2 bedrooms include conventional beds with queen sized mattresses, and the office space holds two queen air mattresses Large gourmet kitchen provides an array of different utensils, plates, glasses, and just about anything you could need if you would like to cook. Coffee/tea
neighborhood_overview: Less than a mile to US BANK Stadium (MN Vikings, 2018 Superbowl location) Only one mile to TCF Bank Stadium (MN Gopher football, Mariucci (MN Gophers Hockey), Williams Arena, U of M Hospital and the rest of campus.  Less than two miles to Target Stadium (MN Twins baseball) and Target Center (MN Lynx & Timberwolves). A short 6 minute walk to the Stone Arch Bridge and Historic Main Street. Downtown Mpls is close including Guthrie, Walker, fine dining resturaunts, bars, and clubs. U of MN campus is within walking distance. Easy access to 35W to get around town/to and from airport easily.
transit: We have ONE on site parking spot. On street parking is free and quite accessible in the neighborhood. A short 2 minute walk brings you to a bus station that will take you to downtown, Dinkytown, NE, Uptown, and Roseville quite quickly.

name: Great home close to the U of M!
description: Welcome to our home in one of the best locations in Minneapolis!  You are 5-10 minutes from St. Paul, the U of M, and downtown.  1 house away from a bus line, 2 blocks f/river, bike paths, rental bikes, and a park!  Also close to hospitals. Our location is definitely the best.  I work at the University of Minnesota and bike or walk there everyday (mostly bike).  It's also on a bus line that goes downtown, and within a block of bike paths that lead downtown, uptown,  the University of Minnesota and Augburg College, as well as hospitals.  2 cats and 1 dog live here, all very friendly.  The dog is VERY popular with the airbnb folks, as you can see from reviews.  :) Wireless internet, laundry, kitchen, back patio, etc. As much as you want.   I'm pretty busy (I work full-time and am in school), but am happy to show you around and answer any questions you might have! I love how close the neighborhood is to everything and how safe it is.  There are great coffee shops, hiking trails, a white s
neighborhood_overview: I love how close the neighborhood is to everything and how safe it is.  There are great coffee shops, hiking trails, a white sand beach, bike paths, and a park just 2 blocks away!  The co-op and target are within a mile, as are fun restaurants and bars.  Close to everything, yet quiet, it's great!
transit: Transporation includes: Nice Ride Bikes (station 1/2 block from our home), Light Rail commuter train, and bus service. If you have your own car, parking is available on street in front of our home. Our neighborhood is very active with bikers, walkers, and friendly neighbors. We are blocks from the Minneapolis Grand Rounds trail system which by bike or foot will take you through the many wonderful and natural areas of our City.

name: Charming Cottage in Southwest Minneapolis
description: This quaint and cozy rambler is located in one of the best neighborhoods in Southwest Minneapolis. Just a few minutes from the airport, downtown, and the chain of lakes, it's the perfect place to stay on your vacation. With a gas fireplace and plenty of natural light, this retreat will give you all the inspiration and relaxation you need. The entire home is yours during your stay - including use of the washer/dryer in the basement and the private fenced-in backyard. The neighborhood is very family friendly and quiet, so if you're looking for a peaceful stay, this is the place for you! The home is one level and free parking is located on the street. You will have access to the entire main level and the laundry in the basement. We live just down the street and are available if you have any questions! The Kenny neighborhood is incredibly family-friendly with a park half a block away and Grass Lake around the corner (great spot for a walk!). You can take a leisurely stroll to Minnehaha Cre
neighborhood_overview: The Kenny neighborhood is incredibly family-friendly with a park half a block away and Grass Lake around the corner (great spot for a walk!). You can take a leisurely stroll to Minnehaha Creek (about 6 blocks away) as well, where you can jump on the walking/running/bike path and see some of the most beautiful nature the city has to offer. About a mile and a half away is beautiful Lake Harriet, too, where you can walk the lake path, rent a paddle boat, or stop at Bread & Pickle to get an ice cream cone on hot days. Right near the house there is also Starbucks, Prima (pasta bar), El Jefe (Tacos, etc.), and Kowalski's (grocery store) for all your dining needs! We also love the nearby corner of 50th and Penn Ave S, where you can find Sparrow Cafe (amazing coffee), Broder's (Italian), and Paperback Exchange (a favorite local bookshop).
transit: We are located just a few blocks from Lyndale Ave, which has public transportation options (bus lines), and there is easy access to several major highways (62, 35W) which connect to just about anywhere you need to go (airport, downtown, suburbs, etc.).

name: Private deck in NE Mpls Arts District
description: Our apartment is a stylish retreat from the city while still having access to all that NE Minneapolis has to offer.  Breweries, Coffee shops and parks are all in walking distance.   It has two bedrooms, large living room, updated kitchen, and a bright sunny sitting area, washer/dryer in the unit, and best of all private deck The apartment is on the upper level of a duplex and  is very comfortable with a nice open feel to it.  The kitchen has pretty much everything you need for a full meal. It has a full size oven/stove, fridge/freezer, french press, & tea kettle, dishes, utensils, pots & pans. And it has an eat-in counter with four stools. The bathroom is a little tight but gets the job done and is fully stocked with soap, towels and what not.   The deck has a table with seating for four as well as two lounge chairs.  As well as a pergola for some shade Both bedrooms have a queen memory foam mattress with  hypoallergenic, waterproof protector with plenty of sheets, pillows and blankets
neighborhood_overview: Northeast Minneapolis has grown into one of the more popular neighborhoods in the twin cities. It is known as the Art District and subsequently many of the old industrial buildings have been transformed into art studios.  On the first Thursday of every month they are opened up to the public  There are a ton of great restaurants and breweries; too many to list.  And in the summer there are festivals going on pretty much every week.
transit: Bus stops are about a block away in every direction and there are "nice ride" bike sharing system stations thru out the city.  Also taxi and Uber/Lyft are around You can get to downtown Mpls in 10 mins by car and access to  35W is 3 blocks away.  And the nearest grocery store is half a mile away in the Quarry shopping center

name: Sunny Cozy Home near LightRail-10min to dwntwn/MSP
description: Bright, clean home just a few minutes' walk to the Metro Blue Line, bringing you directly to downtown Minneapolis (just a 10-min ride or drive!) or to the airport. Beautifully remodeled living room with a 43" smart TV equipped with Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, and local channels. Remodeled bedroom with queen bed; double futon in attached office can function as 2nd bedroom if needed. Wi-fi, new kitchen bar, and yard/patio to enjoy! Cozy, clean, and comfortable with many updates including new windows that let in lots of natural light! Friendly neighborhood in close vicinity to light rail, Twin Cities lakes, great local bars/cafes/breweries, and all the action in downtown Minneapolis! This is a duplex, so the basement and back yard are shared, but the unit is completely private with a separate entrance. Guests are free to use the back yard, as well as the laundry room in the basement if you let the host know you'd like to ahead of time.  Grill, fire kettle, and patio furniture are all ava
neighborhood_overview: Friendly, quiet neighborhood that's in close reach to all the action! Walking distance to the Metro Blue Line, Northbound Smokehouse & Brewpub, the Cardinal Bar, Sister Sludge Cafe & Wine Bar, A Baker's Wife Donuts, A Cupcake Social, and Colossal Cafe. Du Nord Distillery, Venn Brewing, and Matt's Bar (home of the famed Minnesota Juicy Lucy) are just over 1 mile away-- walking distance on a nice day or a few minutes' drive. For outdoor adventures, Lake Nokomis, Lake Hiawatha, and Minnehaha Falls are all also very close and can be reached by a quick drive or from the many nearby bike trails. The Blue Line will bring you to downtown Minneapolis, the Mall of America, and MSP Airport. The airport is a 10-minute drive away.
transit: The 38th Street Station on the Light Rail Blue Line is an easy few blocks' walk away. This will bring you to and from the airport, the Mall of America, and downtown Minneapolis.  Easy driving access to Hiawatha, 62, 35W, Uptown and Downtown.

name: Cozy room w/private bath in modern Victorian
description: We're located in Powderhorn Park, one of the city's most unique and creative neighborhoods. Mark and I run The Porch Gallery and our home is filled with artwork. Powderhorn Park is very close to many landmarks: U of MN, Downtown/Uptown, Vikings Stadium, Target Field, etc. Bike path is right out the front door. Second floor bedroom w/queen memory foam mattress, attached screened porch and a private, updated bathroom down the hall. We have 2 small, sweet pups and one cat that keeps to himself. All will be welcomed into our home. We are LGTBQIA friendly. We do not tolerate -ISMS: racism, sexism, ageism, homophobia or ethnic discrimination. We encourage open minds and open hearts. Our Victorian home was built in 1903 and we've spent the last few years updating it to appeal to our more modern style. Mark and I run The Porch Gallery, a twenty square foot white cube exhibition space wrapped inside our Victorian home (check our website for more info). We host month-long exhibitions June - Octo
neighborhood_overview: The Powderhorn Park neighborhood, on Minneapolis' south side, takes its name from Powderhorn Park lake, a small lake shaped like a powder horn. It's definitely one of Mpls most creative and diverse neighborhoods. People gather for cultural activities and large community events in the park and many artists live in the area. We are about 15-20 min to the airport, 5-7 min to Uptown and Downtown.
transit: Parking is free and plentiful in front of our house or on a side street. Uber/Lyft are great options for those not wanting to drive. Uptown or Downtown is about a $7-8 ride. We are also 2 blocks from bus lines that connect to the Light Rail Train. The light rail goes to/ from the airport, Mall of America and Downtown and connect to St. Paul. There is a Nice Ride (bike share) and a bike station close to our home. The bike lane runs in front of our house.

Your host is always close by, and available via text or phone for tips about navigating the Big North or finding th
neighborhood_overview: Midway from MSP airport and downtown, you can't be more centrally located. The Corcoran neighborhood features the best of friendly Minnesota, you betcha. Free street parking. Choose from over 100 locally-owned restaurants, breweries, and bars within a mile!

name: Cute 2 BR Apartment in Charming Minneapolis Duplex
description: Our charming 2-bedroom apartment is the bottom floor of a duplex on a quiet street in Minneapolis's hip Powderhorn neighborhood. The apartment has great light, cozy touches, and a full kitchen. One bedroom contains a queen sized bed and the other contains a full size futon. An air mattress can be set up in either bedroom or a common space. The apartment is an easy walk to Powderhorn Park and several restaurants and cafes, and a quick bus ride to both uptown and downtown. We will be sadly out of town the weekend of the Final Four but thought some out of town guests might like to take advantage of our space and great location. We'll be available by phone all weekend. Powderhorn is one of Minneapolis's most charming neighborhoods. It's full of small businesses, friendly families, and beautiful tree-lined streets. Many bus lines run both north-south and east-week nearby, and the light rail isn't far away. The neighborhood is also extremely walkable.
neighborhood_overview: Powderhorn is one of Minneapolis's most charming neighborhoods. It's full of small businesses, friendly families, and beautiful tree-lined streets.
transit: Many bus lines run both north-south and east-week nearby, and the light rail isn't far away. The neighborhood is also extremely walkable.

name: Clean, Cheap, Convenient Condo -UPTOWN MINNEAPOLIS
description: It's cheap, clean and convenient to everything and anything you need for your stay in Minneapolis. It's been updated, but this is by no means the Four Seasons-hence, that's why it's cheap. We have many beautiful properties-this one is all about location, location, location.  it has a wall unit a/c that works like a charm, separate kitchen, full bathroom, work area, living room and bed are shared space. There is one dedicated parking spot. As we mentioned, this is all about location. We bought it to use for our own out-of-town guests. It's on the larger side for a studio-perfect for work or leisure travel. Temperpedic full size bed with down comforter. The bathroom has been updated, it is clean, but has older tile and tub (we mention this because if you rent, please don't write a review and give us anything less than a 5 because of old tile:)-we will haunt you)  We ask our guests for quiet time after 10 PM and til 6:30 AM-don't rent to have people over (back to the haunting thing-our ne

Roomy, light-filled bedroom in a house filled with art. Bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, living room, back yard. Limited use of kitchen for simple meals from 7 AM to 10 PM. name: Stay Steps from the Minnesota Orchestra
description: Here for a show? The Orchestra, Theater District and Target Center are all within a block or two of this apartment. From here, you’re minutes to an abundance of dining, drink and shopping options. But you don’t even need to leave with all the building has to offer a private penthouse club with lounge, rooftop pool when the weather’s nice, and healthclub with sauna year-round. Studio apartment with full kitchen and washer/dryer; complimentary coffee, toiletries and wifi. Enjoy the convenience of this efficiency apartment during your trip to Minneapolis. A step up from a hotel room, you’ll have a full kitchen at your disposal, and even an in-room washer/dryer closet. You’re guaranteed to sleep soundly in this king bed, with matching nightstands for your cellphone. Your Keurig coffee machine with complimentary coffee/tea and accompaniments is a great way to start the day. A dining table for two doubles as a workspace if you must work. And the free highspeed Wi-Fi is convenient for both st
neighborhood_overview: Downtown West (aka The Central Business District) makes up the skyscraper dominated skyline of Minneapolis.  But don’t let the association with work fool you – this is the *center of fun and nightlife* in the Mini-Apple – with 3 stadiums, a district for professional theaters, nightly live-music venues, sophisticated steakhouses, new American restaurants, and enough retail to shop-til-you-drop, all within walking distance – you can’t beat this location!    Minneapolis is known for its Skyway: 9 miles of elevated, climate controlled, enclosed walkways (the largest in the world!). With entrances all over downtown, including right here, once you arrive you don’t have to deal with subzero temps or hot humidity.  Just around the block you’ll find… - AT&T Tower (1/2 block) - Minnesota Orchestra (1/2 block) - Dakota’s Jazz Club (1 block) - Starbucks / Caribou Coffee (1 block) - Minneapolis Convention Center (3 blocks) - IDS Center (2 blocks) - Pantages Theater (2 blocks) - Univ. of St Thomas /
transit: No car required! This location has a WalkScore of 97/100! And when the weather is too cold or too hot, enjoy the convenience of the Skyway – a unique mode of travel in Minneapolis that covers 80 city blocks and connects you to all your downtown destinations.  When the weather’s dreamy, get around smoothly on a ‘cycle with Nice Ride Bikeshare System (download the app) and 92 miles of city bike ways. Metro Transit (check out their website) has bus and light rail connections that will get you around the city, between here and Saint Paul (Twin City!), and the suburbs. If you like the convenience of a car, Zipcar operates in Minneapolis; and Lyft/Uber and Taxi’s are just minutes away.

name: Red + Cozy Two Bedroom Walkup in Marcy-Holmes
description: This cozy two bedroom one bathroom walk up apartment is perfect for 2-4 people looking for warmth with spaciousness. Located near the U of MN and also only a few short minutes from downtown, US Bank Stadium, the Stone arch bridge and many more famous spots, this home is ideal for travelers who want to experience the excitement of being in the city with a friendly, neighborhood feel. We offer a very large kitchen with amenities to make it effortless to cook in. The kitchen provides an array of different utensils, plates, glasses, and just about anything you could need if you would like to cook. Coffee/tea included as well as oils/spices/some condiments to help you get started with your stay.  Flat screen TV in the living room to watch movies or sporting events. It's a comfortable and beautifully decorated space to relax with beautiful light. Please note that though the entire living space is on one level it is a walk up and requires climbing stairs to get into the space. Second level of
neighborhood_overview: Marcy-Holmes is a wonderful neighborhood with access to so much in the city. Less than a mile to US BANK Stadium. Quick and easy access to downtown and NE Minneapolis. Only one mile to TCF Bank Stadium (MN Gopher football, Mariucci (MN Gophers Hockey), Williams Arena, U of M Hospital and the rest of campus.  Less than two miles to Target Stadium (MN Twins baseball) and Target Center (MN Lynx & Timberwolves). A short 6 minute walk to the Stone Arch Bridge and Historic Main Street. Downtown Mpls is close including Guthrie, Walker, fine dining resturaunts, bars, and clubs. U of MN campus is within walking distance. Easy access to 35W to get around town/to and from airport easily.
transit: On street parking is free and quite accessible in the neighborhood. A short 2 minute walk brings you to a bus station that will take you to downtown, Dinkytown, NE, Uptown, and Roseville quite quickly.

Relaxing outdoor space with grills. Great for business travelers. Theaters, UofM, HCMC hospital are close by. Very cozy condo with almost everything that you would need. Fully stocked modern kitchen, Queen size bed, extra sheets and towels. High speed internet, premium cable channels, Smart TV. Bathroom with high-end finishes unique shower with bench seating. In-unit washer & dryer. Association requires background/credit check for each occupant which is $78.00/person and the tenant is required to sign a lease addendum, which will be provided by the association. You will have access to two tennis courts, outdoor pool and cabana with restrooms and s

name: Beautiful, comfortable, quiet, home away from home
description: A beautiful house in a trendy neighborhood about 3 Miles to downtown or Uptown.  Abundant parks, a great beach, neighborhood grocery store, café and coffee shop within walking distance.   Private guest room and bathroom.  My well behaved dog would welcome yours in the house as well as her fenced backyard.   I have extensive personal knowledge of the city and would welcome helping you plan your visit to Minneapolis. My home is in a very progressive picturesque neighborhood with our own coffee shop, small grocery store and even a restaurant with the sidewalk café. The thing I love the most about living in this neighborhood is that I am two blocks from two very large parks including one that is filled with trails in the woods.  In the winter lots of people come to cross country ski or walk their dogs through the woods and snow. In the summer the wildflower garden is a big draw. Guests can use any part of the house they like including the beautiful backyard I encourage my guests to make th
neighborhood_overview: Bryn Mawr is an incredible neighborhood filled with wonderful people, a great coffee shop a fantastic Ecuadorian restaurant and even a little grocery store. I am two blocks from a very large regional park and live on a beautiful tree-lined street with wonderful neighbors who have welcomed all of my guests.
transit: You are welcome to drive to the house but you won’t need to drive once you arrive and can park on the street easily for free. I am 50 feet from a bus stop, a seven dollar Uber ride to downtown and blocks from a great bike paths that can take you miles and miles around the area. Plenty of interesting things to walk to and perfect for dog walking too!

description: Quiet and cozy lake neighborhood home located directly on walking/biking/skiing trails with easy access to  uptown, downtown and chain of lakes. Renovated mid-century home with open kitchen that flows into bright and airy dinning room, sun room and living room with wood burning fireplace.  Two  bedrooms and private bath on first floor. name: Near Downtown, Cozy Queen [9a]
description: The 3rd floor of our home is a clean, quiet and charming unit. The home is over 100 years old, so you can expect some quirkiness that an old Victorian home offers. Our home is very centrally located and within walking distance to downtown Minneapolis. We are 8 blocks from the Convention Center & 0.7/mile from the lightrail. US Bank Stadium is less than a mile away, as well as Target Field, Uptown, downtown nightclubs, and the Mississippi River. Each of our guest rooms is sun filled with a comfy queen size bed. In warmer summer months, we have a window AC unit available for use, as well as a fan. In winter months, extra blankets are available. Included in your stay is access to gigabit internet (50 times faster than most others). You will have access to your private room, SHARED living room, bathroom/shower, and large kitchen. There is ample free street parking. We, your hosts live right across the street so if you need anything, we are just  a stones throw away.  We are most available
neighborhood_overview: We are within less than a mile and within walking distance to downtown, US Bank Stadium, Abbott Northwestern Hospital, Children's Hospital, HCMC, and the Convention Center. We are just a couple miles from the center of the University of Minnesota, Uptown, Lake Calhoun, Lake Harriet, Lake of the Isles, and Lake Nokomis.  We love good food, so we can also point you in the direction of local eating hot spots.   We love our neighborhood.  So much so, that we bought another home right across the street where we are raising our three daughters. We appreciate its diversity and vibrancy and how centrally located it is to the entire metro!!   Because we are in the heart of the city, we get to experience people from broad cultural and economic backgrounds in a densely populated area.  Our neighborhood, Ventura Village, is a part of the most diverse neighborhood in the entire country with over 100 languages spoken here!  There are restaurants, healthcare buildings, old Victorian homes, apartment
transit: There are bus stops within 50 yards of the house. Light rail is 7/10 of a mile east down Franklin from the home.

name: Downtown Convenience, 2 Bedroom 1400 SQ FT.
description: 2 BLOCKS AWAY FROM US BANK STADIUM. I AM A 5 STAR RATED HOST. I do live here most of the time. I keep my clothes and necessities here but will take my necessities with me if you rent the entire place. I will leave plenty of room for your things including closet space. There are coin operated washers and dryers outside your lower level door for convenience. I furnish 8 clean sets of wash cloths and towels. I offer a stocked bar in the lower level with TV and sitting area for your at home convenience. If you decide to cook here you may use the available condiments. There is 2 keys to enter the premises. Outside key, middle door access key and a unit key. I only have 2 sets available. There will be a $20.00 charge per lost key. Depending on my schedule I will be accessible throughout your stay. If something is needed you will be able to call me anytime. I am just east of the sometimes chaotic main drag of downtown's party life. You have the convenience of it within a few blocks of walking
neighborhood_overview: I am just east of the sometimes chaotic main drag of downtown's party life. You have the convenience of it within a few blocks of walking, but just far enough to not have to deal with the after bar noise. I am located 5 blocks away from the Mill City district that has the beautiful Guthrie Theater and beautiful west river drive along the Mississippi, great for jogging, walking and biking, or even a picnic if desired. If you are here on business in the downtown Minneapolis area it is within walking distance. If you visit during our Winter season you can easily access our sky way system.
transit: You have an off street parking spot included in the rental. If you are in town on business you wont need a car rental, everything imaginable is a walk or a Lyft away. I am 3 blocks to the light rail that gives you access to Mall of America, St. Paul and the MSP International airport. Many fun stops along the way as well. I am also a professional driver on the side, I drive Lyft. As a guest we can arrange your pick up and drop off at the airport for a fair fee. I can also be your driver throughout your stay upon availability. I own a premium level Lincoln MKS.
