Work during the day and usually home by 7 PM. Occasionally will cook or walk to dinner/drinks after work. Weekends are free to hang out and bike around the town. Bikes are available. You can walk three blocks to the party scene on Lake Street or four blocks to the lakes and when you are at home you would never know you are in the heart of the city. Great places to bike to for brunch on the weekends. There is a bus stop one block away that will take you to downtown and the Midtown greenway for bike transit is only five blocks North. Tons of paved trails to run or bike all around the house. My wife's cat lives at the hous

name: Garden Studio Apartment close to Convention Center
description: Our garden-level studio is located in the quiet Steven Square neighborhood, steps from the Convention Center, and right on the edge of Downtown Minneapolis, blocks from Eat Street, the Minneapolis Institute of Art, Children's Theatre Company, and more. This cozy basement studio has it's own kitchenette, bathroom, and key-less entry from outside. This cozy space is located on the garden level of our historic cottage condo unit. We have setup this space especially with Airbnb guests in mind complete with everything you might need, whether you are here for a convention or just to visit! There is a double bed, plus a sofa bed. We way the unit can sleep up to 4 people, but please be aware that it is close quarters for four people. You will have your own private space, including the studio space with a double bed, desk space, TV, armchair, and clothing rack. The space is also stocked with books, games, and information about local attractions. In the kitchen, we have a microwave, fridge, sink
neighborhood_overview: Stephen's Square is a quiet neighborhood in the center of Minneapolis. We are a short walk or bus ride away from the convention center and downtown Minneapolis, many restaurants on Nicollet Avenue (known as Eat Street to locals), Loring Park, and the Minneapolis Institute of Art. We love living in Stephen's Square because it is close to everything and very easy to get around, but doesn't have all the late night noise of downtown. Some guests have told us it's a bit sketchy after dark, and while we understand the vibe, we both feel comfortable being out and about anytime of the day.
transit: We mostly walk since we are so close to downtown but we are close to several major bus routes and well as I-94 and I-35W. If you are driving, we have a dedicated parking space for your use as well. You cannot hail cabs in Minneapolis so we recommend Lyft for getting to places public transit cannot take you!

description: Close and convenient, located on the NE edge of downtown Minneapolis. Walk, bike, Lyft, Uber, cab or bus to dining, breweries, theater, museums, music, movies, nightlife, college and pro sports venues. A comfortable home in a quiet, old-fashioned neighborhood, nestled on Nicollet Island, the only inhabited island on the Mississippi River. Free parking for 2 cars. ALL are welcome. In addition to the private use of one queen bedroom and one full bathroom, guests can make themselves comfortable in all main floor areas, including kitchen, den, living and dining rooms and 1/2 bath. name: Our Urban Cabin
description: Welcome to our Urban Cabin!  It's a warm, friendly older home & we love it. 4 blocks from the light rail station with easy access to MSP airport, Mall of America, arts and sports venues, we are near lakes, parks, beaches, rinks, trails, & great dining options.  When you send us an inquiry or if you instant book, please tell us why you are coming, and include a little about yourselves and any other guests so we can tell if the Urban Cabin would be a good fit for you! A lovely place and location for any special occasion, but especially If you are looking for a quiet location to recover from the Superbowl excitement, check us out. Respectful and considerate guests are welcome. You can avoid parking charges since our Urban Cabin is only 4 blocks from the light rail station that take you directly to US Bank Stadium. Our lovely craftsman style home has beautiful woodwork, hardwood floors, and a built-in buffet. We stay here when we come to visit our sons and their families or attend concerts
neighborhood_overview: There are several great dining places, bakeries, and coffee shops nearby, some an easy walk away, others a short drive. Lakes Nokomis and Hiawatha have great walking/biking trails, seasonal beaches and skating rinks. Beautiful Minnehaha Falls is surrounded by a lovely park with picnic areas, trails and playgrounds and you can follow the Minnehaha creek trail all the way to the MIssissippi.
transit: The light rail station is 4 blocks away and many bus routes follow 42nd Street and Hiawatha Ave. Uber also has drivers in Minneapolis.

description: Artsy eclectic and fun.... totally Uptown! But in the higher-end Kenwood Area. This large apartment has  tons of space, windows and closets. Two large bedrooms and a living room with a pullout sofa. This is a third floor walk up apartment in one of THE prime locations in the twin cities.  This space is charming, funky and large. Lots of room to share with a roommate and have your own space.  Free laundry in the basement All of it I am available quickly via text or Airbnb messenger. If anything is needed I’ll answer right away or run it right over One of the most desirable neighborhoods in the twin cities. Up the hill from The Walker Art Museum ( cherry and spoon), this location is on the edge of Uptown and Downtown and easy major freeway hub access.  Hip Uptown is full of buzzy gastropubs and fashionable bistros, as well as stores and independent boutiques selling contemporary designer clothing, vintage garb, furnishings and locally made gifts. The classic Uptown Theatre screens indie
neighborhood_overview: One of the most desirable neighborhoods in the twin cities. Up the hill from The Walker Art Museum ( cherry and spoon), this location is on the edge of Uptown and Downtown and easy major freeway hub access.  Hip Uptown is full of buzzy gastropubs and fashionable bistros, as well as stores and independent boutiques selling contemporary designer clothing, vintage garb, furnishings and locally made gifts. The classic Uptown Theatre screens indie and foreign movies and has a bar.  Nearby, walking and cycling paths encircle Lake Calhoun and Lake of the Isles. Bike the Greenway Trail. Hop  a bus anywhere via the Uptown hub. Grab a short Uber downtown for nightlife such as First Ave . US Bank Stadium is 3 miles away! This home has it ALL!!  While you are close to all the nightlife, it is about 3 - 4 blocks away which keeps the neighborhood very quiet at night. You can go out to dinner or drinks and then come home to peace.

name: Luxury Alcove Apt Downtown
description: Live in the center of Minneapolis' vibrant downtown and Nicollet Mall and 5th street. The area is known for being a Warehouse District that is heavily populated with innovative restaurants, trendy entertainment experiences, and stylish boutiques. The converted warehouses contain design shops and the Minneapolis Farmers Market that sells locally made products such as produce, snacks, and candy.  You’re also only minutes away from the Mississippi River, where there are parks, bike trails, and other outdoor activities to enjoy.
transit: Getting around your destination couldn’t be easier! Minneapolis offers public transit through light rail and busing. Nice Ride, the non-profit bike-share program, is a great way to explore the city and its many parks. Given the popular location, Uber and Lyft are also easily accessible

neighborhood_overview: The Seward neighborhood in Minneapolis, Minnesota, U.S., is geographically southeast of downtown and defined by the triangle of land bordered by Hiawatha Avenue to the west, Minneapolis Midtown Greenway to the south, the Mississippi River to the east, and Interstate 94 to the north. Seward's bordering neighborhoods are Cooper to the Southeast, Longfellow to the South, East Phillips to the Southwest, Ventura Village to the West, Cedar-Riverside to the North, and Prospect Park/East River Road across the Mississippi River to the East. It is one of the neighborhoods that is part of the larger Longfellow community. Seward was named after former New York senator, governor, and US Secretary of State William H. Seward

description: Uptown Minneapolis renovated 1 BD apt w/in walking distance of all restaurants, shopping, bars & lakes! 1BD w/ king bed, brand new kitchen & bathroom. This is one unit you will have all to yourselves of a triplex/3 unit home. HOUSE TRAINED DOGS ONLY. $15 non-refundable dog fee for animals. Fee covers the entire duration of your stay. NO CATS. Completely updated kitchen and new bathroom and shower area. Brand new king bed and 60" tv. We have fiber optic internet that goes up to 100 mbps. The sofa does not pull out and can sleep one guest comfortably. Please let us know if you would like an extra set of sheets and comforter for the sofa when you book. Extra charges for laundry may apply.  There are tenants upstairs so if you hear footsteps, just know that people live up there but are respectful of that. We have a fireplace in the unit as you see in photos but it is not in working order and has been sealed. HOUSE TRAINED DOGS ONLY. $15 non-refundable dog fee for animals. Fee covers the en
neighborhood_overview: This is very vibrant and fun part of town. Uptown is generally the place where all the locals in Minneapolis like to visit or live by. There are so many great restaurants, bars and lakes near by that make uptown such a great neighborhood. The best part is that you can walk everywhere! CHECK OUT my guidebook for all our recommendations of where to eat and visit when your in town! Here are a couple below. Lake Calhoun, Lake of the Isles & Lake Harriet  These are the lakes that make Minneapolis and especially Uptown great. They are a short walk (3-5 min depending on the lake) from my location. They are all in a row, so you can walk around one after the other if you are so inclined. 2 of the 3 feature fun restaurants on the lake. Stella's Fish Cafe - Fun rooftop deck that will allow you to see the Minneapolis skyline. Mostly serving seafood. It's only a 2-3 min walk from my place. Most dishes are between $15-$30 Bar Louie - The closest restaurant to my place and is the newest spot in Uptow
transit: We live two block away from the Uptown bus station that can get you downtown Minneapolis within 10 minuets. We also live a block away from the Minneapolis Greenway, which is an AMAZING bike path that will take you all over the Twin Cities. Minneapolis is consistently ranked #1 in bike friendly cities and this is one of the main reasons why! There are numbers bike rental places within 2-3 blocks of my place that you can rent for under $10 per day. It's referred to as "Nice Ride". It's a great bike share program that the city. Our location is just under 12 miles from the airport which is in Bloomington, MN. Not a bad ride! You can take public transit from the airport. It requires a ride on the light rail and then bus. It's normally only $2.50 to do this. There is plenty of off street parking right in front of my place. If you are renting a car, you are going to be just fine!

neighborhood_overview: The Midtown/Central neighborhood is part of the larger Powderhorn Community. The Powderhorn Community is located approximately three miles south of downtown and is bordered by East Lake Street to the north, Cedar Avenue to the east, East 38th Street to the south, and 35W to the west. Its namesake is the city's Powderhorn Park facility in the northwestern part of the neighborhood around Powderhorn Lake, which contains playing fields, playgrounds and a park building that hosts community education classes ranging from pottery to yoga. In winter, a portable warming house is set up and the lake is used for ice skating. Developed mainly between 1900 and 1920, it is a residential area consisting of single-family homes, duplexes, and three-story brick apartment buildings. Approximately 9,000 people live in Powderhorn Park.
transit: Driving is easy and parking is free right in front and side of the house. If you aren't driving, taxis or Uber are readily available and Uptown or Downtown are a quick $7-8 ride. We are also 2 blocks from the bus lines that connect to the Metro Transit Light Rail Train. The light rail goes to/ from the airport, Mall of America and Downtown and connect to St. Paul. Minneapolis also has a bike share program called Nice Ride and a bike station is 3 blocks from our house. The bike lane runs in front of our house and 2 blocks from the greenway which connects to over 51 miles of paved trails that wrap around lakes and along parkways of the Grand Rounds Scenic Byway showcasing parks, gardens, historical sites, beaches, golf courses and diverse neighborhoods. Many trails offer separate paths for pedestrians and bikers/rollerbladers. During the winter months the Park Board keeps the bike paths plowed and sanded to be shared by walkers, runners, and bikers. name: 7 minutes to FIS Nordic Events and Theoworth Trail
description: Unit is super cozy,  thoroughly cleaned (duvet covers and ALL pillows; even decorative ones washed every new booking), and well equipped.    *Customized itineraries and personalized upgrades to unit available upon request with additional costs (i.e. reservations for dinner, special events, plays, limo, etc.   Additional touches in space if celebrating a special occasion; balloons, flowers, beverages, etc. as part of a Love Dove package unique to guests celebrating any milestone. Property suitable for kids 7 and up! Depending on the circumstances, and other bookings surrounding your stay, an early check in or late check out may be arranged. Have a special occasion coming up and want to add a romantic package to the booking? "Love Dove" offers intimate and customized packages to suit all kinds of special occasions couples are celebrating.  Great for anniversaries, V-day, birthdays, Newlyweds (honeymoon suite), Mother's Day, Father's Day, proposals, etc.  ANY reason is a GOOD reason to be
neighborhood_overview: This property is next to the walkable Bryn Mawr neighborhood and is truly a Minneapolis gem with a great coffee shop (Cuppa Java) and restaurant (La Mesa) in close proximity!  Minutes to, Lake of the Isles/Calhoun, downtown Minneapolis, the Sculpture Gardens, West End Outdoor Mall- with Movie Theatre, and lot's of awesome Restaurants. Accommodations include the upper level of our duplex. Private entrance and balcony, laundry in basement, plenty of on/off street parking. Next to the Bryn Mawr neighborhood; a quiet pocket on the outskirts of Downtown and Uptown.  Super convenient for events and adventures.  Bryn Mawr Meadows Parkway is the gateway to many trails to get all over.
transit: The property is close to a bus line that goes into downtown Mpls. (11 minutes total and your downtown, including a 4 minute walk from the property to Morgan Ave. and Glenwood Ave. N.).   Rent-a-bike station only 2 blocks.  Can rent a bike and drop off at any location throughout the cities. Also, same bus #9 will take you in the opposite direction to West End shopping center. 19 minutes total and you're there.  Great area; movie theatre, major grocery store -Cub Foods, lot's of restaurants, outdoor shopping, spa, Costco, LifeTime Fitness, etc. Short distance to many attractions and most places are a quick car hire service away.   Also, bike and running trails are an option for getting around the Uptown, Downtown, and West End area.

name: Large Two-Bedroom Unit in Northeast Arts District
description: Traditional Minneapolis home in the Northeast Arts District 8-minute drive to Downtown Minneapolis. We are right next to the Northeast Co-op, Fair State Brewery, and many cultural restaurants and a mile down the road from Betty Dangers!  We have two larger bedrooms, a family room with a full pullout couch, a full bathroom, and a kitchen/dining room that can seat 8. Our semi-finished basement is the perfect place to hang out with a large ping pong table, dartboard, beanbag toss, lazy-boys, etc. You are more than welcome to use our washer and dryer in the laundry room Guests are invited to use the TVs, game consoles (specifically encouraged to play Guitar Hero), the grill, and the parking spot in the back lot on the right. Will meet guests at check-in but remote check-in is always possible. Will be within 20 minutes from guests everyday after 5:00 pm on weekdays and will always be available by phone on weekends. Northeast Minneapolis is known for its craft beer scene with over a dozen br
neighborhood_overview: Northeast Minneapolis is known for its craft beer scene with over a dozen breweries calling the area home. Located a block away from Fair State Brewing Cooperative and a large number of restaurants and boutique stores.
transit: Conveniently located off of 3-minutes off of 35W.  Bus 10 stops across the street and goes directly to Nicollet Mall (in Downtown Minneapolis) in 20 minutes.

name: Bright Sunny in Winter
description: First floor apartment in Victorian Tri-plex is spacious, elegant, and comfortable. Airport is 16 minutes.  Powderhorn Park, directly across the street, provides a peaceful view out the picture window. Walk two blocks to Modern Times Cafe and Midtown Global Market Food Court/Brewery. Across the park, Mayday Cafe with on site baked goods and great coffee. Numerous other good restaurants nearby.  Fresh ground organic coffee and tea provided. This home built in 1905, has old world charm with original leaded and stain glass windows, chandeliers, oak woodwork and hardwood floors. Sunlight streams in through large windows on the south side. Full kitchen, dining room and living room, bathroom with shower and tub. The space is clean, well loved and well maintained. It has been my home for 26 years. Children 5 and up are welcome. Guests can use whole apartment, including laundry in the basement.  Laundry soap in basement that is labeled "air bnb" is for your use. Off limits are my work supplies
neighborhood_overview: Vibrant, friendly neighborhood. The Park, directly across the street is 65 acres with walking paths, cross country skiing, and a pond turned skating rink. They have free ice skates to borrow in the warming house and sledding down good hills. (I have a sled for you).  Centrally located, we are 20minutes from MSP airport and just minutes south of downtown Minneapolis. Many restaurants are within easy walking or easy distance. The Mayday Cafe, across the park, is a hub of the neighborhood and serves mouth watering baked goods, breakfast and lunch. Midtown Global Market/food court/ Brewery and Modern Times Cafe, a carnivore, vegetarian, and vegan restaurant are two blocks away.  Cafe Racer Kitchen, Seward Creamery Cafe, Rincon 38, Tiny Diner, Chef Shack Cafe, Colossal Cafe, Black Bird Cafe, Harriet Inn, Longfellow Bar and Grill, are just some of the places close by to enjoy a meal. If you like to cook, we have two food coops, Wedge and Seward. The Riverview is a fantastic renovated art-dec
transit: From the airport, you can take the light rail to the Hiawatha stop on Lake Street, walk across Lake Street, hop on the 21 bus which comes often, and get off bus on 10th Ave., walk 1 and a half blocks. YOU HAVE ARRIVED. Or take an Uber. Free, easy parking out front and in all the neighborhood. Two bus lines, the 5 and the 21 within two blocks, 21 bus connects with Light Rail.  Minneapolis hosts Car2Go, HourCar, Uber. Nice Ride MN for city-wide bike rentals.

name: Emil's Place Apt #2, Lowry Hill, near Downtown!!
description: 2 Bedroom Apartment.  Hardwood Floors, 1400 Sq. Ft., Remodeled Kitchen and Bath, In apartment laundry.  Includes off street parking space. 2 queen beds. Minneapolis Uptown neighborhood.  Night life, restaurants, bars.  This is still close to downtown (1 Mile).  Close to lakes, art museums and more. Unit 2 consists of the entire 2nd floor of this Tri-plex. We are in and out of the area. If needed, we are close-by. Lowry Hill Area of Minneapolis, Uptown! This location is close to Downtown Minneapolis and US Bank Stadium, Target Center, Target Field and the Minneapolis Convention Center. Sough-after location in Minneapolis. Public Transportation is very close... bus stop and bus route, taxi and uber just a quick and easy call away. Many things are in walking distance.

name: Happiness in Minneapolis~Near Eats, Stadium, Bars!
description: A Charming Interior with quirky decor make this space the perfect home away from home for your group :)  4 Bedrooms, 2 Full bathrooms, 2 Kitchens, and a spacious kitchen and dining area! Nestled in the Uptown neighborhood, near Eat Street , and 2 miles from Downtown Minne, this beautiful space is close to art, restaurants, public transportation, and highway access!  Historic and beautifully remodeled, you'll love the gorgeous woodwork, spacious living & dining area, and fun quirks! The large dining room and game room area is a unique part of the space-great for entertaining large groups. The antique fireplace, hardwood floors and beautiful built ins and buffet make the historic home charming and unique. Important to note-The hardwood floors are original to the home, and as a result do bend and warp in some areas. Those with accessibility issues may need to pay special mind, though guests have not had an issue I like to mention the older wood floors just in case :) This is a private res
neighborhood_overview: About a mile south of downtown Minneapolis, Uptown is where fashionably fit residents live, work and play. Here you'll find a high concentration of stylish homes, stores, bars and restaurants. The neighborhood borders beautiful Lake Calhoun, used by runners, cyclists and outdoor enthusiasts. This hip, vibrant area is home to late-night dining and an ever-growing nightlife scene along with movie theaters, shopping, coffee shops and more than 30,000 unique residents.
transit: Public Transportation is convenient and affordable in the area, and the house is only 2 blocks away from the nearest bus stop to the rest of the metro area. There is guest parking behind the house for 1 car.

name: Uptown Minneapolis Condo. Free Private Parking.
description: Located in the heart of uptown. Just a fifteen minute drive from MSP airport. A short walk from tons of amazing local bars and restaurants. A five minute drive or cheap Uber ride and you're in Downtown Minneapolis. Where there is always something going on no matter how cold it gets. There is private off street parking and washer/dryer access in the building. Great for families, groups of friends, couples getaways, business trips. Its a newly remodeled unit with a modern style. Unit has one queen bed and two full sized futon couches. In the unit you have access to a bedroom, living room, stocked kitchen, and bathroom. In the building there is access to a free washer/dryer. Located in Uptown just off Lyndale and Ridgewood ave. A block over from Franklin. It is a five minute walk from tons of great local bars, restaurants, co-ops that are located all along Lyndale. The Walker Art Center and the Sculpture Garden are also just a short walk. About a fifteen minute walk and you're in Uptown S
neighborhood_overview: Located in Uptown just off Lyndale and Ridgewood ave. A block over from Franklin. It is a five minute walk from tons of great local bars, restaurants, co-ops that are located all along Lyndale. The Walker Art Center and the Sculpture Garden are also just a short walk. About a fifteen minute walk and you're in Uptown Square where Lyndale and Lake street meet. Here there are more bars and restaurants as wells as shops and the beautiful Lake Bde Maka Ska. It is just a five minute drive to Downtown Minneapolis on the Lyndale or Franklin Ave to First Ave. Its also walk-able and will take about twenty five minutes.
transit: Very quick driving access to I-94 and 394. There is a bus stop half a block up on the corner of Franklin and Lyndale where you can hope on the 4 or the 6 and get to downtown in minutes. Buses to Target Field and Target Center can also be boarded here. There are also several express buses to the U of M. The 113 takes about 7 minutes to get there.

name: Comfy NE MPLS 1br apt, close to downtown
description: Spacious 1 bedroom apartment in historic triplex circa 1876. Located in the popular NE Minneapolis arts district. In close proximity to the cities best restaurants, breweries, and bars, minutes from downtown. Want to eat in?! fully loaded kitchen has everything you need to enjoy a meal at home. Cozy bedroom featuring a memory foam king size bed and workspace. The perfect place for weekend getaway or a business trip. This 143 year old Brick Beauty has stood the test of time and charm. Newly updated and cozy amenities, enjoy a relaxing time in NE Minneapolis. We live on the main level and also rent the unit across the hall as an airbnb unit! We strictly enforce our 10pm-8am quiet hours rule to ensure comfort for all guests. Still, this is an old house and you will hear some noise (footsteps, muffled conversation). If you’re noise sensitive, this might not be the best fit for you! We live on premise and are always happy to show up and give guests tips and recommendations for the neighborh
neighborhood_overview: The NE Minneapolis Arts District is one of the best neighborhoods in Minneapolis. Walking distance to a number of excellent breweries (Indeed, Bau Haus, Dangerous Man, Sociable Cider Werks, Tattersall Distilling...) and restaurants (Young Joni, Northeast Social, Anchor Fish and Chips...). Just 3 miles from everything Downtown Minneapolis has to offer (US Bank Stadium, Target Center, Minneapolis Convention center, First Ave., Guthrie Theater...) and easily accesses by bike, car, or bus.
transit: We recommend renting a car to get around MPLS quickly, but it is definitely do-able with public transport, too. Multiple bus routes within 2 blocks that will take you North, South, East or West. Lyft/Uber rates (depending on time of day): to/from the airport $26 to/from downtown Minneapolis $6-$15 to/from Saint Paul $10-$20

name: 2 Bedroom Condo - 2 Blocks from U.S. Bank Stadium!
description: Enjoy the modern, boho charm of this newly renovated condo in the heart Minneapolis. Condo is 2 blocks from U.S. Bank Stadium and within walking distance to many restaurants, bars, shops, museums, and parks!  MORE PHOTOS COMING AFTER RENOVATION IS FINISHED! The unit is newly renovated and is being finished up this week (painting walls and cabinets). It is beautifully decorated with boho, modern features making you feel right at home!! It features 2 bedrooms, both with queen beds. There is a living space with a full kitchen, living room, dining room, and work area. The unit features 3 TV's, one in the living room and one in each bedroom. Free WiFi throughout plus Sonos sytem music.  The building itself has a small workout room and beautiful rooftop patio with a view of the U.S. Bank Stadium and downtown skyline! There is no designated parking for guests, but the Fleet Farm parking ramp is across the street, and there is also street parking. Workout room and rooftop patio access is avail
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is home to many restaurants, grocery stores, bars, shops, parks, and museums - all within walking distance! The U.S. Bank Stadium is only 2 blocks away and the light rail is one block away. The light rail gives you access throughout the downtown area, MSP airport, Mall of America, and more!
transit: The area is within walking distance to many places in downtown. You can also use Lyft/Uber to get around, or the light rail is one block away. Light rail will give you access to the downtown area, MSP airport, Mall of America, and more!

name: Immaculate 2BR/2BA apartment in Minneapolis
description: Welcome to Minneapolis! Stay in this conveniently located 2BR/2BA apartment near Target Field, Minneapolis Convention Center, Target Center, US Bank Stadium and several theaters including the Guthrie and Orpheum. Settle in and enjoy the award winning North Loop neighborhood featuring several hip and trendy restaurants and shops. Catch a ride on the light rail, or stroll the beautiful Mississippi River. This unit is perfect for the business traveler, sports fan, theater buff, foodie or shopper. Enjoy a comfy seat in the living room, or pull up a stool to the kitchen for a drink. Guests have access to the pool and gym at the Marriott next door for people looking for something more active. Guests have access to several amenities shared with the Marriott hotel next door such as an outdoor swimming pool (seasonal), billiards room, executive business center, fitness center, snack bar, and conference room. The Marriott also provides luggage holding services if needed before or after check in/
neighborhood_overview: Great part of downtown Minneapolis close to restaurants, bars, sporting venues and much more. Just a couple blocks from Acme Comedy Club and Target Field, and one mile from US Bank Stadium. Many things to do within walking distance or a short Uber ride.
transit: Walk Score = 88 out of 100 Transit Score = 87 out of 100 Bike Score = 97 out of 100 This apartment is an eight minute walk from the Blue METRO Blue Line and the Green METRO Green Line at the Target Field Station & Platform 2 stop.

name: SUPERBOWL Quite Area 15min From US Bank Stadium
description: Classic split level entry home 15 minute drive from US Bank Stadium. 3 Bedrooms, 2 Bathrooms, remodeled Kitchen, updated bedrooms and Sauna.  4 Blocks away from  a Metro Transit Bus Route 4 stop - Which will take you right to downtown Minneapolis. Our space is lived in, not everything is perfect - the bathroom tub faucet leaks a bit and the other usual house quirks -but we'll think you'll find it a nice place to stay, relax, or go on big city adventures. My wife and I moved in the Summer of 2017 and have been busy renovating and updating. We travel from time to time and would love to have you stay at our place when we're not.  Parking:  There is a concrete driveway in front of the house with room for 2 cars. There's a 2nd driveway around the corner (on the West side of the house) with room for 3 cars. You can park on which ]ever is more convenient for you.  There is plenty of on street parking. We do get snow here - if your stay is Nov 1st to April 30th please do not park on the street
neighborhood_overview: Located in a quiet first ring Suburban Neighborhood, there is a park 1/2 block south with a large sledding hill. Silver Lake is to the North and the North side of the lake has a beach and 2 parks. There is an additional park that has an Ice skating rink 4 blocks to the West.  A Cub Foods Grocery Store is located 0.6 miles away, along with other local restaurants and shopping.
transit: If you have a car or rental car our place has plenty of off-street parking for you to use. There are public bus routes a bus stop as near as 1 block from the house. And of course services like Uber, Lyft, and other local Taxis services.

name: Cozy Artist’s Abode, ENTIRE Home-Wifi,NetFlix +
description: Make my home your homebase while you check out all that Minneapolis has to offer.  My home is in a prime part of NE Mpls!  Home to eclectic artists, lots of new craft breweries & pub crawls, ethnic eating strip, retro shops, cafes, live music, parks ! Location Location! Quick drive to downtown, U of M area, and all the major freeways that connect the city, very centrally located, and a comfortable place to lay your head between activities. This is a duplex house with a FULL kitchen, bathroom, living room, sunroom/office, and great backyard garden - not just a room, or apartment in an apartment building.   Plus, I check out when you check in, so you have the place to yourself (some listings on Airbnb are more roommate scenarios).     One of the best things about the house is that it's located, very conveniently between Mpls and St. Paul - A few miles from the U of M and just 5 minutes from downtown Minneapolis!  Freeway entrance is just a couple blocks away. One block from a major bus r
neighborhood_overview: The area:       Welcome to NE Minneapolis! Coming to town to tour our incredible NE Minneapolis breweries? Or for theater, farmers markets, or our great local Arts events? A business convention?  Or to visit nearby relatives? NE Minneapolis is a convenient, centrally located, yet safe, residential spot for your homebase. It's artsy, quaint, and full of neighborhood bars and restaurants, many of them with acclaimed chefs and locally raised ingredients!  Pub crawls are very popular in NE because it's so easy to walk from one bar to the next, and each has its own individual flavor. :)  My house happens to be just over a century old, though you wouldn't know it from looking at it, it does retain some of that great old character. The neighborhood is all residential with sidewalks, though a short, 1.5 block walk to restaurants and major grocery store, Target, etc.  There is a large park with wading pool, tennis courts, soccer/ice skating just one block from the house. Freeway entrances are o
transit: There is a major bus route 1 block from the house and a very handy website for metro transit to help you plan your route. Also, close by are Nice Ride bikes available for rental. The light rail line is ever expanding and will get you quickly to the airport, downtown, or Mall of America area.. and now to St. Paul too!

name: Walk to the Stadiums, up to 11 guests!
description: Close enough to walk to the US Bank and Target Field Stadiums, Target Center, Convention Center, First Ave, Armory, Orchestra Hall, etc! Our beautifully renovated, turn-of-the-century home on Elliot Ave is only 10 blocks from the center of downtown Minneapolis. Off-street parking available for up to six vehicles. We have lived in this home for 39 years, raising and launching our family of 6 children. Our home consists of 4 levels. The basement houses Steller Handcrafted Goods. There are three private entrances and a beautiful lofted deck off the kitchen, hardwood floors and a bright, cozy atmosphere throughout. The upper two levels are for our guests. Our guests will have access to the entire upper duplex, including full use of the kitchen and the laundry. There is a kennel area for your dog to be let out through the kitchen door. High-speed internet and cable TV are also available. We would love to answer any questions you may have and are looking forward to welcoming you to Minneapol
neighborhood_overview: Our home is on Elliot Ave near E 15th St, just 6 blocks from the US Bank Stadium, the Minneapolis Convention Center, downtown shopping and restaurants, and the light rail which will take you to and from the Mall of America, downtown St. Paul, and the airport.
transit: An experienced Lyft driver with his seven passenger fully loaded Town and Country van will be living downstairs and may be available for some of your transportation needs. For easy access to Mall of America, MSP International Airport, and downtown St. Paul, the US Bank Stadium light rail stop is a twelve minute walk from our house. MTC bus stops are a block away.

name: Northeast Minneapolis Apartment Close to Downtown
description: This is the perfect place for your trip to the Twin Cities! Only 8 minutes away from  Downtown Minneapolis. Also located near a strip mall including a grocery store and Target for anything you need while in town. The apartment is cozy with nice furniture and privacy. Private and free parking is included along with laundry service. You'll love the style and friendly touches throughout the apartment that make you feel at home while you stay here. The space is friendly and welcoming. The neighborhood is perfect for those looking to see the sights and experience the city. However, it is also near family homes and not too busy, making it the perfect combination of convenient and comfortable. Our apartment is close to many different restaurant and local brewerys. Downtown is only 10 minutes away and there are bus stops in front of our apartment making travel easy. We will clean all dishes you leave and take out the trash. Internet is included along with Apple TV that provides Netflix and Hul

There are parks nearby as well as friendly biking streets for the guest that is active. There is also a strip mall within walking distance that includes a Target and a grocery store. Lastly, the highway is close for ease of travel from the home.
transit: There are bus stops in front of the apartment as well as nearby that will lead you anywhere in the cities. Highways are also close making travel easy. Northeast is also a friendly neighborhood to park in if you are driving around the neighborhood.

name: Charming home - single bed -in S. Minneapolis
description: We are conviently located close to bus stop and light rail which you can take directly from airport to within a 15 minute walk of our home.   Perfect for the business traveller or single visitor. Ours is a cozy home  built in 1911 with beautiful oak woodwork and trim. Relaxing with easy access to both downtown Minneapolis and St. Paul. There are stairs both outside and inside the home.  On street parking is available.  Rental bikes also available. This bedroom accommodates a single person. We have limited closet space for hanging some items and a small dresser in the room.  Guests can use the kitchen for morning coffee which will be provided for guests. We are also close to many coffee shop options as well as excellent restaurants. Kitchen - use of shared kitchen if desired- please treat as shared space by keeping area clean. All food and drink MUST stay in kitchen area.  Bathroom - we offer a claw foot tub for bathing, no shower;  guest use. You can knock on basement door or text if y
neighborhood_overview: Our Longfellow neighborhood is quiet and family oriented with access to many good restaurants, coffee shops and a great bookstore, bike shops, post office and grocery stores all within walking distance. Very good public transportation to both downtowns.
transit: From airport you can either rent a car, take the light rail or taxi. By car we are 20 minutes max from the airport if traffic is light. Once here, you are close to a great choice of good restaurants, coffee shops and grocery stores. It is a 15 minute walk to the light rail station or a 10 minute walk to a bus stop where you can then transfer to the light rail to get downtown or to the airport or MOA.

name: Large bedroom by LightRail, Airport & Downtown
description: Just a short walk from the 46th St Blue Line light rail station and down the street from Minnehaha Creek, this space offers a beautiful blend of urban and nature retreats. 15 minute light rail rides from the Downtown scene and the airport, a short walk away from gorgeous lakes, trails, and Minnehaha Falls, as well as great shops & restaurants. This Airbnb is perfect for guests that want a home base for spending a few days in the city (in a quiet, residential neighborhood!) Guests will have access to the basement level (accessed through the side door) which has a private bedroom with a lock, as well a large shared space with a living space, dining room table, mini fridge, and coffee/tea station. There is also a shared bathroom, which is also accessible for the second private bedroom. If you are interested in booking both bedrooms for larger groups, please send a message for a discounted price, as long as the second bedroom is available. The Airbnb is in our basement. Though we may go in
neighborhood_overview: Our location is within a mile of great neighborhood spots such as Buster’s on 28th, Al Vento, Town Hall Lanes, Bull’s Horn, Sea Salt, A Baker’s Wife, Venn Brewing Company, Angry Catfish, Dominguez Family, Sassy spoon, and the list goes on. There is a brand new “fancy” Cub Foods grocery store that’s an 8 minute walk away. We are half a block from Minnehaha Creek and its amazing bike/walking trails that connect Minnehaha falls and the rest of the south Minneapolis lakes with continuous paths to Lake Nokomis, Harriet, Bde Maka Ska, Isles, etc. in the Minneapolis Grand Rounds.
transit: The residence is seven minutes from the 46th Street Station of the Blue Line light rail, a major transit hub for Minneapolis and St. Paul. Our Twin Cities are not necessarily known for their Mass Transit system, but this location has direct connections to an incredible number of locations. There are the obvious connections on the Blue Line light rail to downtown Minneapolis (15 minutes), the MSP airport (10 mins), and Mall of America (20 mins).  Additionally, there is a direct bus line to downtown St. Paul and the Xcel Energy Center (30 mins - route 74), to the new Allianz Field, home of MN United FC (25 minutes - A Line - take this route, not two trains, it’s faster!!!) and the 50th and France neighborhood (25 mins - route 46). The MN state fairgrounds are 30 minutes away from the station further down the A Line rapid bus route!

name: Historic 1920s Duplex - Upper Level
description: Entire upper level duplex in the heart of the Chain of Lakes! Safe and historic neighborhood. Only a few minutes to Lake Harriett! Beautiful built-ins, fireplace, shared patio/grill, 2 bedrooms, private dining room, kitchen, and living room. Convenience store is one block away. Rose Garden, Bandshell, beach and Minnehaha Creek nearby. 5 minutes to Uptown. Ten minutes from Downtown Minneapolis. Twenty minutes to MSP Airport. Clean and tidy. All bedding washed regularly! Spaces are shared. I am okay with events but ask guests to share details before their stay. I always respond within 24 hours if messaged on Airbnb. I am okay with texts or calls as well if anything comes up during your visit. Kingfield neighborhood. Close to Lake Harriett. Local landmarks include St. Luke's Episcopal Church, Guse Grocer/Hardware. 2 miles to uptown. 5 miles to downtown. Uber, Lyft, and scooters are available. I highly recommend the 2 minute walk to Lake Harriett.

description: Newly remodeled condo.  Centrally located in downtown Minneapolis.  Close to everything, building connected to the skyway. The space is cozy with a full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, living room, and 2 bedrooms. The bedrooms are apart from each other, making it ideal for two roommates to share. The building has lot's of great amenities including an outdoor pool, hot tub and sauna, amazing views of the city, nice gym, and central to all the happening events in the Twin Cities. The condo is 4 blocks from US Bank Stadium. Also just blocks away from the Armory, The Commons Park, the Guthrie Theater, Stone Arch bridge, Hennepin Ave, Nicollet Ave, and Government Plaza Light Rail station. description: New walkout basement apartment remodel with gas fireplace, heated bath and pantry floors, walk thru shower,cork floors,french doors,washer/dryer,and custom cabinets in open-concept kitchen. Bedroom has queen Tempur-pedic bed and great light. Huge private patio with green space. Easy access to freeways in this safe neighborhood. Fully furnished with all the necessities make it perfect for the weekly business commuter. Your space is fully private with no entrance other than your own keyless entry. The circular floor plan makes the space flow beautifully, every room has two entry/exit points.  The large kitchen with french doors, is the heart and focal point of the space with its large center island and Lem piston stools, it's easy to work at, cook at or use for entertaining. It's a 'cool' space with central air that's rarely needed but when you do, it's there.  Rather be outside? name: Central location!! dwntwn MPLS, uptwn, MOA, MSP
description: My place is close to restaurants and dining, nightlife, and public transport. You’ll love my place because of the comfy beds and cute decor, the natural light, the outdoors space, and being so centrally located to everything Minneapolis has to offer. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).Also an awesome space for large groups visiting the city. Stroll 2 blocks South on Nicollet and eat at some of the best restaurants in the city! 4 bedrooms on the upper level. One Extra Large bedroom, two average/spacious bedrooms and one small bedroom/office. There are also 2 living rooms on the main floor each with a hide-a-bed couch, with pocket doors that can be closed for privacy and this can be used as a 5th bedroom.  Bathrooms and kitchen are all recently remodeled. 0.5 bathroom on main floor is toilet and sink. Upstairs bathroom has a  toilet, double vanity ( 2 sinks) and a full shower/tub.  Goregeous wrap around porch and stone patio for e
neighborhood_overview: Located 2.5 miles from The US bank football stadium! 8 Minute drive from Mall of America and 12 minute drive to MSP airport. You are right in the city and along with that comes traffic and some noise from traffic- which being a city girl I never notice, and some people of color, the occassional siren ( several of the best hospitals are located within a few miles of the house.) I find that adventurous people, open minded, cultured, and people that love good food and traveling by foot tend to love my neighborhood. I also find that people in their 20s-30s especially enjoy it. It is up and coming.  Some families find it too busy for their needs so I like to throw that out as a disclaimer. We both win when the right guests stay! Located in the Lyndale neighborhood of Minneapolis. You can't get more central than this. Walk, bike, or a short drive for all of your needs. Within 5 blocks there are several very popular restaurants and bars. If you expand that to a mile radius there are even more
transit: Check out Metro Transit information online. Take the 18 North bus directly downtown. The bus stop is located less than 2 blocks away at the intersection of Nicollet Ave S & 33rd St E.

name: Cute home for Fun in hip NE Minneapolis
description: This is the ideal location for your Minneapolis adventure! The entire 900 Sq Ft main level for rent. This home is close to everything. Located close to downtown in the vibrant Northeast neighborhood of Minneapolis this home is recently remodeled & full of local and original art. This is a warm, comfortable, fun space. A walk-able neighborhood, Northeast is known for it's nightlife, arts community, bars, and breweries and nationally-rated restaurants. Enjoy! This house has been updated for comfort! New windows, door, water heater, new furnace, new roof and new bathroom all within the past 3 years.  Seasonal weather in Minnesota is no joke!  Don’t get stuck in a cold, hot, damp, or drafty space. You will have access to the entire home, with the exception of an unfinished basement and attic level. I will have the home cleaned before your arrival and fresh linens will be provided for all of the beds. Extra blankets and pillows available. I want you to have the experience that YOU desire. L

Within a short walking distance to many great destinations including parks, trails, restaurants, Co-op grocery, bakeries, breweries, a distillery, drugstore etc. My home is in a quiet, tree-lined neighborhood, just a couple blocks from the action.  My neighborhood is relatively quiet, however this is still the city! Box fans provided in each bedroom for nighttime white noise.
transit: Less than 10 miles to Minneapolis/St. Paul airports. This house is 3 miles to downtown Minneapolis and US Bank stadium. Off street parking in the driveway and ample free street parking. We have great bike/ hike walking trails here!

name: S. Tyrol Hills cottage - minutes from downtown.
description: Cozy bedroom with a queen size bed & private bathroom. Full access to a large kitchen, spacious great-room, sun-room & basement entertainment center with pool table. 1 block to bus line & 1/2 mile to Cedar Lake Trail for running & biking. Arts & Crafts designed home built in 2002 with spacious great room, sun room, kitchen, entertainment area & out door patio. 3800/sf of living space. Access to kitchen, great room, sun-room and down stairs entertainment area with pool-table. On-site parking in the driveway. I will be available 24/7 via text or at my home during your entire stay, and will tailor our interaction to suit your wishes. name: Private Room Near Light Rail in South Minneapolis
description: Welcome to our home! We are an educator and an engineer who are new homeowners in Minneapolis. We own a duplex in the beautiful Standish neighborhood and we live in the 2nd floor apartment. We are excited to offer guests a private bedroom and shared bathroom, kitchen, and living room. Our home is  within walking distance to Lake Hiawatha, several bars and restaurants, and the light rail. This is a great location with easy access to all the Twin Cities has to offer! Dog lovers only! :) We offer guests a private bedroom with a desk, TV, and full size sofa sleeper. The sofa sleeper can be easily changed from bed to couch and back again, allowing you to enjoy your space as a bedroom or as your own private living room if you prefer to lounge on a couch and watch TV, read, etc.  A shared bathroom and kitchen are located just outside of the private room and open to guests. We also have designated spaces in the kitchen for you to keep your food. In addition, the dining room and living room are
neighborhood_overview: Standish is a beautiful, walkable neighborhood in the heart of South Minneapolis. There are a variety of bars and restaurants within walking distance of our home. Here are some gems within half a mile walking: Colossal Cafe (located just across the street!), Sisters' Sludge Coffee Cafe & Wine Bar, Northbound Smokehouse Brewpub, Ted Cook's 19th Hole BBQ, Cardinal Restaurant & Bar (includes darts & pool!), Keen Eye Coffee, A Cupcake Social, Chatterbox Pub.  Another thing that makes our neighborhood unique is its proximity to so much beautiful nature. If you are a runner, walker, or cyclist, then this is the neighborhood for you! We are just half a mile north of Lake Hiawatha, which has a beautiful green space, tennis courts, small beach, and running/biking trails. Lake Nokomis is just south of Lake Hiawatha (~1.5 miles walking from our home), so you can easily access the green space and paths at Lake Nokomis as well. Minnehaha Creek and its accompanying trail are located just between the
transit: Our home is a 10 minute walk to the Light Rail, where you can hop on the Blue Line and quickly get to downtown Minneapolis (~8 min), Minnehaha Falls (~4 min), and Mall of America (~22 min). The Light Rail stops directly at US Bank Stadium and Target field, which means you won't have to worry about parking or traffic!

description: Walking distance to the Super Bowl!  This gorgeous two-story home is the perfect space for your Super Bowl adventure!  You'll be walking distance to US Bank Stadium, downtown, uptown, bars, restaurants, music, and nightlife. Or catch the high frequency bus (every 5 min) that picks up on the corner and takes you directly downtown. You'll love the modern feel and enjoy the comfort of home. Brand new Queen memory foam beds provide the ultimate in comfort. This apartment has two bedrooms with queen size memory foam beds, and a futon to sleep 5 comfortably. A high quality, queen size, double thick air mattress can be added to accommodate additional guests. Uptown is the heart and soul of Minneapolis with restaurants, shops, art, nightlife, and, of course, our famous lakes! Here's just a small sampling of what you'll find. Lake of the Isles: only .5 miles away is gorgeous Lake of the Isles surrounded by multi-million dollar homes that are amazing to check out! Lake Calhoun: 1.5 miles away (a
neighborhood_overview: East Isles is THE place to be. You'll be steps away from restaurants, nightlife, and one of our most celebrated lakes, plus right on the bus line for easy access downtown or anywhere in the cities. Check out the Luminary Loppet the day before the game when Minnesotans flock to the lake to see hundreds of ice sculptures and luminaria right on the lake! It's like a neighborhood block party with cross country skiers next to families with strollers walking the lake to see it in all its splendor.
transit: The 6 and 17 buses pick up right on the corner and take you directly downtown.

We live just across the street. We’re available to respond to questions and offer suggestions, but we will let you enjoy and explore our great neighborhood and city on your own. If you enjoy craft beer, we can direct you to several of our favorite nearby taprooms! You’ll be in one of St Paul’s most charming residential neighborhoods. description: BRAND NEW Mid-Century Modern styled private guest house at the back of our completely renovated 1910 Craftsman home. Don't confuse this with the numerous nearby old apartments hastily converted to airbnb rentals. This space was designed and outfitted specifically as a vacation rental. Lake of the Isles is the premier location in Uptown, Minneapolis - within walking distance to everything you'll need, and just 1.5 miles South of downtown. Isles Inn Uptown is a completely private separate space! Unlike the numerous nearby older apartments converted to airbnb's, this completely private guest house was just completed and designed specifically as a vacation rental. Located in the trendy Uptown Minneapolis Lake of the Isles area, you're within walking distance to everything Uptown has to offer! This is a completely separate and private 800SF 1 Bedroom, 2 Bath home, complete with full kitchen, cozy gas fireplace, Master Bedroom with Queen bed, Queen sofa-sleeper in the living room,  free wash
neighborhood_overview: East Isles is a beautiful neighborhood located on the East side of Lake of the Isles, full of incredible architecture, award-winning restaurants, shopping, groceries, pharmacy's, banks, public transportation, and so much more, all within a short walk from Isles Inn Uptown.  This area is a walker's paradise with walking and biking paths all around Lake of the Isles, Bde Maka Ska (formerly Lake Calhoun) and Lake Harriet.
transit: We offer plenty of free overnight parking on both Humboldt Ave S and W 24th Street. The Metro Transit bus stop is just 3 short blocks away at Hennepin Ave S and W 24th Street.

name: Two bedroom unit on the best street in the city!
description: Cozy two bedroom bottom unit of duplex located in booming Uptown Minneapolis neighborhood! Short drive Downtown. Tons of restaurants and bars nearby, the closest being historic Mortimers bar/music venue right out the back door, servicing brunch on the weekends and a kitchen open until 1A.M. every night. The perfect spot to crash for friends/couples looking for a night on the town. DISCLAIMER: It can be a bit loud as we are both next to a bar and on a busy street!! Two bedrooms, both Queen sized beds. Futon and small couch in the living room. I listed it as sleeping 5, although this is under the assumption both beds would sleep two. Best fit for a group between 2-6. Very clean, well lit space. All of the art is part of a found antique collection from the previous owner of the bar next door! My name is Jakob, and I work and live in the neighborhood. I have close relationships with many of the bars and restaurants in the neighborhood, and have tons of recommendations on where to go and wh
neighborhood_overview: Great restaurants and bars (Nightingale, Mortimers, Tilt) whether you're more interested in fine dining or dive barring, boutique shopping (Cliche, Proper & Prim, Pharmacie), secondhand shopping (Buffalo Exchange, B. Resale) the Wedge Co-Op grocery store on the same block. 24 hour convenience store a block away. A nice walk to a modern museum, The Walker Art Center, and a short drive to the Minneapolis Institute of Art.
transit: Right on the 2 and 4 bus routes. Uber and Lyft drivers are almost never more than a couple minutes away. That being said, Lyndale can be a fun street to walk down.

name: Ideal Downtown Spot for your Mini-Apple Getaway
description: Whether you’re in town to catch a game, watch a play, visit family, or just check out one of the US’ most exciting cities, you couldn’t ask for a better place to call home during your stay! This spot puts you right in the middle of all the action. Avoid the weather by traveling the Skyway to explore shopping, dining and entertainment options galore! Plus, as a guest at this Downtown West high-rise, you’ll have access to all kinds of amenities, including roof deck, pool and sauna. We think you’ll fall in love and never want to leave! Up to four guests will sleep comfortably each night in this one-bedroom, 667-square foot apartment that comes with a queen-size bed and a pull-out sofa that sleeps two. Once you step foot inside your high-end kitchen that’s outfitted with stainless steel appliances and granite countertops, you’ll never want to leave. Your apartment also includes a modern bathroom that features a Kraus Rain showerhead complete with a hand massager. With a dishwasher, washer-
neighborhood_overview: Downtown West (aka The Central Business District) makes up the skyscraper dominated skyline of Minneapolis.  But don’t let the association with work fool you – this is the *center of fun and nightlife* in the Mini-Apple – with 3 stadiums, a district for professional theaters, nightly live-music venues, sophisticated steakhouses, new American restaurants, and enough retail to shop-til-you-drop, all within walking distance – you can’t beat this location!    Minneapolis is known for its Skyway: 9 miles of elevated, climate controlled, enclosed walkways (the largest in the world!). With entrances all over downtown, including right here, once you arrive you don’t have to deal with subzero temps or hot humidity.  Just around the block you’ll find… - AT&T Tower (1/2 block) - Minnesota Orchestra (1/2 block) - Dakota’s Jazz Club (1 block) - Starbucks / Caribou Coffee (1 block) - Minneapolis Convention Center (3 blocks) - IDS Center (2 blocks) - Pantages Theater (2 blocks) - Univ. of St Thomas /
transit: No car required! This location has a WalkScore of 97/100! And when the weather is too cold or too hot, enjoy the convenience of the Skyway – a unique mode of travel in Minneapolis that covers 80 city blocks and connects you to all your downtown destinations.  When the weather’s dreamy, get around smoothly on a ‘cycle with Nice Ride Bikeshare System (download the app) and 92 miles of city bike ways. Metro Transit (check out their website) has bus and light rail connections that will get you around the city, between here and Saint Paul (Twin City!), and the suburbs. If you like the convenience of a car, Zipcar operates in Minneapolis; and Lyft/Uber and Taxi’s are just minutes away.

name: Quaint room in cozy duplex, heart of Powderhorn!
description: Private bedroom, double bed in main level of a duplex just a block away from Powderhorn Park. Enjoy a spacious common area, cozy for reading, games, or yoga. We’re a couple blocks from the popular and vibrant Global Market, and a stones throw from the bus stop! Also within 1 and 2 miles of Abbot Northwestern and HCMC, and a 35 minute bus ride to the U of M. Welcome! Guests have a full sized bedroom, a shared common area, with a fully equipped kitchen and common area. Coffee provided! A deck in the back is cozy for a cup of coffee or a glass of wine during warm months! Guest has access to the full main level apartment, first level deck, and basement laundry facilities. We are available with messaging, and if desired, could often meet guests at the apartment, as we live close by! You may share this apartment with another guest, and you may see us in and out for cleaning:) We are a block away from Powderhorn Park where you can enjoy a walk around the pond in a city. The Park has wonderful
neighborhood_overview: We are a block away from Powderhorn Park where you can enjoy a walk around the pond in a city. The Park has wonderful play areas for kids as well as hosts events in warm months, most notably May Day festival. We are a couple blocks from Midtown Global market with great food, music and shops. A couple blocks off the bus line makes an easy direct bus ride north to Downtown for football games or concerts, or South to the Mall of America  and the airport. We are located less than a mile from Abbot Northwestern, and about a mile from HCMC for residents or medical/nursing students. About 5 miles and a 30 minutes bus ride to the U of M for many students!
transit: Walking and biking in warmer months is very easy to various restaurants, parks and theater. Bus rides are easy and direct to both downtown and the Mall of America. Our place is in South/Central Minneapolis and Uber/Lyft rides are also short and cheap. For those who have a car, we have an off street parking spot for you!

name: 1903 Queen Anne Beauty-ask about summer specials!
description: Come experience neighborhood living in quirky Bywater.  Legally registered, owner-occupied, lovingly preserved  1903 Queen Anne Victorian built by ship's captain with room for up to 7 guests.  Minutes away from Frenchman St., French Quarter and other major attractions.  Check out GO NOLA for information on our neighborhood. Three bedrooms, two separate full baths plus 1/2 bath downstairs.  Bedrooms feature one queen-size (burgundy bedroom), one king or two twin beds (yellow/blue bedroom) and one twin and one full bed in the library/crafts room.  Two roll-away beds available. Master bath has walk-in shower, separate soaking tub.  Two full living rooms provide space for relaxing and connecting with friends and loved ones.  Full kitchen, wi-fi access and office working space. Bikes may be available and it's an easy bike to the French Quarter.  Please note:  discounts available for stays over 5 days.  Please contact for special pricing.  Also, rates quoted are for up to 5 people.  If you p
neighborhood_overview: Bywater is a walkable neighborhood where we cherish a diverse community of artists, writers, creators and neighbors.  Home is only blocks away from neighborhood watering holes and wine venue that feature music Interesting and growing food scene including The Joint (BBQ), Elizabeth's (breakfast, lunch and dinner) among others.  For more information about the neighborhood, check out GO NOLA  For a tongue in cheek introduction to New Orleans, a la "Portlandia", check out webisodes of "Sunken City" on YouTube.
transit: The home is located 1/2 block off of public bus line, but better yet, hop on a bike and explore the Marigny, French Quarter, Uptown and City Park with freedom and ease.  We have a Blue Bike Share 1/2 block away with plenty of racks available at local and tourist-friendly spots around the city. New Orleans is bike-friendly with  designated lanes and relatively flat streets. Cabs are plentiful and inexpensive and Uber has become popular.  For those who enjoy a good walk to the French Quarter, take Bartholowmew Street up to the river and walk along Crescent City park and enjoy the river and view as you arrive at the French Quarter.

name: Historic New Orleans Bienville Guest Room
description: Beautiful private bedroom & bath nestled in historic Mid-City New Orleans! Explore the city easily by foot or streetcar. Only 2 blocks to Canal Street car, Lafitte Greenway Park & Pool, Whole Foods, Beaucoup Eats, Dollar General, Waffle house, Betsy's Pancakes and Iberia bank. Walk to Dooky Chase, Gabrielle, Neyow's, Bayou Beer & Wine Garden, French Quarter, Downtown & Bayou St John. Roku YoutubeTV and WIFI. Blue bikes available. Mardi Gras parades, just 2 blocks to Endymion! 19STR-07482 Great quiet central location. 8 minute Streetcar ride to the French Quarter/Downtown. Streetcars also go to City Park, Riverwalk, Garden district and  Marigny. Streetcar passes every 5- 10 minutes. 2 minutes to downtown by car. The free public pool is a couple blocks away at the Lafitte Greenway park. The Greenway connects the French Quarter to Bayou St John and City Park. Join us for our Endymion parade party. Walk to the parades, the French Quarter and Downtown! Full size air mattress also available.
neighborhood_overview: The home is located on Historic Bienville Street Mid City- home to 100s of restaurants. A short walk to Bayou St John, the St Louis Cemetery, Treme  Neighborhood, French Quarter and Downtown. The street car gives you almost 24 hour access to everything New Orleans has to offer including City Park, the French Quarter, the Garden District and to Downtown Superdome and Smoothie King Center.
transit: This location let's you explore New Orleans easily on foot or by bus or streetcar. 2 blocks from the Canal Street car, Lafitte Greenway Park, Whole foods and Dollar General. Waffle house and Betsy's Pancake House are within 2 blocks. Great restaurants- Dooky Chase, Gabrielle Restaurant, Neyow's Creole Café, Piece of Meat, Marjie's Grill, Fharmacy Nola and Bayou Beer Garden are also minutes away.

name: Private Suite/Bath Overlooking Courtyard In Treme
description: Monrose Row is a three-story Greek revival townhouse built in 1839, with attached slave quarters and a most charming courtyard.  Located in the historic Treme neighborhood,  two blocks outside the French Quarter. The Bed and Breakfast is walkable to all downtown venues, and only a ten minute walk to Frenchman Street.  This private two room suite with bath overlooking the courtyard has a two night minimum stay which includes a full breakfast and daily maid service. This two room suite is on the second floor of the slave quarters overlooking the courtyard. It includes a private bath with shower, self-controlled central air and heat, as well as wifi.  Part of a group of three, three story Greek Revival row houses, Monrose Row was begun in 1839 for Charles Monrose. Monrose, who had a bakery and residence on Bourbon Street until 1838, moved to the corner building, the first of his planned row, opening his business in 1839. Later that same year, Monrose's creditors held public auction and he
neighborhood_overview: We are located two blocks from the French Quarter in the Faubourg Treme. Walkable to all downtown venues, only a 10 minute walk to Frenchman Street.
transit: Parking is on street, regular neighborhood parking - no loading zones or parking meters. We are two blocks from the Rampart Street streetcar.

name: 3 blocks from the St. Charles streetcar!
description: Our newly renovated apartment is right in the middle of town, within walking distance of Magazine St. and just on the edge of the Garden District. Plus, it's just 3 blocks from the streetcar and St. Charles Ave. Please be our guest in the newly renovated apartment situated at the back of our really old (1850s), charmingly-dilapidated house. It’s just a couple blocks from the parade route/street car/St. Charles, and only about a mile from the Superdome.  They don’t call it Central City for nothing! Walk past the main house, down a winding brick pathway, and up the stairs to the private entrance. You enter into the kitchen, with concrete countertops, old wood floors, and plenty of sunlight pouring through the original wood windows with old bubbly glass. Fix yourself a drink and head up the spiral stairs to the bedroom.  Just around the iron handrail is a full size bed, and plenty of reading material about the places you’ll want to see and the food you’ll want to eat while you’re here. Th
neighborhood_overview: Central City is the Best! We're right in the middle of everything. . . and I don't mean right in the middle of the French Quarter, I mean in the middle of a less touristy, little bit quieter New Orleans. We're just on the edge of the Garden District, a short walk from Magazine St, and just 3 blocks form the streetcar line. Plus, we're only one block from the super hip, up and coming Oretha Castle Haley Blvd where you'll find the best coffee, the indiest movies, a few restaurants, the new Food and Beverage Museum, and a tatoo parlor in case you're in the market. So come check out my neighborhood, you'll love it like I do!
transit: It's super easy to get around from here. We're just 3 blocks from the newly reworked streetcar line. For $1.25 it'll take you to the Quarter or all the way uptown.  And then if you just feel like hoofing it, we're within walking distance of Magazine St, the Garden District and even the French Quarter if you're up for it.

name: Uptown Garden District Near St. Charles Street Car
description: Our wonderful condo is the main floor of a typical New Orleans "raised basement" home.  It sits just one block from St. Charles streetcar and a few blocks from Magazine street. Take the street car to the French Quarter or Uptown to Tulane or Audubon Park - enjoy music, great restaurants The Condo has 4 bedrooms (1 King, 1 Queen, 2 twins and a daybed), 2 bathrooms and a utility room with washer and dryer.  My favorite feature is the screened in porch out front where you can hear the sound of the street car chugging along.  Great kitchen and bar area both fully furnished for any chef!  Wifi and cable TV in 3 of the bedrooms but New Orleans is so much fun I doubt you will need them much!    Two parking places assigned in the back parking lot along with street parking. You will have access to the entire home.  We will have one central hall closet locked with most of our belongings, but this is our "home away from home" so the closets and drawers will have a few of our belongings.  There ar
neighborhood_overview: Our home is right on the border of New Orleans Uptown and the Garden District so the location is perfect!  You can walk to Pascale's Manale, Fat Harry's, Charlie's steaks, or catch a show at Tipitina's.  Take a stroll down Magazine, have an Oyster Po-Boy at Casamento's or grab some ice cream at Sucre' .  There is a Rouse's market, a Fresh  Market and a Martin's Wine Cellar all within a mile or less.   You can jump on the street car to see Tulane or stroll through Audubon Park...further around to Carrollton and hit the Maple Leaf for some music and have dinner at Jacques-Imo's.  The other direction takes you through the Garden District to places like The Columns for a cocktail, or further on to experience to all the greatness the French Quarter has to offer.
transit: New Orleans Uber is reliable, buses are fine and the Street Car line will take you to most of the tourist destinations.  We have parking for 2 spots and the street parking is generally safe and available near our home but not always easy to find elsewhere so we generally recommend public transportation when sightseeing to avoid the hassle of parking.  It's $1.25 to ride the street car.  There is a bowl of change on the entry hall table, feel free to grab 5 quarters if you need to,.  The street car doesn't give change , you will get a card with your balance for later rides.  If you have any left and aren't sure what to do with it, feel free to leave it in the change bowl...someone will put it to good use.  There is an app you mean download called WDSU Transit Tracker that shows you where the street cars are along the route.  It's free and  good to have.

name: Stayloom’s Elegant, Renovated Oasis \| CBD, Casino
description: Stayloom offers a collection of handcrafted homes designed to bring your group together. Our luxury spaces are more than just a place to stay. They are a source of lasting memories. The key to an authentic experience. Your redefined sense of travel. Stay in style. Stay for the story. Stay Heirloom. A truly unbeatable location just steps to the French Quarter and Harrah's Casino, our contemporary 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom CBD apartment accommodates up to 8 guests. Combining contemporary open-concept design with gorgeous original architectural features such as loft ceilings and exposed brick, our home is a chic blend of classic Southern Gothic elegance and ultra-modern comfort. The ideal city escape for families, friends, colleagues, and other groups seeking first-class comforts and that authentic NOLA experience. - Exposed brick throughout the apartment - Chef's kitchen, featuring high quality essential cookware - TV loaded with Smart TV that comes pre-loaded with apps like Netflix, Hulu, e
neighborhood_overview: An amazing NOLA location in the Central Business District, you are steps from famous Canal Street and the French Quarter’s edge. The ideal homebase for city exploring! The Quarter’s bars and eateries are world-renowned, and the CBD itself is home to many of the city’s very best restaurants. Kick off your stay with a ride on the famous Canal Street trolley, or take a stroll to Jackson Square, one of the city’s best-loved hotspots. Harrah's Casino is 2 blocks away.
transit: You will be less than 5 minutes on foot to the French Quarter, and biking is another fun and convenient option, with scores of rental shops to choose from. Uber and Lyft services are easy and affordable in this compact city. Retail hub Magazine Street is just a short cab ride away, as are some of the city’s other hip neighborhoods, Bywater and the Marigny.

name: Balcony on Uptown Parade Route; St Charles & Mag
description: Relax on the front balcony under stately oaks in Uptown New Orleans; steps to St. Charles Avenue and Magazine Street.  Live like a New Orleanian, soaking in the atmosphere of the Old South at this spacious and accommodating abode.  This charming 1880s home, once owned by a Senator was recently renovated to perfection.  From its elegant master bedroom, step through time through the floor-to-ceiling windows that overlook majestic Napoleon Avenue from your private balcony.  It's a 30 day rental. A large stately home supported by four columns that feature a full front balcony that overlooks Napoleon Avenue.  This house was originally built for a senator and its recent renovations feature its beauty with large stain glass windows, tall ceilings, wide plank wood floors, and walk-through windows to get you out onto the balcony.  At the back of the home is a nice, pleasant brick patio to sit back and enjoy either some quiet time or to have fun with family and friends. Guests can access their o
neighborhood_overview: Uptown on Napoleon between eclectic Magazine Street with all #1 & #2 restaurants as noted internationally, nationally and by locals.  On St. Charles Avenue, take the streetcar in multiple directions and see all the beautiful architecture that adorn these large homes.
transit: You can catch the city bus at the corner of Napoleon and Magazine which will take you just about anywhere in the city.  At the corner of Napoleon and St. Charles Avenue, you can catch the streetcar and this will bring you to many parts of New Orleans.  Trips tend to be $1.25 one way and there are passes you can purchase (i.e. Jazzy Pass) on (URL HIDDEN)  This same site will offer you routes, schedules, rates and such for improved access around the city.  Venture out!

description: Filled with local art and modern amenities, our professionally designed home can comfortably accommodate large groups. With roomy living spaces, refined interior design, and a pool in the backyard, this is the ideal hangout. Not to mention, the home is in a close proximity to both the French Quarter and Frenchmen Street. This is the perfect spot for groups seeking only the best of New Orleans. - Our professional interior decorators carefully selected local artwork to reflect the vibrant culture of New Orleans throughout the home. - A saltwater pool located in the backyard *this is shared with 2 other homes next door that we also run as vacation rentasl* - Home features a chef’s kitchen which comes fully stocked with essential cookware and more than enough place settings for your whole group. - Other amenities include a WiFi, Smart TV with apps, central AC and heating, and much more. - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens. - All bathrooms a
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located steps from the French Quarter in the historic and culturally vibrant Treme, just blocks from North Rampart Street. This is a safe, friendly, and laid-back area. For those interested in experiencing the gastronomy of the city, some of the best bars, restaurants, and cafes in the country are located in our immediate neighborhood. We are also within walking distance to the African American Museum, St. Augustine Church, Louis Armstrong Park, and other notable sites in NOLA. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
transit: Our home is located directly next to the French Quarter, which makes getting around convenient and easy. We are a 6 minute walk to the edge of the French Quarter, and a 15 minute walk to Frenchmen Street. The Marigny/Bywater is also reachable by walking, biking, or Uber/Lyft.

name: Garden View Eclectic Apt. - Magazine St, Conv.Ctr!
description: Delight in returning home to this tucked away apartment in the Lower Garden District. One block from Magazine St, the neighborhood is extremely walkable with a great coffee shop, local brewery, bourbon bar and restaurants all within a 2 block radius. It's a 10 minute walk to the heart of the Garden District or to the Warehouse District. The French Quarter is 1.5 mi away which is a nice walk or an easy $5-10 Uber/Taxi.  A convenient 0.6 mi to the Convention Center. Decorated by a designer and artist with treasures from the world over, the space is delightful and comfortable place to return after exploring the city.  The sofa in the living room converts to a pretty comfortable full size bed.  Extra linens provided.  The apartment is on the garden level of a large historic house that has been restored. It consists of a spacious combined living and dining area, a fully appointed kitchen, private bedroom and bath. The bedroom has a queen size bed. Fine linens, hotel sized soaps/shampoos, an
neighborhood_overview: Some of the most enriching travel experiences center around feeling a personal connection to a place. Staying in the Lower Garden District neighborhood is a unique way to experience New Orleans local culture.  It's one of the best districts outside of the Quarter for historic architecture and you'll delight in strolling through the tree lined streets & parks and exploring plenty of local shops & restaurants.  We provide a well-qualified "locals list" of favorite restaurants, music venues and experiences!
transit: 1 block off Magazine shops & restaurants.   3 blocks to St. Charles Streetcar stop.   0.6 mi Convention Center. 1.6 mi to Super Dome.   Walk/Short Cab Ride ($10 or less with Uber) to Garden District, Warehouse District & French Quarter. 20-30 minute cab ride to airport.
