name: The Bienville Suite: Walk to the French Quarter
description: This is a 100% private guest suite located within a lovingly restored New Orleans home, two blocks from beautiful tree lined Esplanade Avenue in the Treme neighborhood — a culturally rich historic area where many of the city’s Jazz musicians got their start.  Key features of the unit are a beautiful marble bathroom, private entrance, kitchen and sleeping area. It is an easy 15 minute walk to the French Quarter and five minutes in an Uber. The Bienville Suite is a sparkling clean little gem furnished with a mix of vintage & modern decor. This is a great getaway spot for anyone seeking a fun-filled New Orleans adventure. This is not a party pad, just a cool place for couples, two friends or the solo traveler. $6 in an Uber and you're at all the top tourist attractions: Frenchmen Street, The French Quarter, Bourbon Street and more. There are also two bike rental racks two blocks from the home. Check out my Instagram: GreyGardensNOLA for insider pro tips!  From The Bienville Suite you can
neighborhood_overview: The location is unique and special because it’s so close to the French Quarter, Frenchmen Street (where you really want to go to hear all the best music), City Park and Bayou St. John. This is an awesome place to stay if you want to be close to all the action but not pay high hotel prices. $6 in an Uber and you’re on Frenchmen ready to eat, sing and dance all night!  But wait, theres more! On Sundays you’ll spy a huge block party at Kermit Ruffin’s famous Mother In Law Lounge which is located four blocks away. If the Saints win…it’ll be an even bigger one!  Since we have a funeral home around the corner you may even witness a “Jazz Funeral” procession pass near the house complete with a brass band and second line.  During season, on “Second Line Sundays” things heat up and the party really gets going! These second lines aren’t in honor of the dead, instead they are celebrations the many Social Aid & Pleasure Clubs host to bring the community together — basically they are awesome travel
transit: There are two SoBi bike rental racks roughly two blocks away. Lyft and Uber are always just a minute away and it will cost you about $6 to get to the French Quarter, Frenchmen Street or City Park.

name: Be My Neighbor In The Channel!
description: Come be my neighbor and stay in my newly renovated attached one bedroom apartment! This is a 200 year old property converted from a classic shotgun double.  Easy walk to shopping and food on Magazine Street, bus stops, and the famous Garden District. Well behaved pets are welcome! They can play in my yard or you can walk them and get to know the neighborhood. I am fully legal and licensed! (License #18STR-12538). Please help our neighborhoods by only renting legal Airbnbs! This is a cozy 750 square foot one bedroom apartment with a private entrance. The bedroom has a queen bed and desk, and the living room futon folds out to a full bed (I have it on good authority both beds are very comfortable). The kitchen features a fridge, oven, range, and keurig, while the bathroom has a cast iron tub and shower. This space is pretty small, so it's probably ideal for two people, or two parents and a child, but if you're just looking for a place to sleep and keep your things, I think four good frie
neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighborhood! We’re close enough to the Garden District and Mardi Gras Parade routes to walk and be involved if we want, and just far enough away for participation to not feel mandatory.  We have friendly and involved neighbors, and some of the best restaurants in the city! Walk to Commanders Palace for cocktails then take a cemetery tour in Lafayette Number One Cemetery, or lunch at Turkey and the Wolf and shop in some of the artists’ collectives on Magazine Street. There’s more to New Orleans then the Quarter!
transit: There is a lot you can walk to in the neighborhood, but if you want to go further afield the Magazine bus is only blocks away. We also have several blue bike rental stops in the area, and the St. Charles streetcar isn’t too far away if you’re feeling adventurous. Since we are a (mostly) civilized city, we also have Uber, Lyft, and a host of local taxi services (I recommend United). Please note: this neighborhood is in the "box" for Mardi Gras. We're in between where the parades line up and where they end, so please look up parade schedules before you book your flight! You can't drive across parades, and walking across the parade line with luggage is almost impossible.

name: Uptown Elegance on Magazine Street
description: Maison Petit Biscuit. This elegant one-bedroom condo is located in the heart of Uptown New Orleans on Magazine Street.  Minutes to Audubon Park (Tulane and Loyola Universities), Garden District, French Quarter and Convention Center. Walk to all the best eateries, art galleries and boutiques on Magazine Street. This extraordinary New Orleans home, originally built as a shotgun double in 1898, is impeccable. The building was converted into a tri-plex post-Katrina. This first floor single shotgun condo has been painstakingly and lovingly updated while keeping many original, turn-of-the-century features including hard-wood floors, brick fireplaces and 12' ceilings. The original floor to ceiling front window offers a lively view of bustling Magazine Street. *Follow us on instagram: @maisonpetitbiscuit* Guests will have full occupancy of the home, therefore full access to all amenities listed. Host is available full-time, local, and always ready to support your experience.  I'm here if you n
neighborhood_overview: The best boutiques, art galleries, restaurants and bars in New Orleans are within walking distance:  Lilette, La Petite Grocery, Shaya, Saffron NOLA, Cavan, Bouligny Tavern and Tipitinas!
transit: The St. Charles Streetcar is 4 blocks away.  This central location also means quick and easy Uber/Lyft travel to all parts of the city.  And the parade routes during Mardi Gras are an easy,  pleasant walk - allowing you to choose your spot on either Napoleon or St. Charles Avenues.

name: FESTIVAL Ready House Perfect for Large Groups!
description: •Perfect for entertaining your group, whatever the occasion!  •Gourmet marble kitchen opens to a party deck w/ 2 umbrella tables, a huge dining table, & large gas grill and basketball court outside.   •Fully Furnished, 6 BR, 2 living spaces, 2 huge flat screens,  mini-pool table, poker set, & foosball table. •If the price doesn't fit your budget just shoot me a message! FIRST TIME USING AIRBNB? Create your account and get $40 off your stay!  www.airbnb.com/c/anthonyk5772 6BR*/3.5BA Luxury Party Pad w/ 2 Balconies Experience New Orleans in complete comfort and style. Your luxurious home away from home will have you wanting to stay on vacation forever.  Close enough to celebrate everything New Orleans has to offer in minutes, yet private and quiet to enjoy the space & character of an old New Orleans neighborhood. Home has amenities abundant to keep you busy when you're not out on the town. However if you're just looking to crash when you come home, you will have plenty of beds and space
neighborhood_overview: The South is known for its old-fashioned beauty and genteel charm; for graceful live oaks shading the drive and drooping with Spanish moss; Locals take pains to preserve their most historic streets and the very special sense of place created over centuries. This street fits that description perfectly.  It's pretty enough to star in pictures, and tourist-friendly to boot. The house is on Louisiana Avenue Pkwy, just across Clairborne Ave from the Garden District.  It is technically located in Broadmoor, but most folks in New Orleans have never even been on this hidden gem because of Washington St/ Toledano St, a busier thoroughfare that runs parallel to us.  This street has a lot of life-timers, residents who dearly love their city and the street that many grew up on and never left.   It is very much a mixed income neighborhood that is on the rise, but in some ways is still recovering from the storm with some blighted homes and construction underway. Our street has a well below average c
transit: Driving/Uber/Lyft Nothing in the city is more than 15 minutes away by car or Uber/Lyft (New user promo codes given prior to arrival for your booking!) Public Transit Just a few blocks away is Elysian Fields Ave where public transportation allows access to the entirety of the city. A bus to the French Quarter is a short, direct trip straight down Elysian Fields. Single rides are $1.25/person and day passes are $3! All passes can be bought directly on the bus.  Transportation To/From Airport If you are flying into New Orleans, please ask me about booking a shuttle to/from the airport, as I can get you  great prices with a local vendor!  Chauffeur Services If you are interested in any type of Chauffeur Services for your time, please let me know and I will get you a very reasonable quote from a local vendor!

name: "Delille" Studio - Steps to French Qtr
description: The historic 1890 Treme private "Delille" studio apartment with full kitchen with dishwasher, washer/dryer and private courtyard is in a quiet residential neighborhood, steps from the French Quarter and Marigny.  Per New Orleans law this unit is a minimum 30 day rental. The "Delille Studio" is perfect for a short visit or an extended stay. You have your own private entrance and courtyard, a Stearns and Foster full sized bed and wireless internet and smart TV for your comfort and entertainment. If you are planning an extended stay, you'll find the kitchen is fully equipped to allow you to prepare meals at home. You are welcome to use the entire courtyard and apartment. We enjoy interacting with you, but we respect your privacy.  You have a separate entrance and completely private facilities.  We live on the premises, and are available when requested. Our location is convenient to the French Quarter and Marigny entertainment districts but in a quiet neighborhood for your rest and relaxat
neighborhood_overview: Our location is convenient to the French Quarter and Marigny entertainment districts but in a quiet neighborhood for your rest and relaxation.  There is a diverse mix of professional adults residing and a bevy of children playing on our block that make living and visiting here a real New Orleans experience.
transit: There's plenty of street parking if you bring a car, but you will probably walk most places and take an occasional pedicab. We are 1.5 blocks from the new St Claude Avenue streetcar. Also nearby are two major bus lines: St Claude Jackson Barracks Line - easy to Marigny, Bywater and St. Claude-Jackson Barracks, and Jackson-Esplanade - easy to City Park and Uptown and streetcar lines. Cabs, Lyft and Uber can be summoned for quick pick up.

description: You’ll love my place because of the cozy atmosphere, prime location near the Superdome, French Quarter and street car lines!  Enjoy the conveniences of being next-door to a world class boutique hotel with complimentary coffee service, a Taiwanese street food restaurant, craft cocktails and rooftop bar. Come stay at our private downtown 1-bedroom suite apartment. Easy to access on the second story by stairs or an elevator. Cozily sleeping up to 6 guests in a master bedroom (queen bed), a fold out sofa bed (queen size) and a blow up mattress (full size). The apartment also features a spacious living room, open kitchen, and a balcony overlooking a great centrally located street. If you searched by typing in specific dates and our apartment came up, it's available for you to book now!! Our Living Room features a relaxing environment with modern furniture, including a large lounge sofa bed, seats at the kitchen counter to have a nice dining experience, and a brand new flat-screen LED TV equ
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is centrally located, being within walking distance of the French Quarter, the Warehouse District, the St. Charles Streetcar line, Canal Street, Bourbon Street, the Convention Center, and great parks. As a visitor, you'll enjoy the walk no doubt, those walks are scenic and beautiful. A Map app is a great companion and will tell you how long it is to walk, train, or cab wherever you need to go. It also links to Uber, which is very responsive in the city.
transit: Getting around is really easy from this apartment! Uber is easy to use in the downtown area, as are taxi cabs, but you will find that the location of this property makes walking everywhere really easy and fun! The St. Charles streetcar line can take you uptown and is just a block away, and the Canal Street streetcar line can take you to Mid-City and the fairgounds and is only 3 blocks from the apartment.

Morial Convention Center and the French Quarter. Exploring the French Quarter is essential to an authentic New Orleans experience. That’s why we are perfectly situated from the historic neighborhood—close enough by foot, trolley, and car, but far away enough for a sound sleep.

name: Historic Marigny Condo next to French Quarter
description: French Quarter inspired luxurious condo with modern finishes in the historic Faubourg Marigny neighborhood.  The building dates back to 1852.  Hardwood floors, top of the line appliances, and quartz countertops.  On the Rampart streetcar line and just steps away from the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Bywater, Treme and Frenchman Street (where the locals go.  Our condo is a licensed short term rental # 17STR-19350 ideally located for Mardi Gras and all of the French Quarter festivals. This quaint condo is located on the courtyard with secured access.  The condo is accessible by a few stairs and is all one level.  All of our condos are key pad and deadbolt secured.  The courtyard is well lit for easy access. Our beautiful courtyard is available to our guests.  Relax and enjoy the flowers and fountain after a day of fun. Your host is always a quick phone call away.  You will be given security codes that will access your unit for quick entry and check in. Nestled between the eclectic Byw
neighborhood_overview: Nestled between the eclectic Bywater and the historic French Quarter, the Faubrough Marigny is a quaint historic neighborhood with brightly colored homes.  This area was once the plantation of Bernard de Marigny, a wealthy Creole and political leader of old New Orleans.  In 1806, he had his property subdivided and developed as a neighborhood. Many of the houses in this area are over 100 years old; some are much older.  Frenchman Street, where the locals go to listen to jazz, is in the Marigny and close to our beautiful condo. Visit Buffa's a local bar and eatery around the corner or Port of Call for their burgers.  And, the convenience store across the street has fantastic shrimp po-boys.
transit: Take the Rampart streetcar to get to the foot of Canal street where you can take a transfer to the French Quarter. The French Quarter along with Frenchman Street are both in walking distance. Street parking is limited to two hours during the day in front of the building.  Parking is very limited in the French Quarter and the Marigny; however, there is street parking on the other side of N Rampart.  In addition, we have one parking space on our property inside of our fence that can be reserved in advance for $25 a day.

name: Dream LOCATION! Freret Uptown BOOK NOW!!

neighborhood_overview: AREA INFORMATION For the quintessential New Orleans experience, hop on a streetcar and ride the tracks down to the French Quarter. Here food, culture, music and history are stirred into a distinctive Crescent City roux. Take a scenic stroll to Harrah’s New Orleans Casino or the Aquarium of the Americas for a change of pace — each is less than a mile away. Be sure to save a day for exploring the city’s museums, mansions and quaint thoroughfares. You can even pack a picnic lunch and enjoy 1,300 acres of greenspace at the New Orleans City Park. Jazz it up with a Mississippi River steamboat cruise — or unwind with beignets at Café du Monde. ACTIVITIES & ATTRACTIONS Live Entertainment Golf Lake Boating Fishing French Quarter Casinos Tennis Courts Picnic/BBQ Area Zoo/Animal Park
transit: Your own transportation is always nice but from here public transportation can get you all New Orleans has to offer.

name: Dreamy Hideaway in New Bywater
description: This newly renovated, cozy, modern apartment is ideal for a family getaway or weekend with friends.  Less than 2 miles from the French Quarter and a short walk to vibrant St Claude Avenue and the riverfront Crescent City Park this is the perfect home base from which to explore the best of New Orleans! License #18STR - 18002 Freshly renovated and updated with the latest fixtures, you will find everything you need to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable in this conveniently located first floor apartment.  Designed with a modern, fresh flair, the spacious living room is the ideal place to relax and unwind after exploring the city.  Spread out on the comfy sectional sofa and enjoy Netflix and Hulu with Showtime, HBO and Starz on the huge Smart TV.  Or cook up a meal together in the spacious, fully stocked kitchen and enjoy in the colorful dining area. Our 3 large bedrooms have plenty of storage space in closets and dressers and very comfortable beds for a tranquil night’s sleep.  The mast
neighborhood_overview: This home is in an area referred to as the St. Claude Arts District, or the New Bywater and it is one of the most eclectic and  bohemian neighborhoods in the city. Just a few blocks away from Marigny/Bywater/St. Claude staples such as The Country Club which has a fantastic restaurant and year-round heated public pool, Elizabeth's Restaurant, Bacchanal, and Lost Love Lounge, you are in one of the most exciting parts of the city! This urban residential neighborhood features some of the trendiest new restaurants, bars, and arts/performance venues in the City. Close to N7 (a restaurant named by Bon Appetit magazine as one of the "10 Best New Restaurants in 2016" and "the most romantic French restaurant in the world") and an easy walk to the St Roch Market, Always Lounge, Siberia, and Hi-Ho Lounge, you are in an area full of art galleries, theaters, music venues, and wonderful restaurants for every taste and budget.
transit: The reserved off-street parking spot will make it easy and convenient to explore the city by car.  No worries if you don’t have wheels  - the French Quarter, City Park and the Marigny are all also easily and cheaply explored by Uber, Lyft or a taxi.  And our public transportation is easy to use with the RTA website or NORTA app - the 88 bus runs up St Claude Ave/Rampart St to the French Quarter and Downtown area.   Nearby Gerken’s Bike Shop on St Claude is a great place to rent bikes to explore the city.  And you’re within walking distance of so many fantastic spots - however, if walking I would suggest sticking to main roads - in this case Poland Avenue 1 block away - or going as a group.  Just like in any urban area it’s wise to remain vigilant.  If in doubt take a cab!

The spacious interior is cozy & inviting, designed by local artists.  Make yourself at home, meet fellow travelers from all over the world in the common spaces  & enjoy this magical city!  We live onsite & are dedicated to making your experience authentic, giving you all of our city secrets & personal recommendations! This is a private room in a cozy, artsy big historical multi bedroom house . There is a shared living room, spacious kitchen, and two shared bathrooms with showers at the rear of the house. The fenced lit up backyard is also accessible to guests.  We are always at home and are very dedicated to keeping the common spaces squeaky clean for guests. neighborhood_overview: New Orleans ranked 2nd best U.S. city by Travel + Leisure in 2015-2018. Travel + Leisure attributes New Orleans' rise in the rankings to a growing number of new hotels, shops and restaurants across the city as well as the thriving Faubourg Marigny and BYWATER neighborhoods. BYWATER:  The Historic Bywater neighborhood is an artsy area with easy access to the Quarter, Frenchman St, Crescent Park, cafes, restaurants, grocery, park, and bars all within walking distance. Welcome, and enjoy our Historic Bywater neighborhood.  We are close enough to the French Quarter to walk (if you're fit, 15 -20 minute walk), but still far enough to not have the noise, expensive parking and activity of the French Quarter.  If the walk is too much just call a taxi, or rent a bike.
transit: Car: not necessary Located in the heart of Historical Hipster Bywater within walking distance of the French Quarter & Frenchmen St. (Marigny) (if you're fit, 15 -20 minute walk), but still far enough to not have the noise, expensive parking and activity of the French Quarter.  Don't like to walk the #5 bus, Uber, Lyft, or taxi will have you to the Quarter in minutes. Plenty of parking spaces by our house. Entrance to the beautiful riverfront Crescent Park is just 3 blocks away.  Want to sip some wine & listen to music, Bacchanal is just a few blocks away. Want to sample some praline bacon, The famous Elizabeth's is only blocks away.  Want to go for a swim, the Country Club has a climate controlled pool & is accessible to anyone for a small fee. Want to sample New Orleans best Pizza, Pizza Delicious is only blocks away. We can’t forget The JOINT for some of the best BBQ. name: Bright and Cheery Boho Historic Treme Flat!
description: Discover the history and beauty of New Orleans from the Historic Treme district, known as being the birthplace of Jazz! Nestled between the French Quarter, Marigny and Mid City, You are convenient to whatever your heart desires. This adorably-decorated, mid mod-styled house is perfect for both the avid traveler, as well as the group who prefers to cook and wind down after a busy day of touring. We hope you'll join us! NEW AND DISCOUNTED FOR A SHORT PERIOD!!!!! Step into New Orleans history in the Treme! Though the city lists its build-date as 1947, the nails in floorboards are Civil War Era and the insulation in the walls dates from before that.  Other fun finds include a little girl's comb and a barber shop menu listing a haircut for two pennies. Sitting alongside a National Registry of Historic Places home (two doors down), it is an architectural jewel that has had, in 150+ years on this earth, only three owners: the first a Sicilian immigrant to New Orleans, the most recent an artis
neighborhood_overview: The historic Treme neighborhood is home to some of the city's most heralded museums and parks, including Louis Armstrong Park.  One of our favorite bars, Ooh Poo Pah Doo, is located 1/4 mile away from the home as well as (another favorite!) the historic Dooky Chase Restaurant, which is just 3 blocks away! Go there!

description: Feel at ease in Gentilly Breeze!  Our home is a newly renovated and updated 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom home, with a fully stocked kitchen, and dozens of amenities. Our home is located in the beautiful and quiet neighborhood of Gentilly, and is centrally located to some of the most popular destinations in New Orleans, such as the French Quarter, the Fairgrounds, City Park, the Superdome, Audubon Park and Zoo, and St. Charles Avenue. Our home has a front porch and a back deck where you can relax.  Inside Gentilly Breeze, there are high ceilings, beautiful floors, and all the comforts of home, including spacious bedrooms, an attached bathroom in the master bedroom, and a "Jack and Jill" bathroom connecting the second and third bedrooms. Our home is equipped with WiFi, smart TV’s, a working space, a laundry room, video gaming system, an alarm system, and plenty of space for parking. name: Charming Historic House- Steps from Esplanade!
description: Charming two story house in a beautiful quiet neighborhood.  Just steps from Esplanade, and a short walk to restaurants and local spots.  Walking distance to the fairgrounds, and a short Uber or bike ride to the French quarter and city park. Off street parking spot! Hard wood floors throughout and many antique features keep with historic nature of the house, with an updated kitchen.  We love living here, and are happy to answer any questions you may have! The house is a distinct New Orleans style shotgunned double.  Please note the two of the bedrooms are in the traditional shotgunned style. The owners live on one side so are on site if you need, but otherwise give you full freedom to enjoy the house and have your privacy.  The house has black out curtains in the bedrooms, sleep number beds and the walls are filled with local art. The house offers an entirely separate living space, you have separate front doors and back doors, additionally there is a private balcony off bedroom one.  S
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is just off Esplanade, one of the most beautiful streets in New Orleans (we think!). Cafe Dega is right around the corner and Esplanade boasts a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, bars and grocery stores.  Easily reach any part of the city from our neighborhood.  Walk to Jazz fest at the Fairgrounds, or take a stroll through city park or the French quarter, all are very easy to access from the house.
transit: There is a bike rental just down the street, additionally Esplanade has a bus that will take or connect you to anywhere you need to get to including the Carrolton street car line and the French Quarter, which is also within walking distance.

name: Charming House in Former Creole Corner Store
description: Swim a few lengths of the private saltwater pool in the backyard oasis attached to this charming home. Indoors there’s an inviting gourmet kitchen with island. The downstairs bathroom features a beautiful marble shower and clawfoot bathtub.
neighborhood_overview: The home lies in the Marigny Triangle, a historic and well-preserved neighborhood of New Orleans. It’s located between the French Quarter and the bohemian Bywater neighborhoods and Frenchmen Street – the best place to catch local live music. STR: 18STR-14476
transit: Getting around is easy; enjoy a leisurely 15 Minute walk to the French Quarter or 10 minute walk to Bywater or Frenchmen Street.  My favorite way to explore the city is on bikes. name: Private Loft Two Blocks to Quarter
description: This is not just an accommodation; it is an experience that I am so thrilled to share with you. This apartment is so perfectly perched between several neighborhoods: Treme, French Quarter, Marigny, and very close to the Bywater and Mid-City. That means that you get a really diverse experience with easy access to so many different neighborhoods. The space consists of two floors. The bottom has the kitchen and the bathroom, which are the common spaces. The good stuff comes when you get to your exclusive floor though, which is a loft. It's shaped like a cross and is divided into three sections - there is a bed in 2 of them, and then there is a little living room area. This is an open space but we have curtains so that you can maintain privacy between each section if you'd like. One thing to keep in mind. Because it is a loft space, the ceiling is low. Every room is available for you, minus the two bedrooms downstairs (where my roommate and I reside). The upstairs will be entirely yours th
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is really cool! It's literally two blocks from the edge of the French Quarter and the street car (we are equidistant between Frenchman and Bourbon so both are a ten-minute walk).
transit: Since you are so close to so many things, I recommend just parking outside the apartment and going around by foot.  If you don't have a car, and you're looking to explore a little further out, we're two blocks to the street car that will lead to another one if you're wanting to go even further. Uber and Lyft are efficient options to get around as well.

description: Freshly renovated private suite in Fairgrounds neighborhood. Includes a comfy queen size bed, private bath, private entrance, sitting room with mini frig and coffee maker, access to back yard, laundry available upon request. Walking distance to public transportation and local restaurants. 2.5 miles from French Quarter. Walking distance to City Park. Quiet street in a residential neighborhood. No kitchen access unless arranged in advance. Bike rentals and tours can be arranged. Newly renovated and freshly painted. Private room with rear entrance behind gated back yard. Bedroom features a comfy queen size Hampton & Rhodes mattress with pillow top mattress cover. Access to a reading room/library with mini frig and coffee maker. Private bath with shower/tub. As an additional note, a couple of the reviews mention the shutter doors that allow sound to travel. I have recently replaced them and installed SOLID wood doors on the guest bedroom as well as my bedroom, so this should not be an issu

transit: I can help you out with taxi, Uber,  and public transportation info (buses as well as streetcars), as well as directions and recommendations.

name: AUDUBON CORP 30 DAY RENTAL/JACUZZI/UNIVS/PARK/ZOO
description: DAILY price for MONTHLY rental FOR 1-6 PEOPLE.  For larger groups there are two 2bd/1ba units.  Call for availability.  Recent pics/wrong date. COMFORTS of home await you under 200 year old Oak in this bright spacious upper apartment in upscale Uptown neighborhood where CRIME is UNHEARD OF.  One block to AUDUBON PARK, Clubhouse, Golf Course & AUDUBON ZOO.  Ten minute ride down Magazine to the French Quarter.  Audubon Park to St. Charles street cars.  24/7 private patrol.  Check the crime map. If you have a larger group there are two units.  See https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/12595082 for pictures and availability.  The unit is other apartment upstairs. SAFE***ONE BLOCK FROM AUDUBON PARK & ZOO***LOVELY UPTOWN Perfect for FAMILIES, GOLFERS, visiting Loyola & Tulane PARENTS, vacationing with CHILDREN, TEMPORARY WORKERS... A Laid Back Getaway... Busy, yet quiet, SAFE, charming upscale Uptown residential neighborhood. 2 Bedroom/1 Bath/Daybed w/ trundle -- Upper ½ Double (approx (Phone number
neighborhood_overview: BEAUTIFUL - SAFE RESIDENTIAL AREA!  One block to view the birds of James Audubon in Audubon Park with walking track, fitness course, Country Club w/ outstanding brunch buffet/bar, Golf Course and our famous Audubon Zoo. I have been here for 24 years with no crime problems or even an nervous twitch!  It is a unique area surrounded by million dollar homes, condos and mansions.  We do not experience the walk-by traffic as most New Orleans neighborhoods which might make guests uncomfortable.  There area is safe during the day and by night.  I do pay for 24/7 private patrol with a call number.  Their number will be listed on your welcome note.
transit: There is one parking space in front of the house for this unit.  There is unlimited parking on the levee across the street. Just a walk through the park to St. Charles Avenue street cars ($1.25 - $3 all day pass).  There is also a covered bus stop with seating in front of the Zoo.  Both go straight to downtown, the French Quarter and Bourbon Street.  When I have guests we usually walk down to the street cars and head out for FUN!  If you don't feel like walking (although it's a gorgeous walk) you can drive the few blocks, park you car and jump on the street car.

name: Two Room Private Suite, Marigny
description: Come be a guest in my lovely two-room suite, located in my historic Marigny cottage, three blocks from Frenchmen Street and a 15 minute walk to Jackson Square in the French Quarter! Please read all sections of listing prior to booking. Two rooms, with an arch in between, in my Marigny home: a bedroom with a Queen sized bed, and a sitting area with a daybed set up as a couch, but can sleep a third person (twin mattress. )  The space features hand-stencilled walls and is furnished with an eclectic mix of antiques, vintage furniture, art and books...and a vintage baby grand piano! There is a small chest of drawers and an Art Nouveau wardrobe in which to store your clothing and other items. Amenities include fast wireless internet and a new 24" television with a Roku and cable. There is a latch to lock yourself in from the rest of the house.  I am sorry, but there is no kitchen use with the rental of this suite. However, in your suite there is a mini fridge, a coffeemaker and an electric k
neighborhood_overview: Marigny is a wonderful, eclectic, artsy neighborhood and is the second oldest neighborhood in the city, the French Quarter being the oldest. My home is a 15 minute walk away from Jackson Square in the heart of the Quarter, and is three blocks from Frenchmen Street. Who Dat Cafe  and Orange Couch are nearby coffee shops (two and three blocks away, respectively) and there are numerous dining and shopping choices nearby without even having to go to the Quarter, including a Co-Op grocery store and Walgreens.
transit: Walking is the best way, since my home is so close to everything! But cabs and Uber are plentiful and a phone call  or app away, and you can take a pedicab home from the Quarter as well. Bicycles - true NOLA transportation - can be rented on nearby Frenchmen Street.

description: 2 bedrooms 1 bathroom sleeps 5 (max) cable TV AC & heating washer/dryer fully furnished kitchen private backyard & covered brick patio 30 day minimum very easy going and understated.  this place has all that is needed for a simple getaway or settled-in long time stay.  with plenty of attractions close by, spy boy is out in front of all the rest!  cozy and contemporary with stained & scored concrete floors, topped with unique throw rugs.  it has the perfect mix of old & new.  subway tile and granite counters in the kitchen.  vessel sink on top of a custom made barge board vanity in the bathroom.  interior doors are all salvaged cypress treats.  hopefully, you'll stay long enough to get your read on, with over 300 books already placed on the built in floor to ceiling books shelves.  step through the french doors looking out onto the backyard and chill on the covered patio with historic soft red river brick, vibrant colors, green grass and solitude - it's the perfect retreat from everythi

(first Saturday of every month) annual Freret St. festival! (first Saturday in April) "the new freret"  (URL HIDDEN).
transit: just a few short blocks from the St. Charles Ave streetcar & one block from the Freret St. bus. bikes also available, upon request (for laid back riding around the neighborhood).

name: Tasteful Designer Mansion near French Quarter
description: Space, luxury, and genuine "NoLa": you’ll find it all here in one of the city’s largest private mansions. This 19th century home comes complete with quintessential New Orleanian features such as the dramatic double-gallery facade and original pieces by noteworthy local artists. This is your ultimate destination for your next New Orleans adventure! - Constructed in 1851, the estate sits on acres of manicured land stretching from Esplanade Avenue to Kerlerec Street.  - The mansion comprises two wings. This listing is for the east wing, at the rear of the estate ￫ 3500 sq feet. To rent both listings, contact me! - Original architectural details such as crown moldings, chandeliers, heart-of-pine floors, and marble-lined bathrooms were preserved during renovation. - Large, open living and dining areas. - Plenty of room to unwind, including expansive gardens around the property. Please note the gardens are shared with the other half of the estate. - Other amenities include wifi, laundry, Sma
neighborhood_overview: Located on leafy Esplanade Avenue in the lower Tremé, you are at the center of one of the most joyful, lively, and vibrant neighborhoods of New Orleans. The French Quarter and the Marigny/Frenchmen Street are both a short walk away. The Quarter’s bars and eateries are world-renowned, and the Marigny is home to a burgeoning art and music scene. We are also a few blocks away from the North Rampart streetcar line.
transit: The best way to get around is by foot, bike, or taxi, or Uber. For cycling enthusiasts, New Orleans is a very bikeable city, and there are several rental and tour companies in close proximity. The French Quarter and the Marigny are both within walking distance, and other hotspots such as The Bywater neighborhood and Magazine Street are a short cab ride away.

name: *Private Freret Street Apartment*
description: Our place is great for anyone, including families.  VERY centrally-located with tons of great restaurants just around the corner (literally) - High Hat, Company Burger, and Ancora - just to name a few.  Guests have access via private entry to a living room with couch and futon, 2 bedrooms with a queen-sized bed in each, bathroom, and kitchen.  It is the downstairs apartment of our home. **1 Mile from Tulane/Loyola, 2 miles from Superdome, 4 miles from FQ, 7 blocks from Mardi Gras Parades** This is the private downstairs apartment of our home.  The space includes two bedrooms, living room, bathroom, and kitchen.  It is completely separate with its own entrance.  There is a mini-fridge and microwave available for use in the space as well as a full kitchen in the shared area in the back of the Airbnb space.  Also, if you need a pack n' play, baby bath, or any other baby/child equipment, we probably have it, just ask!  Our neighborhood is super fun with tons of restaurants, coffee shops, a
neighborhood_overview: We live in a beautiful neighborhood.  Freret has tons of places to eat, get coffee, or get a cocktail.  We love living here and look forward to you checking it out too.  It's very centrally-located and guests can reach popular attractions around town very easily from our space.
transit: We are 1/2 block from the Freret Street bus line stop and 1 block from the Napoleon Avenue bus line stop.  You can walk (or take the Napoleon bus ) 8 blocks to St. Charles to hop on the Streetcar to the French Quarter in one direction and Audubon Park in the other direction.  It really is a great location, we love it.  VERY easy to get to the Superdome for games and events.

name: Victorian Luxury-Walk to French Quarter
description: Our home is a historic Victorian built in 1866 and furnished with antiques so you'll feel like you're experiencing old New Orleans, but was fully renovated in 2017 so you'll have all modern comforts, including central heat & air, ample hot water and screaming-fast Wi-Fi.   We are easy walking distance to the French Quarter, Frenchmen Street & Jazz Fest and a 9-minute walk to many wedding venues and mansions on Esplanade Avenue (Degas House, The Melrose Manson, The Benachi House, etc.) This listing is for the rental of  the space to yourself, which includes use of the grand master suite with ensuite bathroom and another large bedroom with separate seating and vanity area as well as another full and separate guest bathroom, kitchen, laundry room and living room.  There is also a private backyard with deck and seating.   The home was gutted and loving restored in 2017 and features soaring cathedral ceilings and skylights, but all of the original charm was maintained, such as the original
neighborhood_overview: We are easy walking distance to the French Quarter (15 minutes) and Frenchmen Street.  We're also a 9-minute walk to many wedding venues and mansions on Esplanade Avenue such as The Degas House, Melrose Manson and The Benachi House.  We are a nice walk or a fun and easy bike ride from the Marigny and Bywater neighborhoods as well as the Superdome.  (Bikes for hire a half block from our house). We are in "Esplanade Ridge" which is a section of the historic Treme neighborhood (or Faubourg Treme) which is the birthplace of Jazz and the neighborhood established by "Free People of Color" and former enslaved people in 1841. According to the New Orleans Times-Picayune: "The neighborhood, which is viewed by many as ground zero of New Orleans culture, seems to be on an upswing as people have fallen in love with the area's diverse architecture and culture.  Located at the epicenter of New Orleans culture, the neighborhood is the birthplace of artists such as Kermit Ruffins, Shannon Powell, Louis
transit: Our home is in the perfect location! We are easily walkable to the French Quarter, Frenchmen Street for live music and the Marigny and Bywater neighborhoods.  We are six blocks to the new Rampart Streetcar line and a half block from both the Claiborne Avenue bus routes and the Esplanade Avenue Bus Routes.  Uber usually takes 3 minutes to arrive.  In town for a wedding?  We are a 9 minute walk to many wedding venues and mansions on Esplanade Avenue such as The Degas House, Melrose Manson, The Benachi House, Le Musee de f.p.c., etc. We are half block away from a Social Bikes self-rental station ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) - download the app before you come)  New Orleans is a very bikable city (and is especially recommended during festival times when traffic is bad). We are a fun and easy bike ride from the Bywater and Marigny neighborhoods as well as the Superdome (geaux Saints!). name: Irish Channel Artist Loft
description: Recently renovated. Private, quiet and clean. Also, its really cute, there's 729 square feet of cozy space. Free wifi, gated entry, on street parking, a/c and heat. This would be ideal for a couple looking a unique getaway. This is truly a unique space, the studio loft was recently renovated and has tons of character and charm. Positioned in the back of an 1890's double shotgun along the historic oak lined Washington Ave. in the heart of uptown. Just blocks away from restaurants, bars and coffee shops on the lovely Magazine St. along with tons of shopping. This is a great accommodation if you want to stay in a New Orleans neighborhood and meet local people. Guests have the space to themselves! Full access to kitchen and all rooms. The backyard is private and would prefer to not have people back there. We live on the property so if there is something you need, there is always someone around who can assist you. Also something to note, our 5 year old daughter's room is positioned directly
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the heart of the "Irish Channel," a great funky and culturally diverse New Orleans neighborhood with grocery stores, nightlife, unique shopping boutiques along Magazine Street, and bars and restaurants throughout the area, including Coquette (corner of Washington Ave and Magazine), Commander's Palace, The Ruby Slipper, Sake Café, Joey K’s Restaurant and Bar, Sucre, The Rum House, and soon to be French Truck coffee. Located a few blocks from Belladonna Day Spa and Parasol’s Bar and Restaurant. Also, Stein's Deli (a personal favorite-great food and coffee), Turkey and the Wolf (recently named best new restaurant in the U.S. by Bon Appetit and District Donuts. Other attractions include the historic St. Louis Cemetery and there is also a Starbucks on the street corner of Washington and Magazine. The NOLA brewery is within walking distance if you'd like to sample local beer in their newly opened tap room.
transit: The property is centrally located, next to the Garden District, with the Magazine Street bus to uptown and downtown in close proximity and a 10 minute walk to the St. Charles Streetcar line and the MARDI GRAS PARADE ROUTES.

name: Corporate Luxe Extended stay Haven
description: Perfect location! 5BR/3.5BA. 2 blocks from the Canal Street Streetcar, several restaurants and area attractions! Includes our 4 bedroom home and our 1BR/1BA guest suite - connected via a paved brick patio with dining table, grill and hangout spot. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! This listing includes our 4BR/2.5BA and 1 BR/1BA guest suite. These 2 are connected via bricked entertainment patio. Beautiful new furnishings, modern decor, open spaces and everything you could possibly need for your trip to NOLA! With exposed fireplaces and vintage mantles, you will fall in love with the home and the location! 2 blocks to the Canal Street Streetcar line, 3 blocks to the Lafitte Greenway - goes all the way to the French Quarter/Frenchmen Street and 5-8 minutes to the Superdome, CBD and Garden District. 10 minutes away from City Park where the Voodoo Festival is held and 5-8 minutes away to the Fairgrounds for the Jazz Fest! Inquire about  furnished long term Corporate rental opportunities.   Thi
neighborhood_overview: Located in Mid City, referred to as the "heart of New Orleans," our home is close to everything! The new Medical Center is within walking distance...you can see the hospital from the house. Canal Street, which is home to the Canal Street Streetcar is 2 blocks away - also, the home to the route of the well known parade, the Krewe of Endymion. The Mid City neighborhood offers a central location and a vibrant local culture. In addition to being within striking distance to the Quarter and Uptown/Garden District, it is one of New Orleans' largest intact historic districts. The neighborhood is full of traditional roots while intermingled with modern architecture. Our home is about 10 minutes away from the Voodoo Fest at City Park and the Jazz Fest at the Fairgrounds! We highly recommend you rent bikes and checking out the Lafitte Greenway as well!
transit: We recommend you rent bikes and ride around the city or ride on the Lafitte Greenway to the French Quarter. We've done this exact thing and you get a better perspective of Nola and the local culture by riding through the neighborhoods. At nighttime, we don't recommend you walking anywhere in (URL HIDDEN) probably best to just use Uber/Lyft for a cheap $5 ride.

Front door entry of Victorian side hall shotgun opens into cypress wood paneling hallway. Suite includes one bedroom with pocket doors leading to lounge room and glass French doors leading to hall. Home includes 12 foot ceilings, crown molding, original fireplaces, ceramic door knobs and hardwood floors. Suite is adjacent to a SHARED kitchen and bath. Access to front porch with street view. name: MidTown Funk: Eclectic and Cool!
description: Our cool and comfy apartment offers everything you need; plush queen-sized bed, WiFi, classic claw foot tub with shower, breakfast nook, and super clean! Located 3 blocks from the Esplanade bike lane that goes from City Park to the French Quarter. The location is an up and coming neighborhood, with newly renovated school across the street, and only a 5-minute Uber to the French Quarter. Our home is a historic, Victorian-Era house that has been converted into four units.  It is has old New Orleans style charm, built nearly 100 years ago, and faces the newly renovated elementary school.  Two units are permanent local tenants that are very hospitable.   This is a lower unit, directly below a two-bedroom Airbnb apartment.  It is about a 5-minute drive to the French Quarter, not far from Esplanade street bike lane that goes to either to the French Quarter or to City Park.  You are an 8-block walk to the Fairgrounds where Jazzfest is held.  Lloyd, a long-term tenant, lives in the one bedroom
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is going through a fantastic transition as many of the houses in the 7th Ward are being renovated, in particular the newly renovated elementary school across the street.  You will see children playing in the street (mostly down Onzaga street).  The big plus is the proximity to the French Quarter- It is a 5-minute drive with traffic!
transit: You can catch an Uber to about anywhere for a reasonable fee.  $8-10 should get you to the French Quarter.  We are only 2-3 blocks from the bus line on Saint Bernard St.  You can see the New Orleans Regional Transit Authority schedules and (Email hidden by Airbnb)  RTA also operates the streetcars that run down St. Charles Ave and Canal St.  If bicycling is appealing to you, there are several places that rent bicycles.  New Orleans has also recently have incorporated public bicycles throughout the city.  See (Website hidden by Airbnb)  The public bicycle rates are very reasonable at $8/hour, or $15 a month (1 hour per day, $8/hr after), or $20 per year (1 hr per day, $8/hr after).

name: Doctor Gumbo Guesthouse: Festival HQ on the bayou!
description: Welcome to the Doctor Gumbo Guesthouse! My wife and I have designed a super-fun, funky and family-friendly space for you to enjoy during your stay in one of the world's greatest cities: New Orleans!  Less than 10 minutes by car/Uber from the French Quarter, we are located right on historic Bayou St. John, a natural waterway popular among locals for kayaking, jogging, picnicking and more. Walk to many of the city's top restaurants, bars, parks and festivals (Jazz Fest, Voodoo Fest, and more)! Located in one of the most desirable areas of New Orleans, the Guesthouse puts you in the perfect position to explore the city. The owner also owns an internationally-recognized tour company focused on the history of food and cocktails in Louisiana, and can assist you in navigating through the city's vast and wonderful foodie scene. Additionally, the Guesthouse is equipped with all the comforts of home if you'd prefer to just stay in and chill like a local. The backyard is exceptionally spacious fo
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located in New Orleans' oldest neighborhood (Faubourg St. John in Mid-City), the Guesthouse is just steps from the historic Bayou St. John, City Park, Jazz Fest, Mardi Gras' Endymion parade, Rock 'N' Roll Marathon, Crescent City Classic, with the streetcar, eateries, bars, coffee shops and grocery stores nearby.  With their tree-lined streets and avenues, gathering places, and landmarks, the Mid-City and Bayou St. John neighborhoods are decidedly more tranquil than their downtown counterparts. You're not likely to find "Huge-Ass Beers to Go" or music blaring out of every doorway here. Instead, you'll find a quieter charm in the gardens, galleries, and lagoons of City Park, in the cemeteries with their elaborately constructed tombs, and on the tree-shaded patios and decks of restaurants and cafés, where you can listen to the church bells keep time as you relax with a cold drink. Above the French Quarter and below the lakefront, neither Uptown nor quite downtown, Mid-City embra
transit: In addition to providing our guests with bikes, the Guesthouse is a 3-minute walk to the nearest rental Blue Bike stand and public bus stop (direct line to/from the French Quarter). Additionally, New Orleans boasts a robust Uber/Lyft/taxicab industry to get you to/from the Guesthouse. If you do have a car, there is abundant free street parking directly in front of our house.

description: Gated in an 1880's 4-plex camel-back building with shotgun layout, full of architectural details, front porch, 12.5 ft high ceiling, 10 ft walk-out window, ceiling medallions, mantels and brick chimneys, transom windows with modern comfort.  This unit is perfect for long term and corporate rental with a minimum of one month.  For any questions, inquire with us.  It is gated with lock and in the Garden District with 24/7 security patrol.  It can be rented along with our other units onsite. If this unit is booked, we have another two units in the same building which can accommodate up to 11 people.  This unit has 3 spacious rooms with A/C units (cool and heat combo) in two bedrooms. Upon the front entry, there is bedroom 1 with a queen size bed and a large desk.  The ceiling medallion, 10 ft down to floor walk-out window, one set of mantel and exposed brick wall, as well as the sitting area with a leather couch is all in this room.   Walking through the door going inside you will see the
neighborhood_overview: The property is in Garden District with the district patrol 24/7 (tax money).  If you will be back late at night, feel free to call the patrol a few minutes before you get back.  The patrol officers will be there watching you enter the gate safely.  It is a great relief in New Orleans, even though the neighborhood is rated the top 3 neighborhoods in the entire U.S. A few blocks away you will find a cluster of houses and gardens in all the popular walk tour lists with magnificent architectural details and grand gardens.  The property is 1 block to St. Charles (where the street car is at bounding for either French Quarter or uptown university area), 2 blocks to Prytania Garden District book store, 3 blocks away from Commander's Palace, an upscale restaurant often rated the No. 1 for the city and top 10 in the U.S., and Lafayette Cemetery No. 1, the most toured above-ground and heavily filmed cemetery (right across the street from Commander's Palace) and 4 blocks to the trendy Magazine St
transit: 1 minute walk to St. Charles Street Car line or bus line for all the major tourist destinations in the city.  Uber and taxi are available.

name: Luxury Condo with Onsite Pool Steps from the French Quarter
description: Stroll to all New Orleans has to offer from this centrally located condo. Have the 24-hour onsite concierge book a tour or answer any questions. Steps from the French Quarter and Bourbon Street, you're never far from where the action is.  Located in the heart of everything, your NOLA home offers everything that you could want: beautiful new renovation, well appointed, spa-like bathrooms with great pressure and endless hot water, 24-hour concierge, hot tubs, pool, cabanas, gourmet BBQ station, sun deck, and plenty more. The Natchez blends old New Orleans charm with modern comforts & amenities.
neighborhood_overview: Within easy walking distance of all main attractions downtown, including the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Smoothie King Center, the World War II Museum, Harrah's Casino, and the Aquarium. There are countless amazing bars, restaurants, & venues nearby. If you want to visit the Garden District, just hop on the street car one block away. Business travelers will be happy to know that The Natchez is located in the Central Business District and is a 10 minute walk from the Convention Center.
transit: Many major attractions in New Orleans are easy walking distance from our condo. If you would like to visit Uptown, Mid-City or the Garden District we are only 1 block from the Streetcar stop that will bring you to those parts of town in style. Uber, Lyft, and taxis are all very readily available from the property.

name: The Mazant - Renovated 1880s Mansion in Bywater
description: With 5,000+ sq ft of living space and 1/3 acre of gardens, The Mazant is a historic mansion located in the heart of New Orleans' Bywater arts district - and about 1.5 miles from the French Quarter (30 minutes walking or 8 minutes by Uber).  We are close to Bacchanal, The Joint, The Country Club, Elizabeth's, and The Music Box.  It's perfect for family reunions, wedding parties, company off-sites, and other large groups. Over the past several years we have renovated the property, seeking to preserve historic details including 13' ceilings with plaster medallions, heart pine wood floors, cypress doors, and a 175+ year old oak tree. At the same time, we also updated the layout to more comfortably accommodate large groups: *18-person dining room table *Oversized living room with 75-inch television, surround sound system, and Baldwin upright piano *Private yard (1/3 acre) with fire pit, six-burner propane BBQ, outdoor table, and hammocks *Super-fast WiFi (the top tier that Cox offers) *Fron
neighborhood_overview: Just down river (east) from the French Quarter - stretching from Press Street to the Industrial Canal - is the Bywater, where the mood and pace shift as you enter into the heart of an edgier yet still welcoming neighborhood. The St. Claude Arts District, centered around St. Claude Avenue, is home to more than thirty locations exhibiting visual and performance art, along with an array of artisan crafts. Down Piety Street, the fun continues with restaurants, thrift stores and more galleries. Even the homes, cafes and restaurants seem to capture Bywater's eclectic appreciation for the arts. Spend the afternoon at Crescent Park for some impressive views of downtown New Orleans and the Mississippi River. Afterward, you can thrift your way through the neighborhood before stopping in at an exhibition and finally making your way to dinner. The area's restaurants are among the most innovative in the city and are great places to sit with a cocktail and chat with locals.  Above all, the Marigny a
transit: You can walk to the French Quarter and Frenchmen's Street in about 30 minutes via Crescent Park along the Mississippi River (park entrance is just three blocks away) or through the neighborhood.   As with most urban and semi-urban areas, walking alone late at night (after 10pm) isn't necessarily advised.  Though we've never had anything happen, better safe than sorry and it's really easy to take an Uber to/from the house.

name: Comfy room in historic uptown Nola
description: 1 Br. with queen-sized bed, full closet, armoire, and full bath. Located in the up-and-coming Freret St. area of Uptown. Great for Mardi Gras and Jazz fest, minutes from the St Charles Parade Route, short drive to French Quarter and Fair Grounds. Home to a local New Orleans musician, it's a spacious, renovated 100-year-old, classic "Double-Shotgun" style home. The tall ceilings, original hardwood floors and French shutters give it a cozy and authentic look and feel. It's an upstairs apartment with a beautiful front porch, great for sunsets especially in the spring and summer months! Guests will have access to the front bedroom, full bathroom, kitchen and family room, front and back porch and backyard. Provided I'm not out on a gig, teaching, or rehearsing I'd be happy to show the guests around town, or advise them on the best, venues, restaurants, museums and other attractions. The neighborhood is typically quiet and is centrally located which allows you short travel times to many part
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is typically quiet and is centrally located which allows you short travel times to many parts of the city. About a 10 minute walk to the cafés, bars and restaurants on Freret St. or the historic St. Charles Ave. Streetcar. The neighbors are all very friendly and we are a tight knit community who look out for each other. The nearby elementary school also ensures that it's a safer neighborhood. My downstairs neighbours typically keep to themselves and are both very friendly and accommodating.
transit: There is a bus stop just down the street and the historic St. Charles streetcar is only a 10 minute walk away. The Uber/Lyft drivers here are plentiful, friendly and knowledgeable. A cab would also work in a pinch though I'd always recommend Uber or Lyft first.

name: Jazzy Upscale Condo! Just Min From Frenchman St!
description: Step into the historic Bywater, one of New Orleans’ most vibrant neighborhoods in one of America’s greatest cities. Our laissez-faire nature derives from the heart and is rooted in years of tradition and rebirth. From this cultural identity comes The Saxony, a premier condominium development just blocks from the Mississippi River at the corner of Bartholomew and Burgundy Streets. Our amazing condominium units have been thoughtfully designed to create a harmony of well-planned spaces and convenient amenities. The impressively spacious living areas offer the ultimate condo lifestyle with numerous small touches to make you feel right at home. Each condo is equipped with high speed internet/wifi, Keurig Coffee maker and coffee supplies, plush towels, cookware and utensils. We even provide shampoo, body wash and conditioner. Each unit also has a queen sofa sleeper to sleep additional guest.  Each residence features its own terrace or balcony with spectacular views of the surrounding neighbo
neighborhood_overview: For creative professionals who view the city as an extension of their own four walls, The Saxony is surrounded by a rich array of historic sites, one-of-a-kind businesses, unique restaurants, music venues, and public spaces. We’ve brought together a local group of designers and consultants to capture the true essence of Bywater, so at The Saxony, you’re truly a part of the neighborhood. Located just minutes from historic Frenchmen Street and a $6 Uber ride to downtown New Orleans, Bywater is tucked away into its own diverse community, combining old-time New Orleans culture with a hip, contemporary bohemianism. Spend your days leisurely wandering the vibrant streets, stopping for a coffee, drink, or a bite to eat, or just admiring the charming scenery.
transit: Uber, Bike, Lyft, Taxi

STR #18STR-10530 This listing is unique -  your room and bath are separate from the rest of the house. neighborhood_overview: So many things are just a walk away - coffee shops, restaurants, live music, bars, art venues, and more!  Check out the Frenchmen Art Market, live music on Frenchmen, St. Claude Avenue, Faubourg Wines, St. Roch Market, Crescent Park, Washington Square Park, and the French Market.
transit: Walking distance to many locations.  Street parking generally available though during special events may be limited.  Several bus stops within a few blocks.  Uber, Lyft, and cab-friendly location.   We are just a half block from the N. Rampart/St. Claude Avenue Streetcar line!  The line runs along the edge of the French Quarter on its way to the Tremé, Marigny, and St. Roch neighborhoods, stopping just short of Bywater, but creating a connection to five of the city’s most historic areas, and linking into our existing Canal Street, City Park/Museum, St. Charles, Riverfront and other streetcar lines.

This is safe and leisurely experience. There is free street parking for cars. It is also near the Camellia Grill, where the lines are always present to eat in a place with only counter and stools. Also nearby, the Audobon park, 400 acre park named for John James Audobon, now has a golf course, a park and a zoo. the famous Jacques-Imos Cafe, a colorful creatively delicious creole cafe with a funky colorful truck has table for 2

name: Domio \| Warehouse District \| Penthouse Views \| Chic Two Bedroom
description: Nestled in the heart of the Warehouse District in Downtown NOLA is this stunning two bedroom penthouse boasting floor to ceiling windows, breathtaking balcony views, and all new stainless steel appliances.  Conveniently located near major attractions such as the WWII Museum, Convention Center, the Superdome, French Quarter, and more! This house can take 6 GUESTS. The common space has a sofa bed as well as an air mattress upon request. Also comes fully equipped with all the amenities. Upon entering the home, you'll first find the convenient utility closet with a washer, dryer, iron, and ironing board. Down the hall to the left is the first full bathroom.   The kitchen is equipped with pots, pans, flatware, and more for all your cooking needs. You'll also be provided with a Keurig coffee machine alongside a variety of coffee pods. Further, you'll find the master bedroom featuring a queen size bed and a walk in closet The second bedroom also has a queen size bed.  We are happy to provide
neighborhood_overview: Just down the street from major attractions, food and entertainment, the location of this home is what really makes it special. In the heart of Downtown, minutes from the beautiful shops of Magazine street, and some of the best scenery in all of NOLA. If you are looking for good eats, one spot that is always a recommendation is Peche Seafood Grill. The restaurant has received numerous awards such as Best New Restaurant in America and Top 10 Best restaurants in New Orleans. Downtown New Orleans in never short of entertainment. The best spot for live music and amazing drinks is The Jazz Playhouse. The Playhouse has live performances seven nights a week and they never disappoint. It’s the perfect hangout for a night in New Orleans offering great food and drinks, all in a luxurious and intimate setting. Now walking is one way to enjoy the sights, but to some they may seem more enjoyable while riding on the street car up and down St. Charles Ave. You will be just a short 2 block walk from t
transit: With so much to see and so much to do in NOLA. The streetcar is the best way to get around the city besides walking. The streetcar is a short 5 min walk away. If walking is something you are not fond of, you can always have an Uber drive you around while you take in the sights.

name: 2 bedroom suite at Bluegreen Club La Pension
description: *Booking this listing acknowledges that you have read and agreed to all of the house rules. ***Stay must start on the Friday.*** You will be staying at my timeshare at Bluegreen Club La Pension. You have full run of my 2 bedroom, 1 1/2 bath, partial kitchen suite. Kitchen has a convection microwave oven, small fridge, coffee maker, toaster, sink and dishes. Also available is a free washer and dryer located in the resort. Soap is available free of charge at the reception desk. The Big Easy is renowned for its eccentric and flamboyant culture, Mardi Gras parades, soulful jazz and irresistible Cajun and Creole cuisine. And Bluegreen Club La Pension™ is in the historic French Quarter where you can revel in the essence of the city while enjoying a comfortable stay in a roomy 1-or 2-bedroom villa. Located in the historic French Quarter and filled with artwork representing the thriving local art community here, Bluegreen Club La Pension represents the city as it stands today–an eclectic mix o
neighborhood_overview: There's always a friendly face behind the front desk area. All your cares will melt away with our full-time concierge, skilled in guest house etiquette and an expert on New Orleans sights and sounds. Your concierge can help you arrange restaurant reservations, city tours, show tickets, private transportation or whatever suits your needs. Just ask and consider it done. Why not stop by the five star new world Italian restaurant, Cafe Giovanni and let Chef Duke feed you, while you enjoy your stay at Club La Pension.
transit: The Canal Street Streetcar is only steps away. Bus is half a block. Walking distance to most attractions. 3 blocks to Bourbon Street, 2 blocks to Royal St., walking distance to Frenchman Street. Several blocks to Harrah's Casino and Riverfront Outlet Mall.

We strive to make your trip as enjoyable as possible.   We've been airbnb hosts and guests for years and look forward to hosting you! The house is a traditional shotgun with 2 PRIVATE bedrooms. Internet and TV with cable, Netflix, etc. for your convenience.      The next room is a dining room. You will have access to a large front porch where you can watch the sunset.  It is well lit, decorated, and has a grand piano in the front room. You'll have access to a nice large front porch that faces the sunset, your own bathroom, and a shared living room and kitchen. I'm happy to offer any advice and answer questions about the home, neighborhood, or New Orleans in general. It is a quiet, residential neighborhood of mostly New Orleans natives.  It runs adjacent to the Bywater (6 blocks away), where there are popular bars and restaurants to check out. I am 6 blocks from St. Claude Ave, where the St. Claude bus line runs into the French Quarter.  I would also recommend taking a che

name: Heart of Mid-City- close to everything
description: Newly renovated two-bedroom apartment in a quiet, safe part of Mid-City, with easy access to major festivals and downtown. Central heat and AC. Fully furnished kitchen. Closets in each bedroom. Modern lighting. New appliances in kitchen. Water filtration system. One block off the Canal Street streetcar line. Close to shopping, restaurants, bars, laundry, parks. Pet- and kid-friendly. Upper unit is owner occupied. Two large, independent bedrooms with closets (a rarity in New Orleans), one bathroom with tub, fully furnished apartment ready for your New Orleans vacation!  Includes Wifi. Large bedroom has a queen sized bed and smaller bedroom has a full sized bed. First-floor apartment includes central air and heat, and is well insulated for optimal climate control. Kitchen includes new fridge, gas range/oven, dishwasher, microwave, toaster oven, pots, pans, glasses (wine, rocks, pint), plates and bowls with mugs, french press, tea kettle, nice silverware, knives, hot pads, dish towels, me
neighborhood_overview: Apartment is located one block off world-famous Canal Street at Cleveland Avenue and South Telemachus Street, and is part of the Mid-City Neighborhood Association security district, which means on-duty police officers patrol the neighborhood regularly and will respond promptly to any sort of concern. Entrance to yard and apartment is through a steel gate. The Canal streetcar stop is one block away, meaning it's a quick ride downtown in one direction or to the park, museum or shopping in the other. There is a staffed laundromat on the corner -- should you need to wash clothes, just drop them off! Rouse's grocery store is a 10-minute walk, with a Winn-Dixie and a number of other retailers (Five Guys, Pinkberry, etc.) are across the street. Many excellent local restaurants are nearby (Katie's, Mona's, Ruby Slipper, Theo's, Juan's Flying Burrito, Angelo Brocato's, Venezia, Blue Dot, etc.) It's half a mile to Bayou St. John and the Thursday Crescent City Farmers Market, public library, etc.
transit: Apartment is one block from the Canal Street streetcar which travels to downtown and also City Park. It costs $1.25 each way. There is also a bus line that travels up and down Canal Street.  Street parking is ample and available.

name: Stay in style, walk to French Quarter, free bikes!
description: Wake up feeling recharged in the private suite of this historic New Orleans Creole Cottage.  Located in the hip Bywater neighborhood. Escape to a comforting space with a private bedroom, sitting room, private bath, and original high end design finishes.  Coffee, assorted tea, snacks and bottled water are complementary.  Bikes with helmets are provided and the bus is on the corner. Enjoy the swimming pool 1 block away at The Country Club. Queen bed with all white bedding, TV with Amazon Firestick with HBO, Prime, Netflix, etc.  Beautiful sitting room off of bedroom.  Mini fridge and keurig coffee maker in the rental.  Bathroom has a walk in shower, no tub.  Free bikes with helmets and locks provided.  Small kitchenette - mini fridge and coffee maker available. Quiet block. Many restaurants, bars, cafes within 3 blocks of house. We live on site but respect guests privacy but are readily available to answer any questions or give recommendations to guests. The apartment has it's own privat
neighborhood_overview: The Bywater/Marigny neighborhood has a vibrant art scene - with local artisans' galleries, coffee shops, funky live music venues, and art markets, embodies the essence of these adjacent neighborhoods. The food scene is mixed with trendy spots & locally founded, casual digs - take your pick. All walking distance. Explore the St. Claude Arts District, Crescent Park along the river, pool 1 block away at The Country Club. Take in the colorful, historic architecture while still being minutes away from the French Quarter.
transit: With 2 bikes provided, you can easily get around most of the city by bike. We are also a scenic 15 minute walk to the French Quarter, 12 minute walk to Frenchman Street. We recommend walking down Royal Street which takes you directly to Frenchman Street and the French Quarter.

name: Mid-City Gem Close to Everywhere Great in NOLA!
description: Location. Location. Location. Enjoy the best that Mid-City has to offer in this brand new home centrally located on a rapidly-developing block in a fast-emerging neighborhood and within minutes of everything you need to play and dine in NOLA. The property features: * stainless steel, energy-efficient appliances;  * granite countertops;  * beautiful hardwood floors;  * central air and heat;  * indoor washer and dryer;  * spacious closets;  * lots of windows and natural light;  * tiled kitchen and bath flooring; and  * ceiling fans throughout. The entire space is privately and exclusively yours throughout the entirety of your stay! Do not hesitate to call if anything is needed at all throughout the course of your visit. Located within blocks of Canal Street, Tulane Avenue and Carrollton Avenue, the home is walking distance to a number of popular food and beverage establishments including TRÈO Restaurant, Twelve Mile Limit, Finn McCool's Irish Pub, the Ruby Slipper Cafe, Namese, 504 Craft
neighborhood_overview: Located within blocks of Canal Street, Tulane Avenue and Carrollton Avenue, the home is walking distance to a number of popular food and beverage establishments including TRÈO Restaurant, Twelve Mile Limit, Finn McCool's Irish Pub, the Ruby Slipper Cafe, Namese, 504 Craft Beer Reserve, Juan's Flying Burrito and Angelo Brocato, to name a few. The world famous Parkway Tavern (for po-boys) is only a short drive away.  Groceries can be purchased just a short drive away at Rouse's, Costco, Whole Foods or the popular Mid-City Market, which is anchored by Winn-Dixie and features a number of popular fast-casual dining, seated dining and service retail businesses (visit (Website hidden by Airbnb) for more details). When it’s carnival time, you’ll be on Canal Street in just minutes to yell “throw me something, Mister!” to the masked riders of Endymion—one of New Orleans’ most beloved Mardi Gras krewes.
transit: Enjoy easy access by bicycle, car, car share or streetcar (5 blocks away) to a number of area destinations including the New Orleans BioDistrict (featuring the new LSU Hospital and VA Medical Center), the prestigious Xavier University of Louisiana, City Park, the New Orleans Museum of Art and Botanical Garden, the Fair Grounds Race Course (home to the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival!), Bayou St. John, and Rock 'n' Bowl. Drive just a few short minutes and hop on I-10/I-610 to get to the CBD/Warehouse District (5-10 minutes), the New Orleans International Airport (15-20 minutes), Baton Rouge (75 minutes), and the beaches and casinos of the Mississippi Gulf Coast (90 minutes).  After all: it's called "Mid-City" for a reason!

This home is welcoming and cozy, yet still allows large parties to enjoy privacy while remaining close. The space has beautiful modern light fixtures and maintains historic charm with original hardwood floors! Come feel at home with us and get an authentic New Orleans experience!! Guests have access to this entire home. Hosts are always available to guests. As you stroll and tour this neighborhood don't be surprised if local asks you, "How's ya mama n them?" cause this is a real authentic neighborhood with a true New Orleans flair.  Come as a visitor and leave as family.

name: Colorful and Bright Designer Home \| Pool, near FQ
description: Professionally designed and decorated to put you at ease as soon as you walk through the front door, our 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom luxury home is your ultimate NOLA travel destination. Featuring upscale amenities, local art, and a pool in the backyard, our home provides you with a first class New Orleans experience. Whether you’re visiting the Big Easy for business or pleasure, this is the perfect spot for you to access everything Nola has to offer. - Our pool is perfect for an early morning dip or lounging with a book or friends as the sun sets on Nola. *Please note the pool is shared with 2 houses next door that we also operate as vacation rentals* - Our professional interior decorators carefully selected local artwork to reflect the vibrant culture of New Orleans throughout the home. - Home features a chef’s kitchen which comes fully stocked with essential cookware and more than enough place settings for your whole group. - Other amenities include a WiFi, Smart TV with apps, central AC
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located steps from the French Quarter in the historic and culturally vibrant Treme, just blocks from North Rampart Street. This is a safe, friendly, and laid-back area. For those interested in experiencing the gastronomy of the city, some of the best bars, restaurants, and cafes in the country are located in our immediate neighborhood. We are also within walking distance to the African American Museum, St. Augustine Church, Louis Armstrong Park, and other notable sites in NOLA. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
transit: Our home is located directly next to the French Quarter, which makes getting around convenient and easy. We are a 6 minute walk to the edge of the French Quarter, and a 15 minute walk to Frenchmen Street. The Marigny/Bywater is also reachable by walking, biking, or Uber/Lyft.

Very spacious - luxurious private master suite. Need more space? There are 2 additional units - https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/31647014 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/31647915 License: 18STR (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) A beautiful, unique space in the Faubourg Marigny neighborhood. Shared courtyard. It is designed and furnis

Art markets, galleries, retail shops, restaurants and music venues are within steps of the condo. Perfect area for guests who enjoy music and art in an area with a storied history. Walk or bike to everything that is New Orleans culture!  Artists are likely unable to find a neighborhood with better proximity to some of the best artistic options that New Orleans has to offer. Art centers and galleries are abundant in the Marigny and Bywater, increasing in number as you move towards the French Quarter.
