name: Lilac
description: Welcome! I live in the heart of the 7th ward home. Minimal and sweet. You have one of the three bedrooms to yourself in my home. I am a quiet, creative type, and keep to myself. I am a full time student studying Art History at UNO. This is a brand new home  and its filled with my books and simple kitchen items you are welcome to use. This location is not in the heart of any tourist kind of district. You will take uber or bicycle to get around like most everyone else who lives here. Not to despair, you are actually central and within a 5 minute drive to almost anywhere in the city.  Plan for blue biking or a quick uber/bus ride!  I clean a lot but do not sweep every single day. Your room will be immaculate, though. I keep the house around 74/75 degrees.  I keep things open and airy in the house because it makes me feel comfortable and creative to live a life uncluttered. I set out coffee, fruit, and oatmeal for guests. I don't like microwaves so I don't own one. You can use the kitchen
neighborhood_overview: I live in a special neighborhood which has little old roads leading to many major getaway streets in New Orleans. By this I mean, you can get almost anywhere from my house! I am an easy bike ride or bus ride anywhere you want to go. French quarter and Bywater are about the same distance as getting to mid city or fairgrounds so this is a special location. My neighborhood also has some blighted houses which can be a shock for most people from developed nations(including our own), but this is an unfortunate fact of life here in new Orleans-and one that the city and its people do care about-myself included. Having visitors and tourists here is a blessing because it brings life and joy to otherwise empty spaces. I hope that the potholes and the infrastructure don't inhibit you. I also will say that my neighborhood is racially almost completely black. I respect my neighbors and the families and I will not tolerate any sort of, veiled or otherwise, racism against it.  I feel safe here, welcom
transit: Blue city bikes are available! Most people here use only bicycle, and you will not have one so take lyft and uber anywhere you are trying to go.  Usually a ride from my home to the quarter is about 7$ also the norta application for your phone tracks buses and streetcars in real time and I live very close to many bus stops.

description: Step into the classic claw-foot tub, then step outside with drinks and some tunes for a leisurely evening on the balcony. Property is 14 min drive to the French Quarter. 30+ day extended stay available! Just ask!  STR: 18STR-10399 Located on the 2nd floor in a historical New Orleans home. The unique local art work give this space a one of a kind vibe. The balcony is the perfect spot for enjoying a night in and socializing, or watching the world go by. There is a shared w/d downstairs. name: Domio Baronne St. \| Stunning Studio Suite \| Pool + Gym + Laundry
description: Domio Baronne St. is the perfect place for large groups of families and friends to enjoy curated apartment-style living with hotel amenities. Located in the heart of the Warehouse District, guests are minutes away from the French Quarter and Convention Center. As New Orleans’ first apartment-hotel, Domio Baronne St. boasts a range of luxe rooms—from cozy studios to four bedroom suites with full kitchens. Enjoy the lively atmosphere of our rooftop pool or break a sweat in our fitness center. A cozy and comfortable studio perfect for your quick New Orleans getaway. Fitted with a full kitchen, Casper® mattress, sofa chairs, bathroom, and more. 525 square feet (average) Room: Queen bed Disclaimer: This room is located in the interior areas of the hotel and will have no access to windows. Design, decorations, and furnishings may vary from images shown in the listing. Enjoy brand new, modern facilities inside of this historic Warehouse District building. Equipped with a game room, a 24-hour
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of the Warehouse District, old New Orleans meets new. Also known as the Arts District, the Warehouse District is filled with many museums, brunch spots, and bars for visitors to explore. You'll be minutes from the Ernest N. Morial Convention Center and the French Quarter. Exploring the French Quarter is essential to an authentic New Orleans experience. That’s why we are perfectly situated from the historic neighborhood—close enough by foot, trolley, and car, but far away enough for a sound sleep.
transit: Being centrally located, you will have plenty of Uber, Lyft, Streetcars, Blue Bikes, and more transportation services available to use to explore New Orleans. Domio Baronne St. is approximately 20-25 minutes away by car from the Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport. There is a third party valet garage service available at the property for $40 per car per night. Blue Bike Hub - Julia Street & St. Charles Ave (3 blocks away) St. Charles Streetcar Stop (Line #12) - Carondelet at Julia (2 blocks away) Rampart-St. Claude Streetcar Stop(Line #49) - S Rampart at Julia (3-4 blocks away)

name: Airy Mid-City Turquoise Home
description: With 12 foot ceilings and original hardwood floors throughout, this spacious Mid-City shotgun house is quintessentially New Orleans.  The house is 3.5 blocks from the streetcar line for access to the French Quarter and is walking/biking distance to a number of bars and restaurants, as well as the beautiful green Bayou St. John and City Park.  STR Number 19STR-17405. My favorite thing about my house is all the space! It has 12 foot ceilings and a huge common space and kitchen, along with two perfectly sized bedrooms and a backyard for green space. Guests have access to the entire house. I give my guests space but am available when needed. This shotgun is on a calm and friendly street that is within 1-4 blocks from a few of the coolest "locals" bars in the city (Finn McCool's, Twelve Mile Limit, for example), as well as some great restaurants (Echo Pizza, Biscuits and Buns on Banks).  And within a short bike ride you will be at City Park and the delicious restaurants on Esplanade.  This
neighborhood_overview: This shotgun is on a calm and friendly street that is within 1-4 blocks from a few of the coolest "locals" bars in the city (Finn McCool's, Twelve Mile Limit, for example), as well as some great restaurants (Echo Pizza, Biscuits and Buns on Banks).  And within a short bike ride you will be at City Park and the delicious restaurants on Esplanade.  This house is in truly in an ideal location for experiencing some of the best of New Orleans.
transit: 3.5 blocks from the Canal Street trolley, which will zip you right down to the French Quarter! And walking/biking distance to the great places in Mid-City.

name: Cute retreat near Garden District
description: Two blocks to the Garden District, the street car and the Mardi Gras parades on St. Charles Ave. Our newly updated room in a recently renovated home built in the 1850s has lots of charm, a poster bed with a super comfy mattress, its own a separate entrance & a full private bathroom.  Located in the Faubourg Livaudais neighborhood, you'll be in the middle of everything in a friendly residential area with lots of neighborhood bars, restaurants and historic buildings nearby.   License #19STR-08001 Our place is just a couple quick blocks to the world famous Garden District, Commander's Palace restaurant, shopping along Magazine Street,  Lafayette Cemetery No. 1, and a whole lot more.  The street car can take you Uptown to Tulane, Loyola, and Audubon Park or downtown to the Central Business District and the French Quarter.   We're right in the center of New Orleans so most Uber/Lyft rides are about $10-15 to get about anywhere.   And, we have lots of free parking on the street in front of o
neighborhood_overview: We LOVE our neighborhood. It's full of some of the most fun, diverse,  friendly and outgoing folks we've ever met.   If you need directions, suggestions on what to do or a good recommendation on a favorite restaurant, folks will be happy to help out. There's a great convenience store two blocks away as well as several bars.  A short 15 minute walk through the Garden District gets you to the galleries, shops, restaurants and bars along Magazine Street.
transit: Located right in the center of the city, we are a short cab ride or trip on the street car to the universities uptown or to the French Quarter.  Most trips by cab or uber around town are around $10-$15 and usually take less than 15 minutes.

name: Steps to Streetcar Uptown
description: This is a perfect spot! The spacious 1 bdrm with loft sleeps up to 4 and is conveniently located 1 house off of the St Charles streetcar. It is walking distance to the Tulane and Loyola universities and many restaurants, bars and other attractions. Located in the Carrollton/Riverbend area. This spacious 1 bedroom apt located on the second floor has an open floor plan with a loft. It's a traditional Nola home with hardwood floors and high ceilings. There is a queen bed, queen sofa bed and a loft with a single love seat sleeper sofa. For special events there is a blow up mattress upon request that will fit nicely in the loft. The kitchen is fully equipped for cooking. Plenty of extra bed linens and towels are included. Owner lives on property. You will have access to 2 tvs with Netflix and Amazon your own washer and dryer, Internet, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. We will be available most of the time and be happy to answer any questions or give recommendations. Early check in or lat

Tulane and Loyola university as well Audubon park and zoo are minutes away,. There are plenty of famous restaurants, coffee shops and shopping nearby. Live like a local!

name: Frenchmen House "Green Room"
description: Victorian-style 100+ year old house on Frenchmen Street -- home of the best collection of jazz clubs in New Orleans -- and still only blocks from the French Quarter. GREEN ROOM Frenchmen House is my home.  I share it with my puppy Charles (a huge, cuddly golden retriever), Molly (king of the feline world), and my airbnb guests.  I have three guest rooms. The house retains the architectural details that make New Orleans homes interesting and beautiful -- 13 ft. ceilings, transom windows, original wood floors, and double parlor with functioning pocket doors.  Very few renovations have altered this original home, and its charm represents the homes of its era.  The house is a side-hall shotgun, so unlike a traditional shotgun, one does not have to walk thru each room to get to the next.  Great backyard for entertaining -- very private courtyard setting.  Smoking is allowed in the backyard. PARKING:  Easy on-street parking, no meters, no time restrictions and always spaces available on my b
neighborhood_overview: I love that my neighborhood is just far enough away from the hubbub to be (relatively) quiet and actually be able to park a car, yet close enough to be in the midst of it all with a very short walk.
transit: The new streetcar line runs from my corner on Frenchmen Street along St. Claude & Rampart to the train station/bus depot.  There is also a streetcar line that runs up the river from the end of Frenchmen to the Convention Center.  Both of these streetcars provide easy transfers to both the Canal Street line and the St. Charles Ave. line.  There are also bus stops right on the corner.

name: Uptown 1bd Apt w/Private Entrance
description: The sunny, clean, & private apt is on the first floor of our 90 yr old home, just blocks from the streetcar and the universities. Recently renovated, it has been well appointed with luxurious touches, attention to detail, and your comfort in mind. NOLA STR Lic #18STR-14189 The apt is meant to be a wonderful place to relax and wind down when not out exploring the city.  It is cozy and comfortable, light and airy, and fully stocked as your home away from home.  It is a newer listing, just renovated a last year. You are greeted with a warm welcome sign and brightly colored outside furniture for you to baste in the sun or enjoy breakfast outside. You enter into the fully stocked kitchen with new: *Stainless steel refrigerator and full-size stove/oven *Kitchen appliances including a microwave, toaster, coffee pot, blender (for margaritas!…or smoothies! lol), mixer, and croc pot *Service for 8 including plates, bowls, silverware, mugs, and glassware *Pots, pans, cookware, bakeware *Every ute
neighborhood_overview: I absolutely love living Uptown.  I have wanted to live in this neighborhood my whole life and still pinch myself after nearly 5 years, amazed that I get to live here.  There is just something about running my errands under 300 yr old oaks while driving by 200 yr old Victorian mansions.  I am born-and-raised and it never gets old. Our house, the apartment, is in what they call the University area of Uptown bc it is just several blocks off of Tulane's campus and about a half mile from Loyola's campus.  The place is great for students and parents as well!  The house is also in the most sought-after school district in the city with the #1 elementary school in the state just 4 blocks away (why I bought the house and where my little one goes to school)--so I find it to be a mix of university students and young families.  So we are very family friendly as well!  They also call the area "Carrollton" as it was once it's own little town outside of New Orleans by the name of Carrollton and is ju
transit: There is usually ample street parking available in front of and near the house. As I mentioned, I am just 6 blocks from Carrollton where you can catch the streetcar straight up Carrollton Ave to St. Charles Ave to Downtown (the CBD, Quarter, etc.).  A lot of locals use this as their daily transportation.  It is also a great way to get Downtown if you don't want to park or drive home after a long night!  ;-) You can also catch it on anywhere along St. Charles.  That is the green streetcar line (they are literally painted green), there is also a red streetcar line (yep, painted red) that goes up Canal St. to downtown, you can catch that at the corner of Carrollton and Canal. There are also several bus routes near by.  There is the 16 that goes straight down Claiborne to Downtown; the 15 goes straight down to Freret to one of the hottest strips of restaurants in the city right now and then Downtown; the 11 goes down Magazine; the 10 down Tchoupitoulas; and the 90 straight up Carrollton to

name: ST. CHARLES AVE CONDO-EASY WALK TO THE SUPERDOME!
description: This condo is on St. Charles Ave., a few blocks toward Uptown, from Lee's Circle.  It's an easy walk to the French Quarter, the Warehouse Dist, and the Central Business Dist.  Or enjoy a relaxing ride on the Street Car, right in front of the bldg.  You have to check out some of the great restaurants that are within easy walking distance of this location, ie Peche, Cochon, Herbsaint, Emeril's Delmonico (Across the Street), August, Mr. B's Bistro, Antoine's, Galatoires, etc. I recommend them all! There is nothing like walking around New Orleans, from the Garden District, to the Warehouse District, the Central Business District where the Superdome and Lafayete Park are located, and of course, the French Quarter.  And a little longer walk, right past the House of Blues and Iconic Cafe du Monde, takes you to Frenchman Street, which is where you will find that interesting and entertaining New Orleans music scene. And you will have a place to stay with a great view, and a secure covered parki
neighborhood_overview: Many of the finest restaurants and bars such as Peche, Herb Saint, Couchons,  Ave. Pub, and the Circle Bar are easy walking distance from the condo.  One of Emeril's Restaurants, Dominico, is practically right across the street, and the WWII Museum is only a few blocks away.
transit: The St. Charles Street Car Line runs right in front of the bldg, with a car stop only 1/2 block away.

name: Artist's mural filled shotgun home
description: Built in 1870, our original shotgun home is close to everything! Magazine street, the French Quarter, & the St. Charles street car line are all 5 minutes away. I made this home into an art piece. The murals, outdoor shower,  and all our unusual plants surround you. This is not your typical Airb&b! We take pride in making our space special. Permit number - 18STR-07615 - Please read our house rules before you decide to stay with us. For real. Seriously. Read the house rules. This house is off the charts amazing. I know every inch of it and have really put all my love and energy into making it a beautiful place to stay. It's a very old home, and I haven't really made that many changes to it. Understand this is not like a hotel at all in any way. If you are looking for a pristine space, or something newly remodeled, don't book our home. If the walls could talk you'd understand... It's old, old New Orleans. You have access to everything except my side of the house. There is an outdoor showe
neighborhood_overview: The Halfmoon bar is my favorite spot and its super close. I painted all the murals in their courtyard. The Ruby Slipper (right around the corner) is so good for breakfast! There are about 15 coffee shops all within 5 blocks. My favorite coffee spot is HiVolt. There is a corner store called "Saint Vincent" on First and Constance, 2 blocks away, with the best beer selection ever! I love the Irish Channel! Just go for a walk.
transit: The Street Car is super close & bus routes are also everywhere. Taxies & Lyfts are fantastically cheap because everything is very close. (8 bucks to the quarter from my front door) If you are here during a festival or other big event, I'd use our local United Cab as they don't surcharge.

name: ☆2BR w/Balcony Near St Roch Market - 10 Min. Walk☆
description: A true gem in the middle of the historical Saint-Claude area of New Orleans. This bright and spacious house is the perfect place to relax and entertain. Only minutes away from the French quarter and the Business District, this home is perfectly located to ensure you the best experience in New Orleans.  This home has spacious common areas including a full kitchen and dining area, and a beautiful balcony. This home is great for families, groups of friends, and more. The house is composed of two separate but connected units, both equipped with a full bathroom, kitchen, living room and dining area. This is the second unit which has two bedrooms while the first unit has three bedrooms. The house can be rented out as a whole (for a total of five bedrooms) or partially as both units have their own entrances and can be locked away from each other. Each bedroom comes with a lock and key as to ensure the safety of your belongings during your stay.  *** THIS BOOKING IS FOR THE UNIT WITH TWO BEDRO
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located steps away from the Saint-Claude corridor, one of New Orleans' premiere dining and entertainment destinations. Every restaurant on that strip is bound to give you a taste what the Crescent City is all about, but we do have some favourites like the St. Roch Market, which is known for its eclectic food and drink stalls, and outdoor seating.  If you're in the mood to walk and ingest some culture, Studio Be is a 35,000 square foot warehouse filled with vibrant and culturally relevant art. It's a pleasant 15 minute walk away from the house and definitely worth the visit. If you have more specific interests, feel free to talk to us for more tailored recommendations, which we'd be more than happy to provide for you.
transit: The house is very well located and there are many great businesses within walking distance. Bike paths have also started emerging all over the city helped by the addition Blue Bike, a bike-sharing service that allows you to leisurely get around the city. Of course, driving is still the easiest way to get around, but there are always other options once you get closer to Uptown and Downtown, where streetcars run fairly regularly. Finally, ride-sharing services like Uber and Lyft are very reliable and available throughout the city.

name: Vintage Modern Townhouse Uptown - Close to Tulane!
description: No car needed - easy access to all the action.  Enjoy all of New Orleans from this historic double in Uptown/Carrollton - 1/2 block to city bus, 3 blocks to street car - go anywhere without a car.  You'll LOVE this new renovation in vintage industrial style. Just remodeled, everything is brand-new.  Stainless appliances and all new custom kitchen... all beautifully designed without changing the New Orleans charm of this 1920s raised basement double.  The décor is vintage industrial with serene, sophisticated colors and furnishings. Your stay will be in the upper left unit.  You have your own front porch and a parking spot in the driveway.  It's super-easy to get around town from here.  Just hop a city bus at the corner, or stroll three blocks to the Carrollton Station of the streetcar line.   The streetcar can take you all the way from Uptown into the French Quarter and soon, even into the St. Claude shops and neighborhoods.   No need to cook, either.  Plenty of restaurants, deliveries
neighborhood_overview: Uptown/Carrollton is true New Orleans, near Tulane; not just a party, but a gathering of neighbors who truly love their city.  You never know when there will be an event, a parade, a special celebration nearby... and this neighborhood is an authentic experience of being a resident of the city.  Visit many local restaurants and bars on Oak and Maple Streets - just a quick ride on the street car - or use your base as a place to unwind before joining the party in the French Quarter or Warehouse District.
transit: The bus stop is literally one house away.  From the front steps, walk 1/2 block to Claiborne Ave.  Turn right on Claiborne and walk just three blocks to the Carrollton Station of the street car line.  It's the "end of the line," or the "beginning of the line" on the streetcar route throughout the city.   Uber and taxis are plentiful... it's easiest to leave your car in the driveway and avoid those parking tickets!

Very spacious home with three bedrooms and huge living space. Perfect for larger parties to feel the comforts of our home, have privacy, yet be able to mingle with family and friends. Guests have access to this entire home Hosts are always available to guests. We like to give our guests privacy while on vacation, as we like when we are vacationing, but we are a text message away in case of emergency! name: Spacious Uptown Retreat
description: Come stay in a brand new renovation completed in Jan. 2016. Chic and relaxing, we provide everything a traveler needs. Minutes from Tulane/Loyola Universities and just a couple miles from the FQ, Downtown NOLA, and Central Business District. Fully furnished! Renovated January 2016.  Custom kitchen with refrigerator, stove, microwave, utensils, coffee maker, pots/pans, and knives. Grocery is blocks away with great selection of prepared foods, beer, and wine.  Master has a king sized bed in bedroom and 2 additional rooms have queen sized beds. All beds new! High quality Egyptian cotton sheets. Large closets in bedroom stocked with iron & ironing board, extra pillows, linens, and towels. Modern bathrooms with showers and baths (hair dryer provided). Business travelers will love the free wifi, dining table for working, 24 hour check in, and ease of commute to Downtown. Video monitored stairway leads you to your front porch and door. Enjoy the outdoors on the front porch...well, assuming it
neighborhood_overview: The main street is broad Carrollton Avenue, lined with live oaks, with the St. Charles Avenue Streetcar running on the "neutral ground" or central median. The streetcar barn is a block off the avenue in Carrollton, on Willow St., and the landmark Camellia Grill diner is near the corner of St. Charles and Carrollton Avenues. The old Neoclassical Carrollton court house building is on Carrollton Avenue near the Mississippi. The neighborhood and Avenue are pronounced "kaa-rull-ton" or "kaa-ril-tin" by residents and other uptowners, but many people from the downtown parts of New Orleans (especially those born in the mid 20th century and earlier) pronounce the names as "Karl- ton". Tulane University and Loyola University New Orleans are just a few blocks below Carrollton, and many students, faculty, and staff live in the area and patronize the businesses there. Small businesses line Maple Street In addition to Carrollton Avenue and Saint Charles Avenue, the neighborhood still retains two "ne
transit: Minutes from everything! A quick 5 mile drive to French Quarter and the Central Business District of New Orleans. Blocks from Palmer Park for children's playgrounds and only 1 block from Carrollton Avenue for running and biking. The Historic Street Car line is so close you can hear it while sitting on the porch. Walk to restaurants, bars, and stores on fabulous Oak Street.

This historic neighborhoo
neighborhood_overview: The French Quarter, Garden District, and Faubourg Marigny have always been great destinations for visitors to New Orleans, but the city's revitalized Arts District is giving travelers yet another reason to come to the Crescent City. This historic neighborhood - filled with amazing art galleries, fine restaurants, and world-class museums, has become a bustling center of attention in the heart of downtown New Orleans. History The Warehouse District, known today as the New Orleans Arts District, was originally established as an industrial area in the 19th century to store grain, coffee and produce shipped through the Port of New Orleans. As commerce, trade and industry practices evolved over time, the area's prosperity faded and the once busy streets became eerily quiet. The transformation from an urban wasteland to what many have called “the SoHo of the South" began in 1976 with the opening of the Contemporary Arts Center (CAC). The 10,000-square-foot complex is still entertaining and en
transit: Street trolley is one block away on Saint Charles and a few blocks away on Canal. Everything else is at a walkable distance. Across the street is the Renaissance hotel where you can easily catch a taxi to any destination in the City.

name: Bohemian Bywater Cottage
description: Very bright and clean, open cottage -perfect vacation home in New Orleans. Walking distance to wonderful restaurants and bars of the Marigny and Bywater neighborhood.  Wonderful garden to sit outside and smell the night blooming jasmine. Adorable one bedroom cottage located in the popular Bywater neighborhood in New Orleans. Fully furnished with queen size bed in bedroom. This cottage is newly renovated, central a/c, hardwood floors, beautiful high ceilings, ceramic tile in bathroom. Tastefully decorated with local folk art, with a mix of vintage style New Orleans. Huge farm table to enjoy breakfast in the kitchen. Music inspired living room with record player and vinyls for your enjoyment. Fenced courtyard to sit outside and drink coffee, while enjoying the view. Walking distance to the popular restaurants, Satsuma, Markey's Bar, Bywater Country Club and other coffee shops in the Bywater. Walking distance to the Art Galleries on St. Claude, and many of the bars as well.  Three blocks
neighborhood_overview: The Bywater is a neighborhood a bit east (down river) from the French Quarter with a  mix of locals who grew up here, and more recent bohemian arrivals. Artists and musicians call this neighborhood home. It is primarily residential but with amazing restaurants and entertainment everywhere; there are neighborhood bars, restaurants and randomly placed edgy found-object art scattered throughout the neighborhood. Travelers and residents from other parts of the city are flocking to this neighborhood's old-time, laid-back charm.
transit: Walking is the best way to get around the Bywater. And biking of course. Also- public transportation (the #5) will take you straight to French Quarter every 40 minutes.

name: Frenchmen Retreat
description: We are conveniently located on Frenchmen Street, near the French Quarter, Crescent Park, Marigny, the St. Claude corridor.  This is a prime location for enjoying some of the best of what New Orleans has to offer— live music, food, art, and neighborhood life.  Your room is separate from the rest of the house, and has a private bathroom with shower. It has a Queen sized bed, a Mini-fridge with freezer, single-serve coffee maker, and microwave. STR License 19STR-01293 The space is a great getaway for couples or solo travelers looking for a comfortable place to rest and get refreshed from a busy day or night in New Orleans. You'll enter through the backyard, and pass through the workshop and resident's sitting room to access your private room and bathroom.  There are no shared spaces available to guests, just a shared entry through the back of the house. I'll pretty much leave you to enjoy your stay on your own, but I gladly will be available to answer any questions your may have and give
neighborhood_overview: So many things are just a walk away - coffee shops, restaurants, live music, bars, art venues, and more! Check out live music on Frenchmen, St. Claude Avenue, Faubourg Wines, St. Roch Market, Crescent Park, Washington Square Park, and the French Market.
transit: The house is within half a block of the Rampart/St. Claude streetcar line, giving you access to just about anywhere in the city.  All the music and club action on Frenchmen is just four blocks away.  The heart of the French Quarter is an easy 15 minute stroll.  Uber, Lyft, and taxi cabs are all readily available. If you are driving in, free street parking is almost always available in front of the house.  Major events and weekend nights can be tougher so you might have to park a bit further down the street.

It's your own private space with a fully equipped kitchen.  We have a 55" flatscreen Tv with cable. The mattresses are new. A place to call home away from home! AutoNo problem street parking and some Space is available on property first come first serve We are always a text or phone call away! Famed Mid City District with neighborhood grocery, restaurants, bars with music venues all within four blocks! A 3 short block walk to take the streetcar to all of the top tourist spots.  Take the hassle out of driving headaches and parking fees. My recommen

name: The Peach Palace - NOLA
description: Vibrant, bright, shotgun style home in the heart of New Orleans. Spacious set up, three porches to relax on, and in the wonderful St. Roch community, minutes away from everything New Orleans. This home was built by a NOLA nonprofit. Walking distance to many New Orleans classics including Bywater, Marigny, Frenchman, French Quarter, St. Roch Cemetary, the Healing Center, and more bars and restaurants than one can count. We have a Great Dane and two cats! You will have a private room (with lock) and a full size double bed for 1-2 guests. You will have your own private bath/shower/tub and access to shared spaces including living room, kitchen (bring your own food), dining room, front and side porch, washer/dryer, wifi. Relax in a welcoming home with plenty of space, a desk that is yours for the stay to get work done in the living room, and local hosts that can help you make the most of your visit. We do have pets (a dog and two cats), and you can have as little or as much interaction with
neighborhood_overview: St. Roch has a long and rich history. It is centrally located and convenient to all things New Orleans, many of which are walkable. We have rarely had to spend more than 7 or 8 bucks if we do use a ride service like lyft or uber. Neighbors here like to sit on their front porches and are friendly as well as look out for each other. We encourage you to follow the southern hospitality and say hello! This neighborhood is experiencing changes (some are good and some are problematic ie gentrification) and we ask that people be mindful, aware and respectful. Embrace this community and it will embrace you.
transit: Easy access to both major highways (I-10 and I-610). Bus stops 3 minutes. Walk to St. Claude Ave and arts district down the historical St. Roch Avenue 10-15 minutes. Extremely bikeable, with New Orleans Blue Bike rental station 3 blocks away. 5 minute walk to the magnificent St. Roch Cemetary, this is a special cemetary that does not allow tour groups, so you can have the full experience of a New Orleans cemetery without the  hustle and bustle of the tour groups. Across the street is St. Roch Playground and Park. Limitless access to both New Orleans most famous, and most unknown local bars and restaurants.  Easy access to the 7th Ward, Treme, Marigny, Frenchman Street, the French Quarter, Crescent City Park, Bywater, and the St. Claude corridor. Hosts can provide limited transportation at request for a much lower rate than Uber or Lyft - including airport pickup/dropoff with advance notice. Unless uber and lyft are peaking (like during festivals), should be able to get pretty much anyw

name: Camelback Garden next to St.Charles Streetcar FQ
description: Camel back is 1 short block to St. Charles Avenue/Streetcar, going to French Quarter/Downtown, uptown universities and Audubon Park.  You’ll love our place for its complete renovation and many architectural details.  This unit is perfect for long term and corporate rental with a minimum of one month.  For any questions, inquire with us.  It is gated with lock and in the Garden District with 24/7 security patrol. For holidays and special events, please check with us for the price before booking.  Due to certain airbnb calendar issues, the price you see may not be the intended price of host. We will stay connected for any of your questions, concerns or needs. You can call, text or email if anything comes up or you have a question.  Read up the description, house rules and refund policy before you book.  When booking for your group, please manage your own guests' expectation.   The policy is clearly laid out and read them. The discounted monthly rates may not apply for major holidays. The
neighborhood_overview: The property is in Garden District with the district patrol 24/7 (tax money).  If you will be back late at night, feel free to call the patrol a few minutes before you get back.  The patrol officers will be there watching you enter the gate safely.  It is a great relief in New Orleans, even though the neighborhood is rated the top 3 neighborhoods in the entire U.S. A few blocks away you will find a cluster of houses and gardens in all the popular walk tour lists with magnificent architectural details and grand gardens.  The property is 1 block to St. Charles (where the street car is at bounding for either French Quarter or uptown university area), 2 blocks to Prytania Garden District book store, 3 blocks away from Commander's Palace, an upscale restaurant often rated the No. 1 for the city and top 10 in the U.S., and Lafayette Cemetery No. 1, the most toured above-ground and heavily filmed cemetery (right across the street from Commander's Palace) and 4 blocks to the trendy Magazine St
transit: 1 minute walk to St. Charles Street Car line or bus line for all the major tourist destinations in the city.  Uber and taxi are available.

name: Beautiful 1-Bedroom  House, 3 Blocks from Canal St
description: Charming Century old, “shotgun style” home, recently renovated.  Centrally located 3 blocks from the Canal St streetcar line, where they can take you directly to the historic French Quarter. Steps away from parade routes, several amazing local bars and restaurants. This home was built in 1919 and still has its original architectural features such as 12ft tall ceilings, original fireplaces, and moldings. You will have one unit of our triplex all to yourself. It has a specious living room furnished with a bed sofa, 2 side sofas, a smart TV, and more. You then walk in to a small office area next to the open kitchen equipped with microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, etc. A beautiful bedroom is furnished with a queen bed, a dresser, and a small fire place to give you the cozy feeling to have the best rest time. Each room has its own air conditioning/heating unit. There are plenty of towels, sheets, blankets, and pillows available. Although I may not be there at the property, but feel free t
neighborhood_overview: North of the noise and saturated color of the Quarter is a New Orleans neighborhood that’s perfected the art of living. “Welcome to Mid-City,” read the signs on the neutral ground. And that’s truth in advertising. It’s the kind of place where your auto mechanic invites you to a crawfish boil and a total stranger may buy you a drink at an Irish pub or a cannoli at an Italian bakery. Take the red streetcar line up Canal to the Cemeteries (Mid-City’s dead neighbors are as interesting as the live ones) or bike the new 2.6-mile-long Lafitte Greenway that stretches from Basin Street to Carrollton Avenue and, conveniently, past a po’ boy shop or two – or 17 – with a sno-ball shop and a micro-brewery thrown in for good measure. Buttermilk biscuits. Live music. A bowl of Vietnamese pho. Who wouldn’t want to visit? Eat. Drink. Get up here.
transit: 3 blocks to Canal Streetcar Line: Have the exact amount of cash ready. $1.25/person for one time ride or $3/person for a daily pass. Generally, you enter in the front and exit out back.  Fun fact: this line was rebuilt in the early 2000s; the original Canal Streetcar Line stopped running in 1964, and was replaced by buses for a long time. The bright red streetcars that run on it today are designed to look like old-school trolleys, but are relatively modern (for example, old-school trolleys weren't air-conditioned or remotely wheelchair friendly!)

name: Historic Mansion Balcony Suite on Esplanade w Pool
description: The Mimosa Suite has 12-foot ceilings, a 19th century Louisiana antique armoire and sleigh bed. The bathroom is enormous, with an oversized antique clawfoot tub (seated shower head only!) Our art-filled home is ideally located walking distance to the French Quarter, Fairgrounds and City Park. Sip coffee or Sazeracs on the balcony, spend your afternoons in the saltwater pool surrounded by fig and banana trees and original sculptures by artist Bob Tannen. Welcome to our circa 1890 mansion! Stay in one of the grand historic mansions that line Esplanade Avenue; in our opinion, one of the most beautiful streets in the city, with huge live oaks shading the street, surrounded by interesting architecture and grand homes. Your suite includes a large private bedroom and gorgeous bathroom with a porthole window, as well as shared access to the large upstairs balcony overlooking the avenue and our trees. Wonderful for your morning coffee or sunset cocktail on the chaise. We also have a beautiful s
neighborhood_overview: We are located very centrally with easy access by bike, bus, taxi or Uber to almost any location in the city. You can walk to the Quarter (1.1 mile) or to City Park, if the weather allows, or a 5 minute bike ride either way. We are also walking distance to Jazz Fest at the Fairgrounds! We are a few blocks away from: the excellent outdoor Pagoda Cafe, Domino Sound record store, Pirogue's neighborhood bar & food, and Dashing Bicycles, and also very close to Whole Foods, two local groceries, Swirl Wine shop, Fair Grounds coffee shop and many great restaurants such as Cafe Degas, Lola's, and 1000 Figs. We are also very close to our huge City Park with the New Orleans Museum of Art, 24-hour beignet cafe Morning Call, the Besthoff sculpture garden, historic St. Louis cemetery #3, gorgeous Bayou St. John and loads of historic, jaw-dropping architecture centered on Esplanade Avenue. Also nearby are the Backstreet Museum showcasing Mardi Gras Indian costumes, the historic St. Augustine Church w
transit: There is free street parking on our lush, shady block at most times, or within a block or two nearby during occasional busy hours. Otherwise, grab a Blue Bike,  bus (runs down our avenue), taxi or Uber.  We are only one mile from the Quarter!

name: Garden District Oasis, St Charles Mardi Gras Apt
description: Located in the New Orleans Garden District, this apartment is ideal for 1-4 guests (or 5 with the white sofa bed in the front room), offering two queen size beds, kitchen w/dining table and large 55" TV. There is one bathroom with a shower. One block off the Mardi Gras parade routes down St. Charles Avenue, it is close to the street car line that can take you downtown (CBD), to the French Quarter, or uptown to the universities (Tulane, Loyola). This is a shotgun house built in the 19th Century, with many architectural details.  Heated and cooled by two mini-split units mounted high on the wall, each main room also has a ceiling fan and plenty of lights. There is wifi for internet access, a desk in the front room, the full size kitchen has a dishwasher, refrigerator, electric stove, microwave, toaster oven, blender, plenty of plates, bowls, glasses, etc. Featuring granite counters, and large cabinets, there's plenty of room if you want to cook, and plenty of nearby restaurants if you do
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located to much of the city, the Garden District offers easy access to the Warehouse District (museums, art galleries, dining, etc.), the Central Business District (CBD), is close by, and the universities (Tulane and Loyola) and right up St. Charles Ave. Many Mardi Gras parades go down St. Charles Ave, which is one block away. Magazine street is just six blocks away and offers lots of shopping and dining options.
transit: The St. Charles Avenue street car is one block away and offers convenient transportation to uptown (Audubon Park, Audubon Zoo, Tulane and Loyola, Oak and Maple streets dining and shopping), and to downtown (Warehouse District, CBD, French Quarter, Faubourg Marigny, etc.). Uber and Lyft operate here, as well as taxis and there are rental cars if you want to venture further away.

name: DEGAS HOUSE! Josephine Room - on Esplanade Ave
description: Complimentary Creole Breakfast includes  Bloody Mary or Mimosa and a tour with the Great Grand Nieces of Edgar Degas! Degas House is home to the French Impressionist, Edgar Degas, and is a masterpiece of history and hospitality. We are WALKING DISTANCE FROM JAZZ FEST. A 5 minute Taxi or Bike ride to FRENCH QUARTER.  This historic house is on beautiful Esplanade Avenue.  Guests traveling from near and far to the Degas House are transported back in time to a world of sophistication and glamour. Josephine was Estelle’s daughter and Degas’ niece. A copy of her portrait at age 10, painting by Degas, "Le pédicure", hangs in this room along with her photo and documents of her life. The mood of the Josephine Room is both playful and soothing, with an antique rocking horse and a four-poster queen-sized bed among cherry wood furnishings. The private bathroom features a classic Victorian claw-foot tub with shower. An adjoining door between the Josephine and Estelle rooms allows conversion to a sp
neighborhood_overview: You are staying on one of the oldest and grandest streets in New Orleans. Esplanade Avenue. This area of New Orleans was know as the European Section.
transit: Taxi, Uber, Lyft and a bus stop right in front of the Hotel.  Its a 5 minute taxi ride to the quarter or 10 minute bike ride.  10 minute taxi to the Garden District There is also the Street Car.

name: Domio Baronne St. \| Expansive Four Bedroom Suite \| Pool + Gym
description: Domio Baronne St. is the perfect place for large groups of families and friends to enjoy curated apartment-style living with hotel amenities. Located in the heart of the Warehouse District, guests are minutes away from the French Quarter and Convention Center.  As New Orleans’ first apartment-hotel, Domio Baronne St. boasts a range of luxe rooms— from cozy studios to four bedroom suites with full kitchens. Enjoy the lively atmosphere of our rooftop pool or break a sweat in our fitness center. Relax in our expansive neighboring two bedrooms with hand-picked furniture, Casper® mattresses, unique artwork, and all your home essentials. Suite 1: 1090 square feet Master Bedroom: Queen bed Guest Bedroom: Queen bed Living Room: Sofa bed  Suite 2: 1345 square feet Master Bedroom: Queen bed Guest Bedroom: Queen bed Living Room: Sofa bed Disclaimer: These are two individual two-bedroom suites that are situated next to one another. There is no interior connection and each unit is accessible via th
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of the Warehouse District, old New Orleans meets new. Also known as the Arts District, the Warehouse District is filled with many museums, brunch spots, and bars for visitors to explore. You'll be minutes from the Ernest N. Morial Convention Center and the French Quarter. Exploring the French Quarter is essential to an authentic New Orleans experience. That’s why we are perfectly situated from the historic neighborhood—close enough by foot and far enough for a sound sleep.
transit: Being centrally located, you will have plenty of Uber, Lyft, Streetcars, Blue Bikes, and more transportation services available to use to explore New Orleans. Domio Baronne St. is approximately 20-25 minutes away by car from the Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport. There is a third party valet garage service available at the property for $40 per car per night. Blue Bike Hub - Julia Street & St. Charles Ave (3 blocks away) St. Charles Streetcar Stop (Line #12) - Carondelet at Julia (2 blocks away) Rampart-St. Claude Streetcar Stop(Line #49) - S Rampart at Julia (3-4 blocks away)

name: New Orleans Oasis + Crash Pad (Mid-City)
description: This place is basically a two-for-one. The main house is upstairs and it has a full suite with a kitchen downstairs—plenty of room to stretch out! Just far enough away from the craziness of downtown and the French Quarter to relax, but still close enough for convenience.  This house is in a great neighborhood right in the heart of Mid-City.  Tons of awesome eats & drinks are within easy walking distance. An Uber will take you anywhere in the city in about 10 minutes for about 10 bucks. This place is an authentic New Orleans shotgun style house. It feels like it goes on for miles.  There’s three bedrooms, two living rooms, and two kitchens.  It’s half of a duplex, I’m on the other side so you don’t have to worry about disturbing the neighbors. It has 2 new, very comfortable beds, one huge couch and one normal couch upstairs and two full beds and a comfy twin bed downstairs. There’s a couple of air mattresses at your disposal too.  The backyard has a big bench and a fire pit. There’s als
neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighborhood with plenty to do and see and eat and drink without getting into the craziness of downtown.  Also an 8 dollar lyft/Uber ride, or $1.25 streetcar ride away from downtown when you’re ready to get crazy.  One block away from the best dive bar on Banks street, Banks Street Bar, to get your walking drink before you head out for the night.  Also one block away from Wakin’ Bakin’*, Biscuits & Buns, and Mid-City Pizza to nurse your hangover the next morning/afternoon.  2 blocks away from Blue Dot Donuts*, Monkey Monkey Coffee & Tea, and the Canal St streetcar line straight to the French Quarter.  Walking distance to Jaun’s Flying Burrito (plus at least 3 other taco places), Mid-City Yacht Club, Bevi Seafood, Angelo Brocato’s Italian Ice Cream*, Frey Smoked Meats, Brown Butter Southern Kitchen, Walgreens, two grocery stores (local Rouses and chain Winn Dixie), a bike share station, and tons of other bars and restaurants. Easy access to City Park, the Fairgrounds, Ba
transit: Let me know if you’re bringing a car and I’ll leave the parking spot open for you to unload, but there’s plenty of parking on the street.   You’re better off getting around by foot, bike, streetcar, or uber/lyft.

name: SLEEPS 10! 15 MINUTES TO BOURBON ST & FRENCH QTR!!
description: Enjoy the nightlife, restaurants, festivals, and tourist attractions that New Orleans has to offer, then travel 10-15 minutes to your beautiful and tranquil home for a peaceful and relaxing night of sleep!!! Distance to... French Quarter/Bourbon St: 4.1 miles Frenchmen St: 4 miles Mercedes Benz Superdome : 5.4 miles Smoothie King Center: 5.7 miles Ernest Morial Convention Center: 5.8 miles Harrah's Casino: 5.3 miles Cafe Du Monde: 5.4 miles Jackson Square: 4.6 miles St Louis Cathedral: 5.4 miles Luxury, spaciousness, and comfort call you to this beautifully appointed home. Sleep in the comfort of plush queen beds. Have a relaxing day in the open living room, dining room and kitchen that is designed for socializing. Enjoy the huge fenced yard and the massive deck. Have your meals and cocktails on the covered deck. The home has a 2-car driveway and plenty of street parking. Guests have access to the entire house. The home is completely furnished including essentials that will make your t
neighborhood_overview: The home is close to the French Quarter and  tourist attractions as well as... > Close to Southern University and UNO. The UNO Lakefront Arena hosts concerts and other fun events throughout the year >Joseph M Bartholomew golf course is just a few blocks away. > New Orleans Lakefront airport is just a mile away. > Lakeshore and Lakeshore Terrace are very close as well as the Yacht club > Close to area restaurants and grocery stores > 10-15 minute drive/Uber ride to the French Quarter and Frenchmen St!!!
transit: The home is a block away from the RTA busline. Uber and Lyft will get you into the nightlife in 10-15 short minutes!

name: UPTOWN GEM WITH POOL!!
description: This is a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom house with a backyard pool and pool house containing an additional bed and full bath. High ceilings and wood floors throughout make this the quintessential New Orleans house, while being very cozy and up-to-date. The kitchen/great room has long windows that overlook the backyard pool and pool house.This charming house is located in a great neighborhood on a dead end to Audubon Park where you can enjoy a relaxing walk among the Oaks or pleasant bike ride. This house is very comfortable for a party of six with plenty of space.  Beautiful backyard with a porch overlooking the pool and hot tub.  Great for relaxing in the evenings after a long day of exploring the city. There is a hot tub that guests are welcome to use at an additional charge of $30/day. We ask that the usage be limited to four hours per day. I am managing this property for Theresa and Pat and I have my own rental next door.  I live around the corner from the property and am always available f
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is one of the most desired neighborhoods in New Orleans.  The house is located two blocks from Historic Magazine Streets, which has a plethora of great restaurants, shopping, and bars.  It is located about 12 blocks from St Charles Avenue where you can catch the streetcar to the Garden District, Warehouse District or the French Quarter.  Also a great location for families with Tulane or Loyola students.
transit: There is a bus stop on Magazine Street just two blocks away which is a great way to travel down  Magazine to the Garden District or French Quarter.  The bus as well as the streetcar is  $1.25.  Of course, you can always call an Uber.

name: Sunny Guest Suite with a view of St Charles
description: New Orleans Short Term Rental License #17STR-15937 This sunny guest suite is located above a pizza place on St. Charles Ave. It's close to many bars & restaurants. It is set up like a hotel room with a private, connected bathroom. There is also a coffee maker, fridge, & microwave but there is no kitchen, shared or otherwise. It's a one mile walk to the Convention Center and a direct streetcar ride to Canal Street & the French Quarter. This is a private guest suite located above a restaurant with an awesome view of St Charles and the streetcar line. THERE ARE STAIRS. I have a total of 3 Airbnb units in this building and all share the hallway to the stairs and entrance door. There is a memory foam queen mattress on the bed with freshly bleached/laundered sheets, duvet, and pillow shams. I change all of the bedding between guests, including the duvet cover. That may sound silly but many places do not change the duvet cover every time and I do. There is a full bathroom with shampoo, condit
neighborhood_overview: This is the best location.  It is located on Saint Charles Ave and directly in front of a streetcar stop.  It is considered on the edge of the Lower Garden District and it is super close to many options for food, drink, and fun.  Obviously there is pizza at the restaurant downstairs but there is also a barbeque joint next door, a gin distillery and coffee shop across the street, and a few 24 hour bars a few blocks away.  That isn't even to mention all many other options within walking distance.  This is generally a safe area and not scary or vacant of people at any time of day or night.
transit: Of course there's the streetcar which stops directly in front of my place... otherwise it's convenient for buses, cabs, Lyft and Uber.  The parking is metered in front of the building but there is free parking on the side streets. The quickest way from the airport is a taxi.  It is a $36 flat fare to anywhere in the metro area for up to two people.  The cab stand is by the luggage claim.  Lyft and Uber are about the same price and pick up in the base of the parking garage across from the luggage claim.  The cheapest way for one person is the Airport Shuttle.  It is $40 round trip per person and you can get off at the Historic Streetcar Inn stop which is next door to my Airbnb. For parking, there is metered and unmetered parking in front of our place but all the parking is on street parallel parking.  When you drive up, there will be a "hotel loading zone" that has signage.  Then in front of that is a spot with no meter and next to the trees in the boxes that say "Pizza" on them.  This

name: Cozy 2 bedroom cottage in the Mid-City-Treme
description: Cozy 2 bedroom/1 bath house in the Mid-City-Treme area.  In the heart of the Inner City--short ride to the Mercedes Benz Superdome, Canal St, the French Quarter, and the CBD (Central Business District). Two blocks off Orleans Ave near Willie Mae's and Dooky Chase restaurants, 2 blocks from Galvez, about 4 blocks from N Broad. Shotgun-like with a side hall (the hall separates the bedrooms). Hardwood floors, washer/dryer, refrigerator and range included. Off-street parking. Recently renovated. THE ENTIRE HOUSE This is an inner city location--in the heart of everything.  World famous Dooky Chase Restaurant is just around the corner.  Close to everything. Close to bus lines and a short Uber ride away from Downtown.  Blue Bikes are available within 3 blocks.  3/4 of a mile from the Canal St streetcar line.  Take buses or streetcars to most anywhere in the city from the point.

name: Renovated City Park Apartment w/ Balcony
description: Beautiful, newly renovated 900sf one bedroom apartment located near City Park & Bayou St. John. One of few AirBnBs with permit in town. Safe neighborhood. Walk to many restaurants, grocery stores, bars and local shops as well as NOMA & City Park,Jazz Fest & historical cemeteries. Street car stop across the street provides direct access to Historical French Quarter. The apartment is above a local coffee-shop. It has covered balcony on N.Carrollton Avenue where Endymion Mardi Gras parade rolls. Renovated apartment with high ceilings, central A/C, covered balcony & great central & safe location. It is approximately 900sq ft.  Less than 2.5mi./10min UBER drive to French Quarter. Unlike many in town, my place has proper Short Term Rental permit (18STR (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) from the City of New Orleans. Always available for any questions  via email or text. Safe & historical New Orleans neighborhood. Lots of local shops, bars & restaurants within couple minutes walk. Streetcar stop
neighborhood_overview: Safe & historical New Orleans neighborhood. Lots of local shops, bars & restaurants within couple minutes walk. Streetcar stop is across the street. Lafitte Greenway Bicycle Trail is 300 yards away as well as Blue Bike Bicycle Rental station.
transit: Street car stop across the street provides direct access to Historical French Quarter. Private off-street parking available with prior reservation.

name: Beautiful 100yr old uptown home..walk to parades
description: **There is a sofa bed available and a air mattress for multiple guests** 1700sqft beautiful old New Orleans Shotgun style house with lots of charm located very close to the parade (Website hidden by Airbnb) about a 10-15 min walk to (Website hidden by Airbnb) Mardi Gras day,you can see Rex from the porch.Walk 3 blocks to Freret for local bars and restaurants.You're about a ($7)10 min drive from anywhere in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) also 2 blocks from multiple bus routes. The house has has high ceilings and hard wood floors. It's just a really nice house in a great neighborhood. 12 ft ceilings. Hardwood floors. Furnished kitchen. It's pretty roomy at 1700sqft. Master bedroom has a king bed and the other bedroom has a queen. The sofa turns into a queen size sleeper. There's also an air mattress and a cot for multiple guests. I'm only allowed to have four guests, but you can message me with any questions. Feel free to play any records in the record player. There's a roku tv available
neighborhood_overview: Really nice quiet street with lots of places in walking distance. Check out Freret Street...There's restaurants, coffee shops, music clubs, and a couple bars. There is also a Walgreens and cvs 2-3 blocks away. It's super convenient to get around. You're only a 10 min or less drive to the French quarter, bywater, cbd, mid city, lower garden district, river bend, super dome, and many other cool spots.
transit: You're one block away from the Napoleon bus line and two blocks from the Claiborne bus line. It's within a 10 min walk to the St. Charles street car, but you can get downtown from the Claiborne bus. It's also only a 10 min drive to get anywhere and a $6-$12 lyft/uber ride to get pretty much anywhere as well

name: Bayou St. John Studio w/Bikes & Courtyard
description: This is a large, sunny, private studio with covered deck & courtyard located in beautiful residential area just a few blocks from Jazz Fest. 2 Bicycles available upon request. Just a short walk to the Fair Grounds, coffee houses, restaurants, Whole Foods, City Park, NOMA &  Bayou St. John. Less than 2 miles to French Quarter. Just a few minutes by car to Superdome, CBD, Lower Garden District, Marigny & Bywater.  BIG MONTHLY DISCOUNTS FALL 2019. STR License Permit #: 17STR-20422 Beautiful, roomy, well-appointed studio apartment with tons of charm. 805 sq. ft. all to yourselves with a private courtyard right off the living room. The kitchen is stocked with plenty of utensils, dishes, pots & pans. There is a comfy queen size bed with 100% cotton linens. The perfect space to rest and recuperate after enjoying a day at the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival, VooDoo Music Festival, or exploring this wonderful town.  Located in a walkable friendly, historic neighborhood. New Orleans own C
neighborhood_overview: The Faubourg St. John/Bayou St. John is an historic neighborhood nestled between Esplanade Avenue's gorgeous live oak tress, restaurants, groceries, and coffee houses and Bayou St. John (perfect for long walks, jogging, SUP, and kyaking). Just a short walk to City Park's New Orleans Museum or Art and sculpture garden. 7 blocks from the Fairgrounds and JAZZ FEST; less than 2 miles to the French Quarter, Marigny & Bywater, and; 2.4 miles to the Superdome.
transit: Parking is available on the street but parking during Jazz Fest can be tight in this area. We are 1 block from the Esplanade bus route, less than 1 mile to the street car line, and a 15 minute walk or short cab ride to the French Quarter, Marigny and Bywater. 2 bicycles are available for guests -- you assume all responsibility for loss or injury.

name: LUX 4BR 2BA 15min FrenchQtr & Nitelife w 2 BIDETS!
description: Spacious 2600sqft home 4BR/2BA, 6 beds (+2 queen air mattress) great for big groups. 10-15min uber ride to French Quarter and nightlife! Bachelor(ettes) welcome. Lux space with memory foam mattress & heated toilet seats! We’re in unit 2 w/private entrance, so we'll be neighbors. You'll have unit as pictured to yourself. Scroll for amenities  Miles 4.0  City Park -Voodoo 4.5  Frenchmen St 4.9  Cafe Du Monde 5.0  St. Louis & French Quarter 5.1   Bourbon St - 15min 5.8  Superdome 15.9 MSY 20min Kick back and relax in our spacious home! Equipped with your comfort in mind, sleep in brand new memory foam beds and quality linen. Our bathrooms are designed with your comfort in mind with heated toilet seats and bidet features available.  Enjoy a zen living space with plenty of live plants to filter the air you breathe in. Our living room features a sectional sofa set, a large smart tv, and plenty of activities for pre-gaming. We offer Connect 4, UNO cards, a Poker set, Bingo, Jenga, and Drinkin
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a quieter neighborhood of New Orleans. Our neighborhood is referred to as the Gentilly neighborhood, is a highly sought after neighborhood with up and coming construction. Our neighborhood has a 24-hour private security company that monitors our neighborhood. Cafe Gentilly is right on the corner (walkable). Some other landmarks include University of New Orleans, Franklin Avenue, City Park, New Orleans Lakefront, and Good Times Sushi.
transit: Uber or Lyft: French Quarter & Bourbon St: We recommend using uber, which cost around $10-$13 during the day, according to our guests.  Lyft: Get $10 OFF your first Lyft ride using code: THU46785 UBER: Get your 1st ride FREE using my code: vzauwt63ue UberEats:  UberEats is available at this location for delivery of restaurants in the New Orleans area. Get $10 Off your first meal using our promo code: eats-thuv339ue Parking in the quarter can range from $20-$30 for a full day of parking. Meter parking is available at $3/hour, maximum 2 hours, from 8am-6:59pm. Meter parking are free after 7PM on weekdays.

name: Comfortable 2BR walking distance to Frenchman!
description: Located in the most wonderful neighborhood, The Marigny!  This local area is a Historical Residence with many 100+ year old refurbished and vibrant houses! •Short distance to St. Roch Market, St. Claude Street Car Line, Eateries, and much more! •Fully Furnished: 2 Bed, 1 Bath Home with Kitchenette, and comfortable Living Space! •Wifi & Super Comfortable Beds! FIRST TIME USING AIRBNB? Create your account and get up to $55 off your stay! https://www.airbnb.com/c/anthonyk5772?currency=USD This space is different and unique in that it is extremely private and secure. The beds and linens are of exceptional quality. The location provides safety and quiet yet close proximity to the French Quarter. The location to the streetcar line provides the opportunity to explore the city without a car. Guests will have uninterrupted access to the entirety of this home - 3 bedrooms, 1.5 bathrooms, kitchen, & living area. I am usually hands off with my guests allowing for a relaxing stay, but with half a d
neighborhood_overview: Quaint, Quiet, and Artsy!  The Marigny/Bywater where all the neighbors know each other and greet guests with a smile. Perfect location for reaching anywhere in the city by car in no more than 10 minutes or via public transportation. Near: French Quarter Bourbon City Park Frenchman Street St. Roch Cemeteries Lake Ponchatrain UNO Dillard Brother Martin Lakeview Boutique Shops Grocery Stores Outlet Stores Easy access roads Interstate Lakefront Airport Yacht Club Golf Courses
transit: Driving/Uber/Lyft Nothing in the city is more than 15 minutes away by car or Uber/Lyft (New user promo codes given prior to arrival for your booking!) Public Transit Just a few blocks away is Elysian Fields Ave where public transportation allows access to the entirety of the city. A bus to the French Quarter is a short, direct trip straight down Elysian Fields. Single rides are $1.25/person and day passes are $3! All passes can be bought directly on the bus.  Transportation To/From Airport If you are flying into New Orleans, please ask me about booking a shuttle to/from the airport, as I can get you  great prices with a local vendor!  Chauffeur Services If you are interested in any type of Chauffeur Services for your time, please let me know and I will get you a very reasonable quote from a local vendor!

name: Harmony in the Irish Channel
description: Cozy three bedroom home located in the Irish Channel neighborhood of New Orleans. The home is located 4 blocks from busy Magazine street where you'll find endless restaurants, shops, & bars. The home has three full beds, a kitchen (complimentary tea & coffee), a living room, and a full bathroom. Guests can use the entire space which consists of 3 bedrooms, living room, kitchen, and bathroom. Email or text is easiest communication for me. We live next door so we’ll be home at times but also work full time so you may not see us. 4 blocks from magazine st which has many restaurants, bars, and shops. There is street parking up and down the block if you drive. For getting around town I’d recommend uber or lyft. Streetcar & bus lines are within walking distance.

transit: There is street parking up and down the block if you drive. For getting around town I’d recommend uber or lyft. Streetcar & bus lines are within walking distance.

name: Location! Balcony overlooking Bourbon & Dumaine 6
description: "Elected as the most beautiful accommodation in New Orleans" located in the heart of the French Quarter just steps of Famous Bourbon St. This mansion was built in 1820 and converted to luxury loft/Units. High ceilings, 5ft chandelier, original wood floors & antique furniture. All those details will take you back in time 2 the glory days of the French Opulence. Balcony overlooks Bourbon & Dumaine Street. Enjoy the Mansion’s cozy courtyard. Complimentary Champagne & Coffee. This Loft features French Quarter history at its finest, this property was built in the 1820s; and most recently, it was converted into high end luxury historic lofts.  The uniqueness of this 359 Sf suite reveals that attention to detail. When you walk into this Victorian unit, you will be dazzled by the 14 foot ceilings which are adorned by a dramatic five foot hanging Crystal French chandelier; the beautifully enriched hardwood floors, together with an antique non functional fireplace, crowns beds, silk drapes and a
neighborhood_overview: The French Quarter, also known as the Vieux Carré or the “Quarter” to locals, is the oldest neighborhood in New Orleans with Spanish and French roots dating back to the 17th century. The French Quarter unique attractions is the reason why is the most visited area by both locals and tourists. From the beautiful architecture to art galleries, museums, restaurants, and bars, the French Quarter has something for everyone – no matter what your interests, budget, or age may be. Join up with a tour and learn more about the fascinating history of the area, or spend the entire day exploring and shopping in the area, topping everything off with an excellent meal in a world-famous restaurant and some live music. With so much culture, history, and entertainment, you’ll find a unique and exciting experience around every corner.
transit: Ask us about our Private Airport Shuttle Service - save cost of Taxi's and Uber with our discounted price. Most everything you'll want to experience is within walking distance, however, some visitors enjoy a quick lift with a pedicab.  The streetcars run every 20 to 30 minutes along Canal St. and Rampart St. if you want to explore outside the French Quarter. We'll provide a list of nearby parking lots and garages upon arrival.

name: 1930's Cottage Uptown
description: Uptown home by universities in a safe neighborhood filled with locals. Relax on the porch/yard or hop the bus (.5 block) to the FQ and enter the madness of Bourbon St. in less than 15. Take an Uber/Lyft for less then 10$ almost anywhere in the city! This is a two bedroom "shotgun" apartment great for a family or two couples on vacation in New Orleans, who want to get away from the touristy French Quarter and stay in a real friendly neighborhood.  The kitchen is awesome and funky with true New Orleans flair. Opens to backyard which is great for hanging out and relaxing. There is a converted garage on the property with a bar area and picnic tables where we love to sit and grill (when it's not too hot). There is also free laundry provided just for that unit and tons of safe street parking. Uptown New Orleans is beautiful, safe, and quiet with tons of "pockets" of great restaurants and bars. Our apartment is located walking distance from Tulane and Loyola (about 10-15 minutes) in  the Carr
neighborhood_overview: This is a safe neighborhood without the hustle and bustle (smell) of the Quarter. If you are looking to stay where people live and neighbors say hi to you on the street this is the right type of area for you. There are several restaurants, bars, and cafes just blocks away as well as convenient access to public transportation; bus and streetcar to get anywhere in the city you need to go.
transit: The bus is less than a block away to have you in the Quarter in no time for a bargain price. The streetcar is just a pleasant and safe 7 short block walk away for a picturesque way to travel from Uptown to the FQ while getting to see the park, universities, and the mansions of St. Charles Ave.

name: Modern 2 BR Creole Cottage - Entire House!
description: Luxury 2 bedroom / 2 bath, modern creole cottage-style home, new construction, beautiful architectural details, fully furnished kitchen & baths, spacious rooms, memory foam mattresses in rooms, open floorplan, well furnished w/ high end furnishings, wifi, coffee maker & smart TVs (Roku Ready). This home is newly built (2019) in the highly desired Irish Channel area, I’m actually the architect that designed and developed this home myself.  This is an 1,100 square foot home, it’s modernly designed, yet welcoming space. We have high ceilings, lots of light, and very airy. Furnished with New Orleans art work all around.  Bedroom 1 is a queen size bed with memory foam mattress with brand new, clean and comfy linens.  It has a large walk-in closet, with a luxury bathroom. And a smart TV in room. Bedroom 2, has two full size beds with memory foam mattresses with brand new, clean, and comfy linens.  And a smart TV in room. Living area , has a queen sofa bed with linens provided, with smart TV.
neighborhood_overview: Located in highly desired Irish Channel  Short distance to Uptown/Irish channel parade routes on St. Charles Avenue, Magazine Street , and Napoleon Avenue  Popular Magazine Street Area 4 blocks away (many restaurants, shops, and bars)  Popular restaurants such as Rum House, Dat Dog, Mahony’s Poboy & Seafood and Atchafalaya restaurants are all within walking distance!  The Bulldog Uptown 0.5 miles    New Orleans Lager and Ale (NOLA Brewing) 0.3 miles  The Tchop Yard 0.7 miles Walgreens 0.6 miles  Walmart 1.1 miles    Mercedes-Benz Superdome 3.1 miles Ernest M. Morial Convention Center 2.6 miles  Smoothie King Arena 3 miles  French Quarter 4.5 miles
transit: We are located near most New Orleans attractions. A 10-15 minute inexpensive Uber/Lyft ride will bring you to basically anywhere in the city!  The city’s bus line is 5 blocks away.  We are within walking distance to the city’s shared bike rental, Blue Bike rental.

Walk out the front door and you're two blocks from Frenchmen Street's jazz clubs, three blocks from the French Market and Mississippi River, four blocks from the clubs/restaurants of Bourbon Street, and short walks to dozens of other attractions, eateries and lounges. name: Historic Esplanade w/ Antique & Mid Century Decor
description: Traditional home located in quiet Bayou St. John; less than 2 miles from FQ.  Much within walking distance. I own the building; was our residence for 15+ years. It's a unique home furnished w/ antiques & art.  The space is good for couples (3 full beds), solo travelers (safe), and business travelers (quiet). When configuring the apartment (for visiting friends & family) we opted for 2 equal bedrooms.  There is an outdoor 1/2 bath in shed off patio. Local Licence # 17STR-07131 The house is 1100 sq feet and was built in the 1890s. It is furnished almost exclusively w/ antiques. No TV but plenty of unique books; games & puzzels can be provided. ( 1/2 bath & coin laundry is located in the shed) You will have access to the entire home; Large dining room table & large living room, 2 bedrooms (each w/ full size bed), a new modern bathroom &
neighborhood_overview: Bayou St. John is a historic neighborhood that is bike and pedestrian friendly. name: The Desire Room at the Sully Mansion
description: Book a private room at the Sully Mansion, a nine-bedroom bed & breakfast. There are three rooms on the first floor and six on the second floor. We have designed each room of the mansion with an eye for modern convenience, while retaining the grace of its origin. In addition to the guest rooms, there are many inviting spaces to congregate, both inside and outside of the inn. We want you to feel at home and relish in the experience of living like a local here in New Orleans. The Desire is the Sully Mansion’s smallest and most intimate room, perfect for the single traveler eager to explore the riches of the Crescent City. Tucked away on the second floor, the Desire is everything a guest looks for in a comfortable stay. Please note that this is a very small room with a double sized bed. We recommend only sleeping one traveler comfortably in this room. Guests are given access to their private room and to all common areas of the house. Common areas include the foyer, dining room, salon, and
neighborhood_overview: The Sully Mansion is tucked in the middle of the New Orleans Garden District. Best known for its jaw dropping mansions, ornate iron work, wrap-around porches, and lush gardens, the Garden District provides a front seat to the cultural and architectural history of New Orleans. We’re just one block from the St. Charles Ave. parade and streetcar routes, and four blocks from the antique shops, restaurants and bars on Magazine Street. Step away from the hustle of the French Quarter and experience authentic New Orleans in the Garden District with a stay at the Sully Mansion.
transit: New Orleans city center is very walkable, but there are a few other ways to get from one place to another. Here are a few that I recommend:  Streetcar: The St. Charles Streetcar line is just a block from the house and can take you to the French Quarter or in the other direction throughout the Garden District and further Uptown. The streetcar is $1.25 per person (exact change required.) You may also purchase a day pass which is $3.00 per person all you can ride.  UBER / Lyft: Uber and Lyft are both great services in New Orleans. The city is geographically small, so fares are typically very affordable.  Blue Bikes: New Orleans has recently launched the bike share program, Blue Bikes. There are over 70 Blue Bike stations located around the city which makes riding from one area of the city to another very convenient. The bikes costs $0.13/minute and are prorated to the minute so you are only charged for riding time.

Bedroom 2: Bunk Bed with full bed on bottom and twin on top, Closet, Spare Linens and Towels. Bedroom 3: King Bed, Closet, Spare Linens and Towels. The Master Bathroom is located between the kitchen and King Bedroom. The kitchen has a stove, oven, refrigerator, coffee maker and all utensils needed for cooking. The tap water has a Brita Filter. Guests will have access to the entire home. You are s

transit: If you can't walk to your destination, I recommend getting around via Uber/Lyft. If you have your own vehicle, you will find ample parking on our block. Please be careful not to block any driveways!

name: Amazing Views Top Floor FQ/CBD Skyscraper!
description: Located only 3 short blocks to French Quarter and 3 short blocks to the Mercedes Benz Superdome.   You are in THE prime location for everything! Just steps away from bars, restaurants and shopping. Ultra modern apartment building is like walking through an art gallery!  This fully private bedroom with full bath inside is on the very top floor of this artsy skyscraper.  You'll wake up to amazing views of the New Orleans Cityscape! The exposed ceiling and metal beams are true to the overall industrial downtown vibe.  The room has a large walk in closet and a television equipped with cable!  The comfortable bed has fresh linens and the en suite bathroom has fresh towels, soap, and a hair dryer. The kitchen and parlor are shared space if you choose to utilize them. In addition to your private room and bath, you will also have access to the kitchen/dining area and parlor. The Kitchen is fully equipped with all the cookware and dinnerware you would need if you decided to prepare a lovely mea
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood has bars, restaurants, and plenty of shopping.  Stop by Krewe Lounge on Loyola on the first floor of my apartment building for specialty cocktails and to meet the locals.  There is a rooftop restaurant/bar, The Monkey Board, at The Troubadour hotel a block away.  Take a short walk to experience the fun of Bourbon Street, or catch a concert at the Smoothie King Center, or sporting event at the Mercedes Benz Superdome.
transit: Getting around in my neighborhood is super easy.  Mostly everything is within a short walk but there is public transportation right outside my apartment building. So you'll have your option of a bus or streetcar.  If you need to travel further maybe Uber, Lyft or taxi would better suit your needs.   As for parking, most of our guests park in the lot behind my building.  It's usually cheapest in the area, between $8-$12 per day.  Otherwise, street parking is readily available and free between 7pm and 8am and all day Sunday.  Keep in mind depending on what's going on in the city, the lot can cost more for "event parking".
