name: Cozy Blue Tremé Home
description: In the heart of the Tremé neighborhood known as the birth place of jazz, you will find a charming newly renovated home. It is a mile's walk from the French Quarter and is in the center of the city with easy access to the other neighborhoods, whether by public transportation or car. Guests have reported it takes anywhere between 20-25 minutes to reach the Quarter. Know that this is a shared, owner occupied space. The upstairs is completely private for guests, and the downstairs is shared. My house is in the perfect location in New Orleans. Three quarters of a mile away from the famed Bourbon Street in the heart of the French Quarter, it is an easy walk to many of the famous sights of the city. The house itself was completely renovated in 2017 and is both modern and comfortable. Hard wood floors throughout, modern appliances and central air. If you come in the summer time, there is even a public pool that you can access two blocks away.  Guests have complete privacy in the upstairs porti
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the coolest neighborhoods of New Orleans. HBO even did a series on it entitled, Tremé. It is the oldest African-American neighborhood in the country and has numerous jazz clubs and soul food restaurants as well as parks (LaFitte Greenway, Louis Armstrong park) that are within walking distance. Here you will tap into the true soul of New Orleans. If you are staying in New Orleans, know that crime is an unfortunate reality. While I personally have not encountered any issues, I always recommend that my guests use cars (Lyft or Uber or taxis) at night. The neighborhood of Treme is unique and full of culture, but has its rough and run down spots. If that is not something one is comfortable with, I do not recommend this location.
transit: The best way to get around in New Orleans is by car. If you don't want to rent a car, Uber and Lyft are options as well as local taxis or city busses or streetcars.

name: Degas House! Desiree Room -  on Esplanade Ave
description: Complimentary Creole Breakfast includes  Bloody Mary or Mimosa and a tour with the Great Grand Nieces of Edgar Degas!  Degas House is home to the French Impressionist, Edgar Degas, and is a masterpiece of history and hospitality. We are WALKING DISTANCE FROM JAZZ FEST. A 5 minute Taxi or Bike ride to FRENCH QUARTER.  This historic house is on beautiful Esplanade Avenue.  Guests traveling from near and far to the Degas House are transported back in time to a world of sophistication and glamour. Overlooking our picturesque courtyard, The Desiree Room features a splendid four-post queen-size bed and elegant draperies. The real gem, however, is the bathroom, where a deep, two-person Jacuzzi tub provides a perfect retreat for romance and relaxation. The bathroom also contains a standing shower. Remember this is an old New Orleans house. Quaint with its flaws. You will have access to the whole house, museum and grounds. Owner does not live on the property. The Degas House is more of a Histor
neighborhood_overview: You are staying on one of the oldest and grandest streets in New Orleans. Esplanade Avenue. This area of New Orleans was know as the European Section.
transit: Taxi, Uber, Lyft and a bus stop right in front of the Hotel.  Its a 5 minute taxi ride to the quarter or 10 minute bike ride.  10 minute taxi to the Garden District There is also the Street Car.

name: Barbara's Uptown: License #19STR-01763
description: The "mother in law" apartment you are renting is in a lovely uptown neighborhood 4 blocks from the St Charles Street Car , 1.5 blocks from Magazine St  and Magazine St Bus. Nearby numerous fabulous restaurants and shopping. I live in the front part of the home and my daughter lives across the street. You will have access to the entire private apartment that includes bedroom, kitchen , living room and bathroom with private entrance. I live in the front part of the home and will meet you upon your arrival and am usually available to answer questions if you have them. Fabulous neighborhood within walking distance to many great restaurants, coffee shops, bakery, shopping, laundromat and grocery, Public transportation by streetcar and bus is within a short walk. Uber and Lyft services are plentiful in New Orleans. You really do not need a rental car unless you plan on going outside of the city for a swamp tour or plantation tour.

This home is complete with modern amenities including Wifi, smart TVs, central air/heating, new appliances, washer/dryer, and comfortably sleeps 6 (sofa bed, Trundle bed and Queen). A true New Orleans double, in historic Uptown includes: living room, family room, hardwood floors throughout, washer/dryer, and central heat and air. There are two bedrooms (entire home is shotgun style), large kitchen, fully stocked with dishes, cookware etc. and a gas stove. Fully renovated bathroom, backyard, with plenty of street parking. The cost is all grocery costs plus $20 for time and delivery.
transit: In addition, if this is your first time traveling to New Orleans and you need recommendations for anything during your stay, please let us know in advance so we may provide you with a list of trusted options before your arrival.

This home is perfect for a family or group of friends looking to visit this amazing city!  You can book this home that has a connecting courtyard to our "Stunning New Orleans Home in the Bywater/Marigny." Both homes can sleep 6 people together. Perfect for 2 families or a big friends trip! neighborhood_overview: We are adjacent to the Marigny/Bywater, 2-6 blocks from awesome restaurants, cafes, and bars. name: Historic Irish Channel Apartment -Amazing location
description: This historic Irish Channel private apartment is two blocks from magazine street, and walk-able to restaurants, bars, cemeteries, shops, the bus stop, & streetcar line.  12 foot ceilings make the apartment feel much larger and roomier.  Street parking at the house that is usually never hard to come by.  We have a 2 year old and an under 1 year old. There is a shared wall so you might hear the occasional pitter patter of them running or a tantrum but are normally very good kids. - Historic renovated home with details that bring you back to the late 1800's.  - Enjoy the shared front porch - Separate bedroom with queen bed  - Pull out queen sofa-bed in the living room  - Full kitchen makes you feel that you are at your home away from home - DirecTV - Wireless Internet  - Central Heat and Air - Family friendly (pack-n-play available upon request) - Security Cameras on porch as well as side of house for security. - If booking with 4 people, know that you must walk through the bedroom to get

Inside the apartment you will find a detailed description of all of our favorite places to eat, drink and play.  The apartment is off a quiet stretch of Magazine that does not have the crazy foot traffic that other locations do but a quick walk in either direction on magazine street will get you to some of the best restaurants, bars and shopping in the city.  The apartment is only 2 miles from the heart of the downtown.
transit: The house is 2 blocks from a bus stop that will take you downtown to the heart of the city as well as 7 blocks from the famous St Charles Streetcar line that will also take you to the heart of downtown.  A quick transfer to the Canal Streetcar line will take you to City park, one of the largest parks in a city.  There are two bikes for guest use throughout their stay.  Uber has started a huge presence in New Orleans and prices are reasonable to get anywhere in the city.

name: Eclectic New Orleans Home - Near Tulane/Streetcar!
description: Welcome to our New Orleans home!  This 100 year-old Spanish Eclectic/Craftsman Double in the heart of Uptown/Carrollton is charming and convenient, making it the perfect getaway.  You have the entire apartment to enjoy and are only a short walk from iconic New Orleans amenities such as:    -  The historic St. Charles streetcar line    -  Neighborhood corner stores and restaurants    - Tulane & Loyola    -  & some of the most eye-catching architecture in the City! LICENSE #: 19STR-11455 Quiet, safe Uptown space perfect for couples, families, young professionals, wanderers, travelers, Tulane and Loyola visitors, relatives, friends, neighbors, and newcomers.   Our space features two private bedrooms with queen beds, closet space, a darling breakfast nook, full kitchen with stainless appliances, microwave, living room w/ television and Apple TV, dining room, a sunny front porch and re-landscaped backyard.   There is central A/C and heat as well via a Nest unit.  New ceiling fans are also i
neighborhood_overview: The Uptown/Carrollton neighborhood is quiet, safe, and close to Tulane, Loyola, Xavier, Audubon Zoo, Palmer Park.  It is just minutes from the 10 Freeway,  Superdome, Central Business District, Warehouse District, Mid-City, Metairie, Oak Street, Freret Street, Magazine Street - you name it!   We have a lot of historic architecture without the hubbub of the inner city while being close to everything.  You'll enjoy walking around and seeing the sights!
transit: We are within walking distance of the historic St. Charles streetcar, Tulane campus, Lusher Elementary School, Panola Street Cafe, and bus service. Streetcars do not run as frequently after hours!  Please check with RTA to confirm service hours and schedules.  The streetcar stop is at Carrollton and Claiborne, just six blocks from here.  It is the end of the St. Charles line, so there is almost always a car waiting there. You no longer need cash for the streetcar or bus. RTA has a mobile app (RTA gomobile) that you can use to purchase day passes for multiple riders. You show your phone to the driver when you board. New Orleans has 24-hour taxi service, Uber and Lyft service.  There is flat-rate taxi service available to and from the airport. Our neighborhood offers plentiful, free street parking.  There are no permit restrictions unless there is a parade route or a movie is filming.  However, there is very limited space for longer vehicles such as moving vans, RV's and trailers. You ma

name: Cozy and Luxurious Desire Getaway, Great Location!
description: This bright and charming home was renovated with care and artistry by the owner who lives next door. Walk down Desire St to reach the entry gate to Crescent City Park, take a short drive to Bacchanal fine wine and spirits, roam the eateries and bars of the Bywater neighborhood, and enjoy the across-the-street view of a historic cemetery. 30 to 45 minute walk to the French Quarter, or an 8 minute drive! This space has everything you could possibly need in a home away from home!  The house is set back from the street with a raised driveway that is available to guests. Inside, you will find a bright and open common area with a full kitchen, pull out couch, and dinette.  There is a CD/radio/bluetooth player and speakers so you can groove out while you’re at home. Enjoy my curated selection of local CDs and radio stations. There are plenty of outlets along the breakfast bar if you need to plug in and get some work done, or a 43” TV with Netflix and several other options provides a relaxing
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is close to the action, while still feeling like a quiet getaway.  The house is just a few blocks away from Polly's Bywater Cafe and Shake Sugary, which I can't recommend highly enough for breakfast or a baked treat. Like most of New Orleans, this is a diverse neighborhood that is still in recovery from hurricane Katrina, so you will see new renovations right next to houses that need some love.  There is a decent amount of foot traffic on our street and New Orleans is a very friendly city, so don't hesitate to say hello!
transit: New Orleans is a fairly small and very manageable city. Most of my guests choose to get around by Lyft or Uber once they’re here so they don’t have to worry about parking in the French Quarter (though I can give you all my parking tricks if you want them!). If you get bikes, everything is a fairly quick ride through town, a longer walk (though I don’t usually recommend walking home from the quarter after nightfall), or a medium length bus ride.

name: Laid Back Charm in Bywater Marigny
description: Minimum 30 days rental. Historic home carefully designed to provide a very cozy stay. The independent one bedroom apartment/studio is extremely well equipped for comfortable modern living, even for long term stays. The placid neighborhood of Bywater, a destination by itself, is really a dynamic historic district just blocks away from the FrenchQuarter. Be seduced by the relaxed tone of this quaint, artsy & eclectic neighborhood, it’s fabulous restaurants & hip art/entertainment scene Guests will have their own separate entrance to this quiet and comfortable newly renovated apartment/studio in a historic double shotgun. This1890s home has been carefully designed to provide a very cozy stay. It includes the bedroom, equipped with a perfect to snug in queen-size mattress with luxury cotton linens, leisure seating, ample closet and storage space and large HD flat TV with access to all the media. The full bath with shower and all linens and plenty of toiletries supplied. A cook’s kitchen su
neighborhood_overview: The Bywater, once considered a bohemian neighborhood now housing a hipster crowd with it's laid back charm. It is located in Dauphine, between Louise and Clouet surrounded by the artists shops, cultural centers, restaurants & bars.  Next to the Marigny and it's famous jazz venues & the French Quarter’s extremely rich history. The Bywater captures those wanting to live in the placid side of downtown. Artisans, local markets, fine eateries & shops are few of the treasures of the Bywater/Marigny area. It is very pleasant to stroll down or ride a bike by  Dauphine, Royal or Chartres Streets, the specialty shops and galleries of St Claude, the Crescent Park and the several fairs that pop in the area.
transit: There is no need of a car while in New Orleans. Public transportation is extremely easy, the bus travels on our street and back one block away. Line 5 Walking or riding are the most common means of transportation in the area.  Taxi companies, Uber and Lyft serve New Orleans very efficiently and the rides are not expensive, we are an small city.

name: Two Bedroom Suite
description: This is a large Two Bedroom Suite with in a historic house B&B. The Two bedroom suite features a private living room, kitchenette (no stove due to fire local code), 2 separate bed rooms, one bathroom. The Suite is located on the second floor with either a private outside entrance or access through the main house. we welcome you on the main floor of the house as well as the courtyard. I welcome all of my guests into my home. I make myself available as you may need. I'm always up for a cup of coffee and conversation. We are located on the edge of the French Quarter in the Treme & Esplanade ridge neighborhood . Esplanade Avenue in known for its beautiful Greek revival architecture . It was once considered the grande avenue of the creoles. We are bordered by Treme, the second oldest neighborhood in New Orleans. Culturally Treme is the heart of New Orleans, home to many early pioneers of Jazz. It's also the home to our famous Mardi Gras Indians & iconic second line parades. Most things are

It was once considered the grande avenue of the creoles. We are bordered by Treme, the second oldest neighborhood in New Orleans. Culturally Treme is the heart of New Orleans, home to many early pioneers of Jazz. It's also the home to our famous Mardi Gras Indians & iconic second line parades.
transit: Most things are with in walking distance, The French Quarter & Frenchman Street are just short walks. We are 2 blocks from a street car line. Both "blue bikes" and cabs are available.

Situated in the lively Riverbend/Carrollton/University area providing numerous restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and more. A few blocks from Maple Street, Oak Street, Tulane, Loyola and Audubon Park/Zoo. Ample free on street parking available as well. Recently renovated "A" frame studio apartment. 8 Ft Ceilings, plenty of light, private deck, refrigerator, Kurig Coffee maker, shampoo/conditioner, 2 flat screens TVs with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, etc. Upstairs deck is Guest' s private area however guest have access to common area back yard with a covered deck. We live in downstairs apt and share backyard with guest, however we rarely see our guest. The upstairs deck is exclusively for guest. Since we live on site we are available to assist in any way pos
neighborhood_overview: The Riverbend/Carrollton area  is a lively, hip area with many restaurants, shops and bars. Tulane and Loyola are located 1/2 mile away which provides for a college atmosphere yet the area remains a true New Orleans nieghborhood. Great area to get away from the French Quarter yet only a scenic streetcar ride away to French Quarter, Garden District, Warehouse District, Downtown/Canal St., Convention Center, Cruise Line Docks and much more.

neighborhood_overview: This house is located near everything you could need. name: Pied-à-terre Luxe with Outdoor Deck
description: This contemporary private retreat is in an historic neighborhood adjacent to the Faubourg Marigny. You're just three blocks from a streetcar line (giving you easy connections to just about everything) and a steps from the very popular St Roch Market for food-truck-style vendors, coffee, juice, cocktail and oyster bars. This is the heart of the St Claude Avenue arts and entertainment district — and an easy walk to the music clubs on Frenchman Street or the excitement of the fabled French Quarter. “Top Airbnb!!" says Sheila of her stay here. Featuring clean lines and designer furniture, this bright 200-sq-ft pied-à-terre (bedroom, 4-piece bathroom, mini-bar) was renovated in 2015. It features a window-wall looking out to a large, secluded outdoor deck with a shaded table and garden chairs. Here’s a sampling of what other guests have said lately about the pied-à-terre: “The apartment is exactly how it appears in pictures. Modern and comfortable. All around, a perfect stay.” (Hunter)  “Geo
neighborhood_overview: This is a vibrant, diverse neighborhood of mostly long-time residents and families living in houses that vary in style from Cajun Cottage to 1950s modern. The busy St Roch Market is a focal point and an attraction for local foodies — it’s just steps away and has a dozen or so vendors including coffee, juice, cocktail and oyster bars. The Market is open from 7am until 10pm (11pm Friday and Saturday) with happy hour from 4-6pm weekdays when there are food specials too.  “The St. Roch market is an ABSOLUTE MUST. No matter how many people you go with there is something yummy to eat and a decent bar.” (Jay, 2017)
transit: “We were given a neighborhood [orientation] when we checked in which was very helpful in getting our bearings and taking note of great spots to check out for food and nightlife. We wish we could have stayed longer!” (Hilary) Maison Marais is in the heart of the St Claude Avenue art and entertainment district (with a monthly Second Saturday Art Walk). Adjacent to Faubourg Marigny and so close to the Bywater area, it is perfectly located for exploring. Think restaurants written up in national magazines, lively bars and coffee shops that locals frequent. Within walking distance, you might try The Franklin, N7, Paladar 511 or Red’s Chinese for a memorable dinner. Next day, wander over to Cake Café, Elizabeth’s or the St Roch Market for breakfast as early as 7am or, if you like to sleep a little later, a reasonably-priced, delicious lunch. It is centrally located, only 2 blocks away from St. Charles Ave and perfect for large groups. Large string lighted shared fenced backyard. This property features 3 bedrooms and two full baths. name: Artsy Shotgun Apartment in Central City
description: Live like a local during your stay!  This two bedroom, one bath shotgun apartment has plenty of that New Orleans charm—high ceilings, mantels and tall windows. It’s filled with original paintings, unique touches and comfortable furniture. The kitchen pantry is stocked with staples, there is a washer and dryer, extra linens, umbrellas, and a parlor/office to make you feel at home.  **READ ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IN THE LISTING DESCRIPTION ABOUT THE HOUSE AND NEIGHBORHOOD PRIOR TO BOOKING.** The apartment has two bedrooms, one bathroom, kitchen, living room and desk office. The house is a ‘shotgun’ layout, so you walk through each room to get to the next, making it most ideal for close friends. There is a washer and dryer, extra closet space with hangers, clothes iron, hair dryer, plenty of towels, and pantry with staples, including coffee and tea. The kitchen has pots, pans and other cooking supplies. There is a large desk facing the window in one of the bedrooms, a record player and boo
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in a working class New Orleans neighborhood that is a little rough around the edges. My family and I have lived in the house for 6 years and have had no problems with safety. We are walking distance to the streetcar line, St. Charles mansions and the Garden District, but Central City is NOT a touristy location. Central City is not the Garden District. If you are not comfortable with urban neighborhoods this may not be the spot for you. Do not expect Bourbon Street or the French Quarter, although the house is only about a 10 minute ride away from those things. The neighborhood has a ton to offer for those looking to get off the beaten path. Sunday second lines go within a block of the house with awesome brass bands, urban cowboys, and marching crews.  The Mardi Gras parades are a 3 minute walk and Super Sunday surrounds our block. However, like a lot of New Orleans we are still rebuilding (we continue to work on our house and many folks in the neighborhood are doing
transit: The house is 3-5 minute walk to the St. Charles trolley line and at most a 10-15 minute drive to many places in the city (the convention center is 7 minutes, Bourbon Street is 10, City Park or Audubon Zoo are 15). There are a few bus lines that pick up and drop off one block away.

name: Steps to the French Quarter in the CBD
description: French Quarter inspired modern luxurious condo with original brick walls that date back to the 1830s & large windows that face Union Street. New hardwood floors and top of the line stainless steel appliances. Half a block from the street car and just steps away from French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Convention Center, Superdome and historic St. Charles Avenue. This is a licensed short term rental - 17STR-10840 This condo is ideally located for Mardi Gras, Jazz fest, and all of the French Quarter festivals and events. Famous Royal Street which is renowned for antique shopping, art galleries, boutiques, and restaurants is only a short walk away, as is Bourbon Street and all of its entertainment, energy, and excitement. The kitchen is fully equipped and furnished with all new appliances; you will have everything you need to put together great New Orleans Cuisine. You will always have a host just a phone call away. There is always something happening in the CBD/Quarter, be it a festival, par
neighborhood_overview: There is always something happening in the CBD/Quarter, be it a festival, parade, convention, or just a beautiful day. Walk to your favorite restaurant, take a paddle wheel cruise, go on a horse drawn buggy ride on a cool night, and explore jazz clubs and bars only a few steps away. This is a one of a kind property in the greatest city in the world...
transit: There are various ways of getting about the City! Public transportation is in walking distance of the condo. Also, you can enjoy a ride on a Hop-On-Off Double Decker Bus tour,  this maybe the fastest way to see the City. Pedicabs are readily available throughout the French Quarter /CBD for those times where you just don't feel like walking anymore. Uber and Lyft are also available in New Orleans.

name: Mecca for music lovers, Frenchmen!
description: Location, Location, Location!   This is right on Frenchmen Street, mecca for music lovers, art and food.  Support the local music scene in this wonderfully spacious apartment with everything you need.  Your own private balcony overlooks the "street scene" below,  where you can enjoy the plethora of music while sipping your beverage of choice.  Keep shopping! Even at night with two art markets open from 6pm to 1am right across the street.  A very walkable area just two blocks from the quarter. The apartment and building date back to 1861.  High ceilings, hardwood floors, yes the bathroom is modern (walk-in shower).  Chadeliers, private balcony, full kitchen.  Living room is stylish and the bedroom is comfortable.  Central air/heat Private Balcony overlooking the clubs, New Orleans Premiere Jazz Club, Snug Harbor is next door, spotted cat & the Frenchmen Street Art Market are across the street.  d.b.a., another great music club is on other side.  You are literally surrounded by music, ar
neighborhood_overview: At around 5:00 pm you start to hear someone singing or a band playing, subtely at first until it gets a little later.  A very walkable area.  The location is just two blocks from the French Market, The Mint (State Museum) and numerous other landmarks.  Frenchmen street is now dotted with music venues on the 500/600 block.  Restaurants too numerous to mention are all nearby.  By evening, you can hear a brass band in the distance or witness another impromptu parade.  Two art markets open in the evening until 1:00 am. Don't worry! Sleep in, after all you are on vacation!
transit: Walkable area, two blocks to the French Quarter.  If you are tired just hop on bicycle buggy powered by someone else while you enjoy the scenery! The experience is priceless!

name: Best Location in the Heart of the Marigny Triangle
description: Unique, private, newly renovated apartment.  Easy walk to Frenchman street, Marigny neighborhood, Crescent Park and the French Quarter.  Short drive or bike to Fairgrounds/Jazz Fest/City Park.  Fully stocked, modern, kitchen.  Comfy living area.  Amenities included.  Queen bed in private bedroom with washer dryer.  Fold down Futon in living areas can sleep 2 more (apartment sleeps up to 4 total).  Immerse yourself in one of New Orleans' best historic neighborhoods. (City License #: 17STR-06464). Basement apartment with private entrance in a newly constructed house within the historic Marigny.  Features an open living room and kitchen divided by an eat in bar, full bath with tub, washer/dryer, and a separate bedroom.  Kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need to prepare your own meals and a few bonus essentials. Guests will be given a key to a private entrance on the side of the house.  Guests have access to a small patio next to the entrance. We live onsite and are available to
neighborhood_overview: We are in the "Marigny Triangle," which is a historic neighborhood immediately adjacent to the French Quarter, which starts on the other side of Esplanade Ave.  This is part of the "residential" portion of the quarter, which is a little quieter than the area closer to Canal Street.  The neighborhood features a number of more local shops and restaurants.  We are a five-minute walk from Frenchman Street, which is home to a large number of great music venues, bars and restaurants.  Close to the new streetcar line on Rampart St. that services the French Quarter, Canal St (Theatre area) and Central Business District/Superdome.  Line terminus is the Loyola Street Bus Station.  It is a short drive or bike down Esplanade Ave to the Fair Ground, Mid City, and City Park.
transit: Parking: Street parking is generally easy and available.  The block immediately in front of the house is technically 2hr residential parking, which means you can be ticketed if you park there for an extended period of time.  However, enforcement is sporadic.  We park there regularly.  There are green signs that identify this zone.  One block back towards the main street and around the corner in both directions is not restricted and you can park there without being ticketed.  These are short blocks and this gets you within about 100ft of the house. Walking: From the house, you can walk pretty much anywhere in the French Quarter area.   Public Transit There are two street cars within walking distance that run in parallel down the sides of the French Quarter.  The closest is the new St Claude/N. Rampart line that runs within a block of the house with stops within 2-2.5 blocks either in either direction.  We are near the end of this line on the Maringy side.  This line will take you along

There is always something happening in New Orleans, be it a festival, parade, convention, or just a beautiful day. name: Chateau Lola     18STR-11379.
description: This classic, funky old New Orleans house was built in 1912, purchased by my Great Grandfather in 1923. Located in University area, apartment on the second floor (not handicap accessible). 2000 sq ft, 3 br, 2 bath, private balconies, new kitchen.  A short walk to Maple Street, Audubon Park (including a world class zoo), Tulane, Loyola. The world's oldest continuously operating streetcar line, which takes you directly into the French Quarter, is mere steps away. I live on the first floor. This second floor apartment has 3 bedrooms; one has two twin beds that can be put together the other has a full size bed,  an office with a day bed and trundle, also a full kitchen pots, pans, coffee maker, microwave. washer and dryer, bar sitting area for 4.  One bathroom has a claw foot tub the other has a shower. Have a glass on your private balcony while listening to the streetcar roll by. Private entrance to second floor apartment, that has fully equipped kitchen, including dishes and cookware, 2
neighborhood_overview: The house is in walking distance of Tulane and Loyola also Maple st. for coffee shops, restaurants and some bars.  the neighborhood is a mix of college students, families, teachers.  We are a streetcar ride away from downtown and all the stops along the way
transit: We are on the St. Charles streetcar line, a short walk through Audubon park will get you to the Magazine bus and a few blocks the other way will get you on the Freret jet (local colloquialism for the bus that takes you down the happening Freret Corridor to Canal Street), they will all get you to Canal St.  Different sites along the way. A pleasant neighborhood to walk around in in general.

name: Marigny Garden Charmer with Bikes!
description: Located on the border of the Marigny and Bywater, the city's bohemian core and a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter, this stylish and historic garden apartment provides easy access to soak up the magic of downtown New Orleans. The perfect home for Mardis Gras, Jazz Fest, and more! Soaring ceilings, wide-plank flooring, original moldings, eclectic furnishings, this apartment is well over a century old and exudes New Orleans authenticity. You'll be in a local's shoes the moment you walk in the door, and will quickly realize why those of us who live in the neighborhood rarely leave it.   Some highlights: - plush, Queen-sized Casper mattress and crisp white linens to ensure a good night's rest on a quiet corner - high speed internet - prime location: the French Quarter is a few blocks away, and downtown's coolest bars and restaurants are literally steps from the front door - two new, well-maintained bikes (typically $40 a day to rent) to explore the city; Jazz Fest is ten minutes away! -
neighborhood_overview: Simply put, the Marigny is unlike anywhere else. Lush, mysterious, and funky, the neighborhood has so much of what makes New Orleans great, from the food to the music, without being overrun by tourists. Situated between the French Quarter and the Bywater, it allows for easy access to the best of downtown.
transit: New Orleans is best seen by bike, and taxis are a phone call away. There are buses nearby, too, so you'll have no trouble getting around town.

name: The Caribbean Room at the Galerie on Esplanade
description: Enjoy your visit to New Orleans the way it's been enjoyed for centuries - in a 150 year old lovely home on beautiful Esplanade Avenue. This private home offers newly renovated rooms, offering modern conveniences and preserving it's original glamour. This lovely is surrounded by a lovely wrought iron fence and features a large veranda out front - perfect for enjoying your morning coffee or an afternoon cocktail.  Each room sleeps two guests. The space offers original hardwood flooring, soaring ceilings, and are stylishly decorated.  There is a shared restroom at the end of the hallway, featuring a shower/bathtub combo, lavatory, toilet, fresh towels. We ask that guests please provide their own toiletries. Guests will access home from the front entrance and all bedrooms are located at the top of the beautiful wood stairway. Guests will have access to the expansive outdoor veranda, their room, a shared restroom, and other common areas of the house. Host will be on site to meet guests upon
neighborhood_overview: The home is located on beautiful Esplanade Avenue, which is surrounded by a canopy of lovely oak trees, offering the peace and serenity for which New Orleans is so well known.   Geographically, the house is on the edge of the 7th Ward, and within just a few blocks of an arterial road which offers easy access, no matter your entry point into town. Once here, you really don't need a car at all. The house is located approximately half a mile from the French Quarter, the Marigny, and lively Frenchman Street! It's also less than a mile from the French Market where local artisans gather with their best local-made wares for sale, and a plethora of options for taking in brunch or a nice lunch, featuring local cuisine.  The house is also within easy walking distance to the Jazz and Heritage grounds.
transit: From the house, it's very easy to hop on the city bus system, which passes on Esplanade Avenue. It's also a short cab ride to area attractions (maybe $10 cab ride) but, like everything in this city, the best kept secrets and beauty lie within the places that you don't see when riding in a cab or a bus. It's the stories in the nooks and crannies of his centuries old city - the places you don't see from a fast-moving car. For this reason, renting a bicycle is recommended. Doing so will give you an up close and personal tour of the city's architecture and allows you the freedom to stop and take it all in. There are many area bicycle rental shops. We are happy to make recommendations for you.

description: This beautiful 19th-century home has been carefully restored and filled with period furniture.  The kitchen is the best kitchen you will find on Airbnb -- Wolf range, well-equipped, built for a chef at home.  Living room with 1920's baby grand piano. Full formal dining room with chandelier and 19th c. furnishing. The bedroom has a desk and small tea table.  The house is at Frenchman St and N Claiborne, and is a short (10 minute) walk from the jazz clubs of the French Quarter. All original 19th c. hardwood floors, window frames, glass and moldings. Working gas fireplace in living room. 12 foot high ceilings. Two canoes available for use can be found on the side of the house. Use of all but the back bedroom which is locked off from the rest of the house. My co-host Marcus lives right around the corner and will be available to you should you need anything at all. The interesting things to explore are generally towards Frenchman. from there you can head directly into the french quarter.
transit: Just 4 short blocks from the St. Claude streetcar line that connects all the desirable locations of the city. 10 minute walk to the most famous part of Frenchman, 15-20 minute walk to the Quarter. Can see about 4 restaurants within eye shot of the house.

neighborhood_overview: Uptown New Orleans is one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in the city. You can literally walk anywhere - Audubon Park is a short walk from the house as well as hundreds of bars, restaurants, and shops. The Quarter is a short Uber away (three miles), but honestly our neighborhood has so much to offer there is no reason to even head that way more than once just to get Bourbon Street out of your system. :-) We are also at the epicenter of all of the Parade Routes during Carnival and St. Patrick's Day. Close enough to walk and far enough away from the routes to rest when needed. Location is amazing. Here is a great long list of our favorite neighborhood spots.  Have fun exploring!  WHERE TO EAT AND DRINK UPTOWN  Ancoro Pizzeria and Salumeria  Wood-fired puttanesca pizza is topped with tomato sauce, garlic, capers, black olives, anchovies, oregano and chili oil. We suggest you Uber or cab home when you are alone or if it is late in the evening. Uber drivers are available 24/7.  We are a ten minute walk from the St Charles Streetcar line. The Historic St. Charles Streetcar Line is the longest in the city and the oldest continuously operating street railway system in the world. If you want to catch the St. Charles Line heading toward Uptown/Garden District, then you’ll want to catch the car at the corner of St. Charles Avenue and Common (Website hidden by Airbnb) Charles Street Car to Garden District The cars on this line are registered with National Register of Historic Places and remain unaltered. The neighbourhood is a mix of mostly residential homes with small commercial business interspersed.  There are authentic (and aging) shotgun style houses with neighbours who have lived in the area for years, as well as many new renovations and beautifully restored heritage homes. There is plenty of free parking around the home if you decide to rent or bring a car.  There are plenty of transit options and many amenities in the area, as well as Uber readily available so having a car isn't a requirement.  Amenities in the area Our house is blocks from renowned restaurants and shops on Oak Street, any kind of cuisine you could be craving  -Jacques Imo’s (a highlight restaurant for authentic local food) -Breads On Oak (French bakery),  -Simone's, a  local and or
transit: Our home is very centrally located, away from the noise of the heart of downtown but close to many other restaurant and nightlife options. And for when you want to be in the heart of the French Quarter a 10 minute walk gets you to a 24 hour a day streetcar and a scenic ride on it across town will bring you to most areas of New Orleans – the French Quarter, the Garden District, to the Bywater, to Frenchman Street. So many amenities are within walking of our home but if you should need, a bus line runs nearby on Leonidas.  The street car to French Quarter and many other areas of the city runs 24/7 and Uber and taxis are also readily available. There is parking out front for anyone who rents or brings a car.

name: Uptown Private Apt - 1 BLOCK TO ST. CHARLES AVE
description: Come enjoy this newly appointed apartment as a convenient home-base to explore New Orleans, with a well-stocked kitchen, a spotless bathroom, and a cozy pillow-top queen bed! 1 BLOCK to the streetcar and mansion-lined St. Charles Ave.  Only 3 miles to the historic French Quarter when riding the streetcar! This apartment sleeps 4 guests comfortably. Please review the section entitled "The Space" for more details. This centrally-located apartment is well-appointed for a getaway weekend in "The Big Easy". You'll sleep peacefully in the luxurious queen-sized master bed after enjoying the shaded outdoor living area. Plenty of closet space with extra linens! The couch in the living room folds out to a full size sofa bed! The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need (cookware, dishware, silverware, etc) to cook an authentic New Orleans meal using the ingredients you've purchased at The Fresh Market, a large neighborhood grocery store 2 blocks away. Come stay, relax, and have fun! The
neighborhood_overview: This property is one block North from mansion-lined St. Charles Avenue filled with high quality bars and restaurants (Commander's Palace, The Delachaise, Martin Wine Cellar, Superior Seafood). If you want to stray a bit further from home, you are a quick 10-minute car ride to the world-famous French Quarter (the city's most famous bars, restaurants, shopping and architecture), Frenchman Street (a collection of the city's hottest live jazz venues) and The Garden District.
transit: The St. Charles streetcar line is 1 block away. This is the most-economical way for traveling to and from this location. $1.25 for one-way travel and $0.25 for streetcar line transfer. Visit the RTA-New Orleans website for 3-5 day passes. I would highly recommend using the streetcar for LEISURELY, ECONOMICAL transport. Both Uber and Lyft are highly recommended for more efficient transportation.

name: Quiet Studio with Bayou St. John View
description: Enjoy being centrally located in Bayou St. John.  Look out your front window and see the water, walk 5-10 minutes and you have access to groceries, restaurants, a wine bar and many other amenities.  Or enjoy a 15 minute walk to city park to scope out an art exhibit, play mini golf or just enjoy the scenery.  You'll be living in the heart of this very beautiful neighborhood, living like a local and enjoying your own quiet studio apartment. This is a studio which means it is open. There is a small kitchen with a table for two, couch and television. The bedroom has a small closet to hang clothes and store luggage and the bath has a large walk in shower with bench. The space is recently renovated with original heart pine floors, and the unique Arabian archway between the bedroom and living room. Enjoy lots of light, high ceilings and a very pleasant space. The entire apartment is yours! We are here if you need us, we both work from home and are usually home throughout the day.  If you need
neighborhood_overview: We live in an old neighborhood full of classic New Orleans shotgun homes and old corner stores converted to homes.  It is very walkable with a couple of nice tree lined avenues, Ursulines and Esplanade, that run down to the French Quarter (I would not advise walking to the quarter, but they are nice to walk around in our section of town).  We have some of the oldest homes in the city located on the bayou waterway, we are a short distance from City park and the streetcar.
transit: We are about a 1/4 mile from the end of the Canal Street streetcar line which runs to downtown.  There is also Uber and Lyft so it is really not necessary to have a car and in fact is easier since parking can be challenging in many neighborhoods.   If you are bringing a car there is street parking, but we would encourage you to park at the beginning of the block as that is usually open and easiest.

name: Private backhouse w/ kitchen in Carrollton area
description: This independent, recently renovated back house with full kitchen is sweet and clean.  Whether it's enjoying the walking distance of restaurants, shops, and bars on Oak Street, Maple Street or Riverbend, or taking part in the activities on Tulane or Loyola campuses or Audubon Park, this is the perfect quiet and cozy jumping-off point for exploring New Orleans. This unit requires a minimum rental period of 30 days - how much of that you use is up to you.  Competitively priced with rave reviews! This detached backhouse has a full kitchen, full bath, large queen size bed with a Tempur-pedic mattress, and a twin size day bed with another roll-out twin trundle underneath. There is also a private outdoor patio underneath the shade of a giant Elm tree.  The backhouse (along with the main house) was completely renovated in 2017. The entire detached backhouse, and the private patio are all yours. This backhouse is detached from the main house and offers independent check-in / check-out and a pr
neighborhood_overview: Top Ten Reasons for why love our neighborhood.  10. Safety The East Carrollton neighborhood (part of “Uptown”) has low crime rate and is patrolled regularly by the NOPD 2nd District and the Tulane and Loyola Police Departments.  9. Audubon Park and Zoo This beautiful oak filled park and award-winning zoo are about a mile from our location. I run there each morning and take my kids to the playgrounds and zoo all the time. The “Fly” connects the park to the Mississippi waterfront and is the place to be when the weather is nice.  8. Snake and Jake’s Christmas Lounge A truly legendary New Orleans dive bar. This a small, late-night, neighborhood bar that has been voted 'New Orleans Best Dive Bar' many times and is a favorite of folks around the world.  They are open every night of the year, especially Christmas.  You could crawl home if you needed to (not that I ever have...) 7. St. Charles Avenue Street Car Line The historic line starts uptown, at South Carrollton Avenue and South Claiborn
transit: Three blocks to the streetcar line, another half a block to the closest pickup point headed downtown.  It's also easy and quick to catch an Uber from here to anywhere.

name: Jazz Fest Home: Jazz Under the Oaks 18STR-08646
description: Beautiful historic home in the Mid City neighborhood, the heart of New Orleans. Excellent location 3 blocks from New Orleans Jazz Fest! Walking distance to many restaurants, coffee shops, dancing, barber/beauty salons, gift shops, entertainment and more. 3 private bedrooms offer friends and families comfort and space. Off street parking. 8 min drive to French Quarter and Frenchman Street jazz clubs.  7 min drive to City Park via the beautiful Esplanade Ave. Only 4 min drive to street car. A quick glance up the street will give you a good idea of all of the businesses that will peak your interest and taste buds all within walking distance of the apartment. Guest have full access to the whole apartment which provides ample space for a family of six, or a group of six friends. The front porch and back deck is for the guests’ use. The whole back yard is also for your use if you choose to, during your stay. We will allow all of our guests the freedom to enjoy the home and/or explore New Orl
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is conveniently located close to so many amenities, that you can stay in the neighborhood and never get bored. There’s New Orleans Famous hotdogs at the corner. Across the street is Broadview Seafood. A few steps further, at the corner, is the Bayou Road corridor. There’s Piroques which offers food and drinks, also there is Dominos Record Store, MLV Nail Shop, The Half Shell on the Bayou, The Pagoda Cafe and the Caribbean Reggae Club all in walking distance. If you would have continued straight, you would run into the Famous McHardy’s Fried Chicken and don’t worry, If your money runs short, there is a J P Morgan Chase Bank right across the street from McHardy’s. Of course we are 3 -4 blocks to the Jazz Fest, a short uber ride down the beautiful Esplanade Ave to the French Quarter to the east and Beautiful Serene City Park to the west.
transit: Depending on your destination uber, taxi or the blue bikes rentals (located right on Bayou Road, next to the Uber Office) would do good for the French Quarters, Harrah’s Casino and the World Famous Canal Street shopping.  If you are headed to City Park, an uber or blue bike rental will work fine. If you’d like to see the city travel our Regional Transit bus line, you can get one right at the corner of the apartment and transfer to the Street Car.

name: Chic Private Room in French Quarter near Bourbon
description: We are the cure for the common hotel / hostel - City House Hostel New Orleans!  Check out the bands and bars of Bourbon Street & French Quarter (2 blocks away!), an easy stroll to Jackson Square (4 blocks), beignets at Cafe du Monde, see the Mardi Gras parades on Canal Street (1 block!) - all of it just steps from our front door! Want to ride the street car line to see the historical architecture? Want to know where the best po boys are or go see alligators? We got you covered there as well! This listing is for a private queen room in a hostel.  The queen room has one queen bed that can accommodate 2 guests. Snuggle up and get comfortable in our Tuft + Needle queen sized bed and enjoy a few extra little luxuries. Come on and bring a party! (Just remember to make enough reservations for each member of your party!) All rooms have heat and air conditioning.  We provide pillows, blankets, fitted sheets, and towels for FREE But we are s (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) much more than that! W
neighborhood_overview: You literally can't find a better place to be to explore New Orleans and the French Quarter.   At City House Hostel New Orleans you are one block from the parade routes and two blocks from Bourbon Street! Those two blocks, by the way, are AWESOME! Now you are super close to all the action, without the noise!  So now when it is finally time to sleep (because, come on...at some point you're going to have to sleep!) you'll actually get a good nights sleep! In the French Quarter where we are located you will find all of the music, bands, bars, restaurants, and town plazas that has made New Orleans and the French Quarter famous for so long!  Take an easy stroll to Jackson Square, have bengeits at Cafe du Monde, check out Mardi Gras parades on Canal Street - all of it just steps from our front door!
transit: We offer free maps when you check in to help you get around and our friendly staff will point you to where ever you need (or want!) to go! Additionally, City House Hostel New Orleans is only one block to the famous New Orleans Street Car's that run all over the city! There is no provided parking available unfortunately. There are numerous parking garages within one block of our property, but we can't really recommend one over another.  But be aware -- where ever you do park, it is *always* for pay, so be sure you do. The lot owners around here are notorious for towing unpaid vehicles.

Only 3 miles from the French Quarter, you are sure to enjoy all aspects of New Orleans charm! The two main bedrooms are in the back of the home and the third bedroom is the front room in the house.  It can function as a second living area or third bedroom with a queen pull out couch! description: A Lovely historical home has lot of space and Charming Antique finishes with a contemporary/modern twist. A great stay for solo adventurers, Convention travelers, students or Interns.  NOLA's own Rouses Grocery across the street and next door to a bar that's great if you want to wind down after a long flight or day. Tipitinas nearby too! The area is usually quiet when there are no parties next door,professionals neighbors, Street Parking.Cool Off with Hansens Snowball 3 blks away. As you can see in the images, This is a Spacious SEMI PRIVATE Shotgun style Bed Room with a full size comfy bed. This room has a bed , a nightstand a dresser a mirror, lamp, 24 inch smart tv with Netflix.  and a closet.  It's Very comffy and cozy while living the nola shotgun style life. This home offers a great way to see how New Orleanians live uptown and have lived for centuries. A true nola experience at an affordable price in a convenient location. What more can you ask for? I'll look forward to meet you
neighborhood_overview: There is a fabulous grocery store directly across the street which stays open until midnight. So if you cook Great, you will enjoy using my brand New Stainless Steel 5 burner stove. If you dont cook, no problem... there is plenty of good food cooked like grandma across the st. Breakfast, lunch and dinner at New Orleans Own Rouses Grocery store. Tipitina's less than 2 blocks away. I'm on the parade route where they line up so that will be fun, A local restaurant on the next block for nights you want to take it easy. I'm also super close to Magazine and St. Charles avenue where there are several restaurants to choose from or just hop on the street car and check out the Beautiful Historical French Quarters where I'm sure there's a festival of some sort.  Tipitinas is 2 blocks away, and i'm very convenient to the Convention Center  3.9 miles away or a 15 minute bus ride or 5 minute uber ride and  the Cruise terminal is even closer.   This is also great for Cross Crountry Travelers who want

And if you are going in the other directions, it's close to shopping and the Beautiful Audubon Park near Loyola University. A quick uber or 10 block walk to the street car or a 4 block walk to Magazine street. Very convenient location if you rely on public transportation or if you are traveling by car.  $3 dollars gets you a RTA Day pas ( bus)

name: Cozy Townhouse in Uptown Nola
description: Cozy 2 bedroom 2.5 bathrooms in this modern two story townhouse located at the heart of Uptown New Orleans,  just a few blocks from Magazine street and several trendy restaurants and bars.  Choose whether to enjoy a nice walk in the Garden District—which is considered one of the best preserved collection of historic mansions in the southern United States—or dive into the French Quarter nightlife which will certainly not disappoint. European inspired recently constructed condo in prime location. Tons of natural light, cathedral high ceilings, adorable balcony, beautiful wood flooring. Feels like a classic Nola home, but built less than ten years ago.  Located in one of the best parts of town. You will be walking distance: -Delicious restaurants  -Bars & Breweries -Street Car -Art Galleries -Cemeteries -Historic Garden District ....and much much more!!! Ps. Stop by some of our favorites: Nola Brewery, Miel, Urban South—just to name a few.  Shopping: Tons of cute boutiques, cool antique stores, coffee shops, pastry shops (Sucre-YUM),  bakeries (Including--La Boulangerie--A MUST), pharmacies and supermarkets (Breaux Mart). name: Cottage on Frenchmen
description: Cute little place tucked away off of busy Frenchmen Street. Landscaped and lit courtyard make this a very romantic, special apartment. Brand new queen bed, full size fridge, stove, oven, coffee maker. Shower in the bathroom, all custom wood work and quirky designs throughout. Fully legal STR # 17-STR-06486. Don't get caught renting an illegal unit that will have to cancel. Imagine a lovely little quiet courtyard, and you're own little spot to call home in a world of live jazz music. Situated in the only courtyard on Frenchmen, this little place has hosted multiple musicians and friends. Cute little apartment with full amenities makes this spot much better than a hotel. Full kitchen, with stove, refrigerator, small coffee pot, dishes, linens, slate shower, wood floors, wood counters, BBQ. There is also a washer and dryer on site if you need to do some laundry! Access to public areas(please note other tenants are allowed to use the courtyard also) laundry room , apartment. I may possibly
neighborhood_overview: Frenchmen Street! The most sought after area for music and food lovers alike. Only one block to the French Quarter and one block to the French Market and Trolley, it is truly a unique area in that it is right in the heart of everything.

name: Fairgrounds Studio
description: Tucked in the back of my shotgun house, this airy 2 room plus bath apt. with it's own side entrance is in the historic Bayou St. John area. The studio apartment is a part of my house, but no part of it is shared with anyone. Walk to bayou, restaurants, grocery, City Park, Museum, bus and streetcar. 15 Minute drive to French Quarter, very easy with Uber. I live in the rest of the house, though you have a private side entrance, and am around most of the time if something is needed. There is a large kitchen area with micro, toaster oven, coffee maker and fridge, and a stove top if needed.  check in 2pm    check out 12am Access to their studio apartment, the backyard, and front porch if desired. I am around most of the time, do work outside the house some days, but I live in the house so am around most evenings. This is one of the most charming neighborhoods in New Orleans, where you can walk to most things needed or desired, Restaurants, wine bar, general store, City Park, art museum, Bay

transit: There is a public bus stop 2 blocks away that will take you to the French Quarter, and you can catch the streetcar in front of the museum, about 8 blocks away. Uber is an easy mode of transportation. I am 10 minutes from the French Quarter by car.

name: Domio Baronne St. \| Stylish Two Bedroom Suite \| Pool + Gym
description: Domio Baronne St. is the perfect place for large groups of families and friends to enjoy curated apartment-style living with hotel amenities. Located in the heart of the Warehouse District, guests are minutes away from the French Quarter and Convention Center. As New Orleans’ first apartment-hotel, Domio Baronne St. boasts a range of luxe rooms—from cozy studios to four bedroom suites with full kitchens. Enjoy the lively atmosphere of our rooftop pool or break a sweat in our fitness center. Relax in our elegant two bedrooms with hand-picked furniture, Casper® mattresses, unique artwork, and all your home essentials. 1152 square feet (average) Master Bedroom: Queen bed Guest Bedroom: Queen bed Living Room: Sofa bed Please note that some units come with an in unit washer and dryer (subject to availability).  Disclaimer: Design, decorations, floor plans, and furnishings may vary from images shown in the listing. Enjoy brand new, modern facilities inside of this historic Warehouse District
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of the Warehouse District, old New Orleans meets new. Also known as the Arts District, the Warehouse District is filled with many museums, brunch spots, and bars for visitors to explore. You'll be minutes from the Ernest N. Morial Convention Center and the French Quarter. Exploring the French Quarter is essential to an authentic New Orleans experience. That’s why we are perfectly situated from the historic neighborhood—close enough by foot, trolley, and car, but far away enough for a sound sleep.
transit: Being centrally located, you will have plenty of Uber, Lyft, Streetcars, Blue Bikes, and more transportation services available to use to explore New Orleans. Domio Baronne St. is approximately 20-25 minutes away by car from the Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport. There is a third party valet garage service available at the property for $40 per car per night. Blue Bike Hub - Julia Street & St. Charles Ave (3 blocks away) St. Charles Streetcar Stop (Line #12) - Carondelet at Julia (2 blocks away) Rampart-St. Claude Streetcar Stop(Line #49) - S Rampart at Julia (3-4 blocks away)

You will enjoy being close to the heart of New Orleans in a historical and convenient location.  We offer all the necessary amenities in the home, so make yourself at home. This traditional "NOLA" duplex (double) lends access to the heart of the city, being within walking distance of Uptown/Carrollton streetcar, and many festivals and attractions! The 3 bedroom home offers our guests 3 queen beds, 2 air mattresses making it spacious enough to accommodate up to 10 family and friends. There is also a full size equipped kitchen, bathroom, and washer/dryer in the home. Our guests have access to the right side of the duplex (double) and all things inside of the home. D
neighborhood_overview: *The neighborhood is located in the  Historical Uptown/Carrollton area. *This neighborhood is a laid-back residential area known for it's oak trees and landmark restaurants like the late-night Camellia Grill, and the Iconic Jacque-Imo's, Brigsten's Restaurant, Clancy's Restaurant, and Carrollton Market, serving Creole Cuisine.   *Venerable live music venues include the Maple Leaf Bar, Tipitina's Uptown, Gasa Gasa, Carrollton Station, Rock N' Bowl,  for brass bands, bayou tunes and dancing.   *Quirky bookstores and indie clothing boutique line Oak Street, while Palmer Park has a popular monthly art market.
transit: There are several options for transportation which include: *Uptown St. Charles streetcar *RTA (Bus Transportation) *UBER *LYFT

name: The Napoleon Suite @ Grey Gardens NOLA
description: This 100% private guest suite is housed within my lovingly restored historic home. It boasts a private entrance, bathroom, coffee bar, mini fridge, microwave and exterior patio area. It is conveniently located just two blocks off beautiful Esplanade Avenue between the French Quarter & City Park. An easy 15 minute walk lands you in the French Quarter or Frenchmen Street. If you bike, even better! There is a bike rental rack a few blocks away and you’ll be there in 5 minutes flat! The Napoleon Suite is a sparkling clean little gem, furnished with a mix of vintage & modern decor and its walls are lined with work from New Orleans artists. This is a great getaway spot for anyone seeking a fun-filled New Orleans adventure. It is not a party pad, just a calm location for couples, two friends or the solo traveler. The house is located within an authentic New Orleans neighborhood. You will be quick to notice that everyone you meet will greet you with a hello or good morning. Don’t be afraid to
neighborhood_overview: Grey Gardens is conveniently located two blocks off beautiful tree lined Esplanade Avenue and just one block from the famed Treme neighborhood. This is a culturally rich historic African American neighborhood where many of the city’s Jazz musicians got their start. The location is also unique and special because it’s so close to the French Quarter, Frenchmen Street (where you really want to go to hear all the best music) and City Park. This is an awesome place to stay if you want to be close to all the action but not pay high hotel prices. $6 bucks in an Uber and you’re on Frenchmen ready to eat, sing and dance all night! I promise you this, my apartments are a screamin’ deal. Get more bang for your buck and stay at Grey Gardens! More information But wait, theres more! On Sundays you’ll spy a huge block party at Kermit Ruffin’s famous Mother In Law Lounge which is located four blocks away. If the Saints win…it’ll be an even bigger one! Since we have a funeral home around the corner you
transit: There are two “Blue Bike” metro bike rental racks roughly two blocks away. Lyft and Uber are always around and it will cost you about $6 to get to the French Quarter, Frenchmen Street or City Park. If you are here for Voodoo Fest or Jazz Fest, I suggest walking to the Fairgrounds. I do and it only takes about 20 minutes.

name: Ravenclaw Manor
description: Stunning arts and crafts style shotgun home located in the historic Lower 7th Ward just minutes from the famous French Quarter. Our neighborhood is a great getaway spot for artists, writers, creatives and anyone looking for a calm, quiet space while having the opportunity to venture out into the city nearby. Built in the 1920s our spacious home has the original heartpine wood flooring through-out, 10 foot ceilings, gorgeous windows throughout with plenty of natural light, central AC and balcony. You will be staying on the right side of the home, we live on the left side. There is a dedicated entrance and key, full kitchen, office and laundry room located on the first level. Please do not block the driveway. We will be available from 9am - 11am. We run a luxury piercing studio in the heart of the Quarter so we are not too far away. Just let us know if you need anything.Please do not block the driveway. Historic Streetcar, Blue Bikes Nola, Uber, Lift, RTA ABSOLUTELY NO DRUG USE IN OR ARO

name: GRAND 1868 MANSION NEXT TO HISTORIC GARDEN DIST.
description: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!  THIS HISTORIC HOME IS  OFF MAGAZINE ST. NEXT TO GARDEN DISTRICT . LOTS OF RESTAURANTS, BARS, CAFES, BOUTIQUES & GALLERIES. PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION, AND STARBUCKS ARE ACROSS THE STREET. WALK 3 BLOCKS TO ST. CHARLES AVE. AND WATCH MARDI GRAS PARADES OR CATCH A STREET CAR TO CONVENTION CENTER, CBD, AUDUBON ZOO, OR FRENCH QUARTER (1 MILE TO FRENCH QUARTER. This recently renovated huge 2500 sq. ft. historic home is perfect for convention, business, or wedding group stays.  It has soaring 13’ ceilings, antebellum architectural details, and hard wood floors, crystal chandeliers adorn the first floor with ceiling fans upstairs. The five Bedrooms have walk-through windows and doors onto front and side balconies. The grand entry hall sports a winding staircase, chandeliers, and a 10 ft. x12 ft. antique baroque framed mirror, ideal for bridal or group photos. Sip coffee or cocktails on the front porch swing or balconies. The galley style kitchen is fully equipped and
neighborhood_overview: Historic Garden District on Magazine street is right outside your door. Restaurants, bars, boutiques, and galleries line Magazine street for miles. The biggest Mardi Gras Parades roll three blocks away on St. Charles Ave. The most historic mansions in the City are right outside your door. This historic neighborhood is known for its beauty, charm, and grand historic  mansions.  Walk two blocks  to the world famous Commanders Palace Restaurant or take a tour of the historic 19th century Lafayette Cemetery. Hop on the St. Charles street car and dash off to the French Quarter, Convention Center, and CBD.  All are just 1.3 miles away.  Grab a coffee at Starbucks across the street or jump on  the HOP ON - HOP OFF sightseeing tour bus and ride atop the double decker tour bus for a unique view of the City.   This location offers history, beauty, and tranquility blended with the hip vibe of trendy Magazine Street while  also providing easy access to the Convention Center, the CBD and the excite
transit: The best way to get around will be to walk to Magazine Street  and Garden District venues, catch the Street Car on St. Charles Ave. to the Quarter. or uptown. Public transportation and bus sightseeing tour stops are across the street.  Take Uber or Lyft to any location in the City.

name: Spacious Suite w/ Historic Charm close to Magazine
description: Located in the heart of the historic Irish Channel neighborhood this suite is 3 blocks from Magazine St. It's perfect for sipping on coffee, dine at local restaurants, grab a local brew, or enjoy one of the City’s prime shopping thoroughfares. Accessible to public transportation and only eight blocks from St. Charles Ave where you can hop on the streetcar for a scenic ride Downtown or Uptown through the oak-lined avenue. Don't worry about Rambo; he sleeps all day, loves everyone and super quiet! You get much more than just a private room with this open two room layout (12'-0" x 32'-0") with a non-functioning fireplace in the center. A lazy Chihuahua/Rat Terrier that sleeps all day and doesn't bark or growl at people and central AC with your own thermostat for the downstairs! The camelback house was originally built in 1906 but I have been modernizing the space while restoring it to the original glory since 2015. Brittany and I live and spend most of our time in the master suite upstair
neighborhood_overview: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  A great neighborhood with lots of history and friendly people. The Irish Channel is filled with a mix of families, homeowners and renters and it's one of the new hot spots to live in New Orleans. I am surrounded by many longtime homeowners with renters on one side. A corner store on one corner and a neighborhood bar on the other. Nola Brewing Company, one of several local breweries, is within walking distance as well as Pete's Out in the Cold, Tracey's and Parasols for good times and great food. Red Dog is one of our favorite breakfast spots with great lunch and dinner options too.  - Breaux Mart, a local grocery store, is only eight blocks away with a Walgreen's next door for a short walk for supplies!
transit: *Bike share of New Orleans has arrived: visit the bluebikesnola website  - 70 bike stations throughout the initial service area (map available on nola*dot*gov/bike-share )  Blue bikes bike rack 10 blocks from the house on Magazine St. and Jackson Ave. Rough pricing is $8/hour but they prorate so you only pay what you use! According to G00GLE maps (appears accurate): French Quarter - 2.7 miles: 13 minute drive / 15 min. bike and 50 min. walk   Fair Grounds - 5.5 miles: 20 minute drive / 32 min. bike Superdome - 3 miles: 11 minute drive / 17 min. bike Lafayette Cemetery - .5 miles: 3 min. bike / 10 min. walk We live 3 blocks from Magazine Street, 15 minutes from the French Quarter and the Superdome. We walk and bike everywhere when home from work. There's also Uber and Lyft available in New Orleans. There's the public bus three blocks away with a bus stop on Magazine Street and Washington Avenue. The historic streetcar is only an eight block walk with a stop at Washington Avenue and St.

name: Saint Ann Retreat
description: Our neighborhood is safe and quiet; we live next door at 4522 and can assist you to make your stay comfortable and fun. Cross the street and enjoy the amenities of City Park, paths for walking, cycling or running. The park has botanical gardens, a sculpture garden, art museum, amusement park, miniature golf, beignets, wooded trails,  and  18 hole golf courses. You can rent bicycles & boats. We live 2 blocks from a safe bike path, the Lafitte Greenway, which takes you to Treme and the French Quarter.  We live in the heart of Mid-City so you will have easy access to each of the city’s historic neighborhoods. If you want to stay close to the house, you can eat at a local restaurant,  visit a neighborhood coffee shop, or try a snowball.  When you are ready to relax, the apartment is the perfect retreat.  We welcome everyone! The apartment has a TV, fully equipped (appliances/dishes) kitchen, queen bed, washer/dryer, and shower/tub. The front porch is available to sit and relax. If you need
neighborhood_overview: We live within 4 blocks of an iconic and funky hamburger joint, a Brennan's restaurant- Ralph's, and a Vietnamese fusion restaurant. There are 5 coffee shops within walking distance, shops, a grocery, many more restaurants, the best bakery in town,  and a neighborhood bar.
transit: We are  within walking distance of two streetcar lines that will take you downtown to visit the WWII Museum, Aquarium,  Insectarium, and  French Quarter.  You can rent a bike and cycle to the lakefront, Treme', the Bywater, or French Quarter.

It’s a unique home, raised requiring a flight of stairs to enter and features hardwood floors throughout, open concept living, dining and kitchen areas, recess lighting, treadmill, renovated bathrooms, optional driving service, granite countertops, etc. Home has a large backyard with a deck and ample parking. 420 Friendly  Walking into Leighton’s Place features an open concept living/dining and kitchen area. The entire home features hardwood floors throughout with awesome options for natural lighting or a beautiful display of recess lights throughout the shared living areas. New renovations were completed on the main living areas and bathrooms of the home. There is a treadmill available to use in the main living area for any of your cardio needs. The kitchen includes granite countertops with an island and a couple
neighborhood_overview: Grocery store, PJs Coffee Shop, selection of restaurants, nails and pampering salon, etc directly across the street. If you're VEGAN there's a restaurant less than a half mile up the road! Walking distance from the home is the New Orleans Lakefront with a multi mile long running/walking/biking trail. Milnie Neighborhood Playground is 0.7 miles away which features a full gym for your use that is completely free. Gym features a basketball court, elliptical room and boxing room. There are also classes that are offered.  New Orleans historical City Park is 2 - 3 miles away from the home.
transit: My mother, Terry offers driving service, please review the "OTHER THINGS TO NOTE" section for rates.  If you have your own vehicle there will be two parking spaces available for your use.

name: Large House- Free Parking & Lots of Extras
description: This southern guesthouse boast over 1200 sq. feet and  features all of the fixings including full kitchen, kingsize bed, large double living room, off street parking and much, much more. Our home boasts over 1200 square feet of spacious comfort.  Our property features a full size kitchen for cooking and congregating, a double living room for ultimate relaxation with a cable TV and WiFi,  a private bedroom located in the rear of the home, and luxury bath with jacuzzi tub. The guests will have access to the entire property. We do our best to ensure the safety and security of our guests with self check-in,  keyless entry, and a security/surveillance system. Gentilly is a broad, predominantly middle-class and racially diverse section of New Orleans, Louisiana. The Gentilly neighborhood is bounded by Lake Pontchartrain to the north, France Road to the east, Bayou St. John to the west, and the Louisville and Nashville Railroad to the south. The major north-south streets are Franklin Avenue,
neighborhood_overview: Gentilly is a broad, predominantly middle-class and racially diverse section of New Orleans, Louisiana. The Gentilly neighborhood is bounded by Lake Pontchartrain to the north, France Road to the east, Bayou St. John to the west, and the Louisville and Nashville Railroad to the south. The major north-south streets are Franklin Avenue, Elysian Fields Avenue, St. Anthony, St. Bernard, St. Roch, Paris, Wisner, A.P. Tureaud (formerly London) Avenue and Press. The east-west streets are Lakeshore Drive, Leon C. Simon, Robert E. Lee (a section of which was formerly called Hibernia), Prentiss, Harrison, Filmore, Mirabeau, Hayne, Chef Menteur, and Gentilly.
transit: We are one block from the city's bus line for travel in and around the city.  Also, we have  black car service from the airport for 50% off and discounted travel on Uber and Lfyt.

name: Luxury w/ French Quarter Feel in the CBD
description: French Quarter inspired modern luxurious condo with original brick walls that date back to the 1830s & large windows that face Union Street. New hardwood floors and top of the line stainless steel appliances. Half a block from the street car and just steps away from French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Convention Center, Superdome and historic St. Charles Avenue. This is a licensed short term rental - 17STR-10834 This condo is ideally located for Mardi Gras, Jazz fest, and all of the French Quarter festivals and events. Famous Royal Street which is renowned for antique shopping, art galleries, boutiques, and restaurants is only a short walk away, as is Bourbon Street and all of its entertainment, energy, and excitement. The kitchen is fully equipped and furnished with all new appliances; you will have everything you need to put together great New Orleans Cuisine. You will always have a host just a phone call away. There is always something happening in the CBD/Quarter, be it a festival, par
neighborhood_overview: There is always something happening in the CBD/Quarter, be it a festival, parade, convention, or just a beautiful day. Walk to your favorite restaurant, take a paddle wheel cruise, go on a horse drawn buggy ride on a cool night, and explore jazz clubs and bars only a few steps away. This is a one of a kind property in the greatest city in the world...
transit: There are various ways of getting about the City! Public transportation is in walking distance of the condo. Also, you can enjoy a ride on a Hop-On-Off Double decker Bus tour, this maybe the fastest way to see the City. Pedicabs are readily available throughout the French Quarter /CBD for those times where you just don't feel like walking anymore. You can always call a cab or Uber.

name: The Border to the Quarter Unit 4
description: Experience the local flavor in our private completely renovated shotgun double in one of the city's coolest neighborhoods. This private Marigny home is one block from the French Quarter, less than a 5 minute walk to Frenchman Street & Bourbon Street, moments from Jackson Square, a short bike ride to Midcity, and 4 blocks to our complimentary secure parking space. It is also centrally located between the River Walk Street Car Line as well as the new Rampart Street Car Line. Built in 1905, our brothel style shotgun (meaning it has a hallway running through the house for added bedroom privacy) retains the architecture you expect in a New Orleans home. High 12 foot ceilings, giant windows, original decorative brick fireplaces, restored pine wood floors,  open kitchen/living space with pocket doors for added privacy, private courtyard/patio -- you get the idea.  Its charm represents a home of its era, an open traditional shotgun with four bedrooms/two baths each complete with a QUEEN SIZE B
neighborhood_overview: The Marigny is one of the oldest and most interesting neighborhoods in New Orleans. You can walk or bike everywhere you need to go, and there are dozens of amazing restaurants, bars, and music venues of all types within minutes of the house.  Our Guidebook will have detailed information of everything going on.  We are also down the street from our favorite local bar R Bar! They have free Crawfish Boils every Friday during season - tip the chef!  During season Mardi Gras parades run down our street - our porch is perfect for people watching. If you are scheduling for Jazzfest, you'll want to consider renting bikes or scooters, as the fairground are about 2 miles away, which doesn't seem like much. . . until you've been at Jazzfest all day. Everything you could possibly want to do is within walking distance, though I would rent a bike for easier travel. Bicycle Michael's is a short walk from here and will set you up with the proper bike.  I am happy to help you get set up if you need ass
transit: Just a quick walk to the streetcar lines or the Hop on Hop Off Bus tour, and less than a block from a city bus stop. A five minute walk to Bourbon or Frenchmen Street, Jackson Square or the French Market. It is pedestrian friendly. Though bikes are optimal for adventures into the Bywater or if you plan to attend Jazz Fest. Uber drivers and cabs are abundant as well.
