name: Creole Cottage & Cafe: 6 minutes to anywhere!
description: Cozy private room & ensuite private bath in a newly renovated Creole cottage.  Bordering the Tremé and Mid-City - a great central location from which to explore the hipper parts of New Orleans: Bayou St John, Mid-City, City Park, the Tremé and of course, the Vieux Carré. You're 6 minutes from anywhere you need to be. Your hosts are well traveled, enjoy great music & food, and are happy to help you live New Orleans like a native.  PLEASE NOTE: You and any guest must be 25 or older to book. We're back open after some downtime and additional renovations!  After a year of hosting travelers from around the world, we spent some time evaluating our guests' feedback and made some changes to better accommodate our offerings at the Creole Cottage & Cafe. We completed some renovations, putting in a sliding barn door to open one of our bedrooms into the adjacent bathroom, creating an ensuite private bath for our guests.  It's quite cozy and charming, actually. And, where last year we rented out tw
neighborhood_overview: All around us are some great coffee houses, restaurants, and bars, including Hey Cafe, Chickie Wah Wah (which hosts live music), Willie Mae's Scotch House (legit fried chicken and soul food), Neyow's Creole Café (like the name says, Creole), Bayou Beer and Wine Garden, and the Broad Theater. Some of my favorite restaurants about are Fhramacy (yes with an F), Piece of Meat, Dooky Chase, Blue Oak BBQ, Marjorie's Grill and Toups Meatery. We're also close to great restos and bars on both Esplanade and Carrolton. During Mardi Gras, we're 3 blocks from Endymion, and 2 blocks from the end of Zulu.  The Zulu Social and Pleasure Club is also around the corner from here. For Essence Fest, you can get to the Super Dome fast through the secret back door (ask me about this), and the Convention Centre is straight down Girod from there. The Fair Grounds are two major streets away, which is where Jazz Fest takes place, and of course, where race horsing happens over the Winter season.  And Bayou St Joh
transit: One block over is the Lafitte Greenway - a bike path that runs the up/down of New Orleans, and, just around the corner at the Greenway is a Blue Bike station, so you can hop on a rental bike anytime. You can walk 3 blocks to the Canal Streetcar to go straight to the French Quarter or CBD, or, in the other direction, the characteristic main cemeteries of Mid City.  There's an app that will show you in real time where the Streetcar is on the tracks, so you can always make the car. At night, best and safest call is take a Lyft or Uber, it's a very cheap way to get around the city and they'll get here in minutes.

name: Napoleon Ave. Guest House - Steps from Tipitina's!
description: Cozy apartment in a historic New Orleans shotgun double located on Napoleon Avenue in the Heart of a fun Uptown neighborhood.  Steps to world-famous Tipitina's Music Club, one block from a large grocery store, only a few blocks away from several wonderful New Orleans restaurants. Sunny apartment with two bedrooms, small kitchen and bath.  Wifi, central air and heat, refrigerator, stove, microwave, ceiling fans, hardwood floors with rugs, high ceilings, and lots of charm :) Two airy bedrooms with a queen bed in each.  Small equipped kitchen and bath.  There are four steps on the front porch to get to the front door.  Also three steps down to get to the small side patio area.  Kitchen has a microwave, refrigerator, stove and oven.  Bathroom has a small shower only (no tub). Small equipped kitchen and bath with shower are in the back of the house.  Soon to have patio furniture on small side patio area. This apartment is one side of my house.  I live in the other side.  I am available if g
neighborhood_overview: This is a historic New Orleans neighborhood (Fauberg Bouligny / Riverside) that is residential with several small shops, restaurants, coffee shop, grocery store and more.  There is a small park and playground (Lawrence Square) three blocks up Napoleon.  Interesting architecture and historic New Orleans houses and buildings in the neighborhood are fun to check out and photograph.
transit: The apartment is on the Regional Transit Authority (RTA) bus line.  Uber, Lyft, and taxi cab are also available.  Pleasant walk (15 short blocks on beautiful, historic Napoleon Avenue) to the St. Charles Avenue Street Car.  Within a bike ride's distance to Audubon Park or the French Quarter

name: Luxury Home Sleeps 10 Near Streetcar & Riverbend
description: The owners call the home "Pretty Pritchard". It is a spacious home with beautiful hardwood floors and crystal chandeliers. The house was originally built in 1918 and renovated in 2016 featuring original wood trim. Windows galore provide beautiful natural light. The house is walking distance (6 blocks) to the Streetcar line. The location is perfect for families, wedding parties and parents visiting college students including Tulane, Loyola, Xavier University and Notre Dame Seminary. There is the main house upstairs with 2 large bedrooms, a TV room off the master suite, a formal parlor with a baby grand piano, a laundry room, a large dining room that seats 12 and  a beautiful kitchen. There is a TV room off the master bedroom with a queen sleeper sofa and flat screen TV. There is a generous cable package with movie channels and free Internet. There is large Terra Cotta balcony with furnishings. The bottom ground level has a two bedroom apartment with 2 bed rooms that have queen beds, a d
neighborhood_overview: Wonderful neighborhood. The famous Rock and Bowl is 2 blocks from the house. Each night there is live music and dancing featuring well known New Orleans artists. The College Inn Restaurant and Bar is also within 2 blocks of the house. It is a white tablecloth restaurant with a lively bar.  Oak Street and the Riverbend is close by as well as Magazine St. and St Charles Ave.  Visit (URL HIDDEN) and (URL HIDDEN) to see all of the attractions located close to the home and along the Streetcar route.
transit: The St. Charles Streetcar line is located just 6 blocks away from the home and the cost is $3 for the day.  To check the Streetcar schedule and maps go to (URL HIDDEN) The St. Charles Streetcar will take you to various destinations such as Tulane University, Oak Street and the Riverbend area, Magazine St. and St. Charles St., Audubon Park and the Zoo, Garden District, the Warehouse District and finally the French Quarter.  The Canal Streetcar which is located about one mile away on Carrollton Ave will take you directly to the City Park as well as Jazz Fest and the Fairgrounds.  Distance to the French Quarter is 4.3 miles. It is 4 miles to City Park and 5 miles to the Jazz Fest Fairgrounds.

name: NOLA Blue
description: Our home is a two bedroom, one bath, full kitchen, and laundry. Located in the up and coming Freret St neighborhood our home provides you with many options for entertainment, dining, and shopping within minutes of stepping out of the door. Perfectly located for a ride on the St Charles streetcars or setting up along the parade route walking distance away. Our home is composed of a master bedroom, with a queen size bed, full closet, television, and luggage rack.Our second bedroom features a twin xl trundle bed which second bed can be moved around by guest as they wish, and television. Both bedrooms are separated by the bathroom. In the living room you will find a futon for guest, 55 inch television, and bluetooth speaker for guest to use. The kitchen is prepared for a light dinner; however, if need be grocery stores are within a mile. Guest can come and go as they please. We offer a private keypad entrance for guest to utilize throughout their stay. We invite our guest to take advantage

name: House Of Dinvaut spacious near French Quarter
description: Free Breakfast for party of 8 or more. 3 nights minimum!  Laissez Le bon Temps Rouler!!!This beautiful brand new super spacious Downtown New Orleans home sleeps 10. name: GREAT LOCATION! Near City Park & Fairgrounds!
description: Bienvenue les amis (Welcome friends)! You'll have access to our entire new home in a perfect location to celebrate Mardi Gras and springtime here. Both Jazzfest and Voodoo fest are 1 mile away! We also have free parking! Located a mile from city park and less than a mile to major interstates, you can get anywhere quickly or stay around the neighborhood and see wonderful City Park or NOMA. You will love the large backyard, perfect for grilling out and drinking before you hit the town. We have HBO, Hulu, Disney Plus, Amazon Prime Video, and stereo systems in both the living room and back porch for all your entertainment needs. We also have a front door keypad for keyless entry, along with a security system for your safety and peace of mind!  Two bedrooms are available. The front room, AKA Geode Room, gets a lot of morning sun, but we have black out curtains so you can get some sleep.  There is a comfortable memory foam (medium firmness) twin size day bed with a pull out twin size trundle
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood! It's a new up and coming area in New Orleans. The street we live on is well lit and provides easy access to wherever you want to go in New Orleans. To be clear, we are not walking distance to the quarter, but only a short 10 minute Uber ride. Remember, when visiting anywhere in New Orleans it's always a good idea to be on guard if you're in an unfamiliar area and travel in a group. We do have a security alarm, first aid kit, and fire extinguishers for you added safety and peace of mind.
transit: Ubering and Lyfting is easy from our house, although Lyft is quicker in the area in our opinion. If you want the true NOLA experience, then our place is in the perfect spot. Easy highway and main cross-roads access to go to Lakeview, Metairie, Mid-City, Uptown, etc.  Average prices and distance for rides:  Bourbon St. & Canal (Quarter): 3.8 miles, 10 mins - $10; surging $25+. Mid-City Area: 3.1 miles,  8 mins - $8. Uptown/Garden Area: 6-10 miles, 19 mins - $16; surging $25+ If you wanted to take the street car to tour NOLA, just get a ride to the New Orleans Museum of Arts at City Park and there is a stop there. That's about a 3 minute car ride. There is also a bus stop 1 block away.

name: Historic Mansion Balcony Suite on Royal St. - #6
description: This grand 1850's Greek Revival house exudes elegance and decadence of old Creole Louisiana, located in a very friendly neighborhood 6 blocks from the French Quarter and 4 blocks to Frenchmen St. Fine restaurants, famous jazz clubs and sidewalk cafes are within a short walk.  Originally built as a single-family home converted to a Bed & Breakfast over 30 yrs ago, we recently made improvements to this beautiful Mansion to provide you with a comfortable experience, for memories to last a lifetime. This room, located on the second floor, has a king bed with access to a shared balcony. There is one other balcony room that shares the other half.  It has a private bathroom, located across the hall from the bedroom.  We have no shared bathrooms. Bathrobes are provided. HOT BREAKFAST SERVED DAILY Coffee will be served each morning by 8:00.  Hot Breakfast includes:  Scrambled eggs or omelets, sausage, hash browns, grits & cheese or steel cut oatmeal with toppings, yogurt w/toppings, bagels & cr
neighborhood_overview: This is a very friendly neighborhood, with free street parking throughout.  Five popular cafes/bistros are within a 2 block radius from our front door.  We are located just four short blocks/minutes from Frenchmen Street where you can find live Jazz and great food every night! We are surrounded by amazing restaurants, cafe's, and coffee shops. Crescent Park is just a five minute walk to see beautiful views of the Mississippi River. It stretches from one end of the Marigny neighborhood to the other end of the Bywater neighborhood along the river. There are three access points. One at Marigny Street and N. Peters Street. One is at Piety Street and Chartres Street. And the Third is at Bartholomew Street and Chartres Street.
transit: If you need transportation from the airport, we offer Private Airport Shuttle Services - save cost of Taxi's and Uber with our discounted price.  Once you confirm your reservation, we can provide contact information for Clarence so you can make arrangements for pick-up.  He is also available if you need transportation during your stay.

This location offers a relaxing ambiance in a quiet safe neighborhood just a few miles from the heart of the City. This 1500 square foot 3-bedroom spacious ranch style home comfortably sleeps 6-8 people and features: •Tile floors •Fully equipped kitchen with dining table •Fully furnished living area •Washer and dryer  •Bed linens and bath towels •Wireless Internet •Three (3) Queen Bedrooms •Cable TVs •Off-Street Parking We do not live on the property. The neighborhood boasts convenient shopping and historic

name: Marigny Shotgun Double- Walk to the French Quarter
description: My place is close to Frenchmen St and the French Quarter. And the nearby streetcar can take you anywhere else in the city you'd like to go. You’ll love  the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families. This is a one-bedroom unit that makes up a portion of what began as a classic Creole Cottage, but evolved into what's known locally as a shotgun double.  According to Wikipedia, a shotgun house is "a narrow rectangular domestic residence, usually no more than 12 feet (3.5 m) wide, with rooms arranged one behind the other and doors at each end of the house." A shotgun double, is two of those under one roof, mirror images of one another. I live in one side of the house and the other side is available to you! Now more about the place you'll be staying -- You enter the space through the front door into a living room comfortably appointed with lounge furniture. Washed with sunlight by day and lighted to your tastes by night, this is your spot
neighborhood_overview: The Marigny takes its name from the wealthy gentleman who owned the land when it was one giant plantation—open farmland, outside what’s now downtown New Orleans. Later a Creole neighborhood inhabited by free people of color, the Marigny’s tangled history includes its run as an Italian Catholic stronghold in the middle of the last century, and more recently, a home to mostly progressive-minded folks drawn from all quarters of society. Artists share cafes with computer scientists, bicycle activists, and PhD candidates, next to retirees enjoying the city’s warm climate and burgeoning arts scene. From those living the hangover culture to those too cultured for a hangover, everybody’s here.
transit: By the scale of most cities, everything would be considered walking distance; however, keep in mind it can be very hot here in summer. New Orleans recently opened a new streetcar line and it begins just a few blocks away -- just a seven-minute walk -- from your accommodations. This offers charm, but in cooler months walking offers the pleasure of the neighborhood architecture and ambience. Taxis are inexpensive compared to many cities, and they come quickly when called or requested via smartphone app (you cannot usually flag down a taxi in New Orleans; a local oddity, you have to request one). And, speaking of smartphones, don't forget Uber and Lyft -- their drivers are nearby and ready to pick you up 24/7. I also have an SUV available to guests through Turo.

name: Location! Location! Location! Close to everything!
description: PERMIT NUMBER: 17STR-06324 You’ll love the modern,techy decor as well as the excellent location of this clean and hip New Orleans condo! Located just 2 blocks off Bourbon, this property is sure to please with convenient and close by access to New Orleans’ finest attractions, including the exciting French Quarter, Jackson Square and The French Market. Want to venture out further? The St. Charles Line trolley is just steps outside the building! Parking next door! After 20 years of frequenting New Orleans ourselves we found our happy place and we want to share it with you too!  Our home is walking distance from world-renowned restaurants, Mardi-Gras parade routes, The Riverwalk, and tourist attractions such as Bourbon St., Jackson Square and The French Market. Guests are only 5 blocks from the Mercedes Benz Superdome and Arena, and 6 blocks from Harrah's Casino.  Take a short uber/taxi ride to The Convention Center.    This location beats any place we've ever stayed in NOLA. It is so cent
neighborhood_overview: Union Lofts is located in the "CBD" or Central Business District.  Two blocks away is Canal St.  Once you cross Canal, what was once Carondelet St. is now Bourbon St.  You are that close!  So enjoy the clean, quiet street of your condo, yet just a few blocks away you can enjoy the party vibe of Bourbon St., and/or dine at any of the fantastic French Quarter restaurants.  If you wish to venture further than walking distance, I highly recommend using Uber or the St. Charles streetcar that runs in front of the condo during the day.
transit: The St. Charles streetcar runs in front of the condo, and tickets can be purchased online or from the conductor.  This is one of the hidden gems of this location.  FYI, no change is given so have exact, if possible. Ubers are all over the city and can be very helpful in getting you near or far at a very reasonable price.  Taxis are available but can be more pricey.  Pedicabs are bicycles pedaled by locals and can be convenient and entertaining ride, yet it is not a cheaper route.  There is some pay-to-park along the street of the building and a few parking garages on each block. Most guests will never need their vehicle once they arrive here.

name: 1894 Victorian 5 blocks from StreetCar and Tulane!
description: We are 5 blocks from Tulane, Loyola and the Street Car which takes you to the French Quarter! Want to head to the French Quarter?  Hop on the St Charles Street Car 5 blocks away and go straight to there! No Crime in our Neighborhood! Audubon Area of Uptown is the Safest in the City We have the Perfect Old Home for Entertaining Guest! Our Open Living-Dining Room is perfect for Groups Pre-Festival Gatherings with a Porch that Overlooks the Sunset. Ask for Attached Apartment! We are in a Central, Old New Orleanian Neighborhood! - We are as close as 5 blocks to the beginning of the Uptown parade route, and no further than a 20 minute walk to all uptown parade routes! - 5 blocks away from St. Charles StreetCar that goes through the Garden District to the French Quarter - Very Safe Neighborhood - 5 blocks from Boutique Shops on Magazine Street - 3 blocks from Audubon Park, a 350 acre Family Hangout - 8 blocks from Loyola and Tulane University Great Old Home Built for Entertaining! - Large, O
neighborhood_overview: The greatest thing about the Audubon Park area of Uptown is that the city is almost wholly accessible on foot. I personally do not own a car because you really do not need one living in this neighborhood. Everything is nearby! Within walking distance is: - A Plethora of Wonderful Restaurants and Bars - Langensteins, our Local Grocer, and Whole Foods - Audubon Park and Zoo, either of which is an Awesome Family destination - The Fly Park (behind the Zoo), which is a Great Place to have a Drink with your Friends as you watch the sun Set over the Mighty Mississippi. - Tulane and Loyola University - Local-Boutique Shops on Magazine Street - The Street-Car on St Charles, which can get you to pretty much anywhere in the city The Neighborhood is also really safe, with no crime that I can recall happening anywhere nearby in the past 20 years I've lived here. A few of my favorites nearby dining/ entertainment options are Monkey Hill (great happy hour till 7) Avo, and Patois (both have great food
transit: We have a 2 car parking lot as a part of our property if you need it. However, with the St Charles Streetcar line 5 blocks away, as well as the bus line on magazine 5 blocks away, you can easily get around on foot. I'd also highly recommend biking! It is my favorite way of getting around and we are in a great location for biking! We have bike trails and bike lanes nearby, making it super pragmatic. Uber/Lyft is never more than a few minutes away as well and is reliable, although that may be different during Mardi Gras and during large Events.

name: Uptown- Private 2 bdrm
description: Conveniently located! Our space has a New Orleans old-world charm w/ modern amenities. Each bedroom has a queen bed . NO kitchen.  *Mardi Gras guests:  this is a quiet respite from the parades and partying especially at night.  The house rules will be no different during this time.  We love partying too, but our walls are thin and quiet at night is a must.  THANK YOU No loud music. No parties. No extra  guests (4 max). Quiet after 11:00 p.m.,  even during Mardi Gras. No kitchen (Eat out :) Its New Orleans!) yet modern amenities. Microwave, mini fridge  and Keurig coffee maker available. Exposed brick and cypress beams are authentic to New Orleans. We also have a fabulous courtyard with a fire pit. Guests will have private access to 2 bedrooms, large living room, 1 full bath and large patio/courtyard.  Your area is completely private from the owner unit upstairs. If we are in town, we will greet you and will be available to answer any questions. We look forward to meeting new friends, b
neighborhood_overview: Broadmoor is a historic neighborhood. It was built in the twenties through the forties, and has a wide variety of architectural styles, from traditional Louisiana vernacular, to Hollywood Spanish, to Moorish Revival, to Arts and Crafts bungalows. Napoleon Avenue features a fitness trail that you may walk or bike. CVS and Walgreen are not far.  There are few restaurants nearby, El Pavo Real and Laurel Street Bakery, a 3 minute walk from our home! You can then walk to the Keller Library, an architectural gem which features a modern and sleek courtyard, where you can enjoy a coffee and pastry from the cafe.  Next door explore the new Broadmoor Wellness Center and catch a yoga class.
transit: Driving from our neighborhood is a breeze as we are so centrally located (like the center of the wheel ) There are bus stops nearby as we are near two major intersections.  Uber and Lyft available ( $7-$14 to get to most places)

name: HISTORIC BYWATER VACATION HOME
description: Lovingly restored 1880s Victorian architectural house with the beauty and character of a historical home, and all the modern features and upgrades that matter most.  Walking distance to many great local Bywater restaurants, bars/music joints and minutes from the French Quarter and Frenchmen Street! The house is a classic New Orleans "double" architecture with your vacation home on one side, completely private and independent from our home on the other side of the house, with its own entrance and no common rooms.  The vacation home is about 700 square feet (75 square meters) with many original details such as wood floors, very high ceilings, fireplaces, and is furnished with an eclectic mix of French and Creole antiques, modern pieces and various finds from all over the world, including original art.  Bathrooms, kitchen and central AC/heating are all new.   The covered back porch has a sitting area overlooking a century-old brick courtyard.   All 4 sides of the property are gated and fe
neighborhood_overview: THE BYWATER:  an historic neighborhood bordered by the Mississippi River, the Bywater is the perfect mix of classic New Orleans architectural residential area and high energy artistic urban environment.  We have great restaurants and bars/clubs, local boutiques and galleries, many within walking distance from the house.   The Bywater features great local bars, many with live music such as Bacchanal, BJ's Lounge, Markey's, Vaughn's and Faubourg Wine Bar.  Some of our neighborhood favorite restaurants - many highly rated and a short distance from the house - include  N7, The Country Club, Bacchanal, Poke-Chan and Paladar 511; and for lunch/brunch Satsuma, Bywater Bakery and Elizabeth’s are all just 3 blocks away.
transit: Plenty of unrestricted parking on our street if you have a car.  You can usually park right in front of the house. 5-10 minutes by bike/car to the French Quarter and Frenchman Street in the Faubourg Marigny.   No. 5 bus to the French Quarter/Marigny is 3 short blocks from the house.

name: We call it the Hirsch Hilton!
description: This is a private apt. in the lower level of our Mid-City home.  Has one double bed in the bedroom and a sofa bed (double) in the living room. Located in a fun neighborhood and two blocks to the streetcar that takes you to the FQ This is a unique place to stay because the hosts who are from New Orleans live upstairs and can tell you all about New Orleans. It is a great neighborhood, lots of fun people around.  There is even a stadium in the backyard during Saints football season.  The living room has a sofa bed with a double size mattress for 2 more. The lower level of the house with a large backyard. Full kitchen is ready for cooking and there is a full bathroom with tub/shower. We are there just for directions and to advise. We can interact or not. The neighborhood is filled with friendly New Orleanians who can show you a good time. The famous cemeteries are also right behind the back gate. Yard is lined with citrus trees. There are 3 bars within walking distance. And the streetcar i
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is filled with friendly New Orleanians who can show you a good time. The famous cemeteries are also right behind the back gate. Yard is lined with citrus trees. There are 3 bars within walking distance. And the streetcar is 2 blocks on famous Canal Street.
transit: The Canal Streetcar is two blocks away. It is about a 30 minute ride to the French Quarter. Cost $1.25 per person. During Jazz Fest this location is just a bike ride away.  The streetcar will get you close.

name: 1860's Historic home between Magazine & St Charles
description: Welcome to the House of Krewe! Enjoy a quintessential New Orleans experience surrounded by historical architecture and landmark destinations in the heart of the Historic Garden District. Our 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom home is in an amazing location! Only 2 blocks from the bustling Magazine St. with ample shopping, dining, Mardi Gras parade routes, and the streetcar on St. Charles Ave. We hope you enjoy using our house to discover all that New Orleans has to offer! STR License: 18STR-08554 Please Note, the second bedroom is accessed via an outside stairway with a balcony. We are located in the Historic Garden District with prime access to Mardi Gras parades, Shopping & Dining on Magazine St., and the streetcars on St. Charles. We hope you enjoy using our house as a launching point to discover all that New Orleans has to offer! Outdoor Gas Grill We enjoy interacting with our guest or giving them as must space as needed. We share a common patio area and you will see us around. Feel free to ask
neighborhood_overview: The Garden District was originally developed between 1832 and 1900 and is considered one of the best-preserved collections of historic mansions in the Southern United States.
transit: The St. Charles streetcar is easily accessible (three blocks) from the house (Streetcar fare is $1.25 per person). Bus stop is 2 blocks away on Magazine St. you can download the New Orleans RTA GoMobile app to your smart device and pay for transportation directly from the app.

name: Alligator Alley - Modern, Garden, and Balcony
description: License Number: 17STR-0628 Beautifully furnished 1 bedroom / 1 bath.  The apartment has been completely updated & modernized-new plumbing, electrical, central heat / ac, appliances & fixtures. Less than 1 mi. to French Quarter, Super Dome, Magazine St, Convention Center, Garden District. 3 min walk to streetcar on St. Charles. 10 min walk to WWII museum. This Listing is for 1 of 3 beautiful apartments in a 4 unit bldg. The apartment is a spacious, clean & luxurious 1 bedroom / 1 bath remodeled second floor apartment.  A large living room with 12 foot high windows open to private balcony.  Separate dining and kitchen areas, lovely bedroom overlooks rear balcony & backyard garden.  Full bath.  Central Location:  The building is located in Central City close to many of the great neighborhoods & attractions. It is less than a mile from the French Quarter, Central Business District, Super Dome, Magazine Street, the Garden District and The Convention Center.  You can walk to the WWII Museum
neighborhood_overview: New Orleans is famous for great food, entertainment and a carefree atmosphere.  A unique, year round destination where there's always something happening.   This apartment is centrally located within easy access of the French Quarter, Magazine Street, World War II Museum, Convention Center and The Garden District. Just across the street is a great Colombian Restaurant called Mais Arepas. Rouses Market at 701 Baronne St. has everything including prepared food. OC Haley Blvd. is located a few blocks away and is developing quickly.  The street includes museums, restaurants, coffee shops, and a theater.  New things are opening up on a regular basis.   You are just a few blocks (or a quick bike ride) to all the cool shops, bars and eateries on Magazine Street, Commander's Palace Restaurant and the Garden District mansions.
transit: New Orleans is compact and public transit is the best option.  An all day streetcar/bus pass is just $3.  Directions from the Airport (20 minutes):  Take I-10 East to Loyola Avenue exit, right on Baronne Street, left on Erato Street, left on Carondelet Street (one way).  The apartment is on your left near the end of the block.

name: Large 3 BR, 2 BA Uptown Awesome Upstairs Apt.
description: My place is good for one to up to six people. I can make price/cleaning adjustments for requests of one or two people . The space has been completely remodeled. Central A/C & heat. W/D. One bedroom has a great walk in shower. Some of the homes accessories were purchased  at the American Horror Story prop sale (from Coven). 15 min uber ride to just about anywhere in the city. Bus stop 2 blocks away. I provide coffee, tea and condiments. WIFI and basic DISH. Off street parking (1). My apartment has just been remodeled.   Central a/c & heat with ceiling fans in each bedroom and living room.  Each room has a different feel (for instance one of the bedrooms has a circus feel).  The bathrooms are also renovated, one has a large walk in shower with stone tiles.  You may find a few creepy things here and there, this is New Orleans after all.  There is an iron and ironing board and all the small kitchen appliances you would normally have at home.  My collection of "stuff" comes from my travels
neighborhood_overview: Broadmore is pretty much in the center of the city.  4 miles from the French Quarter, 2 blocks from uptown, about 2 miles from the garden district,  5 blocks from the Ferret Street Corridor, about 2 miles from the Carrollton district & Oak Street, 2 miles from Audubon Park, the zoo and Tulane University. Broadmore is a neighborhood in transition.  There are many houses coming back to their former glory through renovation.  This is a very mixed working class neighborhood with all walks of life.  Kids like to play in the street next door and are always gone by dark.
transit: There is one electric gated parking space for your use, two cars will fit, back to front,  if you leave the gate open, which isn't a problem.  The bus stops two blocks away, although with UBER I don't know anyone who uses public anymore.  A normal time UBER ride to the French quarter or downtown will cost less than $10, beware of surge times though.

name: Southeast Bungalow- Private Room Retreat
description: This is a cozy private room in a beautiful bungalow home complete with two friendly cats, two dogs and two chickens! The house is in an excellent location within Southeast Portland, with a 10-min walk to quaint Montavilla’s shops, restaurants and bars. Easy access to public transport and the highways. Guests can enjoy a beverage upon arrival (beer, wine, soda) along with a small assortment of snacks/breakfast items. Morning coffee is available upon request to ensure a peaceful start to the day. Our home is a 1918 bungalow on a quiet street. Charming interior with lovely decor makes guests feel at ease. The bedroom is large with a comfortable mattress, a warm goose down comforter and an additional seating area. A very quiet and calm space. Clean towels and toiletries available to guests. Convenient inner Southeast Portland location with walking distance to Mount Tabor for a walk in the forest and Montavilla district for breakfast. Free on street parking and easy access to public transpo
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to quaint Montavilla where there are restaurants like The Country Cat and The Observatory, bars and coffee shops, locally-owned stores like the International Grocery Store and a small movie theatre that always has at least one 80s flick! Bus line is at the end of our block, going either east or west, and MAX transit stops are about 10 blocks from of the house. Mt Tabor, the city's only extinct volcano, is a 20 min walk away. Here one can hike, picnic, listen to free summer concerts, bike and enjoy sunsets over downtown.
transit: Easy access to either bus (end of the block) and MAX light rail (15-min walk, roughly 10 blocks away).

Music lovers dream with turntable, 50+ vinyl collection, Bluetooth/wifi streaming powered speakers (connect to your device/phone/laptop), WiFi, library of music books and Portland-centric books/magazines (current beer/restaurant guides/local papers), and a host of fine and unique decor/furnishings will make you feel right at home in Portland (definitely not an IKEA showroom like so many other rentals...). New locally made Queen bed and frame (maple) with quality cozy sheets/towels/pillows and b

It's easy access to the fun to be had here in Portland from our property (NE, SE, NW, North Portland, and SW).

name: SE Division-Clinton Central
description: Beautiful home in the heart of the Division-Clinton Street neighborhood. Yours to enjoy, is your private bedroom, with queen bed, and your private sitting room with coffee, tea, small refrigerator, yoga mats and props. The loveseat in the sitting room can fold out to accommodate another guest in your party.  Your private bath is just steps away down the hall. Walk to Pok Pok, Salt and Straw and countless other popular restaurants, shops, bakeries, coffee shops, bars and hip spots. The two upstairs, north facing rooms are yours to enjoy. One is the bedroom with a queen bed, the other a sitting room with a loveseat that folds out to a twin sofa-sleeper, coffee, tea, a small refrigerator and yoga mats and props.  You also have your own private bathroom just steps away, with double sinks, shower and tub, hair dryer and plenty of towels. In addition to enjoying your two private rooms and private bathroom, you're welcome to use the kitchen and living areas located on the main floor as well a

name: WATERFRONT, NW  DISTRICT CONDO
description: This is a 1 bedroom with heightened cannonball queen bed, 1 bath, full kitchen (french press, blender, kettle, condiments, hairdryer) dining/living room, equipped with washer, dryer and high-speed wifi... overlooking the Willamette River...  outdoor pool and jacuzzi during the summer... All of this, directly on the footpath which links onto the waterfront boardwalk.  From the comfort of our living room you are able to enjoy both a cityscape, as well as the passing boats and runners on the boardwalk. Since we are located opposite the train station, you will hear the occasional train.. which we like. We are also located just steps from the McCaul waterfront park, which hosts the weekend craft market and a plethora of cultural events throughout the year. If you are attending a concert or sporting event at the Moda Center, just take a 10 minute walk across the Broadway bridge, as we are located right across the river from it! And since you are located in the trendy Pearl district, you can
neighborhood_overview: Portland, in general, is a great walking city. We love that we are close to great shopping, great parks to laze around in, great neighbourhood dining spots...
transit: Public transit is very convenient, but we are pretty game to walk around, when the weather permits. We have parking if you have a car and there is a bike rental down the road on Naito Parkway. We are willing to provide (some pretty nice) bikes, but an additional security deposit would be required. Please inquire in advance.

name: Historic room in the heart of SE PDX, walk to all
description: Great location for enjoying all that Portland has to offer! Walk to local pubs, coffee shops, movies, shops (walkscore 99). Super close to downtown. Easily get out to the mountains or the coast within an hour drive for hiking, skiing, wine tasting etc. Need something else, just ask! You'll have an authentic Portland experience while staying in a 100+ year old home nestled in the heart of inner southeast. Your spacious, room with high ceilings, old growth fir floors and views of historic Portland homes, trees and flowers has a comfy queen bed with memory foam topper and large closet with plenty of room for your clothes and luggage.  You'll have everything within a short walk and come home to a quiet, peaceful retreat. After a day of adventuring, enjoy a book from Powells  in your oversized, comfy chair or munch on delicious treats from St. Cupcake or Pied Cow Coffeeshop at your own table and chairs.  You can come and go as you please with a door code on the front door and the shared bat
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located on a block full of beautifully restored 100 year old homes in the safe and trendy Hawthorne neighborhood of southeast Portland, one of the most desirable areas in town (and one of the areas featured on Portlandia often).   You could easily spend weeks just exploring this area full of pubs, boutiques, vintage shops, restaurants-foodie paradise, food carts, parks, etc., and never have to get in a car or walk more than a mile (Division, Hawthorne, Belmont and East Burnside streets are all within walking distance). We are a short walk to the 100 year old Laurelhurst park full of old growth fir trees and Mt Tabor park situated on top of a dormant volcano overlooking the city. Want to go out and boogie? Some top name musicians live in the neighborhood and play in the many spots around us, often for free.  Or, maybe you are coming for work and need to get downtown or to the Oregon Convention Center.  Both are about 2 miles away and can be accessed to by transit, Zipcar, Ca
transit: Close to public transit, zipcar, car2go, walking and biking are easy.

name: Original, Vintage Craftsman Near Mississippi Ave
description: Located just a 10-minute walk from the uber-trendy Mississippi Avenue corridor, and a scenic 20-minute walk from the Williams street corridor, this 1906 Craftsman home, which has been lovingly styled by a local architect husband/wife duo, is the epitome of the coveted Portland home. As a family-friendly home, this house comes equipped with a dedicated kid's room, while also being comfy for the mature members of a family, too. We believe this house has everything - we hope you agree! This home has been lovingly designed to keep even the most particular design expert happy, while also making sure it's perfectly comfortable for our guests. And, being that it's just a 10-minute walk to the best parts Mississippi Street, which many agree is the hippest area of Portland, our guests will have access to all of the food, drinks, shops and coffee their heart desires, while having a beautiful, sleek reprieve in which to rest their heads at night!  HIGHLIGHTS:  -- Beautiful, 2,000sf home with 2-fu
neighborhood_overview: The house sits on a residential street adjacent to the Interstate corridor, an up-and-coming section of Overlook neighborhood. Its just a quick, 10-minute walk to all of the excitement of Mississippi Street. Neighborhood favorites include Pinky's Pizza, Eisenhower Bagel House, and The Alibi Tiki Lounge. Want to go downtown? No problem. The Yellow MAX line is just a couple blocks away, and there's multiple bus lines to take you anywhere you heart desires. Also easy freeway access for exploring the region.  The house couldn't be better located for traversing the city!
transit: MAX stations are located 2.5 blocks away in either direction on Interstate, which will take you to all parts of the city. There's also bus options should you not want to ride the MAX, though we find the MAX to be the most convenient form of transportation in Portland (and clean!).

name: Bunk Bed @ Travelers' House #2
description: Travelers’ House is an small community focused travel hostel with all the traveler savvy amenities, and a home based atmosphere. You will be hosted by world travelers who are passionate about community, exploring Portland, and being outdoors. The bedroom is a shared dorm with ample space and secure storage. Our mission is to provide a welcoming, clean, secure, and comfortable stay in order to inspire community-driven social exchange and exploration. Travelers’ House is jam packed with amenities such as free coffee and tea, free Wifi, laundry facilities, no curfew, 24 hour secure keyless code entry, 24 hour security surveillance, three communal lounges, and a fully equipped commercial kitchen. We also have bikes to rent, which is our recommended method of transportation for getting around Portland if you're not feeling like jumping on the bus that runs right next to our house heading all over Portland. No joke the Number 4 TriMet bus is awesome. We have exceptional public transport acce
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the culturally vibrant neighborhood of North Portland within walking distance to numerous cafés, coffee houses (Albina Press), music venues (Mississippi Studios), restaurants, pubs, shopping, yoga studios, etc. Our house is situated on the famous Alberta Street and have some of the best public transportation right off our doorstep (Bus & Train). There’s also our favorite health food store (Cherry Sprout), a hidden gem of a pub (Red Fox), and the best cafe in Portland (Albina Press) all about two minutes from our doorstep. We are blessed to be in our location with excellent access to public transit and heaps of fun.
transit: Travelers' House believes that all hostels must have exceptional public transport access...we do!  The #4 bus stop is 40ft from our front door and offers frequent service. It takes 15 minutes to transit downtown and with only one transfer to/ from the airport.  Additionally, we are 5 blocks from the Max LightRail train.

name: Ladd's Addition Sunny Studio Apartment!!
description: My apartment building is located in the heart of the heart of the eclectic Hawthorne District, walking distance to some of Portland's best restaurants, cafes, bookstores, brew-pubs, distilleries, craftspeople, and all services from banks to massage therapists, and just over a mile from downtown via bike, walking, or frequent bus service. Interiors have been designed to create a sleek, soothing European feel, and incorporate the highest-grade surfaces and finishes. The exterior of the building promises to be unlike any of the giant boxes popping up throughout the city: rusted metal siding will blend with painted stucco panels and black, burned Japanese Shou Sugi Bon wood to create a signature look that will be visible to anyone traveling Hawthorne Boulevard. The building sits between the vibrant commercial sector of Hawthorne and leafy side streets full of residential architectural masterpieces from the past 120 years. Interiors have been designed to create a sleek, soothing European fe
neighborhood_overview: Commonly known as “Foodie Row,” the Hawthorne/Buckman District puts you within walking distance to a wide variety of top-notch local flavors (no chain restaurants here!) Make new friends over some vegan poutine fries and grilled PB&Js at the Cartopia food cart pod, get messy with some wings right around the corner at Fire on the Mountain, share a pie at Apizza Scholls (consistently voted Portland’s favorite pizza), or opt for a fancy night out at Castagna - all within a 1.5 mile stretch. Portland isn't just for foodies. There’s vibrant indie spirit in Hawthorne, with lots of made-in-Oregon shops and boutiques to explore here in hipster heaven. Or, catch a movie at Bagdad Theater and Pub, a revamped 1920s theater turned view-and-brew venue serving local McMenamins food and microbrews. If bar hopping through neighborhoods isn’t your idea of recreation, head up to Mt. Tabor, a 196-acre city park on top of a dormant volcano vent, where you’ll find miles of hiking trails and incredible pano
transit: If you just plan on roaming around the city and checking out Portland's diverse neighborhoods, there's really no need for a car. The Hawthorne area is a walker's paradise, with a 92/100 WalkScore® and 98/100 BikeScore® , and there are city busses and MAX Light Rail stops close by that can take you all over town, to the 'burbs, and even the airport. You'll also have BIKETOWN hubs within reach (Portland's Bike Share program), and of course, there's always Uber. If you do plan on making the trek to the Columbia Gorge for a waterfall hike (35-minute drive), the Oregon Coast for a day trip (1.5hr drive), or iconic Timberline Lodge on Mt. Hood (1hr and 40-minute drive), a car would certainly come in handy. Free street parking is available in the majority of the SE neighborhoods.

name: City Chic in PDX's Hottest Hood
description: Join us in one of Portland's hottest neighborhoods. Blocks away from SE Division street (home to Salt and Straw, Ava Gene's and Pok Pok), SE Hawthorne Street (historic hippie district) and Mt. Tabor Park (perfect for hiking and summer picnics). Enjoy our brand new, charming 750 sq/ft apartment with old growth wooden beams, lots of natural light, and an original kitchen sink that my grandma used for canning her garden fruits. Guests have a private entrance, equipped kitchen, extra large bathroom with tub, queen bed, plush linens, full size pull out couch, storage closet and a 50" TV with Apple TV. We've turned this studio into a mini-oasis and can't wait to share it with you. Private access to full apartment, through side gate. Need assistance planning your trip? We enjoy nothing more than helping travelers choose the places to go, see & eat. It's what we do best! Feel free to ask so we can make your visit to Portland perfect. Our home is in one of Portland's best & most historic neighb
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in one of Portland's best & most historic neighborhoods, nestled between two of the city's most active, restaurant and bar filled streets. A family friendly, walkable, beautiful area. Division street sits two blocks south of our home where you can find Portland's most acclaimed & nationally recognized restaurants, such as: Pok Pok, Ava Genes, Woodsman Tavern and Salt and Straw. It's also home to Stumptown Coffee Roaster's very first coffee shop. This street is super chic but laid back, with many cute boutiques and upscale bars. Just two blocks north of our home sits SE Hawthorne Street-- historically known as Portland's "hippie district." Lots of brew pubs, second hand and vintage shops, along with the famed Por Que No Mexican restaurant. And for a killer view of the city and some beautiful nature, just head twelve blocks east, to Mount Tabor Park--a volcano cinder cone! You can hike, picnic, bike, and enjoy summer concerts here.
transit: You can walk just about anywhere you need to go from our home. Just a 3 mile walk to the downtown Willamette River waterfront, our guests have been known to venture on foot. Or hop on a bike, since we are located on one of the cities Bike Boulevards. Two blocks away is the number 4 bus and within 10 minutes, you will find yourself in the thick of downtown Portland. Portland also has an efficient MAX/train system throughout the city.  We have quiet hours from 10:30 pm- 8:00 am. We allow guests to use the outdoor covered patio, but it must be vacated by 10:00 pm on week nights and 11:30 on weekends, so we can respect our neighbors. We live above the studio and hope guests will be aware of their noise levels. We don't allow any smoking of any substances in or on the home's premises and pets are not allowed. Lastly, we hope to share our home with people that will treat it as if it were their own.

name: Bright Woodlawn Bungalow with Backyard Garden
description: Private bedroom with attached bathroom in a quiet + bright & cozy bungalow-style home within walking distance to trendy Alberta Arts and Dekum Triangle areas. Walk to coffee shops, restaurants, boutiques and public transit to see the best of PDX. Need to relax? Enjoy a beautiful backyard patio surrounded with native Pacific Northwest flora. With downtown, the convention center and the airport a 15-minute drive away, you will be perfectly situated to experience everything Portland has to offer. Our spotless + cheery bungalow has beautiful hardwood floors throughout and an updated minimalist aesthetic.  Your cozy guest bedroom is on the main floor just off a bright, airy sitting area in front of a fireplace.  It boasts a comfortable full-size bed, roomy dresser, and spacious closet along with an iron & ironing board. A personal A/C unit is installed in summer months to make your stay comfortable.  Your attached guest bathroom is fully private with a full bathtub and shower and a spacious
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood hosts some of the best restaurants that Portland has to offer. The options seem endless, but if you need suggestions, we have list of hidden gems to share!
transit: The neighborhood is served by major bus lines and is about a mile from the Max line. It's an easy 15 minute drive to the airport or downtown.

name: Cozy Room in Vintage Belmont Home
description: Great base to explore Portland!  Easy walk to over 70 restaurants, shops, and bars in the vibrant Belmont/ Hawthorne area.  The 1910 renovated house includes a Moroccan arched bathroom with clawfoot tub and spacious garden.  Has fan, but no a/c. I've owned my house since 1989 and love this neighborhood of Portland.  I have slowly improved and remodeled my home, with attention paid to its 1910 vintage Portland origin.  There is a porch in the front, where you could smoke or just people watch and relax.  I also have 2 patios and a back garden in the back where you are welcome to hang out.  In the summer I have a hammock hanging from the tree in the center of the yard.  It is cozy, uncluttered, and open. My bedroom upstairs is the only part of the house which I keep to myself. I prefer to meet guests when they arrive and give them a short house tour and the key.  Since I have a tiny house in the back which I often stay in, we will meet (or not) depending on the schedule and wishes of my g
neighborhood_overview: The Sunnyside area  is one of the most attractive and accessible in Portland.  It is great for walking and biking.  It is full of "keep Portland weird" spaces in common places and has a friendly neighborhood spirit.  People say "hi" to others as they walk past their homes.  You can walk to many excellent, ethnic restaurants, 3 small privately owned, movie theatres, breweries to sample our renowned craft beers,   unique shops, and a smaller model of Powells book store on Hawthorne.  It's a mixed neighborhood with all ages and types of people.  I love just walking around my neighborhood and noticing what people are doing with their gardens and houses.
transit: I'm a block and a half from the #15 Trimet bus which gets you downtown in 10- 15 minutes.  From the PDX airport, take an Uber/Lyft for about $15 or take the Max streetcar line to Lloyd Center or downtown and change to the #15 bus from there.  Details are available on the Trimet website!

name: Hawthorne District Cozy Apartment
description: This is a private, daylight basement in our 1920 Craftsman home.  It's roomy, super-clean, with everything you'll need to be comfortable.  Located in the heart of Hawthorne District with all its charm. The apartment has a separate entrance, bathroom, tv room, eating area and bedroom.   We splurged on a great queen size bed and 100% cotton bedding to ensure a good night's sleep and the entire apartment is spotlessly clean and comfortable.  The bedroom has a sitting chair, small desk, dresser and is light and open.  There's a tv room with a couch for relaxing after a busy day exploring Portland.  Wireless high-speed internet allows you to stream movies and tv shows, and we also have a supply of dvds available.  There's also a small boombox size stereo to hook your phone up to if you want to listen to music. A washer/dryer is located in the apartment, with laundry soap on site. The apartment has a private bathroom with spacious walk-in shower.  We supply hand soap, shampoo and conditioner
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of Hawthorne, across the street from a neighborhood park and only a short walk to Division Street – there are plenty of restaurants, food carts, coffee shops, grocery stores, bookstores, a small movie theatre and other shops just a short walk away.  Hawthorne is a great neighborhood.  You'll love it.
transit: Several bus lines serve the neighborhood, with a bus stop just one block away.  The MAX Light Rail + bus brings you here from the airport – no need to rent a car, if you don’t want to.  ZipCar members will find several cars nearby and Car2Go are often parked in our neighborhood.  The area has been rated a “walker’s paradise” and there are also plenty of bike routes.  The city has several Bikeshare stations nearby.  If you are driving, there’s on-street parking available.

name: Eclectic cottage & bath house/SE Portland
description: This dreamy cottage is a rustic but super cozy unique portland experience. Queen size bed as well as a sleeping loft which is good for kids or able adults accessed via a built in ladder. The cottage has a full kitchenette, OUTDOOR private shower which is enclosed by a thick bamboo screen and there is a tiny homemade blue bottle flush toilet bathroom a wood stove and /or oil heater and AC. The loft is not for children under 6. Bed is in same room as kitchenette.... Strictly no smoking allowed. If you're looking for something unique and amazing, here it is!  This is a romantic,  artistic and rustic getaway. I have a home in the quaint and beautiful SE Portland, just two blocks from the famous Hawthorn Blvd. and  Division street.   I am offering a garden cottage with a hand built beautiful glass sunroom that has earthen floors and is attached to the cottage. There is a very cozy queen size bed as well as a loft with a mat for another person (who is fit and able to climb a ladder) or older
neighborhood_overview: This gem of a stay is nestled in the back yard of my home, which is on a quiet street between two of the most popular areas of SE portland, Hawthorne st and Division st. There are cafe's and restaurants galore. This is such a wonderful part of town and extremely walking and bike friendly. There are three bus lines within walking distance but the cottage is in such  perfect place as to never hear any buses or much traffic. You will hear and see many birds however!
transit: There is street parking, walking is great, busses are close and bikes are a great thing to rent or bring if you can...downtown portland is a short bus ride and about a 25 minute walk, or 10-15 minute bike ride. The three close by bus lines are: 4,14,75 for trimet.

name: Two bedroom house with nonconforming 3rd bedroom
description: Great house in a great location, steps from restaurants, shopping, and public transport. Our 1920s house is beautifully renovated and has a peaceful, private backyard for you to enjoy. We have 3 stories, including the upstairs with one king size bed with en suite bathroom, a finished basement with a double futon, 1 bedroom with comfy queen bed.  A second room that is a nonconforming bedroom with a queen bed. A full bathroom on the main floor, along with kitchen, dining, and living room. We live in the best spot in Sellwood!  Step out the door and enjoy the convenience of Sellwood.  Want to stay in?  Our house is quiet, we have double paned windows that decreases traffic noise.  Our backyard is pleasant and private, relax in the hammock, have a BBQ. As a full house rental, you will have access to the upstairs, main floor, finished basement, and yard.  The two bedrooms have queen beds, chairs, and a desk.  The finished basement has a comfy full futon and a couch.  Bathroom is available o
neighborhood_overview: Sellwood is one of the best neighborhoods in Portland.  It is a sweet little suburb located 15 minutes from downtown.  We have amazing dining, cool bars, a movie theater and nice walking space.  The house is located in a prime spot to take it all in!
transit: The bus stop is a block away, takes about 20 minutes to get downtown.  The Max train is 1/4 a mile away, get downtown or to the airport fairly easily.  Uber and Lyft are easy enough!  We also rent our cars out on Turo, let us know if you are interested.

name: Captain's Bed at SW PDX Cottage
description: 'The Captains' Bed' is inspired by tales a friend told of great old ships on the North Sea.  It is wider and longer than a standard twin; roomy enough to sleep 2, head to toe or side by side.  Out the windows are fragrances of the evergreen garden. Here's a unique place to find yourself; a beautiful peace of countryside located 12 minutes S.W. of downtown Portland, Oregon. There's a a bit of old world here; a sweet retreat from the hipness & culture we love about Portland.  This bed is custom built into a large window nook.  It is elevated and this might be an issue for some people. 'The Captains' Bed' is inspired by tales a friend told of the great old ships on the North Sea,  It is elevated in height, wider than a standard twin and long enough for the friendly to sleep head to toe.  The mattress is a combination of latex, foam, feather & cotton. Couples like the coziness. Others relish the solitary comfort.  Sheets are good cotton, blankies are down, wool or silk.  Colors are rich an
neighborhood_overview: The Marshall Park Neighborhood is named for the forested park just down the road.  It has the quiet big trees and feel of the country while being only minutes to downtown.   OHSU, Lewis & Clark College, The Willamette River, Multnomah Village, Hillsdale, John's Landing, Sellwood, & Lake Oswego neighborhoods are moments away.
transit: It's best to have a car to get here; frequent public transport is a 15 minute walk away; the bus up at the corner only comes once an hour and the winding roads don't have bike lanes.  A bike ride to town takes about 30 min. but longer coming home; it's up a good hill.

name: Modern Studio Apt in Laurelhurst, Near Downtown
description: Located in the gorgeous Laurelhurst neighborhood and minutes from downtown, our beautiful studio apartment (more like a 1 bedroom, as there's a separate sleeping area) has everything you need to enjoy everything Portland has to offer. Easy walking distance to local shops, restaurants, bars, and transportation. Our family embraces and celebrates diversity and we look forward to hosting other like-minded guests! Located in our family's 1924 bungalow, the newly constructed basement apartment was built with the comfort of our guests in mind. As much as possible, we opted for full-size amenities (such as the tub, washer and dryer, etc.) over smaller apartment-size items and designed the space to maximize efficiency and natural light.  Should you want to spend an evening in, you will find everything you need to prepare a nice dinner in the kitchen stocked with pots, pans, utensils and other essentials. Plenty of grocery options are nearby such as Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, New Seasons, and t
neighborhood_overview: Laurelhurst is a beautiful well-established (most houses are from the 1920s) neighborhood close to everything Portland has to offer. We have gorgeous tree-lined streets perfect for evening strolls, the 26-acre Laurelhurst park (which boasts ball fields, a small lake, playground, and picnic areas), shops, restaurants, bars, etc.; everything you need is within easy walking distance.
transit: Our home is conveniently located in NE Portland, within walking distance (3/4 mile) to the Hollywood Max (red, blue, and green train lines: connect to the airport, downtown, the zoo, convention center, Moda center, Expo center) station as well as the 12, 19, 20 bus lines. We're also close to the freeways and Lyft is always available. Downtown Portland is a short 2.5 miles away.

name: "Little Hexagon Hut"  Arbor Lodge Cabin In Town
description: Welcome to our cozy, tranquil and tiny hexagon hut! It is a detached unit with private entrance and shared bathroom (in our family home). Simple, inspiring and cheerful space with clay walls, lots of plants, a full size sofa bed that sleeps 1-2,  lovely natural light from big windows, sun roof and french doors. Located in the Arbor Lodge neighborhood of North Portland with a two minute walk to coffee, restaurants and bus lines. Three blocks from local grocery store, cafe and the Max station. The bathroom is shared and in the main house but you do not have to go through any rooms or the main part of the house to access it. It's just right inside from the back door. While access to kitchen is not available,  there are many inexpensive food options very close by.  For a quick AM coffee, you can stay in your PJs, walk one minute to the nearby GrindHouse coffee cart and come back to enjoy your morning...we do that a lot! We have a friendly cat who wanders but not into the hut. The hut, back
neighborhood_overview: The Arbor Lodge/Kenton area is a charming and accessible neighborhood with just the right balance of buzz and quiet. There are multiple parks within walking distance including our favorite Peninsula Park with its dreamy rose garden and beautiful fountain. So many choices for food and drinks all within walking distance but we have a soft spot for Thai Ginger,  Blackbird Pizza, Burritos Azteca and Arbor Lodge Coffee Shop.  Firelight Yoga is less than a mile away and so are some of the sweetest neighborhood pubs such as The Old Gold and Backyard Social. We love it here!
transit: Getting around from our place is extremely easy. There are bus lines a short walk away as well as the Max Line which is only 3 blocks away and can get you downtown in about 15 mins, or virtually anywhere you want to go In Portland.  The Max is amazing. We have free and easy street parking and there are usually spots right in front of our house.

name: Modern Sanctuary in the heart of Concordia.
description: Our newly built in-law apartment is located on a quiet street close to McMenamins Kennedy School hotel, Podnah's Pit Barbecue, DOC Restaurant, Autentica Mexican Cuisine, Extracto Coffee Roasters, Beast, Ex-Patriot, Nonna, New Seasons Supermarket. You’ll love our place because of the comfy bed, the neighborhood, the coziness, the light, the kitchen, the local joints. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids). Our place is located on a quiet street in the heart of Concordia literally two minute walk to 7 different restaurants and a coffee shop. The location is 10 minute walk or five minute drive from Alberta arts district. The whole in-law apartment We respect our guests and committed to their privacy. We are usually available on the phone, messenger and email and always have a backup person to help if we are traveling. Our place is located in a beautiful green neighborhood where people are nice and friendly, close to some of the best resta
neighborhood_overview: Our place is located in a beautiful green neighborhood where people are nice and friendly, close to some of the best restaurants, bars, art galleries and coffee shops that Portland has to offer.
transit: Our house is a walking distance to some of the best PDX restaurants, bars and galleries. There are multiple bus lines and Uber/lift are readily available.  The PDX airport is about 10-15 minutes ride.

name: Pleasant 1BR in hip cool NEPO
description: Where Bali meets Portland. Come relax in this newly, beautifully designed, private mixed use accommodation. Just a few short blocks from Portland's hip N Williams district....Alberta Arts District and the Mississippi Historic Street.  Great deck too. I have a total of three rooms, each listed separately in this unique mixed-use building where I also live and work. You will enter via a private, secure, gated entrance off of MLK at NE Failing street and follow the stairway up to the second level. This is the mid-size of the three rooms. Each room is newly refurbished and furnished with beautiful, responsibly sourced tropical salvage out of Indonesia and locally re-purposed wood/trim doors and windows. Your private room comes with a window, a wall-mounted flatscreen t.v., free wi-fi an armoire, an ornate sink carved out of stone, down pillows, down comforters, a queen sized posturepedic mattress and zen colored walls that might just make you think you are in... Bali? Guests have access to
neighborhood_overview: NEPO (aka NE Portland) is hip and cool and like so many hip Portland neighborhoods–it is ever-expanding and reinventing itself. New restaurants, shops, boutiques and businesses are popping up all over. Whether you are looking for a place to lay your head for the night while you get out and explore during the day, or you are just looking for a place you can hole up and relax, we've got you covered. The options and amenities you will find here in your little oasis in NEPO are plentiful.
transit: Whether you are a new or seasoned Portland visitor, you will know that getting around the "City or Roses" is a breeze. This mixed-use airbnb space is just minutes from the pulse of Portland. Five short, walkable Portland blocks west, you will find the N Williams neighborhood...a mecca of great food, local craft brew, New Seasons Market, boutiques and you name it. N Williams is also the bike superhighway in Portland and within 15-20 minutes you can hop on a bike and be in the heart of downtown or Portland's Pearl District. N Mississippi and NE Alberta neighborhoods are also just blocks away. Bike rental is available close by at Everybody's Bike Rentals and Tours  If you have a car, neighborhood, street parking is available and easy to find. If you prefer to let others navigate, we are near several transit stops where Portland 's Tri-Met buses will take you into downtown in a matter of minutes for a mere $2.50 per adult.

On tree-lined street surrounded by some of the most incredible homes in NE Portland.  1 block to bus, 15 minutes to airport, 10 to the Pearl and downtown.  Suite is in basement of private single family home. I am available by text for anything you need while here or any questions you may have. Irvington is a beautiful neighborhood.  Some of the most incredible historic homes line these streets and it’s close and accessible to everything, groceries, cafes, restaurants, parks, tennis courts and more.  And only 15 minutes to the airport and 10 to downtown and the Pearl. Everything is easy from here. Ample street parking and bus, bike, Lyft, Uber, walking-friendly neighborhood.

name: The Alberta Arts Carriage House
description: In the Heart of NE Portland's Alberta Arts District is my turn of the century carriage house. Expertly renovated from a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) era horse barn, this cute cottage is one bedroom, one bath, with a living room and kitchen. Cottage next to a tranquility pond and summertime garden. Short walk to many restaurants, shops, pubs and music venues. PLEASE READ HOUSE RULES BEFORE BOOKING  My carriage house guest cottage is in the heart of NE  Portland's Alberta Arts District. Portland's best pedestrian friendly neighborhood. Within  a few blocks walk from restaurants, shops, bars, and music venues.This is a very eclectic and fun neighborhood.   My cottage is  behind my bungalow style  home,  in a unique garden setting close to a   garden and  pond. Outside the bedroom window is a pond that cascades water over rocks. The cottage has a private bedroom with a brand new queen sized pillow top bed. The kitchen and living room are both in a larger open space. One new couch, easy
neighborhood_overview: A nice pedestrian friendly neighborhood with many restaurants, shops, bars, coffee shops, and entertainment all within a few blocks walk.
transit: Many bus route to downtown Portland a block or two away. Portland International Airport is 6 miles from the cottage.

name: Mt Tabor Room★Walk to HIP Montavilla★Mt Hood view!
description: Private room in this newly remodeled single level, 1500 sq ft home with stunning Mt. Hood / valley views!  Stroll 10 minutes to super-hip Montavilla (look online: "10 hottest US neighborhoods right now"). Perched on Mt Tabor, just a few blocks from hiking in beautiful Mt. Tabor Park, we're just a few minutes from Hawthorne District, Division St, Belmont, Jade District, and hundreds of pubs and restaurants.  And only 20 minutes from stunning Columbia Gorge, (the best hiking in the portland area). This is one of the few Airbnb places on Mt. Tabor that really offers GREAT views.  (See pics below: Scenes from a TV commercial that was recently shot here).  The home is a  Mid-Century Modern, set up to feature the view in all the living areas (the bedrooms have views of Mt. Tabor Park and forest).  Take some time to relax with a bottle of wine on the peaceful deck which has INCREDIBLE views of the Willamette Valley, the Gorge, and Mt. Hood!   It's an excellent location:  A safe, quiet, neighb
neighborhood_overview: When visiting Portland, where you stay is critical.  You may not want to be on a super busy street, but you still want to have easy access to everything.  We have that here.  The neighborhood is Mt. Tabor, you can look it up online and see why it's such a great place to be.  We are literally surrounded with great food and pubs.  Two James Beard Nominated restaurants are within walking distance!  Walk 5 minutes to the Coquine Cafe, or 10 minutes to the Montavilla pub area with restaurants, pubs, dive bars, a cocktail lounge, a brewery, coffee and tea houses, the best Pizza in town, vintage stores, and a theater where you can have Pizza and Beer while you watch a current movie for $4!!  Walk 5 minutes to SE 82nd Ave (the Jade District), which has some of the most authentic Asian food in the city.  Walk to the other side of the park and you end up on Division St.(one of the 10 hottest food streets in the country), or Hawthorne Blvd (TONS of different ethnic and pricing options).   Portlan
transit: While there are hundreds of restaurants and pubs within walking distance, Portland's Bus 15 comes within 6 blocks every 10-15 minutes and heads straight downtown, so it's easy to get around without a car.  We are conveniently close to the PDX airport, and the 205 freeway.  We are also located within the Car2Go and Reach Now zones.

name: Large, cozy basement apartment near downtown
description: Cozy basement flat in quiet southwest neighborhood that works equally well for families and business travelers, with knotty pine paneling, wall-to-wall carpeting and plenty of room to spread out (~1,500 sq. ft.). Off-street parking, private entry with keypad, kitchenette, washer/dryer, WiFi, flat panel TV w/Netflix & Roku, bathroom, dining/living areas and two bedrooms. Centrally located only minutes from downtown, OHSU, Lewis & Clark, main transit lines and all amenities. For business travelers: - Off-street parking - Programmed keypad for self check-in - Stand-or-sit work desk w/chair and stool - Hi-speed WiFi - Washer/dryer, ironing board & iron - Breakfast supplies (coffee, instant oatmeal, fruit, etc.) - Peace & quiet For families: - Large supply of children's books, games, etc. - High chair, portable crib & baby gate - Flat panel TV with Netflix and Roku - Bunk beds (& double bed) in a 400+ sq. foot room - Separate room for adults - Park/playground/elementary school within walkin
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in South Burlingame (SoBu), a quiet neighborhood located in Southwest Portland, just up the hill from downtown and the Willamette river. From your apartment, you can walk to the local park, an upscale grocery store, and restaurants.
transit: The apartment has easy freeway access and is just minutes away from downtown, Multnomah Village, OHSU, Lewis & Clark, Tryon Creek State Park and all amenities.  Major bus lines to the downtown, shopping malls, etc. are within walking distance.

name: Quiet Master Bedroom in New Apartment
description: Located in the beautiful and quiet Woodstock neighborhood, close to Woodstock Park. We are about 10 min. walking distance to Trader Joe's, the Library, New Seasons, Safeway, Bi-Mart, Walgreens, and a large variety of restaurants. Our residential streets are not often traveled; mature trees; flowers for picking; a walk or run in the park for fresh air and exercise... I'm grateful I live here!  Your bathroom is not shared with guests. ***On Sundays, checkout time is 9:00 a.m. Check-in at 7:30 p.m. It is the Waterfall Room in a new 2-bedroom apartment above the garage. We created this space with the short-term visitor in mind since we have traveled throughout the world also using AirBnB. We know what it is like to enter an AirBnB space and have tried to include helpful details to make your stay more comfortable. You have your own well-lit private entrance in the back of our property which has two buildings on it. This apartment is behind the main house. You can access everything except fo
neighborhood_overview: Food Carts abound for a quick bite in multi-cultural varieties! Restaurants: Thai, Japanese, Chinese, Organic, Gluten Free, Bakery, Southern American fare + much more options abound! Hardware Store, Medical Services, Retail Stores just a few blocks away. Close to:  Crystal Springs Rhododendron Garden, Reed College, Reed College Canyon for hiking, Eastmoreland Golf Course, Portland Waterfront, Springwater Corridor
transit: Walking 5 min. or less, we are in the middle of 5 major bus lines which run to malls, downtown Portland, the airport, etc. Electric and car sharing programs in the area.

name: Beautiful, Vintage Master Suite
description: Our family has a long history in our home, as it was built by Janet's great grandfather in the early 1940s and now houses the fourth and fifth generation of family residents!  The house is true to its original design, with very few modifications made over the years.  We would love to welcome you into our main level master suite which is private and separate from our family's living quarters.  The large original pink bathroom is a sight to behold! This master suite is located on the main level of our vintage home in the Eastmoreland neighborhood near Reed College.  The neighborhood is beautiful, with tree lined streets that serve as a great place for a nice stroll or jog.  The room is separated from the rest of our house, and has its own outdoor entrance, so our guests will have complete privacy.  The separate entrance has a brick pathway leading from the sidewalk. The room has a queen sized bed and will most comfortably accommodate two people, but can sleep up to four with the sofa bed
neighborhood_overview: The Eastmoreland neighborhood is situated approximately 15 minutes by car from downtown Portland, and approximately 25 minutes from the airport.  Our house is surrounded by beautiful vintage homes and tree-lined streets.  We are within walking distance of Reed College, the Eastmoreland Golf Course, the Crystal Springs Rhododendron Garden, and the Springwater Corridor, which is a great trail for walking, jogging and cycling.  The Westmoreland, Sellwood and Woodstock commercial centers are within walking distance, and are easily reached by a quick car ride.  Great restaurants, coffee shops, a local movie theater, grocery stores, and bars can be found in those areas.  There are a number of food delivery services that serve our area, including individual restaurants, Caviar, Amazon Prime Now, and Uber Eats.  We are also a short car or bus ride away from Trader Joes.
transit: Our house is located only one block from a TriMet bus stop, which runs to downtown Portland.  We are also within walking distance of the Max Orange Line train, which runs from Milwaukie to downtown Portland.  We are easily reachable from the airport by car and have plenty of on street parking.  Ubers, Lyfts and cabs are easy to order in our neighborhood and we use these services regularly.

name: Cozy Vintage Cottage in the Woods
description: The cottage is close to public transport (near a MAX light rail station), the airport and family-friendly activities (the Columbia Gorge; Mt Hood) and a 20-30 min drive to downtown. It's cozy (eclectic vintage style), a wooded setting within the city limits, and has secure premises (electric gate). Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers We designed the cottage with a vintage style, having salvaged some of Jon's family farmhouse which was demolished for development. So you will see many elements from that house in our cottage in order to preserve his family's memories. The cottage itself was where Jon's grandmother lived though it was a little smaller then and in terrible shape (the Victorian bed was hers). We've had this property since we were married in 1979, lived in the cottage and then built our home behind it a few years later. You are welcome to wander around our nearly one acre yard and forest. There's a path that goes around the perimeter. We ar
neighborhood_overview: We are 20 minutes from the airport and on the eastern edge of the Portland city limits. We are about a half hour drive from Multnomah Falls and the Gorge and 10 miles from downtown Portland.
transit: We are about a block from the light rail station that takes you directly into downtown Portland as well as to transit centers for lines to the airport and other areas of around Portland.
