name: Hilltop Suite with Private Bath, Stunning Location
description: Visit Portland from high on a hill! You will have the entire spacious second floor/ensuite bath. Relax and enjoy expansive views while in our lush and  peaceful neighborhood.  You will have very close proximity to everything Portland has to offer! Scenic Terwilliger Parkway is steps away. It's just a 5 minute drive to downtown. And it's very easy to get to Portland's many cool neighborhoods/districts, breweries, unique restaurants and shops, fabulous parks and wilderness trails. Our home is an authentic Portland Bungalow built in 1914. It was one of the first homes in the Homestead neighborhood.  Our house is two flights of stairs up from street level. If you are fine with stairs the view and privacy from our house are a very nice reward. The room has an en suite bathroom, a spacious laptop friendly work space and a reading alcove with a comfortable lounge chair, a TV and WiFi. A table and chairs are available for relaxing with breakfast and coffee. The queen size, pillow top mattress
neighborhood_overview: Our quiet neighborhood is on a lush, tree covered hillside close-in to downtown Portland. The views of the Willamette River and the Cascade Mountain Range make this a very unique spot. We have easy access to getting around Portland and to the freeways.
transit: Parking in our neighborhood is super easy. There are always many available spaces close by. I will provide a guest parking permit for your stay.  If you visit without a car our home is two blocks from a major bus stop with many buses going downtown where you can transfer to different neighborhoods in Portland. Downtown is 1 to 2 and 1/2 miles from us depending on where you are going. There are several options to travel by car 2 go, Lyft, Uber, etc. in our close-in neighborhood.

name: Spacious Woodlawn Suite
description: Daylight basement suite includes a private entrance, separate bedroom, large living room with sofa bed, kitchenette, bathroom and free wi-fi. Great location in NE Portland. Walking distance to Tough Luck, Breakside Brewery, Tamale Boy and Woodlawn Coffee Shop! Welcome to Portland! Located in Northeast Portland, our mid-century modern home features a private daylight basement suite just for you. The space includes a separate bedroom, living room complete with queen-sized sofa bed (additional folding bed available if needed), bathroom, kitchenette, mini-fridge, microwave, toaster oven and coffeemaker. There are many great bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks all within walking and biking distance. Want to go on an epic hike? We are just 30-40 minutes (by car) to the scenic Columbia River Gorge and 15-20 minutes to Forest Park. Headed to Downtown Portland? We are just 6 miles from the center of town. Check-in time is 3:00 pm; Check-out time is 11:00 am. We may be able to accommodate
neighborhood_overview: Woodlawn / Concordia North neighborhoods have a ton of character, diversity and are close to some of the hippest areas in Portland (without the traffic).  Walking distance to awesome restaurants and bars on Dekum and a 5-minute bike ride to Alberta Arts District. We are a few blocks from Woodlawn Park and Alberta Park which features Portland's bike polo court (as seen on Portlandia).
transit: Two blocks from Trimet bus line, 12-15 minute drive to Downtown Portland (6 miles), 10-12 minute drive (6 miles) to the Portland International Airport. Bike commuting is just as easy! Two cruiser bikes and helmets are available upon request.

name: Charming Craftsman Loft
description: Hello world! If you're looking for a cozy, two bedroom home, in one of Portland's hippest neighborhoods, this is the spot for you. Our 1922 home is located in the heart of the historic Woodlawn neighborhood, just steps away from shops, a large park, and a summer farmer's market. You will have the upper apartment all to yourself. It is the perfect home base for your visit to Portland! Our home was one of the original farmhouses in the neighborhood. With modern furnishings and classic Eastside Portland charm, you'll enjoy your stay in our home! You'll have the whole upstairs apartment to yourself, with private side entrance. We also have a fenced yard, perfect for afternoon lawn games. We live downstairs. During the week, we will be coming and going from work. On the weekends, we are often off exploring the Pacific Northwest, but usually available by phone. Our Woodlawn neighborhood is one of the best kept secrets in Portland. Take a stroll through this funky historic area and see if you
neighborhood_overview: Our Woodlawn neighborhood is one of the best kept secrets in Portland. Take a stroll through this funky historic area and see if you can spot one of the neighborhood’s many tree houses or yurts. Enjoy the nearby coffee shops, restaurants, and brewery– all a 5-minute walk away. Some of our favorites spots are: Woodlawn Coffee and Pastry, Breakside Brewery, P's and Q's Market, Tamale Boy, and the Oregon Public House. Take a swing dance at the Village Ballroom or relax at Drishti Yoga. We are also a 10-minute walk from Safeway and Walgreens. All this is just in the immediate neighborhood! We are also an easy bike ride, bus or drive from the festive Alberta Arts District and Mississippi St commercial centers. Downtown Portland is only a 10-15 minute drive or 20-30 minute bike ride.
transit: There is plentiful free street parking available on our quiet street. Public transportation is only a block away. Take the number 6 bus straight downtown with no transfers. The bike share system starts a few blocks to the south. The airport is only a 15-minute drive- easy Lyft or Uber.

name: Bitching Centrally located 2 bedroom apartment
description: Walking distance to all the retail and nightlife on Williams and  Mississippi. We strive to make this 2 bedroom, 3 bed location (with private entry) casual with an attention to detail. Not only is it located in one of Portland's more euthentic neighborhoods, it's also centrally located for exploring the city.   With a Walker's Paradise score of 91 & Biker's Paradise 93.  Saunter to some of Portland's more inovative restaurants, breweries, food carts, bars, music venues and local grocery store. A 420 friendly private basement apt with 2 bedrooms, full bathroom, and futon bed/sofa in the living area.  There is also a kitchenette/washer and dryer room. While there isn't a kitchen, you have a small refrigerator/freezer, coffee machine, microwave, plates and utensils for heating leftovers, or fixing snacks. Tons of amazing restaurants in the neighborhood ensure you won't feel the need to eat in. Free Wi-Fi is available to all guests, as well as full use of a flat screen TV with cable. Guest
neighborhood_overview: The Historic Mississippi District is just bustling with things to do - too many to list here! Magazine and pamphlet provided when you arrive to help you decide on what to choose from & please feel free to ask for specific recommendations tailored to your needs as well.  This neighborhood is so great because it is literally a 10 minute bike ride to downtown or an equally short bus ride. There's a ton to see and do just steps away - Alberta Arts district isn't far & the Williams corridor is just a two blocks away as well.
transit: From this location it's easy to walk, bike, and take the bus. Uber and Lift are also popular with past guests. Biketown bike rental station is just two blocks away at Mississippi & Beech.  Bus stop is one block away on Fremont. There is free, usually plentiful, street parking available.  Freeway access from I-405 Kerby St Exit just around the corner off Vancouver Ave & I-5 access via Alberta St Exit.

name: Bright, Modern Loft in North PDX
description: Enjoy Portland in our beautiful, modern guest house.  You will be located in a quiet neighborhood nestled between the heart of downtown St Johns and the University of Portland. Hello! We have a 600 sq. ft, bright, modern guest house tucked away behind our main house.  During your stay you will have access to a fully stocked kitchen including: coffee and 3 ways to brew it, microwave, range, refrigerator, toaster, dishware, pots & pans, and baking goods. The space is loaded with windows which lets in a lot of natural light.   The lofted area has a queen size bed, large closet, desk area and full bathroom.  The space is ideal for 2 people, but it could certainly work for 3. There's a twin blow-up mattress or the couch for the third person.  The house is filled with reclaimed wood, handcrafted light fixtures and artistic touches  - make sure to check out all of the pictures! You will have access to the entire guest house, wifi, washer / dryer, and a private outdoor patio (in the warmer, dr
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the University Park neighborhood of Portland - about 1 mile away of the downtown St Johns neighborhood and 1 mile away from the the University of Portland The University Park neighborhood is within walking distance,  or a short drive,  to parks - including Cathedral Park - bars, food carts, coffee shops, restaurants, a fitness center (Westcoast Fitness) a farmers market (only runs during the summer months), antique/thrift stores, and various other shops.  Forest Park, Portland's largest park that's filled with hiking and biking trails,  is located 1.5 miles away, directly across the St. Johns Bridge. Please note: Our house is not located within walking distance of downtown Portland!
transit: Getting around is easy!  We are located near 3 bus lines, enterprise rental cars, Lyft and Uber are never far away. There's also a car rental called Get Around that's kinda of like Airbnb where people rent their cars.

name: Stumptown Cottage in Eastmoreland
description: Newly built modern studio space in our beautiful historic Eastmoreland neighborhood. Loft like space with modern amenities in a quiet setting. Close to Reed College, Woodstock, Division and Sellwood-Moreland neighborhoods. Easily accessible via public transit. I am an interior designer and loved designing this space. It has a lofty European look with vaulted ceilings, large pendant LED lighting and lots of windows for an abundance of natural light. There is a queen size bed in an alcove and a convertible sofa that folds down to sleep an additional person.  There is a kitchen space with a microwave, coffee maker, tea kettle, small refrigerator and a hot plate if you wish to cook. There is a sink with garbage disposal and ample counter space. There are two folding chairs hanging on the back of the cabinet in the hallway. You will have access to the entire cottage with a small deck. Parking for one car is available in front of the main house. The cottage is accessible via the path to the
neighborhood_overview: We live in one of the oldest neighborhoods in Portland and it is one of the most beautiful with 100 year old trees and homes. Easily one of the most scenic neighborhoods to walk in.  We are located 3 blocks from the Springwater Corridor, a bike/run path that will take you West to ride around our downtown area. This is a must if you are a cyclist and a great way to view our city from two wheels. We are adjacent to the Woodstock neighborhood which has lots of shopping, restaurants and a local library. We are also adjacent to the Sellwood and Westmoreland neighborhoods, which have boutique and grocery shopping, restaurants,  antique stores, etc. Both neighborhoods are a 20 min walk or 5 min drive from our home. We will provide you with lists of restaurants, our favorite Farmer's Markets, supermarkets, including our favorite local New Seasons market that just opened in the Woodstock neighborhood, just a 5 min drive or 20 min walk. Think natural, organic, with a bakery, deli, ramen bar, and
transit: We are close to public transit. The Max Orange line is a 15-20 min walk to our home. You can also access Tri Met bus #19 Woodstock-Glisan. This bus will take you to the downtown area and Sellwood, a short hop from our home.

name: Cute Condo in St. Johns
description: The condo is cute, cozy and bright with an open kitchen/living room and 2 good size bedrooms. There is a small fenced patio out back with a big cherry tree, very private, and great for catching afternoon sun. There is a washer and dryer in closet in one of the bedrooms. Off street parking right in front of the condo. I will be available by phone and text. Usually staying  just a few minutes away. The condo is located in the St. Johns neighborhood of Portland. Walking distance to the downtown area with restaurants, bars, coffee shops, movie theatres, post office and grocery store.  Cathedral Park is walking distance, with great view of the famous St. Johns bridge. Forest Park and Sauvie Island are only a few miles away by car for getting out into nature, walking, bird watching or berry picking. Driving to downtown Portland is only about 10-15 minutes depending on traffic. Public transport is available, just takes a bit longer. There is a bit of traffic noise at times, but not super noti

Cathedral Park is walking distance, with great view of the famous St. Johns bridge. Forest Park and Sauvie Island are only a few miles away by car for getting out into nature, walking, bird watching or berry picking.
transit: Driving to downtown Portland is only about 10-15 minutes depending on traffic. Public transport is available, just takes a bit longer.

name: Bedroom in Hip Mississippi neighborhood home
description: Bedroom right in the middle of Mississippi neighborhood. Chill in living room or backyard, if you can peel yourself away from the tons of great restaurants, coffee shops, boutiques, & breweries nearby - Portland spirit! Public transit very close - both MAX & bus lines. About 10 min drive (and 20 min on bus) from Downtown hot spots like Powell's Books and Voodoo Donuts. Very close to other busy hangouts like N Williams Ave, Interstate, N Killingsworth and NE Alberta Street. Great location in Heart of Mississippi Neighborhood - Spacious home with upgraded kitchen with granite slab counters, newer appliances, tile floor and large shared back yard with fire pit, BBQ and camping chairs. Board games and some books to hang out while not sight seeing in beautiful Portland, Oregon. One private bedroom. Shared living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry, 2 bathrooms, large front porch with bistro table/chairs and shared backyard space with camp chairs, BBQ and firepit. Co-host will be on site wit
neighborhood_overview: In the city that likes to “keep it weird,” Travel Portland has coined the phrase, "You can, in Portland." North Portland is a prime example with delicious meals, tax-free shopping, one-of-a-kind bars and much more off the beaten path. Enjoy live music, tons of local shops, popular restaurants, breweries and great hang out spots on N. Mississippi Ave, one block from home. The many independent retailers of North Mississippi Avenue reflect Portland's eclectic tastes and DIY ethic. North Mississippi provides this vibrant neighborhood with ample watering holes and entertainment, one of the city's best concentrations of quality craft beers and brewpubs, and lots of yummy eateries.
transit: We live on a bike street and there's bike rental right around the corner. Bus  4 and yellow MAX (light rail train) lines within couple blocks. Lyft and Uber are an inexpensive option from airport or downtown. And let's not forget WALKING! Tons of stuff within 1-8 blocks away. We even like to walk downtown (about 40min walk).

name: Charming Alberta Arts Craftsman
description: Explore one of Portland’s hippest neighborhoods and live like a local in this charming Craftsman home. Located blocks away from the Alberta Arts District, vibrant Alberta St is lined with locally owned boutique shops, art galleries, bars and restaurants. If you want a centrally located place that feels like home, you've found your spot! Upstairs: Two bedrooms (one with office desk work space), 1 bathroom, living room, dining room, kitchen and sun porch. Downstairs: 1 bedroom, living room, bathroom, laundry room.  Backyard: Grassy lawn and paver patio for relaxing or gathering outside for a meal. Guests have access to the entire house and yard. Rich with local history and teeming with locally owned boutique shops, art galleries and restaurants, the Alberta Arts district is a favorite among locals and visitors alike.   A hot spot for foodies, you'll find everything along NE Alberta from Iraqi, Indian, Thai, Korean, and sustainable sushi to burgers, brews, biscuits, award winning pie, ice
neighborhood_overview: Rich with local history and teeming with locally owned boutique shops, art galleries and restaurants, the Alberta Arts district is a favorite among locals and visitors alike.   A hot spot for foodies, you'll find everything along NE Alberta from Iraqi, Indian, Thai, Korean, and sustainable sushi to burgers, brews, biscuits, award winning pie, ice-cream and donuts.   Check our neighborhood guide for our top local tips.  We're also just a text away if you have questions about other neighborhoods to explore once you're in town.   (Website hidden by Airbnb)
transit: The house is just 3 blocks from Alberta, so bring your walking shoes, or pick up a new pair at one of the fabulous shoe stores on Alberta.  If you plan to drive, there is a private driveway just for you.  Portland boasts one of the nations's best public transportation systems in the country. Check TriMet's website and plug in other locations around town for bus/Max train info on routes and length of travel.

name: Mins to Conv Center & Downtown: AC, W/D, TV, Patio
description: This modern, ground-floor studio is located in central SE Portland near tons of bars and dining and just a quick jump over the river to downtown and the Pearl. Furnished with a hand-crafted queen Murphy bed, TV with Roku, thoughtfully appointed kitchen, washer/dryer and bathroom stocked with amenities, this space provides everything you'll need for a great stay in Portland. The private patio is the perfect spot for morning coffee and the ductless HVAC system keeps you comfortable year-round! The private entrance is equipped with an easy to use electronic lock to make access a breeze 24/7. Once inside, you'll find a well-equipped kitchen, stacked washer and dryer, bathroom with a stall shower and a cozy lounging area lounging area where you can plan all your Portland adventures or veg out and stream your favorite entertainment on the TV with Roku. The queen Murphy bed and room darkening shades allow you to sleep in as late as you want. With the shades up, the large windows let in tons o
neighborhood_overview: My home is located in the heart of the Buckman neighborhood with a nice balance of residential properties, retail and restaurants just around the corner. I am just 15 blocks from the Willamette River and a quick walk or bike ride to downtown or to the convention center. A Lyft or taxi will make it easy for you to get around and if you need to park a car, it's usually pretty easy to find within a block or so of the house.
transit: Parking is pretty easy to find on the streets surrounding my house, but getting around for travelers without a rental is definitely doable and a great way to experience the city. Tri-Met, our regional transit system, has buses and transit stops around every corner - just hop on the nearby lines #12, 19 or 20. Check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) or download their easy to use app to make trip planning and ticket purchasing effortless. Rent a bike from a nearby shop or use Nike's citywide bike-sharing program, Biketown, that makes rental easy with kiosks all around PDX.  You can  also easily get around with services like Uber, Lyft and taxis. Car sharing programs like ReachNow are also popular in the area. No matter your preferred method, you'll be in a great spot to easily get wherever you need to go.

name: Alberta Arts retro fun studio apt.
description: Come stay in your own retro-modern apartment in the hip and eclectic Alberta Arts neighborhood.  The space is the light-filled basement level of a recently-built home,  1/2 block from NE Alberta St. and minutes from downtown Portland.  Walk score = 92. The apt. is 500 sq ft total.  The main room holds a full size bed, full kitchen, bistro table and chairs, small sofa and shelves holding the turntable, TV and 8 track player.  The space is quiet, private, roomy, air-conditioned and has lots of storage. It features a full bathroom  and a closet with a stackable washer/dryer that are accessed from the private entry hall. There is a separate entrance thru the gate at the south side of the house with stairs to the basement level apt.  The entry door has a key pad lock, therefore key exchanges will not be necessary.  I will contact you with the code when you book. I'm available for any questions that you may have about the apt, the neighborhood and the city of Portland.  I have lots of fun hi
neighborhood_overview: The Alberta Arts district is full of unique art galleries, restaurants, boutiques and pubs.  The area hosts a vibrant and fun street fair the evening of the last Thursday of each month with a focus on the arts.
transit: This address has a walk score of 92 and bike score of 81.  A bike rental shop is an 8 minute walk away.  Many restaurants/shops/pubs are mere blocks away on NE Alberta St.  We are 7 blocks from a bus line and about a mile from the closest Max stop.  Travel time to downtown is 13 min. by car, 20 min. by bike and 27 min. by bus.  There is ample street parking available for guests.

name: Prescott Room ~ Urban Haven
description: The Prescott Room is a classic, Mission style. Located on the main floor with a feather top queen bed, TV/FireStick w/Netflix, and just a few steps from the large shared bath. Guests enjoy much more than simply a "private room;" I welcome guests to enjoy my "entire place" making this the perfect getaway! With a couple of other Airbnb rooms in the house travelers love meeting each other. The serene garden is perfect for quiet relaxing, including a hot tub. I've lived in my house nearly 22 years.  My guests always find a special feeling here, welcoming, relaxing, charming, a real home setting with all the amenities. Each of the guest rooms are inviting, comfortable, creative, and clean; the house is filled with personality.  Guests enjoy access to the entire house (common areas), garden, and share a large bathroom on the main floor with extra, towels and a 50gal hot water.    Washer/dryer use for guests staying 7 days or more. The dining room has a 24 hour beverage "bistro" for tea, coff
neighborhood_overview: This IS the location!  You can see the MAX lightrail station from my front door!  Interstate 5 has on/off ramps, both directions, 2 minutes away. Walk to the awesome, hip, groovy, "Portlandia Style" Historic Mississippi District in 10 minutes.  The Alberta Arts District is only a few minutes by car or bike ... for shopping, galleries, food carts, restaurants, coffee, breweries, dispensaries, and other crazy little shops.  10 minutes on MAX lightRail into downtown for everything you could want to see or do.  MAX runs miles in several directions from my house to all over the PDXMetro area.  There are also bike trails and paths running both north and south from the house.  And if you would rather relax and stick close to "home" check out my Guidebook.  At the end of my street alone there are several restaurants (one with dozens of brews/ciders on tap), coffee and fresh bagels, wine & bottle shop, a bank and even a convenience store.
transit: Car, lightrail, biking or walking.  You will have plenty of options getting exactly where you want to go from the convenience of Urban Haven in North Portland, Nopo!   As we say here ... "plane to train!"  Lightrail can literally take you from baggage claim to my house!  And that means whether you arrive by plane, train, OR even bus you're connected right to your accommodations.

name: North Tabor Basement Suite
description: We have a private basement space available for rent in our 1920's North Tabor house.  Conveniently located on the bus line, bike path, and close to coffee shops, restaurants, and the grocery store.  The rental is available for 1 to 3-months.   About you: low maintenance, quiet, respectful of neighbors, reliable, doesn't mind muffled noise from upstairs, pet free, drug free, & non-smoking. The newly remodeled space is approximately 400 sf and includes a private bedroom, bathroom, and den.  No kitchen.  Bright and airy.  Bamboo floors in all rooms except marmoleum in the bathroom. Includes: -Utilities and internet -Private entrance -Private bathroom -Fully furnished -Mini Fridge -Tea kettle, coffee pot -Microwave There is a shared laundry room in the basement.  We are very respectful with timing and will always knock to access the laundry room. North Tabor neighborhood.  Walking distance to: Tabor Tavern, and QFC Groceries. neighborhood_overview: North Tabor neighborhood.  Walking distance to: Tabor Tavern, and QFC Groceries.

name: Luxurious Suite w/ King & Queen Beds & Master Bath
description: Spacious master suite with a king and a queen bed and luxury bathroom. Gorgeous tiled walk-in shower. Top of the line Tempurpedic mattress for an amazing night’s sleep. Office area and living area with big screen Smart TV. Quiet, peaceful neighborhood and all the amenities you need. Close to grocery stores, many restaurants, and bus lines to downtown.  Convenient check-in with lockbox. You are welcome to use the microwave and fridge but we prefer guests not to cook full meals. You have a huge master suite to yourself, which is enough room to do yoga, relax, watch TV, and do maybe even some work at the desk. You are welcome to microwave and store leftovers in the shared kitchen, but we prefer guests not to cook on the stove/oven. You are welcome to share in use of the common spaces, such as the kitchen (for microwaving and making tea/coffee, not for cooking meals), living room, and laundry room. I’m happy to chat with and share my local tips but also respect the privacy of my guests. La
neighborhood_overview: Lafayette Meadows is a brand new development built in 2019. We are close to major transit lines and grocery stores but tucked away in a quiet, peaceful cul de sac where you can hear the chirping of the birds.

name: Respite in Rose City Park
description: You'll have plenty of room to spread out, play games, and rest deeply.  Feel free to have a coffee on our back porch or lounge on the sofa after a long day of sight-seeing.  Our guests say our backyard is “zen” and “serene”. Lots of great eats and drinks within walking distance.  Easy to get around and your kids are welcome. Let us know if you need a high chair, walker, or playpen. This is the basement of our casa so you might hear us upstairs a bit. We'll give you plenty of privacy but may offer you a guava pastelito if we happen to see you. Escape the summer heat-it’s always cold here! No, really, our basement is cool even when it’s 85 outside. We have heat and AC, but they cannot be controlled from the basement. You have plenty of vents to open or close at your discretion. We also have lots of extra blankets.  Everyone loves this about our place.  There is one king sized bed and a day bed with a pull out trundle-perfect for four guests.  We are pet free, tobacco free and not 420 fri
neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance to 2 major food cart pods and breweries, the best Thai and Pho in PDX, groceries, coffee, park for the kiddos, urgent care, pediatric urgent care, yoga, church, movie theatres and Hollywood Theatre.
transit: Bus 12 on Sandy is just a few houses away, 10 minute drive to the airport, and always a quick Uber/Lyft anywhere in town. Street parking is available if you're driving.

name: Spacious, Private Apt near Mt. Tabor
description: Come stay for a quintessential Portland experience in Southeast!  Welcome to this private, 700+ sq ft apartment with access to a lush yard and patio.  This space is ideal for families, outdoor adventurers, and business travelers.  The relaxed neighborhood boasts views of Mt. Tabor and is a quick walk, bike or drive from the area's great restaurants, food carts, shops, hikes and experiences.  With a modern space and thoughtful amenities, you're sure to feel at home! Luxuriate in comfort in this newly renovated, family-friendly apartment. The space boasts a king-sized bed, modern private bathroom with shower, high quality linens, and a gas fireplace!  The expansive living/dining space includes a sleeper sofa and smart 4K Ultra HD TV with Netflix access and Blu-ray player. Guests have an in-unit fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and French press. The kitchenette/bar is well stocked for all your needs, including locally roasted coffee, tea and a welcome gift to start your stay off right! Th
neighborhood_overview: South Tabor, and your apartment specifically, is only a few blocks from Mt. Tabor park and its many trails, while still only a couple blocks from coffee shops and burger and pizza joints.  We are also just two blocks from one of Portland's many greenways/bike paths, and two blocks from Division St. -- a main bus line that can take you straight downtown or to anywhere else Southeast has to offer.  And at the end of your adventures for the day, the apartment is nestled within a quiet, peaceful neighborhood. You'll be able to turn on the fire, kick back, and relax.
transit: With a bike score of 96 and less than a 5 minute walk to public transit, getting around is easy!  If traveling by car, guests can reach all the SE hotspots in just 5 or 10 minutes, with downtown Portland about a 15 minute journey. We are just down the street from the Division (4) bus line which takes you to trendy SE shops and restaurants, otherwise visitors can stay on the bus to reach all that downtown Portland has to offer.   We are just two blocks from one of Portland's many greenways/bike paths, so biking to shops, Portland State or OHSU is all easy!

name: Stylish, Lovely Bungalow w/ free parking
description: Newly constructed cottage. Ideal location, close to I84, bus, MAX. 15 min to Downtown or Airport. Close to best Food & Drink in town. In Portland's safe & quiet Hollywood neighborhood. Bright, luxurious & private. It is a comfortable, charming modern bungalow that will make you feel like you're at home! Imagine enjoying the comfort and privacy of home in one of the most desirable and convenient locations in Portland. Come stay in our beautifully built cottage that mimics the 1912 Craftsman bungalow (main house) that it sits directly behind.  We’ve focused on offering you the comforts of home with brand new queen-sized Serta pillow-top mattress, quality pillows, and plush, cotton towels and sheets. You will actually get a good night’s sleep here! Our home offers second sleeping place (futon). The bathroom and stocked kitchen and are ready for a comfortable stay. Enjoy relaxing in our living room, featuring modern appliances, and lots of natural light.  We offer an extra fold out bed dow
neighborhood_overview: Our house is nestled within a friendly and safe neighborhood. Enjoy short walks to the Hollywood Farmer’s Market, Trader Joe’s, Whole Foods, Rite Aid, Hollywood Theater, and a variety of restaurants including brew pubs, coffee shops, family-friendly and fine dining. Historical Hollywood neighborhood, with its glorious art house, the Hollywood Theatre, and the district is, without a doubt, the city's expo and sporting hub: The Blazers play here and it's also home to the Convention Center where organizations from all over the world come to set up shop, celebrating everything from dogs and beer to Legos and comics.
transit: Our home is located just a short drive to the freeway allowing for convenient access to the airport (15 min.), downtown Portland (10 min.), and many other neighborhoods. Using public transportation around the city and to and from the airport is incredibly convenient as the Hollywood MAX (light rail) station and two major bus lines (#77 & #12) are located just a few blocks from our house.

name: Beautiful Downtown Studio Near PSU-Parking Space
description: Beautiful studio in downtown Portland, 2 blocks from Portland State University. Near MAX rail & streetcar. A walk away from Portland’s concert halls and waterfront. Historic building, completely renovated. Lots of character & charm with all the modern amenities you need. Hardwood floors, high ceilings. Fully equipped gourmet kitchen features granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, built-in cabinets. Updated bathroom has a clawfoot tub. Washer/Dryer in the unit. Dedicated parking spot. Recently purchased and renovated stylish studio with brand new furniture, linens, towels and a fully stocked kitchen. Coffee, tea, pancake mix and syrup are provided for every guest.  Smart TV, cable and WiFi. There is a lockbox and guests can let themselves in and enjoy their privacy. I am available by phone and email, also in person if there are any questions or problems. The condo is a walk away from Portland State University, concert halls and museums. There are many cafes, restaurants, coffe
neighborhood_overview: The condo is a walk away from Portland State University, concert halls and museums. There are many cafes, restaurants, coffee shops and food carts in the area. It is also close to OHSU.
transit: There is a reserved free parking spot behind the building. The street car and the MAX rail are across the street and guests can also enjoy the convenience of public transportation. Walking downtown is highly recommended.

name: Private suites near it all- Room #4
description: Private Queen bedroom / full shared bathroom with everything you need! Huge common kitchen, living room, porch, etc.   BATHROOM is shared with room 3 (1-4 guests). All other rooms have their own bathrooms.  Short walk to Lloyd and Moda Center, LightRail, downtown, 28th, Broadway, shops, bars and restaurants.  Other rooms available! -1 of 7 guest suites -Sleeps two in a queen bed.   -Shared full bath stocked with natural shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, towels, wash cloth, hair dryer, Q-tips and cotton balls. -Need to schedule your shower? Shower schedule posted on bathroom door.  -Your keys will be waiting for you in the door lock of your room. -Dresser, closet, luggage rack, seating, extra blankets.   -Extra linens in hall closet. -High ceilings.  Comfortable spaces. Full living area on main floor including kitchen, living room, etc. front porch with swing, back deck. (Shared) Coffee and tea provided in the kitchen.  Make it yourself. Ample free street parking with no time
neighborhood_overview: Close enough to walk to everything! 85 walk score.  74 Transit score.  100 bike score. -5 blocks from MAX LightRail.  -2 blocks from many bus routes.  -Easy location to get a cab.  - Lloyd Center - Moda/Convention Center -Shops, bars and restaurants on Broadway, 28th St.,and Vancouver/Williams only blocks away -Also close enough to Mississippi and most of the SE neighborhoods.  Check out Swift or Iconic for drinks only a block away!
transit: Walk, bike or ride easily anywhere!  Ample free street parking in front of the house. We also have a car to rent parked near the house, the name is AJ. Download the app ‘Get Around’ and be able to explore Portland!   (Website hidden by Airbnb)  (website hidden)_form.html

name: Bright Comfy Apartment near Alberta Arts district.
description: Our light and airy, modern basement apartment is located near the Alberta Arts District in a lovely residential neighborhood. On Alberta St. are many shops, restaurants, bars, galleries, and The Alberta Rose Theater. Nearby is Wilshire Park, New Seasons Market, & The Kennedy School (a charming, arty renovation of an old elementary school w/ restaurant, bars and a movie theater). Local buses are within easy walking distance & will get you downtown in a 1/2 hr. or if driving, it's 15 mins by car. The space is over 600 square feet and has a private entrance at the back of our house and includes one bedroom, a bathroom, and good-sized living room/kitchen. The basement has been recently renovated with 2 new large window wells that bring in lots of light. BEDROOM: Attractive, spacious, carpeted and with plenty of natural light. The queen bed is very comfortable and has an inner spring mattress and duvet and bedside tables with reading lamps. A wall heater keeps the bedroom as warm as you wis
neighborhood_overview: ALBERTA ARTS NEIGHBORHOOD: Starts 5 blocks west from our house and goes on for at least 20 blocks of shops, restaurants, pubs, art galleries and the Alberta Rose Theater. THE KENNEDY SCHOOL:  Another 5 blocks north is a renovated elementary school that houses a restaurant, several bars and a movie theater, the hallways are filled with work from local artists.  42nd ST: 7 blocks to the east is an up and coming neighborhood on 42nd street, there are some wonderful places to eat including the Old Salt Marketplace, Red Sauce Pizza and Roses Ice Cream, there is an old ex-bowling alley called the Spare Room that has hosts some local dance bands and  has a karaoke night.  WILSHIRE PARK: There is a beautiful park less than 3 blocks south for strolls or runs.
transit: By Car we are 15 minutes from downtown and the airport. Portland has a wonderful transit line. TriMet provides bus, light rail and commuter rail transit services in the Portland, Oregon, metro area. There is a local bus about 3 blocks west.

name: SW Portland 2bdrm on Private Drive
description: Enjoy your stay nestled in the trees on 1/4 acre.  Only 2 minutes from I-5 south and Capitol Hwy.  Minutes to downtown, Multnomah Village, PCC Sylvania, NIKE, Lewis and Clark College, OHSU and PSU. Two bedrooms both with new pillowtop queen beds, living room with couch and loveseat, lamps, end tables, coffee table, dining area with seating for 4, open concept kitchen, spacious bathroom and laundry room with washer and dryer, deck.  Digital access.  Dedicated parking space. This contemporary 3 story home is located on a quarter acre hillside with a creek running through the backyard.  This bottom level unit space is above ground, spacious, light bright and airy. The house underwent a recent remodel and has new carpet and new paint.  Only minutes from OHSU, VA Hospital. PSU, Intel and Nike World Headquarters.  It's 10 minutes to downtown or the MODA Center and 30 minutes from the airport (all highway). The bedrooms have new queen pillowtop beds.  There's an  HDTV with cable, dining table
neighborhood_overview: Located in West Portland Park this popular area  is close to downtown without all the hassles of parking and noise.  Neighborhood of working professionals who enjoy being out of the city.  Barbur World Foods and Holly Park are just a mile away. Multnomah Village with all of it's restaurants and shopping is less than 5 minutes away
transit: The is a dedicated parking spot for one vehicle onsite. It's a half mile to the nearest transit stop.

name: Modern Alberta Arts Apartment
description: Located in a quiet neighborhood just 2 blocks from the lively and vibrant Alberta Arts District, this modern apartment, with a full kitchen, makes a great home base for exploring Portland and Northern Oregon. This newly renovated garden apartment is part of a charming 1918 craftsman home.  It has polished concrete floors and very modern Scandinavian (read "IKEA" here :)) décor.   It has one bedroom with a queen bed and a queen sleeper sofa.  The apartment has a full kitchen / dining area with all the amenities you need for a comfortable stay. Your private entrance is located on the left side of the house and downstairs through a keypad entry system.  There is plenty of free street parking and the driveway is available if street parking is ever an issue.  The washer and dryer are available to you (upon request). My housemate and I live upstairs, so one of us is usually available in person and we are always available via the AirBNB app.  Also, being avid travelers (and AirBNB guests ours
neighborhood_overview: The Alberta Arts District is a lively commercial area where you will find great coffee shops, restaurants, art galleries, brew pubs and unique shops to explore.  The neighborhood is filled with beautiful craftsman homes and perfect for urban hiking, biking and exploring.
transit: This is a great central location with easy access to transportation.  Portland is a very, walk, bike, scooter, bus and car friendly city.  Just choose your mode of transportation and you can be just about anywhere in Portland in 15-20 minutes.  The nearest bus is 3 blocks away and there are bikes and scooters available for short-term rental on Alberta Street.

name: The Farmhouse Cottage
description: The Farmhouse Cottage is a newly built guest house that is designed specifically for guests to have a home away from home.  The Cottage includes a bright and cheery interior with all of the amenities for comfort.  Placed in a zen filled backyard, full of gardens and the sound of a gurgling pond, the cottage is perfect for relaxation when not out exploring Portland.  The backyard is shared space so being a dog lover is a must. Please read full details about the space below. The Farmhouse Cottage is a guest house that sits in mini backyard oasis. For those with physical limitations it is easily accessible with no stairs and a walk-in shower.  The Cottage includes a full kitchen with all the basic cooking supplies you'll need.  For sleeping arrangements the bedroom has a queen size bed and the main room has a Tempur-Pedic sofa sleeper. A smart TV is provided in the bedroom with streaming services like Netflix, Hulu and Amazon. The  interior was designed for relaxation and comfort with a b
neighborhood_overview: Montavilla is a great neighborhood with plenty to do in walking distance. Three blocks to the South of us you will find  historic downtown Montavilla on Stark Street. Here you will find restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops,  breweries, cocktail bars, food trucks, yoga and a movie theater. There is also an amazing little Sunday Farmers Market not to be missed.  One block to the North is Glisan which also has some restaurant and bar options.  For scenery Mount Tabor Park is 1 mile away.
transit: Montavilla is very accessible! Close to two major bus lines along with easy access to major highways, it is easy to explore what Portland has to offer.  We are about 12 minutes from the airport, 5 minutes from Mount Tabor and 30 minutes from the famous Multnomah Falls. It is also totally reasonable to ride your bike to downtown or walk to Mount. Tabor.

name: Unique PDX Tri-Plex Upper Level Apartment
description: A Rare Unique PDX Tri-plex with full Upper level 1BD/1BA Unit with private entrance. Upper Level apartment built in 1910 is an historic Portland Tri-Plex property. Located centrally within the city, this unique space offers easy access to all points of interests in and around the Portland Metro Area. Thoughtfully appointed details add comfort and a home-away-from-home feel. This Historic 1910 house is clean, quiet, and the upper apartment space is truly unique; One Bedroom, Living and Dining areas, and full Bathroom with original claw-foot tub. The apartment is perfect for a single or couple. Comfortable queen-sized bed with clean linens, bath towels, ample storage. Everything one would need to feel at home while visiting. Flat screen television with cable and wireless wi-fi internet throughout. This historic unit has just enough modern updates that provide a clean and fun space to relax and unwind. Easy access to award-winning restaurants, movie theaters, coffee shops, parks, and so m
neighborhood_overview: Located in a multi-purpose neighborhood of homes and businesses.  A block to Sizzle Pie Pizza, Pine State Biscuits; Blocks to historic neighborhoods, artisan coffee, chocolate. Very close to downtown Portland, Oregon Convention Center, The Moda Center. Diverse communities of Pubs, Cafes, and Fine dining located CLOSE.
transit: Max, Tri-met are our public transportation and are withing blocks to the property. Near I-5 Freeway, Union Pacific Train, Greyhound Bus Station. NIKE Bike and Water Front Rentals near by.

name: Artist's Eco Trailer
description: All are welcome in this musician's tiny home! This cozy trailer is perfect for one person or a couple who doesn't mind sharing a smaller space. Located in outer SE Portland, close to Mt. Tabor Park, grocery stores, a main bus line, and a myriad of restaurants. Private bathroom (with composting toilet), full kitchen, free street parking, and tons of sweet and funky character! The trailer is well-suited for those with a sense of adventure and a DIY attitude. Sort of a lesson in urban eco-living! I am just a mile away! This is the edge of FoPo, the Foster-Powell neighborhood. Just a few blocks from 82nd Street and the Jade district, which is filled with the best Asian restaurants and groceries in town. SE Division Street is nearby  - a stretch of road famous for having SO many amazing restaurants (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are also just a mile from Mt. Tabor Park, for gorgeous sunsets and walks amidst tall trees (Website hidden by Airbnb) And be sure to check out Montavilla,  a sweet n

Just a few blocks from 82nd Street and the Jade district, which is filled with the best Asian restaurants and groceries in town. SE Division Street is nearby  - a stretch of road famous for having SO many amazing restaurants (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are also just a mile from Mt. Tabor Park, for gorgeous sunsets and walks amidst tall trees (Website hidden by Airbnb) And be sure to check out Montavilla,  a sweet nearby neighborhood with shops, restaurants, and some truly amazing hand-crafted cocktails (Website hidden by Airbnb)

name: Fortune 503 - UofP Perfect Stay
description: Built in 2015 the Fortune Haus apartment home is tucked away in a friendly St. John's community neighborhood near the University of Portland. We live in the house on the property so we are nearby if you need anything. We look forward to hosting you! This newly constructed home away from home has amazing windows to see the sky and watch the clouds pass by, an awesome tree behind the unit where you might see a squirrel or some birds, a full kitchen to cook in and more than what you would get from staying at a hotel during your visit in Portland. You will be given a code the morning of your arrival to have access to the apartment. The garage and driveway are not part of the Airbnb. We have been airbnb hosts now for over 2 years and have thoroughly enjoyed it. If you want to keep to yourself and come and go without interaction, we are cool with that. If you want some guidance as to what to do in our great city, we would love to help you with that. If you want to chill out and shoot the bre
neighborhood_overview: We love Portsmouth/St. John's! The community of people are very friendly and we are within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. Even though we are a bit north of Downtown Portland, we get to drive over the beautiful St John's Bridge to get there (takes about 20-25 minutes to get to downtown depending on time of day and where you are going). We are only about a mile away from the University of Portland, and less than a mile to downtown St. John's, where you can find cute shops, coffee, 2 theaters, many restaurants, food carts, and get to Cathedral Park (a favorite). A bit further up is Pier Park, where you can walk among tall trees and even play disc golf.
transit: There is a lot within walking distance - even movie theaters, parks, shopping, coffee, restaurants, and bars. New Seasons Market just opened only 2 blocks away, and it's right next to the TriMet bus stop on Lombard, which can take you to the MAX train on Interstate to get other locations. Uber & Lyft & Taxis are also an option to getting around. If you do have a vehicle, there is plenty of street parking, and you can use the driveway to load/unload.

description: Clean and Cozy 2 bedroom, 1 bath,located in a courtyard 6 plex single level apt. bldg.  laundry on site, kitchen w dishwasher, 1 bedroom w 2 twins and 1 b/r w a queen bed, a/c, t/v, wi-fi. Close to Providence Hospital, 6 blocks from the Max station , close to bus...and off street parking for 1 car if needed. This is a nice vintage apartment in a clean and quiet well maintained building. Access through the back entry (kitchen door) where driveway and parking spot is located A phone call away Walking distance to Starbucks, pizza, mexican, breakfast cafe....right across from Providence Hospital. Close to tri-met, 6 blocks from max, off street parking, easy freeway access to I-84 E or I-84 E This is a non-smoking building. No smoking of cigarette, cigars,marijuana or vaping.

description: Split level, sunny mid-century ranch w/ pool in SE Portland! Many custom features, garden,  double lot, walking distance to Reed Canyon, Trader Joe's. Great home for families & visiting Grandparents w/ 2 master suites. Pets ok.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Pool, air conditioning, solar panels, huge vegetable garden 4+ bedroom and 3 1/2 baths makes this a perfect home for families + grandparents. Outdoor living with 3 separate eating areas, BBQ, Sonos speakers and more! Access to entire home. Owner will not be on the premises so it is for you to enjoy! Reedway/ Reedwood is  in SE Portland close to Woodstock, Sellwood and many parks. name: Portland Magnolia Apartment
description: Eleven easy steps down get you to a very spacious, comfortable, clean and private basement apartment with one bedroom, a beautiful bath, an almost full kitchen and large windows providing wonderful natural light.  An excellent place to launch your daily adventures in the North Portland area and beyond; we are great for visiting family and friends in St. Johns and University of Portland neighborhoods.  You will hear some noise from us upstairs, although we try to be as quiet as possible. Wonderful, clean, comfortable and spacious 900 square foot downstairs apartment with large bedroom in a pleasant setting. Air conditioning is available. There is an almost full kitchen (no stove), electric kettle, small fridge, microwave & toaster oven. We have found that it is best for a couple, or if you need two beds, we have a very comfortable twin foldaway bed to use  in an alcove off of the living room.  Good restaurants,  coffee shops and excellent grocery stores nearby. Guests have private acces
neighborhood_overview: Quiet University Park neighborhood, with 3 parks in walking distance.  Excellent biking and running neighborhood.  Forest Park is nearby, and we are close to the St. Johns and Overlook neighborhoods.  Don't forget to head over to Cathedral Park and drive over the beautiful St.Johns Bridge. We are happy to provide running routes or touring advise based on your interests.
transit: Many of our guests have been using Uber or Lyft to get around. There is an Enterprise car rental in walking distance (save the airport tax!).   You can get downtown in 15 minutes or so without getting on the highway. We are 20 - 25 minutes from PDX airport and no highway travel is needed.  There are many driving routes to our location. Car2Go and ZipCar is  also in the area. We are served by three bus routes - 75, 44 and 35. 35 will get you all the way downtown in about 30 minutes. Also, there is a newly launched bike share program: Biketown PDX

description: Entire home rental for Sylvan Highlands view property.  Scenic outdoor spaces and tastefully furnished interior.  Ample parking, 5 min. to downtown and close to public transportation.  Enjoy Portland in style!  See details below. ASTR # on request Modern house at the top of the hill on a quiet street and with a picturesque view.  Very close-in to downtown, ample parking, and beautiful common spaces.  There is a washer-dryer that guests are welcome to use, as well as an electric piano, record player, and games for those interested.  The house has a functioning wood-burning indoor fireplace. We also have an outdoor fire-pit for those wishing to have a camping-esque experience.  We have recently split up our listings for renting the entire house vs just a private floor in the home.  Happy to provide a link to our other listing for additional 5 star reviews from prior renters. The house is equipped with WiFi, and TV with a Chromecast.  There is no cable or antenna TV. Guests have access to
neighborhood_overview: Plentiful nearby walking and hiking trails, grocery stores and restaurants.  Please inquire with hosts for details.

name: In the Heart of vibrant SE Portland
description: Happy hosts, whimsical home, comfortable bed, vibrant garden, user friendly kitchen, claw foot tub, cozy quiet room, in the heart of the funky inner SE Portland.   Tons of restaurants, bars and shops all in walking distance.  Close to downtown too.   Lots of free on-street parking.  Brand new kitchen and AC.  We provide coffee and tea - but not breakfast.  You're welcome to use the kitchen. Enjoy a comfortable stay in our whimsical 1910  Craftsman Style four-square.  Your room sleeps 2 in a queen size bed with luxurious sheets and pillows.  We provide towels, bathrobes, reading light, clock-radio with iPod dock, wifi, room fan and AC, hairdryer, complimentary tea and coffee.  The house is pet-free so no problem for cat or dog allergic guests. The queen sized bed has a futon mattress that is topped with a feather bed liner.   Most people have found it to be very comfortable and you will find comments about its comfort in the reviews but one guest felt it important that we point out that
neighborhood_overview: Inner SE Portland is a vibrant eclectic community filled with coffee shops, movie theaters, swanky hipster clothes, dive bars, amazing bakeries, tons of vintage and second hand shops, bike riders, pool halls and some of the best restaurants in the city.  Our home is located within walking distance to it all, 3 blocks from Division St, and 6 blocks from Hawthorne Blvd. Favorite restaurants - by proximity - all within easy walking distance Our Walking Distance Favorite Eating Places Southeast Wine Collective - (on 35th - just 50 feet north of Division).  This is a working winery where 10 winemakers share the facilities to craft artisan wines.   The place is small and intimate and the food is simply amazing.   It's a wide range of smaller plates.   After you've eaten, take a look at the kitchen and say Hi to the chef who turns out miracles from a teeny tiny "kitchen".    Bollywood theater.  On Division at 30th.   Indian street food that's unlike a typical Indian restaurant.  If you like p
transit: The closest bus stop is 4 blocks away, and will get you downtown in less than 15 min.  From there you have access to the MAX light rail, the street car and most other bus lines.  You can get to our home from the airport by taxi - about $40 in 20 minutes, by Uber - about $30 or by public transportation (light rail and bus) for $2.50 (it takes about an hour by public transportation including a four block walk).

name: Modern Ranch close to everything
description: Our ranch house is well designed and decorated, net zero (produces all its own electricity) and close to great neighborhoods and Portland itself. Great 1300 SF house on corner lot. It has 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and the master suite and one kids room are available for guests. Laundry room with high efficiency washer and dryer. Recently updated bathrooms and brand new kitchen. Wood floors.  We pride ourselves on being as eco friendly as possible.  We have 28 solar panels on our roof that provide all electricity for the house.  We also have a ductless heat pump and air-conditioning system that are super efficient.   Modern Ranch is close to everything.  3 miles from downtown.  A half mile from I-5. Three blocks from yellow line Max (light rail system) which will take you anywhere in the city. Easy walk to supermarkets, coffee shops and brewpubs.  Within a mile of 7 parks including gorgeous Overlook and Peninsula parks and the Skidmore bluffs.  House in on a major N/S bike boulevard an
neighborhood_overview: Our house is within 2 miles of the fantastic north and north east neighborhoods of Williams, Mississippi and Alberta.  There are dozens of restaurants and coffee shops within walking distance and I leave a list of our local favorites in the house.
transit: We rent our Tesla Model 3 on Turo, and it may be available for use during your stay.  Contact us for more details.  We are four blocks from the MAX yellow line train and 3 blocks from a bus line.  Bike sharing stations are 2 blocks away.  Car sharing services like car2go, Reach now and Get Around are also located in the neighborhood.  Street parking is always plentiful.  We are 3 miles from downtown.

name: Portland Pearl Penthouse
description: Welcome to the Pearl district, Portland's freshest neighborhood. This central location has many restaurants/bars, shops and art galleries within a few blocks of where you will be staying. This condo gives you a view of the Willamette River to the east and a view of downtown Portland looking south. This rental includes parking in the garage as well as transportation from the PDX airport. Master bedroom allows you to wake up to water view with a master bath and closet attached to the room for privacy. The second bedroom offers  a view of Portland's skyscrapers and has a walk-in closet with the bathroom located just down the hall. Pull-out sofa comfortably sleeps two with extra blankets and pillows provided. I am available 24/7 to answer any questions or help make additional accommodations.  If you need to rent a vehicle during you stay, I have a few affordable options. Multiple parks are within a block walking distance, including a dog park with a river view. Safeway grocery store is thr
neighborhood_overview: Multiple parks are within a block walking distance, including a dog park with a river view. Safeway grocery store is three blocks with many options for coffee along the way.  Portland is 420friendly so feel free to stop at Oregon's Finest and enjoy some medication as you soak in this progressive city.
transit: Portland has great public transportation, the StreetCar stop is a block away and Nike rental bikes are just out front of the building (I have one bike that is included in the rental).

Your private room has a very comfortable queen bed, a spacious, clean bathroom is clean, and easy Airport access and minutes to most favorite Portland spots to see/experience: Relax in a beautiful newly remodeled 1961 Ranch home during your stay in Portland. Your private room has a very comfortable queen bed, wifi, iron and board and you can see Portland's Rocky Butte lit up at night right outside your window. The new comfort firm mattress is designed for back and side sleepers. Then it has a nice 2”gel foam topper for a very comfortable sleep. The spacious bathroom is clean, bright and equipped with basic toiletries and a hair dryer. This is a bonus for those who love small, sweet, friendly dogs because it's equipped with a couple of those too. This location is close to lots of family friendly restaurants and shopping including those, like me who like to hit the thrift stores. It is easy Airport access and minute

name: Cozy and Clean Private Guest Suite in Brooklyn
description: Enjoy Portland through our cozy and convenient guest suite in our beautiful home built in 1900. Located right in the heart of the hip and upcoming Brooklyn neighborhood, this abode is the perfect stop for the casual traveler and makes a great home-base for longer term renters. Our home is close to public transit and great spots to experience the delicious food and drinks Portland has to offer. Comfortable and clean, enjoy the two upstairs bedrooms of our house, each with King beds as well as workspaces. A kitchenette is also included with a microwave, mini-fridge, and electric kettle. You have access to the guest suite which includes the two upstairs bedrooms, Jack and Jill bathroom, and kitchenette. We live in the main unit so you may hear us from time to time; however, we try our best to keep quiet. We do go to work/school during the week so try to have quiet time at a reasonable hour. On the weekends, we are more flexible due to our schedules. We are available and responsive as we l
neighborhood_overview: Brooklyn is a very quaint and picturesque neighborhood. In fact, it is a historical area since it is one of the first neighborhoods in all of Portland.  In the 1960's, Brooklyn was a bit down and out but it had a total turnaround in the 1980's and now is a very desirable place to live. Brooklyn has its own very distinctive shopping, dining, entertainment and nightlife. One of the best theatres in the whole city is The Aladdin Theatre, which is right in Brooklyn and has been open since the 1920s.
transit: We are about 25 minutes from the airport and around 10 minutes from downtown Portland. We are a couple blocks from the Max orange line and a block from frequented bus stops. If you decide to bring a car,  there is free parking on the street behind the house. One hour parking is also available in front of the house and is only enforced Monday through Saturday, 8am-6pm.

This is my house that I live in and work in full-time and it’s best for those who have activities planned during the day.  All spaces are shared except for your private room. I’m always just a message (or shout) away if you need anything! It’s a very sweet old style Portland neighborhood, but close to all the new cool stuff! There’s a little mini market down the street if you need to stock up on drinks and snacks. We are ~15 minutes from downtown Portland if driving, (a Lyft to downtown is between $16-$25 depending what time of day) and right near the fun Woodstock neighborhood that has tons of food and bars! name: Private Room with Queen Size Bed in NE Portland
description: Private bedroom in a 3 bedroom house. Room has a queen size bed and a closet. I keep the room clean. Sheets, blankets and towels provided. You will have access to the living room, kitchen and bathroom which are shared spaces. WiFi. 420 friendly, we just ask you smoke outside. It’s a safe, comfortable, quiet place. Located in north east Portland at 64th and Going St. It’s nothing super fancy but we love our home and we hope you do too! Guests have access to a private bedroom, the living room, the kitchen and the bathroom. You can park next to the house. You may or may not run into me (Kelly) or my boyfriend Rick during your stay. We are out a good amount and when we are home we tend to hang out in our own private living space. But you may see us in the kitchen at some point. We are friendly :) Your keys will be located in a lockbox for your convenience so you won’t need to schedule a time to meet us to pick up or drop off the keys. We like to give guests privacy. If you have any questio
neighborhood_overview: Residential neighborhood.  Pretty convenient location.  About 12 mins to the the airport, 9 mins to the Alberta Arts District, 14 mins to Mississippi Ave, 17 mins to downtown, 27 mins to the Columbia River Gorge, Etc.  In walking distance to grocery store, convenience store, drug store, gas station, a few restaurants/food carts and more. We are not located in the most posh part of town but it’s where your average Portlander resides.
transit: If you have a car you can park right next to the house. If not you will have no problem catching an Uber or Lyft. Also a very short walk to the bus stop.

name: **LAURELHURST,  HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS, CLOSE IN
description: HISTORIC LAURELHURST!! 3 BLOCKS TO MAX &TRADER JOE'S When you arrive, you will greeted with a quiet atmosphere of privacy and relaxation. On the first floor of our three story house, brand new, two-bedroom apartment, with private entrance and patio.   Your comfort is of the upmost importance and to ensure your comfort, the apartment is replete with high end finishes of stainless steel appliances, granite counters, luxe towels, and soft, comfortable bedding wrapped up in classic modern interior. THE SPACE Just 3 blocks from the Max line, public transportation and freeway on ramps,   our guest house sits on a quiet tree-lined street. The 850 sq ft dwelling is roomy enough for a family of five and is outfitted with everything you will need for your Portland stay of two days or any length of time. When you arrive at our historic bungalow, there is ample parking on the street and the driveway is also available. The entrance is at the end of our driveway. Walk through your private furnished
neighborhood_overview: Lisa and Frank’s house is located in the neighborhood of Laurelhurst in N.E. Portland, Oregon in the United States. Laurelhurst is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Portland. It is a uniquely designed neighborhood centered around 26 acre Laurelhurst park. It’s streets are punctuated with hundred year old elm trees. Many of the homes in this neighborhood were built in the early 1900’s. Our was built in 1913 and is a craftsman style bungalow. This neighborhood, with it’s beautiful streets is made for walking and taking in nature within an urban setting. It is a jewel in the middle of the city.
transit: Our home is conveniently located in NE Portland, within four blocks of the Hollywood Max station. The Max lines are: red, blue and green train lines: connect to the airport, downtown, the zoo, convention center, Moda center, Expo Center Station as well as the 12, 19, 20 bus lines. We’re also close the the freeways and Uber and Lyft are always available. Downtown Portland is a short 2.5 miles away.

No one will have access to your personal code except the host.  Please be sure to keep garage closed at all times for security. Parking is available in the driveway.   Also, inside the garage to the right is off limits. We really want our guest to thoroughly enjoy the property! Therefore, guest have complete access to the lower level of the split level home. name: Fully Furnished Hip 2 Bedroom Basement Apartment
description: This well lit, 2 bedroom basement apartment is perfect for 1-4 people. Each bedroom has a Queen sized bed. The full kitchen is well equipped and the full sized stacked, front loading washer and drier are quiet & convenient. Located in the Piedmont neighborhood of North Portland only minutes away from many restaurants, pubs, breweries and bars, it is also a close walk or bike ride to Legacy Emanuel Medical Center and Randall Children's Hospital making this a popular choice for locum tenens. Located on one of Portland's hottest and desirable neighborhoods, this very quiet basement apartment provides a delightful launchpad for your stay in Portland. Much care was taken to soundproof the space between the upper home and the basement apartment. Uber rides to the Portland airport (PDX) are always less than $20 from here even in heavy traffic. A bike ride from here of 10 minutes or less will have you at Portland's best restaurants including OX, Pok Pok Noi, Tasty and Son's, Pine State Biscuit
neighborhood_overview: The Piedmont neighborhood is the ideal urban village, boasting easy access to other popular Portland neighborhoods such as Humboldt, Alberta, Arbor Lodge, Boise, Eliot and Kenton, just to name a few. While Piedmont may be farther north than other Portland neighborhoods, the area runs alongside the Max light rail train, allowing for a convenient commuting to downtown Portland, and acting as a launching point for full access to all that the city has to offer it's residents.  With a residential focus, the Piedmont area is community conscious. Unlike other rapidly evolving neighborhoods in Portland, Piedmont remains an old-time neighborhood filled with young families, singles, and long-established locals who celebrate their area with block parties and neighborhood association initiatives. An isolated pocket of neighborhood charm, there can be no doubt that Piedmont is a great place to live.
transit: It is a 4 minute walk to the TriMet bus stop for bus 75 Cesar Chavez/Lombard which runs every 15 minutes on most days. The $5 All Day fare will allow you to transfer to any of the Max Lightrail trains, TriMet buses, Portland Streetcars, and C-Tran buses which serve Vancouver, Washington.  A brisk 15 minute walk will take you to the N Lombard Transit Center where you can board the Max Yellow Line which will take you directly downtown in a train ride of about 10 minutes.

name: Portland 2 Queen Bed 420 Private Suite w/ Bathroom
description: 420 friendly,  LGBTQ+ friendly, large lower level basement suite with private bathroom, separate entrance, wifi, fridge, stocked Keurig. Enjoy private entry thru the garage, a shared fenced backyard area, and dedicated parking under carport.  Walking distance to Powell Butte Nature Park, marijuana / cannabis dispensaries and a large grocery store.  Located (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) minute from the airport, (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) minute drive from downtown, 1 hour drive from Mt. Hood, and ~2 hours to from coastal beaches. We offer a quiet, spacious and private lower unit suite nestled in an underrated and low-key neighborhood in SE Portland.   We are 420 friendly, meaning that some of us do smoke weed inside the house. It is legal here in Portland, and there are many dispensaries located within walking distance. *The Goodies:* The suite itself is stocked with everything you will need for a short stay, including wifi, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, and a Nintendo loaded with 600 r
neighborhood_overview: Our guest suite is located in our low-key South East Portland neighborhood, and offers a little bit of night life close by, and more entertainment and activities out west towards the city. We recommend either having a car or taking the bus, there is not much happening within walking distance. If you are visiting during the spring or summer, I recommend taking a short drive (or about 15 minute walk) to the foot trails at Powell Butte Nature Park, where you can hike or bike over 600 acres of an extinct cinder cone volcano. A few minutes drive north-west, is Mt Tabor, another extinct volcano, nestled in a cute area of town. Make sure to visit the Montavilla, Belmont or Hawthorne neighborhoods for some food and shopping in that area.
transit: 5 min walk to Bus #9 headed East and West on Powell. You can take that bus East towards Gresham, or West all the way to Portland Downtown. Please note that we live in a quieter, more rural area outside of the close in city life.

description: Newly refinished 1,000 sq. foot basement flat with natural light and clean living space.  Guest suite includes modern living space with an attached bedroom, a private bathroom, and a private entrance with an enclosed back yard and covered patio. Driveway parking may be available as well as adequate street parking. We look forward to having you! Guests are not obligated to interact with me or my well behaved black lab Bernie, but if you'd like to meet either of us just say so! To the south of my home you will find Powell Blvd. with easy access to the freeway, grocery stores, laundromats, and area restaurants.

description: If you want to experience Downtown Portland & live in a spacious house with a backyard to sit out in too, this is it! You're a hop & a skip from local transport or you can easily walk to anywhere within the city center. A charming newly remodeled, fully furnished Townhouse in the heart of downtown Portland.  Only one block away from public transport & the Light rail system which will bring you in all the way from the airport to our door!  Within a short walk from the Willamette River front promenades, Parks, children's playground, Theaters, shops, Restaurants, Cafes & the largest Farmer's Market in the West! The home is equipped with air conditioning / Heating, High speed Internet & Cable T.V.   It has a key-less entry. It has a spacious kitchen- because everyone likes to hang- out there, with an eating area & a view of the lush backyard. There is a large formal dining room which seats eight as well as a very comfortable living room. A laundry room equipped with Washer, Dryer, Iron & s
neighborhood_overview: We are in a vibrant, ever changing & improving section of the Downtown where the  Portland State university has its campus as well as an excellent year round Saturday Farmers market. There are a number of great restaurants, bars & cafes within a 5 min walk. Portland's famous food carts are one street away!
transit: If you are not bringing a car the best & least expensive option to get to the house from the Airport is The MAX (light rail system) which brings you all the way from the airport to the House with one simple change.If you prefer a private Shuttle service I would recommend: USA Airport Shuttle . The are car rental options are endless! for just the day or an hour you can rent a Zipcar or car2go or the luxury version "ReachNow".

name: Urban Sanctuary Home Guest Room
description: This cozy guest space is part of a thriving Urban Sanctuary Home, located on our top story with beautiful western exposure   and a view of old growth fir trees and the sunset. The bed is a full sized memory foam mattress dressed in quality bedding in calm neuteral colors and warmth all around. This home has clawfoot tubs, hardwood floors, organic fiber area rugs, clean energy appliances, new heating system with HEPPA filtration, and best of all, a healthy considerate human as your host :) The back garden is home to a number of old growth trees and the birdsong that comes with that, a great place to take your morning cup of coffee or tea. Guests have high speed internet access and and workspace available in common areas on the main floor. Laundry services available upon request. We are an eco-conscious household and use environmentally friendly soaps, cleaning products and detergents. You can always expect a warm welcome, a clean space, organic beauty and good vibes here.. When we are n
neighborhood_overview: The Mt. Tabor / Upper Hawthorne Neighborhood is a beautiful mix of Old Southeast Portland style and the emergent culture happening in this city. It is a close walk from the house to your pick of great food, drinks, coffee, tea, yoga, Trimet (public transit), and of course, glorious Mt. Tabor Park -- a highly recommended destination while you're here!  It is an ideal spot for travelers flying into Portland who would like to keep their footprint small -- a quick hop, skip and jump to the airport or downtown on Trimet and is also located off a major bike route. Close-in to entertainment venues and natural spaces, great shopping and the heart of Portland City Center. While nestled in the heart of a safe neighborhood and friendly community. We love this neighborhood and know you will too!
transit: You can walk a block in either direction to catch a bus to transfer to the max  and go anywhere Portland's remittable public transit goes. You can plan your trips on Trimet's (Email hidden by Airbnb) and download their app while you're in town for smooth getting around. For the drivers out there, we are located close-in Southeast Portland, a 7 minute drive to get downtown  or catch the I-5 if you head west on Hawthorne Blvd. or Division St. (the two major streets the property sits between), or go east to catch the 205 and trek out into the beautiful rural and forested areas supporting the city. We are also located on a major bike route that makes for easy walking and biking all around Portland. We've helped out and have lots of local maps and guides on hand  in your space.

name: Retreat feel w/ wood burning sauna and large yard
description: Recently remodeled 1950's bungalow in emerging foster-powell neighborhood. All hardwood flooring, natural light and working fireplace. Fully fenced backyard and bright living space. House is ideal for multiple couples, business trips or a family visiting Portland.  Amazing authentic international foods walking distance from my home, bars, breakfast spots, library and parks. House includes ample living space with open concept and large outdoor living space set up for easy entertaining. Kitchen includes high end gas range and double dishwasher. Two large bedrooms with bathrooms in addition to a small office space.   Booster seat and other child amenities available by request.  Large backyard with sauna, mature fruit bushes, garden beds (help yourself) and dining area. I have many house plants in my home.  This space is authentic Portland so please keep in mind: no cable TV, no central air but with window AC units, curbside recyling and compost. Please let me know if you would like to use
neighborhood_overview: Foster powell neighborhood is 15-20 minutes from the westside city center and a short walk to restaurants and bars including best dim sum in Portland and the mercado food carts. Within 1.5 miles of Mt. tabor park with dog park, Powell butte walking trails and easy access to freeway for day trips to Hood River or Mt Hood (within an hour).  Essex park with tennis courts and children play area with fountain is .4 miles away.
transit: Trimet bus stop is within 1 block with direct route to city center bus #17.  Bike route is 4 blocks away. The interstate 84 is a few miles away with an entrance to the 205 within a mile.  Quick freeway access provides quick get away to Multnoamh falls, Hood River, Mt hood and other great scenic parts of Oregon.

name: Master bedroom with private bathroom
description: The master bedroom is private and spacious with an excellent shower. It has an overhead fan and blackout curtains. The WiFi extender at the top of the stairs provides fast internet in the entirety of the room. The neighborhood is quiet and the house’s modern construction makes it a very peaceful place to rest. The common areas are nice and well equipped, ceilings are high, seating is comfortable. Indoor and outdoor seating for dining in. House is accessed via a keypad on the front door, garage can be accessed also via an outdoor keypad. House is on the N Portland peninsula. It’s close to Adidas and all the industrial areas on swan island. It’s a quick drive over Germantown Rd to Intel and Nike. St Johns is the nearest major commercial zone with a few excellent breweries in addition to great grocery stores and other food carts. Downtown Portland is a quick drive and easily accessible by public transit. There is plenty of street parking in front of the house. Public transit services the
neighborhood_overview: House is on the N Portland peninsula. It’s close to Adidas and all the industrial areas on swan island. It’s a quick drive over Germantown Rd to Intel and Nike. St Johns is the nearest major commercial zone with a few excellent breweries in addition to great grocery stores and other food carts. Downtown Portland is a quick drive and easily accessible by public transit.
transit: There is plenty of street parking in front of the house. Public transit services the area well. Car2Go offers several short term rental vehicles in the area. Uber and Lyft and readily available 24/7.
