name: Cute and Comfy Lower Suite in amazing Location!
description: Unwind and enjoy Portland in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite! We're located in one of the most livable neighborhoods in Portland, with many amazing food & beverage options within walking distance, and easy access to the rest of our fine city. You're also free to relax in our back yard, which has seating and raised flower beds. We live in the main unit of the property and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city! We're here to help. Enter through your own private entrance at the back of our house. Suite includes two clean bedrooms, a private bathroom, and a main area with sleeper sofa and small fridge. There a basic kitchenette in the laundry room, and there is also a small office space. PLEASE NOTE: our suite is the refurbished basement of a hundred-year-old single-family home. You are likely to hear us going about our lives above you, and we'll almost definitely hear you below us. We respectfully ask that guests honor "quiet time"
neighborhood_overview: We are located in one of the most livable and delicious neighborhoods in Portland. Within five blocks you'll have access to several coffee shops, top-notch restaurants (Spanish, Mexican, Ethiopian, Vegetarian, American, etc. ), food carts, quaint bars, and cannabis shops.  Slightly further afield (ten blocks+) is one of the most popular stretches of restaurants and bars in Portland (including Pok Pok, Bollywood Theater, Salt & Straw, Ava Gene's, Atlas Pizza, Sessionable, etc.) We're also quite close to Mt. Tabor park, a beautiful natural oasis in the heart of Southeast Portland.
transit: There is a bus line running on Division Street, into downtown Portland, with a bus stop one block from our house.

name: SW Portland 10 min to downtown,  OHSU, 2 min to LO
description: Entire lower level of 3 story house.  2 minutes to Lewis & Clark college, Tryon State park & Lake Oswego. 10 minutes to OHSU, downtown, South waterfront &  river.  2 bedrooms w/ walk in closets.  One full bath w/ two sinks, Tub/shower & Toilet.  Kitchenette, & largeTV room w/ surround sound. Great central location 1 hour to Mt. Hood, 2 hours to the coast. Seprate entrance to unit.  Washer & Dryer.  1 parking space in driveway w/ additional on street. Owner lives on site in separate living space. Owner lives upstairs and respects your privacy but is also available if you have questions.  You have private entry, patio and access to your own washer and dryer. This is a 3 story house.  Guest suite includes entire lower level.  Entry is on far end of house away from driveway, follow cobblestone path under deck to patio. We are close to everything! 10 minutes to east side, downtown, waterfront & more. Uber/Lyft arrive within 5-10 minutes after contact.  We are about 25 minutes from Airport.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood in the heart of SW Portand.  Walk to Tryon Creek  State park for a stroll or hike,  Lewis & Clark college and law school. Many summer activities nearby including outdoor concerts. Drive to Columbia Gorge, Coast, Mt Hood and much more within 90 minutes.
transit: The neighborhood is lovely to walk in.  State park is lovely to hike in.  Restaurants, coffee shops and shopping require a car.

name: Eco-gorgeous apartment in North Portland
description: This apartment is beautiful, well designed, eco-friendly and close to everything.  Completely private unit with a separate entrance and self check in.  Full kitchen with dishwasher, range and microwave.  Washer/dryer as well.  Radiant floor heating for the winter.  Private patio out front with tables and chairs.  The house is also net zero- producing on site all the energy it uses.  Come get a taste for Portland where beauty, functionality and sustainability come together. We designed and built the 400 square foot apartment in 2012 and poured our hearts into it. It is well designed with modern comfort and amenities that provides a quintessentially Portland perfect place to stay during your visit.  It was even featured on the Apartment Therapy blog: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  You can minimize your environmental footprint while staying in this net zero energy space complete with solar panels, natural materials, and products, and get around town by bike or scooter rentals, light rail, or
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood (Overlook) is the best of all worlds.  It is located three miles from downtown and a mile from the thriving neighborhoods of Mississippi, Alberta and Williams. It is also quiet, peaceful and residential.  We are walking distance from coffee shops, restaurants, bars and parks as well as Portland's regional light rail system that can take you downtown or to the airport.
transit: We rent our Tesla Model 3 on Turo, and it may be available for use during your stay.  Contact us for more details.  We are four blocks from the MAX yellow line train and 3 blocks from a bus line.  Bike sharing stations are 2 blocks away.  Car sharing services like car2go, Reach now and Get Around are also located in the neighborhood.  Street parking is always plentiful.  We are 3 miles from downtown.

name: Hawthorne Laurel Leaf Retreat
description: If you're new to Portland or have lived here like my wife and I have for nearly 30 years you'll love our recently updated and historic 100 year old house in the heart of some of Portland's best nightlife and restaurants.   Park up to 4 cars securely behind the house then toss your keys.  You'll walk or bicycle everywhere. Permit (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) HO Portland is truly a green city and so is our house.  Out front and along the entire north property line is a mature 15' high Laurel Hedge which makes this urban setting seem secluded.   In the back be sure to check out our Ginkgo tree.  They're a Japanese symbol of longevity as some live to be over (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) years old.  We guess ours is over 50. We either meet you at the house and welcome you or have a keypad and will send you the code. You may have noticed earlier reviews referencing Calvin, a house manager also living in the house in a separate daylight basement.  Unfortunately, we had to evict him.   A
neighborhood_overview: 2 Major Parks: 10 min walk to Laurelhurst Park with a beautiful pond 20 min walk to Mt. Tabor Park with a beautiful view of the city Grocery Stores: Fred Meyer 1 block away New Seasons 4 blocks away Night Club: Hawthorne Theater 1 block away Movies: Bagdad theater 3 blocks away Banks: Chase is across the street Bank of America 2 blocks away Wells Fargo 1 1/2 blocks away Restaurants: Too many to list Shopping: Too many to list After you get bored of Hawthorne walk down to Division for a second helping of everything.
transit: If you're flying into town and staying at our house you don't need to rent a car.  Take MAX (public transportation) right to our house.  There's literally a bus stop right across the street and its a 20-30 minute trip.  You'll first take the Red Line train then transfer to bus #75.  Its faster than driving.  We often park our car at the house then take MAX and save on parking fees.

name: Whole House at Green Acres
description: My place is close to Downtown Portland, Oregon Zoo, and all of Portland. You’ll love my place because of the views, the location, the ambiance, and the people. My place is good for couples, business travelers, families (with kids), big groups, and furry friends (pets). Very quite neighborhood, but only 10 minutes to downtown. Washer, dryer, full stocked kitchen, a great outdoor space, and free sunsets! I might be gone when the house is rented. Great area to walk around and close to one of the largest parks in Portland and rec center with a pool. You can catch a bus 4 blocks away that takes you to downtown in 15 minutes Part of the cleaning fee is refundable if the house is left reasonably clean.  dishes cleaned, stove clean,  no plates or glasses laying around.   Please use coasters on the furniture.
neighborhood_overview: Great area to walk around and close to one of the largest parks in Portland and rec center with a pool.

name: 1-Bed Condo on Streetcar: Walk Score of 100!
description: Welcome to The Nob Hill Condo, named for its location in one of Portland's most walkable and transit-friendly neighborhoods, Nob Hill! This fully remodeled, one-bedroom condo, which sits just steps away from hundreds of eateries, pubs, breweries and shops, as well as across the street from the Portland Streetcar--which will whisk you to The Pearl, Downtown and PSU within minutes--is perfect for single adventurers and traveling couples alike. Allow us to welcome you to your Portland adventure! We can't wait to welcome you to the Nob Hill Condo, a fully renovated one-bedroom condo with a walk score of 100! Located in the most coveted district of the city, within walking distance to both Downtown and The Pearl, and sitting directly across the street from the North-South Streetcar Line, this adorable flat is all about one thing: Convenience. This condo has been lovingly designed with the most particular traveler in mind, and has been outfitted with a top-of-the-line mattress, 100% cotton s
neighborhood_overview: The Nob Hill/23rd Street area is easily Portland's most popular district, with its bevy of art galleries, high-end restaurants, breweries, local shops, and cafes, as well as its proximity to the Timbers Stadium, Downtown, and the Pearl District. The Walk Score of this house is 100 and there is nothing you can't walk to, such as:  • Timbers Stadium • Besaw • Koi Fusion • Portland Japanese Garden (yes, the famous one!) • McMenamins Mission Theater • Fish Sauce  • 23 Hoyt  • Trader Joe's  • Whole Foods • Commodore Grocery • Gallery 114 • Oregon Jewish Museum • Living Room Theaters  • Rogue Public House ...and too many more to list!
transit: - This condo is conveniently located directly in front of the North/South streetcar line, which will take you to The Pearl, Downtown, PSU and more! - There is no dedicated parking for this flat. We recommend bringing comfy shoes! - There is a pay-for-parking lot on the ground level; the phone number posted will instruct you on how to purchase a pass.  RAIL LINES:  Portland Streetcar - NS Line - 0.0 mi Portland Streetcar - B Loop - 0.2 mi Portland Streetcar - A Loop - 0.3 mi Bus lines: 77 Broadway/Halsey - 0.2 mi 15 Belmont/NW 23rd - 0.4 mi

name: Stunning home on NW 23rd - Walk score 97!
description: This 2 bedroom /2.5 bath beautiful home is in an unbeatable location for staying in Portland!  Walk score of 97. Just steps from trendy shops, tons of restaurants, 3 grocery stores, and parks. 10 minute walk to the MAX train stop and 1/2 block to a bus stop that goes downtown. The home is full of light and has 1 off-street parking space, patio, and a grill! Please note there are steps up to the front door and 2 flights of stairs in the house. The house is 3 stories. The 1st and 3rd floors each have 1 bedroom + 1 full bath. The 2nd floor is the kitchen, living room, and 1/2 bath. 1 available off-street parking space is on the driveway. We are family friendly and can provide 2 baby gates and a pack n play upon request. Easy self check-in, but I am available by text, phone, or email. NW 23rd is one of the most desirable areas in Portland!  Ken's Bakery is 2 blocks away. Salt and Straw ice cream is 5 blocks away. Barista coffee shop and Blue Star Donuts are 6 blocks away. Trader Joe's is 3
neighborhood_overview: NW 23rd is one of the most desirable areas in Portland!  Ken's Bakery is 2 blocks away. Salt and Straw ice cream is 5 blocks away. Barista coffee shop and Blue Star Donuts are 6 blocks away. Trader Joe's is 3 blocks away. Restaurants and shops line the neighborhood!
transit: A bus that goes through downtown is 1/2 a block away. Both the Portland Streetcar and the Max train are about a 10 minute walk.

name: Completely Private NE PDX Tiny Room + Private Bath
description: Close to the airport in the heart of Ne PDX! This tiny room + private bath has everything you need. Located off a shared mudroom in our completely renovated (light and bright!) basement, this space features a private coded lock entry, a small entry hallway and a murphy bed / desk combo with basic shelving / storage. A mini fridge is available for your use in the mudroom. Due to noise transfer between adjacent units, this listing is for people who don't mind noise and are not light sleepers. This space is the perfect option for the budget conscious traveler. This room is not an appropriate choice if you are very tall (see bed length) or are a light sleeper (see information about noise transfer). Close to both the airport and all that northeast Portland has to offer, this room is accessed through a coded guest entrance. Upon entry, you will go down a stairwell to a shared mudroom. The door to access your private room + bathroom is coded as well to ensure safety. Please note that the Murp
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is the perfect mix of Portland. A quick 5-10 minute walk in almost any direction takes you to restaurants, bars, shopping, park, etc. and yet we are on a quiet, family oriented street. Our double lot has allowed us to create a back yard oasis with and urban backdrop and that is something that our guests seem to appreciate. Main highlights in the neighborhood include: McMenamins Kennedy School for movies, a soak in the pool + drinking/eating, Alberta Main Street, the bars and restaurants at 30th and Killingsworth including noteworthies Beast, Dame, and Expatriate, and the bars and restaurants at 15the and Killingsworth including Le Tac, La Sudra, and Podnah's Pit BBQ.
transit: Our neighborhood is best seen on foot or by bike. If you want to travel to other parts of the city, we are only 1 block away from Trimet bus stops that can take you almost anywhere in the city. We are also a short 10 minute drive to the major highways running through Portland, or you can take the bus &/or drive 10 minutes to the nearest Max (Portland's light rail) stop, which will take you most anywhere you want to go in Portland.

name: Yellow Door / Heart of NW District /  Free Parking
description: NW PORTLAND/NOB HILL/ALPHABET DISTRICT. PRIVATE ENTRANCE AND FREE ONSITE PARKING.   Wonderfully appointed kitchen and beautifully lit and maintained comfortable and roomy space.  In the heart of Northwest Portland's most walkable neighborhood.  Prime location for tourists and visitors! We offer very fine bedding, cozy bathrobes, quality soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner.  We do our best to make sure your stay is as comfortable and as easy as possible by providing lots of extras including but not limited to usb ports, awesome utensils, cooking and dishware, maps of the area, welcome book with suggestions for local restaurants and businesses, magazines, and the two local weekly newspapers that list what's going on in the area. Back porch and grill are available for your use.  We allow smoking on that back porch. Will be available only at certain times of the year.  We like to travel and explore so we may be gone.  Ask in advance.  If we are around we'd love to see you and help you in
neighborhood_overview: The NorthWest Neighborhood/Alphabet District/Nob Hill is Portland's Prime shopping, eating, and walking neighborhood.  We are in the Heart of one of the Best city neighborhoods in the country!
transit: Bus and streetcar stops within steps.  15 Minute walk (at most) to downtown.  Bike rental 1 block away.  Nike Bikes hourly rentals and scooters all over the neighborhood.

name: Hot Tub Escape - Full Bed #1 SW Portland/Hillsdale
description: Private, quiet setting nestled amongst trees. 5 minutes to downtown. Close to Gabriel Park & Multnomah Village. Parking available. Private entrance. Available Mini fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee maker (you are welcomed to bring your own favorite K-pod), purified cold & hot water dispenser. Two (2) Adult persons to a room. We can take last minute bookings & late night check-ins, provided your AirBNB profile and requested credentials are complete. Just let us know when you will be arriving. This property is situated in a secluded location.  Our hot tub will relieve stress from a hard days work or your long travels.  Relax under the partial canopy of trees and open sky of stars. Please note that if this room is booked by you, there may be a possibility that another AirBNB Guest might book the #2 Room, which is also listed.  The only possibility that you will have the entire floor to your party is if you book "2 Rooms #1 & #2," which is its own separate listing. Or if there are "NO" rese
neighborhood_overview: This property is located next to Gabriel Park.  It is walking distance from the house.
transit: House is close to public transportation (Bus Line) #1, #45 & #64, which is located at Vermont Street. We have also had Guests use Uber & Lift here. A very popular option.

name: Studio Diodone
description: Our modern and fresh studio apartment is just clicks away from being your home away from home. The apartment is centrally located in the Alberta Arts District placing you near Williams Street, Mississippi Avenue, and the Lloyd district. Come enjoy some well deserved R&R in this NE Portland studio. The basement apartment has its own separate entrance in the back of the house via the alley for your privacy. We offer key-less entry with two keypads: one to open the door from the outside and one to open the door to your specific unit. The studio has one Tempurpedic queen bed and a pull out couch that turns into a second queen bed. Please be sure to let us know if you plan on using this second pull-out bed so that we can provide you with a second set of fresh linens. The studio has a full kitchen, including a dishwasher, a refrigerator, toaster oven, and a coffee maker. We live on the main floors of the home and will respect your privacy during your stay. However, we are a mere phone call a
neighborhood_overview: The studio is in the Alberta Arts district which is a highly sought after neighborhood. There are a lot of art galleries, live music options, and specialty restaurants in our barrio. (Hidden by Airbnb) is your friend!
transit: There is public transportation within walking distance from the home and you're also close to I-5 and I-84 (highways).  It's an easy 3.5 mile bike ride to downtown and you're only 7.5 miles away from PDX airport.  You will have private parking on site for one vehicle in the back of the home (off of the alley). This parking space in the back is shared with our work van and is also monitored by a security camera for your safety.

name: Historic Mississippi 2 Bedroom Home w/ Parking
description: This is a spacious and private home located just one block from the heart of Famous Mississippi St. where you can eat, drink & shop your heart away. We have space for the whole family to enjoy Portland! ♥  Dogs Welcome! This private and spacious 1908 house is a great space to be centrally located in the city, but be able to get away from it all and relax, too! Located in the heart of the Historic Mississippi District, and with a Walk Score of 90 and a Bike Score of 88, this is the perfect home to experience all the fun Portland has to offer. Take a quick stroll the Mississippi or Williams/Vancouver street to dine on some of Portland's world famous food and cocktails, or grab the nearby BikeTown bikes or MaxLight Rail to take a quick and easy trip to downtown. Did we mention we are pet-friendly, too? We are! HIGHLIGHTS: * Two levels of living space, as follows: * Main floor has Living Room, Kitchen, and bath * Upper floor has two bedrooms with full bath * Additional pull-out sofa in the
neighborhood_overview: Historic Mississippi St is the heart of NE Portland.  Bars, Breweries, Restaurants, Boutiques, Parks, and Events all within a short walk from the house.  There is great transit available to breakout and explore the rest of the city as well.
transit: -- Walk!  From the house, North and North East Portland is at your fingertips.  Nothing like walking to really be able to take in this beautiful city -- BikeTown Bike Rental.  One block from the house is a biketown bike rental stand.  Rent from an app, and have full access to the city -- Max Light Rail Train.  Four blocks from the house is a Max stop with easy access to any other neighborhood in Portland.

name: Spacious Victorian home close to City Center
description: Go back in time in this Victorian home in historical SW Portland. Minutes to downtown. Walk or bike to neighborhood coffee shops and the waterfront along the Willamette River. Take the aerial tram to OHSU and hiking trails.  This spacious home is perfect for guests coming to town for graduations, weddings, the Rose Festival or family reunions. Experience Portland's award winning restaurants or stay in and cook your own meals in the roomy, modern kitchen. Large playroom for the kids. Fenced yard. Parking for a small vehicle in the garage and one parking permit for on the street is provided. Parking permits are only required M-F 7:00 am - 6:00 pm. Please refer to House Book upon arrival for additional parking information if you are staying during the week. The house consists of three stories, plus a small garage on street level. Guests will have access to the entire home and garage parking. Main level consists of dining room, kitchen, two sitting areas, utility room and half bath. Downst
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, residential neighborhood interspersed with quaint coffee shops, pubs and grocery stores. Several parks less than five minutes away by car or bike. Beautiful walking and hiking trails nearby.
transit: Getting to the heart of the city is just minutes away by car or Uber. You can walk to the OHSU Tram and streetcar station, which runs every fifteen minutes to all parts of Portland. Several bus stops just blocks away.

name: Walkable New Private Suite+Hot Tub on Alberta Park
description: You have everything you need during your stay in this newly remodeled suite.  A large bedroom with a luxurious Queen bed, a walk in closet, eating area, reading nook, office corner.  Your own private Kitchen and Bathroom.  Two short blocks away from the bustling Alberta Arts walking street while still getting a quiet nights rest!  Across the street under 20 Acres a historic old growth forest Alberta Park. There is a new large therapeutic jetted hot tub to relax in (see specifics below for info) Your private oasis was just finished and newly reconstructed from a century old home.  We have created a bright, calm, and cozy place with wood accents, reading nook, eating area, kitchen, coffee and tea area, private bathroom, and luxurious Queen bed. The park across the street includes a basketball court, dog off-leash area, two playgrounds, soccer field, softball field and tennis court, as well as paved and unpaved paths and picnic tables. Your suite has a private entrance off the side our ho
neighborhood_overview: Your suite is nestled in a quiet neighborhood just two short blocks away from the bustling Alberta Arts walking street, Killingsworth, and near by Mississippi Street!  All these streets have the best culinary restaurants, coffee shops, tea houses, and boutiques that Portland has to offer.  Highlights include Concordia University,  Salt and Straw Famous Ice Cream, Great Notion Brewery, Blue Star Donuts, DOZENS of coffee shops/tea shops and breweries, McMenamins Kennedy School.  You will find hand painted murals all over the neighborhood. The area has very cool history engraved into the old streets of this very renovated hip area. Very open, friendly, and safe neighborhood to walk around for a stroll in the 20 acre park or hit the surrounding action.
transit: Really great walking/biking area, so be ready to explore the awesome Arts District... or just sit back and relax in your awesome suite. Public Transportation and Bike rentals just up the street.  10 minute drive to PDX International Airport 10 minute drive to Downtown Portland 20 minute bike ride to Downtown Portland 1 minute walk to Public Transportation

name: Grandpa's Bunkhouse-Backyard Studio
description: Backyard cabin. Vaulted ceiling. French doors open onto organic garden. Queen bed. Terra cotta shower w/ rain head & sky light. Kitchen,  WiFi, local TV. Safe neighborhood off Portland's major Sandy Blvd. **Pet guest fee is $75/pet/week for all cats and dogs, except pit bulls and dobermans, breeds we do not accept. We've dubbed our 360 sq ft backyard cottage Grandpa's Bunkhouse since it really was our grandfather's. Expect pride of ownership from 3 generations.   We have 2 studios here at The Johnson House, Grandpa's being our most private and spacious. If you are a more budget conscious traveler you might check out our daylight studio, Auntie's Hideaway. Either way, please see our reviews from 11 happy years hosting travelers.  Pet policy: We ask that guests do not leave pets unattended in the studio for extended periods of time. Generally guests take pets with them when they go out, although pets who are fully trained and do not bark may be left for brief periods. Please check with u
neighborhood_overview: Ours is a neighborhood just off Noodle Flat in NE Portland. Pho Van is around the corner where we in the neighborhood go, and Thien Hong is just blocks away and where Portland's Vietnamese community goes for pepper salted squid. Otto's Wood Fired Pizzeria is near by as well, and a real asset to our Rose Way District.  There is free street parking, room for 2 vehicles . Our neighborhood is friendly, and it's safe to walk about at night here.
transit: Sandy Boulevard, Portland's 4 lane diagonal artery, is 2 blocks away and gives guests 10 minute access to the airport, 20 minutes to downtown, and 15 minutes to several of Portland's unique neighborhood destinations.

name: Upstairs, studio with bath, fridge
description: I can speak a little Tagalog also not very much but I can comprehend .. I am offering my complete upstairs flat for you.  It has 2 bedrooms, a full bath and refrigerator.  Queen sized bed and TV in main bedroom with another common area that could function as a 2nd bedroom, furnished with a futon. You get my entire upstairs, though it does share a common entrance with the rest of my house.  There is a half sized refrigerator upstairs, though you are welcome to share my fully provisioned kitchen downstairs at any time. Free wireless internet.  Please inquire about weekly or monthly rates.  For that matter, I'm happy to discount stays of after 3 days or more. I cook a nice meal for all my longer term renters at least once a week - complimentary dinner.  Typically, though not always, this would be Filipino cuisine. Welcome skiers and snowboarders  also lots of rooms for your equipments to store and its only one hour to Mt. Hood ski resorts..Also easy access to metro, buses runs every 15 mi
neighborhood_overview: Very quite and have all excess on everything like a walking distance to groceries, buses, restaurants,
transit: Lots, buses and train

name: Mississippi Ave Apartment w/Bikes!
description: Beautifully furnished apartment just 2 blocks from Mississippi Ave, one of the hippest neighborhoods in Portland. Steps to ¿Por Que No?, Mississippi Studios, Stormbreaker & Ecliptic Breweries, Fresh Pot coffee, food carts & bakeries. Bikes included! Private one bedroom, one bathroom and living/dining room, bright and clean basement apartment with separate entrance from the upstairs house. Modern furniture, and a memory foam bed with a designer vintage postcard print Portland duvet. The CB2 couch in the living room can click back to convert to a double bed so there's room for two more adults. Fully equipped kitchen with an oven, fridge, microwave, electric kettle, coffee grinder, french press and an aero press. * Free 120Mbps+ WiFi * A library of guidebooks, Oregon history books, hiking books, maps, etc. * The backyard is available to use. There's a picnic table and a grill, and in the summer you can help yourself to the organic veggies in the garden. * Free bike borrowing included. I h
neighborhood_overview: Mississippi avenue is fantastic! It's blocks of great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, a music venue, breweries, taprooms, cute shops, and a weekly farmers market. It's a perfect example of what really makes Portland cool. It's also really close to downtown or SouthEast, if you want to explore other parts of town.
transit: The apartment is just off the Max and the #4 (and #6) bus lines. Only one transfer to the airport & a 12 min easy bike ride to downtown. Super close to the on-ramps for both the 5 and 405. Plenty of free street parking right out front.

name: The Atomic Ranch
description: My mid century modern Atomic Ranch home has a spacious layout, sun room, jacuzzi, and is furnished in original 1950's vintage style. It comfortably fits two and is centrally located in a quiet historic neighborhood, blocks from vibrant Alberta Arts & Mississippi neighborhoods and minutes to downtown. This impeccably clean space is allergen-free and newly renovated.  It has a retro kitchen, hard wood floors throughout, formal dining room, a fireplace, built ins, two bedrooms, one with comfy queen sized bed, and the other has a sofa bed that pulls out, free laundry on site, amazing sun room, and large back yard. Free wifi internet, no TV, bring your own laptop computer if you want screen time. As far as outdoor space, you have exclusive use of the back yard which has a fabulous sun room that flows to an outdoor gardeners paradise with a jacuzzi, walking pathways and covered patio.  The house is the upper unit of a duplex, and is completely separate with it's own secured entry. I will int
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in a safe, clean and friendly neighborhood, with free easy street parking right in front of the house. This 1949 vintage home was remodeled in 2009 with a focus on sustainability and historic preservation. Energy efficiency upgrades include attic, floor, and exterior wall insulation for comfort, duct sealing, and converting from oil to gas heat, and installing a 95% efficient furnace.
transit: It is very well connected by bus and Max train to the airport and very walkable. By bike, you can be in downtown Portland in 15 minutes. The house is specifically set up to accommodate longer staying guests, international travelers, and especially those looking to relocate to Portland. Also available are relocation services like real estate market orientation, neighborhood home tours, and real estate sales.  I am willing to provide directions, recommendations and additional accommodations upon request. Email me the dates you are thinking about so I can confirm availability. Cheers, Daniel

name: Chic Modern Central - Inner Eastside Gem
description: Enjoy your stay in our tenderly accommodating, self sufficient modern home. Take pleasure in being just minutes away from everything you need, in the heart of South East Portland and the Clinton & Division St. neighborhood. Enjoy one of the best organic local markets, skip down to New Seasons, hop to Clinton corner and relax at Löyly sauna and get a massage. Countless trendy shops, great bars, award-winning restaurants, decadent coffee houses and more are all within walking distance. Spacious living room with dining table, couch and TV. Enjoy Apple TV with Amazon Prime, NetFlix, kids channels and "Pay on demand" via iTunes. Bedroom is a queen bed with soft rolling edges and comes with good closet and shelf space for all your clothes and belongings. Living room couch pulls out into an additional bed to sleep 1 or 2 guests. Topper provided to make your sleep comfortable. Kitchenette has toaster oven, microwave, french press, coffee maker machine, kettle, tea / coffee,  and everything you
neighborhood_overview: Take pleasure in being just minutes away from everything you need, in the heart of South East Portland and the Clinton & Division St. neighborhood. Just seconds way from one of the best organic local markets, a few blocks away from New Seasons, Clinton corner and relaxation at Löyly sauna and massage house. Stroll leisurely to countless trendy shops, great bars, award-winning restaurants, decadent coffee houses and more.
transit: Easily bike, bus, car commute to downtown in minutes over the bridges to downtown Portland and OHSU. From here you can easily get on the highway, walk to the tram, bike down green bike corridors, and rent your bike or electric scooter just a few blocks away with your smart phone. Easily access the best of SE by exploring Hawthorne & Belmont streets by foot, bus, car, or bicycle.

name: Desirable NE Alameda location! Garden Studio Apt
description: We are new to Hosting and looking forward to it! This is close in Northeast Portland. 15 minutes to Airport. 10 Minutes to downtown. Walk to shops, restaurants and grocery store. Safe neighborhood. Street parking is easy. Space is a studio apartment with a Queen bed and couch that converts to a bed. Guests have kitchen & bathroom in unit. Laundry available upon request. Co-Host lives upstairs. There may be a bit of noise from above.  We are available to give information or give you privacy. This is a Garden/In-Law Unit in the home of the co-host. If you need anything let us know and we can help! It is a basement apartment. A family and pets live upstairs so there may be some noise starting about 7:30 or 8 AM. During the week days it is pretty quiet during work/school hours.  Queen bed and pull out futon style couch. The couch is large enough for children but not really for 2 adults. There is enough space to put an air mattress on the floor if you would like to bring one. There are amen
neighborhood_overview: Walkable to shops, restaurants and grocery. Bus line nearby. Alberta Street is just to the North. Hollywood District just to the South. The neighborhood is very family friendly and safe. It is quiet but very close to many Portland hot spots. We love to walk everywhere!
transit: Easy parking on the street for cars. Bike parking in the garage upon request. Bus is just a few blocks away.

name: Arty Overlook Home
description: Sunny and spacious private Albina Victorian home in the central Overlook neighborhood. Full kitchen, living room, dining room, bathroom, two private bedrooms upstairs as well as an office that can act as a third bedroom with a floor mattress. Large private back yard. Great location! 5 min walk to Mississippi shops, carts and restaurants, or 15 min walk to Vancouver corridor, 2 blks to MAX line, 1 blk to Nike bike rental, just off the I-5 entrance (10 min drive to downtown). The house is a 1906 single family "Albina Victorian" home that is inhabited by its owner when not traveling. 1,427 sq feet large, sparse and clean, with lots of original artwork. There are two bedrooms and an upstairs office that can act as a third bedroom/private sleeping space (please specify if you want it set up). Downstairs there is a bathroom with tub/shower, dinning room, living room, kitchen with a breakfast nook that fills with sun in the mornings, as well as a private fenced in yard. Free street parking av
neighborhood_overview: The area is a nice mix of old and new Portland: tons of excellent food carts, cafes, bars, parks, and restaurants within blocks of the house. 5min walk to the Mississippi corridor, also near Vancouver and Alberta Arts districts.
transit: Walk, bike, light rail, Uber... Easy access to the Max line (5 min walk), for downtown, Pearl district, or the airport. Just around the corner from I-5 for quick drive downtown. Plenty of street parking available.

name: Restored Buckman Craftsman-your perfect home base`
description: Enjoy entire 1905 Old Portland house in Portland's historic, vibrant, walkable Buckman neighborhood, 20 blocks from downtown. Inside beautifully restored. Spacious, private decks. Walk to unique shops on Portland's eastside. Walk to award winning restaurants, PDX’s coffee, craft beer scene and dispensaries. Ocean, mountains, great wineries nearby. Super clean, warm and inviting inside and out. (Dec. 2019 and Jan. 2020 avail. ONLY for 20-30 day stays @$139 p/night. Make a request; I'll respond.). This house was designed to make the most of Portland’s  natural beauty, and the interior invites family and friends to gather for conversation and food in a warm, comfortable space that is all the more enjoyable when our weather turns rainy.  Excellent kitchen open to the living room keeps conversation flowing and inclusive. You'll have complete privacy and access to all of the house and yard with the exception of the basement, basement level garage and office. If a problem arises we are availa
neighborhood_overview: Buckman is a diverse neighborhood with many single family homes, loads of excellent restaurants, coffee shops and brew pubs.  It is a wonderful walking and biking neighborhood.  Public transportation is a few blocks away.  This is one of Portland’s famous walkable neighborhoods: within a short walkable distance you’ll find all your needs from medical care to movie theaters.
transit: Bus stop is 4 blocks away as are bike rental stations. Both Uber and Lift are very active in our area of town. The Portland International Airport is about 10 miles away with public transport running regularly 24/7.  An Uber/Lift ride to/from the airport costs approximately $25. Taxi’s about $30.

name: Spacious Inner SE Private Guest Suite
description: Spacious lower level guest suite with private entrance. Well equipped with a queen sized bed, full bath, and an eating area. There is also a desk/counter area with chairs for those who need to get a bit of work done. Washer and dryer located in suite.  The house is ideally located in inner SE Portland, walking distance to shops and restaurants on Division and Hawthorne. We are also just a short drive to downtown Portland (10-15 minutes). Great base for exploring all that Portland has to offer! The house is located on a quiet cul-de-sac. The spacious guest suite is about 600 sq ft. It is ideally located near the restaurants and shops on SE Division (~10 min leisurely stroll). The suite is professionally cleaned and turned over after each guest's stay. We have also installed a washer and dryer for those who might need to do laundry during their stay. The washer and dryer are in the suite and used exclusively by guests. We do not host locals. You'll have your own private entrance to the g
neighborhood_overview: Shopping and restaurants nearby on SE Division and SE Hawthorne.
transit: Street parking is available if traveling by car. There is a bus stop at the end of the block if you need access to public transit.

name: Private Bedrooms at The  Historic Tabor Craftsman
description: This carefully curated and stylish 1915 Portland Craftsman is in a prime Portland Mount Tabor neighborhood and in the heart of renowned South East food & bar scene! This location cannot be beat. This exceptionally stylish Historic Craftsman home offers 1-2 private  bedrooms in a beautiful, spacious, comfortable and light filled home.  Each bedroom has a Queen sized bed, high quality cotton linens, down comforters, and down pillows.  The front bedroom has  Tempur-pedic Mattress topper. There is a large closet in the front bedroom. The large bathroom between the two bedrooms boasts a bathtub and shower. You will be provided with fluffy cotton bath towels and bath and shower amenities.  This is a two story home but the second floor (not pictured) is where my bathroom and bedroom is and it's closed off to guests. I live in this home. My bedroom and bathroom are on the second floor (you will hear me and my dog Odie moving above you but I will be quiet as possible-please keep in mind the hou
neighborhood_overview: Just a few short blocks from SE Division and Hawthorne, and right on the bus line to downtown, too! It's an easy walk to coffee, breakfast and some of Portland's famous destinations  like Mount Tabor (leash free dog park!)and  Powell's Books Annex and a lovely yoga studio around the corner.
transit: Just a few short blocks from SE Division and Hawthorne, and right on the bus line to downtown, too! It's an easy walk to coffee, breakfast and some of Portland's famous destinations  like Mount Tabor (leash free dog park!)and  Powell's Books Annex and a lovely yoga studio around the corner.

name: Stumptown Room ~ Urban Haven
description: The Stumptown Room is filled with Portland personality and Oregon beauty. It is upstairs with a cozy charm, brand new innerspring double bed, TV/FireStick w/Netflix. Guests enjoy much more than simply a "private room;" I welcome guests to enjoy my "entire place" making this the perfect getaway! A large shared bathroom is just down the stairs. With a couple of other Airbnb rooms in the house travelers love meeting each other. The serene garden is perfect for quiet relaxing, including a hot tub. I've lived in my house nearly 22 years.  My guests always find a special feeling here, welcoming, relaxing, charming, a real home setting with all the amenities. Each of the guest rooms are inviting, comfortable, creative, and clean; the house is filled with personality.  Guests enjoy access to the entire house (common areas), garden, and share a large bathroom on the main floor with extra, towels and a 50gal hot water.    Washer/dryer use for guests staying 7 days or more. The dining room has a
neighborhood_overview: This IS the location!  You can see the MAX lightrail station from my front door!  Interstate 5 has on/off ramps (both north & south) 2 minutes away. Walk to the awesome, hip, groovy, "Portlandia Style" Historic Mississippi District in just 10 minutes walking.  The Alberta Arts District is only a few minutes by car or bike ... for shopping, galleries, food carts, restaurants, coffee, breweries, dispensaries, and other crazy little shops.   Ten minutes on MAX lightRail into downtown for everything you could want to see or do.  MAX runs miles in several directions from the house connecting you to the PDXMetro area.  There are also bike trails (rentals nearby) with both bike and walking paths running both north and south from the house.  And if you would rather relax and stick close to "home" check out my Guidebook.  At the end of my street alone there are several restaurants (one with dozens of brews/ciders on tap), coffee and fresh bagels, wine/bottle shop, a bank and even a convenience
transit: Car, lightrail, biking or walking.  You will have plenty of options getting exactly where you want to go from the convenience of Urban Haven in North Portland, Nopo!   As we say here ... "plane to train!"  Lightrail can literally take you from baggage claim to my house!  And that means whether you arrive by plane, train, OR even bus you're connected right to your accommodations.

name: Cozy space, one of the most popular neighborhoods
description: My place is located in one of Portland’s most popular neighborhoods. You’ll find yourself within walking distance to several well known Portland restaurants and shops. Because of my convenient location, it’s also very quick and easy to access any other popular spot/neighborhood in Portland like Alberta street, NW 23rd or downtown Portland via public transportation or car making my place very accommodating for everything on your Portland to do/must see list. Come stay in my cozy lofted one bedroom and enjoy a home away from home. I provide complimentary toiletries, snacks, coffee, tea, and hot cocoa for you to enjoy during your stay. The building I live in is right next door to a beautiful plant nursery. There’s plenty to do around and explore on foot in this neighborhood including popular Portland staples. There’s also easy access to other popular spots and neighborhoods from my location. I ask that because I provide complimentary snacks, coffee and tea that you do not help yourself to
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is one of the the most popular  spots in Portland to come and visit. You have plenty of restaurants, bars and shops walking distance right outside of my doorstep.  Some popular spots within minutes of walking include:  * Blue Star Donuts -You need to visit this spot after Voodoo donuts or dare I say INSTEAD of voodoo donuts)  * Por Que No- Famous Tacos in Portland * Mississippi Studios- an amazing bar with a great patio and arguably one of the best venues and sound for concerts here in Portland  * Laughing Planet- Very healthy but incredibly delicious popular restaurant in Portland
transit: My place is perfect for all of your needs when it comes to exploring Portland:  * The airport is a 20 minute drive away or under an hour commute if taking public transportation  * Downtown Portland is under a 10 minute drive by car or under 30 minutes via public transportation  *If you rented a car or drove down, there is free parking all around the neighborhoods off of Mississippi Ave.  *Because of public transportation and accessibility to so many restaurants, shops and bars by foot, my location makes it easy to plan a trip with no car

name: Hawthorne Hideaway-Close To Food and Fun!
description: Stylish apartment in Inner-SE Portland, located in the basement of a 1908 craftsman home. The apartment is near all of the amazing spots that Portland has to offer while being a true peaceful oasis from the hustle and bustle. There is a king size memory foam bed, spa-like bathroom, plus a kitchenette to warm up your amazing leftovers and enjoy a locally roasted morning coffee. This part of the house is newly renovated and designed by us - with modern style and vintage inspiration. This is a studio apartment in a daylight basement with its own bathroom and kitchenette. The space is all yours.  The homeowners live upstairs, but occasionally Airbnb the house when they are out of town. The back yard is open for your use, but the upper deck is for the people who live or rent upstairs.  *Please note that there is no stove/stovetop. There is a fridge (no freezer), sink, coffee maker, toaster and microwave for your convenience. We are always available should you need anything, but we will make
neighborhood_overview: Food & Drink: - Pok Pok - Brass Horse Pub - Porque No? - The Woodsman - Ava Gene's - Sapphire Hotel - Pine State Biscuits - Salt & Straw - Bamboo Sushi - Sweet Hereafter - Gold Dust Meridian - Cascade Brewery - Hopworks Shopping: - Tender Loving Empire - Powell's  - Multiple record stores - Awesome Boutiques! Parks/Outdoors: - Laurelhurst Park - Mount Tabor Historical: - The Bagdad Theater - Lone Fir Cemetery
transit: Super walkable (92, walkscore!) area with tons of fund things to do, eat and see. House is on major arterial with access to 14, 75, and 4 bus lines offering a short ride (15 mins) to downtown Portland, or other east side neighborhoods.  Area is very bike friendly (94, bikescore!) with Biketown Bike share program 2 blocks from the house. Portland has Lyft, Uber and Taxi service readily available as well.

name: Charming, Pristine Ranch near The Falls, PDX &DTWN
description: We are excited to share our newly renovated and fully furnished 2 bedroom, 2 full bathrooms 1500 square foot home with large back yard! We are new to Airbnb and committed to giving you a fantastic stay! The home is on the way to beautiful Mount Hood and Multnomah Falls but is also close to downtown, it's a perfect location to check out all of what the Pacific North West has to offer. All of the furniture, beds and linens are NEW and all the rooms are tastefully decorated to help make you feel at home during your stay in Portland!   As you enter through the front door you will be greeted by a bright sitting room with two over sized chairs. This is a large room perfect for reading your favorite book, or to spread out while playing any of the board games that we supply. Don't forget to eat some of our complimentary popcorn! You will also find our guest book and large guest map in this room, as we would love to know where you have traveled from. As you walk into the center of the home you
neighborhood_overview: Right around the corner from the home, well less then a 5 min drive you will find Glendoveer Golf Course.  It is a large golf course that is beautifully manicured. It offers a 36 hole golf course, 18 hole Footgolf (a sport that combines soccer and golf) course and 4 indoor tennis courts! They also offer a heated (in the cold winter months) and well lit driving range.  Around the golf course is a tree lined trail surrounding the 231 acre site. You can enjoy a 2 mile morning stroll or run around these beautiful grounds.  Once you are finished and exhausted from your round of golf, tennis match, walk or run, Von Ebert Brewing has your back! They are located on the  grounds for you to enjoy a cold one and/or great food.  The restaurant is open late and has indoor and outdoor seating.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  The home is approximately 30 minutes to beautiful 611 foot tall Multnomah Falls. It is located right off the I-84 freeway. There is a restaurant and gift store located in the lodge
transit: There is plenty of parking in the drive way and in the front of the home. The Max train is approximately one mile from the home. It will take you into downtown Portland, Lloyd center and Clackamas  town center Mall's, the airport and many other places around Portland.

name: Artist haven/historic Laurelhurst
description: Beautifully remodeled spacious basement apartment in historic Laurelhurst with separate entrance, full kitchen, private bath, garden patio, and off street parking.  Walking distance to nearby trendy Hawthorne & Division neighborhood shops, restaurants, parks, and transportation. This lovely remodeled apartment is all yours for the length of your stay in Portland. You will feel comfortable and very private in this generous sized apartment with a kitchen and private bath. On warm days you can enjoy your morning coffee or late afternoon wine on the patio. There is a separate entrance and private off-street parking. There is an adjacent studio cottage which makes this a perfect location for multiple guests visiting for weddings, graduations, reunions or other special events. To view, check out my Airbnb profile. You have complete use of the apartment and patio. There is convenient off-street parking. There are laundry facilities which can be unlocked for long term guests. I am more than ha
neighborhood_overview: Historic Laurelhurst is one of Portland's most desired neighborhoods. It is a quiet family orientated area grounded by beautiful Laurelhurst Park which features serene walking trails, a lagoon, tennis and basketball courts. Within walking distance are trendy Hawthorne and Division Street neighborhoods. There is easy and quick access to downtown Portland, where you can become acquainted with the waterfront, the Pearl, NW 23rd Street and other points of interest. While exploring be sure to check out museums, theaters, restaurants and great shopping.  If the city is not your thing, think about heading to Mt. Hood, Multnomah Falls, the Oregon Coast or spending the day visiting Oregon's renowned wineries.
transit: There is great access to public transportation to downtown Portland and surroundings within minutes of my home. I am close to the freeway which can take you downtown or to other more scenic areas such as Multnomah Falls,  Mt. Hood, or even to the Pacific Coast beaches!

name: Central condo in downtown PDX - Pet Friendly
description: Bright top floor unit centrally located in downtown Portland. Beautiful refinished hardwood floors, antique touches, remodeled with new kitchen appliances and big windows to let in the sunshine. Nice living room space with large couch, a dining nook and walk in closet with ample storage space. Pet friendly. Location is key here with close proximity to NW 23rd, the pearl and just 10 minutes car ride to Beaverton (Nike and Columbia campuses). The space comes with kitchen and bathroom essentials, Ethernet and WiFi. guests will have access to the entire building including laundry room I am available for any questions about the space if needed. Close to shopping, some of the best Portland dining and just a few blocks from the freeway so getting around town is easy. Super accessible to public transportation. One block from the Max stop and in a very walkable area.
neighborhood_overview: Close to shopping, some of the best Portland dining and just a few blocks from the freeway so getting around town is easy.
transit: Super accessible to public transportation. One block from the Max stop and in a very walkable area.

name: Basement Apartment + Garden Lodge
description: Enjoy two private spaces on your trip; your own apartment (w/bathroom and kitchenette) beneath our 1929 family home, plus our magical backyard converted garage studio, w 15 ft reclaimed wood cathedral ceilings and a sleeping loft. With the Basement Apartment and hand-remodeled Garden Lodge you are fully self-sufficient in our old-school Portland oasis of calm amidst the flowers.  We invite guests from all backgrounds, and especially offer a safe and welcoming space for POC and LBGTQ travelers. We are a family of four, with two young sons (Waylon is almost 5, River was born in June 2018). We run a theatre company in town and host lots of visiting artists and friends at our place. Since this is our first house we've ever owned, we are pretty proud to share it. We are also slowly fixing up and improving and changing things, (especially in the back yard and front and side gardens) and want you to enjoy your time here as much as you can in the city that we've called home for over 20 years.
neighborhood_overview: We are close to downtown St. Johns, with lots of food, drink and coffee options. There are great breakfast places like Anna Bananna's, the amazing Cathedral Park under the St. Johns Bridge, coffee shops, comic book stores, dive bars and yoga studios. An awesome food cart pod on Lombard (Kruger's) is a short walk from the house -- also nearby are a farmer's market stand and three grocery stores (New Seasons, Fred Meyer and Grocery Outlet). So great to walk or bike in the whole zone w/ less than a mile to tons of restaurants, stores, groceries, bars, two movie theatres, three amazing parks, etc, etc. It's also very quick access to the more well visited N/NE hip artsy neighborhoods of Kenton, Alberta/Killingsworth and Mississippi, which are full of things to do, eat, drink, etc at all hours.
transit: We are one block from a stop for bus line #4 (on Fessenden) and a short walk to #75 (on Lombard). If driving or going via a ride the easy way to get anywhere across town is either Columbia Blvd or St. John's 'Cathedral' bridge to get to any part of Portland by avoiding traffic/stoplight heavy streets. 15 minutes to downtown, quick and easy. Uber/Lyft and such are very cheap from here to other parts of the city.

name: Waterfront condo in SW Portland
description: Willamette River and Mount St Helen views with the Willamette Greenway biking and walking path right out my door.  2 bed/2 bath condo located in John’s Landing/Lairs Hill SW Portland neighborhood and 1.5 miles from downtown--walk or bus there. My SW Portland condo is located on the third floor (up 2 flights of stairs) with spectacular views of the Willamette river.  This listing is for the whole condo. I also list for 1 bedroom only (see Fabulous View in Portland Oasis listing). Bedroom #1 has double bed with Select Comfort mattress (the sleep number bed) and master bath. Bedroom #2  has a comfy queen bed, small table and closet space with an adjacent bath. It does not have air conditioning, but stays rather cool at night because of the breeze off the water. Located 1.5 miles from the center of downtown Portland. You’ll  have access to the kitchen, dinette, living room and deck to enjoy the full views of water life. This is one of my homes and I want you to enjoy your stay. If you need
neighborhood_overview: John's Landing is located 1.5 miles from downtown Portland, which has many food choices. Eating in John's Landing is convenient yet delicious. Dining-in or picnic supplies are easily purchased at Zupan's Market (about 1.5 miles).   John’s Landing has a few select restaurants that have become quite famous in the Portland area. Those are Buffalo Gap, Corbett Fish House, Fulton Pub & Brewery, Jolly Roger at John’s Landing, and Reo’s Ribs. Elephant’s Deli (3 blocks) is an excellent café and coffee shop.  Willamette Park is a convenient and plentiful picnic place with views of the Willamette river.
transit: The streetcar and tram to OHSU on the hill is .5 mile walk on the Willamette Greenway path and the bus (#35, #36, #43) is 5 min walk. It’s 1.5 miles from downtown Portland and could easily be walked. The airport is just 20 minutes away. There is free parking in the condo lot.

name: Clinton/Division spacious room
description: Natural light fills this spacious room at a quiet corner of the house. The room features a queen bed and plenty of space & storage for you to stretch out and enjoy a comfortable stay.  Please note ** The extra floor mattress is available by request ** The bathroom is shared with other guests Natural light-filled and beautifully appointed furnishings perfectly compliment this renovated mid-century home with modern and smart home conveniences, perched over a quiet tree lined street, steps from the excitement. Guests have full access to the following shared spaces: full bathroom, dining kitchen, and living room. I'm available as much or as little as you want, it's your trip so you decide. I live in the house and work from home most of the time so you can easily find me to get help with anything in the house or get recommendations in the neighborhood.  Hosting is a passion of mine and I enjoy meeting people from all over the world and hear their travel stories over a cup of tea or a glass
neighborhood_overview: You probably know or you've done the research and figured this is the neighborhood! So I'm just going to list a couple of Portland institutions and the minutes it takes you to leisurely stroll to them from the front door. Pok Pok—10 Salt & Straw—11 Cafe Broder—5 Little Big Burger—18 Little t—6 Pine state biscuits —21 Cartopia —25 50 licks—10 Stumptown—27 Ava Gean's—12 Blue Star Donuts —24 Bollywood Theater —8 Lauretta Jean’s —12 Tea bar —23 Powell's Books on Hawthorne (not the flagship)—27
transit: The neighborhood is very pedestrian friendly and best explored on foot. Ask me for a walking map. If you prefer to bike, after all it's Portland! We are 3 blocks away from a BIKETOWN bike share station (Clinton & 26th) which is conveniently located on the neighborhood greenway, where bicycles have right-of-way. Portland has one of the most efficient and safe public transportation in the country and I would highly recommend using it. We're conveniently located 4 blocks from the #2 bus line that spans the whole length of SE Division St and takes you downtown (15-20min). The #9, 10, 14, 17 and 75 are all within walking distance, in addition the Clinton orange line max (light rail) station is a mile away. Of course Uber, Lyft, CAR2GO, Zipcar and ReachNow are all available in the city. If you're driving you'll be happy to know that street parking is readily available in front and in the vicinity of the house. It's good to know that we are blocks away from both SE Powell blvd and SE Cesar Ch

name: Private Entry/Big View/Sunlit SEPDX
description: VIEW! Funky, fabulous private unit has lower level patio entrance, faces S/SW toward a wide, beautiful view and lots of light. Tucked away in deep SE Woodstock, this is a perfect combo of urban & rural, close but removed, gracious style & free form. This is a fresh, new guest room created in a recent remodel. Within the room is a private toilet/shower room with pocket door. Sink and vanity contained within room. Lots of color. Queen size bed. Desk and ergonomic chair. Refrigerator and Microwave. Coffee/tea/hot water and breakfast bars. Private entrance. Access to yard and garden. On premises, off-street parking. Easy access to bus lines. All guests are invited to share the backyard gardens and may have access to laundry facilities on request. Host and owner, Kate, and other household members are often on site and available for consultation about local cuisine, entertainment, and nearby fun. You can have a lot of interaction or maintain your complete privacy - as you wish. This property
neighborhood_overview: This property is located in the Errol Heights addition just below the up and coming Woodstock neighborhood. It rests on a ridge inside the Portland city limits and overlooks a wide view of the Willamette Valley. In this part of town you will find a number of eating and drinking establishments, markets, coffee shops. The local corner hardware store and a few funky long time neighborhood joints make this a unique place to be. Close to Reed College.
transit: Onsite parking in the drive! 2 frequent service bus routes within a few blocks of the house. UberCab and several traditional taxi services available. Go for a walk in the neighborhood and you'll find a mix of early to mid 20th century houses aside brand new structures. This is an evolving part of town with a new vibe. You'll find wide streets, narrow, streets, and streets that bear signs saying "roadway not improved." On these lanes you may find gravel or deep ruts/potholes, a tree in the middle, or maybe just a foot path! No worries though... plenty of ways to get through. The new Orange Line Max train stop is just over a mile away- a beautiful walk through lovely Eastmoreland to access. Very close to the Springwater Corridor Trail, Crystal Springs Rhododendron Garden, Reed Canyon. Off the beaten path but close to it all. Respite and rockin' fun combined. A great spot to watch the clouds or rain or sunlit sky, to relax and chill, as well as to be the jumping off point for any in town

name: Private & Clean SE Portland Garden Cottage
description: Cozy and Clean 250 sqft South East Portland  cottage on a quiet tree-lined street.  Cottage is ideal for a single person who travels light.  You'll have a private bathroom with sink, toilet, shower, fresh towels, and a lovely kitchen. There is complimentary tea and coffee in the kitchen. The cottage has a very comfortable full sized bed, wireless internet, and New Yorker magazines. Enjoy the sun from two skylights and  and look out into a backyard garden with a private entrance. This an eco-friendly cottage suitable for a single traveler who packs light.  It has easy access to light rail and bike baths. Very close to Reed College, Sellwood, and Woodstock neighborhoods. Please respect our neighbors privacy and enjoy your stay. Just call or text. It's a great centrally located neighborhood in SE Portland. Easy access to bike trails, public transportation, and hip SE neighborhoods. Lots of street parking available. -We are .8 miles from the Bybee Max rail station (Orange Line).  -We are .
neighborhood_overview: It's a great centrally located neighborhood in SE Portland. Easy access to bike trails, public transportation, and hip SE neighborhoods.
transit: Lots of street parking available. -We are .8 miles from the Bybee Max rail station (Orange Line).  -We are .3 miles from TRIMet 19 bus stop on 32nd & REX

name: Cottage Mississippi/Williams ave
description: Why rent a $150 hotel room? Our family friendly home offers, privacy, space and easy access to transit, freeways and two fun neighborhoods, you can easily get around by car, bus, bike or foot for half the price of a hotel room. Please do not book our cottage if you have not read this ad completely. We work very hard to offer a 5 star stay, and the way to ensure our unit is a good fit for your stay, we ask that you read this in it's entirety. Please print all the necessary information, doing so will ensure you have all the important details.  Please note that this is a private unit located in the back of our main home. PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN FRONT. OR ACCESS THE MAIN HOUSE YARD. PLEASE PARK AND ENTER THROUGH THE ALLEY. Feel free to walk through the main yard at the end of your stay to empty trash, compost and recycling.  There is separate parking in the back and you can easily access the apartment through the alley, please do not walk through the front as this is a private residence. Thi
neighborhood_overview: We have a very quiet though lively neighborhood. Lots of shops, restaurants, bars and music venues. There are quite a few wedding venues near by making us ideal for family weddings.
transit: 1.5 blocks from the number 4 which takes you on a five minute ride to a major transit mall. Portland is at your finger tips.

name: Waterfront Condo living at McCormick Pier
description: Furnished Gated entry Swimming pool Hot tub Outdoor lounge with fire pits Barbecue gas grills Direct access to 15 miles of running Trails pet friendly  Reserved Covered Parking Space Mini mart & Cafe on site Stainless steel appliances Range / Oven, Washer/Dryer Refrigerator, Dishwasher, Microwave Granite Counter Tops Central A/C and Heat Walking distance to MAX Multiple closets Garbage disposal Internet Built in wine rack Easy walking distance to Waterfront Park, Amtrak, the Saturday Market, Pearl District, China Town, the Historic District, the Rose Garden, Lloyd Center or Convention Center, along with Portland's finest shopping and restaurants.  Easy access to all freeways, 1.5 blocks from the MAX red line to the airport or Amtrak to Seattle. Even if you choose to bike or drive your car you will find this place is truly: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. A great urban base for bicycling, dining, shopping, theater, or just exploring the nearby Cascade mountains or the Willamette Valley wi
neighborhood_overview: Gated community with 24/7 security.  River Path way passes through the condo complex.  Allowing runners to run around the city river front.  One block from Tom McCall Part and the Saturday Market.

name: Cozy Apartment--Hollywood District
description: The upstairs apartment in our vintage home has two bedrooms to sleep five comfortability, a fully equipped kitchen, a bath with shower, a dining area, a TV area, and also has a small reading room.  From the Cozy Apartment, one can walk three blocks to public transportation that accesses all of Portland, or five blocks to the vibrant historic Hollywood district with restaurants, coffee shops and grocery stores. Location!! Location!! The Cozy Apartment is a quick ride from the airport or train station via auto or public transportation. We are in a quiet residential neighborhood that welcomes our guests.  Several historic districts are within walking distance; and nearby public transportation (light rail and bus) gives access to the entire Portland Metro area.  View the space in the pictures.  We  provide coffee/tea, filtered water, and snacks for you to serve yourselves. You can use our lovely, enclosed backyard garden with patio table/four chairs/peaceful shady bench to watch the hummin
neighborhood_overview: Quiet old residential neighborhood, many 100+ year- old, well-kept homes, beautiful yards with many flowering plants and mature trees.  There are many restaurants, coffee shops, and grocery stores within easy walking distance.
transit: Definitely good access to public transportation.  Three blocks to a bus that takes you the 9 blocks to the Hollywood transit center with access to the light rail which goes to the PDX airport or into down town, and to other buses that can take you most anywhere in the city.  That same bus will take you over to the Amtrak  railroad station.

name: Modern Ranch w/ Hot Tub by Columbia River - NE PDX
description: Enjoy this modern ranch home on a quiet residential street, two blocks from the beautiful Columbia River in inner NE Portland! The space is close to the airport, Portland Expo Center,  and a quick Uber or Lyft ride away from popular Mississippi, Kenton, and Alberta neighborhoods. Downtown and inner SE nightlife are about a 10 minute drive away. It's also a super short bike ride/drive to Broughton Beach on the Columbia River, and the Marine Drive bike trail. (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) HO Enjoy a comfy private room that overlooks a private wooded area, with a full memory foam mattress, lots of natural light, and thick curtains to block out the light in the sunny season if you so choose to sleep in. The private bathroom has a full bath and shower, towels, basic toiletries, and is a few feet away from your room entrance. There is also central heating and AC...the thermostat is located in the hallway. The rest of the home is an open floor plan with plenty of space and light, so feel fr
neighborhood_overview: The best part of my neighborhood is most definitely its proximity to the Columbia River. I highly suggest catching a sunset at Broughton Beach or on the patio at either The Deck, The Sextant, or Salty's on the Columbia (upscale bar/seafood). The Marine Drive bike trail is also a beautiful casual ride along the river that runs east with breathtaking views of Mt Hood.  I'd imagine you'll want to venture into the rest of Portland at some point, so if you need suggestions please let me know and I'll make sure you have a great time!
transit: Uber and Lyft are the best transit options, although there is a bus stop about a 10 minute walk away that will take you down MLK Blvd. There is also plenty of bike sharing throughout Portland ("Biketown" bikes), which is a great way to explore the city. If you have a car, I will leave the driveway open for you, but if you happen to have more than one car, please park by the curb directly in front of the house. Please do not park across the street as those spots are reserved for my neighbors. Two car max parking available.

name: Beautiful Cozy Modern Loft in NE w/ Patio near PDX
description: Stay with us and enjoy incredibly cozy & delightful hospitality experience in a custom-designed modern loft space. Walk to the park and take in the morning sun or fog, sip local coffee & peruse the markets, boutiques, food carts, restaurants & bars of Alberta Arts. This space is a Premium Loft space, providing a luxurious sleep under the stars (skylight), custom lighting, impeccable design, walk-in rain shower, two window walls that fold out, natural light & sleek kitchen. Sleeps 2-4 guests. A beautiful loft space that was built as an ADU extending out from our modern house close in, NE Portland, accommodates guests with a fresh & refined taste for design while still keeping in mind all the intricate and cozy details. Plush designer linens, custom velvet sofa, high-end decor accents will truly make this place stand out. Your space is entirely self-sustainable with everything you need for short and longer stays. Have an Incredible space to come home to during your Portland stay. The spa
neighborhood_overview: Read below for favorites: Located in a quiet mid-century neighborhood, you'll find lots of great sidewalks to stroll, beautiful houses to look at, and fun activities going on in the best park in NE, walking distance to walking street 42nd ave, close to shops, with awesome neighbors, this place is one of the safest neighborhoods in NE.  Our neighborhood is quiet & charming with huge trees, spacious sidewalks, and lot's of beautiful Mid Century style homes, modern remodels, and renewed bungalows. The neighbors smile & talk to each-other and are very quiet and respectful. Fernhill park (less than a block away) is a huge part of the neighborhood, and is the best dog-park for all of Portland, tennis courts, a track for running, and a large uber kid-friendly playground. Walk for 10-15 minutes and you'll reach 33rd & Killingsworth - which has a plethora of shops and local eateries nearby. Our favorite grocery store: New Seasons is stocked with healthy food & normal food alike, and has lot's o
transit: We are close to everything! Close to the airport, close to food, close to drinks and shopping!  Walking 10-15 minutes will bring you to a lot of the places on our guide :) but if you have a car or take uber/lyft - it's even quicker to the good stuff!  Commute Times to downtown: 15-20+ minutes by car 39+ minutes by bus 30+ by bike We live on an avenue that is the recommended bike path, so it's easy to get around for that too. There's a bus stop about 1.5 blocks away - takes a couple minutes to walk there but it's easy and has a shelter if its raining.

name: Lost Arts Ranch
description: Bright and airy room in our midcentury ranch home in a quiet neighborhood. Great access to downtown Portland, Mt Hood, and the Columbia River Gorge. The guest room is on the main floor of our Midcentury ranch situated on a half-acre lot in a quiet, residential neighborhood. There is a queen bed with firm mattress and 400-thread count cotton sheets, desk, office chair, and a comfortable upholstered chair.  NOTE: The "floor mattress" in this listing is actually a cot that is available for a third guest. Anyone may use it, however it is suitable for people under 140 pounds or so. Larger bodied guests have reported that is not comfortable. Outside we have a large organic garden in a side lot, bordered with roses and dotted with sunflowers, and a flock of chickens out back. The private backyard includes a patio seating area where guests can enjoy the sound of birds singing from the dozens of surrounding trees. As home base for the traveler who enjoys both country and city life, we have two
neighborhood_overview: We are in the tree-filled, quiet neighborhood of Russell, made up of homes built in the 1950s and 60s. Located in outer Northeast Portland, we're ideally situated for those eager to get out of town and explore the Columbia River Gorge, Mt Hood, Mt St Helens, and u-pick farms and go in town and enjoy Powell's Book, Mt Tabor, food carts, microbrews, bikes and bridges.  There is a large supermarket about ten blocks away, plus Thai, Mexican, and Middle Eastern markets nearby.   There's a fancy steak house and good casual Indian, Thai, and Mexican restaurants within 1-2 miles.  Glendoveer Golf & Tennis is a 36 hole daily fee golf range with 4 indoor tennis courts and a covered, heated and lit driving range located a short 1.4 miles away. Visitors are welcome at two local high school swimming pools. Great neighborhood for biking, with local access to the Gateway Green, I-205 and I-84 bike paths.
transit: From the airport by public transport on weekdays between 7am and 7pm, you can take the MAX light rail to the Gateway Transit Center and take #23 Trimet bus to stop  6714. Evenings and weekends, take the MAX to 82nd Avenue TC and the #77 bus to stop 2374. Visit the Trimet web site to plan your public transit travels.  A taxi from the airport takes about 12 minutes and costs about $22-25.  Bicyclists welcome! We can stow your bike for you during your stay. Ample street parking available.

name: Cheerful Hollywood Bungalow! Walk to Everything!
description: Vintage charm meets modern day conveniences in this centrally located, Hollywood district bungalow.  Fresh remodel, featuring hardwood floors, subway tile, butcher block counters, clawfoot tub.  Cozy basement bonus space with Queen bed and private, full bath. Laundry, books and lots of board games for those rainy days. Walk to farmers market, iconic Hollywood Theater, shops, restaurants bars.  Easy access to freeways, steps away from Max station and  a few short Max stops away from airport. Entire house, no sharing with strangers. (Apologies for being redundant  but have many inquiries confirming).  Updated 1920's bungalow, 1254 total SF.  2 bedrooms on main, 1 Queen and full bed in either room. 1 Queen bed, full bath and laundry in finished basement.  The photo with the accent wood wall is the Queen bed in finished basement. Living room, clawfoot tub bath, kitchen and small dining area space are on the main. Please make sure the square footage, age of home  and setup, fits your needs
neighborhood_overview: Easy going and eclectic neighborhood in the heart of Portland's Hollywood district.  Steps away from Saturday farmers market, Trader Joes, Whole Foods. Shops, bars, restaurants and hospital are also in extremely close proximity . 4.5 miles  from downtown Portland and blocks away from public transport including a few short max stops away from downtown and Portland airport.
transit: Property is located a few blocks from Hollywood transit center which allows access to busses and Max. Max line is just a few short stops from downtown Portland and Portland airport.

name: Charming Alberta Arts Studio
description: Newly renovated, private, detached bedroom and bathroom. Walk to the epicenter of Portland Culture, Alberta Arts, where you can explore the many bars, cafes, galleries and more and all just a short stroll from your front door. This is a great space in a great location. Come stay with us! Charming Portland studio in a perfect neighborhood for walking and exploring. The studio is detached from the main house and is located in the front of the property with private access from the street. The studio is equipped with a brand new modern bathroom as well as a large TV and Wi-Fi. Guests will have access to the studio only. Please feel free to contact us any time. We will be close by, in the main house, which is located in back of the property. Alberta Arts is the Epicenter of Portland's "close in" urban culture. Amazing variety of scenes just blocks in any direction. Check out the "Last Thursday" (last Thursday of every month) street fair in the summertime! You will be amazed by the street pe
neighborhood_overview: Alberta Arts is the Epicenter of Portland's "close in" urban culture. Amazing variety of scenes just blocks in any direction. Check out the "Last Thursday" (last Thursday of every month) street fair in the summertime! You will be amazed by the street performers and the street art is truly spectacular. There is something for everyone in this neighborhood and very safe all hours.
transit: Yes !! Multiple bus lines within walking distance. Very easy to get around.
