name: Private Backyard Guest Studio w/ Fireplace & Patio
description: The studio suite is recently renovated and built, with brand new floors, bath, gorgeous beamed ceiling, a super cozy fireplace, comfy bed, quality linens, a private patio with outdoor seating, private secure parking, super fast wifi, and a pool to cool off in during summer! Come relax in the best city in the Pacific Northwest! Portland has so many amazing things to offer. The friendliest city in America! In addition to Portland’s thriving urban center, it also boasts beautiful natural spaces, bike paths throughout the city, mountains, lakes, rivers, hikes and outdoor excursions all within a few minutes drive. Come enjoy some of the country’s best breweries, wine country, lakes, rivers, hiking, cycling, kayaking…Portland has it all! -Brand new fully furnished guest studio suite -Brand new bathroom with full-sized tub and great water pressure -Comfy queen bed with quality linens -Cozy Fireplace, air conditioning -Private outdoor patio with seating -High speed wifi internet -Smart TV with
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the most conveniently located areas in Portland! A lovely “pocket” neighborhood that is very quiet...and next to the beautiful Rocky Butte observation mountain. The Madison South neighborhood is also home to some of the best Vietnemese restaurants in the city! Nom nom. We're ten minutes from the airport, a straight shot down Sandy Blvd. to Downtown (15-20mins), Alberta Arts (10mins), with Rocky Butte, The Grotto grounds and beautiful Mount Tabor park just minutes away. Very conveniently located to all the main streets and highways, but without the hassles, petty crime/theft and noise you may encounter in busier neighborhoods. Serene spot to come home to after exploring our fair City of Roses! *Apologies, but we are unable to host any pool parties or photo shoots. Thank you
transit: We are exactly seven minutes from the international airport and a quick jaunt to all the best places to see in Portland! Portland has an excellent public transportation system. You can choose from the light rail MAX train, buses, and uber, lyft, taxis and zip cars abound. Or take some city rental bikes that dot Portland and explore the bike paths that encircle and entwine the city! Also, try Turo for car rentals. They are like Airbnb for cars with rates as low as $20/day, and can often deliver the vehicle right to you (no lines at a counter)! For younger guests under 25yrs. who have a hard time renting cars...Turo only charges an extra $10 per day!

name: The Tiny Big Guest House
description: The Tiny Big Guest House is a newly-renovated studio cottage, cozy and private.   It's conveniently located for access to downtown, and a short walk to local destinations for Portland's food/drinking/coffee/ice cream/bakery/boutique scene.  It's also easy to get away to the Oregon coast, mountains, and the Columbia River Gorge. We welcome ALL nationalities, religions, sexual orientations, and genders! Most guests use our studio as a place to curl up at the end of a busy day exploring all Portland has to offer, or hanging out with friends or family who don't quite have room to host them. The guesthouse has a kitchenette with a microwave, mini-fridge, dishes and cooking supplies.  There is a portable 2-burner induction stove under the sink if you'd like to cook for yourself.  The bathroom features a spacious tiled shower. It's well-insulated for sound and comfort and outfitted with blackout blinds/shades.  Guests report it's nicely warm in the winter, and nicely cool in the summer - even
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a mix of single-family homes and apartments.  Close by are restaurants, coffee shops, beer, wine bars, pubs with full food service, Mexican, Sushi, Pizza, and fast food.  A large food cart space is in the works near by, along with 600+ others around Portland.  Our family often walks to parks or to eat out nearby, and we enjoy running and biking in the neighborhood. A 15-minute walk will bring you to Clinton and Division Streets, one of Portland's biggest restaurant scenes!  It's a 20-minute walk to our nearby stores (Safeway, Trader Joes, New Seasons), and of course everything is convenient by bike or car.  We're a 25-45 minute drive from the airport, depending on traffic.  Some guests have stayed with us for treatment at OHSU. There are many fantastic farmer's markets, some are year-round. Let us know if you're looking for anything in particular, we're happy to give recommendations!  We can especially give you detailed advice for options like vegan, gluten-free, an
transit: Public transit to downtown Portland is 2 blocks away and runs often throughout the day.   You can park in our driveway in front of the studio.  There's also plenty of free parking on our street.

name: Best of both worlds
description: Best of both worlds: nestled in nature with amazing views five min from downtown. Open floor plan, modern kitchen with new high end appliances, gas BBQ on huge outdoor deck, large living room, spacious bedrooms with views, hardwoods throughout. Master bedroom has en suite with rain shower and heated floors. Our home is bright and lofty year round. It’s minimal while avoiding being cold. There are plenty of spots to get cozy and read a book or lay back in the tv room and enjoy a movie while overlooking the city. The house is situated perfectly between Forrest Park and Downtown. You have access to the entire house. This also includes three decks, a stainless steel BBQ and Japanese Soaking tub overlooking the city. We love meeting our guests! You can reach us with questions by text, phone and in person visit. We are located in a relaxed and quite neighborhood perched above downtown Portland. Our home is a 10 min walk to the nature trailheads leading into Forrest Park. We are also a 20 min
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a relaxed and quite neighborhood perched above downtown Portland. Our home is a 10 min walk to the nature trailheads leading into Forrest Park. We are also a 20 min walk from the beautiful Pittock Mansion. If you are looking for a quiet nights sleep you will find it here.
transit: Because our home is located fairly high up the mountain we recommend using a car. We have a driveway for as well as additional street parking.

name: Red House Retreat in Alberta Arts
description: Relaxing, fun, and spacious private one bedroom eco-conscious basement apt.  Enjoy the beautiful outdoors and comfy indoor space - just steps from restaurants, bars, public transit, and the fun of NE Portland. Convenient for travel -just 12 minutes to the airport.  Super comfortable- sleeps five. -The entire space is yours with a private entrance and keypad entry so you don't have to bother with a key -1 private bedroom (with a comfy queen bed) and a separate large living room with two options for pull out couches that turn into beds (queens), an antique pool table, flat screen TV with Netflix, games for kids and adults, books, and our own personal guidebook to the area -The kitchen is fully equipped to cook a good meal (toaster oven and stovetop, microwave, electric tea kettle, refrigerator with freezer, french press for coffee, cutting boards, sharp knives, and cooking and eating utensils.)  -Washer / Dryer in unit -Brand new bathroom with shower and natural body wash, shampoo, and c
neighborhood_overview: You feel like you are in a forest retreat, but you are just steps from all the happenings of Northeast Portland.  Walking distance to Alberta Arts, the Kennedy School to catch a film, soak in the hot tub, eat at their restaurants or bar, Dekum Triangle, family friendly Alberta Park, restaurant row and gourmet coffee. Close to New Seasons Market and Walgreens pharmacy, and the bus that goes straight downtown.  You are in the heart of it all and there is almost too much to do.
transit: Yes!  There is a bus just three blocks away that takes you straight to downtown portland.  You can also walk to just about any convenience (within 10 minutes), and if you rent a bike thats even better!

name: Deluxe Apartment Studio & Jacuzzi
description: This is a beautiful Private Studio includes a Master Bedroom, Master Bath with a Jacuzzi Tub, a Kitchenette & Living Room. The entire space has beautiful hardwood flooring throughout and its own private entrance surrounded by fir trees. This is a beautiful Private Studio with a Master Bedroom, Master Bath, Kitchenette: No gas oven, Living Room. The entire space has beautiful hardwood flooring throughout and its own private entrance surrounded by fir trees. A queen futon and privacy drapes allow for a second sleeping area in the living room space. The master bedroom boasts a king-sized bed, spacious interior-lit wardrobe, large HDTV, xfinity cable and AC during summertime.  The floor-to-ceiling hand-tiled master bathroom is equipped with a large jacuzzi tub, rain shower, skylight, and double sink vanity with a modern, handmade concrete countertop. The bathroom has a beautiful, modern, stained concrete floor with radiant heating. Dimmed sconce lighting provides for a romantic mood. The E
neighborhood_overview: Woodstock is bounded on the north by Southeast Holgate Boulevard, east by Southeast 45th and Southeast 60th Streets, south by Johnson Creek, and west by Cesar Chavez Boulevard (formerly Southeast 39th Avenue). Woodstock borders the neighborhoods of Reed and Eastmoreland on the west, Creston-Kenilworth on the north, Mt. Scott-Arleta and Brentwood-Darlington on the east, and Ardenwald-Johnson Creek on the south. Just 15 minutes to Downtown & 5 minutes to the Hawthorne District!
transit: The house is located in the SE Woodstock neighborhood: 5 minute walk to Woodstock Village, 5 minute drive to I-205, and 5 minute drive to Reed College and about a 15 minute drive to Downtown or 35 minute trip in a scenic bus ride.

name: Room in lovely home, near airport.
description: Lovely Argay Terrace neighborhood, near airport and 15 minute drive to downtown Portland. A private room with comfortable queen size bed and original wood flooring.  Cable TV and Internet Wifi throughout home and deck. Full use of kitchen and dining area.  Private backyard with deck and grill. Washer and dryer are also available. Plenty of street parking. Full access to kitchen, living and dining room areas, the backyard and deck and washer/ dryer. We request an approximate time of arrival and departure. Communication via Airbnb messaging preferred, no phone calls. You’ll also find access to several bike and pedestrian paths that traverse the area and allow people to travel along the Columbia River, east to Gresham and south to the Gateway Transit Center. Argay Park on 141st offers areas to exercise pets, play tennis, basketball, baseball and soccer. Auto transportation is best and most convenient for this area. Very near the airport and Cascade Station. Max is the rail system in Portl

name: Inner NE Close to Williams, Downtown & Moda Ctr
description: Great inner NE Portland location! Perfect for individual travelers or couples who are here to explore all this exciting city has to offer. We are close to downtown, the Williams corridor, Moda Center, Alberta Arts district, Mississippi Ave and Emanuel hospital; and within walking distance of many bars, breweries, restaurants, and music venues. This is a quiet, cozy private space and entrance to our beautiful 1907 Portland-style home. This place is perfect for a good night's sleep, a warm shower and quick cup of coffee/tea before heading out to enjoy Portland or off to your business engagements. There is coffeemaker and small refrigerator in the room for your use.  The TV is smart for your Netflix, Hulu and Amazon accounts. We also supply cable TV. We are available to help with questions, or if you need suggestions. Otherwise, we will leave you alone! This is a busy and bustling inner NE Portland location with older beautiful homes and quick easy access to many amenities. There is close
neighborhood_overview: This is a busy and bustling inner NE Portland location with older beautiful homes and quick easy access to many amenities. There is close access the Williams corridor, Moda Center, Mississippi Ave., and the Alberta Art district.  You can walk to some really great places to eat and drink in the area. We are just blocks from critically acclaimed restaurants like Ox, Toro Bravo, EEM and Ned Ludd. There are several craft  brew and cider houses very close by. Also nearby are an oyster house, locally roasted coffee, a fabulous bakery, and ice cream like none other. We are about 20 minutes from the airport.
transit: This is a very walkable neighborhood, close to many of the places listed above. Free street parking is available, but can be a bit challenging depending on time of day (later evenings). You might need to park a block or two away. You are welcome and encouraged to block the driveway for unloading.    Public bus transportation is available just a block away on Williams Ave. or Martin Luther King Jr Blvd. Max station - 1.2 miles Portland streetcar - .8 miles Bus stops - few blocks Lyft  Uber Nike orange bike share station - 3 blocks Car2Go ReachNow

name: Spacious and Clean NE Portland
description: Get the chance to live like a Portlander!  Huge lovely space in a safe neighborhood, close to downtown, Portland airport, public transportation, grocery, and restaurants. Private 24hr. keyless entry, and free street parking...perfect! Enough space for 2 people, beautiful and clean one bedroom apartment, original hardwood floors, high ceilings, living and dining area.  Full-size kitchen with double door fridge, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, full-size range with oven, pans and pots, just in case you feel like cooking?? Portland is top 3  of Best Food Cities (and affordable) in the US, so it's up to you ;-) There's also an ironing board, iron (of course) and hairdryer. The apartment is located on the main floor of a house, you might hear some noises from the unit above. You might see me around, but I am always available, text, phone, email, in case you need anything, recommendations, places to go and where the locals hang out ;-) This is the great Rose City Park Neighborhood, easy
neighborhood_overview: This is the great Rose City Park Neighborhood, easy to walk and get around, there's a golf course and a park 2 blocks away for a nice little jog, or you can just go to downtown and enjoy our great City!
transit: A convenience store is a couple of blocks away, nice and diverse restaurants, the bus stop is right at the corner for a straight shot to downtown or the airport around 15 min either way. If you need a quick bite there's a pizzeria on the corner, Pho, Hawaiian within walking distance.

name: The Map Room
description: Private room in what we think is the best neighborhood in Portland. It is a 10-minute neighborhood with everything you could want in the city-- shopping, cafes, bars, parks, downtown across the river, etc. Our home is very comfortable and we love getting to share it with new faces! High speed internet here. We aren't a sterile hotel experience-we offer a personal touch and local flavor...welcome home! *Please note specific check in/out time  and your CHECK IN INSTRUCTIONS and NO guests! The room itself is not large but is cozy and equipped with its own private TV and has a small closet you are welcome to utilize. There is also a great desk working station with a supportive desk chair! The window looks out over our neighbors yards with apple trees and small gardens. Our house also has a double living room (Netflix, movies, widescreen TV at your disposal) and a split kitchen with all amenities. The entire house is open to you for the duration of your stay. All common spaces-- bathroom, l
neighborhood_overview: We're in a fairly youthful neighborhood- residential but just blocks away from all that SE has to offer. Cool shops, quaint cafes, hip bars...the list goes on! Mr Tabor and Ladd's Addition are both beautiful natural or greener areas to stroll through and both public transport as well as the busier atmospheres of Division st, Belmont, Burnside, Hawthorne are all nearby. Some of the places close to where you'll be staying: Favorite coffee shops: Oui Presse (Delish hazelnut espresso cake) Floyd's (very chill, retro decor) Stumptown (their coffee makes a great gift! Iconic) Upper Left Roasters Favorite places for breakfast/brunch: Jam The Hazel Room Petite Provence Favorite bars/restaurants: Revolution Hall (rooftop bar!) 442 (soccer pub) Teote (Central American cuisine with fun cocktails and upstairs patio Stammtisch (German beer bar and restaurant) Pambiche (Cuban restaurant with delicious food and great, strong drinks- service is a bit on the slower side but worth it) Harlow (vegan gf p
transit: Buses are the easiest- download Trimet App! You can also reach a lot of places by walking.

name: Private and Clean Studio Apartment
description: Enjoy your stay in a welcoming and comfortable studio apartment in the University Park neighborhood of North Portland, near the University of Portland.  Newer construction with lots of amenities.  Private separate entrance, ample on-street free parking and walkability to restaurants, bars, coffee shops and New Seasons grocery make staying with us easy. Fully furnished with a double Murphy bed, queen sleeper sofa w/ foam topper (in the closet and see manual for instructions), end tables, lamps, coffee table, bistro table and chairs,  dishes, coffee maker, pots, and pans. Enjoy cooking with gas! Gas stove/oven, dishwasher, disposal, microwave, refrigerator, washer and dryer, smart TV, and WiFi. All bedding provided, towels and washcloths too! Monthly discounts can be found in the binder along with monthly events in Portland. The entire studio apartment! We are available for questions anytime. We are close to the University of Portland in a quiet neighborhood. One block south of Lombard w
neighborhood_overview: We are close to the University of Portland in a quiet neighborhood. One block south of Lombard which has a coffee shop, deli, pizza, Asian cuisine, and a couple bars within walking. New Seasons about a mile west. Columbia park the cities oldest and very beautiful park within walking and views of the city and forest park. If you love disc golf, head to Pier Park and toss it around! We are two miles east of Forest Park, St John’s iconic bridge, with a farmers market, several shops, and restaurants to enjoy.
transit: Lyft and Uber. A bus stop 1 block away. 15 minutes drive to downtown. Ample biking lanes. Free Street parking. **Please park on the side of the street the home/unit is located on.**

name: NW Terrace View Apt, near NW 23rd & Pearl!
description: A secluded apartment, serene environment with a view of Forest Park, Willamette River and Mt. St. Helen.   We are 5-10 min to most Portland attractions.  It feels like being in a tree house, where you enjoy lush greenery, bird watching and amazing sunsets. Large Bedroom with a comfortable plush queen bed overlooking Forest Park and Willamette River, newly remodeled bathroom with a rain shower system and a large sink, another large room with a queen Murphy bed that can be used as living room or second bedroom, tastefully remodeled kitchen features full size refrigerator, induction burners, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, dishes and silverware.  A/C and  new Washer/Dryer combo right IN UNIT! Guest have access to the entire apartment as listed and shown in pictures. Jim and I live in the upper unit.  We’re very respectful of our guests privacy.  However, we’re a text or call away if you need something or have a question.  We’re happy to share our livingroom and deck with you, should you
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the heart of the City, on a quiet dead-end street in the desired King’s Height neighborhood surrounded by beautiful homes and gardens. We are 5 min walk from our doorstep to the trails of Forest Park with amazing trails, 2.5 mi to Pearl district, and Downtown Portland, less than a mile to NW 23rd.   Also a very short drive (5-10) min to Moda Center and Providence Field (soccer & baseball). These areas are known for urban entertainments, theatre, nice shops, fabulous restaurants, breweries and pubs. Close proximity to Portland Timber’s home games, Powell bookstore, Japanese Garden, Oregon Zoo and many other attractions.
transit: we’re close to public transportation within 15-25  min of walk.  For getting around local attractions, we would suggest using Uber or Lyft basically not to deal with parking dilemma.  Should you choose to have your own car, there are plenty of parkings available on the street.

name: Multnomah Village Studio
description: Come visit beautiful Portland and stay in our private studio. Just 15-minutes from Downtown, the studio is perfect for two with a full bath and kitchen. Explore Multnomah Village or just hang out and listen to the wind in the trees. Come visit beautiful Portland and stay in our private studio. Just 15-minutes from Downtown, the studio is perfect for two with a full bath and kitchen. Explore Multnomah Village or just hang out and listen to the wind in the trees. This studio is a private mother-in-law addition attached to our 1937 home. It overlooks a green and woodsy half-acre we affectionately refer to as "The Shire". It's quite a sight to see in full bloom. Please feel free to wander around and smell the roses.  The studio has a super comfy bed, gets plenty of light, and has a private patio overlooking the yard.  We keep it clean, comfortable and classic with everything you need for a great stay in the Rose City. We have a big, beautiful woodsy property you're welcome to explore and t
neighborhood_overview: Multnomah Village has everything that's great about Portland without being right in the middle of the chaos. We're walking distance to food carts, a farm stand, great coffee, breakfast joints, fro-yo, bars (from classy to divey) and a Safeway. There are only two measly blocks standing between you and one of Portland's best selections of beer and wine! If you're into fresh air, check out nearby Gabriel Park. It's amazing.
transit: There is also a bus stop about three blocks away in the Village that will take you anywhere you want to go. Getting downtown takes about 20 minutes. If you have a car, we're within minutes of I-5 heading in either direction.

name: Rosedale Bedroom
description: Step into history by staying in the Rosedale Bedroom in our 1914 Craftsman home. Located one block off Hawthorne Blvd, the house is easily walkable to restaurants and shops, but quiet. It is also a pleasant one-mile walk to Mt. Tabor Park, where you can stroll to the top of an extinct volcano and experience an expansive view of the surrounding area, including Mt. Hood, on a clear day. Self Check-In: Access to the house is by keypad passcode, so there are no keys to exchange, and you are welcome to check yourselves in and out. We would be happy to welcome you if we are available but provide keypad access to give you more flexibility in arrival timing. Green Features: We participate in utility programs to offset the house's electricity use with renewable energy and its natural gas use with carbon offsets. Efficiency is also a priority, with LED lighting and low-flow water fixtures installed. Games: There are board and card games in the living room that you are welcome to use during your
neighborhood_overview: The Hawthorne area is known for its quirky restaurants and shops. The closest restaurants on Hawthorne are a 5-10 minute walk, with the center of the district and the Fred Meyer grocery store a 15-20 minute walk. Mount Tabor Park, an extinct volcano, is a 15-minute walk in the other direction. More information Division Street, a few blocks to the south, is also lined with restaurants and small shops. Our street and the adjoining neighborhoods are full of craftsman-style homes from the early 1900s.
transit: We recommend exploring Hawthorne and Division Streets and the surrounding residential neighborhoods by foot or bike if you are able. Downtown Portland can be reached by bike or bus in about 30 minutes, or 15-20 minutes by Lyft, Uber, or private car.

name: Basement apartment in SE Portland
description: Enjoy a private, roomy- 500sq ft, functional basement apartment in the up and coming Lents neighborhood of Southeast Portland! Within walking distance to light-rail, buses and less than 1/2 mile to major highways to go downtown or to the mountains. Quick and easy, straight shot commute to the airport. Enjoy your stay in Portland in your private studio, basement apartment.  Kitchenette has a mini fridge, freezer, 2 burner electric stove top, toaster oven, coffee pot, electric tea kettle, pots, tools, essential cooking foods (oils, spices). Flat screen TV with roku, set up for Netflix and Amazon. Bluetooth alarm clock. Hook up your phone and listen to anything you want! Queen sized bed plus a comfy L shaped couch that unfolds to a full sized bed. A tiny but functional bathroom with toilet, shower, sink, towels, hair dryer, shampoo, soap and conditioner. A clean pack and play is available for babies or toddlers. Please be aware that this is a basement and there is a family of 4 above you
neighborhood_overview: Lents is an old, historic neighborhood in Portland that has really boomed in the last year. Still within the metro area, it is less crowded than neighborhoods 2-4 miles away but still has tons of accessibility. New businesses and buildings are popping up daily, and a large walkable shopping/eating square is currently being built within 1/4 mile from this listing. 5 miles from downtown. 5 different food cart pods within walking distance to 3 miles away.
transit: Walking distance to the Foster Light Rail Stop on the MAX, and bus lines. Less than 1/2 mile from highway 205. Straight shot to and from the airport. Generous on street parking right next to house.

name: The Clay Hut: Private Bed&Bath in Backyard Garden
description: Located in the Central Eastside Industrial District, The Clay Hut is a cozy urban cabin set within a hidden oasis. Perfect for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers, guests love the hut for its central location, privacy, comfort, and charm. From the hut you can easily walk to countless critically acclaimed restaurants, breweries and coffee shops. We are just one mile (1.6 km) east of the Willamette River, which you can cross by way of the Hawthorne Bridge to enter Downtown Portland. The hut sits at the back end of our enclosed backyard. Between our house and the hut, there is a lush, shaded garden complete with a goldfish pond and fountain. The sound of trickling water promotes tranquility and helps to drown out noise from traffic and the popular bar nearby.  The bathroom is directly adjacent to the bedroom, although there is no door joining the two rooms. To access the bathroom, you have to take just 4 steps outside (this distance is completely covered by an awning), from t
neighborhood_overview: We are in the middle of a gastronomic smorgasbord, in every direction within walking distance you can find great food, coffee, and other treats. There is a liquor store across the street, and several marijuana dispensaries in the neighborhood. There are beautiful rose gardens in Ladd's Addition, and we are close to the river where you can hop on the Springwater Trail, which goes down to a wetland wildlife refuge. Or you can walk north along the river on the Eastbank Esplanade. If you're visiting during the weekend, be sure to check out Portland's Saturday Market via a pleasant walk over the Hawthorne bridge to the west side.
transit: If you come by car and the driveway is open when you arrive, you are welcome to park there, but we cannot guarantee parking in the driveway. Parking on the street directly in front of the house and throughout our neighborhood is free. There is no time limit for parking on our side of the street, but across the street a time limit is enforced during business hours, just pay attention to the street signs. Portland's public transportation system is called Trimet, and this includes dozens of bus, streetcar, and light-rail train lines. Please look up Trimet's website online where you can plan your trips, and view maps and schedules.

name: Best of Hawthorne
description: We are in the heart of all the fun of the Hawthorne district.  Walk to the  movie house, pizza, sushi, burgers, vegetarian and Grand Central Bakery.  Visit the legendary Mcmenamin's Barley Mill tavern just down the street Walk to downtown in 30 minutes or take the bus or rent a scooter or bike (right around the corner).   Parks abound and great hiking is nearby in the City at the Columbia Gorge or on Mt. Hood. Think of an urban tree house.  Light and airy.    Brand new. Opened summer (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Almost 500 square feet of space. Comfy queen bed with skylight right above.   Sofa bed for your guests. Full kitchen. Full bath. Roku tv with Netflix, Amazon and HBO.  AC if you need it. Parking  right outside if you are driving. Washer and dryer available. This is a totally separate unit from our home next door. Space available in garage below for your bikes, kayaks, etc. Mark can be reached by text and phone at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and Lois can be reached by tex
neighborhood_overview: The Hawthorne neighborhood reflects the best of Portland's urban Renaissance.  It's vibrant and quirky.  Fine dining if you want or affordable and delicious  food cart pods.  Distilleries, microbreweries and plain old pubs within a 30 minute walk or 10 minute bike, scooter or bus ride.  Parks abound close by. Movies, music and great shopping.  Just a great place to walk, bike or hang out.
transit: We are right off the #14 (Hawthorne) bus line. Rent a city bike right around the corner.   Lots of bike lanes. Only a 15 minute bike or bus ride to downtown. Try a Bolt or Lyme or Razor scooter.  We are 10 minutes from interstate 5 or 84. Free parking available on site

name: morrison street eco house
description: Newly constructed, fully detached private garden guest house in a quiet, beautifully landscaped setting in a close-in to downtown neighborhood. Two bedrooms & master bath upstairs. Half bath downstairs. High end kitchen. One block to Belmont restaurants and shops and short walk to Laurelhurst Park & Hawthorne retail district.  Ideal for singles/couples, business travelers, or small groups of families or friends. Suitable for families with non-crawling infants and/or children aged 3+. Morrison street eco house is a separate 800-squre foot home accessed through a courtyard garden alongside the main house. Light and airy and featuring reclaimed wood, the house is constructed for environmental sustainability and energy efficiency with exceptional indoor air quality. The house features oak floors throughout, low VOC finishes, wood windows, salvage fir trim and cabinets throughout. The house has two bedrooms and  master bath upstairs and a half bath downstairs. The house has a high efficienc
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is close-in SE Belmont/Hawthorne, just steps away from Belmont's restaurants and bars and a short walk from the Hawthorne district's shops, bars, theaters, and restaurants.
transit: Located close-in to downtown, the neighborhood is walkable to everything. Zipcars also are conveniently located a few blocks away and the bus stop for the 10 minute trip downtown is one block south.  For guests with cars, street parking is usually available or, if you let us know you are driving, we will reserve the driveway space for you. Arriving in an electric car? Level 2 EV charging available by request.

name: Private 2-Bedroom Home with Sun Deck
description: This newly updated home offers the right amount of natural light, lounge space, and modern touches to make your urban retreat to Portland one-of-a-kind. Private entrance to detached mother-in-law apartment is off a quiet neighborhood street. Includes a fully stocked kitchen, full bath, 1 main floor bedroom, 1 second floor loft bedroom plus a pull-out couch and private patio. Located minutes from PDX airport and a short ride to pubs, restaurants, and shopping in the Alberta Arts district. Perfect for traveling families or anyone looking for a relaxing place to rest in between exploring all that Portland and the Pacific Northwest has to offer. Two queen beds and a large pull out couch sleeps 5 comfortably, and a fully stocked kitchen makes cooking away from home a breeze. The main floor has 1 bedroom and a full bathroom with a bathtub and washer and dryer. The upstairs loft has another queen bed and full closet. The upstairs is a full size (and full ceiling height) bedroom, but is open t
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood (West Cully) is quiet and residential with lots of families. We are close to Fernhill Park which has a playground, splash pad, ball fields, a dog park, and free concerts in the summer. There are often people out walking their dogs, pushing strollers, or riding bikes on our street.
transit: Our neighborhood is quiet and residential. The closest public transit is a 1/2 mile walk and it takes approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour to reach downtown Portland via bus/train. We have parking available for 3 cars and are easily accessible for Lyft/Uber rides.

name: Spacious 5br/2ba Home in the Heart of the Action
description: Perfect home base for your group in one of Portland's premier entertainment districts. Spacious, well-appointed, and fully furnished, this victorian beauty is just one block off of one of the most eclectic and exciting neighborhoods in Portland.  Walkable to most everything you'll need for a great stay, yet it is a quiet retreat on a shady avenue.   We are less then 10 minutes from the heart of downtown, and just 5 minutes from the MODA center (concerts and Trailblazers!) This is a unique home with an eclectic mix of vintage and modern furnishings.  Enjoy the homey living room, the den and library upstairs, use our blazing fast gigabit WiFi, or create a culinary delight in the fully furnished kitchen.  Please enjoy the games, puzzles children's toys, natural light filling the sun room, and everything else that makes this home a special place. With three bedrooms upstairs and two on the main floor, there's plenty of room for your friends or entire family.  Hang out in our large fully eq
neighborhood_overview: One of Portland's premiere entertainment districts, all within a one minute walk from the house.  Let our home, full of character and charm be your base for your visit! Our neighborhood is the perfect example of quintessential Portland culture, combining creative originality and diversity with lots of independent energy.  Almost every business is locally owned and operated, including some of Portland's most talked about restaurants, entertainment venues, coffee shops, brew pubs, and boutique clothing stores.  This newly revived area has become one of the hippest places to shop, dine and imbibe. Colorful buildings line the main thoroughfare one block away,  and charming and bike friendly residential neighborhoods fill in the spaces around the central gathering spots This neighborhood, having evolved from its urban roots has a very pleasant boutique flair with ever-growing options continue to grow establish itself as one of the most diverse and unique shopping hot spots in Portland, whil
transit: Close to anywhere in the metro area by car, by public bike rental, or the TriMet MAX light rail line just 9 minutes walking from the house.  Our street is city designated as a major bicycle through way.

name: Brand New 2br in Great Portland Neighborhood!
description: ultimate location! This is a brand-new apartment in a super-fun Portland neighborhood. Steps from so many of restaurants, cafes, bars, and boutiques and convenient to the whole city. The apartment is spacious, open, and bright with two roomy bedrooms and one full bath.  Relax in the open kitchen/living area, equipped with a flat screen Roku TV and high speed internet. The queen-size sofa bed can accommodate a fifth and sixth guest.  Living Room Features: *Sofa bed to accommodate two guests (linens provided) *Flat Screen HDTV w/Roku and Sling for basic cable chaneels *High Speed Wi-Fi The large, modern kitchen is fully stocked with cooking essentials and dishware. You are invited to whip up a home-cooked meal in the open kitchen! Full Kitchen: *Stainless steel appliances with a microwave, dishwasher and electric range *Pots, pans and dishware provided *Coffee provided Bathrooms: *One full bath with tub/shower  *Hair Dryer *Iron and Iron Board *Top Quality Towels *Shampoo and Body Wash *
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in a trendy Northwest Portland neighborhood that is walkable to boutique shopping, coffee shops, restaurants, distilleries and art galleries. It is a lively, safe neighborhood that is convenient to downtown, the Pearl District and the entire city.
transit: There are many options to get around during your stay (we recommend ditching your car) The #15 bus stops right in front of the building and will bring you downtown in about 10 minutes and also connects to other street car and bus lines. Uber and Lyft are usually only a couple of minutes away Biketown bikeshare and Zip Car are also easy to use.

name: Beautiful and cozy treetop studio
description: Welcome :) If you are traveling solo, as a couple, for business, on holiday, visiting children at Reed College, or visiting relatives and friends then you have found the right spot. We offer you a beautiful, comfortable, and private treetop cedar studio space with your own bathroom and private entrance.  Enjoy the huge and unique Southeast treetops (Douglas Fir, Chestnut, Cedar, Apple, etc.) from your own private balcony with greenery and a bistro table.  The sunsets here are DELIGHTFUL! Please make use of the kitchenette with microwave, small refrigerator, coffeemaker, water boiler, mugs, cups, plates, bowls, utensils, table, and chairs for simple microwave style cooking, although we think you'll prefer the wonderful restaurants that we have available within walking distance from the home. There is a cute spiral staircase lit with bistro lights that is the only access point for the studio, so you must be comfortable going up stairs to stay with us. The studio has great stone heated fl
neighborhood_overview: The Woodstock neighborhood where we are located is one of the fastest growing, up-and-coming neighborhoods in all of Portland; it's also one of the most walkable!  We've included a binder of our favorite local spots and recommendations for how to spend any free time you might have.
transit: We are located two blocks from a well-connected bus stop, just up the corner on 52nd and Duke, that connects you to all other fun parts of town very easily.

name: Brand New Modern Sellwood Stunner
description: This private, all new construction apartment is an open, clean, and relaxing space to unwind. The original house structure was built in 1888. The old house was lifted by the same engineer that hung the Sellwood Bridge before a new foundation and this modern apartment unit were added.   Enjoy staying in a walk-able riverside neighborhood in SE Portland with parks, local artisan shopping, coffee & tea shops, award winning dining, food trucks, nightlife,  yoga/fitness studios, & public transit. This garden level apartment is full of amenities including all new refrigerator/freezer, range oven, microwave,  and dish washer. Guests will have full access and use of the apartment through their private entrance. A foyer and staircase separate the two units on the property behind a locked door. No access is provided to the foyer between the two units on the property. Your hosts, Margaret and Steve, will be a text/phone call away.  The hosts live in the unit above this Airbnb. Food trucks, boutiq
neighborhood_overview: Food trucks, boutiques, farm-fresh eats, garden inspiration, book shops, local artisan shopping, an amusement park, psychic readings, parks made for picnics, paddle boarding, tea and coffee shops; this neighborhood has something for all interests!  Sellwood is home to Oaks Bottom Wild Life Refuge where you'll feel like you've left the city's limits. There is also easy access to popular Springwater Bike Trail which runs along the river and links Sellwood into downtown Portland.  Enjoy staying 4 blocks from New Seasons, a wonderful neighborhood market. There are so many places to eat, drink, play, and relax, it's hard to highlight just a few. Be sure to ask your hosts for suggestions that cater to your travel plans.
transit: The apartment has a walk-ability score of 86 which is "very walk-able." Tacoma/Johnson Creek MAX Station is three quarters of a mile away. The Trimet bus stop is one block away. Hop on the bike trail just two blocks away which will take you all the way into downtown Portland.  Portland International Airport is a short 9 mile drive away.

name: Rustic tiny house overlooking Portland
description: Please read all of this before you book!  thank you! The "room" is a detached cabin fenced off from the rest of the backyard which you are welcome to enjoy. The feel of the space is  quiet, shady and peaceful. A cozy nook that I hope you feel at home and rested in. It has a spacious "outdoor" shower. It is actually fully enclosed but has a roof made of antique windows and is "rustic". The toilet is a composting toilet. Nothing is needed to operate it, just deposit paper in the bin. :) The tiny home was built as a tibetan retreat sanctuary and is incredibly peaceful.  There is a little lounge area with a hanging chair in the main room and a loft above containing a full-size bed with brand new organic sheets and duvet cover all washed prior to your arrival. We collect spring mineral water from one of the freshest springs in Oregon and there is a mini-fridge and a little oven where very basic meals can be prepared. Trees line the property so there is plenty of shade and greenery. And the
neighborhood_overview: We are part-way up Rocky Butte, an extinct volcanic cinder cone in NE Portland which provides some of the most gorgeous views of the greater Portland area including Mount Hood, Mount St. Helens and the Columbia Gorge.  We also have my favorite vintage theater (The Avalon) in our neighborhood and countless amazing (mostly Asian) restaurants.
transit: There is a bus stop just a short walk from the house. We are close to both the 84 and 205, and also Sandy Ave., which goes diagonally straight through Portland.

name: Classic Portland Walk-up - NW 23rd
description: This 1903, 1 bedroom apartment is charming, bright, clean and cozy (715 sqft) and right off NW 23rd and Raleigh.  Everything Portland is known for is out your back door; cafe's, shopping, library, post office, street car, and bus line. No car needed! 1 bedroom, corner apartment in 1903 8-plex.   Great queen bed, lovely cotton linens, down duvet, down pillows, and nicely appointed.  Lots of natural light and character.  Ironing board, hair dryer, microwave, fully furnished kitchen, Wedgwood cook stove and gas fireplace.  This is a vintage building with quirks, you can't run the microwave and blow dry your hair at the same time.  Freshly painted and new carpet.  Newly added window air conditioner in the bedroom. Upstairs, back unit with own entrance, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of NW 23rd. Lock box with key for late night/early morning arrivals. 2 night minimum. I'm happy to help how I can.  If you have any questions or special requests, let me know.  Available by phone or ema
neighborhood_overview: NW 23rd ave. is a great home base to explore Portland from.  Everything you'll need is within walking distance;  Forest Park hikes, shopping, great restaurants and cafe's, library and so much more. PARKING: .There is pay to park in front of the building on NW 23rd and on NW Raleigh. I sometimes can offer a daily, guest parking permit. Please inquiry.  Parking with this Zone M Parking Permit is allowed on Raleigh and other side streets.  However, it doesn't not cover the pay to park on NW 23rd Ave.
transit: You won't need a car here!  Bus #15 runs in front of the building.  The street car is a few blocks away.  If you are coming from the airport; take the Redline to Providence Park (The soccer Stadium) and then take the #15 bus west, down NW 23rd Ave.  Get off at NW 23rd and Raleigh.  The apt. building is on the NW corner.  There are 3 Biketown Stations within a block or 2 from the apt. for easy bike rental :) CAR RENTAL: Enterprise Rent a car on Burnside is closest.  They can pick up and drop off at the apt. ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).  Call to confirm if they have cars available.

name: Dance in my Foyer
description: Gorgeous large 2BR apartment in the heart of the trendiest neighborhood in PDX!  The 10' ceilings and floor to ceiling windows keep the space bright and airy.  Featuring a King semi-firm mattress in the main bedroom, Queen bed in the second bedroom that is the converted dining room. The private apartment is situated in a beautifully ornate updated Victorian Era Mansion.  Apartment is also available for month - month leasing at discounted price! This apartment is the formal parlor on the 2nd floor facing Flanders St. There is 1 apartment across the hall and 1 apartment above, both with full time tenants that help out from time to time. So, feel free to reach out to the neighbors! Common areas include: The herb garden, feel free to harvest herbs for meals made at home! Our garden is organic and pesticide free. Selection of herbs changes annually, the Golden Raspberries are abundant from June - October! The outdoor conversation areas in all areas of the property are available for everyone
neighborhood_overview: My place located at the beginning of "Trendy 3rd" the trendy Northwest Nob Hill Shopping and restaurant area. 1 short block away Trader Joe's is open from 8am-10pm, NW 21st Avenue is also popular for shopping, restaurants, health spas,  art galleries, and more! We are less than 1 mile from the Pearl District, the trolly going to the area is 6 blocks away.  The major arts centers, sport and event arenas are all walking distance if you're spry. Keller Auditorium, Downtown Hilton, Downtown Marriott are .9mi
transit: Our place is very quiet considering we are in the middle of downtown Portland!  Nike Bike Rental Station is 1/2 block away, electric scooters are usually parked right outside. Bus is 1/2 block away, trolly is 6 blocks away. Lyft/Uber are the most popular around here, the rates are incredibly low, and be ready as the cars are usually only 1 minute away!  Rentals: Car-to-Go is in the parking lot across the street, Nike bike rentals are across the parking lot, electric scooters are everywhere in spring-fall. This town is fairly flat, which makes it very walkable. There are several trails nearby for all ability levels. Hills, stairs, steep terain to wheelchair accessible nature trails. We even have exclusive pedestrian bridges!

name: Right on Hawthorne - w 2 perfectly cozy King beds
description: This lovely, spacious, duplex, home is just about as centrally located as one could get. Sitting right on the bustling Hawthorne Blvd our guests have everything they could possibly need and want from a Portland visit without walking more than 5 blocks. From the historic Baghdad theater, countless bars and restaurants, shopping boutiques, amazing coffee shops, several food cart pods, grocery stores, bodegas, and very entertaining people watching!  We invite you ALL to come stay!! This is a beautiful, fully restored 1912 Craftsman duplex. With freshly refinished hardwoods and bright white with bursts of color all around. The space is welcoming and has a very happy, calm vibe. The decor is minimalist, mid century modern, funky, comfortable, and oh so Portland. It was important to us to create a space that we would want to spend time in. We spent a lot of time going to antique stores and flea markets picking out just the right touches. From brass bedside lamps, vintage oriental rugs, uniqu
neighborhood_overview: This is one of my very favorite neighborhoods in Portland. I grew up here and have found myself back (about 10 blocks from my childhood home) after living all around town. Hawthorne has this very chill old Portland vibe that is very distinct to the city. If you're looking up our neighborhood online we are located right between the Richmond and Sunnyside neighborhoods. Both are rich with Portland culture and offer a stunning amount of things to keep you busy - even in the rainy months!
transit: We have a Walk Score of 100 out of 100!!  Take it from the folks at Walk Score online! "This location is a Walker’s Paradise so daily errands do not require a car." "This location is in the Sunnyside neighborhood in Portland. Nearby parks include Sewallcrest City Park, Sunnyside School Park and Piccolo Park." And just a bit further I really enjoy Mt. Tabor park that overlooks the whole city and into downtown. Also, another is Laurelhurst park with wonderful paths and a nice sized pond with all sorts of wildlife like birds and even turtles. Both are walkable but by bike or car it's just minutes.  "There are about 153 restaurants, bars and coffee shops in Sunnyside." "People in Sunnyside can walk to an average of 15 restaurants, bars and coffee shops in 5 minutes." "Sunnyside has good public transportation and about 4 bus lines passing through it." The #14 stops just one block away and can take you to downtown in as little as 15min. "Sunnyside has about 20 car shares from RelayRides, Zip

name: HAWTHORNE Wisteria Retreat
description: A private studio in a garden courtyard located in the heart of bustling Hawthorne and Division neighborhoods, this retreat offers walking access to countless top restaurants, boutiques, vintage stores, book stores independent movie theaters and more. There is ample street parking right infront of the house or very near. Newly constructed in 2013 this studio is bright, modern and has full amenities. Enjoy a fresh cup of brewed Coffee while relaxing on the couch in the sunlit room. Or sit at the table while you plan your day with the Bike There! and Walk There! maps. There is a full bathroom with bathtub, washer and dryer, full kitchen and a storage area for suitcases. There is one bed and a futon couch, perfect for kids or an extra adult to sleep on. (Please no more than two adults and two kids or three adults). We provide complimentary coffee and tea. Make use of our supplied cozy robes, hair dryer, wifi, ipod speaker dock, maps, brochures and a binder with activity suggestions A garde
neighborhood_overview: This delightful retreat, nestled under lush wisteria, is located in the heart of the most desirable part of inner Portland and is within walking distance of (just to name a few): •Unique boutiques and vintage shops on Belmont, Hawthorne and Division streets •A wide variety of restaurants including some of the most sought after, fine dining establishments- Pok Pok, Ava Jean’s, Bollywood Theater, Nuestra Cocina, Three Doors Down, and many more •Powell’s Books on Hawthorne and Powell’s Books for Home and Garden •Bakeries- Grand Central, Little T’s, St. Honore, Roman Candle •Independent movie theaters- Clinton St. Theater, Cinemagic, and Bagdad theater and pub •Grocery stores- Safeway, New Season’s, Fred Meyer and Zupan’s •Ice cream- Salt and Straw, 50 Licks, Maple Parlor, Ben and Jerry’s  •Breakfast cafes- Jams, Genies, Pine State Biscuits, Cup and Saucer, Bread and Ink, Slappy Cakes •One of the newest and BEST Food Cart Pod’s in Portland (Division and 28th) •Bus and Max train lines to do
transit: This unit is located within walking distance of many Portland attractions, and has easy access to the bus and Max lines as well as many bike paths, such as the Spring Water Corridor and the downtown Esplanade. There are NIke rental bike stations just blocks away. There is street parking directly in front of the house. Zip Car stations are only blocks away. If you have a car it is easy to access major highways to travel to surrounding areas.

name: Luxurious hideaway in vibrant Alberta Arts
description: Enjoy old farmhouse charm with all the comforts of new modern amenities. Stylish one-bedroom basement guest suite in beautifully renovated home.  Completely private space with separate entrance, just blocks from Alberta Street.  Fully equipped kitchen with all you could need for cooking in or making coffee. Very comfy queen-sized adjustable Tempurpedic bed. The living room also has a pull-out sofa, with a queen-size gel mattress. Owners occupy the upstairs. Tastefully appointed , 1-bedroom basement apartment, which was designed and built as part of an entire top-to-bottom home renovation. The apartment flows to maximize space, privacy and comfort. Cork floors provide warmth to the space. Brand new kitchen and bathroom. Separate private entrance to downstairs apartment. No shared interior space. Backyard is accessible to guests, and has a gas grill. Access to the upstairs part of the house to use the laundry machine is negotiable upon request. We're very friendly and approachable. If yo
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location!  Quiet residential block a couple blocks from bustling Albert Street.  The Alberta Arts District is home to some of the best Portland has to offer including amazing restaurants/eateries (Pinestate Biscuits, Salt & Straw, Beast, Tin Shed, Barista, Helsers, Podnah's, La Taq, Handsome Pizza, Pokpok, Grain & Gristle, food carts galore, and on and on) and local merchants. Easily accessible to other great NE neighborhoods (Mississippi, Williams, Dekum, Alameda), and only a 20 minute bike ride, short uber/lyft ride, or a bus ride to downtown. Be sure to check out last Thursdays on Alberta, Art in the Pearl, Sauvie Island, one of our local farmer's market, or a movie in the park (seasonal and weather permitting). Only a 30 minute drive to beautiful Multnomah Falls! PDX pipeline is also a great online resource for events.
transit: 20 minute drive to/from PDX, 20  minute bike ride or 10 minute drive to downtown, close to #8 bus to downtown, #72 bus line to MAX Yellow Line, zipcar stall a few short blocks away. Bicycle rental available through spinlister, or other nearby brick-and-mortar locations. Street parking on our street is easy and almost always available.

name: Modern Guest House in North Portland
description: Very Charming newly updated guest house in conveniently located North Portland.  Easy and quick access to Downtown & The Pearl, and all of Portland's major attractions. Very short walk to coffee shops & restaurants, and only a quarter mile to Adidas HQ.  Convenient bus stop and the MAX yellow train line. I live with 2 roommates in the main house, all very busy working professionals, so we aren't always around but may see you when we're coming or going.  Jeff is my cohost and will handle all correspondence and handle any issues. He's available by phone, text, or AirBnB messaging any time. Located in desirable Arbor Lodge in north Portland.  It's a quiet area and people comment what great sleep they have here!  This is a walkable neighborhood with Arbor Lodge Park four blocks away.  Beautiful University of Portland is 3 miles with an overlook of the Columbia River.  The Adidas campus is only about 5 blocks away. Killingsworth street (half-block away) has several restaurants and coffee sh
neighborhood_overview: Located in desirable Arbor Lodge in north Portland.  It's a quiet area and people comment what great sleep they have here!  This is a walkable neighborhood with Arbor Lodge Park four blocks away.  Beautiful University of Portland is 3 miles with an overlook of the Columbia River.  The Adidas campus is only about 5 blocks away. Killingsworth street (half-block away) has several restaurants and coffee shops.
transit: Jeff has rental cars available on (Website hidden by Airbnb) and provides discounts. BUS & TRAIN:  The bus is very convenient in Portland and makes stops on Killingsworth, which is only a block away from Ignacio's Airbnb.  Also, the Max train stops about half a mile away on Killingsworth and Interstate Ave. BIKE SHARE:  Portland's BikeTown bike share has a kiosk only a block away on N Burrage and Killingsworth. APPS:  You can down load these apps for help.  As a reference, Ignacio's place is close to the intersection of N Wilbur Ave and N Killingsworth. "PDX bus" for bus/train routes and schedules "TriMet  Tickets" to buy and use tickets on your phone "BikeTownPDX" for Portland's bike share locations and details Also, Lyft and Uber are readily available in Portland.

name: FoPo studio apartment
description: Light bright basement apartment in the heart of the Foster Powell neighborhood. Separate side entrance with key pad. Portland Mercado Food trucks and FoPo food trucks right around the corner. Walk 1-2 blocks for bus stops that take you to the Hawthorne district and Downtown. Otherwise take two of our bikes and ride along the Spring Water Corridor. Close to Mt. Scott community center (lap pool, kids waterpark, gym, $5). Bright basement studio apartment.  Stocked kitchenette, induction stove (no oven), toaster oven, washer and dryer, plenty of parking and walking distance to food carts, bars, breweries, groceries and public transportation.  The studio has a queen bed and an ottoman that folds out into a cot for a maximum number of 3 guests.  We have a steaming cable service and Roku with Netflix, Hulu and prime videos. Bikes, kayak, tubing and BBQ available for use.  Notes: Ceilings are a little low- anyone over 6’0 may feel a little claustrophobic. The house was built in 1910 and althou
neighborhood_overview: Plenty of food carts, tap rooms, brewery, bars, restaurants, parks and groceries.
transit: Public transportation is easily accessible. We are close to the airport and about 20 min to downtown by car, 45 min by bus and about 30 min by bike.

name: Explore Ptown then rest & relax here - pets ok
description: A spacious, colorful and cozy 1910 house in SE Portland with a well-stocked kitchen, big common areas to hang out, and a huge deck and yard.  It's close to some of the best restaurants and bars in town, and an easy walk to groceries, BIKETOWN bikes , and public transit. I will accept well behaved dogs, but I do ask for an extra cleaning fee of $40.  Walk Score=95 Our house was built in 1910 and has that great old-Portland feel, and is colorful and spacious but still feels very cozy. The house in a residential neighborhood of houses and apartments a few blocks south of Division.  The back deck and yard are big and ready for BBQ and lounging. The first floor has lots of room to spread out and be comfortable. It's a great layout, with kitchen, family, half bath and dining room all on the first floor. The kitchen is large (the photos don't do it justice)  and fully stocked for all your cooking needs.  Portland is Portland (and the rain invariably forces us all inside!) the large couch is i
neighborhood_overview: We live in the west end of the Division / Clinton neighborhood with an incredibly easy drive (or a longer walk) to everything. (For example New Season Grocery is a 7 min walk or a 4 min drive, and all the Division street restaurants are about a 10 min drive, see more below)  We're also right at the southern edge of the Central Eastside neighborhood. There's been a massive influx of amazing restaurants, breweries, and distilleries over the last few years. Please take a look at my Guidebook on the AirBnB site for an overview and location of many great spots. Restaurants:  Lots and lots of great beer and cocktails abound. Check out the guidebook through AirBnB. Also, Check out the travel portland website for some good resources on brewery tours and restaurants to visit.  Groceries:  New Seasons grocery (great selection and beer and wine too) is 6 blocks away, and Peoples Co-Op is only 2 blocks.   Elsewhere:  OHSU and Downtown are an easy 2.5 miles away and there are several close bus line
transit: Uber & Lyft are great options. Car2Go is an amazing car sharing app. Plan ahead and create an account at least a week before your trip. Validating your drivers license takes so time. Electric Scooters - Bolt, Lime and Spin and more coming. Biketown Portland: A city wide bike rental system that allows you (through an app) to pick up a bike and drop it off somewhere else. Brilliant!  Buses:  We have easy access (5 min walk) to multiple bus lines to get just about anywhere; downtown, OHSU, etc. Clinton is a main bike path and you really could get anywhere in Portland on a bus.

name: Portland Cottage with Kitchenette
description: Our cottage is in a quiet southwest Portland neighborhood. It includes a pillow top queen size bed, microwave, refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, toaster oven, 2 burner hotplate, hair dryer, soap & shampoo.  Easy access to I-5 and downtown Portland by car or public transportation. This quiet studio provides a peaceful escape whether you are in town on business or pleasure.  The 250 square feet includes a full bathroom with shower.  It features a pillow top bed (high thread count sheets during warm months and cozy flannel sheets during  cooler months), microwave, refrigerator, 2 burner hotplate, Keurig coffee maker, toaster oven, AM/FM clock radio, TV, ceiling fan, hair dryer, soap, shampoo and access to wired or wireless internet. Guests enjoy their own private studio in the gardens behind the main house.  Enjoy a glass of wine on the deck while relaxing before dinner at one of Portland's many award winning restaurants, or eat in with the kitchenette. Access is by a lighted path around
neighborhood_overview: We are in a quiet neighborhood yet close to all Portland has to offer.  Whether you look for nightlife, restaurants, theater, farmers markets or outdoor activities like hiking, biking and skiing.  Portland has it all!
transit: Easy access to Interstate 5 a half mile from the house.  There are always Uber & Lyft drivers nearby.  Convenient Trimet bus stop for the number 44 bus two blocks from the house. The Trimet transit center a half mile from the house with commuter parking provides additional options including express service to downtown Portland.

name: Tastefully Remodeled Spacious Miraloma Retreat
description: Unwind in this beautiful Miraloma Park home, light-filled, spacious and thoughtfully remodeled, with lots of amenities. The house boasts a large Living Room and open Dining Room - not to mention the awesome remodeled kitchen with exceptional high end appliances. Comes with 2 car tandem private parking. Walking distance to Mollie Stone's (Grocery store),dry cleaners and Starbucks.  Easy hop onto the highway 280 and 101 and 20 minutes drive to Downtown SF. Close to Glen Park BART Station. I am easy to reach :) Miraloma Park is a centrally located (geographically) in SF, and is an overall safer and family friendly neighborhood. It is very close to Glen Park Bart (a few mins drive) and around 20 mins drive to downtown SF. Super close to highways 280 and 101. It is very close to Glen Park Bart (a few mins drive) and around 20 mins drive to downtown SF. Super close to highways 280 and 101.

name: Beach Cottage
description: Enjoy the beach, cafes and restaurants all within walking distance of this cozy cottage in the Outer Sunset.  The bedroom has a comfy queen bed and there is a queen sleeper sofa for overflow. The kitchen is modern and updated, and opens to a dining room. You'll find Cable TV, wi-fi, a washer/dryer, and a fully stocked kitchen. If the weather is nice, you can enjoy the yard, and a covered outdoor dining area. This home has a unique park-like setting, set back from the street with a nice front yard. There is a tranquility inside and out. It's best suited for parties of one or two, but there is also a queen sleeper located on the attic level. The bedroom is bright and opens to the living room, with sliding barn-style doors that can be closed to separate the bedroom from the living room.  The doors have glass panels, so there is not a great deal of privacy between this room and the living room. Mi casa es su casa. When I don't have guests, I live here, and love to cook, so it's well-stocke
neighborhood_overview: I love this neighborhood ... ... for its proximity to the beach,  ... for the laid-back attitude, ... for its walkability to fun cafes and restaurants, ... for the fact that it can be overlooked and underestimated (but those in the know savor the little secret :) )
transit: There are several public transportation options nearby. The San Francisco Muni Streetcar N-Judah can be accessed at Judah and 46th Ave. and is a great connection to downtown. The 71 Bus runs down Noriega The 18 bus runs down 46th Ave.

name: Fully renovated suite - quiet, private, safe area
description: A beautiful, private, 1-bedroom suite in a safe, peaceful, quiet neighborhood with easy free parking in central San Francisco awaits you! The suite is on the home's first level, with a bedroom with queen bed, a living room, bath, and an outside deck and beautifully landscaped yard—both of which are clean, flat areas large enough for morning exercise, and suitably quiet for meditation or yoga. It's everything needed for a comfortable and relaxed stay in a  safe, quiet, and peaceful neighborhood. Whether you will be here seeing relatives living in the area, visiting a student at one of the nearby colleges/universities, attending a convention or other business function, participating in one of San Francisco's many events, or simply spending time exploring this great city, the suite provides everything needed for a comfortable and relaxed stay in a neighborhood that is safe, quiet, and peaceful.  Features ~ entire property renovated/updated in 2018 ~ great choice for solo adventurers, coup
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located in one of San Francisco's safe and quiet residential neighborhood with plenty of free, non-metered street parking (rare in San Francisco). The central location provides easy access to downtown San Francisco by car, SF MUNI or BART transit systems. Within close proximity is San Francisco State University, City College of San Francisco, the San Francisco Zoo, Ocean Beach, and the famous Stern Grove Summer Music Festival—all within a 5-15 minute drive away. The location is convenient to nearby public transportation, highways I-280/US-101/SR-1, and minutes from downtown San Francisco and SFO airport. It's a great location for exploring the city, or getting to the Peninsula and Silicone Valley. Business travellers welcome. ~ convenient to many public transportation options ~ easy access to highways I-280 and 101  ~ 2 minute walk to MUNI stop on Monterey Boulevard ~ 5 minute walk to Safeway grocery (open until midnight) ~ 10 minute walk to San Francisco City College ~ 1
transit: ~ easy access to highways I-280,  US-101, and SR-1 (19th Avenue) ~ 2 minute walk to MUNI stop on Monterey Boulevard ~ 5 minute walk to Safeway grocery (open until midnight) ~ 10 minute walk to San Francisco City College ~ 12 minute walk to Glen Park BART station ~ 10-20 minute drive to downtown San Francisco and SFO airport  ~ close proximity to restaurants and shopping districts at Glen Park, West Portal, and Ocean Avenue

name: Red Victorian- Eden Hostel single bed shared room
description: Eden is a shared hostel bedroom with half bathroom located in the historic Red Victorian, near Haight-Ashbury. This listing is for the single bed pictured, intended for one guest. The Red Victorian is an experimental community run hotel that offers unique guest experiences. While here, we invite you to attend events: lectures & talks, skill shares, music nights, art shows! Near Golden Gate Park and Twin Peaks, this central location also offers easy direct lines to both downtown and the beach. This single bed is the first one found inside Eden, a huge beautiful well-lit room. Located on the top floor, Eden is the sunniest room in the house and filled with light and plants. The room is also the quietest room in the house (furthest from the street), and is located directly across from the cozy third floor lounge. It has its own private bathroom. It used to be the room that Sami Sunchild (the Red Victorian’s founder) once occupied. - Self check-in from 4pm onwards. Self check-out at 11am.
neighborhood_overview: Haight-Ashbury is an incredible relic of San Francisco’s past. The neighborhood, also known as “The Haight” or “Upper Haight”, succinctly personifies the City’s history, aesthetic, and culture. It is perhaps the most colorful swath of acreage in San Francisco, and remains one of the last-standing neighborhoods to retain an eccentric personality. The Haight rose to fame during the Counterculture Movement during the Vietnam War era; it became a regular feature in international news headlines and incited a global initiative for social change with special thanks to the 1967 Summer of Love, and a little help from Janis Joplin and the Grateful Dead. The Haight-Ashbury neighborhood is nestled in between three parks: Golden Gate Park, the Panhandle, and Buena Vista Park, making it somewhat of an urban oasis.  Within the parks you'll find: Museums, botanical gardens, seasonal music festivals, and a tea garden. We recommend: - Eating at a one of the delicious restaurants or food trucks, or catch
transit: How to get here from SFO airport :  > By Public Transit : Board the BART towards San Francisco. Get off at the UN Plaza stop and walk to the northwest corner of Market St. Board the 7 or 7R Bus to Haight and get off at the Clayton St Stop. Walk to 1665 Haight St. You can also take the 6 to Masonic St, and walk 3 blocks to The Red Vic.  > By Car Share Taxi : If you have a smart phone and access to the internet you can take advantage of one of the car sharing services in San Francisco. These services offer a convenient app, faster pick-ups and lower prices than taxis. You can use Lyft or Uber.  For Lyft, use the code KYLE2242 to get $10 in free rides. Lyft has multiple services and Lyft Line will be the least expensive option.  For Uber, use the code FFT3C to get $10 in free rides. Uber has multiple services and Uber Pool will be the least expensive option.  > By Taxi Service : You can call Yellow Cab for a pickup.  Valet Parking: Another option which we have heard good things about is L

name: BR+Private Bath in Artsy Sanctuary❣
description: A shared master bedroom in a fabulous apartment atop Twin Peaks. Our unique corner 2 floor 3 bedroom 2.5 bathroom is one of the greatest apartments that San Francisco has ever built. It easily sleeps 6 people and comfortably accommodates a large dinner party. The master bedroom offered here runs worm and it is pretty quite for a city apartment. I do have an amazing fan for the rare hot days  If police and/or ambulance sirens pass by the street you will hear them very loudly The best thing about this place is that it's split up in The perfect way There is two floors The first floor is a guest bathroom, kitchen and the living room all open, that is the shared space. There is also a balcony!! upstairs are the bedrooms, you have access to "Mama bear" the master bedroom that I will personally show you, when you check-in In the garage there is a room that has a coin operated washing machine and dryer There is also the building picnic area. Everybody that lives in the building has access to P
neighborhood_overview: There are AWSOME hiking trails up on the peaks  If you like peace and quite, and amazing views of the city  Grocery store across the street, some restaurants, gas station, and the neighborhood bar.
transit: Bart "glen park station" is 1 mile away down hill  The underground muni "Forrest hill station" is .5 miles away down hill the other way  There are also muni busses that will take you anywhere the 44 is my favorite the bus stop is attached to my building and it will take you to the Bart and right across the street if you take it, it will take you to the underground or golden gate park  The 48 takes you to the mission  And there are a couple of more busses too  It's faster than taking the car

name: Real SF: renovated gem
description: Period home is infused with modern amenities and San Francisco flair! Friendly hosts just around the corner ready to orient, advise to make your stay amazing. Very close to highways 101 and 280- a quick journey to Silicon Valley and all San Francisco has to offer.  Well-appointed and designed, amenities include: dishwasher, microwave, Nespresso and drip coffee maker, gas range, fully equipped kitchen, laundry, available cleaning service, quiet location, art from awarded local photographer. A modern update to a typical 1940's home in a sunny area of San Francisco.  This home enjoys lots of natural light and charm. You'll have access to the full upper floor of the home, as well as the laundry in the garage. We live across the street and down  five doors.  Would love to host you for a glass of wine at the beginning of your stay and answer any questions you have! Soak up the rays in an area that's usually brighter than the rest of the city. The diverse, working-class neighborhood is curren
neighborhood_overview: Soak up the rays in an area that's usually brighter than the rest of the city. The diverse, working-class neighborhood is currently experiencing gentrification. Highways 101 and 280 are very close, offering fast access to Silicon Valley and beyond.
transit: There is street parking available, fairly easy to get on our block.  The Muni Metro T line is 1 1/2 blocks away, and there are a couple other bus lines within a block or two.

name: Luxurious, Sunny Victorian - Alamo Square
description: Our quintessential (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s Victorian home in San Francisco awaits you!  Professionally designed, luxurious spaces, fully equipped gourmet kitchen.  Walking distance to Alamo Square & the Painted Ladies + hip Divisadero, Hayes Valley and Fillmore/Pacific Heights neighborhoods! Registered with San Francisco: STR (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Our home is spacious and sunny with three bedrooms and 2.5 newly renovated bathrooms on the upper two levels of our three-story (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Victorian in the historic Alamo Square district of San Francisco.  There is a double parlor - living room and family/media room as well as dining room and fully equipped kitchen.  Upstairs, there are three bedrooms (one ensuite) and 2 full bathrooms.  Our outdoor space includes a deck off the kitchen with outdoor seating and gas BBQ.  Downstairs, there is a lower level "reading" garden with two chaises. We look forward to welcoming you and are happy to share our nei
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood!  It's between beautiful Alamo Square Park (3 blocks away) with the famous row of Painted Ladies and killer city views, hip Divisadero Street with great boutiques and restaurants, Hayes Valley, and Fillmore Street with live music, restaurants, and some of the best shopping in the city.  We'll send you lots of information after you book.
transit: From our home, you can easily connect with public transportation (MUNI) a couple blocks away, hire a Scoot scooter, download the ride share apps (Lyft or Uber) or walk.  To hire a Scoot scooter, just sign-up online and take a 45 mins lesson and off you go!  Guests also report that GoCar is a very fun way to see the city - check it out online as well.   We recommend downloading a smartphone app called Moovit so you can easily navigate MUNI and public transport in the City.  The app is easy and shows you when to get off a bus (or other public transport mode), distances, time, etc. PARKING: Our neighborhood mostly requires a Residential Parking Permit for more than 2-4 hours parking on the street between 9 a.m. - 8 p.m on weekdays.  There is some (but limited) free, on-street parking available next to our house which we can assist you with.   No parking permit needed for free, on-street parking near our home on weekends.  You can also park in a nearby garage - Fillmore Center Garage - abo

name: Bliss in Bayview - 4 beds/3 baths with parking
description: Enjoy your home away from home in this newly renovated designer home with modern amenities. Take advantage of everything the city has to offer just a short drive away, and come home in the evening to relax in your private spa. Remodeled in 2017, our home is an ideal vacation spot in San Francisco. The home is located in the sunniest part of the city and minutes away from all the tourist attractions.  The home has been lovingly decorated with photography from our travels and other materials that inspire us. One bedroom has an en-suite bath, one other hall way bath is used by one room, and the lower floor has a hall way bath that is shared by two rooms. Bayview is a transitional family neighborhood with a vibrant art culture. It's sunny most of the year and has its own friendly charm. Best way to get here is by car or uber/lyft. There is a public bus stop half block away and a Muni (subway) stop 5 blocks away. Highway 101 and 280 are both within 10 mins drive. Two cars can be parked in t

transit: Best way to get here is by car or uber/lyft. There is a public bus stop half block away and a Muni (subway) stop 5 blocks away. Highway 101 and 280 are both within 10 mins drive.

name: Spacious Flat With Garden Near Alamo Square
description: Great home base when experiencing San Francisco! We have two years of positive hosting experience from 2016-18. You will love this classic SF Edwardian full-floor flat with 6 bright rooms plus kitchen and 1.5 baths. Larger than pictures show! Centrally located in NOPA, close to Alamo Square & The Painted Ladies, Golden Gate Park (with the California Academy of Science, DeYoung Museum, Conservatory of Flowers and Botanical Garden). Walk to shops and bars on Divisadero, Haight Street, Castro. Open the private front door and walk up a lovely hardwood staircase to this second-floor flat with light and airy rooms. In the front, a living room with an antique fireplace and a queen-sized sofa bed is connected by French doors to the master bedroom. An office has a twin-sized day bed. Both the front living room and office look out over a quiet street with mature trees and well-maintained Victorian/Edwardian homes. A hallway connects to a shoes/coat nook, a kids room with bunk beds, a WC, and a f
neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet residential street one block from hip Divisadero, which has some of the best cafes, live music, ice-cream, soul food and sushi in the city. There is a great farmers market around the corner on Sundays.  All the cool bands play at The Independent, a block away. You can people-watch at bakery The Mill, read the news at Mojo bicycle cafe, taste the flavors at Bi-rite, a gourmet grocery and ice-cream stop, and brunch at Brenda's. For foodies, nearby Jun-ni recently earned a Michelin star.  We are also just a few blocks from parks or playgrounds where kids and adults can bike and run.
transit: Direct bus lines to ocean beach, downtown/ferry terminal, and shopping district (Union Square). Kids under 12 ride free!  Walk to Haight/Ashbury, Alamo Square, Painted Ladies, Golden Gate Park, and numerous museums. Rent bicycles on Haight street to bike over Golden Gate Bridge. Many Tour buses have stops nearby,  Lyft and Uber are very common, and there is a service called Chariot that can also take you around.  If you have a car, free street parking os available, usually within one block.
