name: Balena Blu - Suite with Ocean Views
description: Newly refurnished private bedroom, kitchen, and bathroom with access to a living room and deck.  There are spectacular views of the ocean and you are steps from Lands End, Sutro Park, and Ocean Beach. The bedroom has an extremely comfortable king size bed and blackout shades.  It also offers breathtaking views of the ocean.  The kitchen is fully equipped by and for people who love to cook.  The bathroom has a spacious shower.  The shared living room is quite comfortable and used only by us for access to the back yard and laundry. You will have private use of the bedroom and bathroom.  We will not be using the kitchen or living room, but we will need to walk through them to access the backyard and laundry.   Guests are welcome to use the backyard and deck. We live in the house on the top floor.  We are available to help with local recommendations. We are in a quiet neighborhood in the northwest corner of the city.  This is a great location for people who love to hike, surf, or enjoy nat
neighborhood_overview: We are in a quiet neighborhood in the northwest corner of the city.  This is a great location for people who love to hike, surf, or enjoy nature.  We are walking distance to Ocean Beach, the Cliff House, Sutro Baths, and the Legion of Honor.
transit: Steps away from public transportation and plenty of free street parking.  If you don't mind the hills, it is also easy to get around the city by bike.

name: Beautiful Flat in the heart of the Marina District
description: Looking for luxury in a quintessential gem of San Francisco? Look no further. Get in your element in this top floor two bedroom apartment- walking distance to Golden Gate Bridge, Presidio, Crissy Fields, Marina Green, Fort Mason, etc. Would you also like unobstructed views of the GG Bridge and Alcatraz? Shopping, bars, restaurants? You’ve got it! All of this and more could be yours. Happy booking! The view of this idyllic paradise is calling you. Don’t ignore it. One bedroom, one bath apartment on the top floor. The Union Street neighborhood is known as one of the top 5 neighborhoods in the nation for young adults to live yet has also kept its historic victorian setting. The neighborhood is full of boutiques, yoga and fitness studios, restaurants, sports bars, coffee shops and so much more. The Marina is a short walk away and offers countless activities such as biking and beach access. There is a bus stop 1 minute from the apartment.

name: Charming home in San Francisco!
description: 100+yr old home oozing with charm & character - yet tucked in a quiet & safe San Francisco neighborhood.  Enjoy your backyard oasis!  Sunroom!  Gourmet kitchen!  Parking + walk to public transit or hop on 101 or 280. Your home away from home! This 100+ year old beautifully maintained single-family home oozes with charm and has every convenience.  The neighborhood is single family homes - quiet and safe.   Easy on/off to 101 or 280, excellent transportation or commute options.  QUIET neighborhood! Overall 2+ Bdr + garden studio retreat (detached from house), 2 BA + Living Room, Dining Room, Kitchen, Sunroom. Upstairs:  2 Bedrooms (each with queen beds), + full bathroom (clawfoot tub/shower combo) Main Floor:  Newly remodeled spa bath (shower), living room with TV/Wii/DVD and sofa (can sleep 1), Dining room, giant gourmet kitchen, huge covered sunroom (daybed/twin mattress), fireplace, outdoor kitchen. Sonos sound system throughout main floor. Basement:  Washer + dryer, air hockey table
neighborhood_overview: Mission Terrace is a rare find in the city!  Parking is included.  A 10-15 min walk to two Bart stations, city location but QUIET!  Most places in the city have buses, trolleys and cable cars running right next to the apartment.   Safe single family neighborhood with convenient locations to 101 and 280.  Walk to grocery, restaurants, etc.   2 blocks to park, tennis courts, pool, etc.
transit: A 2 block walk brings you a plethora of bus, light rail and Bart transportation options (Balboa Park and Glen Park).  Super convenient to 101 and 280 - most neighborhoods in SF are nowhere near highways and it can take 30-40 minutes just to cross town to get to highway. Uber is excellent - download the app!  Generally a car arrives within 5 minutes.

name: Garden Studio in the Lower Haight
description: Welcome to the Lower Haight. The neighborhood is filled with cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, and salons. Spend the day walking around and sampling the local flavor or grab a blanket and spend an afternoon in one of the nearby parks (Alamo Square, Duboce Park, Golden Gate Park, Dolores Park). The studio has a private entrance and is furnished with a queen bed, down-alternative comforter, and linens. There is a complete kitchen which features basic utensils, gas stove, oven, microwave, and refrigerator. Access to the studio is through a private door off the side of the building. The studio looks onto the garden and gets great sunlight in all rooms. However, there is no access to the garden or the garage. I live upstairs and have lived in the Lower Haight for 20 years. I usually like to check in with guests during their visits to ensure all is well and see if anything is needed. I am happy to provide recommendations and tips for getting around the city and I am available via email, text,
neighborhood_overview: Located in one of San Francisco's most bohemian and central neighborhoods, I offer a large sunny studio with a very comfortable queen bed and private bathroom. The studio is located on Page Street which is one block from the trendy shops, restaurants, art galleries, and salons of the Lower Haight. It is walking distance to beautiful Alamo Square (home of the fabled "Painted Ladies" Victorian homes), Hayes Valley, Castro, Mission, NOPA, the Panhandle, Golden Gate Park, Upper Haight, and Civic Center. Public transportation is only steps away with public bus and Metro service (MUNI) to Downtown, BART, and Ocean Beach. Freeway access is a short drive to both north and south bound directions.  There are many restaurants and cafes, steps away... Uva Enoteca (Italian), Thep Phanom (Thai), Axum Cafe (Ethipoian), Maven (American), NOPA (Urban Rustic), Nopalito (Mexican), L'Ardoise Bistro (French), Indian Oven, Suppenkuche (German), Woodhouse Seafood, Chow (American), Memphis Millie's (BBQ), Caf
transit: The Studio is located one block from the 22 Fillmore bus stop which will take you allover town. It is also one block from Haight Street where you can catch the 6, 7, 71 bus lines. The N-Judah and J-Church Metro lines are a 5 minute walk, with the other 3 lines only a block further. The Silicon Valley tech shuttle buses stop only three blocks away. There is free, non-metered street parking in the neighborhood, which require residential permits during the day, but is available at night. Street parking is unlimited on weekends.

Bare bottle brewery, Epicurean Trader store, Holy Water bar, Good life groceries, Bernal Heights Park with 360 views of S.F. Blackjet bakery, Little bee bakery, Third Cousin restaurant. name: Magical Luxury Harry Potter themed 2 BR 1 BA
description: Come enjoy a night of wonder at this magical Harry Potter getaway! Enjoy the amenities of a brand new apartment building just steps away from Civic Center while nerding out in this muggle friendly Hogwarts set up. This listing is set up for dates that I'm out of town so you will have access to the entire 2 bedroom apartment (except my closet space which will be locked). You are also welcome to enjoy the gym, business center, and terrace located on the 2nd floor. The apartment is on the top floor of the Ava building right off of Civic Center near 9th and Market. If you can't tell, I'm a huge Harry Potter fan but don't let that intimidate you if you just need a place to stay. In keeping with Airbnb's #weaccept campaign, I welcome all muggles, squibs, wizards, witches, warlocks, elves, goblins, centaurs, mermaids, and even the occasional werewolf. I do not however accommodate trolls of any kind, so be sure and register all of our guests through the platform so they are included in the rev

transit: If you forgot your broom, the muggles have a train system called BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) which is only a quaffel throw away! If you haven't downloaded Uber or Lyft, let me know so that I can send you a link for a discount for 1st time users.

name: Spacious charming 1 bedroom suite!
description: This is a beautiful, renovated place.  One bedroom suite on the second level in our 3-story house, queen bed + a full sofa bed, flat screen cable TV + Netflix, breakfast area. Stunning Views! Parking! Transportation! Would you enjoy the futile search for parking, collecting parking tickets, and paying a small fortune for a tiny place overlooking neighboring wall?  If so, our place is not for you... But if you prefer a  private, quiet,  comfortable, and affordable place in San Francisco's upscale neighborhood where free street parking is not a problem, read on! This spacious (450 sq feet) suite is located on the second level of our 3-story house. It has a separate private entrance.  In the living room, there is a kitchenette with a full-size refrigerator, microwave, toaster and a coffee machine.  We do not offer a stove. Towels, linens, hair dryer, iron and ironing board are all provided. You could store your suitcases and hang your clothes in a convenient closet. There is a full bathro
neighborhood_overview: You will not be disappointed by the neighborhood as it is upscale, safe and friendly. And if you drive a car, our location is ideal in the city! For restaurants in the area we recommend Trattoria da Vittorio (Italian), Fresca (Peruvian), Bursa (Mediterranean), and Squat & Gobble (American, crepes, and breakfast)
transit: Bus 23, bus 43, muni K, L,M,T, Glen Park station bart train, or Uber, (Lyft,SideCar)  can get you to any place in San Francisco fast!

name: Sunny Dolores Park Apartment
description: Sunny two-room apartment located steps from Dolores Park in San Francisco's hip Mission District. Walking distance to some of the city's finest restaurants, bars, and the Castro with easy access to public transit. The apartment has a private entrance and is completely separate. Within the apartment  are two rooms separated by a pocket door from each other.  Both rooms have french doors accessing a private deck. One room has a queen bed and the other a day bed that pulls out to sleep two twin size beds next to each other (king sizes). Also included in the rooms is a TV, fridge, microwave, kettle, cups, glasses and mugs, to enjoy takeout food in the comfort of home. There is no standard kitchen.  There is a very large bathroom with shower and tub. The apartment is tastefully furnished and quiet, and is ideally located within comfortable walking distance to Noe Valley's 24th Street commercial district, Valencia corridor/the Mission, and the Castro. All three neighborhoods offer a wide and
neighborhood_overview: The Mission is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood with some of the best weather and restaurants in the city. The neighborhood is a continually evolving area with something for everybody.
transit: The apartment is very close to public transit - the J Muni line is across the street, and BART, our underground train system, is a 10 minute walk away.

name: Family Room in the Heart of North Beach
description: Classic Elizabethan home in the heart of North Beach, near Fisherman's Wharf, Washington Square Park - the most beautiful neighborhood in SF!  This is to rent out a room. Walking distance to practically everywhere! The family room has five separate twin beds including a three level bunk bed.   Important:  Even though it says it sleeps up to 5 people, we can only allow for up to two adults total.  The other three will have to be children. This is beautiful classic San Francisco home built in 1908 but has been updated with modern touches. You are welcome to use the laundry room and kitchen I am a tech entrepreneur in San Francisco. Love ideas and philosophical discussions so don't be shy and say hi! This is arguably the most romantic and beautiful neighborhood in San Francisco. Artists, poets, writers and musicians have been flocking to San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood since Beat Generation writers like Allen Ginsberg and Jack Kerouac spilled their own creative juices here decade
neighborhood_overview: This is arguably the most romantic and beautiful neighborhood in San Francisco. Artists, poets, writers and musicians have been flocking to San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood since Beat Generation writers like Allen Ginsberg and Jack Kerouac spilled their own creative juices here decades ago. They are the reason a nonconformist lifestyle still resonates through the bohemian neighborhood’s bookstores, bars and restaurants 50 years after the first artists came seeking to follow their own beats.
transit: The house is near a lot of public transportation including the 8 bus one block away and it is a few blocks away from trolleys and Pier 41 where fairies can take you to Sausalito, Oakland, Tiburon, and Alameda. Of course there is Uber!

name: Alamo Square Modern Studio Spa
description: This property is only available with a minimum stay of one month. This studio can be described as a cozy, elegant, small and modern being its spa bathroom with steam room with bamboo bench, hot tub and rain shower its best feature. Easy access to downtown less than 2 miles away. PROPERTY DESCRIPTION  This studio can be described as a cozy, elegant, small and modern being its spa bathroom with steam room with bamboo bench, hot tub and rain shower its best feature. Enjoy the spa bathroom after a long day of visiting our great city or after long hours of work. You can even watch TV while relaxing into the hot tub!. The studio has been recently renovated, the unit features one open space with living, kitchen and bedroom areas combined. The bed is just above three steps from the main floor level. A wonderful mix of both modern and antique furnishings adds the perfect touch to this unit's design. The kitchen is complete with New York style appliances. There is a large sofa sleeper. The unit
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood: ALAMO SQUARE Victorian splendor characterized by the iconic Queen Anne 'Painted Ladies', behind which the central downtown skyline protrudes. The slope of Alamo Square Park is the green sunny vantage point for the famous static show. Houses along McAllister and surrounding streets are breathtakingly stylish and ornate. Divisadero Street is nearby.

It goes from Ocean Beach to The Ferry Building.  Union Square is 1.8 miles away from the property: By car or taxi: 10 min. By public transportation: 19 min. name: Luxurious Home With Expansive Views
description: Located on Liberty Hill in the heart of Dolores Heights with close proximity to Dolores Park, Valencia Corridor, restaurants, shops, nightlife, and public transportation. Great for young professionals, corporate rentals, families, and vacationers. Modern Penthouse in sunny Dolores Heights on one of the most sought out streets in the city! Completely rebuilt in 2006 with great attention to detail, high-end furnishings, gourmet kitchen, and an open floor plan offering THE BEST VIEWS (270 degree) in the city.  Convenient location walking distance to Dolores Park, Valencia Corridor, The Mission, Noe Valley and the Castro.  Master Bedroom has a King size Temprapedic bed, plenty of closet space, a fireplace, yard access, and a 40" TV. Bedroom 2 has a Queen size Heavenly bed, closet, full bath, and dresser.   Bedroom 3 (and/or den) has a contemporary sofa bed (Full), sectional L-shape couch, walk-in closet, bath with large shower, office nook, yard access, and 61" TV.  Great for movie viewing
neighborhood_overview: The inner Mission, from 16th to 24th Street and spanning Dolores, Guerrero, Valencia, and Mission Street, has thrift to high end stores, dive bars to gourmet restaurants, coffeehouses, taquerias, galleries and an avant-garde theater. The Valencia Corridor is a foodie haven. It has been written up by The New York Times, Food & Wine Magazine, and other publications for it's restaurants.  The Mission neighborhood is popular for its eclectic mix of people, vintage stores, shopping, dining, it's walk-ability and mural tours, night life and for being the sunniest neighborhood in San Francisco.  Nestled next to the Mission, Noe Valley has become a quaint, family-oriented neighborhood, with good shopping and great dining options. The Castro is one of San Francisco's most vibrant communities, saturated with popular bars and top restaurants, as well as home to the Castro Theatre.
transit: J Church is one block away with direct access to downtown or a 10 minute walk to BART Walkability Score 86 Bike Lanes on 17th Street Easy access to freeway to southbay

name: Sunny Loft With Multiple San Francisco City Views
description: Spin albums on a turntable and grab a bass guitar to play along. This airy, top-floor apartment has an easy elegance which invites a relaxed and playful mood. Have BBQs on the back deck, then return after sundown for private drinks and conversation. The apartment is 1700 square feet with a master bedroom on the second floor. The master bedroom and balcony have a wonderful view of San Francisco. There is TV in the sitting area off the master bedroom and a 55 inch HD TV in the living room. Guests can enjoy the outdoor TV as well; a gas-burning fire pit is available for chilly days or roasting marshmallows. A grill and outdoor dining set are also available for guests to use. The front door is a private entrance, two flights of stairs up from the street level. I will be available by phone as often as possible to my guests. The apartment is in Bernal Heights, a family-friendly neighborhood in the southeastern corner of San Francisco. The location makes it equally easy to get to downtown, th
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in Bernal Heights, a family-friendly neighborhood in the southeastern corner of San Francisco. The location makes it equally easy to get to downtown, the Bay Area peninsula, and South Bay. The Bay Bridge to East Bay is also close by.
transit: Parking is typically available on the street directly outside the apartment and is never more than a couple of blocks away. Bus lines and BART are both within walking distance. Caltrain is a 10-minute drive away. There are many bars and restaurants on 24th St in the Mission District, a 10-15 minute walk away. More bars and restaurants on Cortland St in Bernal Heights are a quick 5-minute drive away.

name: Red Victorian - Private room, The Conservatory
description: The "Conservatory" is a private bedroom located in historic building The Red Victorian, in Haight-Ashbury. The Red Victorian is an experimental community run hotel that offers unique guest experiences. While here, we invite you to attend events: lectures & talks, skill shares, music nights, art shows! Near Golden Gate Park and Twin Peaks, this central location also offers easy direct lines to both downtown and the beach. The "Conservatory" is a large room located on the second floor of the house, with access to our little private garden.  It offers a queen bed mezzanine + a single bed below, a great desk, closets and a sink.  You will have access to the 5 shared bathrooms of the house ( 1 in the 2nd floor + a restroom and 4 in the 3rd floor). - Self check-in from 4pm onwards. Self check-out at 11am. If you arrive early, you can leave your bags in our guest storage area on the ground floor until check-in time. - You will have access to your bedroom and all the shared spaces (main space,
neighborhood_overview: Haight-Ashbury is an incredible relic of San Francisco’s past. The neighborhood, also known as “The Haight” or “Upper Haight”, succinctly personifies the City’s history, aesthetic, and culture. It is perhaps the most colorful swath of acreage in San Francisco, and remains one of the last-standing neighborhoods to retain an eccentric personality. The Haight rose to fame during the Counterculture Movement during the Vietnam War era; it became a regular feature in international news headlines and incited a global initiative for social change with special thanks to the 1967 Summer of Love, and a little help from Janis Joplin and the Grateful Dead. The Haight-Ashbury neighborhood is nestled in between three parks: Golden Gate Park, the Panhandle, and Buena Vista Park, making it somewhat of an urban oasis.  Within the parks you'll find: Museums, botanical gardens, seasonal music festivals, and a tea garden. We recommend: - Eating at a one of the delicious restaurants or food trucks, or catch
transit: How to get here from SFO airport :  > By Public Transit : Board the BART towards San Francisco. Get off at the UN Plaza stop and walk to the northwest corner of Market St. Board the 7 or 7R Bus to Haight and get off at the Clayton St Stop. Walk to 1665 Haight St. You can also take the 6 to Masonic St, and walk 3 blocks to The Red Vic.  > By Car Share Taxi : If you have a smart phone and access to the internet you can take advantage of one of the car sharing services in San Francisco. These services offer a convenient app, faster pick-ups and lower prices than taxis. You can use Lyft or Uber.  For Lyft, use the code KYLE2242 to get $10 in free rides. Lyft has multiple services and Lyft Line will be the least expensive option.  For Uber, use the code FFT3C to get $10 in free rides. Uber has multiple services and Uber Pool will be the least expensive option.  > By Taxi Service : You can call Yellow Cab for a pickup.  Valet Parking: Another option which we have heard good things about is L

description: An oasis in the heart of colorful and diverse Mission District.  Lots of natural lights, very quiet, and close to everything.  2-level, 2 bedrooms + 1 den, 2 and a half bathroom condo with 2 spacious sunny patios. View of Twin Peaks from upper patio. Building facade features a mural that is on the tourist facade tour. Kids-friendly. Close to public transportation, coffee shops, galleries, markets. This is a 2 bedroom + 1 den, three-bath condominium that was built in 2007, and features a fireplace and cherry floors throughout.  In the kitchen you will find appliances, a caesar stone counter top, and custom cabinets. A washer and dryer set are in the unit as well.  2 spacious sunny patios (with a view of Twin Peaks), 2 levels, one master bedroom (with queen size bed), the other bed room with a single bed + pull out and one office room. 2 1/2 bathrooms. Ideal for a family or 3 adults. Kid/family friendly. Wi-fi available, Roku streaming Amazon and Netflix movies, BBQ. Metered Street parki
neighborhood_overview: Colorful neighborhood with lots of murals and local happenings. Latino district. Mission district is one of the most interesting, diverse, and now a trendy neighborhood but still keeping its true and local SF vibe.
transit: Close to BART and buses.

name: Modern oasis w/ king bed near Golden Gate Park
description: Spacious, recently renovated, light-filled oasis in the Richmond neighborhood with stylish and serene design elements. Walking distance from Golden Gate Park, DeYoung Museum, California Academy of Sciences, restaurants, and public transport. Short drive to Golden Gate Bridge, Ocean Beach, Sutro Baths, Cliff House, and Lands End. Enjoy the king size bed, full chef's kitchen, large spa-like walk-in shower, spacious living room with sectional sofa and fireplace, and backyard w/ outdoor fire pit. Living room has a large sectional sofa, gas fireplace, TV, and piano.  Share a meal at the dining table that seats eight. Kitchen has all the cooking and serving tools you need: Gas stove and oven, cookware, refrigerator and freezer, plateware, silverware, drink ware, coffee maker and electric kettle.  Washer and dryer are at the end of the kitchen. Bedroom has a large comfy king size bed with bed linens, plenty of closet space, a dresser, and luggage racks. The bedroom connects to a small sunroom
neighborhood_overview: The Richmond neighborhood is full of gems like Golden Gate park, restaurants (the go-to neighborhood for dim sum, Korean BBQ, and boba tea), farmers market, views of the Golden Gate Bridge, and quick access to Ocean Beach, Haight Ashbury, and other great San Francisco neighborhoods. The house is walking distance from Golden Gate Park, Outside Lands music festival, DeYoung Museum, California Academy of Sciences, restaurants, cafes (a favorite is Orson's Belly, just 2 blocks away) and public transport. You'll be a short drive away from the Golden Gate Bridge, hiking at Lands End, Ocean Beach, Baker Beach, Sutro Baths, Haight Ashbury, and the Presidio and Sunset neighborhoods.
transit: Public transport: The house is near key bus lines (5, 31, 38) that will take you throughout San Francisco.  Cars: Street parking is available (watch out for street cleaning signs!). Ride share apps: Uber and Lyft cars are readily available. Walking routes: Don't miss out on walking through Golden Gate Park! Walk to Geary or up Balboa for restaurants and markets.

name: Dorm Bed In Friendly Hostel Community #3
description: We’re a social hostel! All of our dorms have 6-8 beds and we are excited for you to make new friends. Up to 3 people can book with this listing. We are sanctioned by the San Francisco planning commission to provide tourist accommodation and have been a top rated hostel for 25 years! We offer mixed gender dorms, clean bathrooms, fully stocked kitchen, and a common room full of new friends in downtown SF. Come join us! Welcome to the smallest of the San Francisco hostels! We may be little, but we’ve got huge personality. Our space is all about creating community with fascinating travelers from around the world. Looking for instant friendships and awesome vibes? You found us, high five! We believe hostels are far more than just a cheap place to stay, and we are seeking out guests who feel the same.  Our accommodation is all mixed gender dorm rooms with 6 or 8 beds per room, bunk bed style, with large lockers underneath each bed. We also have a fully stocked kitchen, clean bathrooms, and c
neighborhood_overview: Our location can't be beat! We are located one block over from the famous San Francisco Chinatown, one block from the bustling Financial District, a few blocks south of "Little Italy" in North Beach, and just a 10 minute stroll from the water along the Embarcadero.
transit: Public transportation is plentiful and nearby, though many things are walking distance. We are next to the #1 bus, 1 block from the California Cable Car line, and 5 blocks from the Montgomery BART station. You can catch many other buses near the BART station as well.  Cars are not recommended since we are right in downtown SF and parking garages are very expensive (about $30/24 hours). There is minimal street parking in front of the hostel: 7pm-7am during the week, and limited on the weekends. Alternatively, we know of some first come, first served free street parking across the city. You can then take a 25 minute bus ride back.

name: Downtown Rainbow
description: Our San Frantastic rainbow of a home is the ultimate combination of modern, artistic interior design, and sweeping views.  It's an urbanite's mecca, replete with the sights, sounds, and local color of Lower Nob Hill in downtown San Francisco. Our San Frantastic rainbow of a home is painted brightly in eight colors, giving it the ultimate San Francisco feel.  You will love coming home each day to our uniquely decorated home, and it is our goal to make sure you love it as much as we do. As a guest, you will have access to our full kitchen which includes a dishwasher, microwave, oven, stove, blender, refrigerator/freezer, and panini maker.  Our washer and dryer is inside the house, and is available for your use during your stay. You will have two comfortable bedrooms:  the red room and the green room.  The red room has a comfortable queen-sized bed and LCD tv, and the green has a full sized bed, acrylic desk, and LCD Tv.  Both rooms have Netflix, Amazon Prime Videos, and other smart tv ca
neighborhood_overview: Our hip Lower Nob Hill condo is centrally located in downtown San Francisco about five blocks from Union Square.  Downtown San Francisco is a vibrant and very busy part of the city, so this spot is great for people who do not mind the sounds and bustle of an urban city.   From our home, you can walk to Union Square, Chinatown, the MOMA, the Asian Art Museum, Yerba Buena, Grace Cathedral and so much more!  Bring your walking shoes because everything is nearby!  Our neighborhood offers a vast selection of amazing restaurants, bars,  and clubs, so nightlife will be great!
transit: You will not need to worry about renting a car here because of the central location. The space and location is an urbanite's dream.The condo is within walking distance to BART, Muni, multiple bus lines, taxis, and the world famous cable cars.  Access to public transportation from our house is very easy, and many find that having a car in this area is more trouble than it is worth.

name: Room in Mission apartment - Great SF Location!
description: My very ordinary apartment is in the Mission District, which, IMHO, is the best place in San Francisco!  It's full of shops and restaurants. The BART Train is 3 blocks away.  You can take the train or walk everywhere in San Francisco.  The Mission is also famous for the high number of homeless people living on the street. Nothing to be scared of, but please don't come if that will bother you.  I have 2 rooms and 2 listings, so there are frequently other Airbnb guests here. STR (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Hi there, My apartment is a newly-renovated, but otherwise a VERY ordinary place, in the Mission in San Francisco.   The main bedroom is rented through my other listing.  This listing is for the living room that has a double sofa bed, plus another sofa.   There's one bathroom with a toilet and sink, and another room with a shower and sink (it's odd but it's a San Francisco thing.)  There's a kitchen (not for use by guests). A brand new washer and dryer (bring your own detergent).
neighborhood_overview: I love that whatever direction you walk in, you are surrounded by shops and restaurants and things to do.
transit: Buses on the street and 2 blocks from BART.  The apartment is located at the center of everything!  So it's great to walk and bike to places.

name: Private 2bd Bayview Modern Home with Parking
description: Stay in our home and explore the sunniest neighborhood in San Francisco! Stay in our quiet, recently renovated, cozy home in the hip Bayview neighborhood. Next to a private bathroom, you'll have full access to the shared kitchen and living room area. Great for a group of three or a family looking for two private spaces. We do have an air mattress available upon request. There is also free parking available for one car. We live in a three bedroom home with two available private rooms and one bathroom all on the top floor. Enjoy the beautiful sunrise overlooking the Bay. Built in the 1940's, we recently upgraded the home to reflect our modern - mid-century - farmhouse style. You'll have full access to the kitchen, living room, plus parking if needed. My husband and I are available if needed but provide privacy for your stay. We're happy to offer local tips and our favorite spots to visit. Silver Terrace is in the Bayview neighborhood, next to Bernal Heights and Dogpatch in San Francisco.
neighborhood_overview: Silver Terrace is in the Bayview neighborhood, next to Bernal Heights and Dogpatch in San Francisco. Check out local breweries Laughing Monk and Bare Bottle, beer and whiskey distillery Seven Stills, and local wine maker Gratta Wines. Local coffee shop Greaser just opened down the street plus the latest local fare including yummy tacos from Tato, famous Auntie April's Chicken and Waffles, and All Good Pizza.
transit: Uber/Lyft to AT&T Ballpark: 10 minutes Uber/Lyft to Union Square: 20 minutes Walk easily to the Muni K Line which goes straight into Dogpatch and then downtown SOMA.

name: Bright and Spacious Victorian with Two bedrooms for you to Enjoy
description: Welcome to authentic San Francisco with this wonderful (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Victorian in lovely Bernal Heights.  Lovely neighborhood. All the amenities of home without losing city proximity! Easy Public transportation. Comfortably sleeps 4 adults. Skylights and lots of windows throughout give plenty of natural light in this sunny part of San Francisco. High ceilings, original detail, and fresh paint give this house extra charm. The street is quiet and peaceful.  Enjoy a glass of wine on the back deck at after a long day of sight seeing. This is a non smoking property, strictly enforced. There are 2 bedrooms, one with a QUEEN size bed and the other with a FULL size bed and one bathroom with large claw foot tub/shower. Simple style with an emphasis on natural wood, create a very inviting atmosphere. There is an outside private deck off the kitchen to enjoy the sun and SF fresh air!  Spectacular views of the city await as you walk around the hill. You can see both the Bay and G
neighborhood_overview: Bernal Heights is a unique village like neighborhood within San Francisco. Our main street, Cortland Ave.,is only a couple blocks away with lots of restaurants and shops.  Please look at Airbnb's "Neighborhood" section for more detailed information about the area. A couple favorite restaurants are Liberty Cafe, Moki's sushi and Piqueos Peruvian food. Half a block away is the Esmeralda Stairway which takes you to the top of Bernal Hill.
transit: MUNI Bus lines # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) th Street BART is about 16 minutes walking distance.

name: Heart of Downtown - Modern Apartment wth Breakfast
description: 2nd floor condo unit with modern decoration and a lot of sunlight/skylight. Located in the heart of downtown San Francisco:  - 18 mins walk / 8 mins drive to Moscone Center - 5 mins walk to Muni and Bart (subway) - 5 mins walk to Orpheum Theatre (for broadway shows) - Next to City Hall, SF Symphony and Opera House - Close to main shopping malls including Westfield Mall.  - Quick stroll to supermarkets, cafes, restaurants - Near popular clubbing spots - Best live jazz music This is a modern apartment where another guest will stay in the master bedroom and you'll get the second bedroom with your own bathroom.  Great central location that is walking distance to Moscone Center, Union Square, City Hall, Broadway Theatres, restaurants, bars etc. This is a two bedroom two bathroom unit. You'll get to stay in the second bedroom with your own bathroom.  You're welcome to use the common spaces, including the open kitchen, living room, and dining room. We will be around to check you in, show you
neighborhood_overview: There is a good Japanese restaurant, ramen place, boba tea, and French macaroon cafe all within 3 minutes walk.  It's easy to get to other parts of San Francisco and beyond because of it's proximity to the Civic Center Bart Station.
transit: It's a 15 minute drive from San Francisco International Airport (without traffic), a 5 minute walk to the Civic Center Bart Station where you can take the Bart to downtown shopping San Francisco, East Bay, or the San Francisco International Airport.

name: Soma Ballpark Place Private Hotel 2  Bedrm
description: My place is good for solo adventurers & business travelers. Located in the heart of Soma district. If u walk outside, you can see the ballpark. We are 3 blocks away from the SF ATT Ballpark stadium. Everything else is close proximity to Caltrain, Bart, Union Square shopping, and the front bus line brings you directly to Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman Wharf, & into the Marina where Golden Gate Bridge is. Welcome to our humble space not fancy but clean This is a private bedroom with sink and desk. It is a bunk bed style with Queen size bed and twin bunk beds. There is a mini frig and microwave provided inside too. Use the bedroom for up to 4 guests. Your choice! To start introducing bit more about our place.  It is an apartment building with residential tenants and traveling visitors; bit of a hostel vibe here.  The main entrance is one huge door on the ground floor. When guest enter, there is a stairway leading up to the second floor.  Reminder there is no elevator, so if you have su
neighborhood_overview: The ample food/ restaurant choices just in our neighborhood offers awesome variety from American to Asian fusion. Plus convenience to public transit of bus muni, Bart, and Caltrain.   Just on our block and the next, there are choices of pizza, Italian, American, Mexican, Asian fusion, Indian, cafes, & occasional food trucks to pick from.   Next thing is Whole Foods, Safeway, Walgreens, Starbucks, Peets Coffee,post office, & Target are all within 10-15 mins WALK away.  Shopping, theaters, Union Square, financial district,& downtown SF is 15-20 mins WALK away.  Public transit is readily available too. Our building is located right on the main street. Taxi you cannot miss them. Bus line is right out front and of course being in the middle of Soma District, you will see heaps of people catching Uber/ Lyft especially during mornings and late afternoon!
transit: Very easy to get around in our area. This is central Soma district. We are located right on the main street.  Muni bus line is right on the same block. Caltrain is 3 blocks away. Bart is a 15 min walk in a straight line. We are 2 blocks away from the SF Ballpark stadium, Whole foods, Safeway, Walgreens, and much more! Lots of taxi, Uber, and Lyft in this area. Be warned it is Soma district, so don't expect much free parking in the city esp here during game days.  No free day parking here but lots of huge parking complexes.

name: Modern, brand new condo in the heart of SOMA
description: Brand new building, super modern, top of the line appliances, bike storage, close to all the startups, great food, Coffee and bars nearby, walking distance to everything. In unit washer/dryer, all utilities plus WiFi paid. Furnished, bright airy space. This is a quiet, residential building so no parties or loud music, please. We have strict quiet hours after 11 pm (this means no loud noises after this time). Guests will have full access to top of the line kitchen and spacious living room with space for chillin', reading, watching movies, watching smart TV, playing video games, playing board games, etc... We are right in the heart of the SOMA (South of Market) neighborhood in San Francisco. Historically, this neighborhood had tons of warehouses and industry, and recently has been renovated and is home to a lot of the new startups and many great restaurants and bars. We're close to AT&T Park, the Bart, and the Caltrain. Whole Foods in only 2 blocks away and Trader Joe's is 6 blocks away.

We're close to AT&T Park, the Bart, and the Caltrain. Whole Foods in only 2 blocks away and Trader Joe's is 6 blocks away.

description: SAN FRANCISCO SHORT-TERM RESIDENTIAL REGISTRATION NUMBER: STR -(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Lovely private one bedroom garden suite apartment self contained with kitchen.  The kitchen has a stove, refrigerator,  miicrowave, and cooking utensils.  The shower (no bathtub) is separate from the w.c.  The bedroom is a large room with a big closet.  It is private and has a door and is separate from the living room.   It is 3 blocks to the quaint West Portal Village with restaurants, shops and a movie theatre.  Close to transportation, 15 minutes to downtown by MUNI.   Golden Gate Park, the Golden Gate Bridge and the ocean are close-by.   Large queen size bed suitable for 2 if needed. Can accommodate a 3rd person. There  will be an extra charge of $30.00 per person after 2 persons. Only children under 2 allowed. No charge. There is a crib if needed. Off street parking and free wi-fi. Nearby attractions are the Golden Gate Park, the Golden Gate Bridge, the San Francisco Zoo and the beautiful Pacific
neighborhood_overview: West Portal is a great neighborhood. There are lots of restaurants, nail salons, a movie theatre, banks and easy access to transit for dowtown.
transit: From West Portal, it is easy access to downtown and Fisherman's Wharf and most of the tourist areas.  From 19th Avenue (which is a 3 block walk) easy access to #28 bus which takes you to Golden Gate Park and the Golden Gate Bridge.

name: Most Cheerful in Cole Valley for Long Term Stays
description: This lovely apartment is a delight: a bright, clean, stylish, and happy home-away-from-home, nestled right in Cole Valley, a safe, family-friendly, charming neighborhood located at the center of San Francisco. It is only for long term stays of 30+ days (please do not ask for an exception, I am firmly committed to hosting only long term stays of 30+ days). If you‘re a family of 4 or 5, please let me know. I am happy to increase the number of guests if there are young children staying. This chic and cool studio apartment in a charming Victorian home in Cole Valley merges the best of San Francisco, with classic 19th century architecture on the exterior, and a remodeled, beautiful studio apartment that features a stylish mod design and a cheerful and vibrant color scheme in the interior. (SEE NOTES ON PARKING IN LAST PARAGRAPH BELOW.) Adjacent to the queen-size canopy bed there is a little nook with sunny window and the absolute cutest twin bed, outfitted with colorful linens, a sweet read
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is nestled right in Cole Valley, one of the hidden gems of San Francisco.  While centrally located in the heart of the city, just blocks from the entrance to Golden Gate Park and the Children's Playground, it remains a bit of a locals' secret.   Cole Street features small, locally owned shops (with everything you might need and more) and charming restaurants.  Just a short walk will bring you to the heart of the neighborhood, where you can feast on gourmet tacos and drinks at my favorite restaurant, Padrecito.  If you still have room, you can top it off with a caramelized honey, creme fraiche and roasted pineapple sundae at the Ice Cream Bar, also a favorite on Cole Street. And if you worry you may have over-indulged, you can run (or stroll) it off the next morning with a circuit around nearby Golden Gate Park, featuring miles of gorgeous paths, and amazing museums like the Academy of Sciences and the DeYoung Museum.  If you're traveling with kids, there's a playground cl
transit: I do not offer a parking spot, but the apartment is extremely close to public transportation (the "N" line on Stanyan/ Carl streets), which is easy, cheap and plentiful.  However, if you're driving, it's a fairly easy neighborhood to find free parking in.   However, while parking is free, it is not unlimited.  They ticket every two hours from 8 am to 5 pm Monday through Friday, so you need to either move your car by 10 am (not too hard, there are usually spots to be found, and most people start their day by then anyway), or park in a parking lot (Kezar Parking Lot is nearby, and you can pay to park all day for ~$20-~25 for 24 hours, should you want to leave your car there for a day or more).  There are also some streets nearby (Rivoli street, for example) where you can park round the clock for ~48 hours for free and they don't ticket, but you have to search a bit for those spots as everyone wants them!

name: Light Filled Flat, Modern Design, Mission/Dolores
description: This is an open concept, thoughtfully appointed with modern, high-end design, top-floor flat with Huge skylights! The light in the space is beautiful. Blocks from public transportation, located in the highly desirable Mission/Dolores neighbored, the sunniest part of the city, walking score of 97. Blocks from boutique shopping, Michelin star restaurants, cafés and music venues. This is a top floor flat, set away from the main home on the second level, above garage. Huge skylights to capture all the gorgeous sun and blackout shades for your sleeping comfort. King size bed. Kitchen is appointed with everything you would need. Shower and Tub for soaking in. You will find yourself in one of the most desirable neighborhoods in SF. Public transit options within a 7 min walk or less. You will have access to your own private flat. I will be here to greet you and show you to your suite and available as needed if you have questions. I live on the property so we will likely cross paths on occasion
neighborhood_overview: We are a few blocks from the Valencia street corridor, where you’ll find boutiques, bistros and bars with a decidedly SF feel. And blocks from shopping and dining on 24th street. You are a 7 min walk to Bart our underground subway and 2 min walk from the Church street cable car. Ample rental bikes all around us, some electric options too. Mission/Delores is near as well, just past the beautiful Dolores Park.
transit: Tech Shuttle stops are 2 min away. Uber/lyft/taxi are only a few minutes wait and public transport is easy. Only a few blocks to 24th street Bart (subway) station. And even less to the Church street cable car. Prime location for South Bay commuters

name: Cozy Home in Charming Neighborhood
description: The house is in the heart of Bernal Heights neighborhood. The house is very peaceful and cozy. It has a garden to enjoy the outdoors and it is half a block away from the main Cortland street which is full of cafes, restaurants  and public transport. The house is next to the main street yet very quiet inside. You will have an access to the living room, bedroom, bathroom, our favorite sun room, outdoor garden space. We will make sure you will have everything you need to your stay and we will be reachable throughout the stay. This is by far my favorite neighborhood in the city. You will be steps away from cafes, restaurants and shops. There are two beautiful parks just a 5 min walk from the house. There is a number 24 bus that runs every ten minutes on weekdays and more like every 15 min or so on weekends.  There are more bus lines that run on Mission St. You can walk downhill to Mission St. to take Bus 24 down to Mission St. Easy to get to Bart or underground muni by taking a bus and tak
neighborhood_overview: This is by far my favorite neighborhood in the city. You will be steps away from cafes, restaurants and shops. There are two beautiful parks just a 5 min walk from the house.
transit: There is a number 24 bus that runs every ten minutes on weekdays and more like every 15 min or so on weekends.  There are more bus lines that run on Mission St. You can walk downhill to Mission St. to take Bus 24 down to Mission St. Easy to get to Bart or underground muni by taking a bus and taking Bart or muni after. Really easy to get around.  San Francisco is a small city. At one point I did not drive, I got around all by a bicycle which is another idea for more adventurous. Rent a bike (many locations about the city) and you will be faster then the bus. Yes, the house is on the big hill, but you can walk it up - great exercise!  If you have a car, there is plenty of street parking and no street cleaning or time limit that many neighborhoods have.

name: Cozy Studio Great for One Traveler
description: Our comfortable in-law studio is the perfect spot travelers and for exploring the wonders of San Francisco.   Our wonderful studio is located in the center of San Francisco.  Comfortably sleeps one with convenient street parking, this property is ideal for single people, traveling for business or visiting family. The in-law studio is cozy, recently renovated, and tucked away in charming Bernal Heights. Perfect for single business travelers who want to get an authentic feel for San Francisco, without being too far away from the action. Studio has equipped kitchenette for simple meals.  Note that it doesn't have a full kitchen, although it does have a mini refrigerator, a sink, a microwave, a toaster oven, and a coffee maker, plus plates, mugs, glasses, and silverware. The unit also includes a washer and dryer. This space is right below our home upstairs and we do our best to keep the noise to a minimum but we do have two children so please message us if it becomes too much and we will t
neighborhood_overview: We have traveled around the world and lived in a bunch of different places. When we were deciding where to put down permanent roots, we knew it would be San Francisco. And our favorite part of SF is Bernal Heights, a beautiful hilltop neighborhood that feels like a small town within the city.  Walk five minutes down the hill from our house and you'll find one of the best farmers' markets in the country: Alemany Farmers' Market, which operates every Saturday morning. Walk about eight minutes up the hill and you'll reach the neighborhood's main drag, Cortland Avenue, filled with terrific restaurants, bars, cafés, and shops. The heart of the Mission District is an easy bike ride or bus ride away. We're within walking distance of three great parks, too: Holly Park, St. Mary's Park, and the crown jewel of the neighborhood, Bernal Heights Park, with its breathtaking views of the city and the Bay. You can read more about our neighborhood online. Airbnb doesn't allow posting hyperlinks, but yo
transit: Public transportation is easily accessible. Two bus lines, the 67 and the 23, pick up and drop off about one block from our house. These buses will take you directly to or from the 24th & Mission BART station (1.7 mi/2.7 km away) and the Glen Park BART station (1.1 mi/1.8 km away), respectively. Parking a car in Bernal Heights can be tricky, but it's free and usually available on our street if you're persistent. SF is well served by taxis, Uber, and Lyft. Transit:  Transportation options abound in San Francisco. For an overview, visit (Website hidden by Airbnb)  > Two bus lines stop within a block of our house: the 67 and the 23. For routes and fare information, visit (Website hidden by Airbnb)  > BART is the main metro train system. You can take it from SFO airport into the city. The two BART stations closest to our house are Glen Park (1.2 mi / 1.9 km away) and 24th Street (1.7 mi / 2.7 km away).  > The 23 bus runs between our house and the Glen Park BART Station. name: Central San Francisco Living in a Victorian Townhouse
description: Host a BBQ in the spacious backyard or enjoy this central SF neighborhood. This character-filled 1905 home features hardwood floors, lofty ceilings, a chandelier, and period details throughout. Flexible check in/out times by advanced request only
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in Inner Richmond, one of San Francisco’s most vibrant, multicultural neighborhoods, famous for its dim sum restaurants and independent boutiques. The Golden Gate Bridge and Fisherman’s Wharf are within easy walking distance.
transit: We recommend  walking, Uber/Lyft or local bus service.  We have parking for your vehicle at the house but parking at attractions can be challenging and expensive. 511.org is the local public transit trip planner.

name: Charming Macondray Lane Flat
description: This is a charming and bohemian San Francisco flat centrally located on Russian Hill. The flat is the upper of two units in an historic cottage on Macondray Lane, a lovely lane which runs between Taylor and Jones streets. The Lane is vibrant green with abundant gardens and a brick and cobblestone walkway.  Note: The Lane is walking only; no cars.  The flat has a tower bedroom and a small den/bedroom along with a breakfast room and dining room. It has one bathroom with a tub and shower. One feels in the country rather than the city and the noise of the streets and city sounds are muffled in this sequestered lane. The house was built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and has a warm charm and lovely furniture and decor.  The living room and the tower bedroom have spectacular views of the San Francisco Bay and Alcatraz Island. (There isn't a bathroom connected to the master bedroom.) Just off the tower bedroom is a roof deck with wrought iron table and chairs and a gas grill for entertain
neighborhood_overview: Russian Hill is a iconic residential community known for the crooked Lombard Street. San Francisco cable cars crest the neighborhood’s hills, which provide views of a number of city landmarks including the Golden Gate and Bay bridges.  Commercial stretches along Polk and Hyde Streets on ones side of Russian Hill offer an assortment of trendy and old-school restaurants, bars and shops, while on the other side the bustling neighborhoods of North Beach and Chinatown are just a few blocks away. Guests can look down on Fisherman's Wharf and can walk there in less than 15 minutes.
transit: Most tenants find they do not need a car as there is a Green Grocer, Coit Liquors and the SearchLight Market within 2-3 blocks, and it is an easy walk to North Beach, Polk Street Shopping District, China Town or Fisherman's Wharf. Convenient bus stops are just 1 block away.  Most guests will find all they need is within walking distance. A city bus stop is a block away. Uber and Lyft may also be met at Jones or Taylor Streets.

name: Mid Century Gem on the foothills of Twin Peaks
description: In the foothills of Twin Peaks, come and relax in our Mid Century guest suite. Newly remodeled with luxury and privacy in mind, the suite offers a private entrance and lovely garden. Enjoy walking to Twin Peaks lookout while still being close to the hustle and bustle of the city. Our private, ground level suite contains a queen size bed with luxury mattress from Room & Board, a newly remodeled ensuite bathroom, a full closet with plenty of hangers and storage, and a large flat screen television with Roku. We provide an electric kettle with an assortment of teas and instant coffee. You'll access our guest suite from a private gate with keypad entry. We'll provide a key code prior to your arrival. Outside your suite is a private garden with sitting area. I live upstairs and will be available as much as you need, or not. I've explored neighborhood and take long walks with my dog so there's not much I haven't seen! We are located at the foothills of Twin Peaks surrounded by lush trees and
neighborhood_overview: We are located at the foothills of Twin Peaks surrounded by lush trees and incredible views. Walk to Twin Peaks lookout to enjoy 360 views of the bay or go for a run along the trails of Mount Sutro. Although we are located in the geographical center of the 7x7 city, the neighborhood is residential, quiet, and safe.
transit: We recommend using a ride share app to get to and from downtown. However, the neighborhood is perfect if you have a car, as there is always parking available directly outside. Additionally the 36 bus stop is one-block away. It is a short bus ride or 15 minute walk to the Forest Hill muni bus station where multiple lines and buses are available.

name: Lwr Haight/NOPA Studio inside  larger home+parking
description: This great studio within a larger home, has its own kitchen, its own shower and toilet, living room with sofa bed, parking, hot tub, laundry and more. This Lower Haight/NOPA condo is centrally located, close to Castro, Duboce Park and public transport all over the city. Restaurants, cafes, and Golden Gate Park are all close by. PLEASE NOTE THAT A CAT LIVES IN THIS STUDIO and she loves people. This studio has been remodeled and enlarged and has a nice size kitchen, living room and fireplace. It is the best of both worlds, its own space in a larger home, with access to main kitchen, formal dining, living room, and garden with hot tub. Guests have full access to all of the common areas of the house, and yet have their own private space and entrance. We adapt to what our guests like. Golden Gate Park and the Castro District are also within walking distance.

transit: PARKING If you are driving, there is street parking in my neighborhood. Its a little hit or miss but you can usually find something within a block or two of my place max.  Street parking can be quick, or sometimes take 10 minutes - it completely varies every day. Its a great neighborhood with loads to do - I live near a bunch of restaurants and bars so sometimes everyone is out and about, and finding parking takes a while.  Just plan for it, and you won't be frustrated :)  The parking is allowed for people without residential stickers from 6pm to 8am the next day. ie. only 2 hour parking M-Sa without a residential sticker.  On weekends there is no restriction - so if you park after 6pm on Saturday, you should be good for the rest of the weekend :) Please keep in mind that certain days have street cleaning! Please read the signs before you park. There are several parking garages less than a 10 minute walk to my place if you prefer that - they show up on (Go.Gl) Maps. I don't have  a car

neighborhood_overview: Nob Hill is a picturesque neighborhood blocks from major tourist and business sites. It's an ideal location for a quiet home base to explore or work in SF. Around the corner, you'll find Grace Cathedral, European-style Huntington Park, and historic San Francisco hotels (my 95 year old mother went out for dates at the iconic Tonga Room). The apartment is only a few blocks from downtown shopping in Union Square and the famous cable cars, and a short walk from offices in the Financial District and Market Street. Very central and walkable area. Easy to get to Trader Joes by foot if you have no car. There is also a corner market.
transit: Public transportation and Uber & Lyft are the easiest way to get around. I do have a parking space if you have a car.

name: Secret Lounge in The Mission
description: The Mission District has it all-restaurants, cafes, parks, nightlife, shops, no hills, public transportation and the most sun and fun in San Francisco. The Secret Lounge is your pied-à-terre from which to experience it all. Our Place: This is a one-room/studio apartment in our house that is completely private with its own bathroom and front door.  A lot of thought went into creating The Secret Lounge as we wanted a private place that our parents could stay in when they visit their grandchildren. In the times between visits, we are open to renting it out as we are avid travelers and always like to stay off the beaten path as well and enjoy meeting like-minded people.  If you're in SF for work, internship, school or simply looking for temporary housing, this is the place. Of course it includes it's own shower, bathroom, and kitchen-esque area (not a full kitchen but enough to cook with microwave, induction burner, electric kettle, coffee maker, pots/pan/plates etc).  We love our neighbor
neighborhood_overview: The Mission has the best food, best weather and the best people. Come check it out for yourself.
transit: We're close to 24th St BART (our subway system) and 1 block from #12 bus to downtown/chinatown. The Mission is very flat and walkable. We almost never drive. Bike rentals are also available in SF and there's a city bike-share rack 1 block from us.

name: View, space, peace, and tranquility.
description: Private, spacious, and comfortable room.  Centrally situated in the center of SF (literally!), atop of the hill at the border of Castro & Noe Valley.   Well connected with public transit,  ample free parking, and a short walk to the heart of Castro/Noe Valley.  The neighborhood is quiet, safe, and clean; far enough from the grind, yet close enough to SOMA/FiDi - ready access to all of SF without sacrificing your sanity.  Friendly, respectful, and worldly host with one cool cat! 很歡迎中国朋友! There are plenty of apartments in SF that have a view.  But then there is this view.  My situated at the end of a cul de sac at the border of Noe Valley and Castro.  It sit on top of the hill overlooking the entire eastern part of San Francisco and Cole Valley.   The bedroom is huge, and it has plenty of floor space and closet space for two guests.  The bed has a new mattress with memory foam topper, and it is one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on, and the past guests concurred too! The
neighborhood_overview: My place is situated on the border of Castro and Noe Valley.  It's far enough from the main traffic to keep its own sanity and character yet close enough to walk to either 18th St (Castro's commercial center) or 24th St (Noe Valley's commercial center).  Plenty of affordable dining options on both streets. Molly Stone and Whole Foods are both within reasonable walking distance. Looking for coffee?  Neighbor's Corner (serving Andy Town coffee, one of the smoothest local roast), Philtz (SF original), and Spikes.   Plenty of green space around here too.
transit: You do not need the car to get around in SF and to/from my place.   Here's some info about getting around from my place.  1. Muni underground at Castro station.  From my place, it's about a 13min leisurely walk downhill to Castro Muni station.  Coming back, going uphills, can be a bit more physical.  But it takes me usually 15mins, and it's not a big deal at all. 2. Or you can take bus 35 to/from Castro station, and it'll save you some walking, and it's another 5 min easy walk to the entrance of my building.  Or you can take Bus 48 (4min walk), that will take you along 24th St (the main shopping corridor of Noe Valley) and all the way to Mission district and then Potrero Hill, or to the Sunset district in the opposite direction. 3. Or use Lyft Line or Uber Pool.  Unless you are going downtown/SOMA during morning rush hours, you can get around most part of the city for about $4.5.  Considering it costs $2.5/ride on Muni (although transfer included), I think $4.5 is a bargain for going d

name: LUXURY ✦ SPACIOUS ✦ UPSCALE ✦ 1 BR Downtown Suite
description: From the gold rush, to the hippie era, to today's high-tech times, iconic San Francisco awaits. Truly the city that has it all, set along the water, with rolling hills and a unique mix of architecture. The Canterbury is a chic and modern resort within walking distance to shopping at Union Square or just a short cable car ride to the Ferry Building Marketplace for those food lovers. Whether it be for business or pleasure this haven will not fall short of your expectations. This unit measures 520- 695 sq ft & can sleep up to 4 people. A queen sized bed in the living room & a sofa bed in the living room. The partial kitchen includes a sink, microwave & mini fridge. Thoughtful extras include: Television, hairdryer, stereo, DVD, in room safe, & wifi internet access. Amenities: Fitness Center Laundry Facilities Business Center Concierge Wifi Valet Parking Fireplace in Lobby Please note that there is no onsite parking; however, our optional valet service is $52 plus tax per night per vehicle
neighborhood_overview: The Canterbury is situated in the heart of downtown San Francisco and features guest suites with free Wi-Fi, an on-site restaurant and 24-hour front desk. This celebrated resort blends past with present, having been a famed fixture in San Francisco for more than 70 years. Tasteful interior renovations tips its hat to the past, but give guests all the modern conveniences and style of today.
transit: The iconic cable car, itself a national landmark, is a great way to tour the city’s hills and must-see sights. Hop aboard for seafood and sourdough at Fisherman’s Wharf and a view of Alcatraz. Golden Gate Bridge emerges like magic from the fog, and transports you to Marin County and the giant redwoods of Muir Woods. Fisherman’s Wharf is less than 30 minutes away via public transit. The Golden Gate Bridge is just 15 minutes’ drive from The Canterbury, and the Cable Car Museum is less than 15 minutes’ walk away.

This suite is on the ground floor of my house. Access is through the garage. Your own special getaway after a long day in the bustling city of San Francisco. This cozy and welcoming in law suite is yours for your vacation! A simple yet warm kitchenette for all your cooking needs, equipped with a microwave, kettle, french press and many other needed cooking pots, pans and utensils. A small dining area to complete our kitchen space.   This cozy suite is on the ground floor of my house. Access is through my garage. It has a queen sized bed and also a sofa be

My neighborhood is a residential neighborhood is not close to downtown or most tourist spots but bus stop is a block away and 15 -20 mins walk to Balboa Bart Station. Uber or Lyft is the most convenient way to get around city.
transit: Bus line 14  & 88 is a block away from my house. Bus 88 will take you to the Bart Station which can take you most places and faster. Bus 14 is the most economic way, it will takes you to downtown, embarcadero, and ferry plaza and it runs 24 hours.

name: Heart of Mission, mins to Downtown, prime location
description: Bright and spacious 2nd story condo in the heart of the vibrant and eclectic Mission district, just off 24th Street. There’s tons to do locally: many great restaurants within blocks, murals and art cover 24th and its side streets, hop the boutique shops and record stores on Valencia t., and there always seems to be something going on in the neighborhood. A short walk to BART station will have you downtown in minutes, with SF attractions easily reached, like the Embarcadero or Oracle Park. The master bedroom has a queen-sized bed and is quite spacious. The second bedroom is usually the baby’s room; the bed is an air mattress (which is very firm and comfortable) and the crib will still be in here. If you have a small infant/toddler, you are welcome to use the crib. The dresser has a change table on top. Sheets for both are available. The kitchen is large and has everything you need to cook your meals at home. Help yourself to tea, coffee, milk, oil, sauces, spices, herbs, fruit, veggies
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is very happening! We do all our shopping at the local markets at the end of the street. Phil's has the best coffee I've ever tasted which a couple blocks away and we're surrounded by amazing restaurants and brunch spots. Precita Park (10 min walk south) and Dolores Park are both great places to picnic when the weather is nice.   There are fun bars and  restaurants all along 24th street, in a variety of styles and price points. If you walk a about 10 mins to the West, you'll find Valencia street, which is also bustling with great shops, restaurants, bars, cafes, you name it. It's right beside Mission St. which is also unique and interesting.
transit: The location can't be beat here. We're close enough to downtown that it's easy to get there but not so close you have sacrifice space or a fair price. Highway access is minutes away which makes getting up and down the rest of the Bay Area a breeze. Transit in San Francisco is not the greatest but we are a few minutes walk to the BART station which is really a game changer if you're taking transit. Other than that there are plenty of bus routes nearby which can not be said of many parts of the city.

name: Wyndham Deluxe 1BR ApartHotel  #13 - Walk to DF!
description: Ideal for Dreamforce, your chic Wyndham Canterbury Resort 1BR Suite is right in the city’s shopping and theatre district and ONLY 1 MILE from MOSCONE CENTER. This 600-square-ft Suite is among the largest in the city and features a living room with pull-out sofa, flat-screen TV, DVD player, kitchenette, dining area, large bathroom, and free WiFi.  The property also provides a fitness center, games room, DVD library, business center, meeting areas, laundry facilities, and paid parking. This is the best of both worlds -- feel like you are in a hotel with hotel amenities like 24/7 front desk, concierge desk, meeting lounges, a business center, a DVD lounge, fitness center, games room, valet parking, etc. But at the same time, you have a very nice 600-square ft (55m2) efficiency apartment with your own kitchenette, living room, and dining area. Checkin can be done through the front desk 24 hours a day, and once checked in, you will have a key-card to access your suite.  In addition to your
neighborhood_overview: The Wyndham Canterbury is very conveniently located only 3 blocks from Union Square and approximately 1 mile (1.61 km) from Moscone Center. It is close to tons of restaurants, bars, grocery stores, shopping, museums, and other resources.
transit: You can walk to most things you need (although the property is located on a hill). Uber/Lyft is the most convenient way to get around. There are parking garages close by, but street parking can be difficult.

This room is on the 2nd floor facing backyard. It has a large queen-sized bed and a twin-sized bed, totally can fit 3 guests. This home is perfect for tourists, business travelers and families.

name: Stare in Awe at the SF Skyline
description: Feel the energy and channel your empire state of mind in this condo with 180 degree views of surrounding glass and art-deco skyscrapers.  Located in the heart of the Financial District, this condo boasts convenience, privacy and warmth. Furnished with a tasteful and unique mix of Chinoiserie art and modern wood pieces – the place exudes charm and Zen.  Window treatments help to control the light and the rush of downtown SF.  Open just a few blinds or all to gather in the tallness of San Francisco at its finest. Boasting 718 square-feet, every furniture piece was selected with care. There is a dedicated office work area, a large flat screen TV, cozy leather arm-chair and comfortable plush sofa.  Dine at a bistro table under a whimsical pendant lighting. The bedroom has a queen bed and also encloses the bathroom and large walk-in master closet. Washer and dryer is inside unit. No pets.  No parking. The building has a 24-hour front desk, common rooftop deck with grill. Chani Trafficante i

Walk to the Golden Gate Park and Ocean beach, 24/7 Safeway, Beach Chalet, Cliff House and other restaurants. No parties. No pets. No smoking. It is on the second floor. There are three bedrooms altogether. One of them is mine, and the other two are for Airbnb. The house was remodeled in 2016 while still retaining 1932 details.  Big living room with HDTV, comfortable couches and a sleeper sofa. The  bedroom features a queen-size bed that can fit two people with luxurious bedding, closet, study table and a window.  There are one full bathroom and a half bathroom. The full bathroom includes a stand shower, tub, towels and bath supplies. There are microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator, electric kettle, a dining-table, pans, bowls and plates, tableware, and all kinds of seasoning in the kitchen. description: Fisherman's Wharf Best Budget Boutique Hotel. Experience a Historic Hotel, the same way as it was built back in 1906. Each room is unique and decorated in the Victorian Style; shared bathrooms down the hall. Room has one Double Bed for two people and a sink. Perfect for couples, or the singular traveler, also known as a double which sleeps two, and includes a sink basin and a window to the exterior of the hotel. Our style is simplicity- there are no telephones or TV's in the rooms. Some rooms feature a private sink. Built in 1906, we maintain an old world ambiance furnished with beautiful antiques. neighborhood_overview: The San Remo Hotel is conveniently located along the 49-Mile Scenic Drive in a quiet historic San Francisco North Beach neighborhood. North Beach is a neighborhood in northeast San Francisco adjacent to Chinatown, Fisherman’s Wharf and Russian Hill. The neighborhood is San Francisco’s Little Italy, and has historically been home to a large Italian American population and is still home to many Italian restaurants. Today, North Beach is populated by a mix of young urban professionals, families and Chinese immigrants connected to adjacent Chinatown. The American Planning Association has named North Beach as one of ten ‘Great Neighborhoods in America’. Fisherman’s Wharf and Pier 39 beckon to the north, only a few intersections away. A half-mile south, the lofty twin spires of Saints Peter and Paul Church are visible high above rooftops, marking Washington Square, the heart of North Beach. The Transamerica Pyramid, the city’s tallest building, and other financial district skyscrapers are fr
transit: We work with a parking garage one block from the hotel. Here is what you need to know when visiting the San Remo Hotel. The closest parking lot is: North Point Center Public Parking (it is not owned by the San Remo) Located on Mason St at North Point Street Discounted parking with the hotel is $20.00 per 24 hrs. plus tax Single entry parking (no in-and-out access). You will need to validate your ticket at the hotel before exiting your vehicle our of the North Point Center. Our White Zone is for loading and unloading only. Please keep the White Zone clear, or you may be ticketed. Please do not leave any valuables of any kind in your car when parking at the North Point Center. Please see the Front Desk for rates, instructions and directions on parking garages, as well as information on bike rentals and overnight storage. name: Cozy Haven with private entrance and private bath
description: This lovely space is situated on the cusp of the very popular Glen Park, Noe Valley, Mission and Bernal neighborhoods. This cozy room with private entrance, private full bath, "kitchenette", and private outdoor space (where smoking is permitted) will be a welcome respite for the weary traveler.  Free street parking. This cozy room, with its own private entrance and private full bath, has a very comfortable American twin (single) bed with lots of pillows and warm comforters. This charming room is small and perfect for one, but If you are interested in booking the unit for two, a tri-fold foam futon with a complete set of bedding is in the room and can be made up at bedtime. I recommend folding up the futon during daytime hours to give you both more living space.  The "kitchenette" area includes a flat screen TV, fridge, microwave, toaster, Keurig coffee maker, electric teapot,  dinnerware, silverware, bottle opener, and can opener. Complimentary Peet's coffee, teas, cookies and bottled
neighborhood_overview: Our charming Victorian home is just an easy 10 to 15 minute walk from the Glen Park BART station and is located on the cusp of four of San Francisco's most diverse and vibrant neighborhoods: Glen Park, Noe Valley, the Mission and Bernal Heights. All four neighborhoods have lively restaurant and bar scenes and multi-cultural shopping areas. For the nature lovers, our home is located within walking distance to beautiful outdoor spaces with lovely vistas such as Billy Goat Hill, Bernal Heights Park and Glen Park Canyon.  We are a 15 minute ride from SFO, and for those who drive we have easy free street parking.  Abundant public transportation is nearby,  and will get you anywhere you want to go in San Francisco and beyond.
transit: With fantastic walkability and public transportation (Glen Park Bart and Muni) a stones throw away, you can not only enjoy the local neighborhoods, but also all that San Francisco has to offer with ease. Secure storage is available for bicycles, and free street parking for those who arrive by car.

name: Private room in The Mission, excellent location!
description: Very large private room with en suite living room in exceptional location: the heart of the Mission, close to everything including many popular restaurants, bars, cafes, movie theaters, parks, galleries, art & other local attractions! Private in-room living area includes a large wrap-around couch, sofa bed, 55" TV and a private deck. The location and layout are great for singles, business travelers, couples. With the sofa bed, room accommodates 3 adults max or a family (2 adults + 2 children). - Private room with en suite living room // room can be divided into two private sleeping areas (queen bed + full sleeper sofa).  - Private & secluded hot tub below a majestic 100+ year old redwood tree  - Two decks and a large backyard with a Weber gas grill perfect for small indoor/outdoor gatherings or meals  - You will have access to two Samsung Smart TVs (one in the room and one in the living room): there is NO cable television but you will have access to digital satellite stations as well a
neighborhood_overview: Named for the 1776-built Mission Dolores, the Mission District is an exuberant, evolving neighborhood with Latino roots and a hipster vibe. Old-school taquerias and eclectic live-music clubs mix with chef-driven eateries and craft cocktail lounges. There are also tattoo parlors, gourmet ice cream shops and Dolores Park, a popular weekend hangout with skyline views. Vibrant murals line streets such as Clarion Alley.
transit: The Mission District is an excellent location so not much you can't find within walking distance, including the 24th BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) metro station for easy sub-way access to the rest of the city.

Parking is free if you have a handicap placard, other wise weekends are free and you will need a parking pass from the SF MTA if you want to park longer than 2 hours.  2 Week Increment Permits – A start date for use must be provided when purchasing the permit. SFMTA will issue permit with this date. The date provided cannot be altered or changed. A maximum of 32 weeks allowed per calendar year per address. Pre-Paid One-Day Permits – Purchase in advance and scratch off the corresponding date on the permit when it is used. A maximum of 20 permits per address may be purchased per calendar year.
