name: Hip and spacious near Dolores Park
description: Located in the heart of the trendy Mission district, light abounds in this bright, modern apartment with old school Edwardian charm. Steps away from cafes, boutiques, transit and Dolores Park, it's the perfect place to experience San Francisco. Spacious, modern one-bedroom apartment in the heart San Francisco's Mission District.  Steps from public transit, iconic Dolores Park, and countless restaurants and shops.  Ideal for weekend getaways and for business travelers. You'll have access to the entire apartment including the outdoor deck and large, lush garden. Please note that the garden is shared with my wonderful neighbors, so please be polite and respectful of anyone you bump into. I'll meet you when you arrive and provide you with a key to the unit which you can use to come and go as you please. I will not be on the property but will be close by if you run into any trouble or need anything. I love welcoming people into my home and will be happy to provide you with suggestions or ti
neighborhood_overview: The Mission is hands down one of San Francisco's coolest and most distinctive neighborhoods, and this apartment is in the heart of it all. Great restaurants – from casual cafes to upscale eateries – abound here, as do hip clothing boutiques, trendy bars, and bright, colorful murals. On weekends, lively Dolores Park fills with a myriad of San Franciscans, making it the perfect place for sun bathing and people watching. Some neighborhood favorites, all within a few blocks of the apartment: - Quick bites: Tartine Bakery, Little Star Pizza, Taqueria Pancho Villa, Pica Pica, Curry Up Now and Orenchi Beyond - Great meals: Delfina, Range, Burma Love, Locanda and Starbelly - Hip coffee shops: Four Barrel Coffee, Samovar and Ritual - Grocery stores: Whole Foods and Safeway are both a few short blocks away, along with many other smaller specialty markets - Fun bars: ABV, Elixir, Gestalt, Churchill, Blackbird and Hi Tops
transit: The apartment is three short blocks from the 16th and Mission BART station and just two blocks from the Church Muni underground station, making it a breeze to get around San Francisco and the greater Bay Area (including both the San Francisco and Oakland airports). Uber and Lyft are also great options and always arrive quickly.

name: Stylish Home by the Beach w/ Easy Downtown Access
description: Welcome to my Sunset home! You'll be staying just a minute from the beach, convenient to lots of shops and restaurants, and Golden Gate Park too! We updated our home not too long ago and, being a real-estate agent, I've always loved staging homes with high-end furniture and have definitely brought that passion into our own home :) Our home is located in the Outer Sunset, only 7 blocks from Ocean Beach! You'll be able to enjoy city-living as well as the peace and quiet of the beach. Our home is a 3-bedroom house, perfect for families and furry family members coming to the city for the first time or even on return trips! One of the bedrooms (XL twin trundle bed) is only accessible by going through either of the other two bedrooms. We have a dining table that seats 6 and a great 6-burner gas stove ready to handle any big family that might find their way to our home! Also, our washer and dryer is free for you to use during your stay. Guests will have full access to our home including your
neighborhood_overview: The Outer Sunset offers some of the best natural beauty that San Francisco has to offer, and it's away from the bustle of downtown. The salty ocean mist (only 5 blocks away) makes the sunset views even more spectacular on clear evenings. Our home is only 2 blocks from Golden Gate Park and a block away from the bustling shops and restaurants on Judah Street, giving you plenty of options within minutes walking distance.
transit: We're lucky enough to have the N-Judah MUNI stop just half a block away! This one line takes you through the Haight (where the hippie movement started!), Duboce triangle (just a few streets north of the Castro), and through to Downtown/Union Square in 35 min without the hassle of looking for parking! You could also take it a few more stops down to the Embarcadero to catch stunning views of the Bay Bridge. From the Embarcadero, there are also a few MUNI bus lines that can take you to Coit Tower and Fisherman's Wharf! That being said, Uber/Lyft are also extremely cheap and reliable, often times equal to the price of taking public transit (depending on the number of people communing) considering one-way on public transit is $2.75/person. Lastly, for those who have Zipcar memberships, there's a Zipcar just across the street for when you want to drive around yourselves.

Hardwood floors throughout with white wainscotting  and colorful trim in every room provide a clean and open feel.  Centrally located! The fourth bedroom has bunk bed and closest to the bathrooms.  The open floor layout lends itself to easy entertaining in the living room, dining room and kitchen. You have access to all of the house including garden area.  Washer, dryer, dishwasher, microwave, and WIFI. If you need street parking, then I can provide daily parking pass for $15/ day. name: Big + Elegant room w/2 beds in Spacious Flat - 1
description: Full of light, clean and very spacious on the top floor of a newly updated Edwardian building built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and just steps away from the famous Haight and Ashbury streets.  You'll have plenty of privacy to slumber in this largely spread out apartment with 3 private bedrooms, 2 living/hangout rooms, and a newly updated and light filled kitchen.  THIS APARTMENT HAS SHARED ROOMS (kitchen, living room, & 1 bathroom) SO YOU WILL ENCOUNTER OTHER GUESTS AND THE HOST LIVES ON SITE WHEN NOT TRAVELING. The Room you are renting includes a queen size bed as well as a twin bed with trundle bed so this room sleeps four.  It also has a TV. Your room has it's own lock on the bedroom door. Here is a link to another bedroom in my apartment: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/18550910 You will share the rest of the house with other guests in two other rooms, Kitchen, Living room, bathroom, washer and dryer (shared spaces) If you would like to book another room in the apartment, here
neighborhood_overview: Born of counterculture roots, this creative-minded slice of San Francisco is a haven for urban hippies and vintage enthusiasts. Haight-Ashbury’s colorful architecture, boldly nostalgic shops, and eclectic (and most likely organic) cafes and restaurants exude a magnetism that draws many to the neighborhood.  Its laissez-faire attitude also attracts folks on the fringe, so Haight-Ashbury might not be your cup of yerba mate should you dislike being approached for spare change.
transit: SFO Airport: 25 minutes by cab without traffic Golden Gate Park: 5 minute walk Fisherman's Wharf: 50 minutes by public transit The Ferry Building: 33 minutes by public transit

description: Savor the aesthetic beauty of this San Francisco architectural jewel. The historic house retains much of its charming, original architectural details, which contrast beautifully with modern-day finishes, warm woods, and subtle uses of color.
neighborhood_overview: Noe Valley is a quiet, family-friendly neighborhood in one of the warmest areas in San Francisco, and characterized by a great variety of homes – including Victorian, Edwardian, Spanish, and contemporary. It is a short stroll to small local shops, restaurants, and Whole Foods.
transit: If you drove, street parking is easily accessible.  If you like to use public transportation, there are several bus stops two to four blocks away.  It is a quick transfer from the bus to BART or to the J-Church Street car.  While you can take BART from the airport, I would recommend taking Uber or Lyft to the house.  It takes approximately 1/2 hour from the airport to the house, depending on traffic.

Very quiet one bedroom apt in a very quiet four unit building, complete with fine linens, fully equipped kitchen, high end bathroom. Relax in the garden after a long day of exploring near by sights. You will have full access to the entire garden apt floor - totally private. The neighborhood is very colorful and the apt is steps away from many places to dine, shop and grab a drink. The MUNI is very close - three blocks away for all public trains - and the bus line 37 is in front of the apt. On street parking, but Uber/Lyft is best when exploring San Francisco

name: Classic SF. Views! Quiet, UCSF, GG Park, Haight.
description: Filled with art and light, this cozy Edwardian/Victorian is on a quiet street in charming and centrally located Cole Valley.  The spacious master bedroom features a comfortable queen bed and large work space.  The second bedroom offers a queen bed with gel memory foam mattress.  Closets in each bedroom.  Airbeds are available for use in either bedroom or the living room.  All areas are for guests' use except third bedroom, which is for my use only. A five minute walk to Golden Gate Park, Haight Street, UCSF, and Cole Street (great restaurants, shops, bars and groceries).  Easy parking, minutes away from the hiking trails of Mt. Sutro.  Public transportation options are 3 minutes away; buses and trains are a 15 minute ride from downtown. Enjoy this light-filled class and cozy San Francisco home.  The entire first floor is yours to use -- cozy living room (with TV and cable access), and dining room and kitchen with panoramic views of downtown and the east bay hills.  Both calm and spacio
neighborhood_overview: This is an ideal setting for fun and business in San Francisco.   You are a quick train ride from downtown and within walking distance of UCSF, Golden Gate Park, Haight Street and many neighborhood delights.  Cole Valley and Parnassus Heights are charming small neighborhoods nestled between the Mt. Sutro Open Space Preserve and the Haight Ashbury.  There's a multitude of great restaurants in the area.  Golden Gate Park, with the de Young Museum, the fabulous Academy of Sciences, and miles of beauty  is 5 minutes away.
transit: The N Judah (light rail), a 5 minute walk from my home, takes you directly to Powell and Market and the cable car turnaround.  Several buses, also minutes away, also provide easy access to downtown and other parts of San Francisco.  It's relatively easy to park on my street (a typical San Francisco hill, a parking adventure!) although parking is limited to two hours on weekdays.  My home is a walker's delight, simply head out the door in any direction for a myriad of great walks (suggestions available)!

name: Entire Flat/Bedroom, Location!, Walk! Eat Local!
description: The home and room is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.  Lots of restaurants, coffee shops and markets within an easy two block walk.  UCSF Benioff Hospital is four block walk and new Golden State Warriors basketball coliseum is an easy, flat 8 block walk. Baseball Field is an easy 20min walk.   The actual San Francisco Bay is a flat, easy 8 min walk, pathways, views and a couple fun restaurants.   Your home is close to Farley’s, Chez Maman and Plow.(coffee and eats) The bedroom has a queen size bed that is a permanent fixture to the room. There is a space heater provided if you get cold.  Two nice in~room arm chairs and a little table to relax after a day of touring or work.  With a large 55” HD TV.  Clean carpet and hardwood mixed flooring.  Regularly cleaned and always smells fresh of nothing!   The home is occupied full time by myself and a female housemate.  It is extremely secure and we both are very experienced with the BNB sharing environment for many y
neighborhood_overview: Best "real neighborhood" in San Francisco.   A classic, very hilly neighborhood with fabulous views of San Francisco.   Northern view of neighborhood is of San Francisco, south neighborhood is very hilly.
transit: The 22 Bus line is one block away. Parking is usually no problem, but pay attention to signs on both sides of street. Street cleaning Monday and Wednesday 9-11am 2hr parking above signs on either side of street.  Turn/Chalk your wheels!! or a ticket Lock and Do not leave anything in your car

name: Walkers' Paradise in Noe Valley LWR
description: Situated one block from the 24th st Noe Valley.  This wonderful room set in a 3-bedroom 3-story victorian home is a "walker's paradise" scoring a 96 "walk score" with access to shops of every kind! Situated one block from the 24th st Noe Valley downtown, this wonderful room set in a 3-bedroom 3-story victorian home features walking access to shops of every kind! Your room features a comfy Queen sized bed, an armoire, and full length mirror, among other things. There is a wonderful kitchen with updated cabinetry, large fridge, and stove. Feel free to chef something up, all of the spices and condiments are available for your use. The bathroom is located right outside your private room and features a soaking tub with shower. The extra large living room features couch, TV with Netflix, fireplace, dining room table, and wide windows. There is also an exceptional second floor patio where you can enjoy breakfast in the sun, or simply hang out. We are right off the main drag in Noe Valley, and
neighborhood_overview: Situated right on 25th st, one block from the 24th st Noe Valley downtown, this wonderful room set in a 3-bedroom 3-story apartment features walking access to nearly everything you can imagine! Whole Foods, Boutique shops, yummy food, and excellent bars are all within a couple minute walk. Noe Valley is situated right next to the famous San Francisco Mission district and is only a quick 5-10 minute walk away. There you can enjoy traditional hispanic food, lively nightlife, and of course the world famous Dolores park.
transit: Being located in Noe Valley makes it extremely easy to get anywhere in the city within a matter of minutes.  For those coming from the airport this place is perfect, just a short UBER rider or BART trip.  Once you're here you are only one block to the J Church MUNI line, as well as several other MUNI busses that can take you to the various areas of San Francisco.  BART is a 5-10 minute walk down in the Mission district and can take you all over the Bay Area, from downtown San Francisco to Oakland, the world is at your fingertips.  Getting around our 7x7 city is easy. Especially when you are in a place like this.

name: Stunning Serene Garden Studio near GG Park
description: Amazing garden studio in a perfect walkable location. The contemporary and clean studio was completely remodeled down to the studs.  Includes:  - Beautiful Brazilian hardwood floors - Sink counter bar with instant hot water - Wine cooler for refreshing drinks - Nespresso Coffee Maker to start the day - Huge closet for your luggage - Chic bathroom & more.   The apartment has tall ceilings, recess lights,  a queen size bed for you to relax on,  and the unit walks out into a peaceful garden. There is a private side entrance along the fence line on Cabrillo Street to enter the studio. Once you're inside, you can enter to the garden apartment.  There is off street parking available,  laundry service one block away,  and for a quick meal, a variety of delicious restaurants within walking distance. Guest entry is located on the side gate of Cabrillo Street. Airbnb will provide you the access code after booking. Please enter the code and press the red logo to enter. Your space is in a separate
neighborhood_overview: The studio is  located one block away from Golden Gate Park, Chain of Lakes, minutes away from Ocean Beach, Safeway, Cliff House, the Beach Chalet Restaurant and Balboa St. Amenities which include wonderful cafes, tasty bakeries, a diversity of restaurants, and the Balboa movie theatre. We are nearby to Golden Gate, Lincoln, and Harding Park Golf Courses (where PGA tournaments are played).
transit: We are located one block away from public transit to Downtown/Financial District/SOMA.  Minutes away from the Great Highway along Ocean Beach to drive southbound, minutes away to Park Presidio Blvd. to drive northbound to Marin and Napa and Sonoma wineries.

description: This charming location is perfect for your San Francisco get-away.  It is conveniently located near all of the action of North Beach including many popular restaurants, parks, playgrounds, shops and nightlife.  MUNI access is two blocks away and it is walking distance to Chinatown, Fisherman’s Wharf and the Financial District. Studio with private entrance. We will be a Call or Text away! North Beach is home to the famous Coit Tower, one of San Francisco's most recognizable landmarks.  We have a great nightlight and fantastic restaurants.  With a walk score of 98, this location is a walker's paradise with everything needed for the best of SF close at hand.  Coit Tower and Washington Square Park are steps away! Convenient access to multiple neighborhoods with easy access to great dining, shopping, and transportation. Neighborhood parking is limited and however, there are a few secure, paid garages within a 5 block radius.

name: Charming, cozy house in Bernal!
description: Sweet, comfortable 3 bedroom home in Bernal Heights, San Francisco. Close to airport, freeways, walking distance to shops, restaurants, cafes, parks, bars, and public transportation. Great location and a fabulous neighborhood! Our house gets great light and is stylish, clean, and comfortable. Guests will have access to the whole house and backyard. We have an outdoor table and a bbq outside. We will have people to greet you when you come! Bernal Heights is a hip and fun neighborhood. Has all the charm of a small village, but is also quite worldly. The weather is sunny and bright most of the time. Hiking up Bernal hill is a favorite pastime for many in the neighborhood. We are located on the south side of the slope. There is lots to do here, plus we are a hop, skip, and jump away from the Mission district, and Noe Valley. Public transpiration is conveniently available right around the corner from our house and can take you anywhere you want to go. There is a blog for our neighborhood: B

Hiking up Bernal hill is a favorite pastime for many in the neighborhood. We are located on the south side of the slope. There is lots to do here, plus we are a hop, skip, and jump away from the Mission district, and Noe Valley. Public transpiration is conveniently available right around the corner from our house and can take you anywhere you want to go. There is a blog for our neighborhood: Berna (Website hidden by Airbnb) for current info. and news about Bernal Heights. Sandbox bakery is yummy, and there are lots of good restaurants ... Vega, Bernal Star, Hillside Supper Club, Moki's Sushi, the Front Porch, Blue Plate, Little Bea's bakery, Martha's Cafe, Precita Park Cafe. Great library too. Bernal Park, Holy Park, and Precita Park are all close by and are great for kids. The Good Life grocery store is a nice market and has a
transit: Buses are a block away from our house. There are Uber and Lyft cars readily available. We are walking distance to the J Church train. And we are very close to the freeways and airports.

name: Beautiful Home with Vaulted Ceilings in Noe Valley
description: Vaulted ceilings and skylights give tons of natural light. Apartment has vintage charm and master bedroom has sweeping views of San Francisco. This is the upper level of a home that has two units.  You have your own private entrance and the space is perfect while in San Francisco.  There are two bedrooms, both with queen size beds. The open living area is comfortable that opens to the dining room and the kitchen. Plenty of space to relax after a long day in SF.  There is one parking space in the garage for a small vehicle. Guests have access to the entire unit, this is the upstairs part of the house, there is a lower unit with a completely separate entrance. I will not be available but I have a hosting company that is available for questions and emergencies 24 hours a day. Noe Valley is a quaint, highly-desired neighborhood that is centrally located and a hot spot for young professionals. The neighborhood features quintessential Victorian and Edwardian homes, and our home is at the top
neighborhood_overview: Noe Valley is a quaint, highly-desired neighborhood that is centrally located and a hot spot for young professionals. The neighborhood features quintessential Victorian and Edwardian homes, and our home is at the top of 24th street on a hill with gorgeous views of the city. 24th Street is stocked with bakeries, wine and cheese shops, cafes and a weekly farmers' market.

name: Sunset By The Beach
description: Location Location !! Stay in the outer sunset in this newly built (2017) ground level unit,  just 3 blocks from the beach. One of the safest neighborhoods in SF with an incredible food scene. The 18  muni bus right at the corner takes you to Stonestown mall and to the Richmond district. The L and N train are both located within walking distance and take you straight to downtown. We also provide rental cars on the Turo App. Pls message if car is needed The bedrooms have sliding doors which lead to backyard. You are welcome to open, but we ask that guests do not use the backyard. Thank you for understanding. Also, please remember this is a family home and not a hotel. A family with kids are living upstairs so there is potential for noise, footsteps and talking. Our usual  quiet hours are 9:30pm- 7:30am. name: Affordable Room in San Francisco
description: FREE Street PARKING! 15 min from downtown SF, a home away from home. Affordable private room with 2 twin beds in SF in a peaceful neighborhood and gorgeous views of the SF Bay. Very friendly and accommodating host with a touch of Filipino hospitality. Come, visit San Francisco! This home has been remodeled and updated. Private room is good for 2 guests. Your room has two twin beds for your restful sleep, linens provided, a mirrored closet and head of bed, your own Samsung cable connected TV, salt lamp for night’s dim light, portable heater that keeps the room warm, free wireless internet, and a telephone line with unlimited calls anywhere in North America, including Canada and Mexico. The bathroom is next to your room. Bathroom is shared in the house. It has shower, towels, soap/bath gels. Cameras/CCTV are installed outside the house and one inside the house facing the hallway for security.  ****** Usual check-in time is between 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM and is flexible if there is no guest ch
neighborhood_overview: The sunniest part of San Francisco.  Only 15 minutes from downtown San Francisco. This neighborhood is next to the DogPatch and Potrero Hill. 15-20 minutes drive from San Francisco International Airport, this house is in a quiet location that is close to everything.  It is at the end of Bayview-Hunters Point facing the San Francisco Bay (across Oakland). Lots of development going on around the area with condominium units being built within 2-5 blocks radius. Downtown SF and the Bay Bridge is viewable from the the neighborhood.  The area is by the bay in the east part of San Francisco with less vehicles passing by. There is no traffic in the area. It is good for people who likes to watch the sunrise or do jogging or walking in the morning, and for those who like to feel the breeze from the bay before sunset - an additional and unique experience worth to try for visitors while staying in San Francisco. ****** The Bayview Plaza Shopping Center (1 mile), Super Save Supermarket (1.2 miles)
transit: The house is one block from Bus 19 Final/First Stop. Also, it is one mile from the T Tram Line, which will take you to downtown San Francisco in 20 minutes.  I recommend taking an Uber or Lyft to most part of the city, or renting a car as it may take longer time when using transit system. Pool for Uber and Lyft is also cheaper. If you don't have a car or prefers the transit system, I recommend taking Bus #19 from Donahue Street going to Evans Station (takes less than 10 minutes) and then transfer to T Tram Line going to downtown SF (takes 20 minutes). Bus 19 also goes to downtown but it passes by a lot of villages and areas and will take longer time (approximately 1 hour). From San Francisco International Airport, the drive is 15-20 minutes. Uber and Lyft Pool is the cheapest way in and out of the airport with pick up and drop off at the Departure level only. Transportation is very good in San Francisco even late at night.

"Breakfast corner" providing coffee maker, microwave, and mini fridge for your use. One private bathroom with tub and shower.  We live in the floor above year-round, so we are available to help with anything you might need. My friendly dog Mr. Bean lives upstairs with me and may be eager to meet you. Our place can accommodate families, but is great for couples, visiting students, those traveling for business, or just checking out the city! We are working professionals so we will not be home 24/7 but are always accessible by phone for any needs that may arise. We will give you your privacy, but are responsive to any questions you might have. There is ample nearby shopping, such as Stonestown Galleria featuring Trader Joe's, Target, and Nordstrom. Close access to 280 and 101 freeway. A short trip away from Ocean Beach and the SF Zoo.
transit: K and M muni lines stop within 2 blocks, so you are always one muni ride from AT&T ballpark, downtown, and other popular sites. Easy access to Balboa Park BART station for travel around the Bay Area. Convenient access to 280 and 101 freeway for travel to and from the city.

name: Private Room + Private Bathroom
description: Our cozy garden room will be your oasis after an amazing day touring around San Francisco!  Located blocks from Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Park and a short drive to the Presidio,  with a bus stop on the corner to take you downtown. Before your arrival we will email you a code to get into the door by the garage and for the private room We live upstairs but we are hands off hosts. There is a great corner store and free street parking.  We are a few blocks from Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Park.   On Balboa there are restaurants, Bank of America and a large Walgreens on Geary Street just a few blocks up. A Safeway grocery store about 7 blocks away.  We are only a few blocks from Golden Gate Park and all the amazing things it has to offer. Also, only 7 blocks from the legendary Ocean Beach with some great surfing/kite boarders to watch and you can enjoy dinner or beers at The Cliff House or Beach Chalet.  Sutro Baths and great hikes at Lands End are also blocks away with amazing views of t
neighborhood_overview: There is a great corner store and free street parking.  We are a few blocks from Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Park.   On Balboa there are restaurants, Bank of America and a large Walgreens on Geary Street just a few blocks up. A Safeway grocery store about 7 blocks away.  We are only a few blocks from Golden Gate Park and all the amazing things it has to offer. Also, only 7 blocks from the legendary Ocean Beach with some great surfing/kite boarders to watch and you can enjoy dinner or beers at The Cliff House or Beach Chalet.  Sutro Baths and great hikes at Lands End are also blocks away with amazing views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the Lands End trail. The Zoo is 3 short miles away (my family and I bike there!) 15 minutes (by car) to the Presidio, Crissy Field and the Golden gate Bridge.
transit: Great public transportation right on Balboa or Geary can take you straight across the city to downtown. The Muni bus right on 40th & Balboa will take you downtown for $2 There is free street parking but you must be cognoscenti of all street cleaning signs (each side of every street is different) and make sure not to block anyone's driveway (including ours;-)) A bus stop is around the corner which will take you downtown.  Although if you plan to be downtown for most of your trip, this is not the spot for you as the bus will take a good 25-40 minutes depending on stops. If you drive from the airport we are about 20 minutes using the Great Highway.  If you drive downtown its about 20 minutes straight across town on Geary. if your using public transportation it can take 30-40 minutes. * How far is the nearest BART station? There is a Muni bus right on 40th and Balboa that takes you straight across down for $2

Close to city attractions, restaurants, freeways and public transportation. My place is good for couples, business travelers, and families with kids. Conveniently located on Castro & 26th St, this comfortable, sun-filled flat is the Lower unit in a traditional Noe Valley house, which is very quiet with nice view of the city and the bay. The living / dining area is spacious. The two bedrooms have one queen-size bed and one king-size bed. description: Large and sunny one bedroom with views of Candlestick Park and the Bay. Apartment with a great view on the Bay. 815 square feet, fully furnished with large capacity washer and dryer, dishwasher, refrigerator and dedicated parking. One bedroom, large bathroom, and a living room that overlooks Candlestick Park and San Francisco Bay. Modern decor.  Candlestick Point the cove is located 7 minutes from San Francisco International Airport and 10  to 15 minutes to most major attractions in the City. Take the Candlestick Park exit to access the condominium complex.  A CalTrain station, muni station and T-Line are within walking distance. A walk along the Bay is just a minute away. The nightlife is a 10 minute drive down highway 280 to San Francisco's eclectic nightlife.

description: Our remodeled apartment building is located in downtown San Francisco, within walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Financial District. This furnished furnished studio is on the 5th floor on a lively stretch of O'Farrell with plenty of options for restaurants, shopping, and public transportation! This is a great hotel alternative. We look forward to hosting your stay whether for business or pleasure! - Fully equipped kitchen - Wifi - Smart TV - On-site laundry - Hardwood floors As our guest, you will have full access to your apartment, shared lobby and a private mailbox you can use during your stay. We also have a maintenance line you can call if needed. This building borders several neighborhoods including Fidi, Nob Hill, Union Square, and the Tenderloin.  The neighborhood is on the nitty-gritty side. There are also many famous tourist attractions close by such as the cable cars and Ferry Building. There is a great mall nearby called the West Field Shopping Center. Some

There are also many famous tourist attractions close by such as the cable cars and Ferry Building. There is a great mall nearby called the West Field Shopping Center. Some of our favorite restaurants and bars within walking distance include Brenda's French Soul Food, Borobudur (Indonesian) and Bourbon and Branch (an original speakeasy).

The band Jefferson Airplane used to live here when it was just formed in 1964. There're 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 1 living room, 1 kitchen, and 1 laundry room. TVs in all the bedrooms and living room. Two blocks from Haight-and-Ashbury one of the most famous attractions in San Francisco. There is definitely a lot of fun around this neighborhood. (1) The bus (MUNI) line N, several blocks away, can take you downtown San Francisco. (2) 5 mins away from Golden Gate Park on foot. name: Eco, Tidy & Quiet Designer Suite / Noe Valley
description: Comfortable, peaceful and well-appointed with thoughtful, elevated details. Great location full of charm, conveniences and sunshine; equally vibrant & peaceful with easy access to trendy areas. We reside in the home upstairs from the suite; it has private keyless entrance from the street without any stairs. Eco chic: 100% solar powered home! Walk or public transit to the Mission, Castro, Dolores Park, Hayes Valley, downtown, AT&T park, Moscone, etc. We have thoughtfully decorated the space with items we found on our global adventures and mixed them with modern classics to keep the space feeling clean but interesting. The suite is less than 10 years old, so unlike the 100 year old main house, it is modern & up to date! It is *professionally* cleaned after *every* guest. We ask that you make yourselves at home and treat the space with the care & respect that you would your own home. The suite is your private space, with a private keyless entrance from the street and includes a dedicated
neighborhood_overview: Our area is known for being very "neighborhoody" - lots of small restaurants & shops and in many cases, the shopkeepers recognize the locals. It is friendly, low-key and most importantly, usually sunny! We also love that we are walking distance to great stuff in the Mission & Castro, but come home to the peace & quiet of Noe Valley. We have easy access to downtown hotels & shopping, Moscone Convention Center, AT&T ballpark and all that the city has to offer! It is truly the best of all worlds.
transit: We are very close to several public transit options: - Bus stop on 24th & Castro - Muni (light rail) J line on 24th & Church - Bart (subway) on 24th & Mission - Tech shuttle buses on 24th (based on your employer) - Quick car service to Cal-Train If you have a car, street parking is readily available but be sure to read the signs! (we can help you decipher them). Please note that if you have balance or strength issues, walking in hilly SF may be a challenge. We are on one of the many hills so if this is a challenge for you, we recommend taking a car service (there are no stairs from the street to the front door so that part is easy!). This is just an FYI; we have hosted many seniors who have not had any difficulty! :)

name: Serene, private guest suite near Mission/Bernal
description: Newly constructed guest suite in a charming Art Deco style San Francisco home. Enjoy a private entrance and private use of our hillside backyard with a natural spring. King-size bed with super comfortable Stearns & Foster mattress. Dedicated workspace and separate chair for reading. Closet with plenty of space for your belongings. Mounted Roku TV with Netflix, Hulu, Prime, and HBO Now.   Beautiful tile in private bathroom. Roomy shower with rain shower head and glass doors. The guest suite is on the ground level of our house, and we live upstairs. You'll enter through our garage and walk out to the backyard where you can access your private room from French doors on the patio. We're always available for questions - just send us a message through the Airbnb app. The Excelsior is a quiet, residential neighborhood on the Southern edge of San Francisco. We are about a 15 min walk to Bernal Heights, 15 min walk to Glen Park, and a 10 min drive to the Mission. Take a 10 min Uber/Lyft to the
neighborhood_overview: The Excelsior is a quiet, residential neighborhood on the Southern edge of San Francisco. We are about a 15 min walk to Bernal Heights, 15 min walk to Glen Park, and a 10 min drive to the Mission.
transit: Take a 10 min Uber/Lyft to the Mission, where there are tons of great restaurants, bars, and shops (or anywhere else you want to go in the city). You can also walk 15 mins to the Glen Park Bart station, and from there you can easily get to the Mission, Downtown, East Bay, etc. You can park in front of our house if you bring a car, but please let us know so that we put our car in the garage and leave you the spot out front.

name: Brand new home with views. Close to... everything!
description: Newly remodeled 2000 sq. foot entertainment home - open plan living room, dining room, chefs kitchen, 3 decks with spectacular views of SF Bay and Oakland hills.  Sitting at the top of SF's sunniest hood: Potrero Hill  (beside Mission and Castro). Located only 2 blocks from Caltrain, 280 freeway, bars, restaurants, shops and down town. For work trips or family vacation or group get aways - the perfect house to relax and get to work quick or enjoy the city. Laundry on site and 1 car parking. Our newly remodeled home is perfect for work trips, family vacations or group getaways. We have a huge newly remodeled (2019) open plan kitchen / living room area with state of the art appliances, 8 seater dining table, a 75 inch 4G TV and sliding doors leading out to our new private deck with amazing views of the Bay. It’s a great  space to have fun or to switch off and relax in. We also have another smaller private deck upstairs on the top floor and 1 huge shared deck (if you wish to access). All
neighborhood_overview: We are located at the top of sunny Potrero Hill within 2 blocks of bars, restaurants, shops, parks and bus stops and Caltrains. Potrero is a vibrant, friendly neighborhood with amazing views of downtown San Francisco and offers quick access to downtown and the peninsula via 280 freeway (3 blocks away) For great meals check out Chez maman (French cuisine) - Pera (Mediterranean fare) Umi (sushi) - Mochica (Peruvian food and cocktails )  If you want something cheap and cheerful try Goat Hill Pizza or Ganims burgers All the above restaurants are located only 2 blocks away on 18th st in a 2 block strip. No reservations required / taken at them. Chez Maman can get busy - so you can out your name down for food and sip a glass of wine while looking at the view of downtown. Thank you !
transit: Getting around SF is easy with Uber, lyft or yellow cab. There also bus lines, muni lines and Caltrains stops within a couple of blocks of our home. If you rent or bring your own car - you have one designated street parking space in front of the garage door in the right hand side of the house as you are facing the front door. Thank you!

Huge, sunny living room has comfortable modern furnishings, vaulted ceilings, and a 52" flat screen TV.  Full dining room seats 10.  Queen beds in each of the two bedrooms sleep 4, plus a sleeper sofa in the living room can accommodate a 5th, if needed.  Spacious bathroom offers a double vanity (two sinks) and a glassed-in shower. The fully stocked kitchen has modern appliances and all of the amenities.  And you can access our pretty back garden via the rear staircase. Please come and enjoy! All of the flat. You'll be walking distance from the many restaurants and shops in the Fillmore District and on Sacramento Street, as well as Japantown, NOPA, and the Presidio. It's also easy to get to Union Square and all of the major tourist sights on public transit. We are well served by 4 major bus lines that run frequently.

Mason. The house is well-appointed: antique furniture, Asian carpets, paintings, and was featured on architectural tours. Point, Palace of Fine Arts, Disney Family Museum, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach. You will also be within an easy walk of the many charming shops and exciting nightlife on Chestnut and Union St.

name: Golden Gate Park Orange Studio UCSF w private entr
description: This sweet spacious kitchenless studio is ready to spoil you with high ceilings, queen bed, luxurious shower & sitting room. It has independent entrance, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster... 2 blocks to heart of Inner Sunset, 4 blks from UCSF. The Orange Suite is a convenient, kitchenless studio on the 3rd floor of my house! It offers a comfy firm queen bed, a new bathroom and fixtures, refrigerator, toaster, microwave, espresso maker, as well as the sweetest sitting area in orange you ever will see – with couch, chairs, bean bag chair and tv. I love spending time under the cozy slanted ceilings! PARKING -  Street parking in the neighborhood is usually good, there is no parking space with the unit. (Also this is good to know for most neighborhoods in San Francisco: There is a 2 hour limit weekdays from 8a-6p. Effectively what this means is you have to move your car if the tire is marked between 10am and 4pm. Overnights and weekends there is no time limit.) Washer/Dryer available
neighborhood_overview: Eclecticism with a family atmosphere made even better by the huge green space of Golden Gate Park 3 blocks over. Within the distance of a short 5 minute walk, you have a zillion restaurants, cafes and bakeries to browse at, the Botanical Garden, DeYoung Museum and the California Academy of Sciences to amuse and educate your brain, and an entire park leading down to the ocean for picnics and meandering.  The University of California, San Francisco, UCSF, California's premier teaching hospital, is a 4 block walk away.       And on top of all that, it is a 30 min MUNI ride by train down to Union Square, Embarcadero and the heart of the urban city.
transit: MUNI train line N-Judah 2 blocks away, bus lines (phone number hidden)  A combo of which will take you downtown, to the Haight, Cole Valley, the Richmond, Ocean Beach and many places in the city. Not to mention affordable Uber/Lyft etc for a more direct ride to the Castro, Mission, North Beach, Marina, etc.

name: The heart of San Francisco
description: Two large, quiet rooms in a beautiful house. The rooms share a private bathroom. The owner of the house lives in a suite upstairs. We all share the kitchen, living room, and huge deck with a view of the City. There is a small dog who will hit you up for treats and petting. PARKING From 6PM-8AM you can park right in front of the property.  There is also parking right around the corner that allows you to park for as long as you wish. Watch out for street sweeping wherever you park in SF. Views of the city and bay are just a few steps away, and it is the best view of the skyline. There is public transportation just a few blocks away. The neighborhood is full of delicious restaurants, comfy coffee shops, and interesting small businesses that overlook the city. In-bedroom TV with complimentary Netflix. Spacious living room/kitchen/dining area. Designer kitchen with refreshments and snacks provided. I've lived in SF for decades so ask me if you want insider advice on where to go and what to

The ships on the bay and the blinking lights of Oakland are part of the show. This Airbnb is just a short walk away from both the bay view and city view. After a long day out, come home to a quiet, cozy, and private apartment located in the heart of San Francisco.

name: Red Victorian - Sun Bunk in shared Friends Room
description: Comfortable and clean bunk bed in "Friends", a shared hostel-style room, located in the historic Red Victorian Hotel on Haight street. The Sun Bunk is a top bunk. The Red Victorian is an experimental community run hotel that offers unique guest experiences. While here, we invite you to attend events: lectures & talks, skill shares, music nights, art shows! *Note: This listing is for a single top bunk- you may be sharing the room w/ others.* The "Friends" Hostel Room is a shared room with four bunk beds. This listing is for the Sun Bunk, which is a top bunk. The room is located on the 2nd floor of the house, overlooking Haight Street. Lights for each bunk, power strips, and a sink are available in the room. We have abundant bathroom access- you will have access to the 5 shared bathrooms of the house (1 in the 2nd floor + a restroom and 4 on the 3rd floor).  Some fun historical facts about the Red Victorian:  - We often hold events in the bottom floor of the house that guests can attend,
neighborhood_overview: Haight-Ashbury is an incredible relic of San Francisco’s past. The neighborhood, also known as “The Haight” or “Upper Haight”, succinctly personifies the City’s history, aesthetic, and culture. It is perhaps the most colorful swath of acreage in San Francisco, and remains one of the last-standing neighborhoods to retain an eccentric personality.  The Haight rose to fame during the Counterculture Movement during the Vietnam War era; it became a regular feature in international news headlines and incited a global initiative for social change with special thanks to the 1967 Summer of Love, and a little help from Janis Joplin and the Grateful Dead.  The Haight-Ashbury neighborhood is nestled in between three parks: Golden Gate Park, the Panhandle, and Buena Vista Park, making it somewhat of an urban oasis.  Within the parks you'll find: Museums, botanical gardens, seasonal music festivals, and a tea garden.  We recommend:  - Eating at a one of the delicious restaurants or food trucks, or c
transit: How to get here from SFO airport :  > By Public Transit : Board the BART towards San Francisco. Get off at the UN Plaza stop and walk to the northwest corner of Market St. Board the 7 or 7R Bus to Haight and get off at the Clayton St Stop. Walk to 1665 Haight St. You can also take the 6 to Masonic St, and walk 3 blocks to The Red Vic.  > By Car Share Taxi : If you have a smart phone and access to the internet you can take advantage of one of the car sharing services in San Francisco. These services offer a convenient app, faster pick-ups and lower prices than taxis. You can use Lyft or Uber.  For Lyft, use the code KYLE2242 to get $10 in free rides. Lyft has multiple services and Lyft Line will be the least expensive option.  For Uber, use the code FFT3C to get $10 in free rides. Uber has multiple services and Uber Pool will be the least expensive option.  > By Taxi Service : You can call Yellow Cab for a pickup.  Valet Parking: Another option which we have heard good things about is L

Just 15 mins to downtown or SFO Keyless entry system and two locked doors plus gate for privacy and security. You’ll love the Sweet Stay! You won't find a similar accommodation in this area of SF. Lots of attention to detail in an effort to make you feel at home: coffee, tea and some welcome snacks are stocked for you, in addition to all the cooking utensils you'll need to make a meal. The apartment is on the first floor of our 2-story home which is connected to other homes on either side, so you will hear footsteps and muffled noise as you would in any downstairs unit. neighborhood_overview: Ingleside still retains old-school charm of San Francisco. This is a quiet, residential working-class neighborhood where some residents have lived here 30 years. Walk 3 blocks to Ocean Avenue and you'll find Whole Foods, yoga studios, cafes and authentic asian restaurants.  There's a skate park and Balboa Park a short walk away. This is a safe neighborhood, our daughter walked to school and we all walk at night.
transit: The apartment is located on the South East side of San Francisco, in the Ingleside district. We are right off the 280 freeway and about 15 minutes from SFO international airport. Both BART and MUNI is accessible within 2-4 blocks of our location. It's just a 15 minute BART ride to the heart of downtown (cable car turnaround, shopping)  and 10 minutes to the hip Mission district.  BART: Balboa Park BART station. ((7 min walk)) MUNI:  43 bus: Geneva & Howth stop (5 min walk) K railway line, Ocean Ave & Lee stop (7 min walk) 29 bus: Plymouth & Grafton stop ((7 min walk) Parking: Saturday and Sunday you can park anywhere, unrestricted. Residential permits are required parking longer than 2 hours M-F 10am-6pm in our neighborhood. There are a couple blocks of non-permitted parking 1-2 blocks from our house.  Uber/Lyfft: Widely used in SF and very reliable. Download the app to your phone and pre-pay for rides in private cars. Prices vary depending on user demand.

name: Family-friendly house in San Francisco hills
description: Comfortable retreat with 3 bedrooms, 2.5 baths near Mt. Davidson. Gorgeous views and quiet neighborhood. Office space off master bedroom. Close to parks and just minutes from the action of other neighborhoods. Parking is easy to find on our street. Toys, scooters available for kids from 2 up. Guests have access to our full home. Washing machine and dryer, as well. Guests can email, text, call us as needed. Happy to provide recommendations or to just let you enjoy your stay in quiet. Mt. Davidson is the tallest point in SF and the views are magical. Our home is in this quiet neighborhood full of standalone homes and just steps from the beautiful trail to the top. You'll be enveloped in lush green and only reminded you are in the city with peekaboo views of the Golden Gate through the breaks in the trees. Take a beverage and a snack to enjoy happy hour golden light at the peak just 20 minutes by foot through the trails. We are visited multiple times a day by many hummingbirds, which is i
neighborhood_overview: Mt. Davidson is the tallest point in SF and the views are magical. Our home is in this quiet neighborhood full of standalone homes and just steps from the beautiful trail to the top. You'll be enveloped in lush green and only reminded you are in the city with peekaboo views of the Golden Gate through the breaks in the trees. Take a beverage and a snack to enjoy happy hour golden light at the peak just 20 minutes by foot through the trails. We are visited multiple times a day by many hummingbirds, which is it's own little bit of magic.
transit: You can rely on bus routes to the Muni or Bart if you like. But I would recommend having a car if you want to be most mobile. Uber, Lyft are always an option!

name: Alice & Michael's Airbnb 1-Bedroom Suite
description: Our newly remodeled airbnb suite is the perfect getaway for sight seers and business travelers.  Close to MUNI, Golden Gate Park, local shops and restaurants, and blocks away from the Pacific Ocean, consider this your quiet San Francisco home away from home.  With a separate entrance, accessible laundry facilities, guest wifi, mini-fridge, microwave, luxurious leather couch and flat screen TV with local channels, our 1-bedroom clean & comfortable airbnb suite is ready for your arrival. Very clean in a quiet neighborhood. Private 1-bedroom suite with private bathroom, guest wifi, TV with local channels, washer and dryer, backyard.  Guests will receive a key code for the front gate upon arrival. Hosts live upstairs and are available whenever guests need assistance.  We are happy to help with anything you need. Situated between Lawton and Kirkham Avenues in the Outer Sunset, our neighborhood is a clean, quiet street with a large Catholic church anchoring our block and plenty of street par
neighborhood_overview: Situated between Lawton and Kirkham Avenues in the Outer Sunset, our neighborhood is a clean, quiet street with a large Catholic church anchoring our block and plenty of street parking near our house.
transit: N Judah, N Express (rush hour only) and bus 29 are 1.5 blocks away, connecting guests to BART and the rest of San Francisco.

name: Sunny Room with Private Deck and Yard
description: Private room with queen size bed, large closet and sole access to a large deck and backyard.  You'll share the kitchen and bathroom in a 3-bedroom house. Access to washer and dryer in garage, and parking on the street. Close to public transit (1 block to the Muni station), and plenty of street parking.  Designated parking spot available for extra fee. Beautiful bedroom with access to sunny deck.  You will share the house with a dancer couple that is very passionate about the arts. Access to full kitchen and bathroom. Coffee available in mornings :) I live in the home and will be happy to help with any of your travel needs. The Bayview is a vibrant neighborhood close to public transit. It is one of the more sunny parts of San Francisco. Great brewery in neighborhood! 1 block to the 3rd Street and Shafter Ave MUNI Station.  Lyft or Uber works especially well in the city and can be an economical alternative to transit. There is a Ford electric bike docking post just a block away.  Excelle

transit: 1 block to the 3rd Street and Shafter Ave MUNI Station.  Lyft or Uber works especially well in the city and can be an economical alternative to transit. There is a Ford electric bike docking post just a block away.  Excellent for setting out in the city!

name: Sweeping Views and Dolores Park Pad
description: This CENTRALLY LOCATED SAN FRANCISCO RETREAT AWAITS YOU! Enjoy a Private bedroom and en-suite bath as your launching pad to the City's hottest neighborhoods- Mission/Valencia- Noe Valley/24th St. & The Castro: just a short walk from your door.  This location also offers close MUNI connections and easy Parking.  When you arrive "home", relax with panaramic views of San Francisco, the Bay, Oakland, East Bay Hills and beyond.  Dolores Park, the Bay Area's "favorite destination", is steps away. My flat is on Liberty Hill, overlooking the mission and has the best micro-climate in San Francisco. With skylights and floor to ceiling windows in the living area, the space is flooded with light by day, and has expansive views of twinkling city lights by night. The private bedroom has a Queen size bed with a luxurious pillow top mattress and new linens, and the en-suite bath is stocked with toiletries you may need during your visit. There is plenty of closet and drawer space in case you want to un
neighborhood_overview: It is absolutely true that if it is nice in San Francisco, it is beautiful in my back yard. I enjoy a walk to Mission Dolores Park every day. There are three distinct neighborhoods within a few blocks, for you to explore boutique shopping and many of the city's finest restaurants.
transit: You are less than 20 minutes from any downtown destination on the streetcar which stops just around the corner, less than 1 block away. BART is another option, only 12 minutes walking to the 24th Street Station, whisking you away to the East Bay or San Francisco International Airport in a flash. Don't tell anyone, but parking is always available on Hill Street.

name: Newly Renovated Spacious Studio
description: This spacious and newly renovated studio features spacious living area which opens directly onto a private deeded deck. Chef kitchen with electric range, custom cabinetry, breakfast bar, and CeasarStone countertops and common laundry in the building. Easy parking on the street. The Studio has a private deck for customers for relaxation and a private library full of French books to explore(educational, culture, politic, etc). I am a French teacher in San Francisco. When you get to 930 Elizabeth, you will see a lockbox with a pink tag on it hanging on the gate with a shiny pink tag on it with number 2.  Its access code is (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) There are 3 keys inside, the blue key opens the gate, the black and red keys open the studio(Apt2).  Also, there  are free parkings on Elizabeth Street where the studio is located and on the cross street Hoffman, except on Wednesdays from 12-2pm because of the street cleaning. Once you get inside of the studio, you will see little notes o
neighborhood_overview: The 24th street is half a block away and has tone of shops, shops and couple of bars included sport bars. There is a Walgreen store on 24th and Castro, four blocs down. Bank of America and WellsFargo are located on 24th street, between Castro and Noe. There is a WholeFood store between Noe and Sanchez.
transit: The 48, 35,  24 bus lines are all a few blocs down 24th street.  The J Church metro to downtown San Francisco stop is located on Church and 24th. Uber and Lyft are other convenient alternative ways of getting around.

name: Urban Chic in Lower Pacific Heights
description: Ideally located in Lower Pacific Heights just 2 blocks from vibrant Fillmore Street’s world class restaurants & boutiques. 2 bedroom 1 bath lower unit with large living area and kitchenette in an historic Victorian home built in 1879. Walk to Lafayette & Alta Plaza parks. Close to bus lines. Easy access to Union Square, financial district, SOMA, Golden Gate Park & Sacramento St. corridor The apartment is accessed with a keyless pad through our garage and down an exterior garden stairway. The unit itself is accessed by a private entrance, but we do park in the garage so you will need to come and go through this common space. The apartment can accommodate up to four people comfortably. Living-room is spacious, with a luscious carpet and a cool-chic feel, big screen TV and huge built-in sofa that's great for lounging and getting comfortable after a long day of site seeing or work.  For guest comfort,  apartment has a kitchenette with a coffee maker and a mini-fridge.  For business travele
neighborhood_overview: Being located in Lower Pacific Heights just two blocks from Fillmore Street makes this an A+ location for any and all who want an urban experience in the center of San Francisco.  If you prefer to start your day at a cafe, The Fillmore Bake Shop is two blocks away. Their pastries are sublime. If you want a bigger breakfast, walk up the street to The Grove where their morning egg dishes are the rave of the city. Head out to see the rest of the city and then dine on the Fillmore at night. Lots of good shopping. Close to all things you'd want to see in San Francisco.
transit: 1 block (on Sutter) bus lines  Incredible walking location. The nearest Bart station is Civic Center. Perhaps not walkable. There is a 10-13 mins drive to our apartment. Super easy Uber & Lyft pick-up area.

name: Beautiful traditional house in Ashbury Heights
description: [30-day minimum] Beautiful historic house in centrally located Ashbury Heights neighborhood. High up in Ashbury Heights with sweeping views of pacific ocean and golden gate bridge from top floor patio. This is a large 4-level single family house with four bedrooms (plus a study) and 3.5 baths in total. The house is my primary residence and I live in the master suite when I'm not hosting guests.  I try to accommodate guest booking requests by scheduling my business travel around them. The house has all new high end furniture and Thermador appliances.  Master suite has a queen sized bed, two closets and an ensuite bathroom. Guest room #1 has a Queen bed, ensuite bath and walk in closet.  Guest room #2 has two Twin XL beds and two walk-in closets, and shares bathroom with either Guest room #1 or #3 upstairs in the penthouse.  Guest room #3 (the penthouse) is on the top floor with its own dedicated bathroom and a study next to it.  Study has a folding bed that sleeps one.  Laundry room in
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located, high up on hill, surrounded by parks and beautiful lush greenery, with easy access to commercial streets nearby and downtown San Francisco.
transit: Walking distance to golden gate park and N Judah train station (5 stops, 15 minutes to Union Square), #6 and #33 buses.  Cole Valley and Haight Ashbury shops and restaurants, Buena Vista Park all short walk away.

name: The Real San Francisco
description: Minutes to GG Bridge, GG Park, Museums, The Presidio, S.F. Zoo, Lands End Trails, Lincoln Park golf course and three beaches.  Easiest street parking in the city and buses to all major destinations in under 45 minutes.  A market and 6 restaurants around the corner. This is a large 700 sqft studio apartment with 3 Queen beds: 2 freestanding queen-size beds and 1 queen-size pullout sofa, comfortably sleeping 6 adults in a single large room.  There is no kitchen in this studio, but there is a microwave and guests have access to a gas bbq grill in the private yard.  There is a mini-fridge, an electric tea kettle for boiling, coffee maker, toaster, and disposable plates and utensils.  The CVS across the street sells basic foods, and there are several grocery stores nearby. Traveling with kids but don't want to lug out all the equipment?  Pack & Plays, highchairs, strollers, toys; you name it, we have it or can get it.  Give yourself a break. There is an excellent playground across the stree
neighborhood_overview: For those who love the outdoors and good food, this is one of the best neighborhoods in the city. We're situated across from the Lincoln Park Golf Course and Playground and minutes from the Lands End hiking trails.  We're the closest neighborhood to the Golden Gate Bridge.  We're a 10 minute walk to Golden Gate Park and music festival venues.  Ocean Beach, China Beach, and Baker Beach are all nearby, as is The Presidio. Love food?  This neighborhood has some of the most diverse and reasonably priced cuisine in the entire city.  One of SF's best Burmese Restaurants is next door, and award winning dim sum is blocks away.  Thai, Chinese, Moroccan, Sushi and an American bar and grill are all around the corner.   The Legion of Honor is up the street and the Academy of Sciences and DeYoung museums are a short drive away.  The Discovery museum across the Golden Gate Bridge is perfect for kids of all ages and is just a 15 minute drive.   You can be on the Golden Gate Bridge within 5 minutes an
transit: STREET PARKING Street parking in our neighborhood is free and relatively easy by San Francisco standards.  You can usually find a space in front of our home.  At worst, you'll park a few blocks away.  See drive times to popular destinations below. BUSES We're located on the California 1, Geary 38 and 18 (SF Zoo) bus lines, which can connect you to all major destinations in under 45 minutes. TRAVEL TIMES TO POPULAR DESTINATIONS BY BUS/CAR Golden Gate Bridge:  18/10 minutes The Presidio:  18/10 minutes De Young Museum: 25/10 minutes Haight-Ashbury:  30/14 minutes SF Zoo:  30/12 minutes Alcatraz Ferry:  40/25 minutes Union Square:  40/20 minutes Fisherman's Wharf:  45/20 minutes Ferry Building:  45/30 minutes BIKES For guest use we have two adult bikes.  We also have kids bicycles, and some scooters for your little ones to use around the neighborhood.

Kitchen - all appliances brand-new.  4 bedrooms (3 Queen size beds, 1 twin bed).Bay Windows.  Two full bathrooms, one claw foot bathtub, one shower. Solid hardwood floors, original (now decorative) fireplace.  High ceilings in all rooms. Freshly painted. Black out shades. Comfortable. Generous closet space. Large inviting kitchen. name: Killer Views of San Francisco in a Private Apartment
description: Lounge on the outdoor furniture on the deck under the heat lamp and watch the lights of San Francisco come to life at night. This room has a sleek design with vintage accents plus all the modern comforts. This apartment features a private deck with killer views of San Francisco, a quiet bedroom with a queen bed, a living room with 42” television, Apple TV, and Wii. The unit is two blocks from the BART train that gets you to downtown San Francisco in about 10 minutes and the Mission in 3, and it's close to the highway which gets you in an Uber cheaply and quickly. Our rental unit is perfect for couples, singles, and traveling professionals. The apartment is a private in-law unit with its own entrance. We are usually available by text to help with your visit. The apartment is in the adorable Glen Park area, two blocks from the local village with great boutiques, coffee shops and restaurants. The BART train is a 5 minute walk - with trains that take 10 minutes to downtown San Francisco. *

name: Garden 2BR Condo/Great Location/Lower Pac Heights
description: This 2BR condo is the lower unit of a two-family Victorian house, and is comfortable, modern and in an unbeatable location, blocks away from a large selection of restaurants, bars and shops. It is close to Sundance Kabuki Cinemas, The Fillmore, Sweet Maple, and Japantown. It has private access to a backyard and garden with fire pit and heater. The place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). Unbeatable location, unless you want to factor in the space, the garden, and the amenities, too! This place is an amazing launch pad for anyone who wants to explore San Francisco from one of the city's most happening neighborhoods. One queen real bed, one queen sofa bed, plus one full sofa bed. Full access to the home, including backyard/garden. Minimal interaction with the hosts; home owner will most likely out of town, and his friend will live nearby and can help in emergencies. You're on your own otherwise! Pacific heights is known for high-end shopp
neighborhood_overview: Pacific heights is known for high-end shopping and dining, and is only a 10 min walk away. If you're visiting with your family, nearby laurel heights has lots of children's stores and fun parks and playgrounds. Finally, if you're younger and looking to head out for some shows and grab drinks, NOPA is only a 10 min walk.
transit: UBER is the best way to get around - it's a short and cheap ride ($10) to get to downtown. The #2 bus stops directly out front, and comes frequently. It goes directly downtown along Sutter Street, all the way to Union Square.

The People The Startup House community attracts many talented individuals from around the world. From Stanford students, to developers and entrepreneurs, we provide each with a unique opportunity to network, connect with likeminded people or just make interesting new friends. Share experiences and engaging conversations with our guests, while learning and achieving your goals. The House Each house is conveniently furnished to guarantee you a comfortable stay. Through our 5 locations, everything is done so that you can work, relax, and study.  The San Francisco Downtown S

name: 'Painted Lady' Victorian Bedroom
description: Welcome to my house in Beautiful Bayview! I am about 15 minutes from the airport and  Downtown San Francisco.  I’m 2.6 miles from the Chase Center, 3.4 miles from Oracle Park and 3.6 miles from Moscone Center. This room is meant to transport you to a time that no longer exists.   You will have a lot of room to breath, relax and get a great night's sleep.   The adjacent room may also be occupied by a guest so please be courteous by keeping the noise down. I  welcome people from all countries, backgrounds, and cultures. I am listing my beautiful room on Airbnb.  In this city, the rooms are tiny and my house has a lot of space and you can actually breath in this room.  You have a lock on the main door, so this is a private space for you.  I have hardwood floors throughout my place, so great for those with allergies.  I have 1.5 bathrooms that are shared.  There is one full bathroom with a shower  on the same level as the bedrooms and a small half-bath just past the kitchen.  You have acce
neighborhood_overview: This is Bayview, San Francisco.  It is not the posh SF neighborhood that you see in movies.   This is a diverse neighborhood with people of all races and socio-economic backgrounds.  There are homeless people on the streets.  Take reasonable precautions to keep yourself safe such as not walking alone at night, using ATMs during the day etc.  I would say that holds true for most of the city.
transit: My place is one block from Muni Metro rail as well as 2 bus stops.  The Muni will get you straight to downtown.  LYFT and UBER are easy and relatively cheap options too, especially to access the airport.

This sunny and mainly flat neighborhood is full of character that is emblematic of the Mission!  Close to restaurants and all the corner stores.  Great Mexican restaurant right across the street.  A great spot to experience a piece of SF in the Mission!  We look forward to hosting your stay in SF! A great location in the colorful and hip Mission District! - Hardwood floors - Gas stove - Wifi - Private entrance - Fully-equipped kitchen - Smart TV - Great restaurants close by - Sunny and warm(er) neighborhood You have your own private entrance and private apartment. You will see bright murals as you peruse the neighborhood and have a collection of restaurants to c

name: Bright Top Floor Studio by Union Square!
description: Our remodeled building is located in downtown San Francisco, within walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Theater District. This is a convenient location close to downtown.  Whether you are coming to SF for business or pleasure on an extended stay; this is a great option! - Fully equipped kitchen - Wifi  - Smart Tv - On-site laundry - Extra linens, blankets, and towels This furnished studio has been recently remodeled yet still retains historic SF features.. The apartment has hardwood floors and a private kitchen & bathroom. The studio comes completely furnished with sheets & towels, pots & pans and wireless internet. There is a Smart Tv for streaming. As our guest, you will have full access to your apartment, plus a shared laundry room and a mailbox you can use during your stay. This building is close to the Tenderloin neighborhood which is a nitty - gritty part of town. There are a lot of people living on the streets who beg off the tourists in Union Square. That being
neighborhood_overview: This building is close to the Tenderloin neighborhood which is a nitty - gritty part of town. There are a lot of people living on the streets who beg off the tourists in Union Square. That being said, there are also many famous tourist attractions close by such as the cable cars and Ferry Building. There is a great mall nearby called the West Field Shopping Center. Some of our favorite restaurants and bars within walking distance include Brenda's French Soul Food, Borobudur (Indonesian) and Bourbon and Branch (an original speakeasy).
transit: The space is walking distance to Union Square and downtown San Francisco as well to the Civic Center BART Station.

name: Dorm Beds @ Social SF Hostel #8
description: Our social and vibrant hostel in downtown SF is the place to stay! We invite travelers and adventurers of all ages, from all corners of the globe, to rest their heads at this historic hostel in the heart of San Francisco. We pride ourselves on creating a community vibe and a space that encourages guests to gather together, exchange travel stories, and get to know one another. Each room has 4-8 single beds, bunk bed style. There are five single occupancy bathrooms on each floor, each with complimentary essential oil organic lavender shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel. We also have a free sauna on the top floor and massage chairs in the lobby for your every relaxation need. Our Grand Ballroom is the heart of the hostel where people play music, make friends and unforgettable memories, fall in love with the city and each other, and raise glasses in celebration. The ballroom, where musicians are always invited to play, has a pool table, ping pong table, books, games, and complimentary cof
neighborhood_overview: Our hostel is located in the culturally rich neighborhood of North Beach (SF’s Little Italy) and borders America’s largest Chinatown. We have great food and great fun on all sides! The rhythm of the Beat poets flow in the streets outside their regular hangouts, like Vesuvio, and City Lights Bookstore, just a couple of blocks away. And we are only a 20 minute walk from the famous Fisherman’s Wharf.
transit: We are surrounded by numerous MUNI bus and train lines making it easy to get around the city if you're without a car. We're a 15 minute walk away of the Montgomery BART station - a good place to get off if you're taking the BART train to us from the airport.  If you are driving, a discount parking coupon is available at check-in for a nearby parking garage for $20 for a standard vehicle. Please use our loading zone in front of the hostel to unload your luggage and collect the parking coupon.

name: Work/Leisure 10 min walk from BART in Glen Park
description: Enjoy this lovely, light-filled home in a safe residential neighborhood. Licensed. Comfortable space, few blocks from all the amenities of Glen Park Village and BART, which gets you to downtown San Francisco in 10 minutes or to the airport in 15 minutes.  A perfect starting point for exploring SF or for business trips. The house is very suitable for singles, couples or families with one or two kids as it has a very comfy bed in one of the bedrooms and a sofa bed in the other. Our home offers ideal space for the business traveler, the sight-seer and it is family-friendly as well. Head up the stairs and you'll emerge to a well equipped kitchen, the living and dining area. One bedroom has a double bed with tempurpedic mattress, drawers and closet space. The other room has a large working desk with a sofa-bed that can be used as bedroom too. It also has some space for your personal things in a closet. Nice  views from kitchen, dining area and deck. Whole first floor of the house with the d
neighborhood_overview: Picturesque Glen Park Village is a few blocks away, so you'll be a short walk from three coffee shops, a gourmet grocery store, outstanding food options (Thai, French, Chinese, Italian, fancy pizza, bakery, breakfast diner), a charming bookstore, library, ATMs, and other conveniences. Within walking distance you can get to Glen Canyon Park, a city oasis with 70 acres of hiking paths, as well as a playground and tennis courts or to Walter-Haas Playground with stunning SF skyline views.
transit: We are nearby from several major bus lines, the 52 and the J Church muni line, and -- best of all -- BART, which zips you to the Mission, downtown, East Bay, or SFO. If you're driving, feel free to park in the street.

description: Turn on the record player and tune in to some classic vinyl before dropping in on the sectional sofa with a volume from the well-stocked shelves. Bold original canvases line the walls, while a 65" 4K OLED TV offers Disney+, Netflix, HBO GO, and Amazon Prime. We love traveling, reading and the arts. You'll see this reflected throughout our house. Private use of living room, kitchen, dining room, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Access to downstairs washer/dryer in the garage. Private (unoccupied) top floor area is closed off. Please do not access. High speed wireless internet, 65 inch 4K OLED Television with Apple TV. Netflix, HBO GO, and Amazon Prime Video available. We've been living in San Francisco for a long time and love to go out to restaurants, bars and museums. Let us know if you want any recommendations! The location is a single block from the historic Haight-Ashbury intersection and a few blocks from Cole Valley. Stroll half a mile to reach Golden Gate Park Steps, while Haight Str

name: Burgundy Room: OceanView+Breakfast+Parking+3 baths
description: This bedroom is next to my bedroom so it is imperative to talk very softly at all times. Free parking at the door  6 blocks away from subway All illegal stuff free home NO: shoes, the plastic bags provided  to cover your shoes in case of rain are next to racks and it is your responsibility to protect them against the rain. No lock home, no cooking, no parties, no pets and no young children.  Even though we have more than 5 listings we ONLY use 5 listings maximum at ANY given time!!! We live in the safest neighborhood in town. We are 700 meters away from our main subway station and a few blocks away from several bus stops that can take you anywhere in town. We are a 15 minutes' drive from the airport, and it takes about 20 minutes to get downtown. The house is on a slight hill, so please be mindful of your physical health before considering us. Our kitchen is not an amenity, but we are glad to offer daily breakfast which is very simple - toast, jam, butter, great coffee and tea. Whateve
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is safe, beautiful and greatly located in the city San Francisco. We face the Pacific ocean in a very low key and private neighborhood. People can walk in our streets at any time, day or night without any problems This is a family home and we live here, we try with all our hearts to do our best. We have lots of guests here and thus we are not responsible for any issues you might encounter due to another guest's doing. We are a no lock home so you need to bring your own lock for your suitcase. We have never lost anything or had a problem but we reserve the right to put in writing that we are NOT liable for other's mistakes in any shape or form.
transit: We are six blocks away from our subway and few blocks away from several bus stops. It will take you a half an hour to get pretty much anywhere from our home, including to and from the airport!  You have 100% all time FREE parking at our door. Our street is completely quiet and secure! Our home is next to a beautiful park that has a water fountain...well, what can i say? God blessed me with my three kids and a kingdom of a home in San Francisco!

name: Best Views in all of San Francisco
description: The perfect place to enjoy the views, views, views from the top of Noe Valley, the most central location within San Francisco. Enjoy the hardwood floors, recessed lights with dimmers, large empty closet for all your belongings, luxury bathroom. Free HD Cable with DVR and HBO. Free high speed wifi and local phone calls provided. Huge sunny patio with hammock, sun lounger and zen rock garden. **THANK YOU AIRBNB FOR RANKING US THE #1 LISTING FOR OUR NEIGHBORHOOD IN ALL OF SAN FRANCISCO** Make this modern view 2 bedroom 1.5 bath apartment your private sanctuary during your trip to San Francisco. Located just across the street from City View Place, a well known Vista Point at the top of Noe Valley, it's a safe, modern and serene, (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) square-foot  apartment equipped with top-notch amenities throughout. For larger groups, there is an additional ground floor in-law studio unit that can be booked separately or in conjunction with this two bedroom unit. The ground flo
neighborhood_overview: If you are interested in exploring the neighborhood around the Vista Point, it's a short 10 minute walk down the hill to the many shops and restaurants located along 24th Street in the heart of Noe Valley all the way to the hip and trendy Mission district. Just up the hill, Twin Peaks is a breath-taking neighborhood that rises above the rest (literally!). Occupying two of San Francisco’s highest summits, Twin Peaks offers quiet seclusion from the city below. The neighborhood’s high altitude location may remove it from hurried urban activity, but the steep descent from its hilltops is made worth it by Twin Peaks’ sweeping San Francisco vistas.
transit: If you would prefer to rent a car, there is plenty of free street parking just across the street at the Vista Point, very safe and convenient with no maximum time limit. Regarding public transportation, there are 3 buses that stop directly across the street, each of which can take you in 5 minutes to the nearest BART subway or MUNI streetcar station. From there it's easy to get to downtown Union Square or anywhere else you want to go in 15 minutes. Golden Gate Park is also easily reached via public transportation. I leave detailed transit maps in the condo for all my guests. Rideshare Another fine San Francisco innovation: private cars at your service, no cash required. Download the rideshare app of your choice (see below) and request a car when you need a pickup anywhere in San Francisco.  Lyft. For Lyft you can use the following code: MARK1121 to get a free ride up to $10.   Uber is another app you can download and use the code: 3mnld to get a free ride up to $20. Taxi  SF taxis can
