name: Potrero Hill Mid-Century Modern, 1 BR with Views.
description: IMPORTANT: Dear potential guest(s), if you are not eligible to Book Instantly, please DO NOT send a booking Request, but rather send an Inquiry. Thank you for your consideration. Newly remodeled one bedroom split level space on the North slope of sunny Potrero Hill. With spectacular views that include downtown San Francisco, the Bay Bridge, the Bay, as well as Oakland and Berkeley. We provide ample supplies to get you through the first few days of breakfasts, as well as some snacks and wine. One bedroom newly remodeled living space in a unique Eichler style "mid-century modern" building. One of our friends calls our house "The James Bond House" (the Sean Connery years) The area has a private deck with views of downtown San Francisco, the Bay, the Bay Bridge as well as Oakland and Berkeley. You will be able to use the washer and dryer in our laundry room.  If you drive an EV, you will be able to use our Level 2 charging station if you are in a pinch. Fast charging stations are available
neighborhood_overview: Potrero Hill is the sunniest and warmest neighborhood in San Francisco. We rarely get the famous San Francisco fog, even on days when we can see the fog roll in over downtown from our living room. We have many popular restaurants on 18th Street within walking distance from our home. Chez Maman (French), Mochica (Peruvian), Umi (Japanese), and others. As well as Farley's for your morning coffee, or Blooms for your evening martini and a game of pool. The Anchor Brewing Company, the "birthplace of craft beer" is a block from our house. If you are a beer lover a tour of the brewery followed by a beer tasting is highly recommended. They recently opened a tap room where many of their experimental beer can be tasted. The bus to get downtown stops across the street. Very close to the US 101 and 280 freeways to drive South. Easy street parking.
transit: The MUNI bus 19 which will take you downtown stops across the street. Freeway access to US 101 and 280 for driving South, and access to I 80 East for the East Bay are very close.

This is a functioning hotel, guests can access all common areas including the lobby and fitness center. Guests will have a private hotel room with bathroom and mini-fridge. Available via phone/text/email at all times. Guests have 24 hour a day access to the front desk staff who can deal with any issues on site. name: 2965 - Luxury 3BD Home near HW 1, Golf, Beach, Zoo
description: This luxurious and newly furnished 3-bedroom 2-bath house is in a very desirable area of San Francisco near Stonestown Galleria Mall, SF State University, Stern Grove Park (Stern Grove Festival), Lake Merced (hiking, biking, water sports, golf), Ocean Beach, SF Zoo, and Highway 1. Super easy access to bus and light rail to Downtown SF, BART and Silicon Valley. Short walk to hi-tech company shuttle bus stop. Plenty free street parking around the block. 20 mins to SFO airport by BART or car. This beautiful home features a large living room, formal dining room, fully-stocked chef's kitchen, 3 spacious bedrooms and 2 full baths, and free laundry. Two of the bedrooms are very spacious with King beds. It is close to the border of San Francisco and Daly City, and it's very easy taking public transit across the city, as well as in and out of the city and the Peninsula (and SFO airport ) either by BART or car. Guests have full access to the top floor of the home. I live downstairs so I'm availa
neighborhood_overview: Lakeshore is a very unique neighborhood which encompasses the north side of Lake Merced. Harding Park Golf Course, SF Zoo, Stern Grove Concert Meadow (Music Festival runs every Sunday afternoon from 1 pm - 4 pm from June through late August), Ocean Beach, Stonestown Galleria and SF State U are all in a walking distance. Nearby movie theaters include Stonestown United Artist and Daly City Century.
transit: Off street parking is fairly easy to find off Sloat Blvd. MUNI bus 23 is right by the house, transfer through West Portal light rail station which is less than 10 minutes away. MUNI bus 29 and 18 are also just a block away. MUNI bus 28 is 5 blocks away on 19th Ave (HW 1) that runs between Daly City BART Station and Golden Gate Bridge.

description: Happy New Year! Come make memories in SF in 2018. The space is a cozy modern remodeled 2 bed/1 bath private  unit with its own private entrance in a quiet neighborhood. It is perfect for families, adventurers, & business travelers. The house is close to Bernal Heights and Mission neighborhoods. We are centrally located - 15 mins drive from SFO, Union Square with easy access to US-101/280. We live right upstairs in a separate unit and would love to meet you. Our house is a two floor unit and your unit will be on the ground floor with private access through the garage. We use the garage for parking our car but you should be able to find parking on the street right in front. It's a cozy, clean and comfortable space for 4 adults. The lower unit is a private area with a living space, 2 bedrooms and a bathroom. You will have access to the unit through the garage. There is a backyard attached to the lower unit. You can access the backyard as long as you are super quiet and respectful of the n
neighborhood_overview: Near John McLaren park that is serene and provides for great morning walks and beautiful views of the city. It's a very quiet street and broad street. If you want to do groceries check-out Grocery Outlet store which is not too far but can be a hike if you don't have a car since its a hill.  Also San Bruno avenue is pretty close where you can find small shops for quick shopping.
transit: To get to downtown if you don't have a car we recommend using Uber/Lyft. Uber/Lyft to union square should cost 15$.  Union Square is about 5 miles from here. To use public transportation to downtown you walk 0.3 mi to Cambridge & Silver and catch bus SFMTA 44 to Bosworth/Diamond St where you can catch the BART to get to anywhere in downtown. Using this approach you can reach downtown in 35 min.

name: High-Rise Shared Apt at the Heart of San Francisco
description: New, high-rise apartment (low floor) located right on the intersection of Market St & 9th St at the center of San Francisco. Right by public transit, across from HQ of Uber, Square etc. Minutes walk to the chic and vibrant Hayes Valley with a plethora of restaurant and coffee shop options. The location is unbeatable. All major amenities are included as part of the unit (see pics). Laundry and detergent also included. The apartment unit is a brand-new, furnished 2BR/2Bath. I’ll be living in one of the 1BR/1Bath and this listing is for the living room area which has been carved out and converted into a bedroom separated from the kitchen area with sliding curtains. PLEASE NOTE this is a CONVERTED room so while it has a full curtain separating from the common kitchen for complete privacy, it does not have a locked door. You will be the only person using the converted room/space (NOT shared with others) so it is considered a PRIVATE ROOM by Airbnb, but it does not come with a locked door.
neighborhood_overview: Literally everything.
transit: The neighborhood is near prime business district so parking options are expensive and limited. The location is very convenient and central (located right on Market St, the backbone of San Francisco city) and has many public transportation options. The apartment has direct subway train (called “Bart”) access from both the SFO international airport and Oakland airport, making it the ideal overnight stay for people visiting from out of town. The most comfortable transportation option from SFO airport would obviously be Uber/Lyft. Alternatively if you are very budgeted, check out Samtrans bus 292. If you stay, you can contact me in advance for car rental. I have a car parked a few blocks away that can be rented for $9/hour or negotiable discounted daily rate, which can get you around to anywhere in the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Sophisticated Studio-Amazing Christmas Ship Views!
description: This thoughtfully equipped suite offers stunning views of Seattle from the north shore of Lake Union. Experience city living at its best in this sophisticated, cozy space that strikes the perfect balance between minimalism and modern comfort. With convenient access to downtown Seattle, outdoor sports, the Stoneway culinary corridor, tech headquarters, and the Burke-Gilman Trail, this studio offers all that you need to enjoy your stay in Seattle. You’ll find the space to be cozy, well-appointed, and perfectly located for exploring all Seattle has to offer. Though we’ve kept it simple, the suite is carefully stocked to meet the needs of busy travelers and explorers, those seeking a beautiful home base for local business and adventure, or even a vacationer looking for a serene retreat. All furnishings have been conscientiously hand-selected for comfort and practicality. The work area is spacious and functional, all while offering a beautiful view of your scenic surroundings. The private,
neighborhood_overview: Stroll to local landmark Ivar's Salmon House, or sample the flavors of well-known favorites Pablo y Pablo, The Whale Wins, Joule, Manolin, or Super Bueno - all located within close proximity. The culinary delights of many Seattle favorites are a stone's throw away - and Stone Way's new restaurant corridor adds even more to the mix!
transit: We're conveniently located for exploration - with easy access to transit and bus lines, bike trails, and walking paths to most local areas of interest.

name: Artists' off-Greenwood 2-bedroom family apartment
description: Cozy, updated apt one block off Greenwood Ave. Two bedrooms. One queen bed, two kids' bunk beds (4 total kid's beds; accommodates adults on bottom bunks only), plus a couch that folds down in livingroom. Full kitchen, dishwasher, washer and drier. Carport. One block walk to: restaurants, sports bars, cafe, grocery store, pharmacy, and a bus stop taking you directly downtown. Walking distance to two parks, two bike shops, a comic book shop, a toy store, more cafes, and Hwy 99. Pet-friendly. Our home is kid friendly, art friendly, queer friendly. We clean well before guests but let's face it-- we live here most of the time! The laughter rests in the space,  easily welcoming guests to rest and laugh and play while here. Guests will be free to come and go as they choose. We will be available by cell or email to help with any problems. Greenwood features many well loved bars, pubs and restaurants, as well as cute, independent shops-- Vintage, books, home, toy, the works! Art studios and bre
neighborhood_overview: Greenwood features many well loved bars, pubs and restaurants, as well as cute, independent shops-- Vintage, books, home, toy, the works! Art studios and breweries, and plenty of coffee!
transit: Bus 5 stops within a block of the Apt and is a straight shot to downtown. Easy access from the D Line as well, just 5 blocks away on HWY 99. Zipcar parking visible from our building.

name: Private Artists' Oasis in Heart of City
description: You climb up private stairs and enter an open loft-style apartment. Once inside, you are bathed in light - skylights and windows offer exposure from all sides.  The decor is chic-European. The kitchen's luxurious: a gas stove and plenty of space to work in. A balcony gets daily visits at the hummingbird feeder. If you like baths, relax in the claw foot tub and gaze out the skylight or listen to the pitter-patter of the rain overhead. An oasis, nestled in the heart of the city! The rental is top floor of house with private entrance. The landlord lives downstairs. She’s a musician and you can hear her practice piano. This adds to the artsy feel of the space. On street unlimited parking is available. There is access to a washer and dryer, but you must go outside and through the garage. You are two blocks away from the I-90 freeway which gets you to the East side. There is ample public transit options: buses and light rail. The landlord (a Seattle native!) and her partner are both artists
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is mostly houses, so there's not much in terms of coffee shops or cafes. If you walk about 10 min you can get to grocery stores, etc.
transit: There are ample public transit options: bus, light Two blocks away you can catch a bus that gets you downtown in 17 min. If you walk about 5 blocks instead, you can get downtown in about 7 min. Light rail is a 3 minute drive away.

name: Alki Rooftop Retreat
description: 3 Bedroom, 2 ½ bath townhouse that sleeps 6 with rooftop deck.  Garage with guaranteed private parking.  1 block from Alki Beach and steps from restaurants, nightlife and shopping.  We have a washer/dryer, fully stocked kitchen, and bbq available on rooftop deck.  We are ½ block from a playground and 5 miles from downtown. All of our bedrooms feature a premium memory foam mattress with down-filled topper, and two pillows per guest.  Next to the beds you will find a nightstand complete with a reading light, phone charging station, and books. Bedroom 1: King sized bed with huge walk-in closet and en-suite bathroom.  Plenty of space to relax and reading nook in the corner. Bedroom 2: Queen sized bed with walk-in closet.  Spacious bathroom located next to the bedroom. Bedroom 3: Full sized bed with plenty of closet space. Privately located downstairs. Kitchen: a variety of pots and pans so you can whip up dinner for your family, a romantic meal for two, or save money by eating at home befo
neighborhood_overview: Located in the beautiful Alki Beach neighborhood, we are 2 blocks from the Alki Bathhouse, which is used for special events, 1 block from Whaletail playground and playfield, and steps from Locust Cider, West Seattle Brewing and Duke’s Chowder House.  Access to numerous outdoor activities, including walking, biking, kayaking, and paddle boarding.  5 ½ miles from CenturyLink Field and Safeco Stadium, or take the convenient West Seattle Water Taxi to downtown attractions or the Stadiums for a scenic route in just minutes.
transit: Close to bus routes, walkable, bikeable, and convenient for Uber/Lyft.

name: Great Artistic Oasis in Fremont Neighborhood
description: Skip the hassle & noise of DT Seattle. Relax & recharge in private bath & room in a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Contemporary home while minutes from all best Seattle sights, sounds, experiences and natural places. Quality, comfort, safe, clean, stylish, home+ free bag drop off,  parking & many amenities. In rm AC/ Heat. XL qual. twin bed, desk, lg. closet + armoire, Wi-Fi, light filled. Walk: fab restaurants, art, music, unique stores, micro brews, lake and parks, plus running trail. 7 pg. Guidebook upon reservation. New, contemporary, quality, stylish, clean, & very comfortable; upstairs 2nd floor. In residential neighborhood close to everything great about Downtown Seattle and the Seattle area. Short 1/2 block from direct bus to downtown Seattle, Space Needle, UW, Seattle Pacific U., a large Shopping Center, etc. Buses, to other destinations. High quality bed and cotton linens and towels, plus many amenities. Tea and coffee in main kitchen.  I have a small dog (15 lbs.). Dogs are
neighborhood_overview: I love everything about my Seattle neighborhood. Fremont was named by locals as, "the Center of the Universe" and is close to much without the major congestion during rush hour that is downtown Seattle. Fremont is: fun, very interesting with its historic buildings, art, great shops, 5*restaurants, pubs, and coffee houses, bookstores, music clubs, plus a number of micro breweries- two are just 2 blocks away!-, a whiskey producer, Theo Chocolate Factory which can be toured and has lots of free samples, walk to Gas Works Park for fabulous views of Lake Union and DT Seattle and surrounds, walk/ run/ bike/ roller blade along the 35 mile long Burke Gilman Trail, which follows water much of the way, have a look at all the amazing outdoor art in Fremont or walk along the ship canal. Then there is the short bus ride into DT Seattle which has its own wonderful things.
transit: Free on-street parking. Easy and really close public transit; ; requires exact change so need quarters and $ bills to equal $2.75 per rider per ride or pick up an ORCA card at the main terminal at airport or in DT Seattle. Bus schedules are provided or access Metro Trip Planner via cell or computer. Taxi/ Uber/ Lyft anyone? Or stay in Fremont and walk everywhere!

name: Spacious spot in central location
description: Comfortable daylight mother-in-law basement apartment! Perfectly located between Lake WA and DTown Seattle with free street parking. Blocks from a convient bus line and walking to neighborhood shops. Full kitchen, separate bedroom, bathroom, and private entrance. We have a Airbnb binder with maps, suggestions, info on bus, trolly, light rail etc. The entire ground floor mother-in-law is yours for the duration of your stay. The bedroom has ONE  bed suitable for 2 people ( a queen) ) and a large walk-in closet.  The “L shape” sectional couch in the living area can be made up to sleep 2 more, but it is NOT a fold-out couch.  We have a double blow up mattress as well you can use. When you arrive at your rental we will greet you and show you around the rental and give tips on the area.  Located in a great family friendly neighborhood with lots of possible ways to spend your time.  There is a convenient bus line 2.5 blocks away that goes straight into downtown Seattle and lots of on street p
neighborhood_overview: We are centrally located.  Walking distance from Lake Washington, and the neighborhoods of Mt. Baker, Madrona, Leschi, International District, and the sports stadiums.  Neigborhoods have many coffee shops, and restaurants.  We are on a bus line #14 to downtown/waterfront/international district. Uber taxis provides inexpensive rates  to popular destinations.  You can get the Lightrail from the airport to the Mt Baker stop. From there you can Uber or catch #14 bus to our house. We have a binder with restaurant suggestions in the unit for you to get ideas from.
transit: Lightrail takes you from the airport to the 'Mount Baker' stop a mile from our house (and then #14 bus to our house).  Check with us, we are sometimes available to pick you up/drop you off. It is walking distance from many central locations.  We are 2.5 blocks from a main road that has a bus every 30 min. #14 to downtown, waterfront, Pike Place Market, and easy transfers to Capitol Hill #8 etc. Free street parking at our Airbnb.

name: Green Lake Master Suite Apartment with Jetted Tub
description: This beautiful Master Suite Apartment in our guest house is located in Green Lake, one of Seattle's best neighborhoods, and was fully updated in May 2017.  It features a king bed, gas fireplace, and a huge bath suite. It is a short block from beautiful Green Lake, and walking distance to many great local restaurants, cafes, shops and outdoor activities, as well as a short drive (or longer walk) to the University of Washington and the Zoo.  Limited parking is available onsite. This private Master Suite is perfect for 2 adults who want a residential retreat in a vital Seattle neighborhood. The Suite is a large studio consisting of large bedroom which is connected to a very large bathroom.   The bedroom area has a king-sized bed, a dresser, a 40" TV, a gas fireplace, and loveseat that pulls out into a twin bed. The big bathroom has a jetted tub, a separate shower, and two sinks.  Off of the bathroom is a large walk-in closet that doubles as a simple kitchenette consisting of a microwave,
neighborhood_overview: Seattle is among the most active cities in the U.S. and the Green Lake neighborhood is Seattle’s hub for recreation. Circling the lake is a 2.8 mile walking/running/wheels trail. The adjacent park offers tennis and basketball courts, baseball and soccer fields, a public 9-iron golf course, public swimming pool and beaches, boat/kayak/paddle board rentals, and a theatre. Green Lake is also a great place for people watching, and we are walking distance to multiple cafes, restaurants, and shops.
transit: Just around the corner from beautiful Green Lake Park, a 10-minute drive to Downtown Seattle, Fremont, Ballard, and the University of Washington, and right next to the bus #62 stop that takes you to Wallingford, Fremont, and Downtown. There is also plenty to do within walking distance: Six blocks to restaurants, shops, and a natural grocery in Green Lake's neighborhood center, and less than a mile to more options in the nice Tangletown, Roosevelt, & Wallingford neighborhood centers.

name: Entire Ballard Home - Beautiful Sunset Hill
description: Very well maintained 3 bed/2 bath family-friendly and business-traveler friendly home in Ballard facing the water and mountains on quiet Sunset Hill.  Sleep on comfortable beds with nice linens, enjoy cooking in the chef's kitchen, BBQ in the back yard and enjoy the sunset from the front porch. Walk one block to a neighborhood grocery/market for coffee/ice cream or make reservations at Piccolino's Italian restaurant. Fully stocked home with everything you need to enjoy your time in Seattle. We hope you enjoy our comfortable home away from home, fully stocked with everything you need. Includes a fully stocked kitchen, spices, oils, nice linens/towels, Sonos audio, fast internet/wifi, smart TV, games, and much more. _______________________ BEDROOMS AND BATHS: 3 bedrooms plus family room with king sized bed _______________________ 1 very large, master bedroom upstairs with king bed, master bathroom, desk with computer monitor, chairs, couch, and sitting benches 2 bedrooms on the main leve
neighborhood_overview: _____________________ NEIGHBORHOOD INFO: _____________________ Sunset Hill is a walkers paradise.  Take in the views from the front porch, or walk 10-15 minutes in any direction to connect to fine dining, the waterfront, Ballard Locks, Shileshole Marina, and all that Ballard has to offer. Easy living and traveling from Sunset Hill.  Just one block from the bus line, gourmet neighborhood grocery, Italian cafe, coffee shop, video store, and a short 5-10 minute walk from the water where fine waterside dining is at Ray’s and Anthony’s restaurants. Ample free street parking available.
transit: One block from a bus line that runs occasionally, and  10 blocks from a bus line that runs several times an hour.  Easy access to downtown Seattle for those willing to walk 10 blocks to and from the bus. Easy 15-20 minute walk (or 5 minute drive) to downtown Ballard and all it has to offer with food, culture, farmers' market, and night life.

I am asking for a 2-week minimum stay, but I have some flexibility if you want to stay a few days shy of 2-weeks. Also, I can offer a discount if you would like to book for the entire 3-weeks. If you need to stay for the whole month of May, I can additionally rent out the main floor bedrooms while I am still home (April 28-May 5). Please contact me with your booking needs. My home includes 3-1/2 bedrooms. On the main floor is a huge bedroom, with 5 large windows overloo
neighborhood_overview: I proudly live in zip code (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , one of the most diverse neighborhood in the country! You'll see many cars in my neighborhood with a bumper sticker saying " (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) !"in rainbow letters. You need to be a fairly good walker to walk to Seward Park, the bus stop, and the PCC Coop, because of Graham Hill- pretty steep.   (Hidden by Airbnb) "Graham Hill Elementary School" for your directions. I live across the street.

A steep 1/3 mile hill/walk from my house to reach the bus stops,  With #7 bus, it can take as much as 55 minutes to get downtown in rush hour, 35-45 minutes not rush hour. About 15-20 minutes by car, not rush hour. I usually drive my car to free parking on Rainier Ave. and walk to light rail. Light rail is fast to downtown. You can also take #7 bus to light rail. There is also Uber and Lyft.

name: ★ Quiet studio, fun spot, walk everywhere! + AC!
description: Open studio layout with a full bathroom. The kitchen is the perfect size for 2 and has all the basics including fresh local coffee. I am a minimalist and travel quite a bit so I try to keep my personal stuff in the apartment to a minimum. Our guest have access to the full apartment as well as the laundry room. Make yourself at home! We love to show off Seattle when in the area and have a very detailed guide book for when we are out of town. Capitol Hill is vibrant, lively with endless choices of coffee shops, bars, restaurants, speakeasy, pinball arcade bar and other activities. Our building is located right in the middle of all the action and walking distance to just about anywhere you would want to go in downtown Seattle. We are in a great location if you are looking to go to Century Link Field, Safeco Field, Experience Music Project, Seattle Center, or Lake Union. We are also only a few blocks from the Seattle Convention Center. We love the people and the bustle of our neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is vibrant, lively with endless choices of coffee shops, bars, restaurants, speakeasy, pinball arcade bar and other activities. Our building is located right in the middle of all the action and walking distance to just about anywhere you would want to go in downtown Seattle. We are in a great location if you are looking to go to Century Link Field, Safeco Field, Experience Music Project, Seattle Center, or Lake Union. We are also only a few blocks from the Seattle Convention Center. We love the people and the bustle of our neighborhood. Its also nice to have an apt. that does not let in the noise of the city. In addition to a grocery store about a 10 min walk away there are 2 nice convenience stores across the street.
transit: *Everything is walkable! *Pronto Bike rental across the street *We are big fans of Uber or Lyft * 10min walk to light rail which will get you around the city and to the SeaTac airport *Several bus stops within a few blocks *Main bus hub a few blocks away, good for getting out of the city

name: Modern Remodeled 3 BR, Walk to Rail Station
description: This beautiful 3 BR is a combination of two remodeled apartments connected by a door. 2 bathrooms. It has 3 queen beds. Can accommodate 10 people. Two fully equipped kitchens with new appliances, with Washer/Dryer.  3 min walk to Columbia Rail Station. 18 minutes to Seatac Airport.  Long term rentals at 50% discount. What makes this 3 BR unique is that the 2 showers and the 2 toilets have their own privacy doors.  It is like having 4 bathrooms. Perfect for a family of 10!  You were on our mind when we remodeled these apartments  :)  The building has only 5 units and located near the main road on Martin Luther King Jr Way S and a side street. This 3 bedroom is in the rear of the building away from the main road. It has a total of 8 (double pane) windows with intentions to reduce noise (our long term tenants never complained of street noise). The apartments are in the first floor, facing the parking lot. The apartment is all yours.  Free assigned parking spaces letter "C" and "E" right o
neighborhood_overview: Friendly neighborhood with private homes. Diverse Culture. One block is a 4.5 star rated Vietnamese Restaurant called Billiard Hoang. Three words for the food: super freakin' delicious. Read Yelp reviews. Don't let the exterior of the restaurant or Vietnamese dominate area scare you. Focus on the authentic Vietnamese food that is memorable. The owners/employees are fantastic. Super welcoming and friendly to everyone that walks in the door. It's a no-smoking restaurant but you may want to consider take out (if you are sensitive to smoke breathe from the people who play pool there). 5 minute walk to a "Whole Foods" type grocery store and more assorted eateries - Seafood, Sushi, Poke, Italian, BBQ, Pizzerias, Bakery, Bank, Hair and Nail Salon, etc.
transit: Light rail, public bus Walk to Columbia City Light Rail Station where you can go to downtown and other areas without worrying about parking and paying high parking fees. Only 4 stops to Stadium Station - offers easy access to Mariners games at Safeco Field, and Sounders FC and Seahawks games at CenturyLink Field. Only 5 stops to International District-Chinatown Station.  Explore Japantown and Little Saigon neighborhoods.

name: Seattle Pop Art House
description: Step through the doors of Seattle's only 100% Art themed home and get a righteous taste of the 60's served on a silver Pop Art platter.  This whole thing was designed by us and built on 2 groovy notions: Pop Art is ridiculously fun. Pop Art is Life.  We're 15 mins from Seatac Airport, & 15 mins to downtown Seattle. Come hang out! We've got Pop Art coloring books, a record player, board games, brand new furniture and and lots of original and classic Art for you to explore.  #SeattlePopArtHouse The home is well-appointed with all the luxury linens and finishes you need. Enjoy a kitchen with GE Stainless Steel appliances, Queen bed-room with 3 Panel Wardrobe, colorful Full bed-room with retro clothing rack, and dresser. Got 5 people and not planning on snuggling? The couch folds down into a sofa bed, or you may use the additional blow up air mattress. We built some of our own art into the walls of the bathroom where you'll experience a shock of yellow color! Soft towels and all-natural ba
neighborhood_overview: Check out some great Ethiopian food in Hillman city or some Pho-nomenal Vietnamese food up the street in Mt. Baker. It is only a short 5 minute drive down to Lake Washington were you can join the locals in kayaking, paddleboarding, and boating. The house is one of the nicest on the block, and unfortunately some of our neighbors have a lot of clutter in their backyards. Don't worry though, the neighborhood is very safe, and we have NEVER had any concerns or issues with crime. Everyone is aware, and looks out for each other.
transit: Taxis or Ride Share Services are available anytime and cost about $10 to get to many popular attractions. I prefer Uber, which is an app you may download if you haven't used it. Lyft is also available. Also, there is public bus transportation and the Link Light Rail which is a very inexpensive light rail train that goes all over Seattle. It can be another fun way to explore the city. Enjoy your stay!

name: Fauntlee Hills MIL with View
description: Welcome to our Fauntlee Hills Suite located within a 15 minute Uber ride from the airport and 20 min to downtown Seattle (Without Traffic).  Truly one of West Seattle's Prime Neighborhoods where you will Capture views of the Olympics, the Puget Sound and the Local Ferry.  Our MIL Suite, located on the bottom level of our house, includes 1 bdrm, 1 bath, Living Room, Kitchen and optional additional blow up air mattress. * No Smoking allowed inside or outside premises. Our Space is ideal both for the business traveler as well as the couple with kids that just wants to get away on an affordable trip.  For the business man/woman we provide a desk. Desk comes with a Charging station for your phone. Suite comes with a Kitchenette as well (Everything but the oven) * Note that MIL Suite is also equipped with a 83 inch projector screen with Netflix, Amazon TV and Pluto TV.  * No Smoking allowed inside or outside premises. Guest will have separate entrance to the first level of our home which is
neighborhood_overview: The Fauntlee hills neighborhood is located in West Seattle which happens to be about a 20 minute drive downtown and a 15 minute drive to the airport. West Seattle is one of the best neighborhoods in Seattle and is home to Lincoln Park (One of best parks in the City with access to Waterfront) which is about a 15 minute walk from our house. Catch the local ferry to Vashon or Southworth (Bremerton) or catch the water taxi from Alki Beach to Downtown. West Seattle has everything you need and more.
transit: We are about a 10-15 minute walk to Westwood village which has all sorts of Shopping like Target, QFC, Starbucks, Marshalls, etc.   You can also catch the C Line bus from Westwood village which is more of a direct shot to downtown Seattle.

name: Cozy 1 Bedroom Apt Near Children’s Hospital and UW
description: Enter this newly-renovated apartment through a private entrance off a spacious garden deck on the first floor of our 1926 stucco home, located in the lovely Laurelhurst neighborhood of Northeast Seattle, known for beautiful homes, rolling hills, and scenic pathways.   Our neighborhood is safe, quiet and garden-like, yet only minutes from UW, Children’s Hospital, and Downtown Seattle.  University Village, a unique and upscale outdoor mall nearby, offers shopping and wonderful restaurants. Our guest apartment is cozy (600 square feet) and you should find it comfortable, with everything you need for a short or a longer stay. * Living room - - French doors open to a private deck with table and chairs - Couch converts to a very comfortable additional Queen-sized bed - Fireplace with remote - Coffee table easily transforms into a dining room table for 4-6 people or can be used as a desk * Bathroom - - Heated floors - Washer and dryer - Tankless water heater - Lots of fluffy towels and all th
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is essentially a single-family-home hilly cul-de-sac, so it’s very private and safe. It is great for walking, with good lighting and sidewalks, beautiful landscaped yards and views of lake and mountains along the way. You will see all different styles of houses, from early 1920’s to Modern, from middle class family homes to waterfront mansions. There are a lot of excellent dining options in Northeast Seattle and University Village, and there are several parks and outdoor nature areas nearby.  We are just a short walk to the Laurelhurst Park, which has a round 1.2 mile loop trail walk, tennis courts, playground, sports fields, beautiful mature trees and Community Center; Union Bay Nature Area which has several trails with views of Lake Washington and great bird and possibly animal viewing; and the Yesler Swamp with its recently constructed boardwalk to explore a marshy area where birds and beavers live.
transit: There is plenty of free, unmetered street parking, so having your own car is a good option. In addition, there are several buses nearby. However, please note that the neighborhood is quite hilly and walking to and from the bus stops tends to be up and down hills.  We are about 0.5 miles from Children’s Hospital and it’s an easy flat 10 minute walk.   Uber or Lyft might be good options to the UW Husky Stadium Light Rail station which can take you further - to Downtown, International District or the airport.  Uber Jump and Lime Bikes with sun-powered electric assists are parked throughout the neighborhood.  You can drive to Downtown Seattle in about 20 minutes, depending on the traffic (unless it’s rush hour).

name: Spacious Capitol Hill Arts District retreat
description: Need a break from staying with the family? This spacious, vibrant, creativity-inducing one-bedroom apartment is in the heart of Capitol Hill’s Arts District. It's a short walk from the light rail. The unit has a full kitchen and its own private entryway. Note: This is my primary residence, and I'm a radical queer person with artistic leanings, two small dogs, a full closet, and a love of plants. The dogs won't be here, but the place isn't suitable for people with bigotry or dog allergies. The apartment is open and spacious, with its own entryway. It is located in the basement of a house built in 1892 by one of Seattle’s most prominent developers of the century, and it’s the one he chose to live in. Its original character has been retained in the curved doorways, beautiful radiators (now purely decorative), and a front and back yard that have been preserved with great care. It’s rare to find a house that has survived our city’s housing booms, and this one will only be around for another
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is Seattle's most vibrant neighborhood for arts and nightlife, and is also home to the city's most beautiful architecture, some of its largest parks, and several of its oldest trees. Once you leave my front door, there's plenty to find in any direction––and it's less than 30 minutes' walk or 10 minutes by light rail to downtown.  This home is right between the quiet, residential part of the Hill and the busier commercial areas. It is right next to Central Coop and Trader Joe's, and a short walk from Safeway.  DINING & BARS: There's no shortage of extraordinary places nearby, including Chophouse Row, Melrose Market, the many options on 12th Avenue and 15th Avenue, and of course the Pike/Pine corridor. Here you'll find gems by local restaurateurs – some of my favorites are Plum (Makini Howell); Oddfellows Cafe, Smith, and Tallulah's (Linda Derschang), Sitka & Spruce and Bar Ferdinand (Matt Dillon), Rione XIII and Tavolata (Ethan Stowell), Momiji (Steven Han); Trove (Rachel Y
transit: This listing is best for those interested in taking public transit or Lyft, but I also have a parking pass available for all-day parking on the street. It is a 10-15 minute walk from the Capitol Hill light rail station and is served by several bus routes that go downtown - routes 10, 11, and 12 are all within one block, taking you directly to downtown, either on the Pike Place Market side (10/11) or Pioneer Square/waterfront (12). It's also extremely walkable – coffee shops, grocery stores, restaurants, parks, theaters, galleries, pretty much everything a body needs is within a one-mile radius! I frequently walk to work downtown; it's a nice downhill walk to the Market/waterfront as well. The light rail serves downtown and south Seattle, and connects to the Monorail for easy transit to Seattle Center. As of fall 2018, I have a temporary guest parking pass available for those who drive and need to park in the neighborhood; this will allow you to exceed the normal time limit for street p

name: Sunny Room w/a Deck
description: We have a clean lovely home on a quiet dead end, and there's plenty to do nearby. We're 15 mins. from downtown & the UW, 5 blocks from beautiful Green Lake, and access to buses that go everywhere. There are two natural markets (use our kitchen), shops, & restaurants within walking distance. Go out, or stay in for the spa or movies you can stream using our high-speed internet (40 mbps). All parking is free and there's plenty. This 2nd story room has a full size bed, small closet, tiny dresser, desk and chair, full-length mirror, and its own deck with seats for 3+. A full bathroom is next door. In addition to your bedroom deck, there is a larger deck off the kitchen for hot tubbing, outdoor eating, and sun bathing. You are also welcome to a gourmet kitchen, a large dining table, and living room with television and DVD player.   Please feel free to have the run of the house! All of its common areas are open to you. When I say "we," I am referring to my son, Franky, 23, my boyfriend, Micha
neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood for running, walking and biking. Green Lake is 1/2 mile to the south, which has a pool, tennis & basketball courts, and a walk/bike/skate trail. Bike, skate and paddle boat rentals are also available. Our neighborhood also has two smaller but equally lovely trail parks: Licton Springs Park (w/playground) and Mineral Springs Park (w/disc golf course).  We are 1 mile away from a large shopping mall (Northgate), grocery stores (both mainstream and natural market), and a variety of restaurants in the Greenwood, Roosevelt and University Districts.
transit: Rapid Ride's E Line on Aurora is a 5 minute walk away, comes every 15 minutes, and gets you downtown in 15 minutes. We're also on the 45 bus route, which takes you to the University of Washington in 10 minutes, to Golden Gardens beach, and the Greenwood area with shopping and restaurants. Then there's the 26, which takes you to Northgate Mall, the Wallingford Center (great for shopping and restaurants), and downtown.

name: Comfy whimsical in-city space, dogs welcome!
description: My goal with the space is to create a cozy, comfortable space that has a bit of whimsy!  The apartment has a private entrance with each guest getting a unique keypad number.  There is a fair amount of natural light, with accessible parking. The space is fresh, colorful and comfortable with new furnishings and amenities.  Whenever possible, I have added items that are unique such as a retro looking fridge and microwave!  I want my guests to be comfortable and to enjoy being in the space.  My focus is anticipating what a visitor might need and to make it available.  If you forgot something, I can likely provide it!  The living room has a large table that can be used for work or computer use.    Wifi is provided.  The TV is set up for streaming. I live in the house with my dog and cat and am available, will check in with you but you are always welcome to contact me.  I like to get to know my guests but will not be intrusive! And I am very happy to talk about the area, offer suggestions or
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood, Madrona, is a lovely residential area that includes a commercial section that begins about 4 blocks from my house- a comfortable walk for most.  Here you will find a number of diverse restaurants/eateries, many offer a nice "Happy Hour" that are very comfortable for folks by themselves.  There are also shops, laundromat, small grocery.
transit: 3 of Seattle's major bus lines are very close- 2 within 2 blocks, the 3rd is 4 blocks with access to downtown and other areas of the city including First Hill, University of WA etc.  There is easy connection to light rail.   Uber or Lyft are quickly available.

name: Backyard Cottage in West Seattle
description: Bright, beautiful, spacious cottage in walkable West Seattle! Large, fully-equipped kitchen and free laundry in unit. Plenty of space and amenities for families and longer stays.  Lovely, fenced-in yard with playset for kids. Come enjoy peace and quiet while being just blocks from restaurants, coffee shops, parks, and public transit to downtown Seattle. Se habla español. There is a large living space with vaulted ceiling and two private bedrooms with a jack-and-jill bathroom between. The kitchen has modern appliances and plenty of counter space for cooking and cupboards for longer stays. There is a small loft off of one of the bedrooms that can work as an additional sleeping space for kids (or nimble adults) with a queen sized bed. Washer and dryer are provided in unit. You have the entire cottage to yourself, as well as access to dedicated parking spots next to the cottage. You also have access to use the peaceful yard. We live in the main house on the property. The unit has self chec
neighborhood_overview: West Seattle boasts some of the most beautiful parks and beaches in the city, including Alki Beach and Lincoln Park. Lincoln Park has picnic tables and fantastic views of the Puget Sound and Olympic Mountains. The walk along Alki Beach takes you from views of the Olympics to the west to views of downtown Seattle facing northeast across Elliott Bay. These places are 1-2 miles from our home. The Fauntleroy ferry in West Seattle also takes you across the water to Vashon Island. We live in a nice, quiet residential neighborhood with friendly neighbors and older architecture. We're a couple blocks from California Ave which has lovely family-owned restaurants, coffee shops, and commerce.
transit: West Seattle is situated at a 20 minute drive to the airport and 15 minute drive to downtown.  The C Line bus takes you directly downtown in under 20 minutes, and there's a bus stop to board that bus 0.3 miles from our house.

name: Bed, Baked and Beyond in Ballard
description: All ethnicities, genders, religions and sexualities are welcome. A 1940's bungalow in one of Seattle's most eccentric neighborhoods. Ballard is known for great restaurants, craft-breweries, the best farmer's market in Seattle, and the natural beauty of vista views and Golden Gardens beach. Walkable, too! This nicely located guesthouse is smoke-free inside and guests can smoke anything they enjoy outside in one of two outdoor seating areas. The garden swing is super comfortable! This well-appointed duplex-bungalow has a fully equipped kitchen for the cooking enthusiast. A queen-size bed and full-sized sofa-bed sleeps four travelers comfortably on white, cotton linens. There is a full bathroom with plenty of towels, WiFi, PRISM TV, and a ready-to-go picnic basket for a day in the park, or stay home and have a summer cookout in the backyard, complete with a comfy garden swing! Enjoy berries in the backyard in summer and herbs year round. Guests may access the entire, first floor of the du
neighborhood_overview: Shop at the Ballard Farmer's Market and cook with local ingredients in your own kitchen! This is an ideal location for craft beer aficionados: there are 10 breweries in close proximity! The best Neapolitan pizza outside of Italy is just a short walk from the door. There are grocery stores, notable restaurants, galleries, thrift shops, fashion boutiques, Woodland Park Zoo, Sunday’s farmers market, Ballard Salmon Locks, Golden Gardens Park and Beach, live music venues, movie theaters and more!
transit: This property is located on a major bus route to downtown Seattle: Metro bus number 27. There is also a bus to the University District: Metro bus number 44.

name: Loyal Heights Guest House
description: Two story brand new guest house located in quiet Loyal Heights neighborhood. Upstairs has hardwoods, kitchen with stainless appliances, granite counters, living/dining room, bathroom with shower. Downstairs has queen bed, closet. Our guest house is brand new. The upstairs has hardwood floors, pull out queen sized sofa bed, 32 inch flat screen tv, dining room table, kitchen with stainless appliances and granite counters, skylights, bathroom with shower and granite counters.  Bottom floor has a queen sized bed, 50 inch flat screen tv, large walk in closet with stackable washer/dryer, shelves, hanging bars. The guest house is separate from the main house (a tall fence separates the two homes) and is accessed via an alley. You have your own parking spot. Loyal Heights is a quiet, walkable neighborhood. Sunset Hill Park is a six block walk and has amazing views of Puget Sound and the Olympic Mountains. Golden Gardens is about a 1 mile walk accessed via stairs and trails.  Several coffee sho
neighborhood_overview: Loyal Heights is a quiet, walkable neighborhood. Sunset Hill Park is a six block walk and has amazing views of Puget Sound and the Olympic Mountains. Golden Gardens is about a 1 mile walk accessed via stairs and trails.  Several coffee shops (Cafe Fiore, Robertino's) are close. Famous and newly remodeled Larsen's Bakery is a 5 block walk.  Several restaurants are a short walk. Quiet and friendly neighbors, you can't go wrong!
transit: Several bus lines within a four block walk.

name: Brand New Studio - Capitol Hill Including AC/W&D
description: New studio apartment in the heart of Capitol Hill. Rooftop with views Seattle skyline - includes bbq grills and fire pit. Walk score of 99. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, parks, grocery stores & transit. Studio apartment in a luxury building. You’re free to use the gym, lounge, theatre room and rooftop. Rooftop, courtyard, lounge and theater room. Please reach out if you have any questions or need any recommendations. Here is a list of my Capitol Hill favorites: Coffee -  Cafe Petti Roso - just right down stairs on 11th Ave. Great coffee, friendly baristas, full bar service. Perfect for bloody Mary’s or mimosas on the patio! Cafe Vita - Enough said. Strong coffee with enough tables to use as a coworking space. Brunch - Odd Fellows - This is everyone’s Capitol Hill favorite. Good vibes, yummy food and cute inside! Patio is a must! Lost Lake - For those who love a diner style breakfast. Open 24 hrs! Dinner - Tavolata - This place it the best! Fresh hand made pasta, beautiful inte
neighborhood_overview: Here is a list of my Capitol Hill favorites: Coffee -  Cafe Petti Roso - just right down stairs on 11th Ave. Great coffee, friendly baristas, full bar service. Perfect for bloody Mary’s or mimosas on the patio! Cafe Vita - Enough said. Strong coffee with enough tables to use as a coworking space. Brunch - Odd Fellows - This is everyone’s Capitol Hill favorite. Good vibes, yummy food and cute inside! Patio is a must! Lost Lake - For those who love a diner style breakfast. Open 24 hrs! Dinner - Tavolata - This place it the best! Fresh hand made pasta, beautiful interior. Great wine list. Seriously this is the best place! Momiji - Best sushi in Seattle hands down Poquitos - If you are feeling Mexican this place has a great back enclose patio! Terra Plata - If you’re feeling fancy.. love the rooftop. Don’t go unless you can sit on the rooftop. :) Cocktails - Tavern law - Great drinks, always busy. They have a speak easy up stairs shhhhh ;) That’s it for now. More to come!
transit: You can pretty much get anywhere by walking. Light rail and bus stop are a few blocks away.

name: Highland Park Getaway
description: Great centralized location - 15-20 minute drive to airport, Alki beach, downtown, and sports arenas. Charming 1930's house on a quiet street. Come unplug and sink in to the beautiful surroundings of Highland Park - your hub to all outdoor excursions of the greater Seattle area. Guest bedrooms are located upstairs with living room, bathroom and kitchen. There is a deck and charcoal grill outside the kitchen. Enjoy your lunch or dinner on the picnic table outside on the lawn.  Please note, there is no TV at this location. There are shelves and shelves of books, magazines, puzzles, and cards. Here's what I have for you to enjoy: Bathroom: Towels, Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, disposable razors, hair dryer, flat iron, curling iron, cotton swabs, band aids, hydrogen peroxide, tooth brush, flossers, toilet paper, organic tampons Bedrooms: Organic cotton sheets, extra blankets and pillows (Pillows and mattresses have organic hypoallergenic dust mite and bed bug covers. Pillows are made fro
neighborhood_overview: I am on a quiet street with a lot of young families. There are always kids riding bikes and playing football on the streets so please drive slowly through the neighborhood! One of my neighbors has band practice that you can sometimes overhear, but never past 8:00 PM. There is a community college about a mile away, so there are also some younger adults in the area as well. I commute by bike and it very easy. I do recommend riding the bus back from downtown, however. Unless if you enjoy climbing giant hills ;) Alki Beach: The beach has a great boardwalk and restaurants.  You can bike, stroll or skate on the boardwalk.  Excellent people watching! Restaurants: Duke’s is great for a bit nicer place – great seafood.  Spuds Fish and Chips is great casual food and Pegasus Pizza too. DIRECTIONS:  Turn left out of the driveway, turn left on Elmgrove, turn right on 16th, left at the 2nd light onto Austin. Stay straight through the next light sequence and turn right onto 35th. Go straight down to
transit: Riding bikes are super easy to West Seattle or Downtown. I do recommend catching the bus back from downtown back home because of the giant hill.  To get to West Seattle take right from driveway and right on Thistle. Take right onto 34th, left onto Graham, right on 39th, and slight right onto Fauntleroy. California is the main drag so you can take a left at any point until you reach California. I recommend Brandon or Edmunds. To go downtown, ride north on 16th Ave, left on Myrtle, right on 21st. This will take you on the Neighborhood Greenway. Left on Andover, right on 22nd and then you will find a path on the right side of the sidewalk that takes you under the West Seattle Bridge. Follow signs for West Seattle Bridge Trail. Take left on East Marginal Way. This will take you to the water front. From here you can go to International District or Pioneer Square. Bus lines that run close by are Metro 120, Metro 125, Metro 128, and Metro 131 (sorry for the redundancy, Airbnb kept thinking I

name: 2 BR, 1 BA, entire lower level, w/private entrance
description: We love hosting and helping people get the best experience possible of Seattle! Enjoy this safe, clean, and comfortable space which is the private lower floor of our home. Rental includes entire private guest floor. Comfortably accommodates 1 to 4 people (+1 child under 2 years). Please see pricing section regarding cost per guest. Clean and quiet space provides a great place to sleep. Private/separate entry. Basement level with plenty of daylight. Two bedrooms, each with queen bed and large closets (1 pack-n-play available). New private bathroom in hall with full amenities. There is no living room or real sitting area. Space also includes laundry room and exercise room. Small eating area in laundry room with basic pantry (coffee, cereal, tea.) There is no access to a refrigerator, stove, or oven at this time.  We provide a unique key code shortly before your arrival so you may self check-in. If we are available, we enjoy offering you a personal walk-through to help you get settled. SH
neighborhood_overview: Our house is set in a quiet, family-friendly neighborhood with easy access to all Seattle has to offer. Close to University of Washington. Short walking distance to Children's Hospital, University Village, Burke Gilman Trail, restaurants, grocery stores & more. Nearby to bus and light rail transportation.
transit: PARKING Free, ample neighborhood parking.  PRIVATE TRANSPORTATION 3 minute (average) response time for private (taxi, Lyft, Uber) transportation. $10 - $20 (USD) to most places in the city. PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION 3 blocks from major bus routes. 1 mile to light rail with direct access to airport, all stadiums, International District, Downtown/Pike Place, and Capitol Hill. BIKING/WALKING We live two blocks from the Burke-Gilman Trail which runs through most of Seattle and east of Lake Washington. An ideal way to take in Seattle's fresh air and beautiful landscape. Access to parks, views of Mt. Rainier. Perfect for a long walk, run or bike ride. Bike riding suitable for everyone, from families to the serious cyclist.

name: ⭐ Chill in this Tranquil Capitol Hill Garden
description: Please contact host for pricing on bookings longer than 29 days.  This modern 3br, 2.5ba, townhouse is quietly located in the heart of Capitol Hill within walking distance of light-rail, parks, restaurants, bars, shopping and more. Our townhouse is off the side street which makes for added peace and quiet while still centrally located.  First Floor - Entrance way, Garage (for one vehicle) - also includes street parking guest pass for 2nd car, Washer / Dryer Second Floor - Entrance to the backyard garden, full bathroom and two bedrooms. The first bedroom, which overlooks the garden, is small but we've managed to fit a queen bed in it . The second bedroom is larger and also has a queen bed. Both bedrooms have a window air conditioner and an extra fan. Third Floor - The great room packs a lot into this cozy space including an outdoor balcony, living room (with gas fireplace, cable TV, DVD, and seating for at least 5 including a sofa bed), Dinning room (has a dinning table that fits up to
neighborhood_overview: Just a couple of blocks from Broadway, this central house is close to nightlife, shopping and some of the city's most influential restaurants and culinary chefs. Pike Place Market, Lake Union, and The Arboretum are an easy Uber or bike ride way.
transit: Our townhouse is centrally located just off the north end of Broadway on Capitol Hill. It is about a 7 min walk from the Link Light Rail station to the townhouse, which comes directly from Seattle/Tacoma airport. If you have a car, the house is off I-5 and has attached garage parking for 1 car in addition to street parking. Once at the townhouse, it is very easy to get around Seattle by walking, biking, Metro Bus, or a short Uber ride to downtown or other points of interest. A car is not necessary to experience Seattle from our location.

name: Seattle Vacation Home: The Vineyard: 3 bedroom/2.5 bathroom
description: "The Vineyard" is close to everything Capitol Hill has to offer, including bakeries, cafes, pubs, shopping, parks and grocery stores. You'll love this home because of its 3 bedrooms plus bonus space by the kitchen.  You'll also love the quiet location on a tree lined street... yet close to everything. "The Vineyard" is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and big groups. This home has it all: modern amenities, a quiet location, and proximity to all that Seattle has to offer. All furnishings and housewares are brand new as of Summer (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  The living areas are spread over two levels. When you enter the home, walk upstairs to the open concept living floor with a kitchen, dining room and living room.  There is also a powder room located on this level.  You will find two queen size futons on this floor. Continue to the top floor where you'll find three bedrooms and two full bathrooms.  The master bedroom with en-suite bath
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill
transit: Your home is a few short blocks from bus lines that will take you to Seattle's numerous neighborhoods (Madison Park, Capitol Hill, Downtown, Belltown, Seattle Center, South Lake Union). Queen Anne, Ballard, and Fremont are more easily accessed by car.  Your home offers garage parking for one car and a driveway for a second car. Street parking for additional cars is plentiful and free.

name: *Outstanding* apt. near Seattle Ctr.-So Lake Union
description: This outstanding apartment was built for a Son and Daughter-in-Law with very good taste. On the second floor of a home, very private, surrounded by trees, even though it is a city home. Lots of natural light, and everything to help you feel you are in your home away from home, including a deck BBQ, full kitchen and very comfortable queen beds. AND, we will do everything we can to make your stay a positive experience. QA is one of Seattle's more desirable neighborhoods and one of the safest. Outstanding Apartment near Seattle Center (see events, section below). Amazon, Key Arena, Gates Foundation & Chihuly Glass Museum are at the bottom of the hill. We're at the top facing south near the primary view lookout. Space Needle, Seattle skyline, Mount Rainier, Sunrise & Sunset views nearby. Atop a private home in a quiet neighborhood with a very good walk score. Many restaurants (some among the most highly rated) & coffee shops withinin short walking distance. Downtown (15min) bus stop is a s
neighborhood_overview: Just a short walk from Kerry Park (the premier viewpoint in Seattle, Mount Rainier, Puget Sound, Sunrise, & Sunset. The Queen Anne neighborhood is a very safe and pleasant neighborhood near Seattle Center, Amazon, the Opera, Key Arena, Gates Foundation & Chihuly Glass Museum and about 1.8 miles from downtown Seattle. We are just steps from coffee shops, restaurants (some among the best in the city), two gyms. If you stay a month, you could walk to a different restaurant every day. In addition, we are 1.9 miles from the 29 mile Burke Gilman Trail for hiking and biking.
transit: The bus stop is a short block away (16min to downtown). The four "off rack" bicycles are everywhere and cost $1 for 1/2 hour. Some have battery assist. Car2Go and by the minute cars are readily available and Uber makes all destinations convenient.

name: Great location - Private one bedroom apartment
description: Wonderful location in the city, close to lots of fun sights and neighborhoods.  Comfortable, newly renovated 1 bedroom basement apartment with its own private entrance.  There is a queen bed, kitchen, seating area, a new bathroom. Walking distance to many restaurants, the University of Washington, and Lake Union.  We would love to have you as our guest! The apartment is very private and cozy.    The kitchen has a two burner stovetop, small refrigerator, microwave, and sink.  The TV can be viewed from both the kitchen/living room, and the bedroom.  The neighborhood is wonderful to walk around, and there is a small grocery store / deli only 5 minute's walk down the street Guests have their own private entry and use of the entire apartment. We will try to be there when you arrive, and are always available by phone, email, or text.  We will not bother you, but are happy to help or give any suggestions you may need. It is an historic neighborhood in Seattle with gorgeous homes.  We are look
neighborhood_overview: It is an historic neighborhood in Seattle with gorgeous homes.  We are looking out at Portage Bay, a small area of Lake Union.  The neighborhood is very convenient and near University of Washington, Fremont, Capital Hill, Eastlake, South Lake Union, and downtown.  The Arboretum is 5 minutes away by car and a lovely place to hike.
transit: There is street parking all around, and a bus stop 2 blocks away that can take you downtown in 10-15 minutes.  Uber and Lyft are easy options too.  There is a grocery store/deli 5 minutes walk away, and many restaurants within walking distance.

name: Linden Gardens at Green Lake
description: "Linden Gardens" -- a charming craftsman style home in a quiet Green Lake neighborhood. Blocks from the lake, short walk to the zoo, and on the E bus line--10 minutes to downtown. The lower level apartment, (owner lives upstairs,) has two bedrooms: one comfy queen bed, and couch, one with double futon. Living area, full bath, kitchenette. Own entrance with key box. Close to many fabulous restaurants, coffee shops, recreation! Kayaks available for your use. Enjoy the lovely patio and garden! The kitchenette has a  small refrigerator, single burner hot plate, microwave, electric kettle, and a Melitta filter for making fresh coffee by the cup. All dishes, utensils, and cookware are provided for light cooking. Enjoy relaxing in the living area, watching tv or reading. Laundry facilities  available for stays of 6 or more days. You will have a patio just out your private entrance and in the yard, there are several apple trees to pick fruit from! My two single kayaks can be used at Green Lake
neighborhood_overview: While you are here, you may enjoy the city p-patch gardens and park across the street, called Linden Orchard. East: Just two blocks away is a fabulous Cuban restaurant called "Bongos"! Walk 1 1/2 blocks to Green Lake with it's almost 3 mile walking path, coffee shops, pool, and shopping district. West: Up a good hill, four blocks, is Starbucks, Red Mill Burgers, Thai Ku, and Chupacabra  Restaurants. Keep going and you'll find many more,  plus grocery, hardware, and consignment stores!
transit: Excellent location! The E bus line to downtown is a two minute walk away. It also connects with bus line for University of Washington and the Light rail to the airport. Lyft and Uber are also very convenient, and Car to Go is located a few blocks away.

name: Lovely Greenwood Bungalow
description: Located in Seattle's family-friendly Greenwood neighborhood, this lovely 3 bedroom home is perfectly situated for any Seattle adventure. Green Lake is less than a mile down the road and all the fun shops and restaurants on Greenwood Ave are within walking distance. In the house, there are two good sized bedrooms and one smaller bedroom. The updated kitchen is stocked with cookware, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker (coffee not included). For the cool, damp winter days, the living room is equipped with a cozy gas fireplace. And for the lovely summer evenings, the fully fenced backyard has a table and chairs. Perfect for dinner outside or just relaxing in the evening. While staying at the house, guests can park in the driveway. I love this neighborhood! Greenwood is a vibrant community with so much to offer. In five minutes, you can walk to Greenwood Ave and all of it's great shops, restaurants, coffee houses, bars, breweries, and theatre. Anything you might need can be found at the n
neighborhood_overview: I love this neighborhood! Greenwood is a vibrant community with so much to offer. In five minutes, you can walk to Greenwood Ave and all of it's great shops, restaurants, coffee houses, bars, breweries, and theatre. Anything you might need can be found at the nearby Fred Meyers. The house is across the street from the boys and girls club. The street is bike friendly (and officially a part of the interurban trail) with speed bumps to slow traffic. Greenwood park is just a block a way while Green Lake park is less than a mile a way. Phinney Ridge, Fremont, Ballard, and Maple Leaf are all easily accessible. The zoo is a 5 minute drive.  Downtown is only 15 minutes away (if traffic isn't bad).
transit: Both I5 and Highway 99 are close and easily accessible. You can park in the driveway. There is also free parking (and usually space) on the street. There are several bus lines that run close to the house. The Rapid Ride E line can get you downtown very fast (I take it to work).

name: Classic Seattle 5 bedroom with all-city access
description: Our place is close to Volunteer Park, Interlaken Park, University of Washington,  Downtown Seattle, University Arboretum, Lake Washington and Lake Union.    This big home with it's lovely picture windows and surrounding trees will make you feel like you're in a forest retreat with quick and easy all-city access right outside your door. In this particular listing you will have access to the entire house with the exception of two locked rooms in the basement and no access to the garage. When you're in the house we will be available via phone and e-mail but will not be on the premises.  We will let you know if we're in town during your stay so that we can come and address any concerns in person. North Capitol Hill is one of the premiere Neighborhoods in Seattle.  Our location is great for families with young kids (playground a block away, big parks both across the street and four blocks away).  Public transportation to downtown Seattle is right across the street as well.  Ours is also a g
neighborhood_overview: North Capitol Hill is one of the premiere Neighborhoods in Seattle.  Our location is great for families with young kids (playground a block away, big parks both across the street and four blocks away).  Public transportation to downtown Seattle is right across the street as well.  Ours is also a great walking neighborhood.  Interlaken Park, across the street is a fantastic park for trail walks or jogging.  A walk through Interlaken Park takes you directly to the Arboretum,  a lovely green space that encompasses several miles.   The University of Washington, Downtown Seattle, Lake Washington and Lake Union are all a couple of miles away and are also all great walks.
transit: There is plenty of on-street parking in our neighborhood.  There is a bus stop right across the street which will take you directly to Downtown Seattle (about a 12 minute ride).  We are four blocks away from another bus line which can talk you either to Downtown Seattle or the Light Rail.

name: Room in Vintage Whittier Heights
description: Welcome to your own room in my quaint 40's home, furnished with vintage and found objects by a 3rd generation Seattleite. Easily accessed by bus or car, in a neighborhood of mostly single family homes. The household is quiet yet friendly. Having never been remodeled, the house still has it's original charm. It is decorated and furnished with found and vintage items collected from my family and estate sales The house is located in the Whittier Heights neighborhood in Ballard, situated between three other great neighborhoods: down-town Ballard, Phinney Ridge and Greenwood. It is also not far from Fremont.  Greenlake is a mile away. If you are a runner, walker or rollerblader, you'll probably want to check it out! The Woodland Park Zoo is also close by.  There is non-restricted street parking directly out front. Car-2-Go, Zipcar, Uber and Lyft are popular options in Seattle. There are stairs from the street to the door. There is no WiFi or TV in the house. You will have access to  your be
neighborhood_overview: Whittier Heights consists of mostly single family homes occupied by families of various ages and lifestyles. It is friendly yet quiet, with yards that might be occupied by dogs, cats or chickens (very popular in Seattle right now!). There is shopping, restaurants and cafés within a mile, "the land of a thousand beers" is right up the street and has rotating food trucks parked outside!
transit: The neighborhood has a Walk Score (URL HIDDEN) of 76 a transit score of 50 and a bike score of 74. The #28 bus runs every half hour during the day on the street in front of the house. The nearest stop is at the end of the block at NW 80th St and takes 40 minutes to down-town Seattle.  Other bus lines to down-town are roughly a half mile east or west and the walk is fairly level.   Access to other areas of Seattle by car is easiest via NW 80th St, whether getting to SR 99 or I-5, or getting to 15th Ave NW. 15th NW will take you into 'down-town' Ballard or across the Ballard Bridge to Queen Anne or Down-town Seattle. Many people use ride share options such as Lyft, Uber or Car2Go.

name: Zen Escape - Pike Place Market
description: Take in the breathtaking views from this 21st floor condo featuring Zen-inspired decor. The best of Seattle is right at your fingertips from this rare 99/100 walk-score location. To top it off, the unit features incredible views of Puget Sound, the Olympic mountains, and Pike Place Market. It doesn't get any more central than this in Seattle. The place is right above the famous Pike's Place Farmers market. With the floor to ceiling windows you can see the whole Puget sound area. If you're able to peel yourself from the view, you can step out the front door and find everything you need within a few blocks: Pike's Place Market, the waterfront district, the Seattle Art Museum,  the Seattle Symphony, top-rated restaurants, the shopping district, great bars/clubs, and the list goes on! Please be aware that like most homes in Seattle, we do not have not have central AC in our unit. In the summer we provide fans for our guests to use to stay cool. There will be some city noise when windows ar

transit: Light rail & buses run from right in front of my building to the airport and just about anywhere else you want to go in Greater Seattle. The ferries are just a few blocks away - so that gives you access to all the islands if that's more your thing.

name: Bright GreenLake studio + free off-street parking
description: Half a block from Green Lake Park, this bright, charming, comfortable basement studio has its own private entrance and bathroom, as well as a dedicated off-street parking space. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, shops & outdoor activities in the vibrant, popular Green Lake neighborhood. (Plus, I use hypo-allergenic, fragrance-free detergents for linens and towels.) Welcome to Green Lake, a vibrant neighborhood with the perfect mix of city and 'suburban' life. Run, swim, paddle, walk or just relax. Please read the ENTIRE description, to make sure we're the right fit. :)  After you park in the dedicated off-street spot right outside, this bright, charming basement studio is all yours, with a separate (keyless code) entrance and private bathroom. Enjoy the comfy queen-sized bed, small futon couch, HD TV (with extended digital channels including Smithsonian Channel, National Geographic, HBO and Starz), free Wi-Fi, a VCR/DVD, and a small bathroom with a shower. The room also has a mini
neighborhood_overview: The Green Lake neighborhood can’t be beat! Not the hippest, youngest, stuffiest or wackiest, Green Lake is “just right,” in my opinion. (We have a “walkable” score of 80.) Within 8 blocks in each direction (north or south, skirting the lake), choose among restaurants serving Italian, Greek, chowder, Mexican, Chinese, burgers, Ben & Jerry’s ice cream, Thai, frozen yogurt, Subway, fine dining, and more. Bars are here, too, including the well-known Little Red Hen. PCC, a grocery store geared primarily to organic, healthy and ingredient-sensitive eaters, is four blocks away. Slightly further away are Whole Foods, Safeway, Beth’s Café, a tasty taco truck, Indian restaurants, 7-Eleven, Pho Than brothers, a guitar store, and more. Also within 8 blocks in each direction are bike shops, numerous athletic-gear stores (including Title 9 women’s clothing), a nail salon, pharmacy, beauty spas, yoga, a gym, banks and more.  If you’re even moderately active, you’ll have a hard time choosing among the
transit: Super-close to I-5 and Hwy 99. On/near major bus lines that will take you downtown in about 10-15 minutes or in any direction you choose.  Depending on traffic, the airport is about 30 minutes away and easily accessible from the highways.

description: Situated on E. Cap Hill our custom designed art filled lofted efficiency studio has easy access to transit, is walking distance to grocery stores and close to restaurants & entertainment. From our location it's an easy commute to Amazon/SLU, all major hospitals/First Hill, UW, Convention Center, Downtown & SeaTac. Fully stocked with basics plus amenities and run by dedicated hosts! Come enjoy amazing art & support our local artists! Free unmetered street parking is available on our block. Please note - this is a top floor WALK UP. There is NO ELEVATOR. The apartment is on the 4th floor so there are 3 flight of stairs before you get to the unit. The apartment features 2 private loft bedrooms. As such they are open to the kitchen & living room below (respectively).  This is an efficiency studio which means it doesn't have a full kitchen in the unit. We have a kitchenette with mini fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, french press, electric tea kettle and dishes/silverware/glassware
neighborhood_overview: Cap Hill is our favorite neighborhood in Seattle - but we may be a little biased ;) It's diverse and eclectic - we have all kinds of folks from all walks of life living here. From artsy creative types to high tech. This is a lively and thriving neighborhood not for the faint of heart. There is always something to do, a show to see, a new restaurant to try, or a festival to attend. This is also Seattle's 'gayborhood' - if being surrounded by rainbow hair, glitter & feather boas doesn't sound like your cup of tea this may not be the place for you. We welcome everyone here but we expect those who come visit our neighborhood to respect our community. The apartment is near everything - you can walk to the grocery store, coffee shops, boutiques, yoga studio, tons of restaurants and anything else you might be interested. Looking for something specific? Check out our Neighborhood Guide or ask us - we'd be happy to point you in the right direction!
transit: The apartment is right on several major bus lines. You can easily catch a bus downtown, SLU, Seattle Center, Convention Center, UW, Eastside or almost any other neighborhood nearby. You can also rent a bike for the day or by the hour - Seattle has a huge bike culture! You can Uber or Lyft to numerous neighborhoods nearby anywhere from $5-$15 on average. If you have a car I-5, 520 & I-90 are all nearby - however, parking can be a real pain around the neighborhood. Although you can usually find a spot within a block or two of our building. If you must have a car and need help navigating parking, let us know and we can help arrange a parking spot nearby for the duration of your stay. Also, there are several late night grocery stores nearby and Safeway is just a block away.

name: Explore Seattle from a New Townhouse in Cap Hill
description: Stroll back from Pike Place and create wonderful meals in a sparkling chef's kitchen. Cozy up on a big sofa after dinner and catch a movie on TV. Home has 3 bedrooms with a 4th queen air mattress in a shared space. We offer one private parking spot. This room is on the second floor with a bathroom in the hallway which is private and only used by yourself! The bed is a full/double size bed. There is plenty of street parking around the home. You are welcome to use and cook in our kitchen! Guests have full access to first and second floor which includes kitchen, living room, dining area, bathroom and bedroom.  The living room has plenty of seating and tv with Amazon fire stick and Netflix. We only want guests listed on the reservation in our house as it's a shared space, please ! Always available to help our guests with ideas of what to do! This newly constructed townhouse is in the First Hill neighborhood, near Downtown Seattle and tons of great places to eat. It's 5 minutes to Capitol H
neighborhood_overview: This newly constructed townhouse is in the First Hill neighborhood, near Downtown Seattle and tons of great places to eat. It's 5 minutes to Capitol Hill, Seattle University, and Chinatown, and a little farther to Pike Place Market.
transit: We offer a parking pass for street parking. We are close to a bus stop to go downtown and a street train to go into capital hill! Capital hill is also a short walk!

name: One Story - Seattle Quiet Residential Neighborhood
description: If you want to be in the heart of all things Seattle this is it!  Greenlake, Fremont, Lake Washington, Ballard, Golden Gardens, Puget Sound Waterfront and Downtown all minutes away.  This 3 Bedroom, 2 bathroom, modern 'Great-room' style Seattle home is a hidden gem located in a quiet residential neighborhood. Parking included, private yard, and two secluded patios. This home is the perfect spot for enjoying Seattle, travelling for work; with the family or larger groups up to six. One story home is all yours and is well appointed for an easy and comfortable stay for up to seven.  The open floor plan of the kitchen, dining room, and living room are perfect for spending time with family or friends. Each room has a queen bed and hotel style linens and each bathroom is outfitted with  all the essentials such as soap, shampoo, and conditioner. There is an onsite caretaker in the basement apartment which has a private separate entrance.  You will most likely never cross paths, unless you have
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in a very quiet residential area only a couple minutes from two of the main roads that connect all of Seattle and is perfect for exploring the area while still being able to have a good nights sleep. Only 1 mile away from tranquil Green Lake and all it's surrounding restaurants, coffee shops, and cafe's as well as 6 miles from Downtown and all of it's excitement.
transit: Our home is a ten minute walk from the bus stop, has easy access to major Seattle roadways, and is very near the upcoming light rail extension in 2021.
