name: Spacious Studio in University District, Seattle
description: Reservations require a background check. The studio is single, and only one person is allowed to stay at a given time. Spacious Studio equipped with a queen-sized airbed, wardrobe, microwave, refrigerator, Wifi, thermostat, 24*7 water supply, and a private bathroom. The apartment has a shared laundry room and a shared Kitchen on each floor. Using the Airbnb app. 0.5 miles from UW and 0.3 miles from Seattle Public Library. Opposite 7Eleven, open 24*7, and within 0.2 miles from grocery stores such as Trader Joe's and Safeway. 0.1 mile from The Ave filled with eateries serving scrumptious food at affordable prices. Excellent Bus connectivity to Seattle Downtown, Redmond, and Bellevue. Within 0.3 miles of major Bus Stations.

name: Cozy 2 bedroom Ballard walk
description: This cozy two bedroom apt is well lit. Then apt has a modern kitchen and all amenities, a king and queen bed with a bonus luxury queen air bed, your own private parking; walk to local breweries and cafes. Ballard and Fremont are at  your footsteps. Our craftsman style home was aesthetically remodeled by us with passion, hard work, and love.  Enter into a spacious living room, dining, and kitchen area. The layout lit naturally by two large windows, is airy, inviting, and comfortable.  The warm natural wood furnishings are soothing.  Cooks love the open fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances, gas stove, microwave, and large fridge…all new modern amenities.  This home is perfect for entertaining a number of guests.   Hardwood and tiled floors through-out lend to the old world charm of this 1000 sq.ft. 2 bedroom flat.   A full bath, large closet space, an onsite laundry facility satisfies your living needs.  Tastefully decorated with attention paid to the smallest detail, o
neighborhood_overview: Your own off-street parking space means you will always have a spot to leave your car while you walk to a variety of shops, restaurants, and a number of Seattle’s famous microbreweries.  Or walk to the nearby bus stop and in 15 minutes you can visit downtown Seattle, Pike Place Market, and the waterfront. Ballard has become the Microbrewery place to be.  Within a 5 minute walk there are 7 small great breweries with their own food trucks for a different experience every night.  Within a mile, the neighborhood of “Old Ballard” has a happening music venue nightlife, movie theatre, a number of International Cuisines, boutiques, galleries and a year round Sunday Farmer’s Market.  Ballard is known for its Scandinavian heritage, and one of the best places to explore it is at the Nordic Heritage Museum. The neighborhood is also the hub of Seattle's maritime industry thanks to the Hiram M. Chittenden Locks and the nearby marina. Underground viewing windows at the locks allow visitors to watch s
transit: Walk to the nearby bus stop and in 15 minutes you can visit downtown Seattle, Pike Place Market, and the waterfront.

name: Pearl Room
description: Pretty basement room in beautiful Queen Anne neighborhood close to shops, downtown, Fremont, Lake Union.  Room is in two bedroom apartment.  Other room houses Jake and Diane, two working twenty somethings. The great: beautiful walkable neighborhood. Daylight, basement apartment.  The OK: 6 foot ceilings so not good for tall people; shared common space with mature, working, personable twenty-something couple; entrance through garage.  The OK is why we only charge $60 a night for this location instead of $100. Laundry; patio; living.room Friendly, helpful, but limited interaction. Gorgeous, neighborhood close to shops, parks, and surrounding urban areas. buses, über, bikes We have a cat who keeps to herself.

If you need anything, just let us know! Lake Washington is a short walk and swim beaches are very close. Seward Park also close. Columbia City - Ark Lodge movie theater, restaurants & bars in walking distance - about 15-20 min. Ample street parking. Close to light rail and bus lines.

name: Modern 4BR/3.5BA Near Downtown
description: Our beautiful modern home is centrally located in colorful Capitol Hill. Walk to restaurants, bars, shopping, theatre, parks, 3 groceries, 2 farmers markets. Family and kid friendly. Walk/bus/10 min Lyft/Uber or rent an electric bicycle to Downtown, Pike Place, museums & more. Our beautiful, spacious 4 BR modern home is fully furnished, extremely comfortable and close to everything. Whether you prefer getting around on foot or via Uber/Lyft, rental bike, bus or car, the central location can't be beat.  The perfect vacation home for families or couples who want to explore the city, spend time together and recharge in comfort between excursions.  Our large home spans three above-ground floors: upstairs you'll find three bedrooms, two full bathrooms and a laundry room; on the main floor the living room, dining room, kitchen, family room with small TV, two gas fireplaces, and a half bath; on the lower level, a fourth bedroom with queen bed, a full bathroom, and entertainment room with larg
neighborhood_overview: Our home is on the eastern side of Capitol Hill, which is a densely populated residential neighborhood in Seattle, just 1.5 miles away from the heart of Downtown and Puget Sound to the west, and 1.2 miles from Lake Washington to the east.  Capitol Hill is one of the city's most prominent nightlife and entertainment districts, and the center of the city's counterculture communities - a hub for restaurants, breweries, shopping, bars, people watching and fun.  Our house is on a residential street full of young families, with new shops and apartments on the corner. Walking distance to restaurants, several grocery stores, 2 farmers' markets (Union and MLK market, and Capitol Hill market), many many coffee shops (of course!), parks (including Arboretum and Japanese Gardens, Volunteer Park, Cal Anderson Park).  Chuck's Hop Shop (tap house with 1000 beers, rotating gourmet food trucks, and $2 ice cream cones) is a block away, as is Central Cinema, Tacos Chukis, Feed Co fancy burgers, and many
transit: Walk to explore the neighborhood and city.  The main bus line to downtown is 30 seconds from our door, and the north-south bus line to the University of Washington and elsewhere is across the street (2 min). Easy Lyft or Uber (download the apps). 25 min to SeaTac airport by car/Uber/Lyft/taxi. Airport easily accessible via public transportation (~22 minute walk to Capitol Hill Light Rail station, $3 one way to airport).

Things to do nearby: 15 minutes from Columbia City on Rainier Avenue which has art/music/restaurants and shopping.  Seward park is only 10 minutes away with beautiful views of Lake Washington.  Visit Boeing field and the Museum of flight only 5 minutes away.

name: Columbia City Urban Farm Stay
description: Charming private bedroom and bathroom with a separate entrance (no kitchen) in the basement of a beautifully remodeled mid-century home and award-winning urban farm in Southeast Seattle. A quiet, natural paradise close to vibrant Columbia City and the Light Rail! Our space is ideal for folks that strive to minimize negative impact. The folks that value our space the most tend to be intrepid, creative, scent-free, anti-authoritarian, non-traditional folks that love nature and art. Private bedroom and bathroom with a separate entrance in the basement of a beautifully remodeled mid-century home and award-winning urban farm in Southeast Seattle.       (Note - there are no kitchen or cooking facilities available in the rental space.)  The room shares the spirit of the rest of the home --  natural, low-impact, non-toxic, and artistically composed with as much salvaged material as possible. The room can be rented for “test nights” for potential customers wishing to purchase an Organic Latex b
neighborhood_overview: Although Airbnb mistakenly maps us into Mount Baker, our house is actually much closer to the vibrant Columbia City Neighborhood.    The heart of Columbia City is an easy 15 minute walk away (most of the walk is through a park!).  The area is packed with many fun bars and restaurants, an independent movie theater, music venues, a co-op grocery,  a Carnegie Library, and a fantastic bakery.     Additionally, the house is just three blocks from a walking trail along beautiful Lake Washington.  From our house, the trail extends south 1.5 miles to Seward Park's old-growth forest and north 1.5 miles to summertime swimming at Mount Baker Beach.   We are surrounded by parks, soccer fields, running trails, bike trails, and easy access to the city.
transit: Best of all, the house is only a 20 minute walk from the Columbia City light rail station!   This station is just a 25 minute train ride from the airport, or a 20 minute train ride from the center of downtown.  The number 50 bus stops at the end of our block and connects to the light rail and other transit routes as well.

name: Great apartment in Classic Capitol Hill Home
description: You get a great place to stay while you are in Seattle on a quiet street in our newly redone 500-square-foot basement apartment filled with lots of light.  A great location: Our home is located two blocks east of Volunteer Park, a beautiful Olmstead Legacy Park. We are located just two miles northeast of downtown Seattle and two miles south of the University of Washington within easy bus service of downtown and the University of Washington. This apartment is on a quiet street in a residential neighborhood with  a private entrance and is newly redone with fresh paint and new carpet throughout.  This is a warm and cosy space and bright with a new memory foam mattress, a 50" TV, cable TV and a Sony Playstation 4. There is a mini-fridge, a microwave, a toaster and a hotpot.   Just a note that if you are 6' tall you will have to duck your head under a central beam in the middle of the house. Access is through a private door-code entrance on the side door. Access to the private basement then
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is Seattle's premier neighborhood and its original suburb. It is located just two blocks from Seattle's Volunteer Park and less than two miles from the Seattle Space Needle and downtown Seattle. We love walking through the park down to Broadway to one of the 50 restaurants between our house and the light rail station that we take to the airport.
transit: It is entirely possible to visit Seattle car free. From Seatac airport take the light rail to the Broadway Station. Exit the station in the direction of the travel of the train. You will exit at Broadway and John. Broadway is the restaurant row. Walk down John Street 100' and take the #10 Metro bus to Highland Drive (the second to last stop). Volunteer Park will be on your left. Walk down Highland and turn right on 17th.   Walking and the number 10 bus are how you will get around town car-free. Should you decide to drive our block has the last free parking before 4-hour zoned parking begins.

name: Charming 1919 cottage in central Ballard
description: Enjoy your own place in the sweet spot of  Ballard.  At 100 years old, the cottage is worn on the exterior but "cuter on the inside".  It is clean and comfortable as shown in the interior photos.  Great location where a car isn't necessary but off street parking in your own driveway is provided. Easy walk to every amenity a visitor would want.  We would be happy to host you! Before accepting your request, we want to be sure you have read the detailed description of the cottage below. Our 1919 vintage house is comfortable, clean, well furnished in "mid -century Scandinavian cottage"-style with colorful art and tasteful decor.  The exterior of the house and landscaping aren't pristine but it is like a good baguette: rustic crust and a tasty interior. Please  look through all the photos - we have described the cottage accurately.  If you are looking for a great place to relax, have easy walking to the local Ballard scene, visit the Sunday Farmers  Market to make a lovely meal, and  have a
neighborhood_overview: Ballard is known for its strong Scandinavian ties and for its character as a small town within the big city. It is quickly becoming THE neighborhood due to the proximity to downtown Seattle and the growth of myriad hip businesses and new residential construction. Ballard is growing quickly. Happily, it remains a vibrant neighborhood enjoyed by both locals and visitors. Ballard does have a homeless population, some of whom have drug problems and mental illness. You may encounter people on the street, in the park or on their way to the nearby Ballard Urban Rest Stop (a facility for laundry, restrooms and showers) located in a senior low-income apartment building. You may even see people living in tents on the street or in their cars.  If this urban environment is uncomfortable for you, you might consider a different property. We are happy to discuss with you before you  book if you'd like more information. Guests typically really appreciate the cottage and it's central location but some
transit: Public Metro transportation to Seattle and other destinations is plentiful. Car2Go, Reach Now, Zip Car nearby. Uber. Lyft.

name: Buddha's Butterfly Beach House
description: Stay in style one block from Alki Beach waterfront!  This cottage style living space has charm and full home access with spacious back yard, bbq, kitchen, laundry, and cozy living area. Alki Beach is a great location for walking, running, and biking on paths.  Kayak rental and paddle boards are also available for rent near by.  Guests can walk to local restaurants and there is a free shuttle to other West Seattle destinations including the Admiral Theater and and the Water Taxi which goes directly to downtown Seattle in fifteen minutes. This home offers guests privacy within the whole house for the majority of their stay.  All areas are accessible excluding one bedroom. I work in hospitality and am able to offer recommendations for tourists to fulfill their travel needs and expectations. The neighborhood is quiet except on sunny summer days when Alki Beach becomes a destination for locals and tourists alike.  Everyone can find entertainment in walking distance.  Water sports, beach acc
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet except on sunny summer days when Alki Beach becomes a destination for locals and tourists alike.  Everyone can find entertainment in walking distance.  Water sports, beach access, and trails provide multiple activities for guests to enjoy.
transit: Street parking is free in this neighborhood.  There is a bus stop less than one block away which provides transportation for free on the West Seattle Shuttle Bus as well as Metro lines to other neighborhoods and downtown Seattle.

name: Hummingbird House in Ballard: Family-Friendly+Yard
description: Make yourself at home in our sunny, cheerful and sparkling-clean family home renovated in 2017. Our sweet 2-bed 1-bath bungalow with large yard, terrific deck and colorful gardens sits on a quiet street in the heart of Seattle's vibrant Ballard neighborhood. Walk to acclaimed restaurants, ice cream, cafes, parks and attractions. Sunset picnic at beautiful Golden Gardens Park. Our location has quick access (2-15 min) to Phinney Ridge, Greenwood, Fremont, Greenlake, Wallingford & Downtown Seattle. Perfect for a group, a family, a couple, or a solo traveler on business, Hummingbird House can flex! We sleep up to 6 people in four separate beds. Here's the layout: King bed in master, twin bunks in second bedroom, and in living room, our sofa is a top-of-the-line queen-size Comfort Sleeper--as decadent as it gets. (Living room blackout curtains allow for a good night's rest.) With advance notice, we may be able to offer a portable baby crib--please ask. We offer: •High-speed Wifi •42" flat-s
neighborhood_overview: You'll find that our quiet, clean, safe, and carefully-tended street of single-family homes is populated with friendly faces and a sweet mix of young and old. Children will quickly find new friends playing outside. If you like to avoid getting in the car, you'll love the walkability and bikeability of this neighborhood!
transit: Hummingbird House is just a 10-15 minute drive from downtown and other major Seattle attractions, and sits within easy walking distance to bus lines. We have ample street parking, and off-street driveway parking is also possible although not preferred. Walking and biking are very popular choices here! If arranged ahead of time, we may be able to make bicycles available to you (helmets required). You can walk in any of several directions 5-15 minutes to reach bakeries, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, groceries, shopping, entertainment, bookstores, public library, parks, and a good deal more.

name: Domicile Suites at Marina SLU - 1BD 24L
description: This beautiful modern apartment in the heart of Seattle's technology district, South Lake Union. Its amenities are designed to maximize natural light, fresh air, and comfort. Each unit is efficient, engaging, and fully wired for seamless access to everything you need.  Thoughtfully created indoor and outdoor spaces such as a roof deck with stunning views, a fitness center, media lounge with a pool table, and more offer numerous opportunities for contemplation and total relaxation. The apartment is in a high-end building, conveniently located near South Lake Union's technology center. With 24/7 guest support and concierge services, we combine a fully-furnished premium apartment with the consistent, high-quality experience and amenities that you expect from leading hotels. Expertly designed with customized furniture, the apartment's furnishings are stylish, contemporary and specifically tailored for this apartment. We equip our apartments with everything you'll need for your home away fr
neighborhood_overview: Located across from the South Lake Union marina these apartments are a short walk to some well known technology businesses nearby. You can also enjoy some nice open green spaces that are on the edge of South Lake Union.
transit: Car sharing services such as Uber and Lyft are also readily available as are on demand car rental services such as car2go and BMW Reach Now. Seattle is also known for having a large number of bike sharing services such as Lime Bike, ofo and Spin. Metro bus route #40 right in front on Westlake and the Seattle Streetcar is nearby.

name: Private Garden Apartment in Seattle
description: Spacious private garden apartment with bath and full kitchen in Seattle's Magnolia neighborhood. Great for couples and families. One bedroom (open concept) and  a comfy pull out couch in the living room. Minutes from the Interbay cruise terminal. and a quick trip (10 min) to downtown, Space Needle, Pioneer Square, Ballard, and South Lake Union attractions. This is basement apartment with a private entrance and plenty of natural light. You'll have the apartment all to yourself. If you need get access to the laundry we are happy to arrange it. The garden apartment is located in the Magnolia neighborhood of Seattle. Magnolia is a quiet and distinctive neighborhood featuring Discovery Park, the gem of the Seattle Park District with sweeping views of Elliot Bay, downtown Seattle, Rainier and the Olympic Mountains, and easy access to Ballard and the Ballard locks. Magnolia is home to a nesting pair of bald eagles and arguably the best French bakery in Seattle. Within a mile of the cruise ter
neighborhood_overview: The garden apartment is located in the Magnolia neighborhood of Seattle. Magnolia is a quiet and distinctive neighborhood featuring Discovery Park, the gem of the Seattle Park District with sweeping views of Elliot Bay, downtown Seattle, Rainier and the Olympic Mountains, and easy access to Ballard and the Ballard locks. Magnolia is home to a nesting pair of bald eagles and arguably the best French bakery in Seattle. Within a mile of the cruise terminal (Pier 91), 2 miles from Seattle Center and 3 miles from Pike Place Market, Magnolia offers a picturesque and easy place to stay while you enjoy all that Seattle has to offer.
transit: There is bus stop at the end of the street where you can catch the 33 to downtown or the 31 which goes through Fremont to UW.

name: Master Suite in Modern Townhouse close to DT
description: Welcome to West Seattle! My townhouse is conveniently located 15 minutes from Downtown Seattle, Seatac Airport, Alki Beach, the Junction, and major highways and freeways. The bus line is across the street (120) which takes you directly to downtown.  The large and private Master Suite is located on the first level of a three story townhouse and is fully furnished (with TV, WiFi access) for your convenience and comfort. You will need a smartphone to have access to the house. This private room is located on the first level of a three story townhouse and the host sleeps on the third level.  The room is fully furnished with a queen bed, computer desk, chair, extra sheets, towels and heater.  The private bathroom is stocked with towels, tooth paste, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hair dryer for the guests' convenience. The room has everything you need and it's perfect for guests seeking long term arrangements and work travelers. Guests have access to the common areas on the second level. T
neighborhood_overview: West Seattle has much more of a small-town feel than what you’d expect for such a large neighborhood. If you are a foodie then the Junction will be your favorite spot with tons of restaurants and bars. After a long day of adventures, stop by Alki Beach to view the Seattle skyline and grab a bite from the numerous restaurants located on the beach. Other major neighborhoods in West Seattle include Admiral, Fauntleroy and Delridge. Recommendations on places and neighborhoods to visit: Pike Place Market, Space Needle, Fremont Troll, Alki Beach Neighborhoods to visit: West Seattle, Ballard, Queen Anne, Capitol Hill
transit: You can get to downtown Seattle by bus (120 across the street), car or Uber/Lyft in 15-20 minutes. We are also about 10 minutes from the West Seattle Junction and Alki Beach.

name: Lux Pike Place 1BD. 99 Walkscore 1
description: Immerse yourself into Seattle with an unbeatable location steps away from Pike Place and unparalleled style in my luxurious ultra-modern downtown one bedroom condo. Head on an adventure to Pike Place and cook some spectacularly fresh food, or enjoy Seattle's vibrant restaurant scene - all on your doorstep! Located in a brand new luxury building in front of Pike Place Market, my spacious home offers 5 star amenities, sophisticated decor, and unparalleled convenience. With gorgeous modern decor, floor to ceiling windows, and sleek finishes, guests will not only live in one of the most convenient locations in the city, but will also enjoy interior spaces unlike anything else in the city. This apartment is centrally located in downtown Seattle a block from Pike Place Market, the Seattle Art Museum, ferry terminals, and more. Enjoy all that Seattle has to offer - with style, luxury, and convenience. This beautiful home is furnished with upscale modern furniture from one of the best local fu
neighborhood_overview: You will be in front of Pike Place Market - it is right across the street! This condo is centrally located in downtown Seattle across the street from Pike Place Market, two blocks from the Seattle Art Museum, 3 blocks from Benaroya hall, very close to the ferry terminals, and pretty much everything in downtown Seattle. Enjoy all that Seattle has to offer, with the ultimate in style and convenience. Pike Place/Belltown is one of Seattle most vibrant and trendiest neighborhoods; ripe with restaurants, coffee shops, retailers, and night life. This neighborhood is perfectly situated for walking to destinations like Pike Place Market (clearly!), Seattle Aquarium, the Seattle Art Museum, the downtown shopping centers, Moore Theater, the Washington State Convention Center, and more!
transit: My home is extremely walkable to anything in downtown Seattle - starting Pike Place on your doorstep. Parking:  1) The building has valet available 2) There is parking on the street which is free from 8:00 PM to 8:00 AM but is otherwise metered 3) There are nearby lots. The one I recommend (1 block away) is $38/day. 3rd and Stewart Parking:  1619 Third Ave, Seattle, WA 98101 Walking: This home is in front of Pike Place, 2 blocks of the Seattle Art Museum, 3 blocks of Benaroya Hall, a 10 minute walk from the Washington State Convention Center, and a short 15 minute walk of the Space Needle. It is in the middle of nearly everything in downtown. It is within a 10 minute walk from Whole Foods and South Lake Union. In general, you can easily walk anywhere you need to go within downtown. Public Transit: Public transit is excellent in Seattle. This home has easy access to all public transit.

name: Cozy City Bedroom and Den
description: You'll have the entire downstairs of this lovely 1920's Craftsman home located two blocks north of Lake Union and walking distance to University of Washington. Local bus into the city and neighborhood coffee shop are within 2 blocks of my home. Proximity to Lake Union, University of Washington and downtown Seattle. Queen size bed in bedroom.  Two night minimum stay. Entire downstairs cozy space with entertainment room including refrigerator, toaster, coffee and tea. Hostess available and present during guest stay. Welcome opportunity to Seattle highlights and assist with travel arrangements. I love the proximity to the city, downtown area, and easy accessibility to freeway and alternate routes to the city. Public transportation is readily available within a few blocks. Small bathroom with shower across hall from bedroom. Blow dryer provided. Free parking on premises. Coffee, tea and snacks  are available in den.

name: Felix House in Columbia City/Seward Park
description: “Felix” has everything you'll need to enjoy your stay here in Seattle.  This beautiful, modern unit is located in our daylight basement in family-friendly Columbia City. This unit is all yours—with its’ own separate entrance and key code. You are welcome to our backyard and fire pit, stocked with firewood and s’mores fixings. The space includes a queen-sized bed and a big, cozy couch.  We welcome couples, solo adventurers, business travelers and families alike! The Felix apartment is in our daylight basement, with a separate entrance and key code. Your private floor has everything you need to enjoy your stay here in Seattle. The unit includes: bedroom with queen-sized bed and closet, full bathroom, living room, small dining table and hang-out space, laundry room. You also have access to our backyard and fire pit that comes stocked with fire wood and s'more fixings. Our place is great for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers. We have a fully fenced in backyard. The entire bo
neighborhood_overview: We are sandwiched between some of Seattle's best neighborhoods, including: Columbia City, Hillman City, and Seward Park. Independent coffee shops, bookstores, and tons of great restaurants dot the neighborhoods. We are also a 10-15 minute walk away from Lake Washington and Seward Park. There, you can explore one of Seattle's most beautiful parks or take a swim in Lake Washington.
transit: We are a short, 15-minute walk away from the light rail which takes you all over Seattle and an even shorter 5 min walk away from a bus stop.

name: Near Seattle University on Cap Hill
description: If you want to be in the heart of the city on Capitol Hill, this is the place. Just a couple blocks away from a wide variety of of upscale bars and restaurants on Pike st. Easy walk to Downtown and convention center.  In the middle of all the area hospitals, close to SU!  Perfect for a law student or proff. This is the 2nd bedroom in my town home, on the 3rd floor. All the common areas, kitchen etc, minus the garage. Meeting folks is part of the fun! Again - right in the heart of everything Seattle, hipster, artsy, and fun! Tons of buses, ubers, taxis, etc.  But mostly - walk. I do have a street guest parking pass for occasional use, but otherwise just street parking and it's a bit tight depending on time of day.

name: Beautiful condo in the heart of Seattle
description: This beautiful condo in the heart of Belltown is close to Pike Place Market, the Seattle Space Needle and Science Center, the Seattle Convention Center, and the waterfront, piers, and Olympic Sculpture Park. You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the comfy bed, close proximity to Seattle attractions, walking distance to great restaurants and nightlife, coffee shops and bakeries, and the views. It's great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families with kids. Whether you're traveling solo, vacationing with your family, here on business, or you simply need an extra room for guests, we can accommodate your stay! My condo has a flare of sophistication yet it's down-to-earth and comfortable for all to enjoy. Conveniently located in downtown Seattle, in the much desired and vibrant Belltown neighborhood, our property is centrally located and an easy walk to most tourist attractions. It is completely furnished and features a 48" flat screen TV, Amazon FireTV con
neighborhood_overview: The most convenient options for food are part of the building. We love the Macrina bakery right outside the building's front door, which has fabulous pastries and supplies baked goods to Seattle's finest restaurants. Also right there is Belltown Pizza which has a great variety of delicious pizza options. Right on the corner is a convenience store. Other nearby restaurants include Shiro's Sushi, Italian, and fast food, but within several blocks there are award-winning Seattle restaurants. It's a short walk down to the waterfront, the Edgewater hotel where the Beatles stayed, and the Olympic Sculpture park.  ADDITIONAL LOCATION INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------------- SPACE NEEDLE: 0.6 mi /13 minute walk PACIFIC SCIENCE CENTER: 0.5 mi / 10 minute walk CHIHULY GLASS & GARDEN MUSEUM 0.5 mi/ 12 minute walk SEATTLE CENTER: 0.4 mi / 9 minute walk TEATRO ZINZANNI: 0.9 mi/ 18 minute walk KEY ARENA: 0.7 mi / 14 minute walk SEATTLE ART MUSEUM (SAM): 0.7 mi / 13 minute walk
transit: Our property is 13.5 miles from the Seatac International Airport, a short 25-30 minute drive (or Uber/Lyft) or hop on the Link Light Rail (airport access) for a quick 38 minute ride downtown (exit at Westlake). From Westlake our property is 0.7 miles making it a 14 minute easy walk. The walk is through flat city streets, safe and has plenty of sidewalk space to walk with your luggage.

name: Craftsman Living in the City
description: A Classic Craftsman bungalow with a remodeled, modern, full-basement guest suite separate from the main home and with its own exterior entrance. The guest suite has high ceilings with a large living area, private bathroom, kitchenette, bedroom and outdoor patio. Wallingford is a well-located neighborhood; quiet  and with many of Seattle’s best restaurants, pubs, parks, & coffee shops a close walk away. THE HOME. Our house is a remodeled 1925 Craftsman, emblematic of the style of structure found through our neighborhood (Wallingford).  We've restored it to its original craftsmanship with modern updates and wonderful outdoor spaces.   THE AIRBNB. The large remodeled basement guest suite is yours, separated from the main house with a private outside entrance. Large, well-lit, with modern design and high 8 ft ceilings, it includes a main living area with kitchenette (microwave, refrigerator, sink, and Verismo coffee maker), large sectional, 55" TV and gas fireplace, a separate bedroom with
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Wallingford, in an oasis of single-family Seattle Craftsman homes.  We are surrounded by some of Seattle’s best parks, pubs, restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, and groceries all a 5 to 15 minute walk. We are 5 blocks from the Burke-Gilman trail if you’re a runner or biker, and a 5-minute drive from Greenlake.   We’re located between two universities, Seattle Pacific Univ. and the University of Washington.  Bus 31 and 32 (the route on our street) runs between them (15 min to each by bus).  Wallingford is a tight-knit community, and our neighborhood blocks are considered some of the safest in the city.  You should feel comfortable walking around at night.
transit: Ways to get around and parking PARKING. We are fortunate in Seattle to have plenty of free, unrestricted street parking available on our block.  We have an off-street parking spot next to our garage on the alley.  BUS. We are well situated for bus access!  Bus route 26 express is 1 block away going downtown (15 – 20 min). Our house is on bus routes 31 and 32 running to University of Washington (10 to 15 minutes) and southbound to Fremont and Seattle Center.  BIKING / BIKE-SHARE / CAR SHARE.  Seattle is an excellent city to bike around, with dedicated bike lanes through our neighborhood and the city. We are 6 blocks from the Burke-Gilman trail for biking and running.  You can easily find bike-share bikes, car-share (Car2Go) on the blocks around our home.   Our central location means you won't be fighting traffic getting downtown or most neighborhoods.  I-5 and Highway 99 are nearby, however when needed for longer commutes.  We are a 10 - 15 min. drive to downtown, depending on traffic.

name: Cozy Ballard Craftsman /upper floor
description: Large bedroom w/queen bed on the upper floor & private bath + bonus twin bed  for 3rd person in their own space.   If  two people and want separate beds,  just book for three people, each will have their own bed/room. Queen bedroom is  separate.      Walking distance to downtown Ballard/fun restaurants.  Easy bus access to downtown and the U of W. You will enjoy a large upper floor bedroom with queen bed.  The bath has both tub and shower.  The third person will have a single bed under a sloping ceiling in a separate room.  You are welcome to share the quiet back yard with an assortment of birds. You are welcome to use the kitchen.  Coffee available, make yourself a quick breakfast or cook a piece of  fresh salmon for dinner. Frig space available.  Street parking  is free and easily available. Please let me know if you want/need anything.  I love my neighborhood and want your visit to be enjoyable.  I am happy to recommend local things to see and do. Ballard is a trendy neighborhood in
neighborhood_overview: Ballard is a trendy neighborhood in the heart of Seattle. It's a wonderful area and very safe. There are many resturants, (nice variety of ethnic foods) live music, shopping, and THE hot area for  breweries. You can walk to grocery, pharmacy, resturants, and easy bus connections to the city.
transit: Metro bus 28 (2 blocks), which goes downtown and the 44, which goes to the University district are a short walk.  The 28 is also an easy connection to the Link Light Rail train to the airport. Ubers are easily accessible & we are about a $13 ride away from downtown.

name: ELEGANT BEACON HILL VIEW HOME-Minutes 2 Light rail
description: Perched high above the city in one of the best kept neighborhoods of downtown Seattle-North Beacon Hill! Excellent transit options-10 minute walk to lightrail Beacon Hill station. HWY I-5 and I-90 within minutes! Immaculate shabby chic home with views of Elliott Bay and the city skyline! An entire top floor master suite with office and ensuite. Two bedrooms and full bath on main level. Longer term requests direct to Corporate Condo Collection, Seattle WA. for direct pricing! North Beacon Hill provides the perfect environment for a Seattle luxury extended stay of a week or longer. Thoughtful interior design with the highest of quality finishes!  The living/dining area is tastefully decorated and set in an open layout - Dining area overlooking the kitchen. Fully equipped for home cooked meals!  Double dishwasher, gas stove and Kuerig coffee station!  2 bedrooms are on this main level - with a full bath!  Upper (3rd level) is a Master Suite!! Office space, ensuite with clawfoot tub and Ki
neighborhood_overview: North Beacon Hill is located in one of Seattle's most sought after neighborhoods, nestled between serene Jefferson Park and the delicious International District. This distinctive Seattle residences is set within a historic 1930’s property that has been transformed to incorporate contemporary style while embracing the integrity of the original architecture and the spirit of the neighborhood. This prestigious Beacon Hill address, in the heart of independent cafes, restaurants, museums, boutiques, and is within walking distance to LINK Lightrail (12 minutes to Westlake City Center), 5 minutes to HWY I-5 and I-90.
transit: LINK Lightrail is a 5 minute walk!  HWY access to I-5 and I-90 are within 5 minutes!

name: Tiny townhome retreat, mins to DT/stadiums/beach
description: Our tiny townhome offers a unique experience while you explore Seattle! Right in the center of it all - within minutes, you can be in the bustle of downtown, relaxing on Alki beach, or hiking an old growth forest. Start your day with a warm coffee while enjoying our tiny living room's natural light, decompress with a book on the patio,  enjoy a hot shower in the wet room, or sip an evening glass of wine while overlooking dreamy neighborhood lights. The space is made up of a fully equipped kitchen with all appliances and utensils, a cozy space to read or watch a movie, a fun upstairs loft with a super comfy full-size memory foam mattress and wet room bathroom, a private suite downstairs with a queen-size memory foam bed and bathroom with shower, a queen size memory foam pull-out sofa bed in the living room for extra guests, and a quaint outdoor patio. We provide all guests with easy, automated access to our home via an August smart lock. Once the reservation is confirmed, you will recei
neighborhood_overview: Our tiny townhome is in the cozy Pigeon Point neighborhood of West Seattle, minutes from the West Seattle bridge which you can take right into the heart of downtown Seattle. It is a quiet, residential street with breathtaking views of the city just a short neighborhood walk away. If you’re in the mood for a stroll, we recommend going left out the front door of the townhome, and walking up the street and to the right for some coveted views of the city.
transit: Exploring Seattle is very easy from our tiny townhome. Our space is very driver-friendly if you're coming with a car (we have one reserved parking spot as well as free street parking), or there is a bus line within a short walking distance. The West Seattle Water Taxi is also a few miles away (and a fun way to commute into Seattle). Uber and Lyft are also very popular in our area - a ride to the stadiums is $6-12 and takes 5-10 minutes.

name: Sunny Sweet Queen Anne Studio
description: The sweetest escape in the heart of Queen Anne. Full of charm and vintage character, with everything you could ever need: walk-in closet, hardwood floors, a work nook & massive windows that soak up the daylight. Time is savored here. Good vibes only! I really love this sweet city studio. Round the corner for a stunning view of the Space Needle, or pop down a couple blocks to grab coffee or brunch. The studio has funky character but lots of space, perfect to put your nose down and get work done or treat it as a creative escape. It's yours for the making! It's a studio so nothing is "off limits." Just be good to it! Depending on the day, I should be reachable during most hours. Maybe with breaks in-between. Lower Queen Anne is one of my favorite spots in Seattle, and not just because I live here. It's loaded with sweet cafes and eateries, and the view reminds you of why living in Seattle is just so good. Wake up for sunrise and walk 5 blocks to Kerry Park. Walk to upper Queen Anne for th
neighborhood_overview: Lower Queen Anne is one of my favorite spots in Seattle, and not just because I live here. It's loaded with sweet cafes and eateries, and the view reminds you of why living in Seattle is just so good. Wake up for sunrise and walk 5 blocks to Kerry Park. Walk to upper Queen Anne for the poshy spots, or pop down to lower Queen Anne for the independent funk. There's a flavor for everyone here.
transit: Public transportation is extremely convenient here. Catch the 2 or 13 bus line 2 blocks West going up/down Queen Anne Ave N. Or walk down to Mercer and catch a bus that will take you pretty much anywhere in the city. Alternatively, take the light rail. Or just walk because you're in the middle of everything. Taxi/Uber/Lyft zone. 99-S about 10 blocks East. 10 minute walk to downtown or Ballard. PRIME location.

Great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Complimentary coffee and tea is also available. We enjoy the high ceiling and abundance of light entering the room. Entire room and outdoor patio. My wife and I are always available to discuss any travel plans you may have.  My wife grew up in this neighborhood and is very familiar with the area. Our townhouse is located in an up-and-coming neighborhood.  We are one of four townhouses in the complex.  We are all friendly and treat each other with respect.  Please do the same when you are visiting.  Thanks! Please ask and we will give you local recommendations. There is a bus stop less than a block away and a light rail station about a half a

transit: There is a bus stop less than a block away and a light rail station about a half a mile away.  You can take the light rail all over the city including to and from the airport.   Our home is also within a Pokestop!  What?! Please ask and we can help suggest public transit routes etc.

name: Cool Studio with Huge Shower in Victory Heights
description: A newly remodeled studio apartment with beautiful kitchen, 3/4 bath with huge shower (yeah, it's got three heads), super comfy queen bed, leather couch, and huge Ecobalanza chair, three person dining table, on-site off-street parking, and access to a covered deck.  "Very walkable" walk score of 75. Very close to bus, I-5, Hwy 522, and Northgate Transit Center. 15 minutes express to downtown. Short walk to groceries, coffee shops, and restaurants. Great spot for couples and small families. The ~400 sq. ft. apartment features a comfy queen bed, couch, handcrafted Ecoblanza chair, 26" TV viewable from bed, couch, chair and dining table, three chair seating for dining and working, and a "full" kitchen (oven, stove, microwave, refrigerator toaster, but no dishwasher or garbage disposal).  We can provide a blow up single bed and "pack and play" crib upon request.  Chromecast and local channels available but no cable TV. You access the apartment from a private entrance via our shared deck.  K
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located near Northgate in Victory Heights. It is a short walk to the grocery store, restaurants, coffee shops, and other shops. Northgate mall is a short drive or bus ride.  The public library, movie theater, hot yoga studio, and multiple parks are a short distance away (walking and biking distance or a few bus stops). The neighborhood is also close to Northwest, Children's, and University hospitals. The Victory Heights neighborhood is quiet but still has great access!
transit: The studio is a 15 minute trip downtown on the I-5 express lanes, ~5 blocks to Hwy 522/Lake City Way, and less than 2 miles to Northgate Transit center. There are three bus stops within three blocks of the studio.  Close to the University of Washington (10 minute drive), which has light rail service to the airport. Wait time for an Uber is rarely longer than 4 min. There is also usually a Car2Go or Reachnow rental nearby. Very accessible with many ways to access Seattle and North Puget Sound!

name: Beautiful Downtown Seattle Apartment
description: Located in the business district, in the heart of downtown seattle close to shopping and bars. The West Lake station close by so hop on the Link Rail train. Seattle waterfront and Seattle cruise ship Terminal 91 are worth the visit.  If experience is your thing, check out the Seattle aquarium.  You can catch the free shuttle directly outside the apartment, or you can catch the Seattle great wheel, within walking distance.  The Century Link field, Woodland Park Zoo and Space Needle are close by. Someone will always be around to answer questions are there to make sure you have the best experience ever. Seattle famous Ice Cream Cake Shop as close by. Seattle Waterfront, Seattle Aquarium, Art Museum, Space Needle and Great wheel. Getting around is easy.  The Link Rail is within walking distance.  Uber and Lyft will get you anywhere you want to go as well as buses are close by.

name: Modern Ballard/Fremont Cottage
description: A bright craftsman cottage with modern charm in the middle of Seattle's great neighborhoods, Fremont and Ballard. Easily enjoy the trails and ales of Seattle by foot, bike, or bus. Room for 2 in the cozy, sunny space.  Our backyard cottage is a quiet spot for up to 2 people to call home during your visit to lovely Seattle - a bright, cozy, and modern 1b/1b with a private entrance for you to come and go as you please. The cottage is heated to keep you warm. French doors open to the side yard, with built-in benches to enjoy your morning beverages or take in the fresh air.  We provide linens, bath products, a hair dryer, wifi, an electric kettle, tea/instant coffee, a mini-fridge, local brews, and the use of a bike to help you get around while you're here.  We're usually either working, playing, or hanging with our Golden Retriever, Gravy. We'll keep to ourselves, and let you enjoy your peace and quiet!  "Frellard" is the heart of 2 of Seattle's great neighborhoods - we're located in the
neighborhood_overview: "Frellard" is the heart of 2 of Seattle's great neighborhoods - we're located in the middle of (and within walking distance of) funky, lively Fremont AND yuppie-bohemian, delicious Ballard. There are so many things to love about both. We're 2 blocks off the long and winding Burke-Gilman trail if you're a runner or bike fan, on major bus routes into downtown, and a quick drive to highways 99 and I-5. If you're traveling for work, we're within an easy 15-minute walk into Fremont (Impinj, GOOG, Tableau, Adobe), and a 20 minute direct bus to South Lake Union (Amazon) and anything downtown.  Each neighborhood has some greats.  In Frellard (just a couple blocks from the cottage): blues on vinyl and incredible BBQ at Bourbon and Bones, craft brew at the Leary Traveler, easy breakfast at the Dish, and the latest addition to the neighborhood, Tarsan i Jane for Spanish cuisine served by a Michelin kitchen chef.  In Fremont: short rib dumplings at Revel, the best breakfast sandwich on earth at Ho
transit: - If you're in a car, we have plenty of free, un-metered street parking - Multiple major bus lines within 2-10 blocks of the house - We're big patrons of Uber and Car 2 Go; you'll always find these close and convenient - There is a ZipCar lot within a 15 minute walk - We've got a bike for you to use (at your own risk - safety first!)

name: Lovely Guest Suite.
description: Walk, bus or drive, White Center (DubC) is a great location in southwest Seattle.  37 minutes to downtown by bus, 20 by car.  15 minutes drive from the airport.  This suite has a lounge, a bedroom and an independent entrance. ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKERS, please. This relaxing basement suite boasts a bedroom with a queen size bed and a walk-in closet, a soaking tub, a lounge with tv, microwave, toaster, magic bullet blender and electric kettle for hot water.  With an independent entrance and plenty of access to buses, rideshare and parking, this location is centrally located for all your Seattle adventures. Please be sure to read the additional rules section for specific terms and fees. The space is separate from the rest of the house so it is all yours during your stay.  There is a keypad lock for entering and exiting and we change the code for each guest. I'm happy to help with anything you need.  I can socialize and spend some time showing you around the neighborhood but I'm just as happy
neighborhood_overview: The Westwood/White Center area is bustling with families and people from all over the world.  You'll find a Cambodian grocery store right by a Latin bodega.  Full Tilt, our very own ice cream shop is accross from Proletariat, our awesome pizza place.  All within a five minute walk.
transit: There are at least 6 bus stops within a 5 minute walk.

name: Earth room @ Happy House★3 blocks to Link
description: ★ Please, read the entire listing and provide *1 secret code word* when you book. You can find it in this listing ★ Happy House is 3 blocks from Rainier Beach link station which takes 12 min to SeaTac airport & 19-25 min to downtown.  ★ This bedroom is called "EARTH bedroom" as it is designed around the EARTH element of nature, which brings balance, stability & stillness and helps you sleep soundly every night.  ★ This is a private room in a shared 3b/2b house. All rooms are rented on Airbnb. Seattle Happy House is a 1300 square foot rambler built in 1960 and fully remodeled in 2016. There are 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen and living room. All rooms are in the same floor. My family and I live in the back unit. * EARTH bedroom (10x14): all to yourself.     The room includes a double bed  (53"x74" or 135cm x 189cm) with fresh linens and towel, 2 night stands, 2 lamps, 1 bookshelf, 1 laptop workstation, 1 mirror, 1 luggage rack, hangers, 1 organizer & an extra blanket in closet * Bathr
neighborhood_overview: In 6 blocks or 0.5 mile, you can find:  - Beer Sheva Park where you can enjoy beautiful views of lake Washington, Mercer Island and the Cascade Mountains - Rite Aid drug store and Safeway grocery store with a Starbucks inside - Rainier Beach community center with swimming pool - A branch of the Seattle Public Library - Ethnic restaurants including Vietnamese (Phat Loi, Pho Van), Mexican (Maya, Tienda Mi Pueblito), Ethiopian (Altaye), Chinese/Cantonese (Hongkong seafood)  - Several fast food venues.  Other nearby attractions are Japanese Kubota garden (1 mile), Museum of Flight (2.7 miles) and Seward Park (3.8 miles)
transit: In 3 blocks or 0.3 mile, you can be at the Rainier Beach Station of Sound Transit's Link Light Rail. This provides very quick, easy and affordable access to SeaTac Airport, International District/China Town, historical Pioneer Square, downtown Seattle, and the University of Washington.  1- Pike Public Market, first Starbucks store, Starbucks Reserve Roastery, Aquarium, Pier 62, 63: take LINK to Westlake station. 2- Space Needle, Chihuly museum, Olympic sculpture park: take LINK to Westlake and then monorail (on the 3rd floor of WestLake center) to Seattle Center. 3- Argosy Cruise, Seattle Art Museum: take LINK to University Street station. 4- University of Washington (UW), canoe/rowboat rental on lake Washington: take Link to UW station. 5- Night life, bars, clubs, restaurants: take Link to Capitol Hill.

name: Cozy Cove - Private bath
description: Welcome home to this tranquil space in the city, free parking, on the bus line, outdoor patio, hot tub and small fitness center. Feel comfortable with your own private bath & laundry connected to your room.  I share the kitchen and living area. I work at a nearby theatre during the day and some weekends. Park free in a safe, lighted area and walk to your space with modern kitchen, dining nook and a private room with private bath. Visit the Cove located at the center complex with a hot tub, small fitness center and yoga room. Guests have access to the hot tub and small gym with yoga room. Carkeek beach access 5 minutes away.   (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Golden Gardens is another beach located 15 minutes away west, which I highly recommend.   (Website hidden by Airbnb) Lots of restaurants in the Greenwood area on 85th street, and I am happy to recommend one to you.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  I grew up in Seattle and have always considered this place my home - tell me your interests an
neighborhood_overview: There is access to Bitter Lake and tennis courts down 130th street with over 5 acres of landscaped walking trails. The Broadview public library is across the street and grocery stores 3 blocks away. Carkeek is a 200 acre park, a five minute drive to the beach and trails, perfect for a sunset on the water. Ten minute drive to Golden Gardens beach for the view of the sailboats.
transit: From the airport, take the light rail downtown and the 5 metro bus north. Parking is free in the complex, lighted in the evenings.  Once you've arrived, you can take the 5 express bus to Seattle Center or Downtown. It also goes  the neighborhoods of Greenwood, Phinney, Fremont and Queen Anne. Bus ride to Greenwood is 5 minutes with a variety of restaurants, karaoke, breweries and theatre.

description: Have family lunch on an elevated deck under a shady tree with views of Lake Washington and the Cascade Mountains. At night, gather on couches in front of the fireplace. This colonial style house is filled with furnishings from around the world. **No extra person fee for kids under 18 Bedroom 1 has a queen bed and spectacular views of Lake Washington and the Cascade mountains beyond - for this bedroom... we have over 50 all 5-STAR REVIEWS. Check it out! www.airbnb.com/rooms/ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  Bedroom 2 has two extra long twin beds (for groups of 4 we can create a king bed if requested by combining the two extra long twins with adjoining system and king mattress pad). We can also accommodate a third person in this room on an inflatable mattress if that is helpful to your group. Both bedrooms have lots of natural light and brand new mattresses. You will also have a private bathroom with bath/shower (shared between your 2 rooms), and other amenities, like a towel warmer. You
neighborhood_overview: The house is on the border of the Madrona and Leschi neighborhoods, close to Lake Washington. Several shops and restaurants are just over 10 minutes' walk away. Downtown Seattle is less than three miles away. There's plentiful free street parking.
transit: There is plenty of free street parking directly outside the house. There are various public buses close by which can take you all over Seattle. Mount Baker Light Rail station is a ~10 min Uber/Lyft ride away.

name: The Pad
description: Rated one of Seattle's 10 best Airbnb's for the last 5 years, The Pad is a fully, self contained unit with full bath (shower), kitchenette, queen bed, outdoor deck, use of free bicycles.   Top floor with a private deck, peace and quiet, and all a 3 minute walk from downtown Fremont!   Located in the center of Fremont in the center of the universe!  No hidden "cleaning" fees or other BS.  The price is the price! The Pad is a space that's been built and decorated specially for your happiness.  Well, also for my amusement....   I've been having so much fun renting my Teeny Tiny Guesthouse to folks that I wanted to do more and so added a 300 sq' studio into the attic of the old millworkers house adjacent to it.  But there's nothing attictive about it!  Or is there..?  Hmm...  Access is by the metal skybridge to a big outdoor deckutron device.  Or "deck".  Inside you'll find my mom's 1930's art deco chinese rug as well as much other vintage and cool stuff.  I built this place myself and my
neighborhood_overview: If you're coming here it's probably because you know about Fremont and want to stay here.  If you don't, it considers itself to the the "Center of the Universe" and was Seattle's historic artsy neighborhood.  It has since become home to a lot of high tech and has grown while still hanging onto it's roots.  Hey, we've got a giant troll, an original giant soviet era statue of Lenin, a cold war era rocket that lights up, and an almost life sized model of the planet Saturn.  Who doesn't love Saturn?!?!  Fremont is a very safe neighborhood with many really good restaurants opening all the time.  There are several live music venues that I'd be happy to direct you towards.  We've got a fantastic organic grocery store a couple of blocks away, a gluten free bakery just down the street, and a Belgian beer hall around the corner.  There's America's first (and maybe still only?) fair trade, organic chocolate factory 3 blocks away.  They give tours for $7 every day and all the free samples you can
transit: All kind of public transit runs through here.  It's about a 10 minute bus ride to downtown from several bus stops, all within 2 or 3 blocks.  You can sign up for car2go and just grab your own smartcar and pay by the minute.  Or, from here, you can just walk everywhere and use the bicycles for the longer trips! If it's between renting a car and using car2go I'd totally go with the latter but, if you do have a car, parking isn't bad considering it's a dense urban neighborhood.  Just read the signs carefully as parking enforcement is ruthless.  I'd be happy to advise you on the "good spots" where you can just park your car and forget about it.  Of course, as in most cities, don't tempt thieves by leaving stuff lying around in your car. And also, remember, come and go out the back way.  Have I mentioned that yet..?

name: Ballard Backyard Bungalow
description: Completely private and separate space remodeled with love and care by local trade/craftsmen.  Laid-back, close to shops, restaurants and night life in downtown Ballard and steps from a great park and buslines.  Minutes from downtown Seattle. This was originally a detached work space that was converted into an art studio.  We transformed it into a surf shop and now a fully independent studio living space for laid back travelers who want to relax in a warm, inviting spot.  Chosen by the Seattle Post-Intelligencer Newspaper as one of their "Unique AirBnBs of Seattle" (Website hidden by Airbnb) You have access to the walkway to the studio and the whole studio itself. We are very friendly folks who AirBnB, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) and love traveling.  If we are around, please feel free to say Aloha or ask any questions.  We are usually on the run with work and activities.  We don't expect you to socialize if you just want to do your own thing. Ballard is an old part of Seattle that was i
neighborhood_overview: Ballard is an old part of Seattle that was its own independent city until the early 20th century.  It was home to a large group of Scandinavian immigrants, so you can still see that flavor around town.  Ballard is known for its massive fishing fleet, great shops, cool architecture, breweries, restaurants and nightlife.
transit: We have street parking.  Don't leave valuables in your cars as the odd smashed window does occur.  We're an easy 10 min walk to downtown Ballard and have bus lines within steps of the house.  We also are less than 1 mile to the Burke Gilman Bike Trail which connects to bike trails all over the Seattle Area. Uber and Lyft are readily available as are the unique bike share and hourly car rentals found throughout Seattle.

name: Cozy & Private Room in the Heart of Columbia City
description: Our cozy bedroom has its own private entrance & ensuite bathroom with shower. We're in the heart of Columbia City & are surrounded by great cafes, bars, restaurants, a farmer's market, parks, a lake, & more! Use the nearby light rail for easy access to downtown, sports stadiums, UW, & SeaTac International airport. Cozy private bedroom in a modern three story townhome in the heart of the Columbia City neighborhood. The bedroom fits two people (full size bed) and has it's own attached bathroom. Just outside is our small garden with fresh herbs and a BBQ-  it gets lots of afternoon sun and is a great spot for morning coffee or an evening cocktail. The second floor has a shared kitchen and dining area as well as a comfortable and spacious living room. Guests have access to downstairs private bedroom and bath, outside patio and garden, and the shared kitchen and living room on the main floor. The top floor of our home is kept as our private living space. We are two busy and active individua
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood!  We're just a block from an amazing natural foods grocery store that features an amazing selection of tasty fresh and prepared foods. It's a great asset for travelers who don't always want to eat in restaurants, but still want great food. You'll also find some of Seattle's best independent coffee shops, a brewery, an award-winning bakery, a yoga studio, a historic movie theater, live music clubs, and a multitude of restaurants and bars (sushi, Thai, Caribbean, new American, Hawaiian, Senegalese, Mexican, classic diner food, Ethiopian, seafood, Neapolitan pizzeria, pub food, and more) all within 3 blocks of our home. Additionally, every Wednesday from May to October there is a wonderful Farmer's Market from 3-7pm with a variety of local and delicious treats! We are about a 10 minute walk to the shore of Lake Washington which has excellent running, biking, and swimming opportunities. Check out our guidebook for more info, or feel free to send us a message.
transit: We are about 4 blocks from the Link light rail (Columbia City station) so there is easy and inexpensive access to downtown Seattle, The University of Washington, Capital Hill, Safeco Field (where the Mariners play) and CenturyLink Field (where the Seahawks and Sounders play) and to SeaTac international airport.  We are also less than one block from three major bus routes. There always seems to be at least one Car2Go or ReachNow vehicle parked near our house, so that could be a great option if you have an account with them. Uber and Lyft are also both heavily used in our city.

name: Beautiful Private Home in Green Lake Seattle
description: This amazing three bedrooms house is located in Green Lake, one of Seattle's best neighborhoods. The home is less than a minute walk from the nearest bus stop which takes you into the heart of downtown Seattle including major sites like the Space Needle, historic Pike Place Market, the first Starbucks, and many more! For students, getting to the University of Washington is less than a 10 minute drive. Newly renovated spacious three bedroom house in Seattle. The expansive great room has couches and a dinner table to comfortably relax. The flat screen TV comes with Netflix and Hulu which are available for you to use. High speed WiFi helps you stay connected to all your Internet needs. Laundry is available upon request. Whether you want to explore Seattle all day, relax on the couch, or get some work done, our home is the perfect place for you. Check in yourself using the digital code on the front door.  You'll be given access to the entire house excluding the garage. The laundry room is
neighborhood_overview: Gorgeous Green Lake is within a 2 minutes walk. There is a walking path that goes all the way around the lake with stunning scenery. Activities around Green Lake include: boat rentals, golf, soccer fields, baseball fields, basketball courts, tennis courts, and Seattle's famous Woodland Park Zoo! Around the lake there are plenty of shops and restaurants with great food to explore. Right across the street from the house is a delicious, laid-back restaurant called Bongos which offers outdoor seating and Caribbean and Cuban plates and sandwiches.
transit: The bus is probably the best mode of transportation. The E-line bus stop is less than a 30 second walk from the house and it takes you to all the popular tourist destinations in downtown Seattle. Seattle also has dedicated bus lanes which make the bus the quickest way to get around during high traffic times. There are typically LIME or JUMP e-bikes nearby for rent.

name: Domicile Suites at Chroma SLU - 1BD 6
description: This beautiful modern apartment in the heart of Seattle's technology district, South Lake Union. Its amenities are designed to maximize natural light, fresh air, and comfort. Each unit is efficient, engaging, and fully wired for seamless access to everything you need. name: Alki Beach Home's Quiet Private Lower Level
description: Private entrance lower level unit with deck, yard BBQ, fire pit and laundry. Enjoy the Alki Beach neighborhood in the privacy of our separately accessed basement unit with bedroom, fireplace, living room, kitchenette, and bathroom including shower. There is a covered deck off the back as well as a BBQ, tables, chairs, vegetable garden and gas fire pit. Alley or street parking is available. You will be just a 5 minute walk from the beach including restaurants and the lighthouse. Don't worry about our small dog. Our small friendly sheltie collie will be kept separate from your unit and away from the back yard. Our backyard is pet clean. Guest have access to Living room with fireplace and tv, laundry/kitchenette area and private bath. We are happy to answer questions while you are here. We live in the upper part of the home. neighborhood_overview: The Alki neighborhood of West Seattle is a beachfront community with a large sandy beach, bike trail, firepits and restaurants. It is quiet in our neighborhood but can get quite busy on the beach in the summer.
transit: Our home is 2 blocks from the King County Metro 56 bus line which runs during commute times. During off commute times the 50 runs to downtown and is also your connection to link light rail which runs from Sea Tac Airport.  King County Metro is your link for public transit on buses and Sound Transit is your link for light rail. There is a water taxi with a shuttle bus from West Seattle to the Pioneer Square area of Seattle. It's schedule varies by season. You can find the information by searching king (Website hidden by Airbnb) website for West Seattle water taxi.  In addition West Seattle has ferries running to Vashon Island and Southworth.  This ferry information can be found by searching for Washington State Ferries. West Seattle is the Fauntleroy dock. Biking from Alki to downtown Seattle is a fairly flat route with protected bike path and bike lanes all the way. It is about 7 miles each way. Seattle currently has 3 bike share companies that you can sign up for to access bikes. Spin

name: Seattle Charm
description: This charming, comfortable old world apartment is full of unique details;  boxed ceilings, vintage detailing, and wood floors throughout.  It will be a haven after your day of exploring Seattle.  If you need help deciding what to do I'm happy to help, I've lived here now 30 + years.  If something in your visit fails to go off as planned, I'm available to help resolve any small difficulties and/or find solutions for any occasion. **Please be aware parties are not allowed at the apt.** My home has original, 100 year old wood detailing throughout, window seats and boxed ceilings. It is a beautiful space.  I'll provide you with delicious baked goods, yogurt, juice, milk, coffee and tea when you arrive.  (This is a completely separate apartment with the only shared space being the laundry room.) My quiet neighborhood location is close to bus routes, the Burke Gilman bike trail, and is just a 20 minute walk to downtown Ballard. In Ballard you'll discover fabulous bars and restaurants, a wond

transit: There are several buses around me that will take you everywhere as well as the Burke Gilman bike trail.  Of course you can also use Uber, Lyft and Car2Go very easily in Ballard.

name: Cozy room in Wallingford home for female guests
description: Peaceful, safe family home 20 minutes north of downtown Seattle by bus for female guests. Near UW, Gas Works Park, and Fremont. Ideal for international student or long term visitor. Private bedroom on upper floor, non-smoking 5 bedroom home in lower Wallingford with views of Lake Union from dining room and over-garage deck. The home has hardwood floors on the main floor, fireplace, light filled kitchen with stainless steel appliances, gas stove, and marble countertops. View deck with gas bbq. Bedroom is on the 2nd floor. Furnished with a single bed, desk, dresser and closet. Shared bathroom with tub/shower is across the hall. We live in the home with our college student daughter, and are readily available for any questions or concerns. We usually host 1 or 2 other female guests. Wallingford is one of the more popular family residential neighborhoods in Seattle. Located at the southern edge of Green Lake in North Seattle, this residential district is bounded to the east by the trendy Un
neighborhood_overview: Wallingford is one of the more popular family residential neighborhoods in Seattle. Located at the southern edge of Green Lake in North Seattle, this residential district is bounded to the east by the trendy University District and to the west by historic Fremont. Overlooking the mouth of Salmon Bay and Lake Union, Wallingford district is within minutes of many of Seattle's most popular attractions and shopping areas.
transit: Five minute walk to Lake Union/Gas Works Park. Near Wallingford and Fremont business districts. 20-30 minute walk to University of Washington campus. 2 blocks from Metro bus 31 and 32 to UW, Fremont and Seattle Center. 3 blocks from bus 26 to Fremont and Downtown. Free on-street parking.

description: I am an artist and this is my home. It is rich with handmade art, paintings and sculptures. A sweet, peaceful getaway for the artistically inclined. The Lovely Guest Room is available all week and the Sanctuary Room is mostly available Wed through Sat. The Lovely Guest Room is good-sized, with queen bed, dresser, desk and closet. Nice, quiet and sunny, good for students or professionals. Spacious kitchen and nice bathroom are shared. Bathroom has tub and shower, towels and washcloths provided. My home is full of lovely and unique art. I am a painter and sculptor and my son is an illustrator, so creativity abounds here! We also love books and music, so there is quite a library and CD collection available. And a lovely floor-to-ceiling fireplace for cozy evenings by the fire. We have a very sweet kitty, so no other pets please!  A note on comfortability for my more religious guests. I am buddhist/pagan/nature oriented in my own spiritual realm and some of my art contains nude Goddesses,

name: Green Lake Duplex Great Kitchen
description: This charming 1906 duplex is in the middle of a sweet triangle between the University of Washington,  Green Lake Park with the Woodland Park Zoo and the trendy, walkable neighborhoods of Wallingford & Tangletown.  The Wallingford/Green Lake neighborhood is enchanting. Great scores for walkability, charming craftsman homes and a multitude of urban conclaves. It has easy access to downtown (four miles), the University of Washington (one mile) and GreenLake (one-half mile). The duplex offers an open floor plan with 10 foot ceilings.  The dining room, living room and front enclosed sun porch/bedroom flowing into each other.  The big bright kitchen invites gathering, cooking and sipping on your beverage of choice.  The two main bedrooms are upstairs allowing a quiet space as need. 24 hour access via backdoor with key code.  Could not be easier. I am a retired register nurse.  I am available by phone or text 24/7. I live on the other side of the duplex, I can provide you easily with what you

transit: There is free street parking. The 26 Metro bus line is at the end of the block and will take you downtown to explore all the treasures of downtown such as Pike Place Market, Seattle Art Museum, the Space Needle and the not to be missed Chihuly Garden and Glass.  The duplex is sandwiched between I-5 and Aurora Ave N so you can get going by car with ease.  Walk Score 82:Very Walkable Most errands can be accomplished on foot.. Very bikeable, nearby Burke Gilman Trail will wind you around scenic waterfronts.   There are about 102 restaurants, bars and coffee shops in Green Lake. description: Welcome to my gateway! With all my heart, I created this place for you. A place that brings together comfort, convenience and I hope a wonderful stay. I do not recommend this place for my senior guests as you may need to crawl on the bed. - Another pull out queen size sofa bed (Cb2 brand) is available in the living room. neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by the local flair and businesses of Belltown, your place is within walking distance to many Seattle landmarks, such as the Space Needle, the Pacific Science Center, and the Olympic Sculpture Park.  Walk right out of the door of the building and explore restaurants, bars and coffee shops footsteps away.
transit: Online platform available: UBER, Lyft, Zipcar, car2go, reachnow Getting to SEATAC airport by using monorail & Link light rail: To get from Seattle Center to Sea-Tac Airport: buy a Monorail ticket at the Seattle Center Monorail station (near Space Needle) and ride the monorail train to Westlake Center. As you exit the Monorail at Westlake Center, you will see an elevator and stairwell on the far left side of the platform, use either option to go to all the way to the bottom level to the Downtown Seattle Transit Tunnel. From there, buy a ticket and ride the Sound Transit Central Link Light Rail which carries passengers between UW Station (Northern-most stop) and Angle Lake Station (Southern-most stop). When you board the light rail at Westlake Station, there are 11 stops until you arrive at Sea-Tac/Airport Station. name: Home Above It All On Alki
description: Enjoy Alki views and beach from my West Seattle duplex townhome, located at the top of stairs that take you directly to Alki’s boardwalk, making it an easy walk to sandy beaches, coffee shops and restaurants. Each bedroom has its own queen size bed & bathroom, with Puget Sound views from the master bedroom. Sleeps up to 6 people with the addition of the full size sleeper sofa in the living room. The deck off the living room is ready for you to grill, dine and relax. Nearly 1400 square feet of living space to enjoy combined with a short walk to Alki Beach & all it has to offer.   The main level includes living room, dining, kitchen and desk. The living room has a wood fireplace, large screen tv (DISH) & full sleeper sofa. A door from the living room opens up to the large deck with table and grill.  Back into the house, the dining table overlooks the living room from a couple steps up. Rounding out this floor is a large kitchen with stainless steel appliances and glass surface stovetop,
neighborhood_overview: What I love about my neighborhood is that everything is in walking distance or a short drive. Coffee shops, restaurants, and the beach are a short walk away. Alki Beach has sand, salt water smells and fish & chips galore – everything one expects from a classic beach community. It has many other restaurant and coffee shop options to go along with views of the Puget Sound and the Olympic Mountains. In the summertime, it is complete with a boardwalk of runners, bicyclists and roller-skaters, a beach filled with sunbathers, volleyball nets, barbecues & bonfires, and water filled with splashing kids, kayakers and paddleboarders. In the off-season, it is much calmer but still a wonderful place to enjoy all the beach has to offer. You can choose to enjoy all of this yourself or enjoying watching those that do. And a short drive (or walk) up the hill also gives you the Admiral District, which also has great restaurants.  There you will also find  grocery options, including Metropolitan Market,
transit: The West Seattle Water Taxi is a easy 2-mile walk walk along the beach (or just over a mile if you choose to go up & over the hill) or a short free bus ride with the stop a short walk from my home. Water taxi provides a 10 minute ride to downtown Seattle. (In summer time, water taxi and shuttle bus runs regularly; in winter time hours limited to “rush hour” times.).  Lyft and Uber are also great options.

name: Sunny Studio close to everything on Cap Hill!
description: Bright & cozy studio in Cap Hill centrally located near bustling Broadway! Walking distance to coffee shops, restaurants, bars & shopping. Easy access to transit and a quick commute to downtown, SLU, UW, hospitals, Amazon, and Convention Center. Professionally managed with dedicated and responsive hosts. Easy 24hr self check-in and fully stocked kitchen & bathroom with beyond the basics! We have a full kitchen with plenty of counter space. It's stocked with all your cooking basics as well as coffee maker, french press, grinder, whole locally roasted beans, wide tea selection, sugar, and creamer.  The bathroom is stocked with our in-house amenity line with shampoo, conditioner and 2 types of body-wash & lotion. We also stock earplugs, make up wipes, hair dyer and flat iron, plus much more!  We have a Neighborhood Guide in the apartment with recommendations for things nearby as well as around Seattle in general. Not finding what you're looking for in our Guide? Shoot us a message and we
neighborhood_overview: Cap Hill is our favorite neighborhood in Seattle - but we may be a little biased ;) It's diverse and eclectic - we have all kinds of folks from all walks of life living here. From artsy creative types to high tech. This is a lively and thriving neighborhood not for the faint of heart. There is always something to do, a show to see, a new restaurant to try, or a festival to attend. This is also Seattle's 'gayborhood' - if being surrounded by rainbow hair, glitter & feather boas doesn't sound like your cup of tea this may not be the place for you. We welcome everyone here but we expect those who come visit our neighborhood to respect our community. The apartment is near everything - you can walk to the grocery store, coffee shops, boutiques, yoga studio, tons of restaurants and anything else you might be interested. Looking for something specific? Check out our Neighborhood Guide or ask us - we'd be happy to point you in the right direction!
transit: The apartment is right on several major bus lines. You can easily catch a bus downtown, SLU, Seattle Center, Convention Center, UW, Eastside or almost any other neighborhood nearby. You can also rent a bike for the day or by the hour - Seattle has a huge bike culture! You can Uber or Lyft to numerous neighborhoods nearby anywhere from $5-$15 on average. If you have a car I-5, 520 & I-90 are all nearby - however, parking can be a real pain around the neighborhood. Although you can usually find a spot within a block or two of our building. There are several late night grocery stores nearby as well as a Sunday Farmers Market!
