name: Sunny & Simple in Seattle
description: This simple, private room with a shared bath is the perfect resting spot for two travelers on the go. Two twin beds give each guest space to relax in a spacious room filled with light in this quiet Seattle neighborhood. This is one of three available rooms within the same house with a shared bath with limited kitchen use. **No animals please, I have elderly cats on the premises who are very afraid of dogs and other cats** **No children under 10 please** **420-friendly (in/outdoors)** A large, clean and well-lit room for you to relax in after a busy day of sightseeing or traveling. Double closet, light and comfortable twin beds. Warm in the Winter and cool in the Summer. Very large room filled with light and a double closet in what used to be Seattle's oldest apple orchard. In the late Summer the garden is bursting with fresh vegetables and prolific fruit trees. Toasty in the Winter and cool in the Summer. Coffee and tea is available in the kitchen along with the ability to store and co
neighborhood_overview: A quite neighborhood filled with front gardens and mid-century charm. Just a few blocks away you'll find one of the best Brew Pubs in Seattle, Elliot Bay, and a new one will be opening soon as well! Plenty of local businesses, both large and small make it easy to bank, grocery shop and help you get any of your traveling needs met.
transit: Suggested transportation options to and from downtown. Home is not far from downtown access via express buses and major arteries for driving like I-5, Lake City Way and Route 99.522 Express Bus leaves a few blocks from here at 130th Street and Lake City Way. Weekend services is less frequent but active during week days. Other bus options include the 72 and a transit hub at Northgate (5 mins from here by bus) gives you access to even more buses plus the local 41/65 buses are also nearby.

name: Urban Retreat- walk to the beach!
description: Walk to the beach from this new architecturally designed studio loft  - tucked away in our beautiful backyard. Think "urban barn" with lots of natural light.  Our neighborhood is charming and quiet - yet minutes from downtown!  The studio loft  is NEWly renovated (2017) and located behind our 1918 craftsman home.  Open up the large modern barn doors and you will find a cool living space you will enjoy.  We do prefer longer stays - generally there is a 5 day minimum. Please inquire. The space: Architectually designed with a lovely mix of wood, concrete and steel.  Just under 400 s/f.   There is a cozy sitting area, a place to eat and look out at the garden, and a small kitchenette with butcher block counters and a big ole farm sink.  The kitchenette is basic and not designed for extensive cooking.  There is a countertop convection oven and hot plates to boil, undercounter refridgerator, coffee maker and most other basics for light prepping/cooking and eating.  The bathroom has an open s
neighborhood_overview: The Mt Baker neighborhood is perfect.  Quite, but central, with easy access.  The neighborhood sits on Lake Washington, there are stunning views, lovely historic homes, trails, a Olmsted Brothers park and views of Mt Rainer.  There are a few places walkable to eat and shop, but, minimal.  But you can hop on the bus behind our home and get right into the International District, Pioneer Square and downtown in minutes!  The light rail is also a 10 minute walk which can take you to the airport and other parts of the city. There is free, ample parking in front of the house.
transit: the number 14 bus is right behind our house, 1/2 block.   The light rail is a 10 minute walk and gets you to different parts of the city and the airport.  There is also a great new bike share service in town, as well as Uber and Lyft, Car to Go and taxi 2service.  Parking is free in front of our house.

neighborhood_overview: The home is in Eastlake, a quiet hilly neighborhood on the east side of Lake Union. Situated just north of downtown and South Lake Union and south of UW. Get almost anywhere by walking, bus, or ride share. Situated only blocks from I5.
transit: Centrally located in Eastlake, getting around is easy!  Less than one block's walk to a major bus route (bus 70 to downtown) and about four blocks to the South Lake Union Trolley.    If you have a car, there is driveway parking available and easy access to I5.

name: Queen Anne Oasis
description: Large groups will rest easy at this newly renovated 5-bedroom luxury home with private guest suite. This gem is centrally located in one of Seattle’s most charming and desirable neighborhoods. Walk along quaint, tree-lined streets to restaurants and shopping on Queen Anne Avenue or catch the bus a block away for a quick 10-minute ride to the popular Seattle Center and downtown. Afterwards, enjoy dinner or a glass of wine on the beautiful fenced-in outdoor patio or a soak in the warm swim spa. INSIDE THE HOUSE This new renovated house included the main house and private guest suite. A total of five bedrooms, four bathrooms, two kitchens and amenities that will give you and your guests a total five star stay.  Inside, an open concept living area shares space with the kitchen and dining rooms. Hardwood floors and classic furnishings characterize this home, with a large flat-screens in most of the rooms. Outside awaits your private courtyard. Sit outside with a glass of wine while the sun
neighborhood_overview: OUR LOCATION The Queen Anne neighborhood is a historic part of Seattle, with gracious mansions sitting side by side with vibrant shops and trendy restaurants – like Crow, which serves new American fare in hip digs and Canlis, a historic lake view fine dining establishment. From my home you can walk to Seattle Pacific University and the Interlay Golf Course, both less than a mile away. If you’re a water lover, head over to Lake Union, 2 miles away, and rent a kayak or a paddle board for the day. If you're not into getting into the car, catch one of three buses lines that run along 10th Ave West  outside the door - taking you downtown, Seattle Science Center and more.  Come in June, when Fremont hosts the Solstice Festival, or live it up at Oktoberfest in the fall. Whenever you come, Seattle will welcome you with open arms!
transit: Uber and Lyft are available 24/7 with usually no longer than a 10 minute wait. The Seattle Metro is right outside your door - ready to take you downtown. Click below  - start planning your metro trip.

name: Capitol Hill Lofted Living :: Broadcast
description: Tune-in to Broadcast :: Stunning top-floor Capitol Hill apartment located within steps to the best restaurants, coffee shops, and nightlife in the neighborhood. Enjoy easy and convenient access by bus or rail to downtown Seattle, Capitol Hill, Convention Center, Pioneer Square, Queen Anne, and more! Set Your Stage :: Brand new top-floor lofted apartment with lots of natural light and plenty of room to spread out while enjoying the best the city has to offer.  This open-concept lofted apartment is filled with natural light, a queen bed in the sleeping space, a sleeper sofa in the living room, spacious bathroom with laundry, fully equipped kitchen with gas range, private balcony, and views of the Olympic Mountains. Please note that this is an "open-style" lofted one bedroom, meaning the bedroom is separated by sliding glass doors from the living space and may not be suitable for those who prefer extra privacy. Additional windows in the space allow for a great deal of natural light during
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is the neighborhood for everyone! The Hill is the most diverse and walkable neighborhood in the whole state and has the best-rated restaurants, coffee shops, and bars around! Enjoy our recommendations below, all within walking distance! :: Coffee :: Porchlight Coffee & Records Honor Coffee Victrola Cafe Vita Capitol Coffee Works Stumptown Coffee Tougo Starbucks Roastery :: Eat & Drink :: Skillet Diner Marjorie Adana Artusi Frankie & Jo's Little Uncle Cupcake Royale Rachel's Ginger Beer Momiji Tavern Law Plum Bistro Old School Frozen Custard Oddfellows Poquitos Redhook Brewlab Molly Moon's Ice Cream Capitol Cider Liberty Bar :: Shopping :: Elliott Bay Book Company The Central Co-Op Retrofit Home Everyday Music Trader Joe's Blick Art Supply Glasswing
transit: Broadcast is located on several King County Metro bus lines and within a few blocks to the Capitol Hill Link Light Rail Station and the First Hill Street Car. On site parking is also available by the hour in the parking garage (entrance on East Madison). From Sea-Tac Airport: Link Light Rail - Take the Link Light Rail northbound toward Downtown Seattle and exit at the Capitol Hill Light Rail Station. From there, it's about a 10-minute walk to Broadcast. Lyft/Uber - Follow signs at the airport for the "TNC/Rideshare Pick Up Area" located on the 3rd floor of the parking garage. From there it's about a 30 minute ride into the city (on a good day). Car2Go/Reach Now - Hop on the shuttle to the Wally Park lot on International Blvd to pick up your car. From there it's about a 30 minute drive into the city (on a good day).

name: The Blue House
description: Our Classic Craftsman Home is ideally located in the Historic Neighborhood of Queen Anne.  It is beautifully equipped with plentiful amenities, while retaining the character, charm, and warmth of an older, comfortable home.  Have easy access to many Seattle  attractions, i.e The Seattle Center, the World-famous, Space Needle, The Pacific Science Center, The EMP Museum, The Seattle Center Monorail, and The KeyArena, home of the Seattle Storm. 1ST FLOOR - Spacious living room with wood-burning fireplace, comfortable leather sofa/chairs - Comfortable "Family Room" with: - Comfortable seating, including relaxing window seat. - 51" TV with Roku, Netflix, Amazon,etc.. - Full kitchen with numerous appliances, fully equipped with kitchen table, place settings, pots & pans, all basic small appliances, etc., as well as French Doors leading directly to Private Backyard. - Dining room with handmade 9-foot farmhouse dining table seats 4-6 2ND FLOOR - Bedroom #1: Master Bedroom, spacious and relaxin
neighborhood_overview: Queen Anne is a charming and desirable neighborhood with beautifully maintained homes. The district’s name derives from the architectural style, typical of so many of the early houses in this area. Other styles in the neighborhood include: Dutch Colonial, Tudor, Craftsman and Cape Cod. Queen Anne is just 1.5 miles from downtown Seattle, and situated on a hilltop with stunning panoramic views in every direction -- downtown Seattle, the Space Needle and Mt. Rainier, Elliott Bay, the Olympic Mountains to the west and the Cascade Mountains to the east. If you're a walker, you'll love the 4-mile "Crown of Queen Anne" loop which takes in all of these views and is a great way to see the detail of the architecture. We are a friendly community within walking distance of Downtown, situated just north of Seattle Center and south of Fremont across the Lake Washington Ship Canal The central street is Queen Anne Avenue, “The Ave”. It has a great selection of boutiques, restaurants, coffee shops, bak
transit: Multiple bus lines within 1 block will take you just about anywhere you want to go in the City. Seattle Center and Downtown are an enjoyable walk down the hill (may want to take the bus or a ride share back up). Lyfts, Ubers, etc are plentiful as well.

name: New Two-Story Backyard Cottage
description: This is a new construction two-story cottage, completed May 2017. It has radiant heated floors, new appliances, a big flatscreen TV, and excellent wifi. It's a very private place, with it's own little yard. I live in this house 99% of the time, so some of my personal items will be present. That said, I keep things nice and tidy, so please make yourself at home. The cottage is close to Ballard and Greenwood neighborhoods, the 28, 45, 40, and D Line buses, Safeway, QFC, and Fred Meyer grocery stores, good Thai, Mexican, fast food, and pizza restaurants. There are several bars within walking distance, and two great coastal parks are a ten minute drive away. You have access to my entire home and garden. I am always accessible, and happy to help you out in any way possible. The neighborhood is called Crown Hill, and it's very close to Greenwood, Fremont, and Ballard neighborhoods. It's also close to Golden Gardens beach and Carkeek Park. The 28E and D-line buses are within a 7-minute walk,
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is called Crown Hill, and it's very close to Greenwood, Fremont, and Ballard neighborhoods. It's also close to Golden Gardens beach and Carkeek Park.

name: Latona Penthouse Suite with A/C and Parking
description: Experience Seattle oasis living in our in-city, Wallingford neighborhood, beautifully renovated (completed in May 2018), Mid-century modern, 1300 SF, completely private, top floor unit of our duplex. The Penthouse Suite is just 3.5 miles from Amazon & Downtown & 1.2 miles from the University of Washington (main campus). We have specifically designed this entire top floor penthouse suite with Airbnb guests in mind with Air Conditioning, keypad suite access, double pane windows and parking. We have Air Conditioning throughout the unit and dedicated parking spot (both are rare in Seattle).  The penthouse suite was designed with an open-floor concept where the kitchen, living room and dining room flow seamlessly. The flooring is a luxury wood-like plank flooring, with carpet in bedrooms. The unit is located on the 2nd floor with 15 steps and has its own private keypad access. Enjoy a seasonal peek-a-boo view of downtown Seattle.   The master bedroom has a king size bed with a Tempur-Pedic
neighborhood_overview: Wallingford is a hip, walkable neighborhood!  The guest suite is within walking distance to numerous coffee shops, bars and restaurants (it is an uphill walk for about 5 blocks, then it is a fairly flat walk).   We are 1.5 miles away from University of Washington or 8 mins drive, Sea-Tac airport is about 18 miles away or 21 mins drive, Safeco Field stadium is 6.1 miles away or about 10 mins drive.  We are within walking distance to Lake Union (3 blocks away), Gasworks park via the Burke Gilman Trail (about 10 blocks away). The Amazon Headquarters main campus is about 3 miles away.
transit: We are located just 1.5 blocks from the Line 26 bus stop.  This bus will get you downtown (Pike Place Market, Westlake Center) within about 15 minutes.  We are located just ½ block away from Line 32 (this line will get you to the Seattle Center/Space Needle), also within about 15 minutes.

We equip our apartments with everything you'll need for your home away fr

name: ★ Couple's Getaway ★ Walk Score 99 \| Near Stadiums
description: At the top of Pioneer Square our apartment is near Safeco and CenturyLink Stadiums, International District, Pikes Place Market, Amazon HQ and Convention Center.  Near coffee shops, restaurants and nightlife.   This is a great spot for anyone visiting Seattle! Check out the recommendations in our house manual - "get lost" tour & "guide to local breweries" tour.  Keep in mind we are in a very lively neighborhood and you will get street noise. 1 bedroom layout with a full bathroom and a good sized kitchen with all the basics,  including fresh local coffee! Our guest have access to the full apartment as well as the laundry room. Make yourself at home! We love to show off Seattle when in the area and have a very detailed guide book for when we are out of town. Pioneer Square and the International District are vibrant and lively neighborhoods with endless choices of coffee shops, bars, restaurants, a pinball arcade bar,  historical landmarks, and other activities. Our building is located rig
neighborhood_overview: Pioneer Square and the International District are vibrant and lively neighborhoods with endless choices of coffee shops, bars, restaurants, a pinball arcade bar,  historical landmarks, and other activities. Our building is located right in the middle of all the action and walking distance to just about anywhere you would want to go in downtown Seattle.  We are in a great location if you are looking to go to Century Link Field, Safeco Field, Experience Music Project, Seattle Center, or Lake Union. We are also only a few blocks from the Seattle Convention Center. We love the people and the bustle of our neighborhood.   It's also nice to have an apartment that does not let in the noise of the city.   In addition to a grocery store about a 10 min walk away there are 2 nice convenience stores across the street.
transit: *Everything is walkable!  *We are big fans of Uber or Lyft * 10min walk to light rail which will get you around the city and to the SeaTac airport *Several bus stops within a few blocks *Main bus hub a few blocks away, good for getting out of the city

name: Cozy Uptown Oasis W/Stunning Views of Elliott Bay
description: Our charming apartment is located in the heart of the historic Queen Anne neighborhood, one of the oldest neighborhoods in Seattle. The apartment is close to downtown and walking distance to Seattle Center, the Space Needle and Kerry Park. A one minute walk to the number 1 bus line takes you directly downtown. The apartment also features stunning views of Elliott Bay, a large kitchen, spacious living room with cable, Wifi and plenty of space to relax and unwind after a full day of exploring! Our spacious apartment has high ceilings, beautiful views of Puget Sound and turn of the century charm. We're walking distance from some amazing restaurants in the Queen Anne neighborhood but if you'd like to stay in, we have a fully stocked kitchen with everything you need to prepare a delicious meal. Our apartment sits at the end of a quiet residential street but there are several bars and restaurants that are in walking distance or a short bus ride away. Our entire apartment is yours! Queen Anne
neighborhood_overview: Queen Anne is the oldest neighborhood in Seattle and sits on the highest hill in the city. It is home to Kerry Park, one of the most famous parks in Seattle with its unmatched views of the Space Needle and the Seattle skyline.  There are restaurants, bars, grocery stores and nightlife at both the top and bottom of Queen Anne. Mid-way up Queen Anne hill, our apartment is walking distance to Seattle Center and the Space Needle and a short bus ride from downtown and the shopping district.
transit: Our apartment is located less than a 2 minute walk from the #1 bus line stop which takes you to Seattle Center and downtown Seattle.

name: Quiet West Seattle Apartment in Restored 1928 Craftsman
description: Get cozy in newly remodeled rooms decorated in soothing earth tones. High ceilings and plenty of windows make this basement-level hideaway feel spacious and bright. Enjoy close proximity to West Seattle's California Avenue and Alki Beach, and a short drive or water taxi trip to downtown Seattle. Have your morning coffee—or evening drinks—on the outdoor patio with gas fireplace when the weather's nice, or stay snuggled up and enjoy a rainy Seattle morning from your comfy bed.
neighborhood_overview: The house is on a charming residential street in West Seattle, close to Schmitz Park, Alki Beach, Alaska Junction, and Admiral Junction. It's a 10-minute walk to California Avenue restaurants and shops, as well as the historic Admiral movie theater. Taxis/Rideshares, public transportation (Rapid Ride C Line, the #57 Metro bus, or King County Water Taxi), or driving yourself are all easy and convenient transportation options from my home.
transit: Taxis/Rideshare: Uber/Lyft rideshare services are easily available across Seattle and you can usually get a ride from my house within 5 minutes.   Public Transportation: You can take the Rapid Ride C Line Metro bus at Alaska & California Avenue (20 minute walk from my home). On weekdays, the #57 Metro bus picks up across the street from the house and brings you to downtown Seattle from 5am-9am and returns you between 3pm-7pm.  Check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) for the most updated schedule details. Driving yourself: Driving is easy in West Seattle, and you can usually find free street parking anywhere you go in the neighborhood. You will have access to a free private parking space at my house.  You can drive to downtown Seattle and Capitol Hill in 20 minutes, University of Washington and Ballard in 30 minutes (Depending on traffic, of course! Try to avoid rush hours.)

name: Northwest Cottage
description: Located in the Haller Lake neighborhood, our backyard cottage is in the heart of north Seattle surrounded by a small forest of trees.  We are just 1 block from metro bus lines and a coffee shop, and just minutes from Northgate Mall and Northwest Hospital.  With easy access to I-5 and highway 99, downtown Seattle is an easy hop skip and a jump away from our little backyard getaway. Once you arrive, a garden path will bring you to a detached dwelling with a private entrance.  The Cottage is a one bedroom, ¾ bath with a small but fully functioning kitchen, and a washer/dryer.  You can relax on the private deck to enjoy a morning cup of coffee or an evening glass of wine.  We provide off-street parking for one vehicle.  The cottage comes with wifi, TV and Comcast cable. If you need a little morning kick-start, we have a Keurig coffee maker and a tea kettle, or you can wander over to the local coffee shop 1 block away. We are easy to reach via the AirBnb messaging app and we are always happ
neighborhood_overview: Nestled in the Haller Lake neighborhood of north Seattle, we are located just 4 blocks from Northwest Hospital and less than a mile from Northgate Mall.  We are within easy walking distance of coffee and restaurants.
transit: We have easy access to both I-5 and highway 99 and we are just one block from Metro bus stops.

name: Ballard getaway with entire downstairs for you
description: This is a Craftsman style home close to downtown Ballard, bus lines connecting to the rest of the city with a back deck for lounging. Perfect for travelers seeking a comfy, cool vibe. I have put a lot of work and effort into creating a welcoming environment.  I would like to think I gave a good sense of style.  Some interesting elements in my home are chalkboard walls in the dining room and a "green" wall with succulents in small pots on the ledges in the kitchen.  It has a working gas fireplace and many mid-century modern pieces throughout the house to pull it together.  The back deck is large enough to entertain and there's a BBQ for outdoor grilling. I have four raised beds in the front yard which are a work in progress.  Ultimately, you can decide how you feel about it. You will have access to all rooms in the house except my bedroom and office.  The entire downstairs will be yours while you are visiting.  You can just shut the door to the basement and I'll know you would like priv
neighborhood_overview: I'm sort of at the intersection of 3 neighborhoods - Ballard, Loyal Heights and Crown Hill.  I'm equidistant between downtown Ballard and Greenwood.  Both locations have wonderful coffee shops, restaurants and bars.  There are always people out walking around in the neighborhood during the daytime but there's great nightlife too.  In general, Ballard is pretty laid back.  You might notice a lot of hipster, techies roaming around too since it's not too far to South Lake Union and Amazon.
transit: My house is just around the corner from the bus lines that go into downtown.  There is a rapid ride bus called the "D" line you can take.  It's a two minute walk to 15th Ave where the buses are located.  There's plenty of free street parking out front.

name: Stunning views in spacious, historic home
description: Spacious, bright apartment with the best views of the bay and sunset in historic home. Your own huge and private guest suite on upper level, plus use of main area, as we are usually away during your stay. Our Subaru Forester is rentable on Getaround. Small pets ok. 25 min drive to airport; 12 min walk to light rail; 10 min drive to downtown. Access to running trails, parks, restaurants, and cafes. Free street parking. People of all backgrounds welcome! Chinese, French, Spanish spoken. Seattle's most hip and diverse neighborhood! Walkable and tons of food/entertainment within short walk or drive.  Huge and private space! The apartment is located on second floor, and it takes up the entire second and third floors of the house. There are four other units in the house, and the tenants are friendly and mind their own business.  We will likely not be in apartment during your stay and you are welcome to enjoy the living, dining and kitchen area. You're welcome to coffee, tea, cooking implemen
neighborhood_overview: North Beacon Hill is a diverse, richly historic, and friendly neighborhood where hole in the wall Mexican restaurants are cheek to cheek with hipster poke places. Multiple coffee/tea hangouts, proximity to the International District with tons of amazing East and Southeast Asian restaurants.
transit: We are centrally located! There are lots of buses, and the International District is within walking distance. It's a quick drive/Uber to Sea-Tac (20-25 min), downtown Seattle (10 min), and Capitol Hill (10 min). The Beacon Hill light rail station is a 12 minute walk south.

name: Beautiful Custom-Built Home in Fremont
description: Gorgeous modern light-filled home in upper Fremont with lovely mountain and city views. 3 floors, spacious and green-built with comfortable beds and huge, tiled bathrooms. Radiant in-floor heat. Unbeatable amenities and central location. Seattle's vibrant upper Fremont neighborhood, with fine local dining just blocks away! Stroll, bike, or run at Greenlake's nearby 3-mile trail. Easy access to Hwy 99 or public transit for South Lake Union, downtown, and Pike Place Market. Close to UW & I-5. Beautiful, custom designed home, built 2007 by us with a local builder focused on  environmentally sustainable materials. Certified BuiltGreen. Three floors, but this is no townhouse! It is a large, immaculate home with bamboo floors  and reclaimed maple throughout. New couches and armchairs (not pictured), high-quality beds.  Master bedroom king bed features organic latex mattress topper. Additional sleeping area in 3rd floor loft features organic Soaring Heart futon with mattress topper. Two clawf
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Fremont, affectionately know as The Center of The Universe. Seattle is a city of neighborhoods, and Fremont is among the best of them. There's always something going on in Fremont, like the solstice day parade, Octoberfest, and the Sunday market.
transit: From this location, it's easy to get around by foot, car, bike, or bus. There are several restaurants, coffee shops, and a local grocery store within a few blocks. If you're driving, the house has off-street parking for one large car or two smaller ones. Highway 99, the quickest route to downtown, is a few blocks away, and I-5 is about 10 minutes away. The neighborhood has bike lanes, and it's close to the 27-mile-long Burke-Gilman trail, a popular biking route. It's a quick trip to downtown on the #5 bus. There are bus stops on nearby Fremont Ave.

description: Our home went under expensive renovation in 2018.  Located minutes away from downtown Seattle, this classic charm home meets modern updates with easy access to the Light Rail Station, I-5, shopping, and restaurants. Perfect for work or weekend retreat! This listing is for the top two floors our house. The basement is a separate Airbnb listing (Jefferson Park Cozy) and may be available to book as well. Our house is conveniently located.  The bus stops right in front of the house, so if you don't have a car, transportation is not a problem!  Our house went through major remodeling in 2018, so everything is brand new!  :)  We also provide some food items such as fruits, bread, eggs (from our own chicken), sweets, water, coffee, tea, etc. The house has a two parts!  The main house and a basement unit.  There is a door that separates the basement to the main house.  The basement unit is also an AirBnb but everything is separated.  You will not have to worry about sharing anything with the b
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful 52-acre Jefferson Park and Golf Course are right up the street!
transit: There are several bus lines near our house.  Buses stopping near our house are 36, 50, 60 and 107.   Link light rail-Beacon Hill station is about 11 minutes walking distance.

description: Luxury 1 bdr, 1 1/2 bath condo in the heart of Belltown with views of sculpture park, Elliott Bay, & Olympic Mountains. Amenities include concierge, community rooftop deck with panoramic views & gym. Unit has private balcony & numerous upgrades. Luxury 1 bdr, 1 1/2 bath fully furnished and decorated condo in the heart of Belltown available for minimum 30 day bookings. Numerous upgrades! 864 sq ft 12th floor with views of sculpture park, Elliott Bay, and Olympic Mountains. Close to paved biking and running paths, restaurants, and nightlife. Walking distance to downtown and Seattle Center. Gourmet kitchen, bedroom has en suite bath, 1/2 bath off living area. Balcony, bamboo floors, custom entertainment center with premium Bose sound system, and w/d in unit. Secure building amenities include 24 hour concierge service, community rooftop deck with panoramic views and barbecues, and workout room.  Equal distance to Pike Place Market and The Space Needle (approximately 6 blocks). As much as n

transit: One block from bus transit.  Easy access to the 99/route to airport.

name: Craftsman Comfort - Your Seattle Base Camp
description: The perfect base camp for any Seattle adventure. Spacious 1,000+ square foot apartment in the center of the city, near Capitol Hill, Downtown, the Stadiums with easy access to all the city has to offer. This neighborhood lower level apartment in our family home has charm and all the comforts of home. With one queen bed room, one full sized bed room area off the living room, and a comfy couch we can accommodate individuals, small groups, and it is a great spot for families. This 1000+ square foot lower level apartment in our family home is light filled and has all the touches of home. You have the apartment all to yourself with no shared space. We live upstairs but the apartment is completely separate.  There is a small deck and you have access to the front and side yard. We live upstairs and are always available if something comes up. Our apartment is the lower level of our family home. If you hear us upstairs and it is bothering you please let me know and we will do the same. We are n
neighborhood_overview: We are near so much yummy food, great coffee, Seattle must sees and fun nightlife. Near Capitol Hill, Downtown and the stadiums this is a great quite spot with easy access to all of the fun Seattle has to offer. Nearby Restaurants, Coffee & Bars: Feed Co. Burgers, Union Coffee, Raised Doughnuts, Tacos Chukis, Twilight Exit, The Neighbor Lady, Meskel Ethiopian Restaurant & Fat's Chicken & Waffles. Shopping: Grocery Outlet is around the corner and there is a Safeway at 23rd and Madison.
transit: Check out ride share options with Lyft & Uber, the Seattle Streetcar goes to limited areas, Metro bus goes everywhere and the Link Light Rail is great for getting to and from the airport. Use the King County Metro Transit Trip Planner to connect all the dots.

name: 2BR Green Lake View Penthouse & Rooftop Deck
description: This beautiful 2BR Green Lake Penthouse Apartment in our guest house was fully updated in May 2017.  It is nearly 1,000 sq. ft. and features two bedrooms, a fireplace, a full kitchen, a comfy living room, a sofa-bed & a private rooftop deck with great lake views. We are just a short block from beautiful Green Lake, and walking distance to many great local restaurants, cafes, shops and outdoor activities, as well as a short drive (or longer walk) to the University of Washington and the Zoo. This penthouse is perfect for 4-5 people who want a residential retreat in a vital Seattle neighborhood with the option to prepare all of your meals in-house. The unit takes up the entire top floor of the building and has approximately 1,000 square feet of living space, plus a private 250SF rooftop deck.  Other amenities include Wifi, TV, Netflix streaming, heating, air conditioning, linens, full kitchen (stove, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, coffee and tea). Other Things to Note This private
neighborhood_overview: Seattle is among the most active cities in the U.S. and Green Lake is Seattle’s hub for recreation. Circling the lake is a 2.8 mile walking/running/wheels trail. The park also offers tennis and basketball courts, hiking trails, baseball and soccer fields, 9-iron golf course, public swimming pool and beaches, boat/kayak/paddle board rentals, and a theatre. The trail is also a great place for people watching and the best way to access many restaurants and shops lining the lake.
transit: Just around the corner from beautiful Green Lake Park, a 10-minute drive to Downtown Seattle, Fremont, Ballard, and the University of Washington, and right next to city bus stops. There is a lot to do within walking distance:  Six blocks to restaurants along the lake and a natural organic foods market, and less than a mile to the other nice Tangletown, Roosevelt, & Wallingford neighborhood centers.

name: Amazing Modern Water View 4, Space Needle. 98 WS
description: Enjoy breathtaking views of the Puget Sound, in your luxurious and comfortable home away from home. This ultra-modern one bedroom is located within short walking distance of Pike Place Market, the Space Needle, many shops, Amazon, and an exhaustive array of restaurants, conveniences and nightlife. This downtown luxury Seattle high-rise condo features modern amenities, stylish decor, and breathtakingly stunning views of the Puget Sound. This beautiful home is furnished with upscale modern furniture from one of the best local furniture stores, tastefully matched with warm colors complimenting the space. Modern fixtures and appliances seamlessly blend with the svelte lines of the furniture, combining the ultimate in form and function. Most importantly - the furniture is cozy and comfortable! Each night, you will enjoy my comfortable bedding atop a plush, comfortable premium mattress to ensure you sleep comfortably and wake up revitalized.  You will be on a high floor above the city, with
neighborhood_overview: You will be within short walking distance to Pike Place Market, the Space Needle, Amazon, many shops, as well as an exhaustive array of restaurants, conveniences and nightlife. This downtown Seattle high-rise condo features modern amenities, stylish decor, and breathtakingly stunning views of downtown Seattle and the Puget Sound. Belltown is one of Seattle most vibrant and trendiest neighborhoods; ripe with restaurants (Shiro's is two blocks away), coffee shops, retailers, and night life. It is a safe and well-located area. This neighborhood is perfectly situated for walking to destinations like the Pike Place Market, Seattle Aquarium, the Seattle Art Museum, the downtown shopping centers, Moore Theater, the Washington State Convention Center, and more!
transit: My home is extremely walkable to anything in downtown Seattle. Parking:  1) I have parking (subject to availability - it's popular!) in the building available for $20 per day 2) There is parking on the street which is free from 8:00 PM to 8:00 AM but is otherwise metered 3) There are nearby lots. They range from $19-$40 per day. Two of the more popular ones are - - Republic Parking is right around the corner (2610 1st Ave). It is ~$20 per day.  - Diamond Parking Services is a couple blocks south (US Bank Lot, 2401 3rd Ave). It is ~$25 per day. Walking: This home is within a short 5 minute walk of the Space Needle and short 10 minute walk of Pike Place. It is in the middle of nearly everything in downtown. It is within a 10 minute walk from Whole Foods and South Lake  Union. In general, you can easily walk anywhere you need to go within downtown. Public Transit: Public transit is excellent in Seattle. This home has easy access to all public transit.

name: Seattle "Sweet Suite" Cherry Hill
description: All ethnicities, genders, religions and sexualities are welcome. "Bed Baked and Beyond: Cherry Hill" is an elegant 1903 Victorian guest-house that features the Sweet Suite: a harem-like suite with an enormous bed, cloaked in reds and golds, with direct TV and a private bathroom. Romantic and whimsical. A 1903, Victorian home with plenty of modern comforts including Wifi. Our newly remodeled version has three beautiful vintage bathrooms with plenty of hot water--you'll never wait for a warm bath. To see our other beautiful bedrooms, click on our profile picture on the right, then scroll down on the left side :o The feeling of the first-floor harkens to a graceful, bye-gone era of calm retreat to the intoxication of thoughtful conversation with a stranger. Relax in the parlor, or the Lounge-room. Enjoy complimentary food and beverages in the formal dining room. Peruse our vinyl collection--our turntable works really well and KEXP is ready to tune in on the dial. For folks who would rathe
neighborhood_overview: Seattle's Cherry Hill neighborhood still reflects its beginnings in the Victorian-era architecture. Many homes were built by the fathers of the original families in the early 1900's, including this house.  Today, there are many distinct, ethnic groups living together in this down-home neighborhood. A happy outcome of this diversity is the food. Many authentic restaurants are walkable, from Ethiopian to American Soul-Food to Mediterranean to totally-hip taverns and bars with local, craft-beer and gourmet dishes.  If you love to exercise, there is a neighborhood pool, a YMCA, and many movement studios within walking/jogging distance. We have lived here for 33 years. We can point you in the right direction.
transit: Seattle has great public transportation and we are centrally located. Our home is two blocks from a Metro bus to downtown, and five blocks from a Metro bus to the University of Washington. We are a short cab-ride to downtown night-life, and to a Seattle Light Rail station to Sea-Tac airport. We are one block from a Zipcar parking location. Renting a car? We have ample, off-street parking.

name: Holgate Terrace Townhome Flat
description: This quiet and spacious ground-floor unit features 12' ceilings, keyless private entry and high-quality furnishings. It is completely private with 24/7 access. Downtown is only a 5 minute Uber/Lyft ride away! This 500 square foot unit is perfect for your next business trip or getaway to Seattle! Guests will be able to access the unit anytime day or night with a keyless access code. I am always available over text/phone/email. In order to be as flexible as possible in meeting our guests needs, I do not require meeting in person to check in or check out. Stroll through the Seattle Children's Playgarden or ride a bike on the I-90 trail over Lake Washington. Located just a few minutes south of downtown Seattle, you'll find free & easy neighborhood parking as well as easy access to bus lines into downtown. Check in is at 1pm.  Check out is at 11am.

name: The Farmhouse at Greenlake
description: Beautiful home in the heart of Greenlake.  2-mins walking to bus lines, grocery store, Greenlake.  My home was built in 1906 so has old Seattle charm.  This is a very good place for artists, musicians, travelers, students, and all other walks of life.  Everyone is welcome here.  Take a look at the photos of my home.  This will tell you very much about the personality and atmosphere of the life in this house.  Please make sure that you fit with the vibe of my home.  This is good for both of us. Beautiful original Greenlake Farmhouse.  This home was built in 1906.  This home provides immediate access to Greenlake.  The lake is across the street.  There is a walking/running path around the lake.  It is within walking distance to many grocery stores, bars, bus lines and 15-mins from the University of Washington. If you stay with me you have full home access.  This includes living room, kitchen, both bathrooms.  There is private parking for 1-car. Please note :: During summer months my home
neighborhood_overview: This is a very beautiful neighborhood.  This area is perfect for runners, walkers, joggers and people who love being outside.  Greenlake is the Central Park of Seattle.
transit: There are two bus lines within 2-mins of my home.  Transportation to and from my house is very easy.

name: Pioneer Square Loft overlooking 1st AVE.
description: Vintage Pioneer Square Loft in the heart of old Seattle.  Very lively neighborhood with plenty of history.  One block from the water front.  Great place to enjoy the city. Is a very large open space with a loft area. Main bed is under the loft with a separate space above. The property has laundry facility in the basement. The neighborhood is lively. Keep in mind that this is the oldest part of Seattle.  It would be Some days the place would be equivalent to the Tenderloin district in SFO  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Central Parking is the cheapest and close.  Otherwise the neighborhood has street parking that is free from 6pm to 8am M-Sat Free on Sunday. Best way to pay for street parking is via App : PaybyPhone Note we do have constructions from our Tunnel project impacting all of Downtown Seattle.  The apartment is above some of the oldest Bars in Seattle built in the 1900 they do have live music with makes the neighborhood lively.

name: New Bright Studio on Capitol Hill-Amazing Rooftop
description: Conveniently located in one of Seattle's coolest neighborhoods -- Capitol Hill. This professionally designed studio welcomes you with great guest experience and amenities that will surely make your stay enjoyable! You’ll definitely love our place for its comfy, tranquil urban ambiance, and ease to explore the entire city! Situated in Seattle's coolest neighborhood, this thoughtfully designed and expertly built studio boasts today's most sought-after features: Stainless appliances, quartz countertops, full bathtub with in-home washer and dryer, Murphy bed, small gym, plus a private patio -- with stunning city and mountain views from the rooftop decks!  KITCHEN & DINING A fully stocked kitchen with a fridge, coffee maker, and other appliances providing you what you need when you get home! Feel free to use the pots, pans, and dishes, and help yourself to coffee, or tea. BATH The bathroom has a full bathtub. Stocked with our in-house amenity line fresh towels, soaps, & basic essentials to
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is one of Seattle’s coolest neighborhoods. It's a densely populated, residential district. It is one of the city's most prominent nightlife and entertainment districts and is the center of the city's LGBT and counterculture communities. It offers bars, brunch spots, and boutiques galore.  Some of our favorites! name: Basement Suite just blocks from Alki Beach!
description: Unwind and enjoy Alki / Seattle in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite!  We're new hosts on Airbnb and super excited to begin having guests stay at our clean and recently furnished guest space.  We live in the separate part of the house and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city! PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A BASEMENT UNIT.  It can get cool in the mornings and evenings.  Please plan accordingly.  Thank you. Enter through your own private entrance which includes a clean bedroom, private bathroom, living room area with sleeper sofa and coffee table, and small kitchenette with a mini-fridge and microwave. You will have access to the entire basement space, and back patio area. We live in the main part of the house, and respect your privacy but are available to answer questions if needed! You are only a couple of short blocks away from the Alki Beach area, where you'll find several great restaurants, bars, and coffee shops to choose from.  There a
neighborhood_overview: You are only a couple of short blocks away from the Alki Beach area, where you'll find several great restaurants, bars, and coffee shops to choose from.  There are also some local surf shops, bike rentals and Lime/Jump bike shares all around ... and of course, the beach!
transit: Parking is somewhat limited during the summer months, but there are plenty of public transportation options for getting around.  The 56 bus line will take you to downtown Seattle.  The King County Water Taxi Seacrest dock is about a mile from Alki, and also another great option for getting downtown.

name: A16: Cozy space in perfect Capitol Hill location
description: Clean, simple, and comfortable one-bedroom apartment in wonderful Capitol Hill location. This apartment complex is located on a safe and beautiful, tree-lined  street just one block away from Volunteer Park, one of Seattle's oldest and most majestic parks. Within easy walking distance to Broadway Avenue, home to many of Seattle's best bars, cafes, restaurants, and dance clubs. Also close to major bus lines that will take you directly to UW, South Lake Union, and Downtown Seattle. This is an approximately 400SF 1-bedroom apartment with a small bedroom, living room, and kitchen. It's a great option for 1-2 guests who plan to share a bed and who want to be centrally-located in Seattle. Guests will have access to the entire apartment. There is an onsite, coin-operated laundry room that is available for use. I am a local host who lives just a few minutes away from the building. I am happy to provide recommendations upon request, and am very responsive to messages and requests. The Adamson i
neighborhood_overview: The Adamson is located within a five-minute walk of the Volunteer Park neighborhood, which is one of the most desirable residential areas in all of Seattle. The quiet, tree-lined streets surrounding our building boast some of the city's oldest mansions and craftsman homes. Our location is also within very close proximity (a long stroll or quick bus/Uber ride) of Broadway Avenue, home to endless restaurants, shops, grocery stores, cafes, bars, and theaters.
transit: We are fortunate to be located in a very central and walkable part of Capitol Hill with plenty of nearby public transportation options. The light rail station is about half a mile from our building (connects to multiple neighborhoods and destinations, including Seatac airport, downtown Seattle, and University of Washington). There are several bus lines with stops just a block away. PARKING: If you choose to drive, please note that we do not offer onsite parking, as all of our spaces are already reserved for our residents. However, we do have free 4-hour STREET parking available on our block and the surrounding neighborhood. The 4-hour time limit only applies between 7am - 8pm on Monday through Saturday. This simply means that you must move your car to a different space on the street (again, only between the hours of 7am - 8pm) if you intend to stay parked beyond four hours. The parking time limit does NOT apply on evenings after 8pm or on Sundays and federal holidays.

name: Crown on the Hill ★ Columbia City Craftsman Home
description: Gather and feast in this historic craftsman home with original features and woodwork, modern furnishings with special vintage touches! With a walk score of 92, you’re within walking distance to an international mix of restaurants and cafes, near the light rail for a convenient ride to downtown and stadiums. Hang out in a lush backyard garden and BBQ (grill is provided) - so buy that market fish! Take your shoes off, put your feet up and relax in a classic home with 4 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms (approximately 1600 sq. ft) is perfect for families and friends to gather. The living room has a large couch that is perfect for a group to lounge, chat, watch Netflix and nestle by the fire. The large kitchen is an  inviting space to congregate with a dining room to seat 6 people. Be at home at our Crown on the Hill Craftsman Home.  Cheers! This house has 2 housing units. There is a connected basement unit below, its entrance is not accessible from the main house but there is a shared ceiling/floo
neighborhood_overview: Our house is nestled in between the two historic downtowns of Columbia City and Hillman City. Come check out this diverse and vibrant spot just south of the more well known Columbia City neighborhood. Hillman City has its local favorites in its own downtown with coffee shops like The Tin Umbrella and fun bar Slow Boat Tavern. We are also butted up close to beautiful parks like Seward Park, Lake Washington and the Kubota Gardens.
transit: Getting around is so easy from the house! The light rail is a 10 minute walk through Columbia City's downtown (swing by the bakery for a snack!). The bus (no.7) is a 3 minute walk just down the street.  Downtown is a 20 minute train  or 35 minute bus north. Lake Washington/Seward Park is a 12-18 minute jog East. Hillman City's downtown is 2 blocks away and Columbia city downtown is a 7 minute walk.

name: Remodeled Craftsman House- Ravenna
description: Newly remodeled two bedroom house in fun part of Seattle.  Walking distance to Lake Washington, Greenlake, University of Washington.  Close to bike path.  Interesting coffee shops, bakeries, bookstores nearby.  Easy access to downtown. Newly remodeled kitchen, comfortable living room, dining room.  Craftsman style, lots of open space.  Two bedrooms upstairs, master bedroom has queen bed, one with single bed.  Lots of available closet space in master.  Hardwood floors. Full first and second floor of house.  Basement rented out as compete separate apartment with private entrance.  Tenant quiet. Rental is for full house (upper unit).  This is a furnished house that is lived in during the non-rental periods.  My things are put away.  I am out of town during the rental period but am reachable by cell if needed for any reason.  The key will be provided by a lock box. Quirky, fun, quiet Seattle neighborhood. Easy access to bus and Birk Gilman bike trail.  Freemont, Wallingford, University Dis
neighborhood_overview: Quirky, fun, quiet Seattle neighborhood.
transit: Easy access to bus and Birk Gilman bike trail.  Freemont, Wallingford, University District, Ballard all close by.  10 minutes to downtown.

name: Private  Retreat in the City
description: Our tranquil, light filled 1 bedroom, fully furnished mother in law unit feels like you are in the country but really just 2 miles from the heart of Seattle. Very walk-able neighborhood, 1 block from 4 different bus lines, 40 steps to beautiful park. This is street parking only but never has been an issue to find parking This home boast  a 12 foot sliding glass door that gives you the feeling you are outside when in. For those who appreciate the more industrial feeling, it has finished radiant heated concrete floors. During the summer, it remains cool because of the Tree that shades the unit during the hot..ok, really warm summer days. ;-). It is approximately 600 sq feet with additional private deck and patio space. This is a unit that is behind my current home, completely separate home so very private and no interactions required unless you see me working on the yard. The bed is a queen size bed that is brand new. Fully stocked kitchen for those who want to keep expenses down and coo
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is my ideal neighborhood.  It boast a range of homes from old homes to the new contemporary homes. You will see people running (no not from someone...;-) ) walkinig their dogs, to riding their bikes. It has the feel of a small town suburban neighborhood and yet, in the heart of the city. Within blocks there are spectacular views that take your breath away as you see the majestic Mt Rainier peak above the clouds and seem so close you can touch it. This home is on the ridge so it boast views of the city skyline, Bellevue skyline, Lake Washington, and Puget Sound. You will be literally a 7 min walk to Lake Washington, or like I said earlier 40 steps to jumping on the the Park that is over I-90. You can even walk from this park over to Mercer Island across the I-90 bridge over Lake Washington.
transit: Easy to get around. The Bus routes that are within easy walking distance are #14, #4, #8 and the #27 The first 3 would take you 2 to 4 minutes to walk but #27 is about a 9 min walk.

name: Beautiful, private waterfront beach duplex on Alki
description: Enjoy a quiet, romantic experience on a private section of Alki beach!   Two bedroom/two bathroom, beautifully remodeled home. State of the art kitchen, high speed internet/cable TV. Heated bathroom floors. European linens. Fall asleep to the sounds of Puget Sound, Grill and eat outside as you watch seals, Orcas, and sunsets on the water, or watch the moon rise in the morning over coffee. Catch salmon in season off the deck! Coffee, restaurants, ice cream and more just steps away. The duplex is a piece of Alki history that's been carefully and lovingly remodeled with state of the art appliances. The entire lower unit is available to you (upper unit not available). Beautiful wooden floors, cozy furniture and lots of upgrades to enjoy. Take your coffee on the deck and snuggle up in the living room. Watch movies and take naps to the sounds of the water. The master bedroom features a Westin king-size Heavenly bed and a huge closet with lots of hangers and plenty of space. The second bedroo
neighborhood_overview: Alki Beach is a relaxed Seattle community with warm, friendly neighbors. There are wonderful places to eat and drink and explore. "Eddie the Eagle" is known for nesting in the beautiful tree-lined park and is frequently spotted fishing.
transit: There is a water taxi at the other end of Alki which is $4.75. It's a beautiful 10-minute boat ride to downtown waterfront Seattle. Two-minute walk to downtown shops and restaurants and Pike Place market.  Schedules will be available in the unit as well as bus schedules, information about light rail and more. If you have a car there is off-street parking available.

name: Gorgeous Alki Beach Waterfront Home!
description: Enjoy breath-taking views of Puget Sound & the Olympic mountains from every room of our newly built West Seattle waterfront home! This bright open space is well appointed with 2 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, an open concept kitchen, dining, living room with walkout balcony, a  laundry room and a spectacular private rooftop deck. The sunsets over the Olympics will rejuvenate your spirit! Our home is situated right on the water front looking out on to Puget Sound and the Olympic mountains.  The 4 mile board walk is right out your front door taking you to Alki Beach.  You will be in a beach community with just a 15 minute drive to downtown Seattle.  Or enjoy all of the local amenities that West Seattle has to offer! Guests will have access to the entire unit - this is not a shared space.  This includes 2 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, kitchen, living, dining room, and private roof top deck. Always available by phone, text and email during guests stay. Should an emergency arise requiring on site assi
neighborhood_overview: Our home is a short 5 minute walk along the waterfront to Alki Beach where you can enjoy local dining, shopping,  breweries and coffee shops.  You can access a 4 mile path right out your front door for biking, jogging, walking, and roller blading. The bus stop is 6 steps from your door, transporting you at no cost to the nearby West Seattle foot ferry.  From there you can purchase a ticket to enjoy a beautiful 10 minute ferry ride to downtown Seattle where you'll find great shopping, theatre, restaurants, museums, Pike Place Market, the Aquarium and so much more!
transit: The West Seattle foot ferry to downtown Seattle is close by.  The bus stop taking you to the ferry is right outside your front door!

name: The Fireplace Room, 10 min drive to downtown
description: This seven bedroom shared house is located in the University District. The UD is home to some of the best coffee shops, movie theaters, bookshops, and ethnic restaurants in Seattle.  Your private room is spacious, clean, peaceful, and comfortable. The house is only a few blocks away from the University, and 10 minutes drive to Downtown, by car or Uber. Parking is available on the street.  The host does not live on site and room keys are available by request. Your room is located on the main floor to the left of the staircase. It is the bedroom on the left. It is furnished with a full bed, a chair, private access to the front porch, closet space with hangers, and a small fan.   The bathroom is downstairs on the basement level. Take the hallway to the right of the staircase. Follow the stairs to the left away from the kitchen. The bathroom is at the foot of the stairs. The light switch is on the outside of the door on the left-hand side. There are 3 rooms that share this bathroom. Please
neighborhood_overview: "The University district neighborhood is amazing. Alive with different types of people throughout the year.  A multitude of restaurants and shops plus amazing proximity to downtown Seattle and other popular local neighborhoods.  The North entrance to the University of Washington is just 2 blocks south & University Way is also just 2 blocks west of our location. Super easy public transportation in and out of the area makes the UD a prime location."
transit: "There are a multitude of ways to travel to our location; Easiest is to drive, take UBER or a Taxi  (parking is on the street) There are also many buses within a few blocks of the house; one is the 70 to downtown. There is a resource manual on the desk in the living room. * FROM AIRPORT* - rental car or taxi  - light rail to downtown (convention center stop within tunnel) - transfer to bus:(#72, #72x, or other) (depending on day & time) - depart bus within just a few blocks of our location no matter which bus you take. All busses to downtown take only 30min depending on traffic. The trip by car from the airport can take 30-60min depending on traffic if you drive. The light rail takes about 30min to reach downtown from the airport.

name: Private Room #4 amongst Seattle's finest amenities
description: Top floor bedroom in a welcoming neighborhood in majestic Seattle! The room is located in the crux of many of the best amenities that the city has to offer! Easy walk to fabulous shops and restaurants on 45th Street and multiple parks. Straight shot off I-5 and drive to downtown in 10 minutes.  Doorstep bus line to Downtown in 30 minutes, and to the University of Washington in 15 minutes. 시애틀에 있는 월링포드(Wallingford)에 위치한 깨끗한 집입니다. 시애틀 도심과 많은 관광명소가 10분정도의 운전으로 가능한 곳입니다. Your room is in the top floor of a two story building. You will be sharing the house with the host and another guest, so it'll be most similar to a roommate situation. Hardwood floors with new coat of interior paint. Shared bathrooms are cleaned frequently. Entrance is on the side of the building with one flight of stairs. - Self check-in via keypad lock on the doorknob up one flight of stairs - Along with your bedroom, you’ll have access to the whole top floor, the bathrooms, kitchen and living room - Check-in time anytim
neighborhood_overview: The building is located on the north end of the beautiful, and very walkable (walk score 86), neighborhood of Wallingford. Wallingford is known for its quaint character, emphasized by the many craftsman homes among its tree-lined streets. There is something for everyone in the hood; families, couples, night life, active lifestyles, artists and much more! Highlight nearby sites of interest include...  45th Street - Restaurants and Shops Tangletown - Restaurants and Shops Green Lake Park Woodland Park Zoo - FREE ADMISSION FOR ONE University of Washington Gas Works Park Closest grocery store is the Quality Food Center (QFC) on 45th and Wallingford Ave, a pleasant 7 minute stroll away.
transit: - Most of the above attractions can be reached by foot or a ~$10 Uber or Lyft - Downtown can be reached by car in 10 minutes, or by a direct bus line (#62) that can take you to downtown in 30 minutes.  - Bikes shares all around, with Limebike being the most prevalent

name: Pleasant room near UW
description: A well-appointed private bedroom in a residential neighborhood near the University of Washington. Amenities include kitchen privileges, breakfast, TV room, fast wi-fi and hot tub. There are frequent buses, or a pleasant 20 minute walk, to the University. Capitol Hill and Downtown are convenient via light rail, bus, or Uber/Lyft. This beautiful home in the fashionable Montlake district is located between two of the nicest parks in Seattle, Interlaken and the Arboretum, with numerous trails for running, walking or biking. The home features tastefully appointed bedrooms, inviting dining room, a media/hang-out room for reading or visiting, and an updated kitchen for meals in.  All bedrooms have a lock for privacy. Breakfast items such as cereal and yogurt are set out in the morning. The University is a 20 minute walk or a short bus ride away. The University of Washington light rail station connects to vibrant Capitol Hill or Downtown in minutes. A Lyft to most tourist attractions costs aro
neighborhood_overview: Montlake is a fashionable residential neighborhood of older homes located just south of "the cut," the boat canal bordering the University of Washington campus. Nearby Interlaken Park is a tranquil wilderness area hidden in the middle of a bustling city. And the Arboretum, with its Japanese Garden and other attractions, is perfect for your daily run or a pleasant stroll. Another nearby favorite is Volunteer Park with its Asian Art Museum and Victorian botanical conservatory. A small commercial area just up the street includes our local coffee shop, a neighborhood urban bar, and a popular Italian restaurant.
transit: The new University of Washington light rail station is one mile north of the house. This connects to Capitol Hill, Downtown, Pioneer Square and the Airport. Two bus lines, #48 and #43, pass in front of the house. The #48 runs frequently going north through the University District and south down the 23rd Ave. artery connecting with buses to Capitol Hill, Downtown and the Space Needle. The #43 operates during commuter hours with stops throughout the Capitol Hill and Downtown areas. Uber and Lyft are popular alternatives to public transit and often less expensive. For most guests, a rental car is not necessary or recommended.

name: Beacon Hill home fit for a family
description: Feel at home while you're on vacation! Welcome! This fully equipped home is only a 15 minutes drive to Downtown Seattle. The home is 3,000 sq. ft. with lots of privacy in each area of the house. The backyard is amazing. You won't want to leave. The house is bright and breezy. Enjoy dining outside underneath the pergola, throw a steak on the Weber grill, and relax.  You'll be close to the city, but away from the hustle and bustle. The home and neighborhood are very family friendly. And you won't have to fight for parking!  Note that this is our home that we share with our baby and English Bulldog. Although we will make sure you have plenty of space for your things, our personal belongings will still be left in the house. Details: - 3,000 sq. ft. - 3 bedrooms/2.5 baths - Formal living room upstairs - Large TV/rec room downstairs - Bonus room in the attic with sofa bed - One king bed - One queen bed - Crib and Rock n Play Amenities: - New washer and dryer - Fully equipped kitchen with new
neighborhood_overview: Beacon Hill is a very unique part of Seattle. Perched up above the city with views of Downtown, Elliot Bay, SODO, and the Industrial District.  Also home to the best Indian restaurant I've ever been to, Thali House. It's about a one mile walk down to the bars, restaurants, and shops in Georgetown. The neighborhood is very accessible from all parts of the city. Enjoy Jefferson Park, Jefferson Park Golf Course, and many bike paths.
transit: There are two Light Rail stations nearby (Columbia City and Beacon Hill). However, a car or bicycle would be the best way to get around. There is a bus that picks up just a few blocks away from the house, which will get you to Capitol Hill in 25 minutes. We're also just 10 miles from Seattle-Tacoma Airport.

name: Columbia City Suite
description: Our cool and comfortable basement suite perfect for 2 people wanting a weekend get away or to explore the most diverse zip code in the country! Great location-close to downtown Seattle and only a 12 min walk to Columbia City, light rail and public transportation. Apartment is fully furnished with king bed, new kitchen appliances +Kurig coffee maker, living room with with flat screen TV, DVD, and WiFi. We live upstairs with our 2 kids (14 & 10) and our cats Jewels and Walnut. This space fits 2 adults very comfortably It's well lit and stays relatively cool in the summer and warm in the winter. The one and only time we needed to cancel a reservation was when we had an emergency plumbing issue. We gave the guest the option of staying without use of water (not ideal) and refund or cancel....they wanted to cancel and found another place! The issue was repaired and no further issues are expected. The apartment is all yours during your stay! It has a separate private entrance and is secured f
neighborhood_overview: We are located in South Seattle (20 min car/uber ride to Space Needle) and just minutes from downtown Columbia City and the Light Rail Station (12min walk) or a few minutes by car. Columbia City is home to a brand new PCC Market, many restaurants (aka Restaurant Row), shops, a movie cinema, library, live music and more! This is the most diverse zip code in the country!
transit: Walk, bike, drive, light rail (station within 12min walk), bus, (stops within 5 min walk), taxi, Uber.

name: Private apartment in Seattle
description: A beautiful apartment on the ground floor. Pathway leads to an outdoor patio and private entrance to spacious living area with lots of light. Perfect jumping off point to see the city. 2 miles to UW and Children's Hospital, 10 minutes to downtown! Apartment includes a living area with a futon couch and T.V. This is a one bedroom apartment, best suited for 2 or a small family. It is possible to sleep 4 (pre-approval required).  Add $25 for a fourth adult.  There is a bathroom with shower. There is a small kitchenette area that includes a microwave, mini fridge, electric water heater, coffee press, and toaster, everything that you need for snacks and essentials. The bedroom has a queen bed. The outdoor patio space is equipped with table and chairs. There is street parking available and a private entrance along a pathway on the side of house. The pathway leads to private patio and apartment entrance. Guests have a lockbox with key.  The upstairs unit is separate. Be aware that the family
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is in a great location. It is a residential, family oriented, quiet community that is friendly and welcoming.
transit: We are on a dead end quiet street that is located just above Lake City Way with easy access to freeways and public  bus transportation within walking distance.

name: Stunning views of Elliott Bay & Olympic Mountains
description: Concierge, onsite amenities and onsite restaurants to splurge yourself. Surrounded by snow-capped mountain peaks, deep-blue waters and swaths of evergreen forests, Seattle is as wild as it is trendy. My place puts you in the heart of the city’s downtown, with the Seattle Art Museum on one side, iconic Pike Place Market on another and the waters of Elliott Bay gleaming to the west. Head out to explore eclectic neighborhoods and craft breweries. Come nightfall, enjoy all the best local flavors. Ceiling-to-floor windows to take in the stunning views of the Puget Sound, Elliott Bay and the Olympic Mountains, a private balcony, king and queen adjustable beds with memory foam mattresses, cotton bedding, small appliances, and a variety of gourmet coffees. You deserve the best! We do sleep 8, but 6 adults max please. Also, we do not have any sleeper sofas, but provide a queen sized airbed with linens. Hands down, one of the best places to stay in Seattle, offering everything a high-end hotel c
neighborhood_overview: You are only a few steps to most of Seattle's attractions. Enjoy Seattle’s underground history, Mount Rainier is a day trip, enjoy the fresh mountain air hiking or biking through the many trails that are available. Take a Cruise of the harbor or catch a Sports game. You can skip renting a car, just ride the light rail from the airport to Benaroya Concert Hall.
transit: You can skip renting a car, just ride the light rail from the airport to Benaroya Concert Hall a block away. Lyft and Uber are a convenient way of getting around Seattle because of the limited parking.

name: Secret Garden Oasis Beckons.  Great Amenities.
description: Comfy captain’s bed in a home, in the heart of beautiful Ballard, WA.  The private room (please note: room is small) and bath, walks out onto a secluded covered outdoor living space overlooking an intimate and peaceful garden.  My guests say they sleep well.  Easy walk to restaurants, shops and some great local breweries.   Ballard is an urban community. The room is small, but has all the amenities you need.  My guests often tell me  how comfortable the bed is and how much they appreciate the outdoor patio and my garden.  They also mention they like the privacy and cleanliness of the room and bath.   I use recycled furniture to promote eco-friendly practices.   The bed is a large twin, and I can put a fold-out cot in for a 2nd person.  It will be tight with 2 people but if lower cost and location is most desired, it's workable as you can fold up the cot during the day.  I had guests asking for this option so added it to my offer. Key less front door entry to my home.  You walk down hal
neighborhood_overview: Ballard is a destination point in Seattle, with a walk ability rating of 90%.  You can walk to well over 75  local restaurants, plus a large number of fun local shops, or spend the day at Golden Gardens, a beach area (20-25 minute walk).  The Hiram Locks are only 3 blocks away from my home and a bus ride gets you into downtown Seattle or the Space Needle in 25 minutes.  There are local bike rental places, and access to bike trails that takes you up north around Lake Washington.  Another bike trail takes you right onto the Seattle waterfront and our famous Pike’s Street Market.  Ballard even has its own beautifully restored movie theater, plus lots of other local attractions.  My home is a mere block from the water.
transit: Parking is available on the street and you can typically find a space close to my house, but note this is an urban neighborhood and sometimes my guests have to find parking further away.  There is a rapid  ride bus that takes you into Seattle where you can easily transfer to another bus and go most everywhere.   There are several local bus lines you can catch (one right across the street that goes downtown), or others a few block walk that take you to University District, North and also downtown, including one that takes you close to the Space Needle.  If you desire a guaranteed parking spot one of my town home neighbors is open to renting her spot for $5 per day, cash due at check in.  Car must be small to mid size only.

name: Domicile Suites at Marina SLU - 1BD 13
description: This beautiful modern apartment in the heart of Seattle's technology district, South Lake Union. Its amenities are designed to maximize natural light, fresh air, and comfort. Each unit is efficient, engaging, and fully wired for seamless access to everything you need.  Thoughtfully created indoor and outdoor spaces such as a roof deck with stunning views, a fitness center, media lounge with a pool table, and more offer numerous opportunities for contemplation and total relaxation. The apartment is in a high-end building, conveniently located near South Lake Union's technology center. With 24/7 guest support and concierge services, we combine a fully-furnished premium apartment with the consistent, high-quality experience and amenities that you expect from leading hotels. Expertly designed with customized furniture, the apartment's furnishings are stylish, contemporary and specifically tailored for this apartment. We equip our apartments with everything you'll need for your home away fr
neighborhood_overview: Located across from the South Lake Union marina these apartments are a short walk to some well known technology businesses nearby. You can also enjoy some nice open green spaces that are on the edge of South Lake Union.
transit: Car sharing services such as Uber and Lyft are also readily available as are on demand car rental services such as car2go and BMW Reach Now. Seattle is also known for having a large number of bike sharing services such as Lime Bike, ofo and Spin. Metro bus route #40 right in front on Westlake and the Seattle Streetcar is nearby.

name: Comfy Convenient Cap Hill - Downtown Clean Studio
description: Our fantastic apartment is located in stunning re-imagined building where Capitol Hill Meets Downtown. Walk to bars, restaurants, pubs and shopping! Visit the Market directly across the street for any food or drink items you may need. Explore the many nearby businesses. Totally Convenient for business travel, vacations, & short trips to the city! Welcome to Seattle. We look forward to hosting your stay! The Apartment is located in a unique community oriented Airbnb embracing building and features: Comfortable 13-inch Queen Size bed, Smart TV with HDMI cable, Fast WiFi, comfortable rocking chair, coffee, tea, cooking oil, shampoo, conditioner, towels, and anything else, please do ask! You'll have complete access to my place and the entire building which includes: large full size Chef's Kitchen, very large TV living room area, washer and dryer, bike storage, printer, WiFi throughout, and work/study room. My home is yours. You're my guest and I am here to make your visit to Capitol Hill a
neighborhood_overview: Explore Downtown - Pike's Place, Space Needle, parks, and Shopping. When it's time to feel the real Seattle, Capitol Hill is the place to be! The vibrant culture of Capitol Hill is comprised of musicians, artist’s young people, college students, couples, single people, and a very strong LGBT community. Harmonious diversity increases the richness of the neighborhood on your ventures you will find........ Bookstores - internet cafes - Ice cream shops and awesome and diverse food scene including: Vegan - Malay - East Chinese - Mexican - Thai - Japanese - Italian - American - Russian - Middle Eastern - Tex Mex - Burgers - Pizza – Ethiopian..... Don’t forget to visit the fabulous coffee shops! Bars, pubs, parks, art museums, abstract fountains, and more! Soak in great Architecture Many apartment buildings were built in the 1920’s and their characteristics have been carefully preserved. Because of this they have become some of the most treasured possessions in the city today!
transit: I'm so excited that the WalkScore for my place is 99! If you have somewhere to go and do not feel like walking - you will find dozens of bus lines within three blocks of the apartment. There are plenty of cab/Uber/Lyft services as well. Parking is mixed between free of charge and metered. There is also a parking garage 3 short blocks away.

name: Ballard Cottage Close to Everything!
description: Fabulous studio cottage, in the heart of Ballard. Located just three blocks from Market Street and Downtown Ballard. Great shops, restaurants and night life within blocks. Ballard Commons park is ½ a block away, and The Ballard Library is 1 ½ blocks. Walk Score of 97! Spacious studio in the heart of Ballard. My place is truly designed for your comfort, needs and has room to accommodate a small family. Full kitchen for the cook at heart or BBQ on the patio. Queen size bed and a full size sleeper couch. . French doors open to a fantastic private patio surrounded by trees and greenery. Before and during your stay, I’m available by cell, text or email to answer questions. Street parking only. Easy commuting distance to Downtown Seattle, Fremont, Green Lake. Close to bus lines. The kitchen is stocked with the basic cooking essentials. Water, tea and coffee available.
neighborhood_overview: Street parking only.
transit: Easy commuting distance to Downtown Seattle, Fremont, Green Lake. Close to bus lines.

name: Renovated bright 1 BR, Great UW/Ravenna location
description: Welcome to our completely remodeled, super comfy and well appointed garden level apartment in a beautiful old quiet and walkable residential Seattle neighbhorhood.  Parks, grocery stores, restaurants, brewpubs, coffee shops, and shopping within blocks.  Just a 10-minute walk to University of Washington campus, and public transport to downtown Seattle is steps away. Full kitchen with range and dishwasher well equipped for cooking during long or short-term stays. Fridge and pantry well stocked for light breakfasts, snacks, and cooking meals.  Warm and inviting living room with freestanding gas fireplace .   Plentiful east-facing windows in living room and kitchen for great bright, natural lighting.   Separate bedroom with comfy king bed located in back of apartment away from street. Walk/bike/bus everywhere!  No need for car.  But if you do bring a car a parking pass is provided for the permitted street parking. 500 square foot 1 BR  -- spacious but still cozy! City-wide dockless bikes c
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is full of character with 100 year old homes and streets lined with horse chestnut trees.  Just down the hill is Ravenna Park -- a forested ravine with trails and a playground at either end.  Green Lake is 1 mile away and one of the best places to be on a summer day.  University Village is a popular upscale shopping center about 1/2 mile away.  The other direction is University Way, AKA "the Ave" , with tons of awesome, economical and diverse restaurants, and an eclectic assortment of shops.  Additional pockets of shops, restaurants and brewpubs are within walking distance as well.
transit: There are many bus lines walkable from the apartment to take you to downtown Seattle, Bellevue/Redmond, and the surrounding neighborhoods. The light rail "Link" station is 1.5 miles away -- a lovely walk thru UW campus or a short bus connection or Uber.  The Link will take you to downtown then on to the airport. Seattle is very bike friendly.  The Burke-Gilman trail is accessed close by and runs for 27 miles throughout the city and out to Woodinville.  It connects all of the great districts of Seattle by foot or bike.   Easy and inexpensive dockless bike shares are readily available.
